title: Inspector (Seasonal)
description:
Division: Ontario

Reports To: Inspections Manager

Employment Type: Seasonal Full-Time: February - October

Location: Ontario Sites and Head Office, Ajax

About Us:

Today Pro-Bel is an international company employing more than 200 people. We strive on having the best people that are experienced and specifically trained to provide the leading service in the high-rise window cleaning safety industry.

To date we have completed more than 17,000 projects worldwide. We have strived to push our industry forward by continually designing safer equipment that is easier to use. Our engineering team has developed Pro-Bel into a professional engineering firm. Our ability to create custom products and solutions suited for modern architecture is what has helped to establish Pro-Bel as the industry leader for engineered fall arrest and suspended access systems.

For over the past 40 years Pro-Bel has built relationships with thousands of architects, building owners and property managers World Wide. Pro-Bel is known as the original roof anchor company and over the years has continued to expand their product line and operations worldwide. We now offer a complete line of window washing equipment and fall protection systems that includes but is not limited to Roof Anchors, Davits, Horizontal Lifelines, Electrical and Mechanical Equipment such as Permanent Powered Platforms and Building Maintenance Units.

Responsibilities

· Drive to the job sites requiring inspections

· Review the engineered drawings to ensure the drawings and the site conditions match

· Take pictures of the work completed and the job site conditions and upload to photo storage system.

· Complete a visual inspection and sometimes load testing is required

· Complete a detailed report after the inspection is completed

· Primarily on the road, 90% on site, 10% in office

· Learn about code and regulatory requirements

· Other duties as assigned

Skills, Knowledge, Qualifications & Experience

  • Completed Architectural Technology or Civil Technology diploma or degree or equivalent
  • 1 years of construction experience is preferred
  • Working knowledge of construction equipment and techniques, drawings and specifications, building materials, and required standards applicable to discipline
  • Knowledge of building construction, Ontario Building Code and the OHSA is an asset but not mandatory
  • Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite
  • Working at Heights Training
  • Ability to assume responsibility and to interface and communicate effectively with others
  • Effective English oral and written communication skills and ability to represent the company and project team in a professional manner to the Client, Architect, related staff and the community
  • Must have their own vehicle to get to the sites
  • Valid Ontario driver’s license
  • Must be legally eligible to work in Ontario

What Pro-Bel Has to Offer

· Competitive wages

· Bonus potential

· A commitment to ongoing development and support with accredited training and education programs

· Room for growth and advancement

· Fun and casual environment

· Company social events

· Excellent location, close to the GO Station and Highway 401

· Industry leader and continuously expanding

Other

We are committed to an inclusive, barrier-free work environment and recruitment and selection processes. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process.

We thank all applicants for considering a career with us; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal
Contract length: 7 months

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: newQuality Inspector - Infrastructure
description:
Graham is an employee-owned construction solutions partner that services the buildings, industrial, infrastructure, water and project finance sectors. We deliver lasting value for our clients through meticulous planning and scheduling, while upholding rigorous safety and quality standards. With offices throughout North America, our passionate and knowledgeable teams deliver projects that enable communities to thrive and people to live, work, move and grow in a rapidly changing world. With over nine decades of experience, Graham has the resources, capacity and expertise to undertake projects of every scope, scale and complexity. Join our team to deliver a better tomorrow.


We are seeking top-tier talent to join our Infrastructure division and build innovative projects in the transit and transportation sectors, such as roads, highways/freeways, bridges, interchanges, LRTs, BRTs, and airports. As a member of this collaborative team, you can expect a safe, diverse and inclusive environment, and on-going learning and career development opportunities.


About the Role:


Reporting to the Quality Director, the Quality Inspector is accountable for providing planning, leadership, coordination, and management for the Graham Quality Management System (QMS) on Infrastructure projects in Ontario. This includes managing all aspects of the Quality processes and programs in a timely manner while also maintaining long-term stakeholder relationships. A successful individual will be an expert in maintaining a relentless focus on quality and continuous improvement and carries the vision of meeting and exceeding customer needs and expectations. The Quality Inspector is highly proficient with technical, leadership, and communication skills while having the ability to work autonomously with project deadlines.


As a Quality Inspector at Graham you will:


  • Ensure that the Quality processes are in place and refined to provide final closeout of projects.
  • Maintain relationships and communication tools as needed with suppliers and other key project personnel to verify that the quality of the supplied materials and services.
  • Review Quality Plan submissions from subcontractors.
  • Provide input into the Project Specific Quality Plan(s) for new projects and ensure compliance during execution.
  • Manage all aspects of the Project Specific Quality Plan (PSQP) and the Inspection and Test Plan (ITP) for assigned project(s).
  • Develop and communicate performance standards and metrics.
  • Support field supervision with Quality inspections and reporting.
  • Initiate and assist with the development of new Quality protocols and processes.
  • Monitor KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) for the Quality system implementation and its effectiveness.
  • Maintain accountability for communicating, leading, and lagging KPIs.
  • Develop regular status reports for the client and the Quality Director, detailing the status of QMS and recommending actions to be taken for continued improvement on a project to project basis.
  • Establish and maintain relationships with the project consultants, client, vendors, and key specialist subcontractors, in addition to other involved stakeholders such as design teams, suppliers, etc.
  • Present information and reports to senior business unit leaders as well as written correspondence or presentations to external parties (i.e. clients, partners, government agencies, etc.).


Education and Experience:


  • Trade experience, certification, diploma, or degree in Construction Management, Engineering or a related field is preferred.
  • Minimum of 5 to 10 years of experience working on medium to large scale civil/infrastructure construction projects in a Quality related role.
  • Experience managing internal quality systems within a General Contracting environment.
  • Certified as a quality professional from a certifying body, successful completion of an ISO 9001 Lead Auditor Course.
  • Expertise in heavy rail construction with training and certification in continuous welded rail (CWR).
  • Experience with the causes and high-risk conditions such as track buckling and stress conditions in rail and be familiar with identifying CAD weld defects.
  • Strong technical proficiency in Quality-related areas: related legislation, auditing, and data analysis.
  • Superior leadership skills with ability and willingness to face challenges, solve problems, and motivate others, while maintaining effective relationships with customers.


If this sounds like you, then Graham may be the right fit. Apply today.


Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law.


Graham Group Ltd. also welcomes and encourages applications from those with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in each stage of our process. For more information please see our AODA Compliance Policy and our Multi-Year Accessibility Plan.


No unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.

title: Senior Construction Inspector (contract)
description:
Minimum Clearance Required to Start:

Not Applicable/None

Job Description:

Are you an experienced Construction Inspector who’s worked on high complexity MTO or municipal highway, road, and bridge projects? Parsons is currently seeking a Senior Construction Inspector to work on large scale Infrastructure at various locations across Southern Ontario. Projects includes highway and road-widening, pavement rehabilitation, bridge remediation, and the development of underground infrastructure.

The successful candidate will conduct daily inspections to determine contract adherence and conformance with contract specifications. She/he will be responsible for bridge and road inspection on existing projects. Additional responsibilities include:

  • Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations and environmental regulations.
  • Maintaining detailed diaries and photographs to document daily construction activities.
  • Conduct inspection as per applicable inspection requirements, such as MTO’s Construction Administration and Inspection Task Manual.
  • Coordination of onsite sub-consultants and quality assurance material testing.
  • Reporting of installed quantities to verify applications for monthly payment and change order work.
  • Maintains office files related to the project, quantity calculations, and other documentation as required by the construction contract.

A combination of the following education experience is required:

  • Degree or Diploma in Construction Management or Civil Engineering, and/or combination of related experience
  • PEO registered or OACETT registered Road Construction Senior Inspector (rcsi)
  • 10+ years of experience in construction inspection with MTO or municipal transportation projects
  • Knowledge of the requirements of MTO’s Construction Administration and Inspection Task Manual (CAITM)
  • Knowledge of applicable design standards, OPS specifications, standard drawings, and quality control / quality assurance material testing methods.
  • Effective organizational and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to utilize computer software such as MS Word and Excel
  • Must provide own transportation to and from job site.
  • Valid Class “G” driver’s license

The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by federal, state, provincial or local mandates or customer requirements.

title: Road Construction Junior Inspector
description:
Four Corners Engineering has been providing professional service to the industry for over 20 years and our clientele have praised us for the exceptional services we continue to provide. In order to accomplish this objective, we are committed to seeking out and employing individuals that are open-minded, enthusiastic, reliable and committed to learning and practicing Quality Engineering Practices.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform as Engineering’s representative (QVE) on the construction site. Coordinates field staffs and attends site meetings and client meetings.
  • Monitor overall project schedule and day to day activities on site.
  • Review contract drawings, specifications and shop drawings to ensure proper coordination and installation
  • Review QA/QC standards and procedures required for the project are implemented and within the company guidelines.
  • Inspect the quality of construction and construction materials
  • Participates in periodic updates and regularly communicates with the customer, project team, field staff, subcontractors and all other stakeholders to ensure compliance of construction projects with specifications, schedule and budget through completion.
  • Coordinates the movement of assigned equipment, tools, supplies and other resources needed to complete the job and controls losses
  • Other duties as assigned by supervisor

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's Degree or student in the field of Civil Engineering or Construction Management.
  • Applied knowledge with MTO, OPSS/OPSD, ASTM, CAITM Manual and CSA methodology and procedures.
  • Capable to read and understand construction plans, drawings, specifications technical procedures and government regulations.
  • Knowledge of various civil and highway construction; Ability or recognize non-compliant conditions and initiate corrective measures.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Projects and Primavera.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • C.E.T./C. Tech/EIT/RCJI certification is must.
  • Certified under CCIL, CSA or ACI is an asset.
  • Ability to work well under pressure.
  • Ability to deal tactfully and effectively with clients, contractors and co-workers.
  • Willingness to work overtime and some weekend work is necessary during the construction season.
  • Valid Ontario driver’s license and reliable vehicle.

Four Corners Engineering Inc. invite all qualified applicants to e-mail us your resume.

Salary: TBD (Based on the experience)

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Road Construction Junior Inspector: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver's License (preferred)

title: Senior QA Inspector (Highway Construction)
description:
AECOM is seeking a Senior QA Inspector (Highway Construction) to be based out of these AECOM offices in Canada (Richmond Hill, Mississauga, Whitby).

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

The Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
+ Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.

+ Responsible for setting own project deadlines.

+ Provides on the job training to new employees.

+ Responsible for monitoring conformance to quality, performance, specifications, and/or code requirements by performing inspection duties.

+ Performs daily field inspections and maintains inspection records.

+ Participates in punch lists, testing, and commissioning.

+ Tracks quality assurance progress.

+ Provides input to documentation for area and equipment turnovers.

+ Review contract drawings, addenda, special provisions, standard specifications (OPSS, OPSD), general conditions, working drawings, applicable manuals for constructability

+ Inspect sampling procedure and verify that test methods follow specifications; review and analyze test results, determine deficiencies and provide reports to CA.

+ Assist in the preparation of: Monthly Status Reports detailing all construction and administration activities that take place during the month; monthly payment statement; contractor performance review.

+ Inspect and approve abrasive blast cleaned reinforcing steel at the concrete removal areas as per contract specified visual inspection standard photographs SSPC-VIS 1-89 (Steel Structures Painting Council-Visual Inspection Standard 1-89) conforming to ASTM D2200.

+ Conduct visual condition survey of structural components, including identification and location of cracks, rusted areas, delaminations and spalls.

+ Carry out covermeter surveys to determine concrete clear cover on new reinforcing steel on bridge decks and barrier walls, and calculate applicable pay factors.

+ Carry out determination of waterproofing membrane thickness, consistency of thickness by standard deviation and calculate applicable pay factors.

+ Inspect asphalt paving operations, verify mix temperature, paver’s speed, rate of distribution, combination and type of compaction equipment, rolling pattern; identify defective workmanship (such as segregation, roller mark, poor joints etc.) and direct contractor to rectify, as necessary.

+ Inspect grade and drainage operations including grade survey by method of GPS or a survey level.

Minimum Requirements

+ Highschool + 4 years of relevant experience in highway/ roadway construction or Diploma/Certificate + 2 YORE

+ OACETT Registration as Road Construction Senior Inspector (RCSI).

+ Minimum three (3) MTO or Municipal projects - full construction season (8 months)

+ Valid G Driving License and access to personal vehicle

Preferred Qualifications

+ Ideally 5+ years of relevant experience in general highway construction experience

+ College graduate with Civil Engineering Technology diploma

+ Ability to prioritize, multi-task and manage staff during parallel daytime and nighttime shifts.

+ Effective oral and written communication skills.

+ Eligibility as Road Construction Contract Administrator (RCCA) is also an asset.

Additional Information:
+ Relocation is not available for this position.

+ Sponsorship is not available for this position.

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

title: newField Survey Assistant
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

EDMONTON


WSP is currently seeking a Survey Assistant for various Land Development and Municipal projects based out of our Edmonton office.


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • Assisting Field Inspector in construction inspection and construction survey on projects in Edmonton and Northern Alberta;
  • Assisting Field Inspector in resolving construction issues with the assistance of the site project manager and field supervisors;
  • Assisting in the completion of preliminary topographic surveys including interpretation of acquired data;
  • Assisting in quantity measurements, daily reporting, and participation in construction meetings; and
  • Assisting in the completion of construction as-building for record-keeping/approval purposes.

What sets you apart ...

  • Civil or Construction Engineering Technology graduate would be an asset;
  • Excellent communication skills – written and verbal, including teamwork and interpersonal abilities;
  • Comfortable working independently in both a field and office environment;
  • Comfortable working long hours and weekends as project workload demands; and
  • Valid class 5 driver’s license with a suitable working vehicle to reliably commute to our field projects each day.


Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Edmonton, AB

title: newCONSTRUCTION INSPECTOR
description:
ID #
20520
City
Thornhill
Job Type
Permanent - Full Time

WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

THORNHILL

The Opportunity:

At WSP, our team is growing, and as a result we're adding Intermediate/Senior Construction Inspectors to our Water and Wastewater group. Reporting to the Team Lead of Contract Administration, this position will be responsible for managing the site inspection multi-million-dollar water/wastewater and other infrastructure construction projects, such as large diameter municipal water mains and sewers.

Your primary focus will be the site inspection and support the contract administration of municipal water and wastewater infrastructure projects by open cut, trenchless technologies, and rehabilitation.


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • Work in field offices, calculating quantities, help preparing monthly payments, finalization of contract items and perform general office work
  • Perform and/or inspect quality assurance (QA) acceptance on watermains, sanitary sewers, storm sewers, maintenance holes, road resurfacing and reconstruction, sidewalk, grading, concrete, asphalt, electrical and granular
  • Ensure that the infrastructure complies to the contract documents and drawings and maintain a record of field deviations for the completion of record drawings
  • Maintain detailed daily diaries of contractor’s work, contract progress and inspection milestones
  • Ensure inspection tasks are completed and recorded in a prompt and accurate manner
  • Recognize when extra work needs to be done and report to the Contract Administrator
  • Identification, documentation and assessment for rating of deficiencies (deviations from Contractor’s Quality Control Process and or OPSS standards) in the contractor’s work
  • Ensure approved construction materials are used and acquired from approved sources and a record is kept of such materials
  • Ensure contractor adheres to all contract requirements, as per Contract Administrator’s direction; e.g. legal, environmental, construction standards, protection of wildlife, etc.
  • Ensure contractor applies the Occupational Health and Safety Act, WHIMIS, Environmental Act, Transportation of Dangerous Goods and Waste Management regulations in a manner consistent with the contract
  • Be a company representative and act on behalf of the company
  • Travel and work on contracts throughout Ontario for lengthy periods at a time
  • Other duties as assigned

What you'll bring to WSP ...

  • Civil Engineering Degree or Diploma from an accredited college
  • 5-10 years of experience in a similar role
  • Experience utilizing relevant Computer software e.g. CDS, HDS/InRoads, MS Word, Excel and Access to calculate payment and test results
  • Previous experience in AutoCAD and Microstation is an asset
  • Experience using construction administration information systems such as Builterra is an asset
  • Experience in City of Toronto projects and surrounding Regional Municipalities is an asset
  • Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
  • Ability to organize, prioritize and schedule inspection work
  • Valid Ontario driver’s license with an acceptable driving record

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Thornhill, ON

title: Civil Site Inspector
description:
Civil Site Inspector - ( 220000YR )

Description

We create the connections that get people and goods moving—whether by car, bus, train, plane, or their own two feet. Working within the context of the communities we serve, we provide planning, engineering, and infrastructure management services that fit the needs of our clients and improve the overall transportation experience. Join our team and help us keep communities connected.

Your Opportunity

Stantec’s Transportation Team provides planning, design and construction administration services for roadway, highway, transit/rail, bridge and related projects. We are currently seeking a Junior Civil Site Inspector to conduct field work to complement our transportation team this summer. The Junior Civil Site Inspector will play a lead role in the delivery of environmental assessment and functional/preliminary and detail design assignments primarily for public sector clients.

Imagine being part of a dynamic team that designs innovative solutions for our diverse set of clients. The Junior Civil Site Inspector will work under close supervision of a Site Supervisor Contract Administrator to develop skills in civil works related to roadway design construction, on-site field review and inspections and contract documents. The ideal candidate has the ability to solve complex problems using sound professional judgement, creativity, and innovation including effective coordination of internal and external constituents, demonstrated experience on various construction projects, effective meeting facilitation skills and strong knowledge of regulatory requirements.

As a Junior Civil Site Inspector in our Ottawa Transportation Group, you will be responsible for assisting project managers, project engineers and construction administrators in the following areas:

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Work under the direction of the Senior Engineer, Senior Site Inspector or Contract Administrator
  • Carries out inspection activities to ensure conformance
  • Construction site inspections and visits including completing Field Observation Reports and site diary entries
  • Supervise sub-contractor work
  • Quantity measurements for preparation of payment certifications
  • Daily reporting and participation in construction meetings
  • Completion of construction as-builts
  • Liaison with local residents affected by construction projects
  • Assist with CAD design and engineering design
  • Interpreting requirements and details of contract drawings and specifications.
  • Liaising with contractors and other stakeholders

Qualifications

Your Capabilities and Credentials

  • A post secondary diploma or degree in Civil Engineering or Civil Engineering Technology / Technician or equivalent is an asset
  • Designation as determined by OACETT as a Road Construction Junior Inspector (rcji) Technology/Technician is an asset
  • Previous engineering/construction inspection experience is an asset
  • Prior experience working on MTO projects or municipal infrastructure projects
  • Either registration as a Technician or Technologist with O.A.C.E.T.T. or Professional Engineer or Engineer-in-Training with PEO
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to work well in a team environment
  • le to work on weekends, nights, shift work, additional hours as required
  • Proficiency with MS Office
  • A valid Ontario driver's license and access to a reliable vehicle
  • Able to travel and work in the greater Ottawa

Education and Experience

This position is intended for a recent or upcoming graduate of a Civil Engineering program (University or College) with an emphasis on Transportation Engineering.

Candidate work primarily in the field on construction sites undertaking construction inspection for roadway contract projects within the City of Ottawa.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Primary Location : Canada-Ontario-Ottawa

Job : Construction Inspection

Organization : BC-1636 Transportation-CA Ontario East & Atlantic

Employee Status : Regular

Job Level : Entry Level

Travel : Yes, 10 % of the Time

Schedule : Full-time

Job Posting : Mar 9, 2022, 11:07:22 AM

Req ID: 220000YR

Vaccine Policy: Stantec requires some positions in North America to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 subject to reasonable accommodation to the extent required by law because of a medical reason or a sincerely held religious belief.

Stantec provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for future and current employment and prohibit discrimination on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. Stantec is in compliance with local, state and federal laws and regulations and ensures equitable opportunities in all aspects of employment. EEO including Disability/Protected Veterans

title: Parks Operator
description:
The Town of Arnprior is strategically located along the four-lane Trans Canada Highway just past the Ottawa border and is the first major stop in the Ottawa Valley. We offer the conveniences of an urban town with the beauty of nature that comes with being Where the Rivers Meet. If you are interested in working with a dynamic team and like to help make a difference in supporting the community, we encourage you to apply for the Parks Operator position for which we are currently recruiting.

Reporting to the Operations Supervisor, the Parks Operator position is responsible for the maintenance, upkeep, and safe operation of Town-owned parks and outdoor recreation amenities.

The primary responsibilities for this position include:

· Responsible for performing operational work and maintenance to the Marina, all Parks, Playgrounds, Beaches, Trails, Ball Diamonds, Outdoor Rinks along with any other outdoor facilities, structures or spaces that pertain to Recreation.

· Performing general grass cutting and trimming, pruning of trees;

· Preparing infields for use by dragging and lining;

· Keeping areas clear of debris;

· Deliver and setup equipment to different functions as required;

· Answer general questions from the Public, report any complaints and assist patrons using the facilities.

· Responsible for custodial duties to outdoor recreation amenities, including washrooms, snack bar and Gazebo.

· Ensure the proper functioning, operation and maintenance of all parks equipment.

· Perform inspections on all playgrounds and playground equipment.

· Train staff on job related duties, safety operation of equipment (e.g. tractors, mowers, hand and power tools, equipment inspections, safe practices).

· Support implementation of work plan for seasonal front-line parks and marina staff.

· Support Park and outdoor facility preparations for marquee town events throughout the year – this includes but not limited to: Priorpalooza, Canada Day, Dragon Boat Festival, Sunday Market, Concerts in the Park, Santa Claus Parade to name a few.

· Support facility operators and/or custodian staff with maintenance, setup and general duties at the Nick Smith Centre on an as needed basis.

· Winter maintenance; Snow removal, clearing pathways and trails, maintaining outdoor rinks (including snow removal, flooding and ice maintenance), maintaining outdoor spaces for recreational programming and events.

· Jobs will require the use of a variety of equipment and machinery.

· Maintain appropriate record which include and are not limited to daily inspections of parks amenities (i.e. play structures), equipment, maintenance and cleaning logs, checklists, equipment and supply inventory.

· Assist in any other maintenance deemed necessary by the Operations Supervisor.

· Carry out other related duties as assigned by Operations Supervisor.

· Keep qualifications up to date.

· Follow instructions with a minimum of supervision and with a high sense of responsibility.

· Represent the Town of Arnprior in a professional and positive manner; lead by example.

· Protect own health and health of others by adopting safe work practices, reporting unsafe conditions immediately, and attending all relevant in-services regarding occupational health and safety. Follow all internal policies and guidelines for employees and employers as legislated under the Ontario Occupational Health and Safety Act. Maintain a safe and clean work environment.

The successful candidate will have a minimum of:

· Grade 12 minimum education.

· Valid ‘G’ Driver’s License.

· CPR, First Aid, WHMIS, and Fall Arrest Training or willing to obtain within one year.

· Certified Playground Inspector or Registered Playground Practitioner designation or be willing to obtain within two years.

· Valid and satisfactory Vulnerable Record check.

· 6 months of previous experience in a related position, having performed the general duties of the position.

· Experience with the operation and maintenance of parks equipment and machinery including but not limited to tractors, mowers, blowers, hydraulics and small engines.

· Experience with Microsoft Office Suite.

· Knowledge of the parks systems, trails, beaches, marinas and waterfront spaces along with other outdoor-related facilities that fall under Recreation jurisdiction.

· Knowledgeable of the hazards and safety requirements of job.

· Thorough knowledge and understanding of the Ontario Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA), WHMIS and other relevant regulatory and legislative acts to related to operations and maintenance.

· Ability to manage multiple projects and shifting priorities.

· Must be physically fit and capable of heavy physical labour at various job locations.

· Ability to carry out directions with a minimum of supervision and with a high sense of responsibility.

· The Ability to communicate with coworkers and the public in a professional manner.

· Ability to document and manager maintenance logs and other records.

Assets:

· Certified Grounds Technician Certificate (ORFA) or equivalent preferred; other parks certificates considered an asset

· Chainsaw safety certificate would be an asset.

Job Type: Full-time (Unionized -CUPE Local 4960)

Work Location: Arnprior, ON

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.28 per hour

Application deadline: 2022-05-06

title: Site Inspector
description:
Requisition ID: 59424

Job Category: Infrastructure

Location: Mississauga, ON, Canada


With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we see challenges evolving in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff, with experience in over 150 countries, to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.


Our expertise in infrastructure includes aviation, highways and bridges, planning and advisory services, ports, rail and transit, tunnels, and water. Want to be part of the creation and construction of our cities? Then the infrastructure team is for you!


Looking to take the next step in your career?


Hatch is currently seeking a highly motivated Municipal Site Inspector to join the Infrastructure group in our Water team in the Mississauga location on a contract basis. In this role, you will be required to work on multi-disciplinary projects and ensure the contractor's work complies with design and specifications.


New infrastructure and revitalizing assets are a key part of growth for any economy. We work with our clients to imagine and build cities of the future through a constant commitment to innovation and cutting-edge technology.


Our knowledge of infrastructure includes aviation, highways and bridges, planning and advisory services, ports, rail and transit, tunnels, and water. Want to be part of the creation and construction of our cities? Then the infrastructure team is for you!


As the successful candidate, you will:

  • Assist in municipal infrastructure site inspection (water and wastewater infrastructure, watermains / sewers including tunneling and micro-tunneling and collection systems).
  • Inspect contractors' work for conformity to plans, specifications and regulations.
  • Examine/inspect field conditions and identify problems, inaccuracies, and cost saving measures that arise or that may be encountered and take corrective actions as needed.
  • Liaise with the contractor, utility agencies, sub-consultants, and client, as well as handling all public relations.
  • Attend and participate in construction progress meetings
  • Assist with Contract Administration.
  • Arrange for geotechnical services and material testing, quality control inspections.
  • Prepare monthly payment certificates and contract change orders.
  • Construction scheduling and monitoring.
  • Start-up and commission the works and ensure compliance with Ministry of Labour (Ontario) guidelines.
  • Preparation of daily and weekly progress reports.
  • Ensure compliance with Occupational Health and Safety Act on construction sites with authority to issue stop work orders.
  • Liaise with regulatory agencies, utility companies, residents and other stakeholders with respect to construction activities.
  • Any other duties as assigned by the Project Manager on the project.


You bring to the role:

  • A degree or diploma in civil engineering from an accredited university or college.
  • P.Eng. or C.E.T certification or eligible to obtain.
  • A minimum of 10 years’ experience in municipal/civil engineering construction with direct experience with water and wastewater infrastructure, preferably with a consulting engineering firm.
  • Must possess sound judgement; strong organizational, administrative, observational and problem-solving skills; effective interpersonal, and oral and written communication skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently.
  • Demonstrated skills in the use of computer utilizing programs such as Microsoft Office.
  • Working at Heights, Confined space, First Aid and WHMIS training.
  • MTO Class ‘G’ driver’s license in good standing and must be willing to travel.
  • Ability to work shift work including evenings and weekends.


Why join us?

  • Work with great people to make a difference
  • Collaborate on exciting projects to develop innovative solutions
  • Top employer


What we offer you?


  • Flexible work environment
  • Long term career development
  • Think globally, work locally


We're committed to fostering a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate and serve. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to age, race, color, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status. If you have any accommodation requirements, please let us know. We'll do our best to meet your needs in accordance with applicable local legislation.

title: Junior Quality Assurance Inspector
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

GHD is one of the world’s leading professional services companies operating in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation.

Privately owned by our people, GHD provides engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services to private and public sector clients across five continents. Focused on creating lasting community benefit, our connected global network of 10,000 people delivers projects with high standards of safety, quality and ethics.

Committed to sustainable development, GHD improves the physical, natural and social environments of the many communities in which we operate

Our Construction Administration group assigned to Greater Toronto Area (GTA) construction projects is looking for a Junior Quality Assurance Inspector to complete inspections as part of a team on Highway / Road / Bridge and Water construction projects.

Your Responsibilities will include:
  • Working safely and observing / working in conformance with GHD’s Behaviour-Based Safety culture;
  • Completing day-to-day inspections of Highway / Road / Bridge and Sewer / Watermain projects in accordance with client terms of reference and manuals;
  • Working with Senior Inspectors and other team members to make payment recommendations to Contract Administrator and client staff;
  • Daily completion of project records / diary entries;
  • Monitoring contractor work for compliance with contract specifications;
  • Notifying supervisor of non-conformances observed;
  • Working nights, weekends, extended shifts;
  • Working overtime hours as necessary. Work is seasonal in nature and will likely involve greater hours of work in summer than in winter months;
  • Other duties as may be assigned.
Skills, Competencies & Qualifications:
  • Completion of Civil Engineering Technician or Technologist diploma, or completion of Civil Engineering degree
  • Past experience in construction field work is considered an asset;
  • Team player, cooperative with other staff with open sharing of information and knowledge;

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

#LI-PQ1


Why GHD?

Being the best we can be is in our culture.
We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.

Our commitment to you

Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.

Who we are

We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation. GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

Covid Vaccine Position Statement

In response to the evolving Covid-19 pandemic, GHD has established an Operating Procedure confirming it will comply with vaccination requirements for any work which is subject to either (i) municipal, provincial, or federal government mandates or (ii) client requirements which require vaccination to perform such work, either on a client site or any workplace (“Work Requiring Vaccination”). To the extent allowed by law, GHD employees performing Work Requiring Vaccination will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and may be required to show proof of vaccination prior to engaging in this work. GHD will consider reasonable accommodation requests in the event you are unable to be vaccinated on the basis of a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.

title: Automotive Equipment Inspector
description:
Department of Transportation and Infrastructure

Automotive Equipment Inspector

Open

Vehicle Management Agency

Various Locations

Moncton or Rexton

Saint John, Sussex or St. Stephen

Who we are?

The work we do has a positive impact on our communities and helps improve the everyday lives of New Brunswickers. Together, we are over 45,000 New Brunswickers who are passionate problem-solvers, who make a difference and are proud to call New Brunswick home.

The Department of Transportation and Infrastructure's mission is to contribute to New Brunswick's economy and quality of life by providing and supporting sustainable infrastructure that allows for the safe and efficient movement of people, goods and government services to the public. Not only is the department responsible for managing over 18,000 kilometers of provincial highways, it also manages the planning, design and construction of hospitals, schools and other government buildings.

The Vehicle Management Agency's mission is to provide fleet management and vehicle maintenance services to Government, on an economical basis and according to established standards, to enable clients to deliver quality services to the public.

What you will do?

As a member of the Vehicle Management Agency (VMA), the successful candidate will be responsible for:

  • performing inspections and supplying recommendations regarding replacements, procurements and repairs to a large central government fleet of vehicles;
  • auditing motor vehicle inspections completed by GNB mechanics;
  • performing regular inspections and providing reports on various types of equipment;
  • making recommendations on regular maintenance, major repairs, salvage and disposal of assets;
  • ensuring adherence to VMA policy and procedures;
  • monitoring and auditing shop budgets/operations within assigned areas;
  • providing advice and direction on shop related issues to management personnel;
  • providing liaison with other government departments and agencies, as well as various manufacturers and suppliers on technical issues;
  • operating and utilizing the Fleet Management System; and serving on committees as a technical resource.

Work environment:

  • Locations: Moncton or Rexton, Saint John, Sussex, or St. Stephen. Please ensure that your application indicates the location for which you wish to be considered
  • 40-hour work week
  • We promote a scent-reduced environment.
  • Extensive travel within the Province and some travel outside of the Province will be required.

Who you are?

Key behavioural competencies:

  • Analytical Thinking/Judgment
  • Client Service orientation
  • Effective Interactive Communication
  • Initiative

Essential qualifications:

  • Possession of a Journeyperson's Certificates in the Automotive Service Technician Trade (AST) and the Truck and Transport Trade (T&T), as issued by the Province of New Brunswick.
  • Five (5) years of related experience in a vehicle repair shop environment.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Valid class 5 driver's license as issued by the Province of New Brunswick.

An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.

Depending on the location applied for, one position requires written and spoken competence in French and English, and the other requires written and spoken competence in English. Please state your preferred location and your language capacity.

Please attach a copy of both certificates (AST and T&T) with your application or send a copy to dti.competitions@gnb.ca.

  • Applicants must clearly demonstrate the essential qualifications to be given further consideration.
  • Résumés should be in chronological order specifying education and employment in months and years including part-time and full-time employment.
  • Please ensure that your preferred language of assessment is identified in your résumé.

Asset Qualifications:

  • Experience in supervising/managing personnel and client relationship development.
  • Experience in Vehicle modification, welding design interpretation, and/or troubleshooting hydraulic systems.
  • Knowledge of the Motor Vehicle Act and Vehicle Inspections Regulation.

Subject to the response to this competition, candidates may be required to demonstrate on their application one or more of the asset qualifications in addition to the essential qualifications in order to be given further consideration

The Department of Transportation and Infrastructure offers:

  • Meaningful work and the opportunity to support New Brunswickers in times of need.
  • Opportunities for career growth, professional development and training.
  • Comprehensive benefits package which includes paid vacation, Health and Dental Plan, Life Insurance and the Public Service Shared Risk Pension Plan.
  • Free access to Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP) and services.

SALARY: $29.17 hourly

Providing a safe workplace for all. Your health and safety are important to us. GNB has implemented preventative measures across the organization to ensure your health and safety

How to apply?

We encourage applicants to apply on-line, by e-mail to dti.competitions@gnb.ca or by mail at the following address indicating competition number 2022-D85-03. This opportunity will be open until filled. This competition may be used to fill future vacancies at the same level

Department of Transportation and Infrastructure
Human Resources Branch
P. O. Box 6000, Fredericton NB E3B 5H1
Telephone: (506) 453-3939

We thank all those who apply, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities in which we live and serve. We encourage and support applications from Aboriginals, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minority groups. Candidates registered with the Equal Employment Opportunity Program and veterans, who are among the most qualified, will be given preference at the time of selection.

Let's connect. You belong here.

title: Asphalt Inspector - Experience Required
description:
You didn't go to school to be a number in a big machine, so why work for one? By joining McIntosh Perry, you will be able to make an impact in the communities where you live and work. Our Core Purpose - Turning Possibilities Into Reality represents our commitment to solving problems, getting things done and moving forward through collaboration with clients and teams.


Our team's expertise, gained through decades of experience, means clients can rely on us to quickly deliver high-quality and successful projects.

As one of the country’s fastest growing engineering firms with more than 800 project managers, engineers, technical experts and problems solvers across North America, McIntosh Perry is proud to be a Platinum Club Winner of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.


Our core values validate everything we have believed in since our company started:


Walk a mile in someone else’s shoes - Treat others as they would like to be treated

Make Momma proud - Do the right thing

Every McIntosh has a core - Be a leader

Pass. Shoot. Score. - Becoming excellent together

Did you dot the i’s and cross the t’s? - Personal responsibility

Don’t forget to cut the ribbon - Making a difference


If you are looking for an opportunity to work with a collaborative, hard-working and dedicated team of professionals and have fun delivering high-quality projects regardless of the project size, we are looking for new talent to join our supportive and dynamic team and enable you to turn possibilities into reality.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


As a member of our Contract Administration Group, under the direction of our Contract Administrator, you will be responsible for asphalt inspection assignments for various construction site projects at different area field office locations. This position requires previous experience on two projects. Duties include, but are not limited to:

  • Inspecting construction of various projects to ensure compliance with contract documents;
  • Interpreting requirements and details of contract drawings and specifications;
  • Verifying quantities, prepare progress reports and maintain documentation;
  • Identifying and act on contractual and regulatory infractions;
  • Liaising with contractors and other stakeholders; and
  • Other duties as may be assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • OACETT designation as a rcsi or PEO designation as an EIT, or qualified to obtain this designation is required;
  • Demonstrated experience on at least two (2) MTO or Municipal paving contracts of medium RAQS complexity and at least five (5) years of general highway construction experience in the last eight (8) years;
  • Demonstrated experience as a asphalt inspector on at lease two (2) MTO grading contracts of medium RAQS complexity and at least five (5) years general highway construction experience in the last eight (8) years;
  • Experience with at least two (2) project of multi-lane paving (i.e. highway 401, 400, 115, etc.);
  • Excellent communication, problem solving and attention to detail skills;
  • Demonstrated willingness to learn;
  • Ability to work both independently and in a team environment;
  • Possess a valid driver's license and have access to a vehicle with valid registration and insurance; and
  • Ability to work flexible schedules and travel to site locations within the area (401 corridor, Barrie, North Bay).

Eligibility to Work in Canada - It is important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made. You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.


McIntosh Perry is an equal opportunities employer offering a competitive salary and benefits to those with the skills suited to the needs of our clients.

McIntosh Perry welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.


(Referral Code - Class B )

title: Construction Inspector
description:
Our construction group of Central Ontario (Brampton) is looking to hire a Construction Inspector. The inspector will be responsible for inspection services on contracts for private, municipal, and Ministry clients under the guidance of a Contract Administrator or Project Manager. **This is a Casual/contract position .


Your Responsibilities

  • The successful candidate will be responsible for (but not limited to) the following:
  • Oversee, document, review, and assess contractor’s compliance with contractual requirements.
  • Take accurate and detailed measurements of all work performed by the contractor to ensure accurate payments for work performed.
  • Assist the Contract Administrator in preparing various internal/external reports and other status reports to Client.
  • Assist the Contract Administrator with the review of contractor submissions (critical path schedules, field changes, monthly payment certificates etc.) for compliance with contractual obligations.
  • Confirm the appropriate qualifications and certifications for all contractor employees, resources, and equipment.

The Skills, Knowledge and Abilities We Seek

  • Experience working with Metrolink, TTC and municipalities for underground services, roads, and bridge construction
  • Must possess a minimum of Three (3) years of inspection experience.
  • Registration with OACETT as a Road Construction Inspector’s or an EIT designation from the PEO is required and similar project experience.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proven analytical and negotiation skills.
  • Knowledge of appropriate laws and regulations (environmental, health and safety, etc.)
  • Thorough understanding of design standards, Ontario Provincial Standard Specifications/Standard drawings(OPSS/OPSD’s), and methods and materials associated with municipal/highway construction.
  • Possess a valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle for travel to construction sites.


What EXP Can Offer

With a mission to understand, innovate, partner and deliver, EXP provides engineering, architecture, design and consulting services to the world’s built and natural environments.

Our heritage dates back to 1906, when the earliest of EXP’s predecessor companies started its engineering infrastructure practice. Today, over 3,000 creative EXP professionals across North America provide the passion and expertise needed to deliver successful projects around the world.

Our promise is to offer you a challenging career in a positive and dynamic work environment, and it is a promise we take seriously.

Join a dynamic team at EXP that provides you with innovative projects, the capacity to develop your career, a full range of benefits, flexible working hours, and much more! When you explore what EXP has to offer, you’ll find exponential possibilities.

For more information, visit www.exp.com .

title: CONTRACT SERVICES INSPECTOR
description:
Has your career led to the development of expertise in highway maintenance and construction? Why not take the next step and become part of our skilled and dynamic team, with the Ministry of Transportation?

What can I expect to do in this role?

Applying your technical expertise, negotiation skills and your knowledge of contract practices, you will:

  • monitor contractors' delivery of construction and maintenance operations while ensuring necessary work records are maintained
  • ensure compliance with contract requirements, review of extra work, contract drawings and documents and claims
  • liaise with contractors, property owners, internal staff, and the general public to address issues and complaints
  • provide technical advice and training to staff


How do I qualify?

Mandatory

  • The position requires the successful candidate to have a valid class G driver's licence or equivalent. The offer of employment is conditional upon the successful candidate providing proof that they have a valid driver's licence upon being hired.


Technical and Legislative Knowledge

  • You have knowledge and experience in maintenance and/or construction practices including inspection and road patrolling and related duties
  • You have the ability to interpret contract drawings and documents
  • You have knowledge and experience of highway maintenance and/or construction standards and specifications
  • You have knowledge of related policies, acts and regulations, safety, and environmental protection requirements (e.g. HTA, Construction Lien Act, Aggregate Resources Act, OH&S Act, Environmental Assessment Act, Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act, WHMIS etc.)


Essential Skills

  • You have communication and interpersonal skills
  • You have analytical, negotiation and problem solving skills
  • You have mathematical skills to assist with the assessment of contract related issues
  • You have organizational and planning skills to effectively carry out assigned inspection and monitoring duties
  • You have the ability to monitor contractor's operations, assess contractors and consultants work for compliance
  • You are proficient in using computer software and applications to complete reports and spreadsheets


OPS Commitment to diversity, inclusion, accessibility, and anti-racism

We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.

We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.

Visit theOPS Anti-Racism Policy and the OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.

We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of Ontario's Human Rights Code. Refer to the application instructions below if you require a disability-related accommodation.

Additional Information:

Address:
  • 1 Temporary, duration up to 12 months, 870 Richmond St, Chatham, West Region

Compensation Group:
Ontario Public Service Employees Union

Your information and the results from this competition will be retained for the purpose of filling vacancies in accordance with the applicable collective agreement or policy provisions.

title: Highways Construction Supervisor/Inspector
description:
The Opportunity: :
McElhanney has an exciting opportunity for a Highways Construction Supervisor/ Inspector to join our team based in Edmonton, AB. In this role, you will be integral to expansion of our field construction services across a range of projects ranging from highways, urban streetscapes to remote resource roads. Working closely with our Construction and/or Project Managers, you will be the field lead on the projects to offer professional services and insight. You are a true team player who is keen on receiving professional mentorship and on-the-job training to grow your career.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Responsible for contract administration and provide on-site construction inspections
  • Monitoring the quality, quantity and progress of construction activities
  • Author daily inspection reports, prepare monthly progress payments and other associated Contract Administration tasks
  • Very familiar with construction specifications, requirements and progress reporting
  • Review materials testing results as required and communicate to Project Managers, Contractors and Agencies related to the project.
  • Review contractor’s submissions and provide recommendations
  • Prepare and chair on site progress meetings with clients, contractors and their sub-contractors
  • Responsible for identifying the required resources and assigning individual responsibilities on site
  • Understand the hazards and safe work procedures for each task and inspection location
  • Report inspection issues to senior supervisor
  • Understand, commit to, and fulfill responsibilities under the McElhanney Quality Management System, ISO 9001 and all client quality, safety, and environmental management systems
  • Provide mentorship and leadership to junior or support staff.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Minimum of 7years of field /construction related experience with preference given to Alberta Transportation experience along with other Provincial project experience.
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in a relevant field along with specific road building experience will be considered.
  • Ability to work remotely with long hours: 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, with fatigue relief as required by relevant Regulations.
  • Willingness to commit to construction projects for the duration of the project
  • Must have experience with municipal, highways, bridge, construction projects; materials testing and/or survey experience is an asset
  • Ability to foresee potential issues and problems so these items can be addressed and resolved
  • Exceptional organization and follow-up skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment, meticulous note keeping
  • Clean driving record and the ability to comply with client-driven D&A testing requirements

Key Characteristics for Best Fit: :
  • Desire to work on construction projects in various locations throughout Alberta
  • Enjoy working outdoors with willingness to work in adverse weather conditions and at night
  • Ability to work well with contractors and thrive in team environments
  • A curious individual who is eager to learn new skills, including the progression construction from drawings and specifications to a completed product.
  • A self-aware individual who knows the limitations of his/her skillset and knowledge with ability to recognize when he/she should defer to the senior supervisor
  • Have a safety and quality conscious mindset.

What Can We Offer You?:
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your lifestyle
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
  • Opportunity to become a shareholder in an employee-owned firm
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support and mentoring for your professional development and growth
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
  • Participation in our numerous programs that support our Four Cornerstones: people & communities, clients & partners, processes & technology, and financial.


For a full review of our projects, please visit our line portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio



About McElhanney:

Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As an employee owned and operated firm with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high level of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people. :

#intermediate #onsite #LI-AM3
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers: to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.

McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.
