All assigned duties or tasks are deemed to be part of the essential functions, unless such duties or tasks are unrelated to the functions listed, in which case they are deemed to be other (non-essential) functions.']

title: Quality Engineer
description:
WECO Electrical Connectors Inc.

Head Office

18050 Trans-Canada Highway

Kirkland, QC, H9J 4A1 Canada

www.wecoconnectors.com

Quality Engineer

Kirkland, Quebec

Are you passionate about developing and implementing optimal processes, controls and work methods, improving production tools and equipment, contribute to designing products of the highest quality? Are you an energetic and committed engineer?

If you are this professional engineer, and you have work experience in a manufacturing environment, please submit your resume now to join a company seeking excellence in its field of activity!

Job Summary:

Reporting directly to the VP Technology & Innovation, the QE works to improve the organization's Quality, Productivity, and profitability by developing and implementing optimal quality control and production processes. He/she designs and improves manufacturing processes, tools and equipment while ensuring that delivery deadlines are met. He/she will occasionally provide assistance to the R & D department by participating in design and new product introduction efforts.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Quality control

  • Leads and participates in the resolution of non-conformities and contributes to the identification and implementation of corrective measures.
  • Assists in the administration and maintenance of the relevant ISO 9001 & ISO 14001 related Quality Assurance processes.
  • Conducts quality audits internally on WECO manufacturing processes and local sub-contractors (assures that work done outside of WECO complies to quality standards).
  • Oversees Quality Control processes in Production
  • Supervises and provides guidance to two (2) Quality inspectors responsible for ensuring quality of components received at incoming (suppliers & sub-contractors), and for finished goods shipped out to customers.
  • Manage NMRs (non-Conformance Materials report) and Corrective Action Request processes
  • Plan and execute manufacturing line audits with QC team and manage corrective/improvement actions when required.

2. Continuous improvement

  • Acts as a continuous improvement agent to develop a "Lean" culture in the organization.
  • Leads, coordinates and implements continuous improvement projects in the manufacturing sector.
  • Plan and organize work groups to implement improvement initiatives, reduce costs and optimize productivity.
  • Carries out studies to determine the workload of personnel, improve processes to optimize equipment and reorganize tasks to maximize the performance of the production group.
  • Compiles data and extracts reports to analyze and correct deficiencies and make recommendations to achieve planned objectives.
  • Analyze and review manufacturing costs
  • Identifies repeat problems in production, when necessary, and solves with use of structured problem-solving methodology with multi-disciplinary team as required.

3. Design and manufacturing

  • Participates in the development, design, purchase and maintenance of production and warehouse equipment.
  • Continually reviews existing machines and processes to improve, update and reduce costs.
  • Monitor performance of key manufacturing machines (OEE) and take improvement actions as necessary.
  • Participates in the development of new products in terms of production tools
  • Ensure that the production has the necessary tools as well as keep the spare parts list for all production equipment up to date.
  • Prepares purchase requisitions for tools and production equipment
  • Maintains quality and technical documentation.
  • Participates actively in R&D in a support role
  • Evaluate effectiveness of measurement tools and methods and take improvement actions as applicable.
  • Manages manufacturing equipment & tools Preventive Maintenance plan.

4. Others

  • Provides support to the Health and Safety Committee in its efforts as required.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering (Mechanical preferred)
  • 2 years of experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Excellent oral/written communication skills (French & English)
  • Sound knowledge of metrology, statistics, materials science, mechanical engineering, and cost/benefit analysis.
  • Intermediate or advanced knowledge of Ms Office software : ie: Excel (Vlookup, pivot table, data plot/charts, etc
  • General knowledge of assembly techniques and plant automation processes
  • Knowledge of machine tools and machining processes.
  • Experience with ISO 9001 internal system or manufacturing line audit process
  • Knowledge of an ERP (e.g. Syteline) and CAD system (e. g. Solidworks) would be an asset.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • Problem-solving skills - ability to find and solve problems, speed of learning and finding solutions to satisfy our customers in a timely manner.
  • Continuous Improvement - skilled and motivated to improve existing processes and production systems. Positive attitude.
  • Autonomy - able to prioritize tasks, manage and plan activities and resources efficiently.
  • Professionalism, diplomacy, reliability - ability to work with colleagues to provide quality support to internal and external clients.
  • Organizational skills - the ability to maintain up-to-date, complete and detailed records and the ability to be quick and accurate in retrieving key information.
  • Multi-tasking skills - the ability to prioritize tasks and manage a variable workload.
  • Analytics - the ability to analyze customer requests versus company results in collaboration with colleagues.
  • Effective communication - communicate clearly and precisely at all levels of the organization.
  • Interpersonal competence - knowing how to work effectively as being part of the team with the customers and colleagues in order to clearly identify their needs.
  • Emotional intelligence - the ability to recognize and manage emotions and the emotions of others individually and in groups. Minimize conflicts and sustain focus when working in team.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Comfortable office with workstation, frequent visits to the production floor. Must comply with safety regulations and procedures on all machinery, equipment and with regards to the working environment in general.

WECO OFFERS:

  • A work schedule of 40 hours, Monday to Friday
  • Insurance: medical, dental, life insurance, long-term disability after 3 months of continuous service.
  • An environment with casual but professional clothing, allowing jeans on Fridays.
  • Events of the WECO Social Committee.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Casual

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

title: Project Superintendent
description:
Subsidiary: Terus Construction Ltd.


Terus Construction Ltd. is an integrated road construction and materials manufacturing company, which has been building roads in British Columbia and the Yukon Territory for over 30 years through decentralized business centers.

Road construction, asphalt paving, aggregate production, hot mix asphalt and ready-mix concrete supply are the core activities. In addition, the Company acts as general contractor on civil construction projects, including excavation, utilities, concrete placement, sidewalks, and curbs, and in all kind of road construction related activities.

Over 800 jobs every year are performed through more than 20 decentralized business centers, such as highway rehabilitation, airport construction, industrial, municipal and commercial work, subdivisions. More than 550 employees are locally employed.

Terus Construction provides challenging and rewarding opportunities in an entrepreneurial, diverse, inclusive and respectful work environment. As our growth creates new career opportunities, likely there is the right one for you!

Mission

Pittman Asphalt, part of the Terus Construction Ltd. group, is seeking a Superintendent for its Prince George operations. Terus Construction Ltd. is a leader in the construction industry in British Columbia.

Job Summary:

The incumbent will be responsible for enforcement of all required safety and work regulation policies and procedures. This position reports to the Project Manager, and works closely with the Paving Superintendent, Grade Foreman, and crushing operations.
Responsible for the efficient use of labor, machines and materials by their crews and will report on personnel, costs and safety. The incumbent with also be responsible for planning and scheduling of work and tracking progress on a job; must be familiar with union contracts and procedures as well as be responsible for safety, efficiency, delivery to project specifications, quality control and employee development.

Main Responsibilities

  • Responsible for implementation and operation of project including initial mobilization and set up of construction sites, scheduling and progress estimates.
  • Obtaining and allocating equipment, materials and human resources.
  • Ensure compliance with company safety program, policies and procedures.
  • Coordinate and direct sub-contractors.
  • Provide coaching and training to foremen and other employees as required.
  • Delegating responsibility and authority for planning and overseeing work to foremen.
  • May participate in project estimating and planning.
  • Responsible for compliance with government regulations, environmental issues, dealing with inspectors, ensuring approvals, licensing and permits.

Profile

Skills and Experience:

  • 5-10 years work experience and/or civil engineering.
  • 5-10 years experience in roads and highway construction, pits and crushing, and industrial and paving.
  • High School Diploma, GED.
  • Strong management, delegation, planning and leadership skills.
  • Strong Communication and problem solving skills.
  • Excellent time management, project management skills
  • High level of independent judgment and reasoning.
  • Ability to deal with people diplomatically and professionally.
  • Ability to exercise cost control measures.
  • Ability to interpret and implement company policies, procedures and applicable legislation

Application

We offer a competitive compensation package with comprehensive benefits.

To submit your cover letter and resume, please visit: https://careers.colasjobs.com/Canada/go/Terus-Construction/767302/

Terus Construction Ltd. would like to thank all applicants for submitting their cover letter and resume; however, only applicants selected to be interviewed will be contacted.

Employment Requirements:


  • Possess a valid class 5 driver license and current drivers abstract.
  • Must be able to meet all safety requirements and applicable safety policies.
  • May be required to work long hours and 7 days a week, in town and out of town.
  • May work up to 15% in an office set-up.

Terus Construction Ltd. offers opportunities for qualified people who want to grow in our high performance organization including competitive salary and benefits package, along with in house training, an incredible work environment, and career advancement opportunities.


Must be able to meet all safety requirements including pre-employment drug/alcohol testing.


We would like to thank all applicants for submitting their resume. However only applicants selected to be interviewed will be contacted.

title: Field Office Administrator
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

GHD is one of the world’s leading professional services companies operating in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation.

Privately owned by our people, GHD provides engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services to private and public sector clients across five continents. Focused on creating lasting community benefit, our connected global network of 10,000 people delivers projects with high standards of safety, quality and ethics.

Committed to sustainable development, GHD improves the physical, natural and social environments of the many communities in which we operate

Our Construction Administration group located in our Markham, Whitby, and Mississauga Offices is looking for a Field Office Administrator to work as part of a team on Highway / Road / Bridge construction projects.

Your Responsibilities will include:
  • Working safely and observing / working in conformance with GHD’s Behaviour-Based Safety culture;
  • Assisting the Contract Administrator in the coordination of field duties and tasks by Quality Assurance Inspectors, specialists, and sub-consultant staff;
  • Completing day-to-day inspections of Highway / Road / Bridge projects in accordance with client terms of reference and manuals. Notifying supervisor of non-conformances observed;
  • Coordinating input from Quality Assurance Inspectors and the Contract Administrator to complete entries on payment certificates;
  • Tracking, receiving, and processing material sampling and test results;
  • Maintaining field office documents, including through the use of the Ministry of Transportation Web-Based Contract Management System when necessary;
  • Preparing contract documentation including agendas, minutes, Instruction Notices, Change Orders, etc., for review and dissemination to client, contractor and third party representatives;
  • Working nights, weekends, extended shifts;
  • Working overtime hours as necessary. Work is seasonal in nature and will likely involve greater hours of work in summer than in winter months;
  • Other duties as may be assigned.
Skills, Competencies & Qualifications:
  • OACETT rcsi or rcca designation, or PEO EIT or P.Eng. designation;
  • 5 years of experience as a Quality Assurance Inspector on MTO or Municipal Highway / Road / Bridge construction projects;
  • Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft productivity software (Word, Excel);
  • Prior experience as a Field Office Administrator on MTO assignments is considered an asset;
  • Prior experience with MTO’s Web-Based Contract Management System is considered an asset;
  • Prior experience in the use of Critical Path Scheduling software (MS Project, Primavera) is considered an asset;
  • Team player, cooperative with other staff with open sharing of information and knowledge;

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

#LI-PQ1


Why GHD?

Being the best we can be is in our culture.
We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.

Our commitment to you

Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.

Who we are

We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation. GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

Covid Vaccine Position Statement

In response to the evolving Covid-19 pandemic, GHD has established an Operating Procedure confirming it will comply with vaccination requirements for any work which is subject to either (i) municipal, provincial, or federal government mandates or (ii) client requirements which require vaccination to perform such work, either on a client site or any workplace (“Work Requiring Vaccination”). To the extent allowed by law, GHD employees performing Work Requiring Vaccination will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and may be required to show proof of vaccination prior to engaging in this work. GHD will consider reasonable accommodation requests in the event you are unable to be vaccinated on the basis of a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.

title: newStructures Construction Supervisor
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an exciting opportunity for a Construction Supervisor to join our team. In this role, you will be a key player in helping expand our construction services for existing clients. As a self-motivated problem solver, you excel in client-facing roles that allow you to think on the spot. You have been seeking an opportunity to grow and develop your technical, leadership, and client management skills without forgoing your love for being outdoors. This supervisory role is ideal for an adaptable individual who enjoys diverse challenges, thrives in team environments, and is looking for good project opportunities in a thriving construction services team.

The position will have a focus on structural field supervision of bridge replacements and rehabilitations. This opportunity is primarily aligned with Major Works projects for BC Ministry of Highway Transportation and Infrastructure in bridge construction. The majority of the work will be located in the Fraser Valley and Southern Interior. Applicants would report to either of our well-established Kamloops or Langley branches. Flexibility for applicants physical living location will be considered.

McElhanney can offer employment options for seasonal time off (winter layup) for individuals who like to work during the typical summer construction season and have time off during the Winter to enjoy the many recreational activities British Columbia has to offer. McElhanney can also offer relocation assistance for out of province applicants.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Provide on-site Contractor supervision to monitor the quality and progress of the work being performed
  • Maintain inventories of bid item quantities and generate payment authorizations
  • Provide reporting of work progress and issue construction memos to the Contractor as needed
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to entry level staff and oversee material testing and surveying operations
  • Identify field and design issues, facilitate corrective measures, and perform constructability reviews
  • Liaise with the Contractor, client, and affected stakeholders during construction operations
  • Lead or assist in the development of construction specifications and contract tender documents
  • Understand, commit to and fulfill responsibilities under the McElhanney Quality Management System, ISO 9001 and all client quality, safety and environmental management systems
  • Ensure the team is motivated and on track, project deadlines are met within budget, and quality of work meets or exceeds client expectations.

What You’ll Bring:
Experience and Education
  • Diploma certificate in a Civil Engineering/Technology program, with experience in construction
  • Ideally +5 years of field or construction related experience as an assistant supervisor/inspector
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in a relevant field
  • Experience with highways or bridge construction projects; consulting experience is an asset
  • BC Driver’s License, Class 5 or higher, with a driver’s abstract that demonstrates safe driving behavior and is acceptable to McElhanney

Skills and Core Competencies
  • Ability to:
  • interpret construction, contracts, drawings, and specifications and compare them with construction in progress, detecting faulty materials and workmanship, and suggesting appropriate remedies
  • foresee potential issues and problems so these items can be addressed and resolved
  • take initiative and work independently without continuous direction
  • Develop acceptance/non-acceptance reports and quality assurance checklists for elements of work in sufficient detail to gauge conformance with all significant contractual requirements.
  • Knowledge of pile, cast-in-place concrete, structural steel, and precast concrete installation
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel)
  • Excellent organization and follow-up skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
  • Meticulous note keeping

Work Environment and Conditions
  • Willingness to commit to construction projects for the duration of the project
  • Willingness and ability to travel and work provincially, and temporarily reside at project sites away from home for a high percentage of time each year. Whenever possible project locations geographically close to home will be selected for supervisors.
  • Ability to work 10 hours a day, 6 days a week (mainly day shifts) to cover the Contractors schedule (regular return to home rotations will be provided, typically timed with the Contractors schedule and statutory long weekends, and/or cross shifting with other supervisors or assistants)

Key Characteristics for Best Fit
  • Desire to work on construction projects in various remote locations throughout BC
  • Enjoy working during the peak construction season and have time off during the Winter to enjoy the many recreational activities British Columbia has to offer
  • Enjoy working outdoors with willingness to work in adverse weather conditions
  • Have an ability to work well with multiple stakeholders such as Contractors and Consultants, and thrive in team environments
  • Natural leader who enjoys challenges and proactively solves problems in a team environment
  • Self-motivated, willing to speak clearly in group settings, and have a firm but fair approach
  • Have a safety and quality conscious mindset
  • Are respectful of team members, Contractors, other stakeholders, and the general public

What Can We Offer You?:
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
  • Opportunity to become a shareholder in an employee-owned firm
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth, including access to industry leading mentors through McElhanney’s mentorship program
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone


This role is designated as a safety sensitive: position.



Vaccination Requirement :

In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others. This position may require that the successful candidate become fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in the future, and as such, proof of vaccination will likely be required at some point. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.



About McElhanney:

Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,000 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people:

#LI-AM3 #Intermediate #Hybrid

If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers: to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.

McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Quality Control Coordinator - Eastern Canada District
description:
Requisition ID: 136499

Job Level: Mid Level

Department: Quality

Market: Transportation

Employment Type: Full Time

Position Overview

As a Quality Coordinator, you will report directly to the Quality Manager, and will administer the Company Quality Plan. In this role, you will be responsible for assuring that quality standards and procedures are disseminated and implemented throughout the company. You will perform and report on internal quality system audits and assists in the overall administration of the internal audit program.

District Overview

Eastern Canada District's projects include highways, bridges, mass transit, mine site development & open pit operations, hydroelectric powerhouses, wind-power plants, dams & industrial. They serve the construction and mining industries and operate in Eastern Canada.

Location

Kiewit's Eastern Canada District has several projects from Atlantic Canada to Quebec and Ontario and into Northern Canada, including in major metropolitan areas such as Toronto, Montreal, Ottawa and Kingston among others. One of the many things that makes Kiewit’s culture unique is that we go where the work is, which exposes your career to abundant opportunities. We relocate our teams based on the work that is available, combined with the development plans, skill sets and career goals of each team member. This means your Kiewit adventure is custom-designed to meet our shared needs.

Responsibilities

The Quality Control Inspector is responsible for:

  • Applying the Inspection and Test Plans on all works,
  • Inspecting the construction operations currently taking place in collaboration with Operations,
  • Validating the conformity of the works at hold points using checklists.
  • Making sure that checklists are being used to help build right the first time & closed within 48 hours,
  • Identifying non-conforming work or other issues to the Quality Manager and Operations,
  • Issuing CRs and NCRs while participating in the closure of the applicable issues,
  • Ensuring that the reception of materials is implemented as per requirements,
  • Ensuring that the Field Engineers verify that the material delivered is properly stored while avoiding damaging and altering materials as per the manufacturer's recommendations, and
  • Reviewing the ITP Inspection Notification Log and ensuring that inspection notifications are properly recorded.

In regards to Subcontractors, the Quality Control Inspector is responsible for:

  • Taking on a role of QA in regards to subcontractor quality management,
  • Performing sporadic audits of quality records to validate that subcontractor QC is effective,
  • Ensuring that ITPs are implemented as per requirements,
  • Ensuring that checklists are utilized as required by the contract,
  • Ensuring that the testing frequency for compaction and concrete testing is requested, and
  • Ensuring that all pertinent information is being recorded in testing.

In regards to Suppliers, the Quality Control Coordinator is responsible for:

  • Collaborating with the supplier to identify Quality requirements,
  • Performing Quality Kick-Off meetings with the supplier to explain projet Quality Management,
  • Auditing the supplier to determine if required Quality records submitted,
  • Participating in weekly coordination meetings to resolve Quality issues, and
  • Ensuring that all Quality issues are resolved before the release of the final payment.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree and/or 10+ years of related experience in Quality preferably within a heavy civil and industrial contractor and/or an engineering/quality consultancy.
  • Experience in a project management type environment; specific experience in Kiewit-related projects such as mass transit, transportation, power, oil & gas, mining and heavy industrial would be an asset
  • ASQ Audit certification is preferred.
  • Experience with word processing, spreadsheet and database applications required
  • Strong critical thinking skills.
  • Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management skills.
  • Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
  • Commitment to quality, safety, ethics, and integrity.

#LI-IS1

Additional Requirements:

  • Absent an approved exemption, due to federal, state, local, provincial and/or client-requirements, this position requires an individual to be fully vaccinated by a Health Canada-approved or authorized COVID-19 vaccine upon hire and as a condition of continued employment.


We believe in equal opportunity in employment practices without discrimination and comply with all laws regarding human rights in the provinces where we operate.

title: Contract Administrator
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

GHD is one of the world’s leading professional services companies operating in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation.

Privately owned by our people, GHD provides engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services to private and public sector clients across five continents. Focused on creating lasting community benefit, our connected global network of 10,000 people delivers projects with high standards of safety, quality and ethics.

Committed to sustainable development, GHD improves the physical, natural and social environments of the many communities in which we operate

Our Markham, Whitby, and Mississauga offices are looking for a Contract Administrator ready to join our growing Canadian Operations within the Transportation team.

The Transportation group within GHD Canada works with provincial government, local regions and municipalities with a variety of projects across the whole spectrum of Highway, Roadway, and Bridge Infrastructure. Our team provides integrated engineering services throughout the project lifecycle from asset management, planning, detailed design and engineering services during construction.

Responsibilities:

Duties include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Responsible for Contract Administration of civil provincial and municipal infrastructure projects
  • Liaise with the Project Managers, designers, field inspectors, contractors and clients on a daily basis.
  • Work with the Construction Administration Team Lead in the overall management of staff and departmental initiatives.
  • Work with Project Management staff to develop project policies and procedures related to quality, safety, the environment, and professional ethics.
  • Supervise and direct field staff
  • Conduct Constructability Reviews as required on Highway and Bridge projects.
  • Liaise with Clients for future Construction work.
Skills, Competencies and Qualifications:
  • OACETT ‘rcca’ designation, or Professional Engineers Ontario designation as a P.Eng.
  • Minimum 10 years’ experience in Civil Engineering Infrastructure, with a substantial focus on Highway and Bridge construction.
  • Minimum 2 projects’ experience as a Contract Administrator on contracts with construction value greater than $5-million.
  • Proven aptitude for estimating construction schedule, quantities and costs.
  • Experience with progress payments, change orders, leading site meetings, preparation of minutes, and providing guidance to field staff in relation to contracts.
  • Excellent organizational and prioritization skills are a must.
  • Strong communication skills, both oral and written.
  • Proficient with MS Word and Excel.
  • Ability to establish effective working relationships with colleagues, associates, and clients.
  • Ability to effectively multi-task and work in fast paced, high change environment.
  • Good initiative and attention to detail.
  • Strong skills in conflict resolution

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

#LI-PQ1


Why GHD?

Being the best we can be is in our culture.
We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.

Our commitment to you

Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.

Who we are

We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation. GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

Covid Vaccine Position Statement

In response to the evolving Covid-19 pandemic, GHD has established an Operating Procedure confirming it will comply with vaccination requirements for any work which is subject to either (i) municipal, provincial, or federal government mandates or (ii) client requirements which require vaccination to perform such work, either on a client site or any workplace (“Work Requiring Vaccination”). To the extent allowed by law, GHD employees performing Work Requiring Vaccination will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and may be required to show proof of vaccination prior to engaging in this work. GHD will consider reasonable accommodation requests in the event you are unable to be vaccinated on the basis of a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.

title: Project Manager
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

THORNHILL


The Opportunity:


WSP is currently seeking a Project Manager to join our Rail & Transit team, located at our Thornhill office. Reporting to the Manager, you will be responsible for managing multi-disciplinary teams responsible for delivering complex projects on time, within budget and with quality results. The Project Manager will plan, organize, monitor, and oversee one or more projects. Projects may include policy reviews, research, operational reviews, network planning, transit planning and design, and construction administration. Types of projects may include bus, heavy and light rail, commuter rail or subway infrastructure, new or expanded stations and mobility hubs, operations and maintenance facilities, commuter parking facilities, and other associated transit works.


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP


Why Work with WSP's Rail & Transit team?

  • WSP strives for gender balanced representation, including mentorship, and collaboration;
  • Be in charge of your own career growth by working collaboratively with your manager;
  • Flexible benefits;
  • Wellness time (to manage work life balance);
  • Hybrid return to office policy (unless otherwise stated per project requirements);
  • Opportunities to contribute to impactful projects locally and internationally;
  • Be a part of a collaborative high performing team;

A day in the life:

  • Manage multi-disciplinary teams of (junior) Project Managers, Engineers, Planners, Designers, Inspectors, and other staff as required;
  • Lead the teams through the successful completion of small, medium and large complex projects, able to manage multiple projects at a time;
  • Develop and monitor scope and schedule within the overall program constraints, within a collaborative contractual structure (Alliance, Progressive DB, CMAR);
  • Prepare project work plans and schedules, and obtain management/client approval;
  • Maintain regular communication with clients regarding project status and project quality, and proactively resolve issues;
  • Manage relationships with project stakeholders, including internal and external clients and vendors, regulatory authorities and technical agencies, and the public. This involves keeping the stakeholders informed of progress and issues to manage expectations on all project requirements and deliverables, and meet the project schedule;
  • Proactively track, analyze and report on actual performance against the plan, and prepare cost and schedule reporting, both for clients and as part of internal reporting processes. Address change management matters promptly and professionally with clients and internal departments;
  • Analyze project management and project delivery risks, establish contingency plans and identify trigger events and responsibility for initiating mitigating action;
  • Manage business development initiatives including Requests for Qualifications and Requests for Proposals; with input from others, compile a comprehensive and realistic scope of work, and prepare a complete and accurate fee estimate, in a format suitable for obtaining the required management approvals;
  • Provide mentoring, assistance, encouragement and motivation to team members, fostering an environment focused on achievement, and empowerment.

We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

CORE QUALIFICATIONS

  • A University Degree in Engineering (Civil Engineering preferred).

TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5 years of relevant experience;
  • Experience managing multi-disciplinary teams of project professionals; concurrently managing issues, scope and quality while bringing projects to successful completion within the scope, quality, cost, and time requirements;
  • Experience in Collaborative procurement models, especially Alliance and Progressive DB;
  • Strong business development and client management skills, scheduling techniques, and budget development;
  • Experience in project planning, risk management, cost management and schedule management, and methods of analyzing and reporting project performance on financial and other KPIs;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills including communication, presentation, leadership, and report writing proficiency with a strong desire and ability to collaborate in problem solving in an integrated team environment;
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills, including experience making presentations to senior management, elected officials and the public.

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS

  • Project Management Professional Certification (PMP) would be considered as an asset;
  • Proven leadership and management skills;
  • Ability to work successfully in multi-disciplinary teams and across different business units in a matrix organization with little to no supervision;
  • Ability to adapt well to changes in direction and priorities in a project and deadline-oriented environment;
  • Negotiating skills within a context of political sensitivity and conflicting interests;
  • Experience in a Consulting Engineering environment is an asset.

#rail2022

#OnCorr


Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Thornhill, ON

title: General Labour - Tank Tester
description:
We are looking for candidates that are mechanically inclined to repair, and test tanks and equipment on highway petroleum cargo tanker trucks and trailers. When we say mechanically inclined we are referring to individuals who are mechanically driven to understand the way parts work and are capable of using air tools and small hand tools to repair them. Internally this position is referred to as a B620 inspector which signifies the individual responsible for testing the unit to the B620-20 standard which is a regulatory standard the industry is governed by.

Responsibilities:


  • To repair or replace broken or malfunctioning parts on petroleum pumps, piping and metering systems used to load and unload tanker trucks
  • To perform low and high pressure tests on tanks and their equipment using both air an water
  • To check all tank piping, valves and equipment for faults and for leaks
  • To pressure test, repair and replace delivery hoses and fittings
  • To disassemble and reassemble faulty equipment in order to replace or repair

Required Skills:


  • Ability to use air tools and small hand tools
  • Punctual attendance
  • Eagerness to work and get the job done right
  • Great attention to detail

What We Offer:


  • An exciting fast-paced environment within a growing company
  • Full time 8-5 Monday - Friday *** ESSENTIAL SERVICE POSITION***
  • Ample training and development opportunity
  • Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits: Medical, dental
  • RRSP program

title: Senior Technologist / Inspector
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

KELOWNA


The Opportunity:

WSP is currently seeking a Senior Technologist/Inspector for various municipal projects based out of our Kelowna office. Reporting to the Senior Project Manager, Municipal Engineering this position will be responsible to support detailed design in delivering municipal and land development projects CADD, field inspection, and project management on municipal projects.


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • Provide Senior Design Engineer with support on design and development of preliminary and detailed design drawings, construction contract preparation and specification.

  • Utilizing AutoCAD Civil 3D knowledge in projects from concept to completion;

  • Engineering record drawing preparation for municipal projects;

  • Preparation of specifications and reports;

  • Construction inspection on projects in Central BC;

  • Resolving construction issues with the assistance of the project manager and field supervisors;

  • Quantity measurements, daily reporting, and participation in construction meetings;

  • Completion of construction as-built for record keeping/approval purposes;

  • Miscellaneous assistance to project manager with day to day project operations; and

  • Communications/scheduling with city/county/municipal inspectors on assigned projects to ensure compliance with contract standards/specifications.


We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

  • Civil or Construction Engineering Technology graduate;

  • 10+ years of experience in CADD and field inspection;

  • Ability to interpret construction drawings and specs;

  • A working knowledge and familiarity with Civil 3D is an asset. Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook also valuable;

  • Registered or eligible for registration with ASTTBC;

  • Excellent communication skills – written and verbal, including teamwork and interpersonal abilities;

  • Comfortable in working independently in both an office and field environment; and

  • Valid driver’s license.


Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

title: Intermediate Construction Inspector
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

MONCTON


The Opportunity:


WSP is currently seeking a Junior or Intermediate Construction Inspector to join our Transportation and Infrastructure (T&I) Team, located at our Moncton office. Reporting to the Manager of T&I, this position will be responsible for providing contract administration duties and performing and/or inspecting quality assurance (QA) acceptance on various infrastructure field projects, which may include roads, culverts, municipal water and sewer, subdivisions, or commercial site developments


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • Liaison with client representatives to administer the construction.
  • Take full responsibility for CA deliverables and monitor them as per the Consultant agreement;
  • Interpret and analyze contractor’s critical path (schedule);
  • Negotiate Price agreements, change orders, claims and work directives for all work that is not covered in the contract documentation;
  • Ensure contractor adheres to contract requirements; e.g. legal, environmental, construction standards, protection of wildlife, etc.;
  • Perform and/or supervise quality assurance (QA) acceptance and inspection of construction;
  • Identification, documentation and assessment for rating of deficiencies (deviations from Contractor’s Quality Control Process and or project standards) in the contractor’s work;
  • Maintain detailed daily diaries of contractor’s work, contract progress and inspection milestones;
  • Ensure inspection tasks are completed and recorded in a prompt and accurate manner;
  • Ensure approved construction materials are used and acquired from approved sources and a record is kept of such materials;
  • Be a company representative and act on behalf of the company;
  • Travel and work on contracts throughout NB;
  • Other duties as assigned.

We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

  • At least 2+ years’ experience with an emphasis on the construction phase of projects;
  • Civil Engineering Diploma from an accredited college;
  • Have experience administering transportation and municipal construction projects or similar type of work pertaining to road and municipal infrastructure construction;
  • Sound knowledge of municipal design standards, Standard Specifications for Municipal Services and methods associated with transportation and municipal infrastructure construction;
  • Demonstrated knowledge of relevant Laws and Regulations (Environmental, Health and Safety, etc.) and their application in construction contracts;
  • Knowledge and skill in interpreting and applying construction practices; procedures and quality assurance techniques;
  • Experience with Autodesk Civil 3D would be an asset;
  • Experience with construction surveying (total station and GPS) would be an asset.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing;
  • Ability to organize, prioritize and schedule inspection work;
  • Valid NB driver's license with an acceptable driving record.


Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Moncton, NB

title: Commercial Transport Mechanic
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Perform preventative and predictive maintenance on highway trucks and trailers
  • Perform operation test prior to repairs to verify complaint
  • Diagnose cause of any malfunction and perform repairs to manufacturer’s specifications.
  • Follow paper-flow procedures including documenting correct mileage/hours, save and tag all warranty and core parts, document all repairs on work order using complaint, cause and correction format.
  • Perform required inspections and preventative maintenance on vehicles and equipment to maximize the safety, productivity and life of the unit.
  • Maintains a safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules and regulations.- Welding and fabrication as required

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • HD truck technical training or trailer mechanic experience
  • Ability to safely and efficiently work around heavy equipment, trucks and trailers perform work in a safe manor in accordance with policies
  • Skilled in diagnosis and repair of electrical systems on trucks and equipment
  • Knowledge of engines and controls, transmissions and controls, brakes and suspensions, and of hydraulic systems
  • Skilled in welding and cutting
  • Ability to work in various inside and outside environments being subjected to weather changes, noise, and job hazards
  • Ability to hear sufficiently to accurately assess equipment problem

Qualities:

  • Must be neat and professional in appearance
  • Must be self-motivated and organized
  • Must be able to safely and efficiently operate equipment
  • Must possess good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Must be able to work around heavy equipment in a safe manner
  • Must be environmentally conscious and solution-oriented
  • Must be a problem-solver
  • Must be able to receive instruction and carry out directives as per company policy

What we are looking for:

  • Motor Vehicle Inspector Certification
  • 3+ years of experience.
  • Self-motivated, team-oriented individuals who have the ability to perform successfully under pressure
  • Professional demeanor and superior customer service skills
  • Valid Driver’s License Class 5

If this sounds like you, apply today! Please note that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted or you can send us your resume directly at sammystruck@telus.net

title: Director of Public Works and Engineering
description:
Town of Hay River is looking to hire a Director of Public Works and Engineering.

PURPOSE:
The Director is responsible for leading the management, operation, administration and implementation of all municipal works, engineering, and community planning programs and services in order to ensure effective and appropriate services for residents and stakeholders.

SCOPE:
The position of Director of Public Works and Engineering reports to the Senior Administrative Officer. The Director is accountable for the proper management of engineering services and maintenance of municipal roads, bridges, culverts, drainage and water/wastewater operations. The Director also provides support to other Departments for troubleshooting and design of infrastructure and facilities.
The Director develops long-term capital plans and ensures appropriate preventative maintenance plans are in place to support public works assets. The Director is accountable for the preparation and monitoring of the Public Works Department’s annual operations and capital budgets.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Directs, monitors and oversees the activities of the Public Works and Engineering Department. This includes but is not limited to:
    • Responsible for the day to day operations including water treatment plant/solid waste facility/water standards, delivery of water, sanitation & sewage services, inspections of roads, bridge & drainage systems.
    • Oversees the road/highway maintenance programs.
    • Ensures inspections of public buildings is carried out.
    • Ensures Town equipment and vehicles are maintained and repaired.
    • Maintains accurate files, draft and/or prepare for Mayor or SAO signature, letters to government and industry.
    • Ensures compliance with all relevant legislation, policy, bylaws, regulatory requirements
    • Preparse and files reports required by all levels of government.
  • Plans, prioritizes and ensures the implementation of Town works, community planning, construction and maintenance programs. This includes but is not limited to:
    • Leads proposal calls, tenders, invitational tenders and purchasing for the Public Works and Engineering Department.
    • Recommends and manages consultants retained by the Town.
    • Liaises with contracted architects, planners & engineers.
    • Schedules work
    • Provides project management for the Town
    • Evaluates and responds to operational challenges and opportunities for improvement.
    • Oversees the development and implementation of a preventative maintenance systems
    • Leads required work on land administration, planning and zoning.
  • Develops departmental standards, policies and procedures. This includes but is not limited to:
    • Responsible for the ongoing development of and adherence to maintenance standards.
    • Recommend design standards for new developments.
  • Provides engineering recommendations and advice to Council. This includes but is not limited to:
    • Applies design standards and comments on various development submissions to the Town.
    • Monitors construction progress and activities.
    • Attends Council meetings
  • Manages staff effectively. This includes but is not limited to:
    • Directly supervises the Public Works Supervisor, Development Officer / Building Inspector, and Civil Infrastructure Manager
    • Undertakes employee performance management, including annual goal setting/work-planning, annual performance appraisals, discipline as required in conjunction with Human Resources
    • Provides regular feedback to subordinates as part of ongoing performance management of staff .
    • Participates in the recruitment, hiring, training, management, scheduling and professional development of public works employees and various casual staff.
    • Attends Department Head meetings and provide regular updates to staff.
    • Ensures staff are appropriately trained, both to meet operational needs and for personal/career development.
    • Reaffirms the importance of safety in the workplace and contribute to the safety culture
  • Responds to inquiries and investigates complaints from the public and public agencies. This includes but is not limited to:
    • Participate in the development and implementation of public service standards.
    • Deals with public concerns
    • Responds to Ministry of the Environment inquiries.
  • In collaboration with Director of Finance & Administration, prepares and monitors Budgets. This includes but is not limited to:
    • Works with Finance, as part of the senior management team, to prepare departmental operating and capital/infrastructure budget for Council approval.
    • Monitors the availability of grants, subsidies and other forms of funding and ensure eligibility, scheduling/timing and implementation requirements are fulfilled.
    • Reviews expenditures and approvals for payment.
    • Prepares applications for funding of public works projects.
    • Infrastructure development responsibilities. This includes but is not limited to:
  • Reviews and approves (on behalf of the Town) engineering drawings for all department construction works and subdivision developments and ensure compliance.
  • Undertakes land development and administration, planning and zoning Ensure land development, planning and zoning are undertaken in accordance with bylaws, policies, best practices, legislation

KNOWLEDGE and SKILLS:
The following knowledge and skills are required for an individual to be able to perform the duties of this position:
  • Basici knowledge of Municipal Services program administration, including preventative maintenance and inspection procedures.
  • Knowledge of water & sanitation systems
  • Knowledge of building and road maintenance & repairs.
  • Knowledge of contract development and management.
  • General knowledge of mechanical, plumbing, heating & electrical systems and heavy duty equipment operation.
  • Knowledge of applicable bylaws, procedures, programs and regulatory requirements.
  • Good writing, communication and problem solving/analytical skills.
  • Understanding of project management best practices.
  • Demonstrated strong leadership/team building skills.
  • Stress and time management skills.
  • Familiarity with GIS and CAD software as well as Microsoft Office.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Post-secondary education in a related engineering discipline and five years’ of experience as a Professional Engineer, preferably in a civil/municipal context. Equivalencies will be considered.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
  • Satisfactory criminal record check required.
  • Class 5 driver's license required

title: Bridge Foreman
description:
Job Category: Labour
Job Type: Full Time
Job Location: Fidelity Engineering & Construction

Company Profile:

Fidelity Group of Companies – with the largest entities being Fidelity Engineering & Construction Inc. and Fidelity Homes Inc. – are fast growing industry leaders specializing in heavy civil construction projects, residential home building, real estate development, and landscape retail products. Administrative offices are located in Colborne, Ontario.

Job Title: Bridge Foreman

Location: Various Project Sites

Position Description:

Our high-growth business is seeking an experienced Bridge Foreman to join the Fidelity Engineering and Construction team. This position will play a key role in the organization’s ability to efficiently meet project deadlines and contribute to the organization’s total customer satisfaction effort.

Responsibilities/Duties:

  • Conducts daily huddles with crew to establish daily production goals and ensures all members of crew know and buy into plan for the day.
  • Supervise crew of craft workers including carpenters, laborers, and equipment operators
  • Supervise crew completing but not limited to: forming and pouring/finishing bridge columns, pier caps, abutments, bridge decks, retaining walls, drainage structures, setting bridge deck panels and beams, setting up and running bridge deck concrete paving machines and crane rigging and flagging.
  • Reads blueprints and job-related documents to properly plan work.
  • Responsible for planning and scheduling materials, equipment and work for the crew.
  • Records daily events in job diary.
  • Performs all work, while adhering to the Occupational Health and Safety Act and Company Safety policies.
  • Lead daily and weekly safety meetings, and ensure crew members follow safety policies.
  • Communicates goals and purposes effectively. Lead and demonstrate by example.
  • Pro-activity train and mentor crew members to enhance their skills and knowledge.
  • Work in conjunction with the larger project team to deliver the project successfully and to establish strategies to meet contract milestones.
  • Oversee field quality control and communicate with inspectors, subcontractors and regulatory bodies.
  • Coordinate with public project owners to comply with local agency and environmental issues and requirements.
  • Assist in the creation of risk mitigation strategies and implement where necessary.
  • Identify requests outside of contracted scope and raise any change management issues.
  • Demonstrate the company’s dedication to customer service and professionalism.
  • Always wear personal protective equipment as required.
  • Performs all other duties of crew members as needed.
  • Complete other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years related experience in field crew management of civil highway bridge construction operations required.
  • At least 5 years of construction experience working with concrete forms, bridges, retaining walls, drainage structures or other rough carpentry work.
  • Experience with interchange construction; highway widening; and/or bridge construction preferred.
  • Knowledge of survey controls, grade checking; and bridge geometry.
  • Competency in reading civil construction Plans.
  • Experience with Pile Driving, Concrete Forming, Steel or Beam Erection, Temporary and Permanent Shoring, Cofferdams, Drilled-shaft Foundations, and Bridge Deck Forming and Concrete Placement.
  • Thorough knowledge of concrete materials, workability, finishing and curing.
  • Through knowledge of concrete formwork systems and assembly.
  • Environmental Stewardship – experience working in and around environmentally sensitive areas including wetlands, streams, mature forests, and high-quality habitat.
  • Valid “G” driver’s license with clean driver’s abstract.
  • Able to work long days, flexible work hours and weekends.
  • Ability to travel to project sites as required.

Qualities / Skills:

  • Demonstrated safety mindset; ability to actively participate in all safety initiatives.
  • Reliable with a strong work ethic and self-motivated.
  • Able to multi-task, prioritize, and be versatile to change.
  • Strong mechanical skills.
  • Strong problem solving skills.
  • Exhibits strong verbal and written skills.
  • Ability to work both independently with little supervision, and as part of a team.
  • Demonstrates superior time management skills.
  • High level of professionalism when dealing with all internal and external stakeholders.
  • Must have a high standard and pride of quality of workmanship.
  • Must have well developed leadership and people management skills.

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

  • Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Physically demanding, requiring but not limited to frequent bending, kneeling, lifting, and climbing.
  • Work outdoors in various conditions including heat, humidity, dust, noise, and cold.

Fidelity Group of Companies welcomes and encourages application from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Thank you in advance for your interest in this position. Please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
