title: Senior Structural Inspector
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

LONDON

The Opportunity:

WSP is currently seeking a Senior Bridge Inspector with a minimum of 10 years’ experience to join our Transportation department, located in London, Ontario. Reporting to the Project Manager and Contract Administrator this position will be responsible to perform all inspection; monitoring and survey tasks required to accurately record and inspect all contractor activities. It is also recommended that the senior bridge inspector have multidiscipline experience in the fields of Grading, Asphalt, sewers, water main and Civil Electrical.

Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • Assist in inspection of high complex bridge construction contracts;
  • Work in field offices, calculating quantities, help preparing monthly payments, finalization of contract items and perform general office work;
  • Perform and/or inspect quality assurance (QA) acceptance on concrete, reinforcing steel, form work, roadway and track protection shoring, waterproofing, asphalt, and granular;
  • Maintain detailed daily diaries of contractor’s work, contract progress and inspection milestones;
  • Ensure approved construction materials are used and acquired from approved sources and a record is kept of such materials;
  • Ensure inspection tasks are completed and recorded in a prompt and accurate manner;
  • Recognize when extra work needs to be done and report to the Contract Administrator;
  • Identification, documentation and assessment for rating of deficiencies (deviations from Contractor’s Quality Control Process and or OPSS standards) in the contractor’s work;
  • Review test results and ensure remedial action occurs with respect to failed tests;
  • Monitor contractor’s adherence to all contract requirements, as per Contract Administrator’s direction; e.g. legal, environmental, construction standards, protection of wildlife, etc.;
  • Monitor contractor’s adherence to the Occupational Health and Safety Act, WHIMIS, Environmental Act, Transportation of Dangerous Goods and Waste Management regulations in a manner consistent with the contract.
  • Be a company representative and act on behalf of the company;
  • Travel and work on contracts in the City of London and Kitchener areas;
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • You will always ensure health and safety policies are followed at all sites and take WSP's Life Saving rules to heart;

We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

  • Must be certified by OACETT and possess the Road Construction Senior Inspector (rcsi) designation; or have a P.Eng. designation;
  • Have experience inspecting highway, municipal or rail bridge projects;
  • Should have knowledge of design standards, specifications, and materials associated with construction, Laws and Regulations including Environmental, Occupational Health & Safety requirements and their application in construction contracts;
  • Familiarity with contract documents, specifications, standards, manufacturer’s material specifications, C.S.A. standards and special provisions;
  • Experience utilizing Computer software including Word, Excel, and Microsoft Project;
  • Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing;
  • Ability to organize, prioritize and schedule inspection work;
  • Valid Ontario driver’s license with an acceptable driving record.

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


London, ON

title: Senior Bridge Project Supervisor - Construction
description:
Senior Bridge Project Supervisor - Construction - ( 220000LM )

Description

We create great places and the connections that get people and goods moving—whether by car, bus, train, plane, or their own two feet. Working within the context of the communities we serve, we provide planning, engineering, and infrastructure management services that fit the needs of our clients and improve the overall transportation experience. Join our team and help us keep communities connected.

Your Opportunity

An opportunity exists with Stantec for a Senior Bridge Project Supervisor Construction. We are seeking a highly motivated person who will provide project supervision services for bridge construction, including quality management, record documentation, survey and volume determination, cost control and reporting, inspection services for compliance with drawings, standards, and specifications.

The position's qualifications include the ability to communicate effectively (verbally and in writing) with strong presentation skills including support of public involvement and outreach programs; strong project/program management expertise; solid understanding of infrastructure design and construction with expertise in complex structures; and strong expertise in bridge rehabilitation, bridge widening and complex structure-types.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Experience in project supervision, ensuring consistency with BCMOT practices
  • Knowledge of BCMOT Standard Specifications and major Works Construction Agreement, application, and interpretation consistent with Ministry practice
  • Practical and technical knowledge of bridge construction including concrete bridge Deck Re-Surfacing
  • Leading and developing technical discipline teams and performing as a project manager on bridge projects.
  • Detailed knowledge in specific disciplines
  • Sound knowledge of Quality Management in project supervision services
  • Timely and accurate surveying and quantity determination
  • Liaison with other consultants, other Ministries, individuals, and outside agencies
  • Arrange, facilitate, and document project team meetings
  • Manage individual bridge construction projects schedule and budgets
  • Serving as the primary client liaison to bring the schedule, budgets, and scope of work to completion and to the client’s satisfaction.
  • Position will primarily work in a field office setting with travel.

Qualifications

Your Capabilities and Credentials

  • Must have been the senior technical person that carried out and was responsible for full time inspection, supervision for structures for highway roadway projects.
  • Must have current experience in inspection/ supervision of concrete bridge deck resurfacing projects.
  • Significant experience with structure construction supervision and management of small and complex bridge projects
  • Experience with Quality Control / Quality Assurance Program development and implementation.
  • Strong client interaction and relationship skills.

Education and Experience

  • Must have professional engineers or technicians/ technologists with current experience as bridge construction inspectors or as bridge project supervisors
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

title: Environmental Inspector / Monitor
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

SASKATOON, EDMONTON and CALGARY

We are a global leader in the Earth and Environment sector, made stronger with the recent acquisition of Golder. Globally headquartered in Montreal, where it all began, we proudly serve communities from coast to coast and beyond. With Golder now part of our WSP team, we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.

As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources, expertise, and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from marine biologists to geophysicists to geotechnical engineers and more.

The Opportunity:

At WSP, we're continuing to grow and develop our expertise in Environment, operating as a trusted advisor and technical expert on engineering design challenges for our clients across multiple industries. Our team is growing, and as a result we're adding an Environmental Inspector or Monitor to our group. As part of the Construction Services team in Saskatchewan or Alberta, you'll be responsible for driving forward our ambitious plans to enhance our Environmental service offering in the province through your work with a close-knit team of engineering specialists, professionals, and technical staff. As a consultant, the successful applicant will be responsible for applying technical skills and knowledge on monitoring a variety of construction projects throughout western and northern Canada. Prior consulting experience is an asset.

Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging
  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.
  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • Providing Environmental Inspection/Monitoring on a variety of projects including pipelines, HDD crossings, rail, bridges, powerlines, mine sites and other linear developments throughout western and northern Canada
  • Interacting with clients, contactors, and representatives from regulatory agencies within a variety of settings
  • Monitoring construction activities for the adherence to Provincial and Federal Permits/regulations, Project Environmental Protection Plans, and industry Best Management Practices
  • Work independently or as part of a larger multidisciplinary team
  • Assist in aquatic, wildlife, vegetation, and soils surveys
  • Preparing permits and reports as part of the regulatory reporting requirements
  • Participation in Golder and client health and safety programs
  • Mentoring and training junior staff

We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

  • A degree or diploma related to environmental sciences with at least three years of relevant experience
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills with particular attention to detail and accuracy of field notes
  • Experience in a variety of technical backgrounds which may include erosion and sediment control, turbidity monitoring, wildlife monitoring, drill waste management, clubroot/weed management, and topsoil handling
  • Strong awareness of health and safety issues and a safety-conscious attitude
  • Experience working on construction sites
  • Willing to travel and work out of remote locations for extended periods
  • Willingness to perform physically demanding work in a variety of conditions
  • A valid driver’s license

Experience with the following are considered assets:

  • Multi-disciplinary background including previous aquatics, wildlife, vegetation and soils experience
  • Strong outdoor skills, experience working in remote areas, and experience with operating field equipment including boats, ATVs, snowmobiles, GPS, water sampling equipment
  • Knowledge of federal and provincial regulatory and permitting requirements.

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Saskatoon, SK

title: Co-op Civil / Structural Engineer or Technologist
description:
Civil / Structural Engineer or Technologist

4 Month (minimum) or 8 Month Co-op Term starting May 2022

Location: London, Ontario


GM BluePlan Engineering is a dynamic consulting firm providing full life cycle expertise and services in land development, municipal infrastructure, asset management, design, and construction projects. Our teams of professionals throughout Ontario have a strong legacy of providing sound technical advice, insight, and innovative solutions to our private and public sector clients.


Job Description:

This opportunity is for a 4 month or 8 month co-op term for students currently enrolled in an Engineering or Engineering Technology program or equivalent training, with the option to extend the co-op term duration to meet the needs of your program's co-op duration requirements.


As part of the Civil / Structural Co-op, you will join our consulting engineering team to provide engineering solutions to a variety of municipal and private clients with exposure to planning, design and construction phases of municipal infrastructure.


What you will do:

  • Contribute as part of a dynamic team of engineers, technicians, technologists and engineers-in-training.
  • Have a balanced working environment of primarily field and office work, as construction and project timelines allow.
  • Topographic site surveys and construction layout using GPS, Total Station and rod-and-level survey equipment as part of a 2 person survey crew.
  • Construction inspection for municipal construction (e.g., sewers, watermains, roads, parking lots, culverts, bridges) with oversight from senior construction inspectors and contract administrators.
  • Prepare preliminary and detailed design drawings, sketches, process diagrams, grading plans, figures and other drawing deliverables using AutoCAD software.
  • Field work including visual inspections in accordance with the Ontario Structure Inspection Manual (OSIM), as required.
  • Prepare cost estimates, contract documents, engineering reports and memoranda under the direction of senior technical staff.
  • Become familiar with design codes, standards, specifications and guidelines within the industry such as Ontario Provincial Standard Specifications (OPSS) and Drawings (OPSD), Municipal and City Design Guidelines, Canadian Highway Bridge Design Code (CSA S6), the Ministry of Transportation of Ontario's Structural Manual, and Ontario Structure Inspection Manual (OSIM).


What you will need:

  • Currently enrolled in an Engineering or Engineering Technology program or equivalent training.
  • Experience and aptitude to work with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook), AutoCAD and AutoCAD Civil 3D.
  • Strong organizational, oral, written communication and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to objectively evaluate problems and opportunities and think outside the box.
  • Motivated to continuously learn and broaden their experience to enhance their engineering knowledge and qualifications.
  • Experience in construction considered an asset.
  • Possess a valid driver's licence.


COVID-19 Considerations:

In accordance with GM BluePlan Engineering COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, all new GM BluePlan Engineering employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment, subject to valid medical or Ontario Human Rights Code exemptions.


What we can provide:

  • A dynamic and balanced work environment which encourages teamwork, initiative and ingenuity.
  • Exposure to a broad range of civil engineering projects.
  • Personalized opportunities for career development, mentoring, training and education.
  • A positive work experience and opportunities for growth and advancement.
  • We are all looking forward to the day when we can transition from our virtual events back to our team building and social events (hockey, golf, BBQs and many more social events).


Join our Team!


Candidates who are interested in contributing to our approach, vision, and values are invited to forward their resume.


We thank all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

GM BluePlan Engineering Limited will accommodate candidates under the AODA legislation in all aspects of the hiring process. Please notify us if accommodation is required.

title: newSenior Structural/Bridge Engineer
description:
Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.



Your Impact:


At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.

If you are ready to bridge the gap between our world and our people, join Jacobs. Let’s build for a brighter future together. Jacobs is much more than just a traditional engineering company. At Jacobs, our vision is to create a more connected, sustainable world. We push the limits of what’s possible and help reinvent tomorrow. Jacobs fast-growing team is currently delivering some of North America's most exciting transportation and infrastructure planning and design assignments, and is the #2 Bridge firm as ranked by Engineer News Record.

We are looking a highly motivated and personable Senior Structural/Bridge Engineer based in the Calgary area. As a Senior Bridge Engineer, you will help lead and grow our Calgary bridge team and support our established bridge teams in Alberta and Ontario. You will be responsible for pursuing, leading and coordinating the design delivery on multiple assignments simultaneously, coordinating the design with other practices, and liaise with our national bridge leader and global engineering design resources, as required. The incumbent should be willing to work in a team environment, mentor junior staff, interact with clients and approval agencies, and assist senior project managers in their deliverables.

You’ll serve in a Bridge Discipline Lead on a variety of bridge project sizes in Alberta and projects across Canada. You’ll lead successful delivery of high-quality projects within budget and on schedule and effectively collaborate with others. You’ll identify creative and innovative engineering solutions based on client, project, and site constraints while leading bridge teams in all aspects of bridge analysis and design, from conceptual planning and preliminary design to final design and construction.

You’ll be working mainly from home or from our Calgary Office with the expectation to travel for client meetings and occasional team meetings.

Here’s What You’ll Need:
  • Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering and/or Structural Engineering
  • Licensed P.Eng. in the Province of Alberta
  • Proven existing relationships within clients and industry in the Alberta market, including extensive experience working with Alberta Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure in a lead capacity
  • 15+ Years of industry experience.
  • Experience with new bridge/bridge replacement and structural rehabilitation and repairs of various types of bridge structures
  • Strong technical design and project management skills related to bridge design, including but not limited to: preliminary and detail design of bridges, culverts and other structures, seismic design, and rehabilitation of existing structures
  • Bridge analysis and design, being familiar with Canadian Highway Bridge Design Code and Alberta Owner’s requirement, and bridge analysis and design software
  • Preparing specifications and contract documents
  • Construction and contract administration as site resident engineer or site inspector
  • Involvement in business development and preparing proposals

Ideally, you'll also have:

  • Experience with alternative delivery projects in a technical/design lead position
  • Experience working on projects in various Provinces and Territories.
  • Experienced report and proposal writing skills.
  • Experience with site inspections during construction is an asset.
  • Experience with pre-design site reviews to establish existing conditions and design and repair strategies is an asset.

#li-gs1

#bia



At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

You’ll lead successful delivery of high-quality projects within budget and on schedule and effectively collaborate with others. title: 4th Yr. Journeyman Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Cascade Energy Services LP is actively recruiting for the position of 4th Year Journeyman Heavy Duty Mechanic at its Redcliff, AB location.

Duties will include:

  • Adjust, repair and/or replace parts and components on all company fleet units consisting of Pressure Trucks, Vac Trucks, Heating Units, Combo Units, Highway Tractors, Tank Trucks, Winch Tractors and pickups.
  • Test and adjust repairs systems.
  • Perform scheduled maintenance service.
  • Diagnose faults and malfunctions.
  • Review work orders and discuss work with supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Alberta Journeyman Heavy Duty Mechanics License.
  • CVIP Inspector.
  • Ability to multi-task with strong attention to detail and excellent organization skills.
  • Positive, pleasant and professional attitude.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment.
  • Self-motivated with the ability to take own initiative on projects.
  • Awareness of our Corporate Objectives and Principles.
  • Team Play – has respect for self and co-works.
  • Required to supply own tools and CSA approved steel toed work boots.
  • Valid driver’s license.
  • Required to successfully complete fit for duty testing which includes medical, physical, drug and alcohol testing.

Cascade Energy Services L.P. is a specialized trucking and industrial cleaning company that provides dependable and professional service to our customers in the energy, utility and construction industries throughout western Canada. We offer a competitive wage relative to experience, company share purchase plan, complete health benefit package along with a solid career in the trucking industry. Cascade Energy Services L.P. focus’ on career development and its people, our employees are the core of everything we do. For more information on Cascade Energy Services L.P. we invite you to check out our company on our website at: cascade-energy.ca. Cascade Energy Services L.P. is an Employment Equity company.

If you would like to join our team, please forward a resume with driver’s abstract and three work references to ceshr@cascade-energy.ca or fax 403-504-1210.

We would like to thank all interested applicants for taking the time to submit a resume, however only those being considered for the positions, will be contacted.

title: Technologist, Municipal Infrastructure
description:
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 9,800+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We are among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects.

At WSP :

  • We value our people and our reputation
  • We are locally dedicated with international scale
  • We are future focused and challenge the status quo
  • We foster collaboration in everything we do
  • We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

WINNIPEG

The Opportunity:

WSP is currently seeking a Technologist or Technician to join our Land Development & Municipal Engineering group, located at our 1600 Buffalo Place office in Winnipeg office. Reporting to the Manager this position will be responsible for CADD Civil 3D, and project design on greenfield, brownfield and infill land development projects throughout Manitoba, with specific focus on the Winnipeg Area. With some great opportunities for career development, we are looking for an individual who wishes to build a long-term career with WSP.


Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging

  • Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.

  • A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.

  • Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.

  • Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.

  • A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAreWSP


A day in the life:

  • Utilizing AutoCAD Civil 3D knowledge in projects from concept to completion;

  • Preliminary design, site grading / earthworks calculations, contract administration, proposal development

  • Engineering record drawing preparation for land development and municipal projects;

  • Miscellaneous assistance to project manager with day to day project operations;

  • Preparation of specifications and reports.

  • Construction inspection on projects mainly in Southern Manitoba;

  • Resolving construction issues with the assistance of the site project manager and field supervisors;

  • Quantity measurements, daily reporting, and participation in construction meetings; and

  • Communications/scheduling with city/county/municipal inspectors on assigned projects to ensure compliance with contract standards/specifications;

  • Other duties as assigned.

We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

  • Civil or Municipal Engineering Technology graduate;

  • 10+ years of experience in design and drafting;

  • Ability to interpret construction drawings and specs;

  • Registered or eligible for registration with CTTAM as a CET or C.Tech;

  • Excellent communication skills – written and verbal, including teamwork and interpersonal abilities;

  • Comfortable in working independently to meet project deadlines, in both an office and field environment;

  • Knowledge of the City of Winnipeg and Winnipeg Metropolitan Area Standards considered an asset;

  • Advanced working knowledge of AutoCAD, Civil 3D;

  • Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook also valuable; and

  • Valid Manitoba driver’s license.


Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY.

WSP Canada Inc.


Winnipeg, MB

title: Civil Construction Manager - Transportation
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:


Wood currently has an exciting opportunity available for a Civil Construction Manager for Transportation related work.


Based in any of our larger Alberta or BC offices, we are seeking a motivated candidate who combines strong technical and construction management skills with a keen ability to ensure that construction remains on schedule and within budget. The role includes responsibility for providing leadership in the performance management of activities related to the execution of construction work within the Transportation sector. This includes a wide range of responsibilities including planning, cost control, materials management, contract/work force administration, safety/incident prevention, quality, security, and change management. If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast-paced environment, this is a great opportunity for you.


Day to day work could include office and field duties as follows:

  • Assisting Engineers with design work for road and highway construction projects
  • Coordinate and participate in road inspections
  • Coordinate and supervise survey crews, material inspectors & contractors
  • Preliminary engineering of new roads and road rehabilitations
  • Detailed design and design checks of roads/highways
  • Preparation of tender documents
  • Construction and post-construction engineering
  • Contract preparation and administration, including RFI’s, NCR’s and Change Orders, etc
  • Liaise with existing clients, involvement with proposals and project presentations
  • Ensuring construction work is executed as per engineering drawings & specifications

Skills / Qualifications:
  • 15 + years of relevant construction experience. CET, P.Tech, EIT or P.Eng. designation would be considered an asset
  • Familiarity with the use of AutoCAD, Civil 3d, and other road design software would be considered an asset
  • Experience with Transportation/Infrastructure work and Construction Standards (AB Transportation and BC MoTI) is required for this role
  • Demonstrated experience supervising highway construction and base paving operations is required for this role
  • Experience working as an Engineering Consultant is preferred
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both verbal and written at multiple levels of an organization
  • Effective people management skills required for this role
  • Must have an unrestructed Class 5 driver’s license valid in the provinces of Alberta and BC and access to a vehicle (mileage will be reimbursed)
  • Must be able to travel out of town and be willing to work extended hours as required
  • Experience with Site Safety management is considered an asset
  • Available to travel within Alberta and British Columbia
Company Overview:
Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com
Diversity Statement (EEO):
We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

description:

We have over 55,000 team members across the globe. RED DEER

The Opportunity:

WSP is currently seeking an Intermediate Technologist for various municipal projects based out of our Red Deer office. Reporting to the Senior Design Engineer, Municipal Engineering this position will be responsible to support detailed design in delivering municipal and land development projects CADD, field inspection, and project management on municipal projects.

Why WSP?

  • We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and Belonging

#WeAreWSP

A day in the life:

  • Utilizing AutoCAD Civil 3D knowledge in projects from concept to completion;

We'd love to hear from you if you have ...

  • A working knowledge and familiarity with Civil 3D is an asset. Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook also valuable;

title: Project Manager - Buildings
description:
RWDI is a global engineering consulting firm, bringing our wide range of experience and skills together to develop a better, holistic solution for our clients.  We share a fundamental dedication to earning the trust and exceeding expectations of our clients.  


Are you a Project Manager with 5+ years’ experience in a consulting engineering environment?


RWDI is seeking a Project Manager to join our Project Delivery team in our Vancouver office. This Project Manager will be focused on supporting RWDI’s Buildings market sector. 


The role includes but is not limited to:
•    Responsible for effectively sourcing, negotiating and facilitating new business.
•    Creating and delivering proposals inclusive of scope, fees and qualifications for public and client RFPs.
•    Responsible for developing strong working relationships with clients.
•    Assembling and guiding a team of RWDI consultants towards meeting project objectives. 
•    Oversee the preparation of documentation and reporting developed by the technical team.
•    Accountable for project performance, on time and on quality delivery, and ensuring client expectations are met or exceeded.
•    Manage financial activities of the project including tracking revenue, issuing invoices and recovering receivables.
•    Ensuring that Quality Assurances are completed, recorded and meet company standards and project scope.
•    Track industry developments and innovations to ensure that RWDI is continuously delivering relevant services, and new and innovative deliverables.
•    Regularly develop and deliver presentations at project meetings / workshops and industry events.



We are currently accepting applications from candidates with the following skills and qualifications:  
•    5+ years of relevant and proven industry knowledge and experience within architecture, engineering, design and construction, interior design, operations and building management, or other relevant fields. 
•    Post-secondary education required.  Preference will be given to a degree or diploma in Engineering, Applied Science, Building Science, Architecture, or another relevant field. 
•    Understanding of building design and construction process, codes, standards and protocols. 
•    Superior and effective communication skills.
•    Excellent client service ethic.
•    Ability to delegate and prioritize deliverables.
•    Ability to market RWDI and develop strong client relationships.
•    Experience in developing detailed proposals and negotiating fees with clients.
•    Ability to manage clients.
•    Proven ability to: successfully meet schedules and control costs; manage scope creep; and negotiate additional service agreements when appropriate.
•    Ability to develop solid inter-personal relationships.
•    Strong leadership, organization and efficiency skills.
•    Ability to speak and present in front of a large group.
•    A drive to make it happen, and to turn client needs into opportunities.
•    Ability to deliver on commitments and exceed client expectations.
•    An aptitude for practical problem solving.
•    Desire and ability to work in and contribute to project teams.
•    Excellent team leadership skills and experience.

Compensation:
•    Competitive Salary
•    Annual Performance Bonus
•    Group Health Benefits
•    RRSP Matching
•    Learning Spending Account
•    Fitness Spending Account

Thank you in advance for your application.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. 

RWDI endorses and practices the principles of equal opportunity employment. We are committed to diversity and inclusion. 

Accommodations are available during all stages of the recruitment process.

title: Construction Site Manager
description:
• An excellent opportunity to advance your career in a rapidly growing company!
  • Receive a highly competitive salary of $35-50/hour!
  • Enjoy a generous benefits package, including 100% health and dental coverage, a company truck, and much more!

About Momentum Design Build

Momentum is a locally owned and operated design and build company. We seamlessly manage the design and build process for custom homes, multi-family, spec residential projects, and commercial projects. Our team works closely with clients, consultants, and sub trades to ensure each project is smoothly taken from initial design right through to build completion.  

To learn more about us, please visit our website by clicking here.

About the Opportunity

Due to an exciting period of growth, Momentum Design Build currently has an opportunity for a Site Manager to join our team in Nanaimo, BC on a permanent, full-time basis. 

Reporting to the Construction Manager, you will be responsible for the supervision of all construction activities that take place on the work site, ensuring high levels of workmanship and efficiency. The Site Manager will be responsible for the management of all on-site workers and the enforcement of all required safety and work regulation policies. All work crews and individuals on-site shall take direction from the Site Manager, who is responsible for assigning required work and applying resources to accomplish that work. 

Some of your essential duties and responsibilities will include:

  • Overseeing and coordinating the actions of crew members during construction projects.
  • Reading blueprints and interpreting information during different phases of construction. 
  • Assisting the Project Manager with the initial mobilization and set up of the construction site.
  • Being an inspiring leader who knows how to manage and delegate while building relationships with crew and clients alike.
  • Taking an active role in the selection, training, coaching, and supervision of team members, including monitoring performance, providing feedback, and taking corrective action.
  • Monitoring job progress and costs to ensure they stay on track, and provide regular progress reporting to management. 
  • Establishing effective onsite communications and progress reporting to stakeholders.
  • Ensuring compliance with health and safety training.
  • Hands-on construction site work when required, including operating site vehicles, machinery and equipment.

For a more detailed list of responsibilities, please click here.

About You

To qualify, you will need a minimum of 5 years of direct experience in construction site management in single-family and multi-family residential construction in BC, with on-site experience being a requirement. Completion of a Technical Diploma is a strong asset. A valid Driver’s License is also required. Previous management experience and experience in coaching and developing team members is preferred.

As our ideal candidate, you have a solid understanding of all construction trades and techniques, along with effective management, delegation, planning, and leadership skills. You have a demonstrated track record of dealing successfully with internal and external customers, and experience in leading a team.

Above all, we’re looking for someone who fits well with the rest of the team, who is capable of creative and innovative thinking, and who is eager to learn and advance their career with Momentum.

About the Benefits

As a valued member of our team, you will be rewarded with a highly competitive salary of $35-$50/hour (negotiable based on higher experience) with the opportunity for overtime pay, along with a generous benefits package, including:

  • Extended medical and dental with 100% coverage
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program
  • Short and long term disability insurance
  • Priority access to Telus Health Virtual Care (see a Doctor any time – 24 hours a day/7days a week)
  • Financial support for continuous learning and development
  • Opportunities for career growth and advancement
  • A company truck
  • A supportive team environment where work-life balance is valued
  • Leadership that values employee input and ideas
  • Consistent work lined up for years to come
  • Donations for involvement in community volunteer activities
  • Company social events, including team lunches, drinks, and Christmas parties
  • Relocation assistance available for the right candidate

If you share our values and have the skills necessary to bring success to the role, then we would love to hear from you - Apply Now!

title: Construction Inspectors - Casual Hours
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

 

Wood is currently recruiting for Casual Construction Inspectors in different locations throughout Newfoundland, to support a variety of infrastructure projects.

  • Conduct site inspection for municipal construction projects, including storm and sanitary sewers, water distribution, and roadways identifying and advising of non-compliance.
  • Review and interpret contract documents and contract drawings
  • Coordinate and monitor the material testing/quality control program completed by others
  • Keep field diaries, records of work completed, materials and equipment on site each day
  • Monitor environmental compliance
  • Work closely with the Contract Administrator to provide observations, records and data as required for contract administration
  • Track and summarize quantities, and review, prepare and recommend approval of payment certificates
  • Liaise with the design engineer and clients for approval of on-site changes
  • Liaise with the public and other stakeholders
  • Ensure compliance with Woodâ€™s project-specific Health and Safety Plan
Skills / Qualifications:
  • 2+ yearsâ€™ experience as a Construction Inspector on municipal infrastructure projects
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Knowledge of DMAE Municipal Water, Sewer and Roads Master Construction Specifications would be considered an asset
  • Valid driverâ€™s license required
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Construction Inspector
description:
Overview:

Do you have a passion for transportation engineering and providing technical solutions to meet the needs of your clients? Do you enjoy sharing your expertise with others and working collaboratively in a team environment? Are you a trusted technical advisor and problem solver? If this sounds like you, than Dillon is the place you need to be!

 

The Opportunity  

Dillonâ€™s Transportation and Facilities technical group is looking for Construction Inspectors in the Manitoba area (east and west).  These are temporary positions with the possibility of extension.

 

You will have the opportunity to work on new and exciting projects while providing clients with a fully integrated and superior customer experience.   You will be a key part of our multidisciplinary group serving our private sector.

 

Responsibilities:

Tender Preparation and Contract Administration (100%)

  1. Contribute your technical expertise through leadership on a variety of transportation and other civil engineering projects, including design and contract administration of highway rehabilitation and reconstruction  
  2. Preliminary and detailed design of urban roadway and rural highway rehabilitation and reconstruction  
  3. Preliminary and detailed design of other civil infrastructure rehabilitation and reconstruction    
  4. Prepare tender documents, specifications, and cost estimates
  5. Prepare site instructions, contemplated change notices, change in work orders, meeting minutes, requests for information, and progress estimates
  6. Provide site inspections during the construction of highway and other civil engineering projects
  7. Provide oversight to construction observers, surveyors, scale persons, and checkers
  8. Provide oversight of quality control and quality assurance activities      
  9. Review contractor submissions during construction
Qualifications:

What you will need to succeed

 

Qualifications

  1. A diploma in a related discipline of Engineering Technology
  2. 5 years' related work experience
Experience:
  1. Experience as a resident inspector on provincial highway infrastructure projects or large private or municipal transportation infrastructure projects
  2. Experience leading or managing multidisciplinary construction teams
  3. Knowledge of industry standard contracts and specifications
  4. Working knowledge of relevant municipal/provincial standards and regulatory requirements
  5. Knowledge of municipal servicing standards and environmental requirements

Why choose Dillon?

 

Dillon is powered by people who are technically proficient, passionate about socially important projects, and motivated to deliver superior, tangible results. We strive to remain at the forefront of technology and innovation, and are empowered to continually grow and develop.  

 

We live our  core values:

  • Reliability: words result in actions that build trust
  • Achievement: do the work to hit the target
  • Continuous development: always learning; always adapting; always growing
  • Creativity: discover new possibilities
  • Courage: do the things that matter, especially when itâ€™s hard
  • Inclusiveness: enabling belonging to draw strength from our differences

   In addition, we offer:

  • Flexible work hours and remote working options
    • Dillon values its staff and the contributions that are made each day and understands that work arrangements can differ based on personal needs and business needs.   We are taking a trust-based approach to oï¬€er a variety of ï¬‚exible and remote work options to help balance the competing demands of work and personal life.s.
  • Focus on Innovation
    • The ability to anticipate, examine, and adopt new and innovative solutions is a crucial driver for the continual and progressive advancement of our business performance. In our culture, people are empowered to reflect and question current practices and seek forward looking solutions to todayâ€™s problems and tomorrowâ€™s opportunities.

About Dillon

 

Dillon is a proudly Canadian, employee-owned, professional consulting firm specializing in planning, engineering, environmental science and management. We partner with clients to provide committed, collaborative, and inventive solutions to complex, multi-faceted projects. With 20 offices and more than 900 employees across Canada, Dillon offers a wide range of services related to building and improving facilities and infrastructure, protecting the environment, and developing communities.

 

Now operating for over 75 years, we continue to strive for excellence in everything we do. Dillon has been listed as one of  Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies for the past 15 years and has the distinction of having achieved Platinum Club member status in this program.

 

Employment Equity, Diversity & Inclusion at Dillon:

Dillon is committed to the principles of employment equity, inclusiveness, and diversity within our organization.  We strive  to achieve a workplace where opportunities are based on skills and abilities and that respects and values differences.  

 

Inclusion is more than a word to us, it is the way we choose to run our business.  

 

We encourage you to connect with us at  

accommodation@dillon.ca

 if you require  accommodation in the interview process.  

 

We would love to hear from you!

title: Highways Construction Supervisor/Inspector
description:
The Opportunity: 
McElhanney has an exciting opportunity for a Highways Construction Supervisor/ Inspector to join our team based in Edmonton, AB. In this role, you will be integral to expansion of our field construction services across a range of projects ranging from highways, urban streetscapes to remote resource roads. Working closely with our Construction and/or Project Managers, you will be the field lead on the projects to offer professional services and insight. You are a true team player who is keen on receiving professional mentorship and on-the-job training to grow your career.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Responsible for contract administration and provide on-site construction inspections
  • Monitoring the quality, quantity and progress of construction activities
  • Author daily inspection reports, prepare monthly progress payments and other associated Contract Administration tasks
  • Very familiar with construction specifications, requirements and progress reporting
  • Review materials testing results as required and communicate to Project Managers, Contractors and Agencies related to the project.
  • Review contractor’s submissions and provide recommendations
  • Prepare and chair on site progress meetings with clients, contractors and their sub-contractors
  • Responsible for identifying the required resources and assigning individual responsibilities on site
  • Understand the hazards and safe work procedures for each task and inspection location
  • Report inspection issues to senior supervisor
  • Understand, commit to, and fulfill responsibilities under the McElhanney Quality Management System, ISO 9001 and all client quality, safety, and environmental management systems
  • Provide mentorship and leadership to junior or support staff.

What You’ll Bring:
  •  Minimum of 7years of field /construction related experience with preference given to Alberta Transportation experience along with other Provincial project experience.
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in a relevant field along with specific road building experience will be considered.
  • Ability to work remotely with long hours: 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, with fatigue relief as required by relevant Regulations.
  • Willingness to commit to construction projects for the duration of the project
  • Must have experience with municipal, highways,  bridge, construction projects; materials testing and/or survey experience is an asset
  • Ability to foresee potential issues and problems so these items can be addressed and resolved
  • Exceptional organization and follow-up skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment, meticulous note keeping
  • Clean driving record and the ability to comply with client-driven D&A testing requirements

Key Characteristics for Best Fit:
  • Desire to work on construction projects in various locations throughout Alberta
  • Enjoy working outdoors with willingness to work in adverse weather conditions and at night
  • Ability to work well with contractors and thrive in team environments
  • A curious individual who is eager to learn new skills, including the progression construction from drawings and specifications to a completed product.
  • A self-aware individual who knows the limitations of his/her skillset and knowledge with ability to recognize when he/she should defer to the senior supervisor
  • Have a safety and quality conscious mindset.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your lifestyle
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
  • Opportunity to become a shareholder in an employee-owned firm
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support and mentoring for your professional development and growth
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
  • Participation in our numerous programs that support our Four Cornerstones: people & communities, clients & partners, processes & technology, and financial.


For a full review of our projects, please visit our line portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio


About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As an employee owned and operated firm with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high level of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

#intermediate  #onsite   #LI-AM3  
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Municipal Building Inspector
description:
Under the responsibility of the general management of Saint-Maxime-du-Mont-Louis, the municipal inspector acting as municipal building and environmental officer is primarily responsible for the application, development and compliance with the provisions of municipal by-laws on urban planning and the environment. Specifically, the incumbent must:

- Inform citizens about the regulations in force, receive applications, analyze projects, issue permits and certificates of authorization and follow up.

- Ensure the application and adaptation of municipal by-laws, urban planning and those relating to the environment.

- Set up and adapt inspection plans according to municipal needs.

- Notify orally or in writing the owners or contractors violating the municipal by-laws, indicate if necessary the corrective measures to be taken.

- Assume the coordination of the Planning Advisory Committee (PAC), analyze and present any request for minor variance or amendment to the by-laws if necessary.  

- Receive complaints if necessary and follow up with the General Management.

- Be part of a new management committee with the general and deputy management as well as the director of public works. The committee will be responsible, among other things, for occupational health and safety.

- Assume any other function or related responsibility agreed with the municipality according to the profile of the candidate.

Requirements

-Hold a college or university diploma in a field relevant or related to the municipal world (technician in development and urban planning, architecture or civil engineering)

-With or without experience

-Have the certification of the COMBEQ or commit to obtain it

-Demonstrate initiative and autonomy

-Have a good knowledge of French

-Mastery of the main computer tools and software

-Be diplomatic

-Skilled at popularizing information

-Hold a valid driver's license

Salary conditions

-Permanent full-time position.

-Competitive salary and benefits depending on the current scale and the candidate's profile ($45,000 to $58,000, group insurance and employer RRSP contribution).

Additional Information

Open job posting with start of employment possible now. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Employer-led training, work-life balance and employment in an experienced and dedicated team.

title: Construction Inspector (Underground)
description:
McMillen Jacobs Associates' has an opportunity for a Construction Inspector in our Vancouver, BC office within our Construction Management Practice. This position will be based out of our design office in Vancouver, BC with work at a project field office in the Greater Vancouver area primarily on underground and pipeline construction projects.

The successful candidate for this position will have experience with shaft, tunneling and trenchless methods for water supply, wastewater and pipeline construction.

This position requires physical fitness necessary to make field visits and inspections of on-going construction including tunneling under various field conditions.

Responsibilities:

  • Inspect and monitor construction contractor's work and prepare daily, weekly and monthly inspection reports as required. Review contractor reports.
  • Review and provide input into field related Submittals, Requests for Information, Design Clarifications, geotechnical information and data, and CPM schedules.
  • Monitor the Contractor's receipt of materials arriving on-site, monitor off-site production activities and/or any other construction activities in his/her area.
  • Monitor construction progress for compliance with Contract Documents, safety standards and agency requirements.
  • Utilize agency Project Information Management System (PIMS) and/or other Agency electronic systems for preparing Inspection Reports.
  • Assist the Engineer of Record (EoR) team as needed during times when inspection requirements are light.
  • Have the ability to work both independently and collaborate with other Inspectors for field problem solving.
  • Ability to manage and meet multiple deadlines.
  • Aid in drafting As-Builts.

Typical Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • On a continuous basis, know and understand all aspects of the job. Intermittently analyze work papers, reports and special projects; identify and interpret technical and numerical information; observe and problem solve construction inspection activities; interpret and explain codes, rules and regulations; and observe safety precautions.
  • Intermittently, sit at desk for long periods of time; walk and stand while performing inspections; kneel and bend while reviewing infrastructure; climb in and out of trenches; perform simple and power grasping, pushing, pulling, and fine manipulation; and lift or carry weight of 50 pounds or less.
  • Evaluate quality of construction and materials.
  • Determine safety implications of construction techniques.
  • Determine and verify elevations using hand level and calculator.
  • Use sound judgment in recognizing scope of authority.
  • Operate and use modern office equipment including computers and applicable software.
  • Maintain regular attendance and adhere to prescribed work schedule to conduct job responsibilities.
  • Utilize appropriate safety procedures and practices for assigned duties.
  • Communicate effectively orally and in writing.
  • Relate effectively with people of varied academic, cultural, and socio-economic backgrounds using tact, diplomacy, and courtesy.
  • Establish and maintain effective, cooperative and collaborative working relationships with others.
  • Minimum of 5 years experience with inspection of heavy civil construction.
  • BC Health and Safety certification or equivalent.

General Performance Expectations:

  • Have a wide range of knowledge of heavy civil and underground construction techniques, building codes and standards.
  • Be well organized and analytical with the ability to communicate information clearly and precisely.
  • Available to work extra hours or a weekend day on occasion as well as periods of night shifts when the work on site requires.
  • Strong math skills.

ABOUT MCMILLEN JACOBS ASSOCIATES

McMillen Jacobs Associates is an employee owned, multi-disciplined firm, with self-performing design-build capability. We are experts in underground/tunneling and water resources projects and deploy this expertise to serve the water, wastewater, transportation, dams, energy and aquaculture sectors including public, private, and regulatory clients using a wide range of delivery methods. For 75 years, we have worked closely with our clients at every stage of a project assisting them with planning, permits, designs, project management, construction, and start-up.

We want our employees to make a career doing what they love to do. We encourage an entrepreneurial spirit and help our team members forge their own path within the company. We support their efforts to stay on the cutting edge of technology while fostering a great work-life balance. In addition to working hard, we also have fun. We socialize and celebrate achievements at summer picnics, holiday parties, and company outings.

We are pleased to accept applications from underrepresented groups and encourage applications from Indigenous persons, youth, new immigrants, and persons with disabilities.

Benefits: Full Benefits Program consisting of Medical Services Plan (MSP), Registered Retirement Savings Plan, Dental, Extended Health Care Benefit, Critical Illness Insurance, Health Spending Account, Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program, Education Reimbursement Program, Stock program, 10 Paid Holidays, Paid Time Off and Wellness Reimbursement

Pay Rate: DOE

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

For additional company information and to apply online, please visit our website at www.mcmjac.com

No Recruiters, Please.

title: Technician inspector in telecommunication structures
description:
Type of employment: Permanent, full time

Schedule: 40 hours per week

Workplace: Laval office (549 Rue Principale, Laval (QC), H7X 1C7)

Frequent travel in the Greater Montreal area and in remote areas from time to time

AXNOR Consultants Inc., member of DPHVgroup - D’Aronco, Pineau, Hébert, Varin Inc. is a consulting engineering division specialized in the field of telecommunication infrastructures and structures serving the major spheres of communication, navigation and energy.

The technician inspector in telecommunication structures will be required to carry out inspections and structural surveys related to foundations and telecommunication structures such as guyed tower, self-supporting and monopole towers, antennas, rooftop structures and other specialized structures. In addition, this person will also be involved in survey and inspection work related to projects to secure work environments.

Responsibilities :

  • Perform surveys, verification and validation of standard structural elements of existing structures;
  • Write structural analysis and inspection reports;
  • Participate in the planning and technical coordination with team members.

Skills required :

  • DEC in Civil Engineering Technology;
  • Valid ASP-construction card;
  • Strong interest in structures and field work;
  • Valid driver's license;
  • Solid knowledge of Autocad drawing software;
  • Experience in inspection and drawing (an asset);
  • SPRAT I certification (an asset);
  • Team spirit, resourcefulness, autonomy, sense of humour and good work organization;
  • French, oral and written, functional English.

The experience, dynamism and expertise of our engineers and technicians create an environment that promotes learning and the contribution of each individual allows us to imagine and design solutions that are adapted, practical and innovative for the various projects of our clients. Join our team of committed people!

Are you inspired by these challenges? Send us your application without further delay to or through our job module on our website at .  

*We thank you for your interest in AXNOR. However, only those selected will be contacted. DPHV group is committed to employment equity and we encourage women, visible minorities, aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities to apply*.

title: Construction Inspector
description:
Gannett Fleming Canada is looking for an experienced construction management professional for the role of Construction Inspector to join our team in Toronto to assist in the management of transportation construction projects in the GTHA. Our construction management and inspection capabilities satisfy the most selective clients. We effectively control our clients’ costs, deliver their projects on time, and meet strict regulatory needs while maintaining long-lasting relationships from the pre-construction stage until long after project completion Construction Inspector be the resident at the place of work when the construction activities are being carried out and be responsible for the inspection examination of work and the preparation of reports for work progressed on site. 

Key Responsibilities

  • Establish a safety-first culture for all construction projects
  • Inspect work materials and methods to ensure requirements of contract documents are fulfilled in a safe manner with requisite quality
  • Maintain a daily inspection diary documenting construction activity, including environmental events and recording of progress and as constructed details for the purposes of project closeout.
  • Issue contract deficiency reports, including follow-up on required corrective actions.
  • Observe, act, and report on contractual and non-contractual infractions of safety, security, operational interference
  • Assist in the resolution of construction related issues.
  • Carry out all quality assurance and quality control functions to confirm contractor's adherence to the contract documents.
  • Be responsible for tracking the details of change notices to ensure sufficient information is gathered for the completion of as constructed drawings.
  • Assist in the project close out phase including certificate of substantial completion, punch list and receipt of as-builts
  • Ability to clearly communicate, in writing and verbally, with project team members about relevant construction systems and processes.
  • Coordinate and carry out inspections during the construction of the work to verify compliance with the contract documents.
  • Review the quality of Contractors work and provide report to client.
  • Ensures contract compliance to technical plans and specifications; and reviews documentation and files for accuracy and completeness, including daily reports and construction logs. 

Education | Experience: Education Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or related field.
  • OACETT Designation (C.E. T, C.Tech, A.Sc.T)
  • Professional Engineer (P. Eng) is an asset.
  • Certification as a Certified Construction Contract Administrator (CCCA) from a Construction Specification Canada (CS) is an asset. Experience Requirements
  • Minimum of 5-15 years in construction engineering experience that includes field construction, contract administration, estimating, negotiations; project and design management.
  • Experience with a Class 1 Railway and working within a right of way is an asset.
  • Demonstrated experience in supervising construction sites, field engineering, site work inspections and work progress measurements
  • Demonstrated on-site construction inspection experience in construction of transit, commercial and municipal infrastructure.
  • Preference will be given to candidates with direct experience on large scale transit projects or transportation infrastructure
  • Must be comfortable in both professional office and field work environments
  • Proficient in MS Word / Excel / Outlook
  • Knowledge of pertinent federal, Provincial, and local laws, codes, and regulations as they apply to transit operations.
  • Proven understanding of industry standards within construction, Health and Safety codes and regulations.
  • Excellent listening, communication, and organizational skills
  • Experience in resolving claims
  • Strong communication skills, verbal and written
  • Valid driver’s license required; this position requires use of personal vehicle in good working order
  • Flexibility to travel to construction sites for extended periods and work outside of normal business hours
