title: General Inspector - Pipeline - Northern BC
description:
Company Description

Make an impact with SGS! With more than 94,000 employees and 2,600 offices and laboratories across the world, SGS is a silent force working hard behind the scenes to deliver quality and integrity to businesses across nine industries. As the world’s leader in providing inspection, verification, testing and certification services, Forbes ranked the SGS Group as one of the world’s top multinationals and one of the world’s most innovative companies. The Dow Jones Sustainability Index has also recognized the SGS Group for its sustainability processes. In Canada, SGS employs over 2,000 team members across 70 locations.

Job Description

The General Inspector is to observe the Contractor’s progress and inspect all activities in his/her assigned areas in accordance with Company drawings, plans, specifications and the terms of the construction contract or agreement. The General Inspector will also be asked to assist other certified craft inspectors, as directed.

SGS is currently looking for a General Inspectors for upcoming projects in Northern BC.

LOOKING FOR EXPERIENCE ALL LEVELS

  • Entry
  • Intermediate
  • Senior

SHIFT SCHEDULE / ROTATION

  • 6/1
  • 24/7

ACCOMMODATIONS

  • Hotel or Camp
     
Qualifications

  • API 1169 (not mandatory)
  • Blasting experience
  • Large Piping Experience
  • Steep Slope Experience (Preferred)
  • Carries a degree/diploma/certification as an engineer, technologist or technician in a related field; certification from the Interprovincial Standards Red Seal Program as a journeyman in a relevant field
  • 5 years or more of progressive, relevant experience in related general construction activities on pipeline or facility projects in the oil and gas or construction industry
  • Possesses a working knowledge of the latest CSA Z662, CSA A23.1, CSA A23.2, CSA S16.1
  • NACE CIP Level 1 certification an asset;
  • Strong background in one or more pipeline general Inspector construction activities (e.g. excavation, bending, lowering in, backfill, etc.);
  • Possesses a strong background in the oil, gas and/or petrochemical industries;
  • Strong background in excavation methods in close proximity to buried, energized, loaded mechanical and electrical systems
  • Possesses a strong background in loss prevention programs;
  • Strong background in company design and construction execution methods.
  • Has a positive safety and quality attitude

MANDATORY TRAINING:

  • Health and Safety Awareness Training for Workers and Supervisors (Ontario only)
  • WHMIS/TDG
  • Valid First Aid / CPR
  • Valid Defensive Driving
  • Contractor Safety Orientation
  • Ground Disturbance Level II
  • Excavation Orientation


Additional Information

SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process.  Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings should be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Inspecteur(trice) en bâtiment
description:
Sommaire du poste:

Relevant du directeur, le titulaire du poste agira à titre d’inspecteur en science du bâtiment et en ingénierie des matériaux. Il sera responsable de la surveillance de divers travaux de mise en place de systèmes d’étanchéité de toitures, de fondations et de tunnels.

Principales responsabilités: 
  • Surveiller les travaux d’étanchéité des systèmes de toitures, d’imperméabilisation des fondations et de tunnels;
  • Réaliser des expertises en enveloppe du bâtiment (façade et toiture);
  • Communiquer avec les clients, architectes, concepteurs, l’Association des Maîtres Couvreurs du Québec (AMCQ) et les différents intervenants concernant le déroulement des travaux et les déficiences constatées sur les projets;
  • Effectuer les tâches d’entretien et de calibration de certains équipements;
  • Préparer des rapports techniques de chantier à partir d’outils informatiques;
  • Rédiger et effectuer le suivi des mémos de non-conformité;
  • Assister les chargés de projets dans les expertises et les diverses investigations (ex. : réunion de démarrage);
  • Appliquer les mesures de santé et sécurité au travail (SST);
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes.
Profil recherché:
  • 1 an d’expérience pertinente dans la surveillance des travaux de toiture et/ou en ingénierie des matériaux;
  • Carte ASP construction;
  • Formation de travail en hauteur (un atout);
  • Formation en thermographie (un atout);
  • Bon esprit de communication, de travail en équipe et du souci du détail et d’observation;
  • Posséder un permis de conduire valide et avoir accès à une voiture.
Avantages ABS: 
  • Salaire à la hauteur de vos compétences et possibilité de temps supplémentaire;
  • Possibilité davancement rapide; 
  • Perfectionnement de vos compétences; 
  • Avantages sociaux dès jour 1 (assurances collectives | REER-RPDB | médecine virtuelle, disponible 24/7 | PAE);
  • Équipements technologiques à la fine pointe; 
  • Équipe unie et collègues passionnés; 
  • Équipements propres et récents; 
  • Reconnaissance : tout moment est bon pour célébrer!
  • Plusieurs comités en place pour des activités sociales!
Travaillez dans une équipe dynamique où lesprit déquipe est au rendez-vous !

** Veuillez prendre note que l’usage du genre masculin est utilisé sans aucune discrimination et uniquement dans le but d’alléger le texte **

title: Contract Administrator / Construction Inspector
description:
If you have a passion for construction delivery and tackling the unique construction challenges of our municipal and transportation clients, we won’t hold you back! Crafting creative solutions to manage our clients’ evolving municipal and transportation construction needs, the Construction Contract Administrator will help lead the delivery of construction services on a diverse array of civil, transportation or municipal infrastructure projects.  This role will provide onsite leadership during construction and be involved in procurement, construction delivery, and post construction activities.


A Little About Us
We are engineers, technologists, planners, landscape architects, scientists, and their support teamsthat work together to deliver infrastructure, minimizing environmental impact and maximizing benefit to the community.  We work hard and play hard because that is what #ISLlife is all about!  Check us out on Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

ISL’s Calgary Office is committed to finding, mentoring, and growing the right individual.  Our collaborative team approach is integral to our success.  We are:
  • Collaborative – we work together as a team and support each other to get the work done
  • Communicative –we build strong relationships and maintain open, transparent communication with clients, contractors, and community members affected by our projects
  • Committed – we deliver a quality project to clients and working some evenings and weekends in construction season
  • Ambassadors – we are representatives of the company and the client while we are onsite
  • Safe – we place a high priority on safety, and identify and proactively address issues we observe onsite
  • Dynamic – we adapt to evolving job sites as they move through different phases and have different challenges


A Little About You
Your cover letter must demonstrate:
  • How you build and maintain client and contractor relationships
  • Your ability to problem solve in the moment

Your resume should show us:
  • Degree or Technologist Diploma in Civil Engineering, Engineering Design and Drafting, Construction Management or related field from an accredited institution
  • Registered as or eligibility to register as a C.Tech. or C.E.T. with ASET or as and E.I.T. or P.Eng. with APEGA
  • 5+ years’ experience in construction inspection for municipal or transportation projects, include a list of these projects
  • Experience monitoring contractor performance in transportation or municipal construction contracts
  • Experience in construction contract administration, which includes preparation and or review of the following documents:
    • Site instructions, notice of proposed changes, change directives, change orders, non-conformance reports
    • Progress quantity review, prepare progress payment recommendations, and project closeout documentation (substantial, construction and final completion certificates)
  • Preparation and review of key contractor submittals such as traffic accommodation and detour plans, care of water plans, ECO plans and ESC plans

Bonus points for:
  • Experience with bid preparation, specification writing and cost estimation
  • Experience in construction inspection with the City of Calgary (or equivalent), Alberta Transportation and/or other municipal government clients in the Calgary area
  • Understanding and application of City of Calgary and/or Alberta Transportation construction specifications
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD Civil3D software
  • B.Sc. CPM, CPESC or Can-CISEC designation
  • Design of ESC Plans
  • Mentoring of junior staff
  • Construction survey and/or materials testing experience


A Little More About the Role
Responsibilities:
We are flexible with the start date for the role, but look to have the successful applicant start in April 2022 at the latest.

This role is based in Calgary with potential for longer-distance / longer-duration travel within Southern Alberta or Western Canada. Increased working hours during the construction season are to be expected, with the choice to bank overtime for time off in slower winter months.
We are looking for someone with a keen attention to detail, someone who can complete both quality control checks of themselves, and the work of others. You will require and must maintain a valid Class 5 Alberta Operator’s License.  A company vehicle will be provided.  You will also:
  • Work with a diverse team of project managers, engineers, planners, and technologists to deliver excellent service to our clients
  • Maintain positive relationships with colleagues, clients, contractors, and community members affected by our projects
  • Observe safe work practices to protect the health and safety of yourself, co-workers, and others on active construction sites
  • Provide constructability review of design drawings on a variety of civil projects
  • Produce construction quantity take-offs and cost estimates from design drawings
  • Prepare tender / contract documents and project specifications using City of Calgary or Alberta Transportation templates
  • Lead construction inspections, construction reporting, design clarifications, third-party utility coordination, material testing and survey coordination during the construction phase of our design projects
  • Organize and chair construction meetings as well as prepare and issue the meeting minutes
  • Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly construction reports according to client requirements (City of Calgary, Alberta Transportation, or others)
  • Work in accordance with ISL’s Quality Management processes to ensure technical quality of deliverables
  • Respond to contractor’s RFIs; preparing and issuing Contemplated Change Notices, Change Orders, Change Directives and Site Instructions
  • Complete quantity verification and review of contractor’s progress claims
  • Arrange and conduct CCC / FAC inspections and issuance of related certificates
  • Prepare record drawings and project closeout documents


 

We are engineers, technologists, planners, landscape architects, scientists, and their support teams that work together to deliver infrastructure, minimizing environmental impact and maximizing benefit to the community. 

  • We work on fascinating projects right in our community.
  • We are nimble. We integrate the right team to solve our clients' biggest challenges.
  • We are social. Follow our hashtag #isllife on Twitter and Instagram or check out our YouTube Channel.
  • We get together.Every year, Staff Development Seminar brings together ISLers from all over western Canada to learn, share and connect.
  • We are independent problem solvers.Employee owned and operated, we like to work hard with minimum bureaucracy.
  • We encourage and reward high performance. Employer paid benefits plan, Group RRSP, and competitive salaries with opportunities for annual bonus.


Want to find out more about this or other ISL career opportunities?

Visit us online at www.islengineering.com/about/join-the-team

title: Official, Building/Plumbing
description:
Job posting closes: May 30, 2022 at 5:00 pm (Yukon Standard Time) 

An Eligibility List may be established from this competition – the duration of the eligibility list may be up to 12 months. The eligibility list may be used to fill future permanent full-time, permanent part-time, temporary full-time, temporary part-time, term or casual vacancies within the same department and classification based on the organizational needs by going to the next highest-ranked candidate until the eligibility list expires.

This position is covered by a collective agreement between the City of Whitehorse and the Public Service Alliance of Canada/Yukon Employees Union.

The City wishes to thank all applicants for their interest but only those candidates selected to advance in the recruitment will be contacted.  Note that only those candidates eligible to legally work in Canada will be considered.

Building/Plumbing Official

Job Code:014
Department: Land & Building Services

Job Summary:

The incumbents enforce the Building/Plumbing Bylaw and Zoning Bylaw.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  1. Inspects building projects for code compliance, specifies remedial action, prepares reports and investigates violations.
  2. Reviews and approves building plans and specifications, and issues permits.
  3. Follows, so far as is reasonably practicable, established safety procedures and standards.
  4. Issues occupancy, final approvals and summary conviction tickets and issues “stop work” orders as directed.
  5. Supplies professional expertise in relation to residential and commercial construction and interprets the Building Code and Building/Plumbing and Zoning Bylaws and acts as a resource regarding national Building Code Standards.
  6. Provides input to Building/Plumbing Bylaw revisions.
  7. Answers enquiries & assists with the processing of applications and issuing of Building/Plumbing and various Planning & Development permits as required.
  8. Acts as Supervisor Building Inspection as assigned.

This description contains elements necessary for identification and evaluation of the job. The incumbent may be required to perform other related duties.



Job Requirements:

Working Conditions:

Scheduled to work 8:30 am - 4:30 pm Monday to Friday for a 35-hour work week. Work outdoors a large portion of the time - exposed to extreme temperatures, inclement weather and health hazards when conducting site visits and completing inspections.

Required Knowledge, Skill and Abilities:

  • Journeyman Certificate in plumbing or carpentry
  • Entry level Building Officials Professional Certification - 7 hours
  • Confined Space Entry - 7 hours
  • Conflict Resolution Course - 21 hours
  • Standard First Aid with CPR Level C - 14 hours 
  • Class 5 Driver's License
  • Previous Experience - 5 years as a Journeyman with increasing levels of responsibility
  • On-the-Job Experience – 6 Months
  • Proven attention to detail, interpersonal, communication, conflict resolution & team building skills

An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.

Examples of Equipment to Operate:

Computer with applications such as Outlook, Word, Excel, Internet, ERP, Access to National Building, Plumbing and Fire codes, office equipment, calculator, camera, vehicle, small hand tools, communications equipment, safety equipment and ladders.

Other Details:

COVID-19 Note: The City of Whitehorse recently lifted requirements for all new hires to be fully vaccinated from Covid-19 before their start date. The Covid-19 situation continues to evolve and the previous vaccination requirements for all current City employees and new hires may be re-instated, should the prevailing status change. The City of Whitehorse continues to follow the direction and recommendations from Yukon's Chief Medical Officer of Health (CMOH) and public health authorities.

Job seekers are required to create an online profile and submit their application electronically through the City's online Applicant system via www.whitehorse.ca/careers. Instructions on applications are provided at https://www.whitehorse.ca/departments/human-resources/how-to-apply. If you have any further questions regarding this posting, please contact the recruiter at

HR@whitehorse.ca

.

To apply for this position, you are required to submit your resume. 

Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the recruiting process. 

At the time this posting closes, candidates must have valid and current licenses/certifications/education that match the position requirements. Candidates who are selected to continue with the recruiting process will be required to provide proof of qualifications during their interview.

title: Construction Inspector
description:
:

Gannett Fleming Canada is looking an experienced construction management professional for the role of Construction Inspector to join our team in Guelph to assist in the management of transportation construction projects in the GTHA. Our construction management and inspection capabilities satisfy the most selective clients. We effectively control our clientsâ€™ costs, deliver their projects on time, and meet strict regulatory needs while maintaining long-lasting relationships from the pre-construction stage until long after project completion

 

Construction Inspector be the resident at the place of work when the construction activities are being carried out and be responsible for the inspection examination of work and the preparation of reports for work progressed on site.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Establish a safety-first culture for all construction projects
  • Inspect work materials and methods to ensure requirements of contract documents are fulfilled in a safe manner with requisite quality
  • Maintain a daily inspection diary documenting construction activity, including environmental events and recording of progress and as constructed details for the purposes of project closeout.
  • Issue contract deficiency reports, including follow-up on required corrective actions.
  • Observe, act, and report on contractual and non-contractual infractions of safety, security, operational interference
  • Assist in the resolution of construction related issues.
  • Carry out all quality assurance and quality control functions to confirm contractor's adherence to the contract documents.
  • Be responsible for tracking the details of change notices to ensure sufficient information is gathered for the completion of as-constructed drawings.
  • Assist in the project close out phase including certificate of substantial completion, punch list and receipt of as-builts
  • Ability to clearly communicate, in writing and verbally, with project team members about relevant construction systems and processes.
  • Coordinate and carry out inspections during the construction of the work to verify compliance with the contract documents.
  • Review the quality of Contractors work and provide report to client.
  • Ensures contract compliance to technical plans and specifications; and reviews documentation and files for accuracy and completeness, including daily reports and construction logs.  
:

Education Requirements:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Civil Engineering or related field.
  • OACETT Designation (C.E. T, C.Tech, A.Sc.T)
  • Professional Engineer (P. Eng) is an asset.
  • Certification as a Certified Construction Contract Administrator (CCCA) from a Construction Specification Canada (CS) is an asset.

 

Experience Requirements

  • Minimum of 5-15 years in construction engineering experience that includes field construction, contract administration, estimating, negotiations; project and design management.
  • Experience with a Class 1 Railway and working within a right of way is an asset.
  • Demonstrated experience in supervising construction sites, field engineering, site work inspections and work progress measurements
  • Demonstrated on-site construction inspection experience in construction of transit, commercial and municipal infrastructure.
  • Preference will be given to candidates with direct experience on large scale transit projects or transportation infrastructure
  • Must be comfortable in both professional office and field work environments
  • Proficient in MS Word / Excel / Outlook
  • Knowledge of pertinent federal, Provincial, and local laws, codes, and regulations as they apply to transit operations.
  • Proven understanding of industry standards within construction, Health and Safety codes and regulations.
  • Excellent listening, communication, and organizational skills
  • Experience in resolving claims
  • Strong communication skills, verbal and written
  • Valid driverâ€™s license required; this position requires use of personal vehicle in good working order
  • Flexibility to travel to construction sites for extended periods and work outside of normal business hours

 

:

At  Gannett Fleming, we believe in  improving  the lives of the people we serve. We believe in  innovation  and social responsibility. We believe in the  diversity  of our team and the creative solutions they provide. We believe in embracing  change  and emerging technologies while maintaining an unmatched standard of quality. We believe in creating an environment where employees can thrive at home and at work. We believe in engaging our employees, building lasting relationships with our clients, and, in turn, making a difference in the world.

 

We offer a comprehensive benefits program, which includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance, our tax-deferred retirement plan, and  the opportunity to incentive compensation for eligible positions. We are committed to your personal growth and professional development, so we offer tuition reimbursement, access to internal and external training programs and support active participation in professional organizations.

 

Gannett Fleming is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteransâ€™ status or other characteristics protected by law.  

 

Permanent Residency or Canadian Citizenship required for this position. No relocation assistance will be provided for this position. Local candidates will be given preference.

 

NO AGENCIES PLEASE: Unsolicited resumes from third party agencies will not be accepted.

 

Location: Guelph, Ontario

Core Business Hours: 8:00 AM â€“ 5:00 PM
Employment Status: Full-Time  

Salary Range: Salary dependent upon experience and geographic location

#L1: Hybrid

 

Please be advised that Gannett Fleming may require you to provide proof of the Covid-19 vaccination to meet regulatory and client requirements. Upon hire, you will be required to attest to your vaccination status. Valid religious and medical exemptions will be reviewed and considered in accordance with applicable law.

title: Chief Building Official
description:
Chief Building Official - Ontario Municipality
CompetitiveCompensation (85 - 135K) & Benefits

Other Similar Titles:
- Building Official
- Building Inspector / Examiner

Reporting to the municipality's Chief Administrative Officer, the Chief Building Official (CBO) is responsible for enforcing the Building Code Act and regulations in accordance with the Provincial statutes and municipal by-laws. The CBO manages all aspects of the Building Division from the building permit application intake, plans review & inspection to ensure the health and safety requirements are met for new construction & renovations. The CBO will have overall responsibility and statutory duties as defined under the Building Code Act

SomeKey responsibilities:
  • Leads & manages the Municipality's planning function including administration, zoning by-laws amendments, development applications & permits, site plan control, consents, minor variances, building & property standards, and the Official Plan
  • Performs CBO duties under Building Code requirements: conducts field inspections ensuring by-laws compliance, reviews & issues building permit applications, conducts building inspections as necessary
  • Assists Deputy Clerk with the management of municipal properties including land & building acquisitions or dispersals
  • Liaises with government ministries, the public and businesses
  • Assists Fire Chief on Fire Code inspections and enforcement
  • Works in a safe manner in accordance within OH&S Act
Ideal Candidates will likely have many of the following Attributes:
  • 8 - 25+ years experience in progressive building compliance roles, some leadership would be an asset
  • Degree / diploma in Architecture, Civil Engineering, Planning or a field closely related to the building industry
  • Experience working with Municipal & Planning Acts, Building Codes & Acts
  • Chief Building Official certification is ideal(CBO eligible &/or in-progress will be considered)
  • Valid Drivers License and open to aVulnerable Sector check
  • Strong organization & communications skills - verbal & written plus Solid computer skills (ie, MS Word & Excel)
  • Open to periodic after hours meetings, emergencies & on-calls evenings & weekends
The successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary and benefits package, a variety of developmental opportunities, and the opportunity to make a real difference. Plus, you will have time to enjoy our community.

title: Civil Inspector - Port Alberni
description:
The Civil Construction Inspector will provide on-site direction and supervision to ensure completion and quality of civil work on our multi-family residential construction site. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills and a working knowledge of various civil and residential construction means and methods.  

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Perform civil works coordination, inspections, and quantity measurement
  • Check grades and elevations of newly installed infrastructure
  • Monitor and coordinate contractor progress to ensure work is completed within construction schedule
  • Check for compliance to plans and specifications
  • Review and confirmation of monthly progress worksheets and measurements
  • Maintain an as-built plan and communicate changes to Civil Team
  • Follow up on deficiencies to ensure timely correction and completion of work
  • Assure compliance with the project construction schedule and budgets
  • Uphold the job-related safety regulations, policies, and procedures
  • Ensure project materials and workmanship meet the project quality standards
  • Use best efforts to resolve any scheduling challenges/disputes between on-site subcontractors and suppliers

 

REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 2 years of civil construction experience
  • Minimum 2 years of experience overseeing project sites/civil crews is an asset
  • Equipment operation is an asset
  • Valid Class 5 Driver's License
  • Understanding of methodology and terminology in the civil construction industry
  • Proven ability to read and interpret blueprints and other construction drawings
  • Working experience in earthworks and utility installation
  • Results-focused with a proven track record of accomplishments in the construction field
  • Ability to travel and work on various job sites at different territorial locations

 

Why Seymour Pacific?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: Materials Testing Technician (Co-op Student)
description:
Your Employer:

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and itâ€™s more than 2,800 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

In our Calgary, Alberta office, formally McIntosh Lalani Engineering, Englobe is pleased to offer a co-operative opportunity to multiple ambitious Civil Engineering/Technology Students. Reporting to the Team Lead, Materials,  you will spend your 8-month co-op program (or 2 consecutive 4-month terms) assisting the team in the field.

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

Your Contribution:

Students will have the opportunity to be trained and to perform the following tasks:

  • Field testing of civil construction materials such as soils, aggregates, concrete, and asphalt  
  • Learn about construction equipment, sequencing, and drawings
  • Compaction testing of soils, aggregates and asphalt
  • Concrete testing; casting cylinders and performing slump and air measurements
  • Asphalt testing; Marshall analysis, pavement coring, and onsite sampling  
  • Preparing daily test summary reports
Your Profile:
  • Successful applicants will receive $20.00 per hour based on a 44-hour week, and $30.00 per hour for time worked in excess of 44 hours (approximately $1,200.00 per week depending on quantity of overtime).
  • Travel assistance of up to $500.00 may be provided, where applicable, at the successful completion of the work term.
  • Technicians will be provided with a company truck.

 

Qualifications

  • A Civil Engineering Student in recognized Canadian College or University
  • Valid drivers license, current drivers abstract, and insurance claims experience letter will be required.
  • CSA approved laced steel-toed boots
  • Alcohol and drug testing may be required upon arrival
  • Must be able to work outside of normal working hours and any overtime assigned

title: Calgary - Roofing Inspector
description:
***All applicants, please note this job is apply online. No in-person applications will be accepted.  Please do not call The Client, there is a phone number is provided in the ad for the hiring manager.  Thank you.***

We are a Roof Inspection firm based in the greater Vancouver region. Our growing company is currently
recruiting a qualified roofing supervisor looking to get their BC RRO Roof Inspector certification.

Responsibilities:

  •  Assist with performing envelope condition assessments of multi-residential, commercial, and institutional facilities and preparation of reports.
  • Assist with performing field investigation work and diagnosis of building problems required to design exterior envelope remediation including exterior walls, roof, and/or structural remediation
  • Assist with performing leak investigations of all aspects of building envelopes; roofs, walls, windows, and foundations
  • Assist with performing field reviews of construction work in progress on both new and replacement projects and report on progress and the contractor's adherence to specifications.
  • Training in project management with regular site visits.
  • Producing reports that include photo observations.
  • Attend on-site meetings as required.
  • Learning to maintain regular contact with all stakeholders throughout the work cycle.
  • Supervise and lead roofing crews from project start to finish.

Duties will include:

  • Work setting in both the office and field environment.
  • Interpretation of re-roofing and deck replacement details.
  • Assist with producing inspection reports.
  • Assist with preparing the technical design, specifications, and/or recommendations for a variety of building envelope assemblies.
  • Safely working at heights including accessing buildings by ladders, mechanical lifts, and stairs.
  • Typical duties associated with working as a roofer.
  • Co-ordinate all input for time billing and job costing
  • Other tasks may be required to ensure timely completion of deadlines

Requirements & Qualifications

  • Knowledge in all areas related to roof assemblies such as proper application of material to roofs and decks.
  • A basic appreciation of building construction including methods, materials, and systems.
  • Exceptional attention to detail, specifically with accuracy and completeness of data collection and notation.
  • Must be able to write technical English at an advanced level
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Good with people and can provide direction without conflict.
  • Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
  • Naturally self-motivating and multi-tasking ability.
  • A great attitude.
  • Able to work individually and with others.
  • Available to work longer hours as needed.

Perks: 

  • A company vehicle and equipment are provided. 
  • Vacation Entitlement is 4 weeks.
  • The company extended medical plan is effective one month following the start date. 

Salary: $70,000 - $80,000 depending on experience.  

Moving allowance is provided for those relocating from outside of Greater Vancouver.

If you are interested & meet the qualifications, please apply now! Candidates selected for the next stage will be contacted via phone for a qualifying interview. 

If you have applied already and would like to contact the hiring manager because you meet ALL the requirements, please call Virginia Johnson at 778-982-1200. 

***All applicants, please note this job is apply online. No in-person applications will be accepted.  Please do not call The Client, there is a phone number is provided in the ad for the hiring manager.  Thank you.***

title: Tower Inspector
description:
Tuesday, December 21, 2021

Are you ready to take your career to new heights? Join our growing team at WesTower Communications Ltd. as a Tower Inspector!

We are Canada's largest network service contractor offering Engineering, Design, Fabrication, Construction, Project Management, and Maintenance Services for telecommunication carriers, independent tower operators, broadcast, and utility.

We are currently hiring for a Tower Inspector position for the Ontario Region. We offer competitive wages, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities to further develop your skillset and grow your career.

Job Description:

  • Telecommunications Tower and Rooftop inspection and mapping.
  • Report building based on field data collection and cataloging site information.
  • Creating loading charts for audits, tower analysis, inspections, etc.
  • Support for Engineering staff with field validation.
  • Document management support for Engineering group.
  • Office work as well as travel to various sites throughout the region.
  • Working with project managers to ensure schedules and timelines are achieved.

Qualifications:

  • Experience climbing telecommunication towers and working at heights in all seasons.
  • CET or EIT is considered an asset.
  • Experience in Tower Rigging, Surveying or Construction is considered an asset.
  • Perform job tasks in a safe manner in accordance with company policy and regulations.
  • Proficient AutoCAD, Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word &Excel etc.).
  • Ability to work independently and efficiently write technical reports and can collect accurate field measurements and data.
  • Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.
  • High attention to detail.
  • Ability to maintain professional working relationships with co-workers and clients.
  • Must be reliable, trustworthy and have a positive attituded.
  • Willingness to travel for extended periods.
  • Valid Ontario driver license w/ clean driving record.

title: Student Construction Inspector
description:
Comtech Group Inc. (Comtech) is a multidisciplinary consulting firm providing integrated, world-class consulting services in Program and Project Management, Project Controls, Engineering, Technical Advisory, Construction Management, and PMIS /Technology Integration Services across a variety of diverse market sectors. Our team thrives in embracing and navigating technical challenges within the Transportation & Infrastructure, Industrial & Manufacturing, Energy & Utilities, and Buildings & Facilities markets across North America. Our firm has a core focus and comprehensive experience supporting project owners through collaborative and integrated partnerships in delivering projects that improve the world around us.

Responsibilities
  • The Student Construction Inspector is responsible for inspecting the Work materials and methods to ensure that the requirements of the Contract Documents are fulfilled in a safe manner with requisite quality
  • Prepares daily reports for active construction contracts and issues Contract Deficiency Reports including the follow up on required corrective actions including inspection of same
  • Observing, acting and reporting on any contractual and non-contractual infractions of safety, security, operational interference or TTC customer inconvenience
  • The Student Inspector liaises between the contractor, client, utility companies, local municipalities and other external agencies
Qualifications Required
  • Enrolled in a Post Secondary Technical Program, preferably in Engineering or Construction
  • Excellent business and technical writing skills
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational, interpersonal, problem solving and analytical skills

Comtech Group Inc. is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are compliant with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).  If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources @ Comtech by emailing –

career@teamcomtech.com

Comtech Group offers our employees a competitive compensation package with comprehensive employee benefits, and an environment that fosters teamwork & entrepreneurial spirit.  Comtech Group is an equal opportunity employer. Please submit your resume in MS Word format to Comtech Group via e-mail at

career@teamcomtech.com

.

title: Inspecteur(trice) électrique/Electrical Inspector
description:
Description

English Job Description will follow the French

CE POSTE EST SITUÉ EN COLOMBIE-BRITANNIQUE - SUR LE SITE DE KITIMAT.

Nous acceptons les candidats de tout le Canada qui sont prêts à se rendre à Kitimat.
********
Intertek est l'un des principaux fournisseurs d'assurance qualité totale pour les industries du monde entier. Notre réseau de plus de 1 000 laboratoires et bureaux, avec plus de 43 000 personnes dans plus de 100 pays, offre des solutions novatrices et sur mesure en matière d'assurance, de test, d'inspection et de certification pour les opérations et les chaînes d'approvisionnement de nos clients. L'expertise d'Intertek en matière d'assurance qualité totale, délivrée avec précision, rapidité et passion, permet à nos clients de progresser en toute sécurité.

L'équipe des services industriels d'Intertek fournit des solutions techniques qui aident les clients à maximiser l'efficacité opérationnelle, à assurer la fiabilité des actifs, à améliorer la qualité et à minimiser les risques de sécurité. Certains de nos nombreux domaines de services comprennent l'inspection, les essais non destructifs et les essais de matériaux, la formation technique, l'ingénierie, l'arpentage, l'AQ/CQ et l'audit des fournisseurs.
Veiller à ce que le plan de qualité du projet soit élaboré et mis en œuvre conjointement avec le plan d'exécution du projet.
Promouvoir la sensibilisation à la qualité dans toute l'organisation, en mettant l'accent sur l'excellence, l'amélioration continue et les mesures correctives afin d'influencer le succès global des activités de l'entreprise.

Fonctions :
- Examiner le matériel original / le certificat d'essai pour vérifier la conformité aux codes et aux spécifications.
- Vérifier que l'équipement est conservé conformément aux recommandations des fournisseurs et aux procédures de conservation approuvées.
- Aider à l'audit de qualité sur demande.
- Assurer la liaison avec les responsables de l'inspection et les entrepreneurs pour remédier aux problèmes de gestion de la qualité.
- Assister et surveiller les activités de travail, d'inspection et d'essai des fournisseurs/entrepreneurs conformément au plan de qualité, à l'ITP et aux procédures de qualité approuvés, etc.
- Promouvoir la sensibilisation à la qualité dans toute l'organisation, en mettant l'accent sur l'excellence, l'amélioration continue et l'action corrective pour influencer le succès global de l'entreprise.
- Aider à l'examen des plans de qualité, des plans d'inspection et d'essai (ITP) et des procédures de qualité des fournisseurs/entrepreneurs et de toute la documentation AQ/CQ pertinente avant le début de tout travail de fabrication/construction.
- Vérifier la mise en œuvre des procédures PTW (permis de travail), LOTO (verrouillage et étiquetage) et autres procédures de sécurité.
Effectuer une surveillance de la qualité chez les fournisseurs / contacteurs pour promouvoir la culture de la qualité de la société.

____________________________________________________________

THIS POSITION IS LOCATED IN BRITISH COLUMBIA - AT KITIMAT SITE.

Accepting candidates from all over Canada who are willing to travel to Kitimat.

********

Intertek is a leading Total Quality Assurance provider to industries worldwide. Our network of more than 1,000 laboratories and offices with over 43,000 people in more than 100 countries, delivers innovative and bespoke Assurance, Testing, Inspection, and Certification solutions for our customers' operations and supply chains. Intertek Total Quality Assurance expertise, delivered consistently with precision, pace, and passion, enables our customers to power ahead safely.

Intertek's Industry Services team provides technical solutions that help customers maximize operational efficiency, ensure asset reliability, improve quality, and minimize safety risks. Some of our many service areas include inspection, non-destructive and materials testing, technical training, engineering, surveying, QA/QC, and supplier auditing.

Ensure that Project Quality Plan in conjunction with Project Execution Plan is developed and implemented.
Promote quality awareness throughout the organization, emphasizing excellence, continuous improvement and corrective action to influence the overall success of company business.

Duties:

  • eview original material / test certificate for compliance to codes and specifications.
  • Verify that equipment is preserved per suppliers recommendation and approved preservation procedures.
  • Assist in Quality audit upon request
  • Liaise with inspection leads and contractor remediate quality management problems.
  • Witness and monitor suppliers / contractors work activities, inspection and test in accordance with the approved Quality Plan, ITP, Quality Procedures etc.
  • Promote quality awareness throughout the organization, emphasizing excellence, continuous improvement and corrective action to influence the overall success of company business.
  • Assist in the review of Supplier's/Contractor's Quality Plans, Inspection & Test Plans (ITPs) and Quality Procedures and all pertained QA/QC documentation prior to commencement of any fabrication / construction work.
  • Verify the implementation of PTW (permit to work) LOTO (lock-out and tag-out) and other safety procedures.

Conduct quality surveillance at suppliers / contactors to promote Company's quality culture.

Qualifications

Exigences :
- Certifications requises dans le secteur du génie électrique et de l'inspection, avec plus de 10 ans d'expérience dans le secteur du pétrole et du gaz.
- Avoir une connaissance des codes industriels (NEC, CEC, CSA, IEC, UL, NFPA, ISO 9001, API, etc).
- Connaître les protocoles de communication industrielle standard tels que 4-20 mA et Foundation Fieldbus.
- Avoir une connaissance du système de câblage et de câblage pour l'instrumentation de terrain.
- Connaissance de la classification électrique.
- Connaître les différents types de câbles, leur application et les exigences d'installation et de test.
- Connaître les pratiques d'installation et de test des équipements électriques, d'instrumentation et de télécommunication.
- Connaître les pratiques de vérification et de mise en service des boucles.

Une carrière chez Intertek signifie rejoindre un réseau mondial de professionnels qui se consacrent à la qualité et à la sécurité. Notre vision est de devenir le partenaire le plus fiable au monde en matière d'assurance qualité et nous offrons à nos employés la possibilité d'avoir un impact avec des opportunités de croissance attrayantes dans cette industrie à l'échelle mondiale.

Nous offrons un salaire et un ensemble d'avantages sociaux compétitifs sur le marché local, notamment une assurance médicale, une assurance dentaire, une assurance pour les soins de la vue, une assurance vie, une assurance invalidité, un REER avec contrepartie de l'entreprise, le remboursement des frais de scolarité et plus encore.

Nous sommes un employeur soucieux de l'égalité des chances et ne pratiquons aucune discrimination à l'encontre des candidats en raison de leur statut d'ancien combattant ou d'un handicap. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront considérés pour un emploi sans tenir compte de la race, de la couleur, de la religion, du sexe, de l'origine nationale, de l'orientation sexuelle ou de l'identité de genre.
Intertek est un lieu de travail sans drogue. Comme condition d'embauche, toutes les personnes recrutées doivent passer un test de dépistage de drogues avant d'être embauchées.

_______________________________________________

Requirements:

  • equires certifications in the Electrical Engineering & Inspection industry, with over 10 years in oil & gas
  • Have knowledge of industrial codes (NEC, CEC, CSA, IEC, UL, NFPA, ISO 9001, API, and etc).
  • Have knowledge of standard industrial communication protocol such as 4-20 mA and Foundation Fieldbus
  • Have knowledge of wiring and cabling system for field instrumentation.
  • Have knowledge of electrical classification.
  • Have knowledge of various type of cable, its application, and installation / test requirements.
  • Have knowledge of installation and testing practices for electrical, instrument, and telecom equipment.
  • Have knowledge of Loop checking / commissioning practice.

A career with Intertek means joining a global network of professionals dedicated to bringing quality and safety to life. Our vision is to become the world's most trusted partner for Quality Assurance and we offer our employees the chance to make an impact with attractive growth opportunities in this industry on a global scale.

We offer a salary and benefit package competitively placed within the local market, including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement and more.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status or on the basis of disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, or gender identity.

Intertek is a drug-free workplace. As a condition of employment, all hires are required to pass a pre-employment drug test.

title: Superintendent
description:
OCL Group Inc. (OCL), is a proudly 100% Canadian, privately held, employee-owned fully integrated general contractor. With design-build solutions across Western Canada, providing trusted experience and dependable quality, serving the energy and municipal infrastructure markets since 2009.

We are currently recruiting Superintendent.

This is for an upcoming project starting in May 2022 in the Elkford, AB region. Shift schedule will be 10/4, camp accommodation will be provided.

Responsibilities:

  • Communication with team through daily safety meetings.
  • Set up work completion schedules.
  • Assist with project estimating, including labour, supplies and materials.
  • Execute work in line with federal, provincial and client and company quality standards, codes and safety regulations.
  • Communicating the job to and with tradesmen/ workers
  • Supervising crew tasks
  • Daily interactions with client on progress and project requirements.
  • Assist Construction Manager on daily reports, schedules and manpower.
  • 15 years of management and supervisory experience
  • Qualified Journeyman Steamfitter/Pipefitter/Welder or trades personnel with experience in piping and mechanical scopes
  • Knowledgeable in the MS suite of applications (Word, Excel, Project, Outlook).
  • Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Flexible during times of change.
  • Good written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial
  • Previous experience in civil/earthworks projects
  • Previous plant experience is considered an asset

If you are looking to join a dynamic team, this may be the opportunity for you!

title: Surintendant
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Travailler chez MONTONI, c’est faire partie d’une équipe qui valorise l’innovation, la collaboration et la responsabilité sociale. Notre équipe est toujours à la recherche de talents dans l’industrie pour nous appuyer dans notre mission de réinventer l’immobilier et la construction. Si vous êtes passionnés, curieux et que vous recherchez un environnement de travail collaboratif axé sur l’innovation, MONTONI est fait pour vous! Joignez-vous à notre équipe dès maintenant! 

Description du poste

RESPONSABILITÉ GÉNÉRALE

Sous la supervision du gérant de projets, le surintendant supervise l’exécution de toutes les activités reliées à des projets de construction sur les sites en coordonnant, organisant et contrôlant le travail des employés de chantier et les sous-traitants.

RESPONSABILITÉS SPÉCIFIQUES

Accueil et démarrage des projets

  • Planifier conjointement avec le coordonnateur de projets la localisation et l’installation des roulottes et des conteneurs et faire approuver le tout par le gérant de projets.
  • Établir le périmètre de sécurité du chantier et s’assurer de la signalisation adéquate du chantier en collaboration avec l’agent de prévention.
  • Vérifier les plans en cas d’erreurs, d’omissions et effectuer les corrections avec le gérant de projets.
  • Accueillir et faire la présentation du programme de prévention à tous les nouveaux employés, y compris les sous-traitants.
  • Présenter conjointement avec le gérant de projets l’échéancier et la planification aux sous-traitants, afin de respecter les dates de livraison prévues et le cheminement critique du projet.

 Gestion quotidienne des projets et supervision du chantier

  • Établir l’ordre des priorités des tâches, maximiser les méthodes de travail et s’assurer que les délais et l’avancement des travaux sont respectés.
  • Superviser, coordonner et organiser le travail des employés de chantier GMDC selon l’échéancier prévu.
  • Établir et réviser l’ordre des priorités pour les situations importantes et urgentes.
  • S’assurer du respect des normes de sécurité au travail, du programme de prévention et de l’entretien du chantier de façon continue et rigoureuse.
  • Déterminer rapidement les risques et les problèmes potentiels en temps et en ressources du projet et communiquer ceux-ci au gérant de projets, au coordonnateur de projets, aux professionnels et aux entrepreneurs spécialisés, selon le cas, trouver des solutions aux problèmes liés au travail et recommander des mesures visant à améliorer l’efficacité.
  • Faire la gestion et le suivi des budgets de quantités, des commandes des matériaux et de locations, et remplir la demande d’achat selon la méthode établie.
  • Coordonner les travaux des sous-traitants, des différentes spécialités et des autres corps de métier selon l’échéancier prévu.

 Suivi, documentation et contrôle du chantier

  • Inspecter et veiller à la qualité des travaux selon les normes requises par l’entreprise et par l’industrie de la construction.
  • Assurer le suivi de l’échéancier et de la planification avec les sous-traitants pour respecter les dates de livraison.
  • Remplir les feuilles de temps et les comptes rendus des activités quotidiennes du chantier, y compris la prise de photos journalières des travaux et des projets LEED, et documenter les évènements et les incidents importants.
  • Vérifier les dessins d’ateliers et assurer leur coordination au chantier sur une base quotidienne.
  • Assurer une communication fluide pour la transmission des documents de chantier au bureau dans un délai normal et régulier tout au long du projet.
  • Assurer un suivi de tout « avis de changement » au chantier.
  • Tenir une cadence rapide (fast track) d’une façon contrôlée et sécuritaire afin d’éliminer les temps morts entre deux étapes.
  • Tenir à jour les plans d’architecture TQC (Tel que Construit).
  • Assurer un suivi des budgets pour les quantités de matériaux et la main-d’œuvre.
  • Superviser l’exécution des corrections des déficiences dans les délais impartis.

Relations

  • Maintenir des liens de collaboration avec le gérant de projets et les adjoints administratifs assignés aux projets
  • Maintenir une relation professionnelle et de confiance avec les clients, les gérants de projets, les fournisseurs et les sous-traitants.
  • Assister aux réunions de chantier avec le gérant de projets, les professionnels et les entrepreneurs spécialisés sur une base hebdomadaire.
  • Participer aux réunions pour le suivi des déficiences et des améliorations continues avec les gérants de projets et les sous-traitants.
Qualifications

  • Détenir minimalement 5 ans d'expérience à titre de surintendant de chantier 
  • Expérience dans le secteur industriel, commercial, data center et / ou résidentiel (atout) 
  • Expérience avec PROCORE 
  • Bilinguisme (français/anglais)

  • APTITUDES

  • Adaptabilité.
  • Sens de l’organisation et de la planification.
  • Bonne communication, entregent et capacité à travailler en équipe.
  • Facilité à mener plusieurs projets comportant des échéanciers serrés.
  • Motivation à toujours rechercher l’excellence.


Informations complémentaires

Travailler chez MONTONI, c’est avoir accès à une solide offre de rémunération globale :

  • Rémunération équitable et avantageuse
  • Contribution REER de l'employeur en collaboration avec l’employé
  • Assurances collectives généreuses incluant une couverture médicale et dentaire
  • Activités sociales multiples et une vie au travail animée
  • Flexibilité d'horaire et politique de télétravail
  • Comité bien-être en place, un accès à un gym et à des activités sportives
  • Réfrigérateur à collations gratuites et du vrai bon café
  • Services sur place (nettoyeur, changement de pneus saisonniers)
  • Billets de hockey ou de spectacles à gagner régulièrement

Ce poste vous intéresse, faites-nous parvenir votre curriculum vitae sans tarder.

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt, cependant seules les personnes retenues pour une entrevue seront convoquées.

Le masculin n’est utilisé que pour alléger le texte.

title: Junior Site Superintendent
description:
Junior Site Superintendent
Chilliwack, BC
General Contractor
Commercial Construction 
New Build and Tenant Improvement

 
 
Junior Site Superintendent Duties & Responsibilities:


Pre-Construction Management
  • Work with the Project Manager, develop and maintain master project schedule with input from subcontractors
  • Assess commissioning and O&M requirements for master project schedule.
  • Develop Health, Safety and Environment Plan.
  • Review contracts with the Project Manager to ensure scope of work and schedules are accurate and feasible.
  • Notify Equipment Management Team of requirements for project.
  • Assist with selection of trade subcontractors.
  • Conduct constructability reviews to bring value to the construction execution stage.
 
Construction Management
  • Plan, organize, direct and control daily construction operations with direct leadership responsibilities for junior resources as assigned.
  • Fully understand the Master Contract and Subcontractor Contracts.
  • Develop and measure productivity on site to measure planned progress against actual.
  • Control site logistics, maximize efficiencies, minimize deficiencies of all work including all subcontractors, suppliers and employees.
  • Establish site for construction.
  • Maintain daily and ongoing reporting to track site progress.
  • Maintain a clean and organized site.
  • Execute the quality management program proactively to minimize deficiencies.
  • Approve timesheets.
  • Hold daily field level hazard assessments.
  • Hold weekly toolbox talks.
  • Conduct weekly subcontract progress meetings and hold everyone on site accountable to the Master Project Schedule.
  • Purchase, maintain, track and forecast materials.
  • Review all subcontractor submittals.
  • Support the development of commissioning and turn over plans.
  • Fix deficiencies in line with achieving total completion date.
  • Manage risk during the project by following the Risk Management Plan.
  • Communicate daily with the Project Manager and project team on the status of construction including any concerns or discrepancies that may require escalation.
  • Attend owner meetings throughout the project.
  • Manage, control, and record all permit requirements, third party inspections, commissioning, training and hand over.
  • Communicate with the office to manage administrative tasks.
  • Responsible to ensure all on site contractually required items are implemented and completed.
  • Champion health and safety and occupational practices and regulations.
  • Provide cost-effective solutions to construction issues and coordinate with the Project Manager.
 


Post Construction Management
  • Complete warranty work.
  • Close all site accounts.
  • Complete any deficiencies and issues related to the warranty period.
  • Demobilize site.
 
 
Junior Site Superintendent Qualifications: 
  • Undergraduate degree or diploma in construction management, engineering, or another relevant field preferred
  • Certification of First Aid/CPR, WHMIS
  • Possess valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle
  • 5+ years’ experience in the construction industry, preferably Commercial construction management 
  • Strong familiarity with contract administration, understanding drawings, specifications, architectural and engineering standards and building practices, including building codes
  • Full understanding of mechanical and electrical installations, including commissioning and handover
  • Excellent budgeting, costing, and scheduling skills
  • Solid understanding of construction industry practices, OBC, OHSA and WCB regulations and safety standards, OHS Certificate
  • Experience using MS Word, Outlook, MS Project, Electronic Document Management System, Bluebeam, and Plan Grid
  • Strong leadership skills with experience managing all disciplines, internal employees, and external sub-trades
  • Ability to inspire trust in difficult situations by instilling confidence and engaging people on matters that affect them
  • Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet the time demands of unpredictable activities, capable of handling pressure and challenges
  • Works within tight deadlines and prioritizes of work to achieve them
  • Strong analytical, critical thinking, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills demonstrated through speaking to groups of employees on site, and communicating to a variety of stakeholders including clients, management, and site employees
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals; ability to work in challenging, fast paced environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Travel to site will be required; travel within Canada as directed
  • Ability to relocate to projects and offices within Canada and elsewhere according to Company resource requirements an asset
  • Supportive of a culture that encompasses the highest ethical standards aligned with the Company Promise
 
Junior Site Superintendent Salary:
Competitive Salary, Extended Benefits, Growth Opportunities, Flexible work environment, Continuous training and development, Match RRSP Program, Birthday off with pay

Junior Site Superintendent Similar Job Titles:
Site Super
General Superintendent
Construction Manager
Superintendent

Interested?
Apply below
 
Only applicants with the legal right to work in Canada can be considered for this opportunity.
We thank all those who express interest in this opportunity however only those short-listed we be contacted.


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: B2C – IT Business Systems Analyst - 30358
description:
To succeed in this role, you MUST have:

  • Been a part of an Agile BA-DEV Team responsible for CRM, eCommerce, Apps, API’s and Integrations for 3 to 5 years – KEY!
  • BA experience with CRM platforms like Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics 365 or other and eComm tech such as Shopify, OpenCart, SAP Hybris etc.
  • An understanding for API technologies, native and web Apps
  • Excellent Analytical and Communication skills to articulate business pain points and translate them to actionable user stories using Jira, Confluence, Visio etc.
  • Superior listening, critical thinking and writing skills. You are expected to take complex, disparate ideas and distill them into simple, workable concepts by asking the right / tough questions! — The big answers almost never come from one source or one system.
  • Managed discussions with business users and DEV on requirements before, during and after project implementation to support cross-departmental initiatives in process driven environments
  • Created and maintained technical documentation and knowledge-based articles to document new projects/programs, daily operations, or commonly faced issues
  • Experience in writing test cases, running point in UAT and documenting findings
  • A Proactive communication style in and outside the Scrum Team with good time management and organizational skills – You will work on projects with tight and competing deadlines!
  • A good technical aptitude with an ability to take direction and lead as and when necessary
  • An ability to contribute constructively in open discussions and being able to work with competing ideas to achieve project success with approved ideas

title: Superintendent
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

Job Description

  • Continuously monitor project budget and forecasting to the individual phase code level and cost type for potential gains and losses
  • Provide leadership and direction for all project activities and tasks, ensuring project outcomes are delivered successfully and in compliance with all contracts and client needs
  • Ensure clear communication of project-specific roles and responsibilities for all site personnel. Provide regular and respectful feedback for all under your direction
  • Monitor company equipment and supplies to ensure the needed equipment is where it’s required.
  • Inspect tools and equipment and notify the Tools and Equipment Manager for service and repair as needed
Qualifications

  • Journeyman trade certification or equivalent experience
  • Technical diploma and/or Gold Seal certification are considered assets
  • Five or more years experience in commercial construction for a large general contractor
  • One or more years experience as a superintendent for a large general contractor


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

The health and safety of our employees, families, industry partners, clients, and communities remains of the utmost importance.  That’s why we’re taking several steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19.

As of November 15, 2021, Chandos Construction requires all employees across the country to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. This is in line with our values and commitment to all stakeholders.

title: Superintendent
description:
superintendent

Are you looking for career opportunities within a global, 
growing real estate company?

Then you might be our next superintendent.

job description

Akelius is seeking a customer service-oriented superintendent with strong interpersonal skills to join the facility management team.

The superintendent will provide a safe and adequate environment for the tenants and assigned staff of the property.

The successful candidate will be responsible for cleaning, maintenance, repairs, and building code compliance.

  • complete minor and major repairs of all building equipment
  • perform preventative maintenance procedures on building mechanical equipment on a scheduled basis which is not limited to inspections of belts, checking fluid levels, replacing filters, greasing bearings, seals, replacing or repair broken parts
  • repair of doors, door locks, closets, and installation of blinds

 

  • complete daily, weekly, and monthly checklists on building equipment maintenance procedures
  • maintain records of scheduled maintenance procedures
  • operate a computer that controls and monitors mechanical equipment and utility systems

 

  • respond to emergency maintenance requests as required
  • assist with the renovations and remodeling of buildings
  • repair plaster, drywall, and painting

 

  • perform outside custodial duties such as snow removal
  • other duties as assigned

who you are

  • three-plus years of experience in building and mechanical maintenance repair, or an acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience
  • knowledge in using hand and power tools
  • must be able to regularly lift up to 50 lbs
     
  • bilingual in French and English preferred but not required
  • must be able to stand, sit, bend and or crouch throughout your shift
  • problem-solving - ownership of responsibilities, able to anticipate and address issues in emergency situations
     
  • great communication skills â€“ able to interact with tenants, people-focused, positive, and stay professional
  • exceptional driving skills
  • articulate - as there might be times in which information will need to be presented
     
  • time management â€“ organized, set priorities, meet daily targets and deadlines

how to apply

Apply with a copy of your resume.

about Akelius

Akelius acquires, upgrades, and manages residential properties.

Akelius owns 18 thousand rental apartments in the metropolitan cities of New York, Boston, Washington D.C., Montreal, Toronto, London, Paris, and Austin.

Akelius Canada is committed to providing accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you are contacted for this position and require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please let the HR team know.

Read more at www.akelius.com

title: Superintendent
description:
Job ID:  400793 

Work Type:  Full Time Permanent 

 

It is a great time to join the CRH Canada team! CRH Canada is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.


We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!


You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Superintendent

 

Under the long established and respected name of Dufferin Construction, CRH Canada operates a multi-million construction business which provides construction services throughout Southern Ontario and on key projects across Canada. Founded in 1912, Dufferin Construction has built a solid reputation for market excellence, drawing on a rich history and a strong heritage of quality, stability and innovative leadership in the marketplace. Dufferin Construction is one of the largest heavy civil engineering contractors in the industry, employing over 1000 people.  Dufferin Construction, a division of CRH Canada is looking for a Project Superintendent to join the team for projects located out of the Northeast Ontario area.

You will be a successful addition to Dufferin Construction if you:
•    Have 10+ years of proven experience within the Municipal Civil Market. 
•    Like to work independently, plan, schedule and manage projects for the construction and/or repair of civil engineering projects such as roads, bridges, sewers and watermains.
•    A minimum of 5 years as a leader who can successfully manage Civil projects and various levels of skilled workers all the while adhering to policies and guidelines.

 

Responsibilities:
•    Administer company safety program as per current procedures.
•    Mobilize and direct the resources assigned in order to achieve maximum contribution to fixed costs and profits.
•    Establish and monitor construction work schedules.
•    Allocate work to and supervise the activities of all foremen assigned to the project.
•    Accurately forecasts financial status of assigned projects.
•    Maintain overall inventory control of all materials, plants and equipment assigned to the project.
•    Coordinate the administration of contracts in conjunction with the Estimator/ Project Coordinator.
•    Maintain positive customer relationships.
•    Prepare all reporting as per current procedures.
•    Hire competent, skilled trades people as per current procedures.
•    Provide training and development activities to subordinates to meet the requirements of the company.
•    Delegate but still maintain overall responsibilities and accountability of the project.
•    Lead team to promote positive work environment.

 

Experience & Educational Requirements:
•    University degree in civil engineering or Civil Engineering Technologist Diploma.
•    Municipal Project experience (high project load) is an asset.

 

Position Dimensions:
•    Excellent interpersonal, communication and leadership skills.
•    Ability to make timely, yet effective decisions.
•    Ability to work under pressure and adaptable to change.
•    Strong planning and organizational skills.
•    Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting experience.
•    Able to help build a cohesive team and facilitate the collaboration of people and cross functional groups.
•    Strong customer orientation.


Why work for us?
•    With parent companies in Concord, the US and Ireland, your growth potential is limitless!
•    Work with a team of dedicated professionals who are there to support your professional growth!
•    Flexible benefits plans, Defined Contribution pension plan, annual bonuses and merit-based increases ensure that your hard work and dedication will be rewarded!
 

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.
