title: Superintendent
description:
general partnership to deliver a 5.7 km extension of the Millennium Line, from VCC-Clark Station to Broadway and Arbutus. Once complete, it will provide fast, frequent and convenient service to B.C.’s second largest jobs center, world-class health services, an emerging innovation and research hub, and growing residential communities.

The main function of a Superintendent is to coordinate all direct report site employees, resources, labourers and subcontract teams to achieve quality and safety objectives in accordance with the project plans and schedules.



Advantages
-High Profile Project
-Steady work
-good compensation
-Reputable GC offering projects across Canada, the US, and other countries

Responsibilities
Proven accountability to the health and safety of project personnel and processes
Develop and maintain an awareness of hazards and other risks
Understand overall site accountabilities and adhere to those
Maintaining a comprehensive working knowledge of the contract, the specifications, the EBA and safety and environmental regulations
Effectively coordinating and supervising the utilization of all on-site resources for the project Ensuring all workers are inducted onto site before commencing work
Monitor overall construction progress as well as safety compliance and environmental requirements
Ensures accurate timesheets are submitted to the necessary parties
Ability to effectively direct, and coordinate the works on site in coordinator with the subcontractors and other working site members
Ensure works are performed to the required safety and quality standards, through both scheduled and non-scheduled site checks to ensure compliance with policies & procedures.
Facilitate collaboration amongst site members, sub-contractors and any other visiting stakeholders
Provides mentorship and leadership and nurture healthy relationships with all site teams and authorities.
Monitor sub-contractor performance and report necessary details
Provide recommendations to improve overall site operations
Initiate daily meetings on site to ensure timelines are kept accurate and moving
Review and report incidents to Health & Safety procedures
Experience/Qualifications:



Qualifications
Minimum 10 years experience within the heavy civil construction scope with a minimum 5years’ experience as a Supervisor
Demonstrated experience to support on planning up to 1 month ahead and monitoring
cost and time of resources within area of accountability.
Ability to uphold safety and compliance measures in place
Proven leadership capabilities
Strong multi-tasking abilities
Ability to problem solve within the best interest of the project and handle any conflicts that arise
Strong relationship management skills


Summary
If this sounds like an opportunity you would be interested in please send a copy of your resume to patrick.stegner@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Superintendent (ICI Construction)
description:
Job Description:

Superintendent - ICI Construction

 

 

As a Superintendent with our busy Buildings Division, you will have the responsibility of overseeing our site staff, field engineering and field teams accountable for the delivery of completed ICI building projects.  

 

At Maple, we look for leaders who can:

  • Direct field operations in the delivery of projects by adhering to schedules, budgets, safety and risk.
  • Effectively manage field employees by providing guidance and leadership on construction activities and developing effective communication between field and other project staff.
  • Develop and execute project work plans aimed at keeping projects on track and on budget.
  • Provide senior level presence in the field, coach field staff on issue resolution, review site labour requirements, mentor field staff and perform succession planning.

 

Our Superintendent will oversee projects that vary in size and scope and the successful candidate should have previous experience in leading construction teams, trades and hourly employees. Many of our projects are located within Southern Ontario; however, work can sometimes take us to other provinces.     We would require the Superintendent to travel or stay close to the site; flexibility is a must. We are also focused on candidates who currently have:

  • Five or more years experience assisting or supervising construction projects of increasing complexity
  • Post-secondary education, CET or equivalent
  • Proficiency with MS Office and Windows based computer applications (Word, Excel, Outlook and Project)
  • Can manage site operations on complex projects in excess of $40 million

 

The Superintendent is a key member of Maple Reindersâ€™ project team and is critical to the success of each project under their direction.  We want you to succeed and we are prepared to get you there by investing in you. We offer extensive training through our â€œCentre of Learningâ€ to facilitate your career growth through programs such as LEED, Gold Seal and â€œlunch and learnsâ€.

 

If you are a solid construction leader, we want to hear from you. Please provide your project list including the dollar value along with your resume and cover letter.

 

Thank you for your interest in a career with Maple Reinders. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Maple Reinders is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Maple Reinders accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

 

No agency calls please.

 

 

People, Passion, Performance

title: Superintendent (FT)
description:
JOB SCOPE

Our Superintendent is responsible for the overall daily maintenance of our 2 buildings and property including the supervision of 2 full-time cleaning staff;

Our Superintendent must live on-site in a condo provided by our Association; 

Our Superintendent will work a normal 40-hour week from 7:00 AM  - 4:00 PM Mon-Fri but must be on call and available 24/7 to handle any urgent issues;

Our Superintendent must:
  • Monitor and ensure the smooth running of all equipment and systems
  • Do all of our preventative maintenance functions where we do not use outside contractors
  • Ensure that all regular maintenance contractors are doing their jobs properly and on a timely basis e.g. gardners, HVAC, elevators, snow removal, etc..
  • Ensure that all entrances, access doors, sidewalks and stairs are kept clear of snow and ice during the winter.
  • Ensure our waste and recycling bins are taken out for pickup and returned at the appropriate times

  • Monitor and maintain the smooth functioning of our pool and jacuzzi equipment and systems
  • Do most handyman small repairs and maintenance functions on his own e.g.small plastering/paint jobs, changing lights, adjusting timers, lubricating all motorized equipment, etc. 
  • Notify the Manager about any needs for major repairs or additions to building operating systems.
  • Order and maintain proper inventory of regular supplies and equipment needed for cleaning and maintenance duties.
  • Handle minor co-owner complaints or requests

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ WORKING CONDITIONS:
  • Physically fit and in good health.
  • Proficient in English and in French.
  • Strong communication skills in both languages.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED include:
  • A minimum of 4 or more years experience as a Superintendent with the ability to work independently and to develop work schedules and plans.
  • Ability to supervise outside contractors while they are on our premises
  • Ability to communicate effectively with Management, Co-owners, Staff and Contractors
  • Starting salary will reflect experience and skills.

Expected Start Date: June 2022
Job Type: Permanent

Job Types: Full-time

Salary:  $ 39.000 and up - will be based on experience and skills 

COVID-19 considerations:
Masks during working hours is a requirements. Covid vaccination required.

title: Superintendent ( Industrial )
description:
Superintendent (Industrial)

We're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values. Then we simply give them the freedom to take their career further.


In the position of a Superintendent, we would ask you to do the following:

-Plan, schedule, direct crews within the budget and timeline assigned

-Provide leadership and training to General Foreman, Foreman and other field staff

-Work with the Safety Advisors to ensure the work is performed safely


Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

-Strong computer skills and experience working with project management software, Excel, Word, and Email

-A minimum of 5 years in a Superintendent role

-10 years of Industrial construction experience

-Strong communication skills

-You must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS-09) Certificate, Ground Disturbance Level II and Leadership for Safety Excellence

-Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required

-Pre-employment Drug and Alcohol testing is required

You will be based out of the Saskatoon office.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

title: Superintendent (Structural/Bridges)
description:
Location: Winnipeg, MB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/11/2022Job ID: VF228116411Category: Engineering & Technical
If you are a talented and experienced Superintendent (Structural/Bridges), David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you! Our client, a leader in their field, has partnered with David Aplin Group to grow their team in Alberta.
 
The Superintendent provides site management for all phases of the project from pre-construction to completion including but not limited to coordinating workers, materials, and equipment as well as ensuring that specifications are being followed, work is proceeding on schedule and within budget, the project is completed with outstanding quality and that the project is a safe workplace.    
 
Benefits & Perks:
  • Competitive compensation, including 100% employer-paid benefits
  • Monthly uplift and housing allowance (non-taxable)
  • Meal allowance (taxable)
Responsibilities:
Pre-Construction:
  • Understanding of the contract and scope of work, ensuring the scope of work is clearly communicated to trades
  • Identify and eliminate/control all actual or potential hazards and risks and document them on the Hazard Identification and Risk Assessment Log
  • Completing a detailed review of drawings and specifications
  • Understanding entitlements and immediately notifying the Project Manager of changes and conditions.  
  • Reviewing shop drawings
  • Participate in developing a cost-effective plan and schedule for completion of the project and following a logical pattern for utilization of resources
Construction:
  • Coordinating the work of subcontractors working on various phases of the project
  • Controlling and directing subcontractors, labour, and labour relations
  • Providing on-site supervision for all project personnel and phases of construction, resolving complaints and grievances with employees
  • Completing all paperwork as required  
  • Reporting any challenges or issues to the Project Manager and/or General Superintendent in a timely manner
  • Maintaining accurate build drawings for underground utilities and plan changes as they occur
  • Keeping a daily log of site activities on the project including but not limited to: All trades and number of personnel/trades, description of work, weather, and safety hazards or issues  
  • Expeditious completion of project deficiencies
  • Conducting weekly progress review meetings with Trades to review the weekly schedule and update accordingly
  • Attending all project meetings
  • Maintaining site files, supplies, equipment, and services
Health & Safety:
  • Enforcing on-site safety in accordance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act the latest regulations and Safety Policy Manual
  • Leading on-site safety meetings with trades and labour
  • Reporting all accidents and incidents promptly
  • Continually ensure any hazards are identified/controlled/eliminated and recorded and filed in the Safety Records Binder
  • Discuss the hazards with all workers at meetings (i.e., weekly toolbox meetings, monthly safety meetings, etc.)
  • Ensuring site personnel has required safety training and records are maintained
  • Ensure all preventative maintenance is conducted according to manufacturer specifications and that records are maintained
Relationship Management:
  • Maintain a good working relationship with all subcontractors and ensures they are treated fairly
  • Maintain professional conduct at all times with owners, consultants, traders, suppliers, and the public
  • Develop a good working relationship with owners and consultants
  • Report progress to owners and architects
  • Supervise crews, reviewing their reports, checking on any reported difficulties, and correcting any safety violations or other reported deficiencies
  • Making realistic commitments to the Project Manager, trades, owners, and consultants
  • Coach and mentor hourly employees
Qualifications:
  • 7+ years of Construction experience
  • Experience with structural heavy civil projects
  • Experience managing own forces’ hourly labour
  • Valid driver's license
  • Advanced computer skills, including base knowledge in MS Suite
 
Job ID: VF228116411
 
If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-DNP #IND-DNP
 
David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Superintendent
description:
Kinetic Construction provides Construction Manager and General Contracting services on Vancouver Island and the Lower Mainland. “Together Building Better” is who we are, in our day to day these values operationalize as “Relationships, Passion and Continuous Improvement”. Kinetic provides a variety of project delivery methods to complete large commercial, institutional, and multi-unit residential projects for private and public clientele. The organization is 100% employee owned with offices in Victoria, Vancouver, and Courtenay. We collaborate with like-minded partners to create a better industry for everyone.

Our people are the most important factor to our shared success. We provide a collaborative, caring culture, and the necessary support for everyone to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you see yourself as a continuous learner, curious and driven to succeed as a team we want you to be part of our team.

Kinetic Construction Ltd. has an opportunity within our Victoria Branch to bring in an experienced Superintendent to provide leadership, coaching and mentoring to all site employees while effectively managing the project and sub-trades and liaising with the client onsite in Nanaimo

  • Certificate, diploma or degree in Construction or related field
  • 5 years’ experience in ICI construction as a Superintendent
  • Gold Seal Certification an asset

Key Attributes:

  • Teamwork: Collaborates and proactively assists and involves others
  • Passion: Inspired to meet and exceed goals both individually and as a team
  • Respect: Contributes to a positive working environment
  • Excellence: Consistently challenges the status quo in the spirit of continuous improvement
  • Integrity: Accountable and transparent; ethical and fair
  • Community Minded: Actively involved in the communities in which we live and work

Together Building Better:

  • 100% employee owned
  • Competitive compensation and bonus
  • Strong benefits package
  • Substantial vacation time
  • Stable work-life balance
  • Training, education, and development opportunities
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Supportive culture
  • A healthy and positive work environment
  • Perks through our strategic partners

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected to move forward in the application process will be contacted. No phone calls please.

title: Superintendent
description:
About the Company:

At Axiom Builders, we pride ourselves on being a down-to-earth organization with serious commitment to building things right. As a leading general contractor of mixed-use, residential, commercial, and special projects, we have become one of British Columbiaâ€™s largest construction companies with notable â€˜Canadaâ€™s 2021 Kincentric Best Employersâ€™ award and current employees in the â€™40 Under 40 in Canadian Constructionâ€™ list. With clear purpose and principles, we are an organization that is cultivating dedication and growth in our people, clients, and communities. Learn about what we do from our current and up-coming projects here.

About the Role:

Axiom Builders is looking for a Superintendent with wood frame expertise to join the team as we get started on the second phase of a major project in centre of Calgary's Beltline area. The 5-storey wood-frame project with 3-storey below grade parkade is currently designed with rental units and a beautiful amenity space.

 

As part of the larger field operations team in Alberta, the Superintendent will lead, mentor, inspire and direct a field and trades team to manage the overall operations, site, quality and schedule of both sizable low-rise and townhome projects. The successful candidate will maintain effective working relationships with our project management, safety and trades partners while ensuring a seamless construction process consistent with Axiom Builders' commitment to quality, objectives and values. Key responsibilities include:

  • Work collaboratively with Project Manager and regularly communicate updates such as field reports, safety inspections, staffing requirements and schedule updates;
  • Oversee subcontractor performance with regards to safety and scope of work;
  • Ensure sufficient staffing is provided to achieve safety, schedule and quality objectives;
  • Identify and advise of design deficiencies, schedule interruptions or difficulties, and other project issues;  
  • Administer contracts, subcontracts, purchase orders, site instructions and change notices to ensure scopes, terms and conditions are properly executed;
  • Supervise and direct trades and labourers through regular instruction, communication feedback;
  • Support CSO and head office in ensuring all employees, subcontractors and contractors are adhering to the safety policies;
  • Work in partnership with Head Office and communicate effectively with all departments and provides reports as requested.
What you Bring:

The ideal Superintendent candidate comes from a background in building multiple townhome communities and low-rise projects in the Alberta market with a focus on Calgary and Edmonton.  Although wood frame projects might be your sweet spot, you are diverse and versatile, open to venturing into the world of high-rise concrete, institutional or even mass timber as long as you are joining the right builder that shares the same values as you.

 

You are a forward-thinking, proactive individual with strong connections and relationships in the industry and you recognize that it's these relationships that will be key to your overall long-term success in this role and at Axiom Builders. As a leader on the job site, you have the ability to motivate and inspire the team to get ahead of the project schedule but you also make yourself approachable to listen to challenges they experience on a day-to-day basis. You value integrity and honesty - you not only dedicate yourself to the project, to the team and to the company, but also, just as importantly, to the client.

 

Skills and Requirements

  • At least six years of experience as a superintendent for a general contractor with a project list that includes multiple wood frame or low-rise projects;
  • Excellent record of leading a project from pre-construction to completion;
  • Ability to work effectively with diverse opinions and personalities and internal stakeholders to meet and exceed our clients' expectations;
  • Ability to build relationships with not only the field staff, but also clients and other external stakeholders;
  • Ability and proven experience to lead and motivate site crew of various sizes and scopes;
  • Proven success in influencing a culture of positivity, ownership and reliability on site;
  • Carpentry background will be considered an asset;
  • Academic background in Construction Management will be considered an asset.

 

Your Rewards

We are not only committed to the growth of the business, but also to the success and development of our people. We recognize that people are the drivers behind our success, and we provide our teams with the tools and support they need to strive, thrive, and advance their long-term career here.

 

At Axiom Builders, we offer a competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package:

  • Medical and Dental Coverage:  Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost;
  • RRSP Matching Program: We support your future goals by matching up to 5% of your salary;
  • Professional Development and Education Support: We are keen on internal growth and development, which is why we are excited to fully support you in your pursuit of achieving further education;
  • Company Development: Our annual development conference that is hosted by our leadership and complemented by a range of world-class speakers and workshop experts;
  • Leadership Development: Our proprietary Leadership Development program designed to support your continued growth, development and leadership capabilities.

 

Whatâ€™s Next

We are always on the lookout for talented people who are passionate about what they do. If you want to love what you do, and believe that with the right tools and opportunities you can grow with us, simply add your resume through our Careers Portal or email:

careers@axiombuilders.ca

to join our incredible team.  While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

 

Follow us on our LinkedIn to connect with our Talent Acquisition Team and Instagram to see updates on our current projects.

title: Superintendent
description:
Overview:

Schedule, coordinate and supervise production and workforce engaged in one assigned project tasks, on a single construction project.

What you will be doing:
  • Supervises assigned project work and liaises between field engineering, estimating, and workforce to ensure project compliance with contract drawings and specifications.
  • Plans work methods, materials, equipment needs and work schedule for assigned project work. Reviews daily work schedule with direct reports and updates weekly schedule from project feedback.
  • Reviews and understands the project specifications to support job set up activities. Works with work crews, field engineers and local utility companies to identify hazardous areas on job site.
  • Forecasts the work schedule to identify possible issues and provides technical or scheduling recommendations to mitigate production issues.
  • Provides technical input to identify and resolve project risks including construction methods, work plan and material requirements, safety and schedule activities. Documents daily activities and meeting notes using Company approved document methods.
  • Performs additional assignments per managementâ€™s direction.
  • Presents production work plan during initial project meeting to ensure all project crews and leaders are in alignment.
  • Coordinates with internal equipment team and external vendors to ensure that project work is equipped with appropriate equipment and material quantities to complete production within assigned budget and schedule.
  • Coordinates with internal and external departments to ensure all mandated inspections are completed within requested timeframes.
  • Supports and promotes strict adherence to safety and process controls regarding operating equipment, worksite safety and documentation requirements. Responsibility includes recommending training needs identified on jobsite.
  • Supervises sub-contractor production and workforce regarding assigned project work. Recommends work schedule or work method adjustments regarding sub-contractor activities, as needed.
  • Coordinates project close out activities in line with Company standards and Owner checklist requirements.
  • Maintains knowledge of Company values and strategic plan.
What we are looking for:
  • 8+ years of heavy civil construction experience required.
  • 5+ years construction management experience required.
  • Bachelor's Degree a plus.
  • Safety Trained Supervisor (STS) certification preferred.
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License.
  • Strong written, verbal and presentation communication skills required.
  • Strong leadership capability with internal drive to mentor and grow internal talent.
  • Growing expertise in a specialized construction type.
  • Advanced knowledge of construction site equipment operation and maintenance requirements.
  • Advanced knowledge of construction site safety protocols and proven ability to enforce project safety programs.
  • Knowledge and understanding of local union or prevailing wage rules.
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret standards and contract specific plans and specifications.
  • Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistics, and fundamentals geometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
  • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Why work for us:

Some of the benefits you may be eligible for as an employee are:

  • Comprehensive compensation package and paid time off program
  • Industry leading 401(k)/RRSP
  • Medical/Extended Health Care, Dental, Vison and/or Provincial Medical
  • Wellness benefits & Employee Assistance Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program

We are an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer.

title: Superintendent - Heavy Civil
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for  Superintendents with large earthworks construction projects experience.
Nuna is the largest Inuit-owned heavy civil construction, earthworks, and mine construction contractor in Canada. 

We offer: 
  • Balanced work / home life with rotations of  2x2, 3x3  ( Depends on site) 
  • Competitive hourly rate with Overtime pay (1.5x),
  • 12-13 hour work days
  • Extensive benefits including company matching RRSPs.
  • Annual bonuses, 
  • Employee recognition program,
  • Rotation allowances paid out every rotation,
  • Commercial flights and accommodations are covered,
  • Long-term employment opportunities

Work Llocations: Nuna has work sites in Nunavut, Northwest Territories, Saskatchewan and Ontario.  

You will be a seasoned Superintendent with a minimum of 5 years previous experience, mainly in the Mining / Heavy Civil Earthworks industries; preferably working in Northern Canada.

The Superintendent coordinates all site construction activities and supervises all field personnel as required to successfully complete the project on schedule and within budget. This includes ensuring that established company goals are realized within established quality standards while supervising all trade and field personnel and administering good construction safety practices with all on-site activities.
The Superintendent and Project Manager will work together to coordinate the project to the satisfaction of the client, consistent with the cost, schedule and contractual requirements. 

The Superintendent will help maintain client relationship that will enhance future business.
  • Ensures adequate site-specific safety orientation and training;
  • Maintains standard operating procedures (SOP's) and Job Hazard Analysis (JHAs);
  • Ensures that the job site is free of hazards and or dangerous conditions prior to the commencement of any work;
  • Maintains all required documentation with respect to personnel and equipment maintenance;
  • Submits weekly activity and status reports to management;
  • Monitors equipment availability and utilization to optimize results;
  • Monitors crews' productivity to optimize results;
  • Monitors planned production and cost targets to optimize results;
  • Effectively plans and supervises crews on a task basis;
  • Effectively manages sub-contractors, ensuring compliance with sub-contract requirements;
  • Attends scheduled crew change meeting as sponsored and required by Nun;
  • Ensures that Employees are well trained for assigned duties and for maintenance of effective records;
  • Sets a personal example to promote a safe work environment as well as respect for the environment;
  • Aggressively pursues strategies to improve safety performance and reduce Frequency & Severity;
  • Conducts Task Hazard Assessments (THA) with their team and ensures employees perform a THA when required;
  • Conduct daily inspections of the workplace;
  • Conduct safety meetings (weekly/ daily toolboxes);
  • Demonstrates strong knowledge and experience in extremely remote sites;
  • Provides accurate and timely daily/weekly reports;
  • Demonstrates excellent communication skills (verbal and written);
  • Demonstrates strong knowledge of appropriate computer software (Excel, and Microsoft Office etc.);
  • Demonstrates strong knowledge of relevant mining/ civil earthworks construction sector.
 


All successful candidates must:
  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written.
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driver's License.
  3. Eligible to work for any employer in Canada.
  4. Resides within Canada.
  5. Have experience as requested in the job description above.
  6. Some sites require clearing pre-access clearances ( D&A, Criminal background checks, medicals /physicals)  
 
Interested applicants can apply at: https://nunalogistics.com/join-our-team You can also apply by email: hr@nunalogistics.com.
 
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
  
Nuna is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective and innovative operator in the north.

title: Lead - Mayfair S/C
description:
About Banana Republic


Banana Republic was founded with an explorer’s spirit and a desire to venture to new places, beyond the boundaries of the everyday. Our clothing is designed for a life with no boundaries.


We travel near and far in search of the finest materials and fabric innovations to infuse style with substance, because we believe that what you wear should open a world of possibilities. And the people that make up Banana Republic share the same qualities as our brand: curious, connected, undaunted by boundaries. Sound like you? Join us for the adventure of what’s next.


About the Role


In this role, you will support the store leadership team by performing functional tasks as assigned. You will act as a mentor and role model to employees to support service behaviors and the execution of tasks in specific areas of expertise. You will focus on leading processes and/or areas of the business, executing tasks and maintaining productivity to ensure goals are met. Through collaboration with your leadership team, your goal is to teach and coach your team and drive behaviors to deliver a best-in-class customer experience.


What You'll Do


+ Serve as a role model to achieve priorities in store, with the customer as the primary focus

+ Support the store leadership team to collaborate effectively with employees and ensure work tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner

+ Build and share expertise in an assigned specialized functional area

+ Support completion or work processes before or after the store closes as needed inclusive of opening and/or closing the store

+ Listen and ask questions to solicit feedback to understand needs and provide service

+ Handle unique or complex customer interactions


Who You Are


+ Provides clear and direct communication of expectations and gives feedback

+ Ability to utilize technology effectively and engage with customers and your team to meet goals

+ Able to effectively lead and inspire others through coaching and mentoring

+ Demonstrate interest and initiative towards continuous improvement and growth

+ Research process or transaction flow to identify root cause of errors


Benefits at Banana Republic


+ Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic, Old Navy and Athleta, 30% off at Outlet, and 10% off markdowns at Gap, Banana Republic and Outlet.

+ Competitive Paid Time Off plans.*

+ Company match for donations and volunteer time*

+ Registered Retirement Savings Plan

+ Employee stock purchase plan.*

+ Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*

+ Virtual health care 24/7*

+ Maternity/Parental Top Up.*

+ See more of the benefits we offer.


*For eligible employees


Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign (https://www.hrc.org/resources/best-places-to-work-for-lgbtq-equality-2022) for the seventeenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the fourth year in a row.

title: Superintendent
description:
Broad Function
This position reports directly to the Project Manager on supporting and growing the business by coordinating all site construction activities and supervises all field personnel as required to successfully complete the project on schedule and within budget.  Ensures all assigned projects are delivered safely, consistently and effectively and are profitably managed and compliant.  Supports building the Brock brand by providing world class service quality to all stakeholders.

Essential Functions
  • Promote, demonstrate and instill Brock’s Bsafe and Bbest culture in all aspects of the business
  • Responsible for site safety, quality, cost and schedule
  • Ensure proper planning and scheduling of resources, monitoring, and taking corrective actions
  • Assist Project Manager in developing and implementing project Execution Plan, Quality Control Plan, and Site Safety Plan.
  • Own the planning and implementation of a project by executing detailed project plans which include timelines, scheduling, logistics, purchasing and training plans
  • Build strong cross-functional operating partnerships across the organization (as defined in role success profile)
  • Ability to understand the contract and successfully initiate change orders
  • Manage changes to project scope through defined change management process
  • Effectively resolves customer issues / discrepancies
  • Ensure that all appropriate authorizations and approvals are in place and job site is free of hazards and or dangerous conditions. prior to the commencement of any work
  • Assist in quoting and performing preliminary job walks for defined projects
  • Responsible for leveraging opportunities to cross sell Brock’s product and service offerings
  • Maintains communication with Project Manager and Business Development to ensure customers’ needs are met 
  • Identify all operations aspects of the job including: labor, equipment, consumables and materials along with any sub-contract requirements
  • Coordinate with Asset Management and Customer on planning/scheduling, and determining materials & manpower demands for defined projects
  • Work with Business Development and Estimating to transition the job from sales to operations utilizing the Healthy Start process
  • Responsible for job cost management and profitability for assigned projects, including daily tracking and reporting for billable and non-billable activities. 
  • Identify appropriate KPIs based on customer and PM requirements and works with project controls to ensure that the site is tracking the proper data and taking corrective action as required.
  • Audit ongoing operations and identifies opportunities for field efficiencies and standardization of methods to improve margins
  • Manage outsourced services within project constraints
  • Follow Brock’s procurement process and manages vendor relationships
  • Manage site supervision and ensures scope, job efficiency and productivity are met
  • Conduct effective performance evaluations and mentors site and supervision and craft employees
  • Identify knowledge gaps and ensures that all site personnel receive appropriate training
  • Determine labor requirements and recruit and hire talented craft personnel within budgeted constraints
  • Ensure all current personnel policies and procedures are implemented and compliant
  • Work closely with Regional HR Manager to resolve all employee issues fairly and equitably
  • Stay current on industry trends and work practices and participates in continuing education opportunities
  • Attend any site meeting where information is exchanged relating to Brock scope work.
  • Don’t wait to be invited to meetings, be proactive and seek out opportunities to become involved
  • All Client/Brock incident reporting policies are met or exceeded
  • Superintendent is responsible to review safety manual stated policies vs. industry or regulatory policies and make recommendations for enhancement to BSL stated policies.
Working Conditions
  • Working conditions include outdoor and indoor field, yard and shop locations.
  • Site specific hazardous environments
  • Working indoors in an office environment
  • Utilization of Personal Protective Equipment is necessary.
  • Willingness to work in highly varying schedule as site conditions dictate
Skills & Abilities:
  • Ability to work within a highly service-oriented team culture
  • Strong understanding of operational impacts on profitability
  • Understands the meaning and implications of key performance indicators
  • Works with PM to generate, evaluate, and act on strategic options and opportunities
  • Manages conflict with a minimum of noise by integrating diverse views and finding common ground or acceptable alternatives
  • High degree of technical ability such as: read/interpret engineering plans, product knowledge, etc.
  • Ability and willingness to seek out areas for improvement and solve problems
  • Demonstrates courage to address difficult issues
  • Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
  • Proven communication and interpersonal skills, including strong leadership skills
  • Strong customer focus on relationship building
  • Strong organizational skills with ability to multi-task
  • High energy level, strong sense of ethics, discretion and adherence to process
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Tools, such as Excel, PowerPoint, Project and Word.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and work independently
  • Comfortable working in a hands-on environment
Education & Experience
  • 5 years' of craft supervision experience
  • 5 years' tank panel insulation experience
  • Advanced craft or project certifications desirable (NACE, NCCER, PMP, PMI, etc.)
  • Knowledge of employment practices (hiring and termination; discipline, attendance, employment regulations, pay practices, etc.)

title: Superintendents
description:
We are currently looking for Superintendents to join our team for upcoming future opportunities!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Employee Benefit Program including medical and dental coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Training and Advancement Opportunities 

What you Bring:

  • 3 to 8 years construction supervisory experience
  • Previous experience as a Superintendent, or similar direct supervisory role
  • Combination of work experience in a similar role and industry related trade certification / education
  • Solid understanding of construction practices and trades
  • Ability to plan and manage to a project schedule
  • Understanding of construction documents and the ability to ensure that they are complete, protect the owner's interest, clearly define expectations, and provide incentive to perform
  • Contract negotiation/management skills
  • Knowledge of construction costs and budgets
  • Provide guidance to project staff, responsible for the smooth functioning of day-to-day operations by influencing, developing and implementing field project plans and schedule
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment
  • Previous Experience: Foreman, construction, general foreman, roofing, supervisor, construction foreman, construction supervisor, superintendent, construction superintendent, steamfitter, pipefitter, Project Management

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Journeyman Red Seal Certification
  • Valid Drivers License and Clean Abstract
  • Leadership for Excellence Certificate
  • Standard First Aid
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015

*Please note that this advertisement does not reflect a current job vacancy; this posting is intended to fill upcoming competitions for various projects we are about to start work on. 

*Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for further consideration; we are not accepting phone inquiries at this time.

See Job Description

title: Superintendent
description:
Location:

GTA, Ontario

Department/Division:

Employment Type:

Construction Site Department, GTA Urban Division

Full-Time

 

Who We Are

 

Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with a 40-year history of operations across the United States and Canada. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 8,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area, as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.

 

What We Offer

 

Mattamy is embarking on a journey to take our experience and leadership as a “community builder” to the next level. We have ambitious initiatives to expand and enhance our multi-family mid- and high-rise offerings in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA).  Mattamy’s new GTA Urban Division includes the company’s current collection of 40 high-rise projects and all multi-family developments within its master-planned communities in the Greater Toronto market and has aggressive growth targets for both the 416 and 905 regions of the GTA. The division will be led by a dedicated, experienced team focused on both growing Mattamy’s urban footprint and implementing innovative community design.

The Superintendent oversees the timely construction of the building from excavation to warranty service request signoff while keeping to the budget and is responsible for producing zero defect suites through effective management of trades, inspectors, suppliers and staff, while upholding the Mattamy Way. 

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Ensures complete adherence to Mattamy Urban Construction Processes, in accordance with policy and procedures.
  • Monitors & supervises all daily trade functions: timeliness, quality of workmanship and completion of work.
  • Conducts site walkthroughs to ensure imperfections are noted, Building Code is adhered to, and Homebuyers Options and Extras are complied with
  • Adheres to procedures as required by the trade Scopes of Work and Mattamy Quality Standards and takes corrective action as necessary.
  • Responsible for supervising on-site construction staff, including the scheduling of subcontractors, inspectors and suppliers on the job.
  • Assists in managing and determining staffing, material, and equipment needs.
  • Is proactive and actively assists in problem solving when job site or construction issues occur (falling behind schedule, quality of work, etc.) while complying with policy, plans and specification.
  • Oversees the approval process for subcontractor invoices ensuring quality and quantity before issuing Completion Slip.
  • Reinforces, educates and communicates the importance of schedule adherence (and assists where trade availability is causing difficulty), unwavering focus on Mattamy mission, and safety and quality standards.
  • Keeps staff both on site and in head office aware of activities and schedules through open communication to ensure smooth production operation.
  • Schedules and attends all necessary municipal inspections. Assists Inspectors with the completion of the review, and rectifies issues as required.
  • Responsible for managing to the Production Schedule. Adds comments regarding site changes and improvements as necessary and communicates changes to Project Manager on an up to the minute basis.
  • Continuously stays up to date with best practices and industry trends.
  • Ensures all work is being done in a safe manner and enforces safety standards and laws within positions scope of authority. Implements corrective action when necessary.
  • Manages maintenance of job site ensuring it is safe, clean and aesthetically appealing while under construction.
  • Carry out additional tasks as assigned.

 

What You Bring

 

  • A minimum of 5+ years of multi-family residential construction management experience.
  • Post-secondary education in a related field (e.g. Construction Engineering Technology, Architecture) or equivalent experience, as asset
  • Extensive knowledge of Ontario Building Code, Occupational Health and Safety Act, and other health and safety regulations.
  • Clear understanding of contracts, plans, and specifications, as well as construction methods, materials and regulations. Includes knowledge of all trades, staff responsibilities, scheduling and scopes of work.
  • Flexible, with the ability to work at locations across the division.
  • Strong organizational skills, including the tracking and control of costs, budgets and schedule.
  • Must be detailed and thorough.
  • Ability to train and mentor staff through advanced leadership skills with the ability to delegate as required.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills required, both oral and written. Willing to take responsibility and be held accountable for results including communicating issues as they arise.
  • Skills in building relationships with a broad network of contacts, including trade partners and suppliers and a strong customer focus.
  • Knowledge of MS Office software, including MS Project an asset. 
  • Valid Class G driver’s license with the ability to travel as required to various job sites.

 

Health & Safety
 

We are doing our part to safeguard your health and taking extra steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19. All work sites and premises will allow for required physical distancing requirements, and new routines and resources such as hand sanitizer, antiseptic wipes, masks, or other protective equipment.

 

Vaccination is the single best protection against COVID-19 for us as individuals and our communities and is vital to maintaining our commitment to health and safety. The successful applicant will be required, as a condition of employment with Mattamy, to provide Mattamy with proof that they have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine (or combination of vaccines) authorized by Health Canada, subject to accommodations required under applicable human rights legislation.

 

Why Mattamy


At Mattamy, we’re passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important aspects of the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues and communities. We offer a workplace that allows our employees to experience exciting possibilities in their career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.

When you’re part of the Mattamy family, your day to day work has an incredible impact. What we do takes teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. Based on the culture we pride ourselves on, we’ve been recognized with external awards as well. Some of our most recent recognition includes:

 

Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2021 & 2020)

Canada’s Top 100 Employers (2020 & 2019)

Greater Toronto’s Top Employers (2022, 2021, 2020 & 2019)

Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2021 & 2017)

 

We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

 

Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us on your application and we will work with you to meet your needs.

 

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.

title: C21011 - Caretaker
description:
Description

Lethbridge School Division is accepting applications for a Caretaking position. The Caretaker is responsible for completing cleaning duties and responsibilities to a high standard within the school. The Caretaker is responsible to the Head Caretaker or designate. The Caretaker must be able to communicate and interact positively with students, co-workers, and school administration to ensure all needs are addressed at the school site. A Caretaker can make minor adjustments to the building, equipment and furniture. They will work the evening shift during the school term, however day shift is required periodically (rotation shift/non instructional days). Caretakers must be able to work unsupervised for long periods of time. Caretaker work demands good health in order to fulfill the physical demands, e.g., lifting chairs, filing cabinets, furniture, boxes of materials, cleaning equipment and climbing stairs/ladders. The daily work routine involves the use of various chemicals.

The school is used by the community after school and into the evening, requiring all staff to be aware of the demand and needs of all the user groups. Candidates must be team players within both the caretaking and whole school staff and be able to relate to students.

Typical duties of a Caretaker include but are not limited to:

  • Cleaning thoroughly all washrooms, fixtures, partitions, and shower areas
  • Washing of all desks, counters, doors, windows, etc.
  • All dusting in the school
  • Mopping, vacuuming, and waxing of floors
  • Securing of Division buildings
  • Preventative maintenance, lock downs, fire drills, and changing lights
  • Snow and ice removal from walkways

Available Locations:

  • Nicholas Sheran School - 1 Position - Hours: 6 hours per day/30 hours per week -commencing immediately
  • Senator Joyce Fairbairn School - 1 Position - Hours: 6 hours per day/30 hours per week - commencing immediately
  • *Note: you may be reassigned to other locations based on Division needs.

**In order to meet school needs, staff will be required to rotate between evening and day shifts. In addition, Rotation Shifts with the Head Caretaker and caretaking staff must occur during the school year between September and June. Division requirements for rotation shifts are as follows:

  • Secondary Schools: Six (6) weeks equaling 240 hours per year
  • Elementary Schools: Four (4) weeks equaling 160 hours per year

Please note that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted regarding an interview.

Requirements

Mandatory Qualifications

  • A High School Diploma or equivalent

Additional Qualifications, Knowledge, and Skills

  • Demonstrated initiative and good judgement
  • Ability to build positive relations with staff and students that values a team environment
  • Capable of working with minimum supervision
  • Organize work and make adjustments to daily routine, as conditions require
  • Capable of performing routine and repetitive tasks on a daily basis
  • Ability to promote and maintain effective working relations with the public, co-workers, school staff, and Division officials
  • Display a good working knowledge of all chemicals/procedures used by caretaking staff

Fitness and Abilities

  • Able to stand or walk for extended periods
  • Able to lift and carry up to 22 kg independently and 22-31.5 kg with assistance
  • Able to work in a highly active physical environment
  • Able to work with a variety of chemicals
  • Must be physically capable of performing heavy manual labour for extended periods of time under various weather conditions

Assets

  • Valid ABSA 5th Class Power Engineering Certificate or equivalent

For the full Caretaker job description, please click HERE.

Conditions of Employment

In order to ensure and maintain a safe and secure working and learning environment, applicants new to Lethbridge School Division who are offered employment must provide:

  • A satisfactory police information check; including Vulnerable Sector Check from Police Services or an RCMP detachment.
  • A satisfactory Intervention Record Check from South Region Alberta Child and Family Services.
  • Proof of photo identification, may be a valid driver’s licence, provincial identification card as issued by a licensed government registry office, valid passport or Nexus card. If one cannot be provided, a new card must be obtained and proof of application provided within three days of hire.
  • Documentation of a valid Social Insurance Number in the employee’s legal name.

Benefits

Enjoy access to benefits for you and your family!

Make a difference in a child's life!

Rate per hour: $23.02


Posting will remain open until 10:00 AM, October 6, 2021.



Apply for this job

description:

Requisition #2362044
Job LocationCanada-Ontario-Pickering
Additional Location DetailsPickering Casino
Job StreamProperty Development
Site LocationGreat Canadian Gaming Corp. Corporate Head Office
Job TypePermanent, Full-Time
Number of Positions1
Posting Date21-Mar-2022
Expiry Date18-Jun-2022
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsN/A
Languages RequiredEnglish
Job Description

LOCATION: Pickering Casino

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Project Lead and under the general direction of the Construction Director, this position is a 14 month contract that is responsible for all aspects necessary planning, scheduling, and safe execution of the work related to all phases of construction for the Pickering Casino. Ensuring business integration, transition events, operational readiness plans, processes and documentation organization is being followed, and work is proceeding on schedule and within budget while ensuring adherence to all policies and procedures.

Key Accountabilities:

• Overall responsibility for the safe execution of the work on site.
• Effectively plan and schedule all activities necessary to complete the construction of the project.
• Overall responsibility for timely and quality execution of the work on site including coordination of trade contractors on site and material deliveries to meet the schedule.
• Coordinate with other Superintendents and Project Managers to ensure effective. completion of all aspects and phases of the Project.
• Liaises and communicates effectively with all appropriate operational departments at a senior level.
• Coordinate and execute an efficient transition plan; leveraging former lessons learned and project artifacts and own enhancements.
• Tracks and controls transition schedule and costs to achieve completion within time and budget, and takes corrective action as required.
• Develops and cultivates strong working relationships with all stakeholders: management, suppliers, vendors and employees; while ensuring all compliance and vetted requirements.
• Ensures compliance with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations.
• Completes formal project close/lessons learned process.
• Performing other duties as required.

Education and Qualification Requirements:

• Postsecondary Diploma or Degree in a Construction related program or Journeyman certification.
• 10 years experience in the ICI Construction market on projects of similar scope and complexity.
• Gold Seal Certification is an asset.
• Ability to meet deadlines and coordinate numerous resources.
• Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as to collaborate successfully with various levels of management.
• Ability to handle sensitive and complex issues with discretion, confidentiality and good judgement.
• Highly motivated self-starter with a ‘can do’ attitude, and the ability to take initiative, prioritize, and work productively without supervision under demanding timelines.
• Proficiency in MS Office; MS Project / Primavera, Bluebeam and PDF Writer.

title: 6104 - Project Manager - Pipeline Integrity
description:
Our Client, one of North America's leading energy infrastructure companies with operations in natural gas, oil and power industries throughout Canada, the United States, and Mexico has an immediate need for an Intermediate Project Manager - Pipeline Integrity. This is a contract position for one (1) year located in Calgary,

Description

The Intermediate Project Managers will support the Integrity, Expansion & Project Implementation (IEPI) team to manage multiple Pipe Integrity, Facility (Measurement and Compression), Maintenance, Capacity and Expansion projects within their Canada Gas Business Unit.

Accountabilities

  • Liaise with internal stakeholder groups to understand a project’s Regulatory and Environmental objectives and determine the necessary scope deliverables, cost, schedule, and quality requirements
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously including planning, budgeting, scheduling, and reporting, while delivering them safely, on time, and on budget
  • Identify and mitigate risks, through team engagement, risk registers, and front-end planning
  • Maintain regular communication with stakeholder groups and manage expectations
  • Oversee project design and facilitate technical reviews to ensure all applicable specifications, codes and legal and regulatory requirements are met
  • Liaise with field construction personnel in order to ensure work is executed with an emphasis on safety and quality

Required

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related field is preferred
  • Technical diploma in a related field of study will also be considered
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) designation is considered an asset
  • Three or more years of related experience
  • Must be able to travel within Canada
  • Must have proven project management skills and previous experience successfully executing projects
  • Demonstrated strong planning and decision-making ability in a busy and dynamic work environment with the ability to manage, prioritize, and effectively deal with multiple and competing priorities
  • Sound interpersonal skills, including conflict resolution, negotiation, and leadership
  • Customer focused and proven ability to align project objectives with regulatory and commercial drivers
  • Commitment to health, safety, environment, and quality
  • Strong team orientation, demonstrating a high level of cooperation and sharing of ideas
  • Have and maintain a valid driver's license and provide a driver's abstract (record) for review

Additional Information

  • Client requires proof of Covid-19 vaccination to access job site. Providing proof of vaccination is a condition of employment with Ian Martin” for this opportunity.

If you're a technical professional, you know that it can be difficult to find fulfilling work that advances your career. At the Ian Martin Group, we exist to connect professionals like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at

http://recruit@ianmartin.com/

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

#WES

#MON

description:
Suite à l'obtention de nouveaux contrats d'exécution, la compagnie souhaite confier à un nouveau talent F/H la gestion d'une ou plusieurs opérations.


Nous recherchons un candidat capable de superviser et de s'assurer de la bonne gestion de toutes les étapes d'exécution de projets de nature commercial, industriel ou résidentiel lourd.


Vous vous assurerez du contrôle de projet, du respect des échéanciers/budgets, de la relation avec les sous-traitants et de la qualité de service offerte au client.

title: Project Manager, Terminal Construction
description:
Job Description :

â€œWe connect communities and customers to the people and places important in their livesâ€

 

 

PROJECT MANAGER, TERMINAL CONSTRUCTION

Victoria or Tsawwassen

 

 

A results-oriented and experienced Project Manager, your goal is to effectively manage marine, civil, and building construction projects at our terminals. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Terminal Construction PMO, you will be involved in multiple projects from preliminary planning through to commissioning, as well as supporting other the departmental technical initiatives. Other specific responsibilities include: initiating feasibility studies and undertaking preliminary field investigations; leading stakeholder meetings and public consultation; identifying, developing and presenting project business cases; and identifying, preparing, managing and being accountable for project scope, schedule, required resources, and budget. You will also manage the tendering process and will be required to coach project coordinators, ensuring a high degree of professionalism and organization throughout the department.

 

You will have excellent knowledge of construction contract law and expertise in the preparation, review, and interpretation of technical design documentation and drawings. You are a systematic thinker with the ability to provide effective solutions to complex problems. You have a positive attitude and excellent interpersonal and communication skills which allow you to maintain effective working relationships.

 

You bring seven to ten years progressive project management experience, with considerable experience managing capital construction projects, specifically site planning and development, consultants, major contracts, project budgets and financial reporting. You possess a Bachelor Degree in Civil or Mechanical Engineering and membership, or eligibility to be registered, as a Professional Engineer with EGBC. Alternatively, a Civil or Mechanical Engineering Technologist with AScT designation and comprehensive work experience will be considered.  PMP designation is an asset.

 

Please apply by May 20, 2022. You will be required to create a profile which you can use to apply on future career opportunities.

 

At BC Ferries, our employees are our most important assets in delivering our commitment to customer safety, service and satisfaction.  We offer a unique West Coast working environment with diverse challenges and opportunities. Whether your goal is to work behind the scenes, onboard our ships, or within our land based operations, you are a key contributor to the BC Ferries team.

 

With 47 ports of call and around 500 sailings every day, BC Ferries is the largest independently-owned ferry company in the world. Dedicated to safety, excellence, innovation, and people, we are committed to continuously improving the west coast travel experience of our customers.

 

BC Ferries supports employment equity and diversity in the workplace and we encourage applications from all qualified individuals including women, visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (LGBTQ2S+), and others who reflect our ever-changing workplace.

 

We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Steel Detailing Project Manager
description:
Steel Detailing Project Manager

JMT Consultants Inc. – Winnipeg, Manitoba

Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent

JMT Consultants Inc. is a growing structural consulting firm that is currently seeking a motivated Steel Detailing Project Manager to join our dedicated team. For individuals outside of the Winnipeg area, we offer an exciting relocation expenses package. We will also consider the opportunity to work remotely for the right candidate.

We are looking for an experienced Steel Detailing Project Manager to oversee the production and completion of large-scale projects. You must be a multi-tasker who has excellent organizational, time management, and communication skills, and can effectively manage a team to finish their work efficiently and within deadlines. At the start of each project, you will collaborate with other department heads to discuss the scope and budget. Then you will monitor each phase, ensuring the staff works efficiently and that the final product meets our client's expectations.

At JMT Consultants Inc. we value our team members and offer a full medical benefits package, vacation/sick time, flexible work hours and relaxed office environment. We provide an annual company retreat and all team members receive an annual profit-sharing bonus.

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate with fabricators, engineers and architects to meet project requirements
  • Manage RFIs and Change Orders
  • Prepare drawing packages and issue to the client per scheduled delivery dates 
  • Work directly with operations director to ensure client satisfaction
  • Determine project roles, responsibilities, and deadlines for each team member
  • Make sure that the project is being completed effectively on time and on budget
  • Coordinate changes and be willing to adapt if necessary
  • Keep teams committed, motivated, and productive throughout the project

Qualifications:

  • Advanced level of knowledge of Tekla Structures
  • 3-5 years of prior experience in project management is desired
  • 5+ years' experience as a Steel Detailer – willing to consider candidates who can demonstrate significant experience in a related field
  • Experience in structural and miscellaneous steel construction, fabrication, and the ability to read drawings
  • Proven project management and coordination skills
  • Self-motivated and ability to complete multiple tasks with minimal guidance
  • Deadline driven with an attention to detail

Requirements:

  • Diploma/certificate
  • Canadian Citizenship/Legally able to work in Canada

How to Apply:

Send cover letter and resume through Indeed.

We thank all applicants who apply, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Surintendant(e) de chantier de construction
description:
Vous avez de l'intérêt pour l'industrie de la construction, vous êtes à la recherche de défis stimulants et d'un projet de carrière prometteur?  Nous avons besoin de vous.  Nous croyons que le développement de notre entreprise passe fondamentalement par une solide équipe de travail ainsi que le développement de nos ressources humaines allié à un coaching en continu.

Groupe Unigesco rassemble des passionnés de la construction qui ont développé depuis plus de 15 ans une très grande expertise en gestion de projets.  Grace à notre intégrité, notre rigueur et notre approche novatrice ainsi que par notre capacité de mener à bien des projets d'envergure, Groupe Unigesco est en mesure de décrocher les projets les plus intéressants et enrichissants.  Notre organisation est un milieu des plus stimulants pour le développement de professionnels de haut niveau.


Principales tâches et responsabilités

  • Au démarrage du projet, étudier les plans et devis.  Avec le chargé de projets, discuter de toute irrégularité constatée et participer à la planification des méthodes d'exécution.
  • Planifier, coordonner et superviser les travaux sur les chantiers en fonction des objectifs visés et de l'ordonnancement dans activités.
  • Coordonner et diriger le travail des différentes équipes de chantier (employés de chantier et sous-traitants).  Prendre les actions nécessaires lorsque le rendement n'est pas adéquat.
  • Veiller au respect des coûts et des échéances du projet.  Communiquer les irrégularités au chargé de projet.
  • En tout temps, gérer l'organisation physique du chantier ainsi que sa propreté.
  • S'assurer que les standards de qualité de l'entreprise sont respectés, tant au niveau des matériaux que de l'exécution.
  • En présence d'une situation de non-conformité, apporter des mesures correctives.  Se référer au chargé de projet s'il y a lieu.
  • Veillez à l'approvisionnement en matériaux, équipement et outillage nécessaires à l'avancement des travaux.
  • Lorsque requis, rédiger et répondre aux mémos de chantier.  Remplir les rapports demandés ainsi que les journaux de chantiers (quotidiennement).
  • Assurer l'application des normes et des lois en vigueur ainsi que des programmes de santé et sécurité.

Valeurs Groupe Unigesco

  • EXCELLENCE

Nous visons l'excellence dans ce que nous faisons et dans ce que nous sommes.  Nous cherchons à surpasser les attentes, à produire un rendement de haute qualité.

  • EFFICACITÉ

Nous évoluons dans un environnement ultra dynamique. L'efficacité et la rapidité d'exécution sont nécessaires, sans toutefois être une entrave à la qualité.

  • TRAVAIL D'ÉQUIPE

La collaboration reste l'élément fondamental à la base de toutes nos réussites. Nous travaillons ensemble en utilisant les forces de chacun et nous sommes  présents les uns pour les autres, même dans les moments plus difficiles. Nous sommes ainsi collectivement plus forts.

  • AUTONOMIE

Étant une jeune entreprise en pleine croissance, nous faisons face à la nouveauté.  Chaque membre de l'équipe doit faire preuve d'une grande autonomie dans les processus décisionnels et dans la réalisation des  tâches.

  • COMMUNICATION

Chez Groupe Unigesco, nous valorisons l'échange d'information et le partage d'idées.  Notre philosophie porte ouverte encourage les échanges entre tous, peu importe la fonction occupée.  Étant en interrelation avec plusieurs intervenants, la transparence et l'honnêteté sont  de mise.

Compétences et aptitudes spécifiques

  • Avoir des aptitudes en coordination de projets et de personnel.
  • Être passionné du domaine de la construction et chercher l'excellence dans l'exécution des projets.
  • Être en mesure de travailler de façon autonome, démontrer de l'initiative dans la gestion quotidienne.
  • Être apte à évaluer et régler les problématiques techniques.

Scolarité

  • DEC ou DEP.

Connaissances et expérience exigées

  • Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience en tant que surintendant
  • Connaitre la suite MS Office.
