title: Superintendent (Nights) - Building Construction
description:
Superintendent (Nights) - Building Construction









Location: Coquitlam, BC, Canada Job ID: R9825 Job Status: Full-Time



Share:











Apply Now



Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.













Description





Job Summary:

You are an exceptional Superintendent with 3+ years of experience. You will be responsible for overseeing and the coordination of our project to ensure it is completed on time and within budget. As a Superintendent, you are able to work independently or with direction from the team, implement project plans and schedules, ensuring site safety and quality control, and are able to effectively communicate with stakeholders.


Join the Ledcor Building team in Coquitlam, BC today!







Essential Responsibilities



+ Lead the project execution in accordance with contract documents, sub-contracts/agreements, plans, specifications and shop drawings including coordination and execution of changes to the work


+ Daily supervision and coordination of sub-trades


+ Demonstrates leadership in health, safety and environmental protection on the project


+ Applies the requirements of the Project Specific Safety Program (PSSP) to promote overall compliance of Ledcor HS&E standards, applicable OH&S Acts, regulations and codes with all employees and subcontractors on the project.


+ Ensures project materials are supplied and work is completed in compliance with the Project Quality Program


+ Ensures that projects are built according to approved plans, specifications, shop drawings, and applicable building codes and that high quality standards are maintained.


+ Reviews, maintains, and updates the construction schedule in conjunction with project team and ensures project milestones and completion dates are met.


+ Issues material and services purchase orders and confirms receipt of materials and return of equipment


+ Participates in project meetings with internal and external stakeholders to monitor and support the project’s ongoing progression


+ Maintains a thorough daily report that accurately tracks site progress, events, inspections, and other relevant information


+ Performs other related duties as outlined in Ledcor’s Construction Operations Manual





Qualifications



+ Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Superintendent


+ Have a thorough understanding of both high-rise and low-rise residential and commercial projects


+ Great relationship with finishing sub trades, material suppliers and vendors locally


+ Coordinate with the Project Superintendent to plan and manage the project schedule.


+ Must have good customer service experience and able to conduct PDI's


+ Working knowledge of health, safety and environmental protection practices and procedures


+ Solid understanding of current construction practices; working knowledge of construction documents, drawings, specifications and project management


+ Ability to guide safe work practices in a high paced environment while maintaining project quality, schedule and budget


+ Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, understand and interpret stakeholder needs and identify solutions


+ Capable of anticipating constructability issues in moderately complex situations and creating solutions in the construction plan and schedule


+ Skilled at promoting teamwork with project team and stakeholders


+ Have strong budgeting and scheduling skills and aptitude with scheduling software and project management software is a must


+ Ability to use Word, Excel, and Outlook


+ Must have and maintain a valid provincial driver’s license





Work Conditions



+ Night shifts


+ Successful completion of pre-employment drug & alcohol requirements





Additional Information:


Company Description


Ledcor Building offers full-service construction for commercial, residential, institutional, and light industrial projects, along with expertise in green building. Our depth of knowledge and expertise come from building hundreds of projects – of all sizes – across North America each year.




But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!




Employment Equity


At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.



Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.




View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here (https://www.ledcor.com/who-we-are/inclusion-and-diversity) .



Date Posted

May 4, 2022



., Coquitlam, BC, Canada

title: Underground Utilities and Earthworks Construction Manager
description:
Overview:

Underground Utilities and Earthworks Construction Manager

 

Sureway Construction, in Edmonton, AB, is currently looking for a solid contributor to our Earthworks and Underground utilities groups who can handle a great but fast paced work environment, successfully leading large scale heavy civil construction projects. You must have a wealth of knowledge when it comes to moving dirt, putting pipe in the ground, and leading large teams with a safety conscious mind.   If you think thatâ€™s you, apply today!

 

Underground Utilities and Earthworks Construction Manager Skills, Knowledge, Qualifications & Experience:

  • Civil or Construction Engineering Technologist Diploma or equivalent is REQUIRED.
  • 10 or more yearâ€™s combined field experience in Heavy Civil Construction (strong underground utilities and grading experience is a MUST) with a minimum of 5 years as a project manager/superintendent/construction manager in heavy civil construction.
    • Supervise heavy equipment operators, and labourers
    • Coordinate and schedule activities
    • Recommend staffing actions and arrange for training
  • Familiar with Heavy Civil Construction methodology and best practices required.
  • Effective leadership skills with a strong focus on operations and business processes.
  • Ability to plan and manage to a project schedule.
  • Ability to anticipate stakeholder needs, investigate the underlying causes and identify short/long term solutions.
  • The following training courses are required: Leadership for Safety Excellence, Prime Contractor, CSTS-09, H2S Alive, Ground Disturbance Level 2, and WHMIS.
  • Clean driverâ€™s abstract. Valid driverâ€™s license (non GDL).  
  • Must successfully pass pre-employment drug and alcohol testing.

 

Underground Utilities and Earthworks Construction Manager Essential Functions/Responsibilities:

  • Plan and coordinate construction operations with the ability to utilize available equipment while maintaining a schedule and completing critical tasks.
  • Supervise the foremanâ€™s daily activities; ensuring their crews tasks are performed efficiently.
  • Ensuring all safety practice and procedures are followed by generating site-specific safety protocols.
  • Read and interpret construction plans and blueprints.
  • Coordinating and managing scheduling conflicts between sub-contractors.
  • Maintaining records of daily construction activities, including worker timesheets, daily progress reports and safety documentation.
  • Maintaining positive and professional relationships with external stakeholders.
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable health and safety regulations.

 

 

Location: Edmonton, AB (non-camp position, required to live in the area)

 

Sureway offers a fantastic opportunity to join a leading team in the heavy civil construction industry. We offer a friendly, fast paced environment with plenty of room for career advancement, great benefits, and a strong team of professionals

 

Sureway Construction is an equal opportunity employer. We would like to thank all applicants for submitting their resume; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Weâ€™re Ready.   Are You?

title: Senior Highway Construction Manager
description:
:

We are searching for a Senior Highway Construction Manager to join our Gannett Fleming Toronto Office, supporting our continued growth and expansion in the GTHA Region. You will serve as a senior technical advisor and be actively engaged, representing Gannett Fleming in professional associations, serving as the primary interface with clients and teaming partners regionally. Our construction management and inspection capabilities satisfy the most selective clients. We effectively control our clientsâ€™ costs, deliver their projects on time, and meet strict regulatory needs while maintaining long-lasting relationships from the pre-construction stage until long after project completion.

 

Position Highlights:

  • Recognized leader: Gannett Fleming, an innovative global infrastructure and engineering firm, reached new heights on this yearâ€™s coveted Engineering News-Record (ENR)annual rankings list
  • Advancement: Gannett Fleming does a great job of investing in its employees, treating them fairly, and providing opportunities to advance.
  • Drive: Progressive â€œissue-freeâ€ employee relations programs.
  • Stability: 100+ years young and we are just getting started. #joinourjourney

Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain contracts and relationships with key clients
  • Provide technical knowledge to client specific projects
  • Manage multiple urban and rural highway and roadway including budgets
  • Oversee the preparation and review contracts and tender documents
  • Ensure quality control practices are followed
  • Maintains, follow and review GF's Health & Safety policies
  • On site management of construction contracts
  • Actively participate and lead preparation of proposals and technical reports
  • Support our BD team in identifying new opportunities within the Greater Toronto Region, be instrumental in developing proposals in a lead role and helping us win opportunities
  • Be the point of contact with Owners, Clients and Contractors as required to ensure successful delivery of the project
  • Provide mentorship and knowledge transfer to other team members in a growing office environment and staff and participate in hiring process to build a strong team to serve our clients
  • Be a company representative and act on behalf of the company.
  • Ensure CA staff are trained to a competent level to do the assigned work.
  • Travel and work on contracts throughout Ontario

 

:

Minimum Requirements  

 

  • Bachelorâ€™s University Degree in Civil Engineering or similar engineering field
  • Licensed Professional Engineer in good standing with the Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO) or a Certified Engineering Technologist with the Ontario Association of Certified Engineering Technicians and Technologists (OACETT) Eng. preferred
  • Experience working with MTO, Regions and local municipalities.
  • Have knowledge in highway engineering, highway construction specifications and standards, construction methods, managing change orders, defective material, schedule changes, public complaints, and payment processes
  • Demonstrated experience in the last ten (10) years in administration of the medium complexity construction projects in Ontario or other similar jurisdictions in Canada
  • MTO RAQS Registration in Construction Administration.
  • Familiarity with GTHA market conditions, public and private sector client base in and around the GTHA
  • Have completed three (3) projects of medium complexity with the ministry with the overall performance appraisal rating of satisfactory
  • Knowledge of the requirements of MTO's Construction Administration and Inspection Task Manual (CAITM)
  • Successful completion of MTO T131 Advanced Claims and Dispute Resolution Training Course
  • Ability to work independently as well as in groups with a demonstrated ability to manage projects, project teams, and clients
  • Highly motivated and enthusiastic with a strong desire to succeed
  • Excellent analytical and decision-making skills, with commitment to excellence and high-quality work
  • Proven analytical, communication and negotiation skills.
  • Sound knowledge of design standards, OPS specifications, standard drawings, MTO Manuals and Best Practices.
  • Knowledge and skill in interpreting and applying transportation construction practices, procedures, and quality assurance techniques.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of relevant Laws and Regulations (Environmental, Health and Safety, etc.) and their application in construction contracts.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
  • Ability to organize, prioritize and schedule work.
  • Ability to analyze and solve problems.
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities.
  • Valid Ontario driverâ€™s license with an acceptable driving record.
:

At  Gannett Fleming, we believe in  improving  the lives of the people we serve. We believe in  innovation  and social responsibility. We believe in the  diversity  of our team and the creative solutions they provide. We believe in embracing  change  and emerging technologies while maintaining an unmatched standard of quality. We believe in creating an environment where employees can thrive at home and at work. We believe in engaging our employees, building lasting relationships with our clients, and, in turn, making a difference in the world.

 

We offer a comprehensive benefits program, which includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance, our tax-deferred retirement plan, and  the opportunity to incentive compensation for eligible positions. We are committed to your personal growth and professional development, so we offer tuition reimbursement, access to internal and external training programs and support active participation in professional organizations.

 

Gannett Fleming is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteransâ€™ status or other characteristics protected by law.  

 

Permanent Residency or Canadian Citizenship required for this position. No relocation assistance will be provided for this position. Local candidates will be given preference.

 

NO AGENCIES PLEASE: Unsolicited resumes from third party agencies will not be accepted.

 

Location: Toronto, Ontario

Core Business Hours: 8:00 AM â€“ 5:00 PM
Employment Status: Full-Time  

Salary Range: Salary dependent upon experience and geographic location

#L1: Hybrid

 

Please be advised that Gannett Fleming may require you to provide proof of the Covid-19 vaccination to meet regulatory and client requirements. Upon hire, you will be required to attest to your vaccination status. Valid religious and medical exemptions will be reviewed and considered in accordance with applicable law.

title: Site Superintendent (FT)
description:
Site Superintendent - Williams Lake.

The Site Superintendent will primarily be responsible to ensure all persons on the construction site are using the required personal protective equipment properly and at all times. This position will ensure all employees are performing duties in compliance with company policies and standards for cost control, waste reduction, quality, safety, and complete and on-time delivery. This role will also manage job site administration duties, such as reviewing/submitting employee time-sheets and completing/maintaining daily logs. The Site Superintendent must possess a degree or diploma in a related field and position-relevant bonding and certifications.

Location: 60 Westridge Dr, Williams Lake, BC.

Responsibilities:
  • Monitor and maintain the project construction schedule as needed.
  • Control and monitor labor, material, and equipment needs.
  • Coordinate and direct good construction standards and quality control.
  • See that good housekeeping practices are observed and maintained.
  • Attend pre-construction and construction meetings, taking notes on areas that may present a future problem and present to the Project Manager for consultation.
  • Coordinate all required inspections as mandated.
  • Prepare and expedite project deficiency lists.
  • Collaborate with the team to determine project needs.
  • Plan construction processes.
  • Estimate costs and ensure the project is on budget.
  • Supervise staff and provide constructive feedback.
  • Monitor and report on project progress.
  • Plan inspections and obtain construction permits from local authorities.
  • Implement safety and quality guidelines.
  • Ensure the job site remains safe, clean, and orderly.
  • Resolve on-site issues and emergencies.

Requirements:
  • 5+ years of experience as Construction Site Superintendent.
  • Degree or diploma in a related field.
  • Position-relevant bonding and certifications.
  • A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills.
  • Ability to manage coordination efforts in construction projects with various parties, such as architects, project engineers, and landscaping installers.
  • Strong knowledge of health and safety regulations.
  • Proven experience preparing and conducting post-implementation evaluations.
  • Ability to create realistic schedules to support the timely completion of construction projects.
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise necessary cost control measures.
  • Demonstrated project management skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage conflicting demands.
  • Ability to delegate, set expectations, and monitor the progress of all direct reports.

Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!

New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.

title: Industrial Demolition Project Manager
description:
Morgan houses a well-established demolition division with over 40 years of combined experience within its core leadership and executions team. This team has been responsible for the safe execution of many of Western Canada’s largest demolition projects, and excels at meeting schedule and cost, in a safe manner in the most challenging environments. Morgan has since broadened its industrial service offering with the inclusion of our specialized abatement services team to form the Morgan Demolition and Abatement brand or MDA. The collective environmental services team at Morgan has an impressive project portfolio of recent works of varying scope, scale, and technicality while maintaining an exemplary safety record.

Morgan’s Industrial Demolition division is looking to add an experienced Project Manager to their team. The primary function for the Project Manager is to assist in the planning, management and execution of assigned projects for Time and Material, Unit Price, or Lump Sum construction projects with the objective of enhancing and delivering excellence on all elements related to the project, including but not limited to: profitability, productivity, efficiency, schedule, safety, local inclusion, equipment utilization, and client management.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide leadership within the corporate safety program to maintain excellence in safety performance;
  • Assist with the establishment and administration of performance measurement systems to meet client service and contract expectations;
  • Manage contract administration, including change order management, dispute resolution, contract review, annual contract performance evaluations, and quarterly contract review stewardships;
  • Direct and supervise all area staff, including superintendents, quality control personnel, environmental specialists, safety advisors, and field supervisors;
  • Ensure that all company and subcontractor relationships and operations meet any applicable industry and regulatory standards while ensuring all gaps are closed in relation to risk reduction plans;
  • Identify and coordinate projects and production to ensure maximum resource utilization and adherence to budget and schedule;
  • Oversee and maintain application of corporate quality system including Requests for Information;
  • Resolve issues as they arise with internal and external clients while maintaining positive working relationships;
  • Other such duties as required.
  • Post-Secondary technical training accompanied by progressive project management in the construction industry;
  • Mechanical, project management or construction management technical diploma or degree;
  • Project Management experience in an industrial environment, preference given to candidates with demolition exposure;
  • Demonstrated analytical and statistical knowledge using general business mathematical skills (able to prepare and understand budget reports);
  • Ability to form strong working relationships with diverse groups of people, including company employees at all levels, clients, and stakeholders;
  • Intermediate skills in MS Office, MS Project, or similar software programs;
  • Ability to successfully manage heavy workloads with multiple priorities;
  • Must be willing to travel; typically working 12 hours per day on a rotational schedule depending on site/client requirements and demands; and
  • The ideal candidate will be Calgary or Edmonton based, with an expectation that the role is primarily based on site on a rotational shift.

title: Construction Manager
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is seeking an experienced Construction Manager to join our growing team!  

 

Position Overview

Plan, direct, and coordinate constructions activities, usually through subordinate supervisory personnel. Liaise with customers regarding activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. Participate in the conceptual development of a construction project and oversee its organization, scheduling, and Execution.   Work in a safe manner, abiding by all company safety rules and applicable legislation.

This position involves working outdoors and extreme temperatures in Alberta climate. May involve working at heights or in confined spaces. Travel, out-of-town work, and shifts would be dependent upon project assignment.

 

Technical Duties and Essential Functions

  • Follow all company and site-specific safety rules. Working within the Companyâ€™s Safety Program at all times. Maintaining behaviour-based safety essentials and adherence to the Life Saving Rules. Understand and respond accordingly to all safety alerts, warnings, hazards, etc.
  • Use effective verbal and written communication skills. Able to adequately comprehend and communicate using the English Language. Listen and communicate effectively and respectfully.
  • Liaise with Construction Team, Management, and Customer representatives to ensure safe and successful execution of all project goals.
  • Respond to customer needs while promoting a safe workplace and meeting quality, budgetary and schedule requirements.
  • Lead and participate in construction planning and progress meetings, responding and adapting to changing conditions.
  • Able to interpret, understand and explain contract terms and project requirements to team members.
  • Motivate, mentor, develop and direct employees throughout the workday.
  • Delegate tasks to the construction supervision team to effectively manage project needs and deadlines.
  • Regularly review all aspects of project progress, ensuring compliance with contractual requirements, construction and safety codes and local laws.
  • Act as a role model for Woodâ€™s safety program. Encouraging full participation of all employees, at all times.
  • Work with the Quality Department, ensuring that all aspects of the project meet required specifications.
  • Utilize Advanced Work Packages to direct construction activities.
  • Assist with proposal process and construction execution plan development
  • Perform other duties as required
Skills / Qualifications:

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in mechanical or civil engineering OR Journeyperson Certification in a related field with considerable leadership training and experience.
  • Minimum of 15+ years in Construction Management or related field.
  • Excellent leadership and interpersonal communication skills are required.
  • Experience in building successful client-contractor relationships
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications.
  • Experience with progress measurement software and 3D model reviews
  • Extensive knowledge of established construction and maintenance practices, procedures, and techniques as well as applicable local, provincial, and Canadian codes.
  • Familiarity with a wide range of equipment and tools and proficiency in skilled construction and maintenance.
  • Strong commitment to Construction Safety
  • Business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources, leadership techniques, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
  • Applicable knowledge of Advanced Work Packaging Best Practices

 

Physical Requirements:

  • Must pass a site-specific drug and alcohol test, as required by the customer
  • Must possess enough strength and stamina to perform the technical duties and essential functions as identified above.
  • May be required consistently to work 10hour shifts performing physical labour in varying temperature extremes and conditions. May be required to work overtime on occasion
  • Must be able to climb and maintain balance on stairs, ladders, scaffolds and steel framework, utilizing proper fall arrest procedures when required. Able to safely and comfortably work at heights without posing a danger to oneself or others
  • Able to meet physical requirements of frequent walking, climbing, standing, bending, twisting, and crawling for the duration of the shift. Aspects of the job may require sitting or walking for extended durations.

 

Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Construction Project Manager : Capital Projects
description:
Are you aConstruction Project Manageror ambitiousCapital Project Managerlooking to continue your career with awell-established,growing real estate firm? Do you enjoy drivingcommercial retrofit, restoration and large capital improvement projects? Do you enjoy collaborating as a team, and mentoring junior colleagues? Then read on…

With your technical expertise you will be responsible for driving commercial, retail and industrial retrofit and capital improvement projects end to end. And, with your team building skills you will collaborate with the asset management and development management teams, mentor junior colleagues and coordinate with consultants and trades.

This is a great opportunity to build your construction management career with a growing and reputable real estate company that understands if you're successful, they're successful!

What you get out of it?
Compensation will be respectful of your experience, with great benefits, and additional perks. If you are interested in building your construction career with a progressive, well established and collaborative team, then apply now!
If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Maintenance Coordinator
description:
Job Description :

 

 

MAINTENANCE COORDINATOR  

Amica London

 

 

 

Amica Senior Lifestyles is setting a new standard for senior living in Canada by combining unparalleled premium hospitality and amenities with expert care and support to deliver a personalized senior living experience. Committed to enriching the lives of seniors now and as their needs change, Amica offers Independent Living (IL), Assisted Living (AL) and Memory Care (MC) lifestyle options. Established in 1996, the company owns and operates over 30 residences in British Columbia, Alberta and Ontario, with plans to continue expansion in select markets.

 

 

 

JOB SUMMARY

The Maintenance Coordinator manages all aspects of maintenance within the facility to ensure that residentsâ€™ needs are met, and the building quality, cleanliness and safety are upheld. The Maintenance Coordinator also manages all Maintenance Department team members.

 

In accordance with applicable codes and regulations, the Maintenance Coordinator performs general routine maintenance, minor repairs and servicing operations. The Maintenance Coordinator is on-call 24/7 for emergency purposes (or must assign a designate in advance).  

 

KEY DUTIES

  • Establishes, maintains, manages and evaluates the development, delivery and performance of the maintenance programs ensuring that applicable legislative guidelines, codes and expectations are followed by ensuring familiarity with community fire safety and emergency response plans and associated procedures.
  • performing a variety of routine maintenance, servicing and repairing operations to maintain facility, equipment furnishings, fixtures and grounds in proper condition;
  • carrying out preventative maintenance programs as outlined in the annual work plan (in the TELS CMMS system)
  • performing mechanical maintenance of equipment and repairs to plumbing and electrical systems such as, repairing electrical switches, replacing tap washers, replacing belts, lubricating motors and hinges;
  • following approval of General Manager, referring problems requiring specialized work, such as electrical or plumbing to outside contractors and monitors work performed;
  • providing general assistance to contractors as required;
  • responding to all work orders (in the TELS CMMS system) promptly;
  • adhering to corporate policies and procedures related to maintenance in accordance with regulatory requirements;
  • liaising with outside service contractors and inspectors to ensure equipment and environment conform to applicable codes and regulations; and
  • Manages Maintenance Department team members to ensure proper condition of the facility is maintained
  • Fosters and maintains a strong relationship with residents by actively interacting with residents, families and guests in a professional, courteous manner; ensuring a hands-on approach by meeting with residents to assess/discuss maintenance and/or housekeeping issues; and being available and flexible to resident and family needs, as required.
  • Cooperates with other departments in such tasks as transferring residents, moving and storing supplies and moving furniture and equipment. Works in conjunction with sales team for complete suite readiness for all move in residents.
  • Adheres to established policies and procedures regarding quality assurance, safety, environment and infection control.
  • Maintains required records, reports, statistics, etc. as outlined in the annual work plan (in the TELS CMMS system), and in accordance with corporate policies, procedures and legislative requirements.
  • Maintains a well-groomed appearance and hygiene, and a clean presentable uniform in compliance with the corporate uniform policy.
  • Keeps the General Manager fully informed of all problems or unusual matters of significance and takes prompt corrective action where necessary or suggests alternative courses of action, which may be taken.
  • Performs all duties and responsibilities in a timely and effective manner in accordance with established company policies to achieve the overall objectives of the position
  • Ensures that the work environment is safe and healthy.   Ensures that own work and the work of all staff is carried out in accordance with applicable environmental, health and safety legislation, policies and procedures and all other legislation, policies and procedures relevant to the work.
  • Performs other related duties consistent with the duties outlined above as assigned.

Experience:

  • Three (3) years experience in a building operations or maintenance environment, preferably in a senior living facility
  • Previous experience on a Joint Occupational Health and Safety Committee an asset.
  • Previous experience with building automation systems an asset.
  • Previous experience with computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS) an asset.  

Knowledge, Competencies & Abilities:

  • Basic knowledge of mechanical, HVAC and electrical systems, plumbing and carpentry
  • Leadership best practices and principles
  • Legislative regulations and policies related to senior living building operations
  • Must be familiar with all applicable health and safety legislation, have knowledge of any potential or actual danger to health or safety in the work place and have knowledge of appropriate actions to be taken to ensure the health and safety of staff
  • Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
  • Ability to read and interpret manuals and drawings related to equipment and systems
  • Ability to meet the physical demands of the job (must be able to lift to 50 lbs.)
  • Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with a wide variety of people
  • Ability to provide training to key personnel on fire and emergency response procedures and critical building systems
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to treat residents with respect, dignity and care
  • Excellent computer skills with proficiency in Word, Excel, Outlook and electronic building systems
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality of resident information
  • Ability to work in a flexible environment to meet the needs of the residents, including weekend and holiday coverage, as required

 

Desirable Qualifications:

  • Building Environmental Systems (BES) diploma from a recognized college preferred

 

 

 

At Amica Senior Lifestyles we are passionate about working together in a supportive and inclusive environment that fosters innovation and turns ideas into action. We remain committed to creating workplaces that reflect the communities in which we operate.   We are actively seeking applicants from all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, Black, Indigenous, racialized people, and persons with disabilities and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for our positions.

 

Amica Senior Lifestyles recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents,  team members and visitors from COVID-19. Effective October 2021, a condition of employment  is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

 

Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

 

#Leaders-Hiring-Amica

title: Construction Manager – Senior Associate (Underground)
description:
McMillen Jacobs Canada is looking for a Construction Manager - Senior Associate to deliver world class tunnel construction projects in the Lower Mainland of BC. This is a full-time, regular (permanent) position with the Vancouver, BC, Canada office. The successful candidate will be a recognized leader in construction management for major underground projects, particularly as it applies to water, sanitary sewer, storm sewer and gas pipeline installations. We are looking for a candidate with demonstrated ability to direct and lead project teams, demonstrate a high degree of foresight and mature judgment in anticipating and solving problems and show a consistent track record of delivering projects on time and budget.

Responsibilities:

  • Act as project owner's representative in managing construction contractors, including acting as the primary point of contract with contractors, and performing contract administration duties such as payments, change orders, time extensions, claims, and certificates of completion.
  • Manage a construction management team, consisting of resident engineers, office/field engineers, cost controller, document controller, inspectors and administrative support.
  • Lead discussions, meetings, and workshops .
  • Plan, create and oversee deliverables such as schedules, specifications and budget reports.
  • Lead technical and management QA/QC reviews per client requirements and/or company policy.
  • Lead risk management efforts.
  • Manage projects with construction budgets up to $300 Million.
  • Develop business development strategies resulting in opportunities with new and existing clients.
  • Promote and represent the Company in industry forums.
  • Provide input to company strategic initiatives and objectives.
  • Promote and contribute to the MJA Construction Management Group growth and development outlined in the company's Strategic Plans.

Qualifications:

  • 20+ years heavy civil industry experience: engineering, construction or construction management.
  • Diploma in Applied Science Technology or Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering (or overseas equivalent).
  • Holds technologist or engineering professional registration/certification.
  • 15+ years specialized management experience in the construction management of large and complicated, underground infrastructure projects.
  • Specialized technical experience in design and construction of tunnels, shaft or other major underground projects.
  • General experience with environmental and reclamation construction work
  • Must have the ability to professionally speak and write in English.
  • Must have the ability to travel to project sites within the greater Vancouver, BC area

ABOUT MCMILLEN JACOBS ASSOCIATES

McMillen Jacobs Associates is an employee owned, multi-disciplined firm, with self-performing design-build capability. We are experts in underground/tunneling and water resources projects and deploy this expertise to serve the water, wastewater, transportation, dams, energy and aquaculture sectors including public, private, and regulatory clients using a wide range of delivery methods. For 75 years, we have worked closely with our clients at every stage of a project assisting them with planning, permits, designs, project management, construction, and start-up.

We want our employees to make a career doing what they love to do. We encourage an entrepreneurial spirit and help our team members forge their own path within the company. We support their efforts to stay on the cutting edge of technology while fostering a great work-life balance. In addition to working hard, we also have fun. We socialize and celebrate achievements at summer picnics, holiday parties, and company outings.

We are pleased to accept applications from underrepresented groups and encourage applications from Indigenous persons, youth, new immigrants, and persons with disabilities.

Benefits: Full Benefits Program consisting of Medical Services Plan (MSP), Registered Retirement Savings Plan, Dental, Extended Health Care Benefit, Critical Illness Insurance, Health Spending Account, Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program, Education Reimbursement Program, Stock program, 10 Paid Holidays, Paid Time Off and Wellness Reimbursement


ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

For additional company information and to apply online, please visit our website at www.mcmjac.com

No Recruiters, Please.

title: Project Manager, Construction - Toronto Blue Jays
description:
Come play a key role in building the future of Sports & Media! Everyone wants to be part of a transformational team – and that’s exactly what we’re building at Rogers Sports & Media. A team that innovates and a team that wins. At Rogers Sports & Media we are committed to creating and growing teams that are digital-first, fast-moving and bold-thinking and are focused on delivering impact with everything they do. Our impressive collection of assets includes media properties, sports teams, sports events & production, venues, e-commerce platforms and a close connection with our Connected Home and Wireless team. Collectively, we touch 30 million of Canadians every month! Are you up for the challenge and the fun?  If so, consider the following opportunity!  POSITION: Project Manager – Construction

DEPARTMENT: Project Management

title: Coordonnateur·rice national·e, Construction
description:
Référer un ami

Company Description


Chez McDonald’s, nous mettons tout en œuvre pour demeurer un modèle d’excellence, et nous recrutons pour ce faire les meilleurs candidats. Notre équipe est constituée de talents exceptionnels venus des quatre coins du monde: des spécialistes de la résolution de problème, des amoureux du risque, des innovateurs et des penseurs qui prennent leur travail au sérieux sans jamais négliger le plaisir. Nous nous mettons au défi de cultiver notre esprit et nos connaissances au quotidien. La croissance personnelle et professionnelle est au cœur de nos activités, tout comme les célébrations et les récompenses entourant les réussites.


Job Description


Titre du poste: Coordonnateur·rice national·e, Construction

Service: Développement de restaurants

Échelon du poste: Coordonnateur·rice (G1)

Relève de: Directeur de la Construction – région de l’Est

Type de poste: Temps plein, permanent

L’occasion

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un·e coordonnateur·rice au sein de l’équipe nationale de la Construction, qui se concentrera avant tout sur les restaurants de l’Ontario.

Qui vous êtes

Vous êtes une personne entreprenante et autonome qui aime prendre des initiatives. Vous pouvez gérer plusieurs projets et tenir plusieurs engagements simultanément et aimez travailler dans un environnement dynamique. Vous êtes une personne organisée, coopérative, axée sur la résolution de problèmes et passionnée par le service à la clientèle.

Ce que vous obtenez

Il s’agit d’une occasion sans pareil de vous joindre à une organisation gagnante pendant une période effervescente de changement transformationnel. Vous vous ferez connaître à tous les échelons de l’entreprise, des membres de votre équipe aux dirigeants et franchisés. Vous intégrerez une culture gagnante qui favorise un développement tous azimuts où vous influencerez de façon tangible les projets centraux.

Principales responsabilités En plus de respecter les politiques et les marches à suivre de McDonald’s, la personne choisie assumera les principales responsabilités suivantes:

Administration de la Construction

  • Coordonner la création de nouveaux emplacements dans les bases de données adéquates
  • Aider à la distribution et à l’approbation des budgets d’investissement
  • Téléverser et tenir à jour les renseignements sur les baux dans les bases de données adéquates
  • Créer et administrer des projets de construction dans MBS (McDonald’s eBusiness Suite – Oracle) Les principales responsabilités relatives aux processus sont les suivantes:
    • Créer des budgets et des bons de commande pour les projets, ce qui comprend l’envoi de demandes de prix pour les nouveaux projets
    • Surveiller et, à l’occasion, soutenir l’acquittement des reçus et des factures
    • Aider au processus d’appel d’offres pour les nouveaux projets de construction et vérifier que tous les documents requis ont été soumis par l’entrepreneur général avant le début de la construction Gérer et soutenir la création des bons de commande de l’entrepreneur général, les tirages mensuels, les ordres de modification et les retenues de garantie
    • Respecter la limite de 150jours pour tous les projets de construction
  • Entrer les nouveaux fournisseurs dans le système de comptes créditeurs et aider à la formation des nouveaux entrepreneurs généraux et fournisseurs
  • Surveiller et mettre à jour les horaires de construction dans le répertoire canadien et PCA
  • S’assurer que les dossiers du restaurant sont organisés et tenus à jour, et qu’ils contiennent les renseignements requis mentionnés sur la Liste de vérification des documents requis du dossier de construction
  • Coordonner/planifier différentes réunions

Administration générale

  • Soutien administratif au service régional de la Construction de restaurants, et soutien supplémentaire au service (réunions, calendriers, etc.)
  • Partage de fonctions administratives, comme la lecture et la distribution du courrier à l’intérieur du service et, à l’occasion, l'organisation de déplacements

Relations

  • Favoriser l’approche de développement de la région; travailler de pair avec les homologues régionaux, le Franchisage, les Finances et le Service aux franchisés
  • Maintenir les relations entre le personnel régional, les conseillers, les entrepreneurs généraux, les fournisseurs et les franchisés

Qualifications


  • De 3 à 5ans d’expérience de travail pertinente
  • Compétences éprouvées en coordination de projets et expérience en administration dans le milieu de la construction, un atout
  • Excellentes connaissances informatiques, surtout dans l’environnement Microsoft Office: Word, Excel et PowerPoint
  • Connaissance approfondie de Sharepoint, Teams et d’autres outils de collaboration en ligne
  • Solide connaissance (ou capacité à acquérir cette connaissance) d’Oracle, y compris les services du siège social, les bureaux régionaux et les restaurants, un atout
  • Aptitudes exceptionnelles à la communication écrite et verbale
  • Habileté à lire et à comprendre des documents de nature juridique
  • Aptitude de travail avec les chiffres et les données, un atout
  • Bon sens de l’organisation; excellente capacité à effectuer des tâches multiples, à établir des priorités et à travailler simultanément sur divers projets avec des échéanciers très serrés, tout en maintenant un niveau supérieur de rigueur et de minutie
  • Expérience de travail dans un environnement dynamique avec capacité à s’adapter rapidement au changement

Additional Information


McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Electrical Superintendent
description:
Job Description

Electrical Superintendent

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction, and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

  • Coordinate and monitor the Contractors’ quality, productivity, and performance.
  • Ensuring work is completed in accordance with contract scope and completed to schedule milestones.
  • Focus will be on overseeing electrical equipment install.
  • Negotiate and monitor changes to the work scope caused by design and filed changes and site conditions.
  • Collaborate with the Contracts Administrator to raise the required documentation for the quantification and approval of any changes.
  • Continuously monitor the Contractor’s safety HSSE performance and ensure that the Contractor’s scope of services is delivered in accordance with the construction schedule and the required design quality requirements.
  • Perform shop inspections to ensure quality and engineering requirements are being met during structural steel fabrication.
  • Work with field engineering to resolve issues which arise during construction.
  • Perform shop inspections to ensure quality and engineering requirements are being met during structural steel fabrication and mechanical packages.

What will you contribute?

  • Technical degree or diploma in an engineering or construction related field. An equivalent combination of training and work experience may be considered.
  • Prefer a strong background in heavy electrical work.
  • Minimum of 15+ years’ experience in installation and management of electrical systems.
  • Ability to prepare work plans and ensure they are aligned for installation operations.
  • Exceptional analytical, problem solving, planning, and organizing abilities.
  • Strong interpersonal skills combined with a positive, team-oriented attitude.
  • Excellent communication and reporting skills.
  • Ability to successfully pass pre-employment/pre-site access drug testing.
  • Ability to travel and work on site in northern BC.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (i.e.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds, and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion, or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology, and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available atsnclavalin.comor follow us onLinkedInandTwitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Project Superintendent - Road Construction
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

The objective of the Project Superintendent is to coordinate and supervise manpower, materials lay down, subcontractors and equipment in order to successfully complete the awarded projects safely, as specified, on schedule and on budget.   The position will assist the Project Manager in the overall management of assigned projects.

Responsibilities:

Health, Safety and Environment:

  • Demonstrates a commitment to a safe work environment. Understands the safety objectives of the organization and supports these efforts in a visible manner.
  • Maintains a working knowledge of safety policies and regulations to ensure duties of self and others are performed in a safe manner.
  • Administers Safety Policies and Programs to employees, subcontractors, and sub-trades including all required meetings.

Responsibilities:

  • Constant monitoring of projects to ensure safety standards are adhered to
  • In conjunction with the PM/General Superintendent, schedule all phases of the project to meet completion dates
  • Update schedules as required
  • A strong understanding of Alberta One Calls and required permits, distributing information appropriately
  • Assist foremen in coordinating daily tasks, including personnel, equipment, and materials
  • Ensure that quality meets specifications and customer expectations
  • Accurate and on-time reports, including time, production, materials, etc.
  • Attend site meetings as a representative
  • Maintain and develop strong working relationship with customers and/or representatives
  • Report deficiencies, potential issues or opportunities as soon as they appear or are foreseen
  • Maintain a daily project diary
  • Supervise, train, and act as mentor to foremen
  • Estimate and/or assist estimators with tenders
  • Understanding scope of project to track measurements for payment, change orders, and extras
  • Understanding of labour laws and collective agreements.
  • Communicate expectations clearly to all internal stakeholders on site, mentor and guide
  • Onsite liaison with customers, building respectful and sustainable relationships
  • Organizing subcontractors on site

Dimensions:

  • Number of employees: 1 - 50
  • Number of subcontractors: 1 -5
  • Total cost of projects: $1 - $20 million
Qualifications:

Education:

Certified Engineering Technologist Diploma, or related post-secondary education, equivalent hands-on experience will also be considered

 

Knowledge, Skills & Experience:

  • Road construction â€“ minimum of five yearsâ€™ field based experience preferred
  • Solid estimating experience â€“ minimum of two years preferred
  • Proven ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams
  • Ability to estimate contracts, schedule work and materials
  • Ability to read technical drawings
  • Effectively conduct meetings with owners, consultants, inspectors, suppliers, sub-contractors, and other customers to promote Lafarge products and image
  • Basic knowledge of operation of heavy equipment for road construction
  • Basic mechanical knowledge
  • Solid understanding of quality control
  • Strong supervisory skills and interpersonal skills
  • Sound knowledge of Safety Policies and Programs
  • Basic product knowledge
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
  • Experience with MS Project, Build2Win, AutoCAD and MS Office Suite is an asset

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Position Overview

This position will provide overall on-site management, administrative and technical direction on construction project site. Enforce company and project policies and ensures project is constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule. Experience with buildings construction is a requirement.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Demonstrates leadership in health, safety and environmental protection on the project.
  • Ensures project materials are supplied and work is completed in compliance with the project quality program.
  • Ensures that projects are built according to approved plans, specifications, shop drawings, and applicable building codes and that high-quality standards are maintained.
  • Develops, maintains and drives the construction schedule in conjunction with project team, ensuring project milestones and completion dates are met.
  • Issues material and services purchase orders and confirms receipt of materials and return of equipment.
  • Supervises field employees, making sure their work is planned and performed efficiently and makes sure their timesheets are accurately coded.
  • Mentors project team members in order to contribute to their development and career growth.
  • Leads project meetings with internal and external stakeholders to monitor and support the projectâ€™s ongoing progression.
  • Maintains a thorough daily report that accurately tracks site progress, events, inspections and other relevant information.

 

Key Qualifications

  • A minimum of 10 years of construction management experience with a heavy focus on buildings construction
  • Working knowledge of health, safety and environmental protection practices and procedures as they apply to common construction processes.
  • Solid understanding of current construction practices.
  • Experience in ICI is essential.
  • Ability to guide safe work practices in a high-pressure environment while maintaining project quality, schedule and budget.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with multiple project stakeholders.
  • Capable of identifying constructability issues in moderately complex situations and creating solutions in the construction plan and schedule.
  • Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities.
  • Ability to lead and evaluate trade performance is essential.
  • Advanced knowledge of various construction disciplines, safety regulations, scheduling, cost control, quality control, engineering drawings and other documents.
  • Ability to assume responsibility, interface and communicate with others a must.
  • Enthusiasm for challenge and new initiatives are prerequisites.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Sound knowledge of construction techniques, practices and fundamentals.
  • Experience with contract and subcontract management.
  • Ability to build and maintain effective relationships and work within a team environment.
  • Strong organizational and time management.
  • Maintain valid Ontario (G) driverâ€™s license.
  • Ability to travel as required.
  • Working computer proficiency with MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).

 

About Us

For more than 50 years, MP Lundy Construction has been providing exceptional service to our clients all across the Ottawa-Carleton area. We achieve project success through a combination of careful upfront planning, efficient communication, and client advocacy. We believe in empowering a team of carefully chosen individuals who thrive in a positive and close-knit company culture.

 

What We Offer

  • Important, long-term career opportunities that clearly shape the success of our organization.
  • A culture of genuine passion, drive, and team spirit.
  • Support in your growth to become the best professional version of yourself.
  • Competitive health benefits inclusive of RRSP matching program.
  • Competitive total compensation and rewards.
  • Awesome projects to work on.

 

If this job description excites you and speaks to your current development path, we would like to meet you. Please send your resume and cover letter to hr@mplundy.com using â€œSITE SUPERINTENDENTâ€ in the subject line.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those to be interviewed will be contacted.

MP Lundy Construction respects the dignity and independence of people with disabilities and provides accommodations throughout the recruitment and hiring processes.

title: Capital Construction Manager
description:
Are you looking for career opportunities within a global growing real estate company?

Then you might be our next Capital Construction Manager.

Join us and be a part of our journey.
 

job description

Akelius is seeking a Capital Construction Manager to join the construction department.

The Capital Construction Manager will manage several multi-family residential construction and renovation projects throughout the local portfolio. 

The successful candidate will be a team player that successfully collaborates with internal and external personnel.

They will be a forward thinker with the ability to share ideas and suggestions and focus on the big picture.

 

  • manage multiple residential retrofit and restoration projects throughout the cities area
  • initiate projects from the concept stage, carry out feasibilities and investigations and see them through construction completion
  • review designs, specifications, and tender packages
  • advise on budget and project costs and provide recommendations to branch managers
  • monitor on-site construction and actively enforce quality and schedule with contractors
  • provide branch managers with updates on schedule, budget, and design
  • effectively communicate to property managers and property administrators about schedule updates and potential tenant disruptions
  • review completed projects and address deficiencies in a timely manner
  • other duties as assigned

who you are

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology, Architecture, or Architectural science
  • Three-plus years of large-scale residential or commercial construction projects experience
  • clean criminal background
  • problem-solving ownership of responsibilities, able to anticipate and address issues, solutions-focused and driven
  • a team player, work as a team with internal and external personnel, forward-thinking, ability to share ideas and suggestions, focus on the big picture, and pitch-in attitude
  • time management and organization, set priorities, meet deadlines and multitask

about Akelius

Akelius acquires, upgrades, and manages residential properties.

Akelius owns 18 thousand rental apartments in the metropolitan cities of New York, Boston, Washington D.C., Montreal, Toronto, London, Paris, and Austin.

Read more at www.akelius.com.

Akelius Canada is committed to providing accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you are contacted for this position and require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please let the HR team know.

title: Construction Lead (Subway Projects)
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

IBI Group’s Toronto office is seeking an experienced Construction Lead to work on major transit/subway projects in Toronto.  Reporting to the Project Director, the Construction Lead will be responsible for leading and managing a multidisciplinary construction team in the execution of the Yonge-North Subway Extension (YNSE) project under various procurement delivery models (i.e. Alliance, CMAR, Progressive DB, etc.). The successful candidate will also be responsible for building a collaborative team to work initially to deliver the project through to commissioning of the project. This individual should be highly organized and a project driver exhibiting extremely strong project management skills with the ability to work with individuals across multiple disciplines.

Most Of The Things You’ll Work On:

  • Reporting to the Project Lead, oversee the entire construction effort between the Construction Team and CA Construction Team to ensure project is constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule
  • Collaborate with Contracting Authority and applicable Contracting Authority Consultants to understand and document Project scope and identify any risks (including gaps in scope, site readiness, and in-market schedule) and develop mitigation strategies for such identified risks
  • Plan, coordinate and/or supervise activities of all company personnel working in accordance with the overall program objectives
  • Oversee the review of  work plans, construction submissions, commissioning and operations submissions and any other submissions by the Construction Team; ensuring that the project is conducted with the highest standards of quality and integrity
  • Oversee the overall coordination between Construction and Quality Team to ensure implementation of the quality program and audits for Construction activities
  • Provide oversight on the monthly report to Contracting Authority outlining findings of any incomplete work, discrepancy or inconsistency with intended dimensions, materials or finishes, substandard performance or failures, or other noncompliance/ non-conformance
  • Review, monitor, and report on Project Co's construction schedules and activities on site; Provide opinions on the validity of the construction schedule as presented by Project Co in coordination with the Owner’s Engineer
  • Monthly reporting to the CA on general project status, milestone activities, NCRs, Risks, and any additional commentary
  • Seeks innovation and cost effectiveness during the project lifecycle.
  • Ensure all company, client, and project policies, procedures, standards, etc., are adhered to
  • Provide oversight to support Contracting Authority, if requested, in liaising with municipalities, utility companies government agencies, Indigenous communities and Early Works Contractors to assess and determine requirements that need to be incorporated into the Project and advise on potential impacts to the schedule
  • Mentor and lead team members in their development and growth
Qualifications

You’ll Need To Have:

  • Ideally a minimum 20 years experience with a University or College degree/diploma; 10 years of construction management experience
  • Must have very strong experience in transit stations (specifically subways).  Experience with other complex P3 level projects are an asset
  • Must have expert knowledge on Construction Safety Standards with ability to drive safety culture
  • Have an integrated team approach to construction; IPD experience an asset.
  • Must be a proven people and project leader with solid experience managing and developing multidisciplinary teams
  • Results-oriented with an extremely high work ethic, excellent communication, planning skills stringent quality standards, and a can-do attitude
  • Thorough knowledge of all aspects of modern construction techniques including incorporation of digital modeling and tools for efficiency in construction and for the benefit of client life cycle


Additional Information

We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car. Occupying 7 floors, with over 700 employees, it is the largest office at IBI Group. The floors are open concept and represent our collaborative approach to projects.

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada. 

We request applicants submit RESUME AND PORTFOLIO highlighting relevant work experience. Please limit PDF files to 10MB or provide a WebLink.
