We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.', 'Ideally a minimum 20 years experience with a University or College degree/diploma; 10 years of construction management experience', 'You’ll Need To Have:', 'Must be a proven people and project leader with solid experience managing and developing multidisciplinary teams', 'Provide oversight to support Contracting Authority, if requested, in liaising with municipalities, utility companies government agencies, Indigenous communities and Early Works Contractors to assess and determine requirements that need to be incorporated into the Project and advise on potential impacts to the schedule', 'Have an integrated team approach to construction; IPD experience an asset.', 'Oversee the overall coordination between Construction and Quality Team to ensure implementation of the quality program and audits for Construction activities', 'We request applicants submit\xa0RESUME AND PORTFOLIO\xa0highlighting relevant work experience.\xa0Please limit PDF files to 10MB or provide a WebLink.', 'Collaborate with Contracting Authority and applicable Contracting Authority Consultants to understand and document Project scope and identify any risks (including gaps in scope, site readiness, and in-market schedule) and develop mitigation strategies for such identified risks', 'Results-oriented with an extremely high work ethic, excellent communication, planning skills stringent quality standards, and a can-do attitude', 'Ensure all company, client, and project policies, procedures, standards, etc., are adhered to']

title: Project Manager, Wastewater Capital (Collection & Conveyance)
description:
Job Description:

Project Manager, Wastewater Capital (Collection & Conveyance)

Public Works - Water and Wastewater

Section: Wastewater Collection & Conveyance  

Regular Full Time

Salary Range: $94,424 - $118,028 per annum plus comprehensive benefits

 

Do you have project management experience within the fields of construction, wastewater collection and conveyance?
 
Are you an effective communicator with strong public relations skills? Then this may be the opportunity for you!
 
The Roleâ€¦
 
Reporting to the Manager, you will manage several Regional projects that support the design, construction, expansion and improvement of the wastewater collection and conveyance systems in the Region of Peel.
 
What you will do:
â€¢ Request and obtain all approvals, define scope of work, develop terms of reference for requests for proposals/services, prepare and issue tender documentation for procurement of goods/services including the evaluation of submissions
â€¢ Coordinate and control project budgets, negotiate and approve changes in scope and maintain the quality and schedule of the project details using project management principles
â€¢ Obtain and incorporate input from other Regional Departments and stakeholders for the design and construction of the assigned Regional capital projects
â€¢ Liaise with the public, local municipalities, provincial and regulatory agencies and all utilities
â€¢ Manage project teams consisting of staff, consultants, external vendors and other stakeholders
â€¢ Monitors performance of consultants and contractors via transparent dialogue, ensuring compliance with terms of reference, contract documents and Regional policies.
â€¢ Provide assistance and recommendations on the preparation and development of the annual Capital Budget
â€¢ Voice and discuss recommendations for the continual improvements of current practices
â€¢ Perform other duties as assigned, in accordance with the departments objectives
 
What we require:
â€¢ Successful completion of a degree in Civil Engineering, a Certified Engineering Technologist diploma or related field
â€¢ Minimum three (3) years of progressive experience in planning, design and construction of municipal infrastructure including watermain transmission and distribution systems and/or sanitary sewer or an equivalent combination of education or experience
â€¢ Thorough knowledge of design standards, related codes, regulations, safety acts, tendering/contract process and contract administration
â€¢ Strong negotiating, planning, scheduling and project management skills
â€¢ Excellent communication (verbal and written) and public relation skills
â€¢ Demonstrated financial skills to make cost estimates to control budgets and expenditure
â€¢ Preference will be given to applicants who possess a Professional Engineering Designation and are members of the Association of Professional Engineers of Ontario
â€¢ Ability to travel within the Region of Peel

 

Location: In this role you will have the ability to work remotely and attend on-site when required based on operational requirements at the 10 Peel Centre Drive, Brampton, ON worksite.    The frequency of on-site activities may vary on a weekly basis and based on operational requirements. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario.  

 

Hours of Work: 35 Hours per week; Monday -Friday. The Region of Peel offers job based flexible hours of work that allows employees to manage personal and professional responsibilities while at the same time ensures business operational needs and customer service expectations are achieved.â€¯    

Interview:Our  recruitment  process  will  be  completed  with video conference technology.  

 

If  this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.

 

As part of the Regionâ€™s ongoing commitment to health and safety, there are enhanced Covid-19 specific safety protocols and/or personal protective equipment requirements (e.g. masks, eye protection, etc.) in place to help protect health and safety. The additional requirements are determined based on the nature of the work being carried out.

 

New employees who commence employment on or after October 1, 2021 are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Being fully vaccinated is determined as the status of having received the full series of approved vaccines (both doses of a two dose vaccine series, one dose of a single dose vaccine series) and any additional doses required and approved by Health Canada and having satisfied the full post vaccination period required to ensure vaccination efficacy. The Region of Peel reserves the right to request proof of vaccination at any time. Acceptable proof includes an Ontario Ministry of Health COVID-19 vaccine receipt which you can obtain through the Provincial portal https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca/, or other government-issued vaccine passport or certification.

 

The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you are not fully vaccinated, a documented medical reason provided by a physician or registered nurse and time period for the medical reason may be accepted.

About Us:

The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region.

Our 20-year vision for Peel is â€œCommunity for Life.â€ Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.

To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore  peelregion.ca.

Additional Information:

The Region of Peel is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.

 

The Region of Peel is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request.  If you require accommodation please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. Please contact

zzg-hrtalentacquisition@peelregion.ca

.  We encourage applications from all qualified individuals; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

 

Please be advised, the Region of Peel uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario.', 'Additional Information:', 'If \xa0this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.']

title: Construction Project Manager - Capital Projects, Montreal
description:
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada
All Available Locations: Montreal

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.

What will your typical day look like?

Your role as the primary resource will be to assist the Project Director and team in contract management and coordination of the project, which includes the following:

  • Scope management;
  • Cost management;
  • Change management;
  • Schedule management;
  • Risk management;
  • Contract administration; and
  • Project reporting.

About the team

Deloitte's Capital Projects group provides a variety of consulting services to capital project owners, governmental agencies, institutions, developers, or any organization with a significant interest in the successful delivery of a capital project. Our team of experienced engineers, quantity surveyors, construction managers, architects, and auditors possesses comprehensive design and construction industry experience, and has advanced degrees in engineering, business, law, and accounting. Furthermore, through our access to the Deloitte global network of member firms, the Capital Projects group offers a broad range of integrated services in varied professional disciplines and diverse locations.

Our clients are executing large capital projects that in some cases require dedicated site- based resources to support construction management. We are looking for professionals at the Manager level to join our Capital Projects team. Candidates will be flexible and able to travel, as required. We are looking for qualified candidates in Montreal, Toronto, Calgary and Vancouver.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

The successful candidate will have:

  • 5-8 years of experience on construction projects from an engineering, construction management, or project controls perspective and understanding or experience with progress measurement, cost and schedule management, risk management, project reporting, contract administration and contractors, architectural/engineering firms, or construction owners;
  • Bachelor of Science, Bachelor of Engineering or Bachelor of Architecture;
  • Professional Engineering or PMP designation or eligibility;
  • Relevant Construction Management or Cost Certification;
  • Construction experience;
  • Consulting/Advisory experience to Owners;
  • Proficient use of MS Office software (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint);
  • Ability to thrive in a team and collaborative setting, to contribute and share ideas, to regularly seek guidance and feedback, and work to ensure the success of the team;
  • Must also be able to work independently, when required, take initiative, maintain a positive attitude and willingness to learn;
  • Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence; and
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills.

Must be eligible for Government of Canada Reliability clearance.

Prior experience in the following areas would be an asset:

  • Developing schedules and the use of related software, such as Primavera P6 or , Microsoft Project;
  • Project Management Information Systems;
  • Process mapping and the use of related software, such as Visio

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now!

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Construction, Project Manager, Engineer, Developer, Consulting, Engineering, Technology

Apply now "

title: Project Controls Manager
description:
About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts. Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23 navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

The Job

Reporting to the VP, Systems Delivery, the Project Controls Manager provides management and leadership to the scheduling and admin functions within the PMO, known as the Program Controls Group. The Program Controls Group is responsible for evolving, further developing, and managing OSI’s Project Control System. The Project Controls System monitors, controls and reports on project costs, budget, schedule, risk, and overall project performance, both actual and predicted. The Project Control System is a critical component of OSI’s Project Management strategy.
  • Implement project control procedures and key performance indicators (KPIs) suitably scalable to specific project complexity throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Manage and conclude the implementation of the Company’s PMO initiatives across all projects, ensuring all stakeholders are fully cognizant of processes, tool-sets, supporting rationale and their respective ongoing role
  • Coordinate and interface between Program Management Office and internal stakeholders to develop, set up, monitor and control project schedules and costs
  • Champion the use of and provide expert level user support to the project management IT toolsets (currently EPICOR 10 and Primavera P6)
  • Establish common Risk Management approach across all projects, preparing reports required for risk assessment and assessing impact of risk occurrence and/or mitigation
  • Maintain the current suite of standard templates and formats such as WBS, cost, risk and budget.
  • In conjunction with Region Program Directors, establish the Performance Measurement Baseline (PMB) for individual projects to enable accurate monitoring of project performance
  • Establish Change Control approach, ensuring consistent oversight, understanding and approval of changes to project PMBs
  • Specify the project control requirements to be included in subcontractor bid proposal documents in order to maintain close control of subcontractor progress, schedule and performance
  • Monitor and report on information that will allow for rapid identification of unfavorable trends or potential problems in advance to allow for timely corrective actions
  • Establish reporting criteria, content and format for weekly and monthly project status reports
  • Interface with Project Managers to prepare monthly internal reports
  • Lead and manage the development, integration, maintenance and review of project schedules
  • Provide reports and analysis to internal and external customers on an as needed basis working closely with the Data Analyst to develop and routinely produce accurate reports from the information systems.
  • Manage the activities and development of subordinate staff
  • Foster and develop a collaborative effort within the Project Team; ensuring a sound understanding by all Project Team members of the control philosophy, project control system framework and process, and the contribution, accountabilities and commitment required of each team member
  • Provide supervision, mentoring and Professional Development opportunities to direct reports
  • Support continuous improvement on all PMO processes
You Bring
  • University or college education at the bachelor or masters level in business, finance or related area and/or relevant working experience; PMI/PMP/APM/PRINCE2 qualified from accredited project management institute is desirable
  • A minimum of 8-10 years of experience in project control, cost, scheduling, budget analysis and change control within a complex system project led environment;
  • Experience and knowledge of engineering, manufacturing and installation within naval or defence domains;
  • Experienced in risk assessment, development of advanced level analysis and understanding of earned value management;
  • Highly proficient with P6 Primavera and Microsoft Office software suite; Practical problem solving ability;
  • Ability to communicate effectively, orally and in writing;
  • Ability to use sound judgment;
  • Ability to manage time and workload effectively including planning, organizing, and prioritizing with attention to detail;
  • Curious nature and willingness to dig into the details to identify trends
  • Ability to obtain and maintain security clearance
Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits:
Extended healthcare
Dental care
Group Retirement Savings Plan
Emergency Travel Assistance
Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: General Contractor Construction
description:
Do you have your own business? Do you specialize in kitchen renovations? Are you looking to work with a growing and highly reputable company?

If so, we have work for you!! Our team is always on the lookout for exceptional talent and you can manage your own division at AGM!

AGM Renovations provides quality basement, bathroom, and kitchen renovation and finishing services throughout Canada and USA. We pride ourselves in our commitment to quality products and execution and the highest ratings for customer satisfaction.

As we are rapidly growing, we are looking to extend contracts to talented kitchen general contractors in the Vancouver Region.

How it works:
We will provide you with ON-GOING weekly work!!
You get to manage your own team on your own time!
You will get access to our suppliers & AGM approved materials

Requirements:

  • 3-5 years of experience in residential kitchen renovations
  • You need to have reliable trades for electrical, plumbing, framing, and painting work
  • Good understanding of safety policies and safe work while ensuring that all safety rules are always being followed
  • Valid Drivers License / Own vehicle
  • Liability Insurance
  • WCB 

Powered by JazzHR

title: Construction Manager
description:
About the Company:

The story of the Bosa Family Companies is one of entrepreneurship, commitment and a passion for construction that began over 50 years ago. The wholly-integrated, family-run company is backed by a longstanding history of excellence in development, contracting, and asset-management, making it one of Canadaâ€™s most respected privately-owned brands. With an uncompromising commitment to quality construction and innovative design, the Bosa Family Companies â€“ through its subsidiaries, Bosa Properties and BlueSky Properties â€“ has cemented its reputation as one of the British Columbiaâ€™s top developers, and boasts an extensive portfolio of residential, commercial, industrial and mixed-use urban properties.

About the Role:

The Construction Manager role is an exciting opportunity to work on some of the highest profile projects in Vancouver on both the Development and Construction sides of the business.  Reporting directly into the VP, Construction, this role is a critical part of the Construction team that acts as the main liaison between the Development, Consultant and Construction teams.  As a part of the Development team, you will work as â€œBosaâ€™s Project Representativeâ€, liaising with the respective Development Managers and managing the Consultant and Construction Management teams.   Your overall focus in this role is to facilitate and drive consistency and accountability to achieve project schedules, budgets and key deliverables.

 

The Construction Manager's day-to-day responsibilities will include:

  • Providing leadership and fostering excellent collaboration between all internal and external stakeholders as it relates to the project, while ensuring solid delivery of the projects and exceeding end-user expectations;
  • Creating a strong and cohesive project team by assuming a leadership role and capitalizing on individual and group strengths to ensure project targets are achieved;
  • Mentoring, guiding, and coaching project team members to expand their capabilities and build depth within the local and new markets to grow partnerships;  
  • Partnering with external vendors to ensure they are accountable to the highest standards and the design and drawings are complete;
  • Partnering with the Development Manager to develop and maintain construction budget and schedule in conjunction with the local project team;
  • Proactively partnering within the team to find efficiency in design;
  • Ensuring project milestone completion dates are being met;
  • Proactively assessing, clarifying, and validating team needs on a regular basis while building team inter-relationships to better understand specific needs and identify professional development opportunities;
  • Participating in project meetings with internal and external stakeholders to monitor and support the projects ongoing progression while providing planning and solutions;
  • Fostering the culture of partnership with team members, consultants, contractor, and trades.
What you Bring:

The ideal Construction Manager candidate is experienced and possesses excellent leadership and communication skills with the ability to effectively build relationships to keep project's on schedule and within budget. As a forward-thinking, proactive leader, you have the ability to motivate and inspire the team while supporting project challenges that may come up. You also possess:

  • Excellent organizational and planning skills, as well as the ability to juggle multiple priorities and projects;
  • Superior communication, interpersonal and presentation skills, and the ability to work with senior executives and team members alike;
  • Ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders and ensure that the business outcomes are being achieved;
  • Capable of acting as a mentor and skilled arbiter in extremely complex or political situations with municipal, contracting and design partners;
  • Ability to work well with many strong personalities and lead the team to one common goal;
  • Ability to coach and develop team members through authentic discussions, constructive feedback and providing opportunities for development.

 

Our Must Haves

  • Minimum of 5+ years of related development or construction experience;  
  • Diploma in Urban Land, Architecture, Engineering Construction or related field;
  • Strong technical knowledge of modern design and construction practices, documents, drawings, schedules, technology, equipment, industry practices and contract negotiations.
  • Experience anticipating problems and challenges, and providing leadership in creating innovative solutions to achieve project organizational objectives.
  • Expertise in the areas of marketing, business development and partner relationships.
  • Possess strong market sector relationships within the commercial, industrial, institutional and residential construction marketplace.
  • Strong understanding in the area of safety within the organization and knowledge of OH&S environmental standards and regulation.  

 

Your Rewards

Our most important offering to anyone that joins the Bosa Properties team is our culture of innovation, achievement, and ownership.   We bring out the best in each other by constantly striving to be world class in all we do. These values are reflected in our Real Estate Projects, our Company, and our People.

 

At Bosa, we also offer a very competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package:

  • Medical and Dental Coverage: Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost
  • RRSP Matching:  We support your future goals by matching up to 5% of your RRSP contributions.
  • Friends and Family Program: Early and exclusive access to our newly released projects
  • BOSAconnectâ„¢: Our annual development conference that is designed and hosted by our leadership and complemented by a range of world-class speakers and workshop experts.
  • Professional Development and Education Support

 

How to Apply

Please submit an application at the link provided. We value your interest in the Bosa Family of Companies.   While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

title: Assistant Construction Manager, Expansion Project (term role)
description:
The Assistant Construction Manager will report to and support the Construction Manager with the day-to-day oversight and management of the TMEP field support resources throughout the construction execution. The Assistant Construction Manager ensures the successful execution, quality control, regulatory compliance landowner relationships, and closure of the construction scopes by the Project Charter and Project Execution Plan also responsible for environmental and safety compliance.

 

The Assistant Construction Manager interfaces with the General Construction Contractor (GCC) on a day-to-day basis to ensure Inspection, Safety and Environmental resources align with the daily planned field activities of the GCC. The Assistant Construction Manager is responsible for Daily and Weekly reporting of construction progress to the Project Manager when directed by the Construction Manager and assists the Project Manager in maintaining schedule and cost objectives through interfacing with the GCC regularly.

 

The role includes management of consultants and direct hire of Contractor resources in support of pipeline construction including, logistical planning for camps, pipe yards, construction laydowns, right-of-way access roads, and traffic management.

The Assistant Construction Manager shall support all the Owner's objectives inclusive of Safety, Environmental Compliance, and Regulatory compliance through proactive planning and maintaining positive relationships with all internal and external stakeholders.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the review drawings and technical specifications for scope compliance and constructability. 
  • Coordinate and liaison through the Regulatory/Lands Department, to ensure that copies of all governmental, regulatory, and/or permits required are in place with compliance of contractors on site. 
  • Responsible for providing construction input into cost estimates. 
  • Responsible for assuring that the construction work complies with governing codes, technical specifications, and design drawings. 
  • Provide Constructability to technical questions relating to the drawings, specifications, and design changes, obtaining assistance from the Engineering as required. 
  • Communicate and approve contractor extra scope through Engineering and Project Manager / Director.  
  • Coordination of TMEP field resources based on contractor schedules and work sequence to ensure compliance with the project schedule objectives.  
  • Support development, review, and compliance of the pipeline/facility construction execution plan. 
  • Coordination of TEMP field resources in support of construction work planning, organization, and site issues including survey, access plan, and traffic management. 
  • Strong communication and ability to work collaboratively with others. 
  • Ability to analyze and troubleshoot complex technical problems and make sound technical decisions. 
  • Responsible for interfacing with TM onsite operations 
  • Ensure approved outages are in place for tying new facilities into existing operating facilities 

 

Qualifications and Professional Experience

  • Degree, certification, diploma, license in P. Eng. or other Professional designation would be an asset
  • A minimum of 5-10 years of experience in planning and execution of complex large bore pipeline construction projects
  • Extensive knowledge of petroleum pipeline systems.
  • Experience successfully planning and executing major projects.
  • Experience working with a multi-disciplinary team of project professionals.
  • Experience with regulatory agencies.
  • Practical skills in creating and managing budgets including justification, prioritization and rationing, forecasting, and reporting. 
  • Strong communication and ability to work collaboratively with others.
  • Ability to analyze and troubleshoot complex problems and make sound decisions.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong organizational skills.
  • Ability to attend to detail and work in a time-conscious and time-effective manner.

 

Other Requirements and Information

  • Primarily a Field Based position

In the Fall of 2021, the Government of Canada expressed its expectation that all federally owned or regulated companies (including Trans Mountain) implement polices to ensure that all employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.  


In order to be considered as a candidate for a position with Trans Mountain, you must be fully vaccinated or eligible for accommodation based on a certified medical contraindication, religion, or another prohibited ground for discrimination as defined under the Canadian Human Rights Act or applicable human rights legislation.
 

We Build Careers and Pipelines That Last

Our story is about determination, resourcefulness and resilience. It’s about charting our own course, finding innovative solutions to challenging problems and doing the right thing. It was true when Trans Mountain became a company in 1951 and it’s just as true today. We welcome new members to our team that embrace the qualities in our story, that thrive on the new path and directions we take.  Our culture is one of care and taking our responsibilities seriously. If you would like to contribute to our culture, then join our journey.

 

A Rewarding Opportunity. We offer:

  • A place to share a sense of purpose and build relationships.
  • Meaningful work that makes a difference.
  • An opportunity within the Canadian energy industry.

 

In keeping with Trans Mountain’s commitment to maximize benefits for communities, priority will be given to qualified candidates from Indigenous, local and regional communities along the Trans Mountain existing, and expansion, pipeline corridor.

 

In Alberta, the existing pipeline system spans the traditional territories of Treaty 6, 7 and 8, and the Métis Nation of Alberta (Zone 4).

 

In British Columbia, the system crosses the traditional territories of numerous First Nations that are affiliated with the Secwepemc, Dakelh (Carrier), Nlaka'pamux, Syilx/Okanagan, Interior and Coast Salish, Stó:lo, as well as the Métis.

Trans Mountain also operates through 15 First Nation Reserves located within the region spanning the BC interior through Fraser Valley.

 

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Trans Mountain is committed to supporting diversity and individual differences.  The diverse viewpoints and cultural knowledge that our employees bring to work enrich our organization’s collective cultural understanding, which is reflected in the work we do every day.  Trans Mountain welcomes new team members from traditionally underrepresented groups, including women, Indigenous Peoples, members of visible minorities and persons with disabilities.

title: Construction Project Manager - Capital Projects, Montreal (Montreal, Quebec, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada 
All Available Locations: Montreal 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

 

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.

What will your typical day look like?

Your role as the primary resource will be to assist the Project Director and team in contract management and coordination of the project, which includes the followin

  • Scope management;
  • Cost management;
  • Change management;
  • Schedule management;
  • Risk management;
  • Contract administration; and
  • Project reporting.

About the team

Deloitte’s Capital Projects group provides a variety of consulting services to capital project owners, governmental agencies, institutions, developers, or any organization with a significant interest in the successful delivery of a capital project.  Our team of experienced engineers, quantity surveyors, construction managers, architects, and auditors possesses comprehensive design and construction industry experience, and has advanced degrees in engineering, business, law, and accounting.  Furthermore, through our access to the Deloitte global network of member firms, the Capital Projects group offers a broad range of integrated services in varied professional disciplines and diverse locations.

Our clients are executing large capital projects that in some cases require dedicated site- based resources to support construction management.  We are looking for professionals at the Manager level to join our Capital Projects team. Candidates will be flexible and able to travel, as required.  We are looking for qualified candidates in Montreal, Toronto, Calgary and Vancouver.

 

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

The successful candidate will have:

  • 5-8 years of experience on construction projects from an engineering, construction management, or project controls perspective and understanding or experience with progress measurement, cost and schedule management, risk management, project reporting, contract administration and contractors, architectural/engineering firms, or construction owners;
  • Bachelor of Science, Bachelor of Engineering or Bachelor of Architecture;
  • Professional Engineering or PMP designation or eligibility;
  • Relevant Construction Management or Cost Certification;
  • Construction experience;
  • Consulting/Advisory experience to Owners;
  • Proficient use of MS Office software (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint);
  • Ability to thrive in a team and collaborative setting, to contribute and share ideas, to regularly seek guidance and feedback, and work to ensure the success of the team;
  • Must also be able to work independently, when required, take initiative, maintain a positive attitude and willingness to learn;
  • Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence; and
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills.


Must be eligible for Government of Canada Reliability clearance.

Prior experience in the following areas would be an asset:

  • Developing schedules and the use of related software, such as Primavera P6 or , Microsoft Project;
  • Project Management Information Systems;
  • Process mapping and the use of related software, such as Visio

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now!
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Construction Superintendent (a.k.a. Installation Manager)
description:
Company Description:

Rite-Hite is the global leader in the manufacture and distribution of industrial loading dock and door equipment.  Our innovative products and world class sales organization ensure solid, consistent growth, both for our company and our staff.  Arbon Equipment, a Rite-Hite company, is North America's premiere distributor of dock and door equipment. To continue our growth, we have an opening for a Installation Manager in the greater Toronto, Ontario area. Our office is in Mississauga. 

Job Description:

Rite-Hite Installation Managers are responsible for managing the installation department to exceed customer expectations for installations, repairs, and maintenance, while maximizing profitability.  The installation manager hires new Install Technicians, oversees their training and development, manages the department's quality and safety, optimizes inventory levels, and motivates and manages the team. In addition, the Installation Manager manages subcontractors, works with sales to provide technical expertise, and interfaces with the administrative support team to maximize efficiency and productivity. This position will manage our service operations in an assigned region of Ontario. 

Required Experience:

Rite-Hite sells the best, and we hire the best. Successful candidates will combine a 4-year degree with a minimum of 3 years experience managing a field service operation. In addition, you must possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, be an effective multi-tasker and project manager, have a good mechanical aptitude, and be committed to a culture of safety and quality.

We Offer:

Rite-Hite is an outstanding place to start and grow your career.  We provide a competitive base salary plus a performance based incentive program and company automobile. We also offer a comprehensive benefits program (medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverage) and excellent retirement program that includes 401(k) with company match and profit sharing.

Rite-Hite is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer offering a drug free workplace for our customers and employees.

title: Directeur(trice) - Structure de bâtiment
description:
Rejoignez la grande famille Tetra Tech! Notre réputation dans l’industrie du génie-conseil repose sur notre expertise technique et l’engagement de plus de 20 000 professionnels à travers le monde, dont plus de 3 500 au Canada et 1 500 au Québec. Nous prenons à cœur l’être humain et nous sommes conscients que nos gens sont notre force. Venez exploiter votre plein potentiel avec nous!

La culture chez Tetra Tech c’est :

  • Des équipes talentueuses et conviviales;
  • Des modes de travail flexibles, adaptés à votre réalité, parce que la vie fait partie de nos plans;
  • La collaboration au quotidien dans un environnement des plus agréables;
  • Un accompagnement axé sur votre développement professionnel;
  • Un environnement humain, responsable et intègre, empreint d’inclusion et de diversité.

Ce qu’il nous manque pour faire briller l’équipe « Bâtiment », c’est un(e) directeur(trice) de services en structure se démarque par son leadership et son expertise technique.

Lieu : Bureau de Laval – Mode de travail flexible

Les défis qui vous permettront de vous surpasser

  • Prendre en charge l’équipe de structure de bâtiment et agir comme mentor et spécialiste technique;
  • Planifie, coordonne et dirige la charge de travail au sein de l’équipe;
  • Élaborer les budgets en lien avec le plan stratégique et en assurer un suivi rigoureux;
  • Agir à titre de directeur de projets dans différents mandats de la firme et en assurer le suivi technique;
  • Réviser et rédiger des rapports techniques et d’expertise;
  • Assurer la qualité et la conformité des livrables;
  • Accompagner et coacher l’équipe dans leur développement professionnel;
  • Participer activement au développement des affaires et aux offres de services;
  • Assurer les relations avec les clients, évaluer leurs besoins et participer aux rencontres.

Ce qui fait de vous la personne idéale pour ce poste

Chez Tetra Tech, nous avons une place pour vous!  Avec la grande variété de projets que nous avons, votre rôle sera adapté selon votre expertise.

  • Baccalauréat en génie civil;
  • Minimum de 15 années d'expérience en conception et gestion de projets, dans le domaine de la structure de bâtiment;
  • Détenir un minimum de 5 années d’expérience en gestion d’équipe;
  • Forte expérience en conception de structure de bâtiment;
  • Expérience en génie-conseil;
  • Excellentes aptitudes relationnelles;
  • Sens du leadership, bonne esprit d’équipe;
  • Membre en règle de l'OIQ.

Tetra Tech souscrit à un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi et invite ainsi les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées ainsi que les membres des minorités visibles ou ethniques à postuler. Veuillez noter que seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées.

title: Site C MCW Construction Manager - 16402
description:
The Senior Site C MCW Construction Manager performs formal management of contracts with medium to high complexity, so that projects and ongoing operations are delivered safely, with quality, within budget, and on time.

This is a 6-month contract position located in Fort St., John, BC. The shift schedule is 14/7 - accommodations are provided at camp and travel/expense policy will apply.

Advantages
Opportunity working for one of B.C.’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers for four years in a row.

Responsibilities
• Manage the allocation of materials, financial, human resources by using excellent technical skills in construction methodologies, estimating, and contract management in support of delivering quality projects safely, within budget, and on time.
• Ensure work site safety by prioritizing the safe execution of work by performing and giving feedback on Safe Work Observations using excellent knowledge in safety standards and regulations to improve the organization’s safety performance.
• Develop comprehensive mitigation plans by identifying, analyzing, and monitoring risks including reputational, environmental, safety, and indigenous relations for effective risk management throughout the project lifecycle.
• Contribute to stakeholder engagement by leading the public consultation process on construction activities using expert skills in communication, principled negotiation, and persuasive influencing so that projects are planned and implemented successfully.
• Respond appropriately to internal and third-party construction inquiries and escalated issues using good working knowledge of project management and the company policies and procedures to maintain positive, collaborative relationships with stakeholders and First Nations.
• Act as a subject matter expert on committees and project teams and advising on complex technical issues to develop future capability at the organization.
• Assist the project team by performing various construction support activities such as supporting the management of claims and facilitating cross-functional team collaboration to successfully complete projects.

Qualifications
• A minimum fifteen (15) years of construction management experience or equivalent.
• Bachelor’s degree in Civil, Electrical, or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent
• Good working knowledge of project management
• Excellent working knowledge of safety standards and regulations such as Occupational Safety and Health (OSH) Standards and WorkSafe Regulations
• Advanced English skills for professional environment, written and spoken

Summary
If you would like to be considered for this Senior Site C MCW Construction Manager opportunity in BC, please forward your resume via email to Dora Pang, dora.pang@randstad.ca or call 236-334-4381.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Project Manager, Land Development
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Crozier is a leading consulting engineering firm committed to growing careers and building communities by delivering multidisciplinary engineering services in private sector land development. Crozier provides services in civil, water resources, traffic/transportation, hydrogeological, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering, complemented by landscape architecture and building science. With offices in Toronto, Milton, Collingwood, and Bradford, Crozier’s growing team of professionals work collaboratively with developers, builders, planners, architects, landowners, and stakeholder groups to advance residential, industrial, commercial, institutional and recreational resort projects from concept through to construction completion.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

We are seeking a licenced Civil Engineer to join our Land Development group.

Our ideal candidate will have 5+ years progressive work experience in the private sector land development industry, with a proven ability to build relationships across disciplines and to foster good client relationships.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Collaborate with Partners and other Project Managers to identify project requirements and relay same to internal design teams.
  • Cultivate strong client relations; liaise with professional colleagues and municipal/agency staff to move projects forward.
  • Prepare project proposals, timelines, specifications and work schedules.
  • Assemble team and resources to identify deliverables and timelines, prepare and modify plans/designs, assisting clients in advancing projects toward completion.
  • Oversee the preparation of engineering designs and briefs, technical reports and submissions to support projects through various municipal and provincial approvals.
  • Review designs and deliverables for quality control.
  • Continually track and manage ongoing projects to ensure timeliness of deliverables
  • Mentor junior engineers and assist with training requirements for in-house Engineer-in-Training program.
  • Monitor and control project budgets and review/approve monthly invoices for project roster.
  • Initiate and expand relationships within the development industry by attending events and meetings aimed at identifying potential business opportunities.
  • Business development aptitude with the ability to source out and pursue new project opportunities.


WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Licenced Civil Engineer with a minimum of 5 years experience.
  • Registered as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) in Ontario.
  • Project management experience in a consulting engineering environment.
  • Demonstrated experience in project engineering and management within the land development industry, including residential, commercial and/or industrial projects.
  • In-depth working knowledge of land development principles and municipal requirements within the Province of Ontario.
  • Documented project experience in some, or preferably all, of the following areas: stormwater management, modelling & design; earthworks/servicing/road design; structural design; construction field; inspection/surveying.
  • Client focused with the ability to cultivate and nurture relationships.
  • Dynamic, resourceful team motivator with proven track record in leading teams.
  • Excellent communication and report writing skills and ability to prioritize/manage multiple project timelines.

WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyer’s Program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.

title: Construction Manager-Quebec City-Fredricton
description:
Construction Manager,Fibre

As part of the Fibre Construction team, the Construction Manager will be responsible for all physical and contractual aspects of the project related to the design and construction of the physical plant associated with fibre optic and FTTP networks. The Fibre Construction team employs a model whereby internal, or third party, fibre optic network designs are contracted out to external construction teams to build and test. As such, the Construction Project Manager must possess excellent people and communication skills to motivate and maintain effective lines of communication between all stakeholders.
This position reports to the Deployment Manager, Fibre, with various locations required in Manitoba, Ontario, Quebec, and within Atlantic Region.

What you will do (Team responsibilities):
  • Work with Fibre Planners to developpreliminary cost estimates and schedules
  • Assist in marketing effort where appropriate and as directed by management
  • Assist Project Managers to run competitive RFP processes for the selection of fibre design and construction contractors
  • Assist management in final contract negotiations and in the development of a short list of qualified contractors for future work
  • Assist in negotiations with municipalities and government departments for Municipal Access Agreements and right of way usage
  • Assist in contract negotiations with infrastructure owners (e.g. pole, duct owners) for the use of their infrastructure
  • Conduct contractor safety pre-qualifications as required
  • Gather applicable project safety documentation and certificates of insurance prior to project start
  • Ensure contract, project coding and file structure are ready prior to project start
  • Ensure contractual obligations of the project are understood and met by all parties
  • Plan and organize work to meet project schedule deadlines and financial objectives
  • Manage Request for Information, Change Order Management process and related reporting
  • Develop and implement Inspection and Test Plans (ITP)
  • Review applications for progress payment and approve invoicing in a timely manner
  • Perform field safety audits and quality inspections
  • Assist with the procurement of fibre construction materials
  • Consult with industry peers and stay abreast of new industry technologies and industrystandards

What you need to succeed (Individual competencies):
  • Engineering Degree (electrical or civil), Technologist Diploma (electrical or civil), Journeyman Certificate for Communications Electrician, or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 5 to 7 years of fibre optics construction management experience
  • In-depth knowledge of fibre optic network construction techniques, construction equipment and fibre optic network technologies for use in both outside plant and inside plant applications
  • Experience in the design and construction of FTTx networks
  • Experience managing fixed price, unit price and time and materials contracting models – understanding of advantages / disadvantages of the various models
  • Proven ability to manage relationships with construction contractors, consultants and subcontractors ensuring defined / contracted responsibilities are met
  • Demonstrated ability to implement processes and best practices which improve communication and allow teams to scale
  • Experienced in the implementation of construction standards and auditing contractors in their compliance of those standards
  • Solid understanding of OH&S requirements with demonstrated experience in the development and application of Project Specific Safety Programs (Job Hazard Assessments, Emergency Response Plans, Safe Work Practices)
  • Proven ability to break down barriers and foster collaboration across functions and teams
  • Able to maintain a high level of performance under pressure in a fast-paced changing environment
  • Excellent computer skills, particularly in the use of Google Earth software, CAD software and Microsoft products including Outlook, Word, Excel and Project
  • Willingness to travel

In alignment with the Vaccination Protocol, all new team members are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case by case basis.

title: Construction Managers - All Levels
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">**Job Summary**
 
AECOM is seeking individuals with construction experience for opportunities throughout the United States & Canada supporting various business lines: Transportation, Water, Environment, and Programs & Project Management (PPM). These positions provide the planning, design, management, and execution of activities related to installation, building, repair or maintenance of structures or roadways. We are looking for all levels of talent for the following roles:
 
* Construction Engineers
 
* Construction Managers
 
* Resident Engineers
 
* Superintendents
 
* Construction Estimators
 
* Construction Inspectors
 
**Please note that this posting is not for a specific opening; we are building a pipeline of qualified candidates for future opportunities. Positions open throughout the year and this pipeline will allow us to be more proactive in acting quickly to fill roles. If a position opens, we will use this pipeline to begin our search.**
 
At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – over 50,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
**Minimum Requirements**
 
BA/BS degree in Construction Management, engineering or other relevant discipline with at least 2 years of construction related experience or demonstrated equivalency of education and/or experience.
 
**Preferred Qualifications**
 
+ 6+ years of relevant experience in construction environment
 
+ Experience as owner’s rep
 
Additional Information
 
+ Sponsorship is not available for this position
 
**What We Offer**
 
We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
 
You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
 
We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in ership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.
 
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.
 
When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, ers, s, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – ing the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
 
**Job Category** Construction Management
 
**Business Line** PPM
 
**Business Group** Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)
 
**Country** United States of America
 
**Position Status** Full Time
 
**Requisition/Vacancy No.** 261780BR
 
**Additional Locations** CA - 35 Prospect Ave. Windsor Ontario, CA - Burnaby, BC - 3292 Production Way, CA - Calgary, AB - 48 Quarry Park Blvd, CA - Edmonton, AB - 18817 Stony Plain Rd NW, CA - Hamilton, ON - 45 Goderich Rd, CA - London, ON - 250 York St, CA - Markham, ON - 105 Commerce Valley Dr W, CA - Montreal, QC - 85, Sainte-Catherine St West, US - Albuquerque, NM - One Park Square, US - Atlanta, GA - 1 Philips Drive, US - Chicago, IL - 10510 W Zemke Rd, US - Cleveland, OH - 1127 Euclid Ave, US - Glen Allen, VA - 4840 Cox Road, US - Houston, TX - 10550 Richmond Avenue, US - Los Angeles, CA - 1800 Avenue of the Stars Suite 1425, US - Miami, FL - 1001 NW 111th Ave, US - New Orleans, LA - 1000 S. Jefferson Davis Blvd, US - New York, NY - 2 Broadway, US - Phoenix, AZ - 11 South Central Aveune, US - Seattle, WA - 1111 3rd Avenue, US - Southfield, MI - 27777 Franklin Road, US - Tampa, FL - 4201 N Dale Mabry Highway
 
**Clearance Required** No
 
**Virtual:** No
 
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</section>

title: Maintenance Coordinator
description:
Are you looking for an inviting and exciting career opportunity? Do you want to positively contribute to an organization that serves the community? If the answer is “Yes!”, this is the job for you!

Catholic Social Services is currently recruiting for one, full time (40 hours per week), IAM (Infrastructure and Asset Management) Coordinator to join our head office in Edmonton, AB.

You will be joining an established Agency that is guided by faith to care for and bring hope to people in need with humility, compassion and respect. With more than 50 years of service delivery, Catholic Social Services is one of the largest multi-function social services agencies in Canada, with more than 1800 staff, and hundreds of volunteers delivering 130+ programs throughout Central Alberta.

“As a Catholic social services agency, we are guided by faith to care for and bring hope to people in need with humility, compassion and respect.”

Job Summary:

The Infrastructure and Asset Management Coordinator is primarily responsible for providing office support to the IAM Maintenance Team and all other members of the department. Acts as the first point of contact for all incoming questions, concerns, or inquires for the departmentin addition to coordinating work with technicians and external contractors.

Job Duties:

Primary job duties and requirements include but are not limited to:

  • Be the first point of contact for any questions, concerns or suggestions for the IAM department
  • Receive and screen all inbound telephone calls, e-mails, and visitors to the Infrastructure and Asset Management office; refer and/or redirect calls, e-mails, or visitors as applicable
  • Coordinate property management and maintenance activities
  • Liaise with staff, suppliers and/or vendors regarding maintenance, purchase and general property management issues
  • Input information into the maintenance software to create and complete work orders
  • Keep the property management system updated with accurate data entry
  • Provide the guidelines document for contractors in order to maintain a safe work environment for all employees, customers, contractors and visitors to our locations
  • Maintain inventory listings for vehicles, furniture and equipment and warranty work on appliances
  • Review and prepare all documents, reports and other correspondence materials for the IAM team
  • Perform other related duties as assigned

The ideal candidate will have an organized and compassionate approach to the work, strong team work skills, and a commitment to developing positive working relationships. Other qualifications include:

  • Excellent customer service and phone skills
  • Well organized and self-motivated
  • Communicate effectively and manage time
  • Ability to receive direction and be flexible
  • Ability to manage sensitive and confidential information

Education and Qualifications:

  • Diploma in Business, Administration, Property Management or a related field
  • 3 years of related experience
  • Property management experience preferred
  • Equivalent combinations of education and experience may be considered

Please apply online at www.cssalberta.ca/careers to competition number 2734.

This requisition will remain open until a suitable candidate is found.

The wage range for this position is between $26.06 and $29.30 per hour.

We offer flexibility, a comprehensive benefits package and a supportive working environment.

We embrace diversity and offer equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless of origin, culture, ethnicity, age, ability, gender identity and people of faith or no faith.

We thank all applicants. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Position Title:SITE SUPERINTENDENT
Reports To: Division Operations Manager or Senior Superintendent
Division: Operations
Location: Head Office, Etobicoke

We are currently seeking an individual with MTO experience and knowledge in quality control and WBCMS.  This individual should also have experience with structures and highway traffic.


Job Summary

The Site Superintendent represents a critical core competence that has direct impact on the success of Fermar Paving Ltd. (“the Company”). The incumbent is responsible to ensure all work performed on site leads to the successful completion of assigned Projects (in the range $5m - $15m). All issues/decisions/actions are subject to review and/or approval by a Senior Site Superintendent or Operations Manager. Site Superintendent may also be responsible for specific tasks on larger, complex projects under the direction of a Senior Site Superintendent. Site Superintendent will act as back up to Senior Site Superintendent fulfilling all duties of this level on a temporary basis when required.

This role oversees project site work processes and is responsible for construction activities within the established design, budget and scheduling guidelines. This includes planning, scheduling, organizing, directing, and controlling activities on project sites.

The role is responsible for timely communication and proactive coordination with other managers and sub-contractors on site, and with Customers or their agents. The role is accountable for decision-making to ensure the effective planning and utilization of material and human resources on site that prevents conflicts in workflow to ensure that work is completed safely, accurately, on time, and meets Company quality standards.

Key Responsibilities

Leadership Oversight

• Accountable for planning workforce and materials needs, ensuring all assigned Projects and tasks are efficiently and profitably managed and completed.
• The role is the key contact for reviewing and resolving issues and concerns with Project performance, P&L, sub-contractors, suppliers, A/R (invoicing), and claims.
• Provides direction and/or support to Sub-contractors, Project Managers, Junior Superintendents, Project Coordinator, Field Engineers, and Foremen who may be assigned to the site.
• Ensures Company safe operating procedures are being followed for all work undertaken on site with a focus on achieving zero accidents/incidents.

Planning/Financial

• Collaborates with the Project Manager in the development of estimates, budgets and work schedules for assigned projects. This includes preparing bi-weekly schedules.
• Resolves Customer and Sub-contractor disputes as expeditiously as possible.
• Reviews P & L status and cash flow forecasts for Projects, as well as Critical Path schedule, and adjusts as appropriate.
• Keeps all stakeholders advised on status, progress, and issues related to the work site.
• Actively participates in Close Out – Stand and Deliver Meetings providing critical information and recommendations to the executive leadership team.

Operating

• Abiding and enforcing contract specifications and regulations e.g. OPSS TCBC with oversight from senior management.
• Coordinates with the Project Manager to monitor progress of work completed against schedules and budget and takes actions as appropriate to ensure work is on-time and on budget. Submits schedule updates to the Project Scheduler.
• Responsible for inspecting and approving all work on assigned site performed by Company workers and/or Subcontractors. Performance Issues are reported to Senior Site Superintendent or Operations Manager.
• Reviews and signs off on all Health Safety and Environment inspections and reports.
• In conjunction with the Project Manager, prepares Progress Certificates and ensures accuracy and timely submission of Progress billings.
• Chairs weekly meetings and Two Week Look Ahead with Contractor and Sub-contractors.
• Reviews and approves Worker daily time sheets tracking and reporting to Payroll.

Education and Experience

• Minimum College Diploma (Civil preferred) or equivalent construction industry experience.
• 3 to 5 years’ supervisor (people management) experience within the Construction Industry.
• Experience in planning, scheduling and coordinating construction work - mandatory.
• Exposure to provincial/municipal government contracts an asset.
• Experience in Health Safety and Environment responsibilities

Demonstrated Management Skills

• High level of personal stress management. Ability to retain focus while addressing challenges, and prioritize conflicting demands.
• Excellent Critical Thinking and Problem Solving skills. Able to find solutions to complex issues/challenges and mitigate risks.
• Independent. Able to make sound decisions with only occasional direction.
• Able to effectively communicate applying sound judgement in an appropriately assertive manner.
• Strong delegating and performance management skills, supported by planning, budgeting, and scheduling acumen.

Company Sponsored Training

• New Employee Orientation
• Leadership Development
• Code of Ethics and Business Conduct
• Health & Safety/Quality Policy Review
• Project Management
• Primavera and MS Project
• Construction Contract Review

Working Conditions

Travel Requirements:  Daily within GTA.
Physical Environment:  Moderate to High intensity. 20% office. 80% construction site visits. Some exposure to disagreeable conditions (inclement weather).
Physical Demand:  Moderate. Walking, sitting, lifting 5lbs or less - occasionally. Consistent computer/laptop exposure.
Mental Effort:  Moderate intensity. Occasional challenges that demand higher level impact, focus.

We are committed to enhancing workplace diversity and fostering a workplace that is representative of the resident population we serve.  We are committed to identifying and removing barriers for diverse employees in recruitment, advancement and retention.  We are an equal opportunity employer and consider applicants without regard to age, race, colour, creed or religion, ancestry, origin, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, record of offences, disability, or other protected status. We have policies and procedures to accommodate applicants and employees with a disability.
