title: Construction Superintendent
description:
Position: Superintendent:

Reporting to the Construction Manager, to plan, coordinate, and supervise a construction project in order to meet company objectives of costs, quality, time and safety

Responsibilities:

  • In Charge of all on-site construction activities
  • On a daily basis, direct field operations.
  • Responsible for the delivery of projects by adhering to schedules, budgets, safety and risk.
  • Organize, coordinate, and supervise the work of the Subcontractors
  • Effectively manage field employees by providing guidance and leadership
  • Completing a detailed review of drawings and understand project plans and specifications thoroughly
  • Develop and execute project work plans aimed at keeping projects on track and on budget.
  • Review site labour requirements and manage hourly employees
  • Maintaining accurate as build drawings.
  • Keeping a daily log of site activities on the project such as: All trades and number of personnel/trade, description of work, weather, and safety hazards or issues. 
  • Prepare timely two-week-look-ahead schedules for review by the Construction Manager and submission to the Owner/Consultant
  • Expeditious completion of project deficiencies.
  • Managing all aspects of safety on site.
  • Track and record all extra work orders.
  • Take the lead on productivity issues and monitor work performance and efficiency of employees and subcontractors to ensure project plans and schedule are followed and project is executed effectively and within budget.
  • Assure construction compliance with design requirements, schedule and budgets and assume responsibility for the commissioning of project systems.
  • Ensure that all proper authorities and consultants are performing periodic inspections as required. Arrange for all necessary inspections throughout the duration of the project.
  • Prepare for weekly/bi-weekly progress meetings held with owners/consultants
  • Review minutes of progress meetings and respond accordingly
  • Ensure the enactment of ROMAGâ€™s Safety Program to create a safe work environment throughout the jobsite and adhere to the safety and record keeping requirements.
  • Build and Maintain positive relationships with Subcontractors, Suppliers, Owner and Consultant.
  • Document and report all injuries, fill out Notice of Injury/Accident Report.
  • Reporting any challenges or issues to the Construction Manager in a timely manner.
  • Advise senior management of potential problems, work interferences or schedule difficulties while resolving issues as they occur.
  • Periodically check for deficiencies during construction and take immediate action to resolve them.

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Ten or more yearsâ€™ experience assisting or supervising construction of complex projects in the water and wastewater projects and or Heavy Civil projects
  • College Diploma / Engineering Degree
  • Ability to work under pressure and coordinate numerous activities and groups of people to achieve maximum efficiency
  • Proficient in reading, understanding and interpreting technical drawings and specifications.
  • Ability to effectively solve problem and take decisive action within the limits of authority.
  • Ability to take a proactive outlook as it relates to Health and Safety.
  • Proficient MS Office and Windows-based computer applications skills (Word, Excel, Outlook, Project, etc.)
  • Excellent communication skills both oral and written
  • Good organizational skills
  • Attention to details
  • Valid driverâ€™s license
  • Ability to exercise independent judgment and innovation and can go beyond immediate assignments and act on opportunities.
  • Ability to address and resolve conflicts and disagreements

title: Construction Superintendent, Civil & Mechanical
description:
WHY WORK AT BACKWOODS?

Backwoods Energy Services is a leading supplier of access and matting solutions, civil and forestry services, pipeline maintenance and security services in Western Canada.  We have been able to attract best-in-class management, staff, and operators from across the industry, allowing us to successfully complete some of the largest midstream and utility projects in Alberta. Moreover, we have become the largest employer of Alexis band members, the largest independent source of income in the community.

Each day, our team strives to live our mission of Driving economic opportunity by empowering Indigenous people and communities. The work we do at Backwoods is meaningful, as it helps build and grow the Alexis community. Experiencing the impact that our work has for building a sustainable future for Alexis is something we are passionate about.


Backwoods Energy Services is 100% owned by the Alexis Nakota Sioux Nation and one of the largest Indigenous owned companies in Canada.

 

OUR EMPLOYEES CAN COUNT ON US FOR

  • Competitive Wages
  • A competitive Health Benefit Package
  • Training Opportunities
  • Career Growth Opportunities
  • Recognition Programs
  • Making impacts within Indigenous Communities and People

 

THE ROLE

 

This site-based role will report into the Operations Manager, exhibiting a high attention to detail while managing various aspects of construction project activities.  This position will primarily require the coordination of resources to self-perform and execute projects in a safe, qualitative, and timely manner. Ideal candidates will have demonstrated their skill set by showing their career advancement into a Superintendent level (having had previous equipment operator and foreman experience).

 

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

  • Develop, maintain, and drive the construction schedule in conjunction with the project leaders to ensure budgets and timelines are met
  • Ensure that projects are built in accordance to approved plans, specifications and design drawings while ensuring that high quality standards are maintained
  • Coordinating of personnel and equipment resources
  • Proactively identifying, addressing, and resolving issues and problems as or before they occur
  • Identify changes to scope and liaise with the Project Manager for change order creation
  • Developing and maintaining positive relationships with clients, consultants, and sub-contractors with a focus on mutual trust and respect
  • Ordering materials and supplies; daily coordinator or work schedule and manpower
  • Ensure safety procedures and programs in place are followed

 

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

  • 5 years of â€œhands-onâ€ experience in the capacity of site superintendent or foreman.
  • Technical school diploma in construction or extensive work experience as an equivalent
  • Civil construction and/or environmental earthworks/remediation experience
  • Previous experience running all types of large earth moving equipment
  • Experience with GPS machine control, base stations & rovers an asset
  • Capable of anticipating constructability issues in complex situations and creating solutions in the construction plan and schedule
  • Well-developed people and supervisory skills
  • Possesses a demonstrable record of success on small to medium scale projects together with effective decision-making capabilities
  • Ability to mentor team members but most importantly lead by example
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills.
  • Proven ability to develop long-term relationships with clients, consultants, suppliers, and subcontractors
  • Sound business judgement with the ability to prioritize safety, quality and then profitability
  • Working knowledge of health, safety and environmental protection practices and procedures as they apply to common construction processes.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office software.
  • Ability to compile reports for internal and client review.

 

HOW TO APPLY

Please submit your cover letter and resume directly to our website: backwoodsenergy.ca/careers

We thank all applicants for their interest in this position, however only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.

 

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent(s) of this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and activities required of the position.

title: Electrical Superintendent
description:
Techmation Electric & Controls Ltd is currently seeking an experienced Electrical Superintendent for our Red Deer branch. This position requires a dynamic and experienced Journeyman Instrument Technician with previous leadership experience.

 

Techmation works on a variety of industrial oil and gas maintenance projects throughout Western Canada. As a successful applicant, you will have the opportunity to work on full-time, long-term maintenance projects with well-established and reputable clients.

Duties include (but are not limited to):

  • Assist the Project Manager in the drafting and issuance of project plans, schedules and forecasts
  • Coordinate daily manpower activities as per project plan
  • Oversee toolbox and site meetings and distribute minutes to all project team members
  • Ensures appropriate materials are ordered, received, and charged out in a timely and accurate manner
  • Prepare project reports with the required information as defined in the project scope
  • Use project scheduling and control tools to monitor projects plans, work hours, budgets and expenditures
  • Effectively and accurately communicate relevant project information to the client and project team
  • Work with the Project Management team to ensure the clients’ needs are met in a timely and cost effective manner
  • Communicate ideas for improving company processes with a positive and constructive attitude, and further develop this attitude in others
  • Keep the Project Manager and others informed about project status and issues that may impact client relations
  • Promote and monitor site safety to ensure requirements and standards are adhered to and meet TECL’s safety culture
  • Monitor, inspect and review construction execution and project quality to ensure it meets the client specifications and standards as per provincial codes and requirements

 

Requirements:

  • Journeyman Electrician certificate
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a leadership role
  • Previous electrical and supervisory experience within Industrial Oil & Gas facilities; clearly detailed in resume
  • Advanced abilities in reading and interpreting plans and specifications
  • Ability to demonstrate exceptional organizational, problem-solving, time-management and decision-making skills
  • Ability to manage a fluctuating workload and set priorities to meet deadlines
  • Proven dedication to safety
  • Strong focus on customer satisfaction
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a diverse team
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Must have valid Energy Safety Canada H2S Alive & Fall Protection, Standard First Aid (Level A or C with CPR/AED), CSTS 2020 & Driving and Journey Management Certificates

Techmation Electric & Controls is one of Canada's Best Managed Companies (Platinum Club Member) that provides a complete range of electrical and instrumentation services throughout Western Canada for the Oil & Gas industry. Our culture is built on a foundation of positive attitudes, genuinely invested people, innovative programs, and quality mentorship. At Techmation, we are committed to Quality, Safety & Service!
 
We provide an attractive compensation package that includes competitive wages, benefits, pension plan, and much more. Techmation believes in succession planning to promote employee career advancement.
 
If you are interested in a stable, long-term career growth opportunity, please submit your resume online through our company careers page at: http://www.techmationelectric.com/content/careers

title: Project Manager, Mechanical Construction
description:
Looking for your next challenge? Enjoy managing large scale multi-million dollar projects? Got a passion for mechanical engineering, enjoy managing people, and delivering projects on time? Join our team, we are on the hunt for Mechanical Project Manager!

As a Mechanical Project Manager you:

  • Establish and achieve project targets and milestones to deliver mechanical construction projects on-time and within budget.
  • Provide active promotion and leadership in Health and Safety
  • Monitor and provide status updates of work in progress, forecasts, cost control and project schedule in line with Plan Group's T.I.M.E. efficiency program.
  • Proactively identify and bring to management's attention potential problems and/or schedule delays.
  • Lead and manage project quality assurance, commissioning, and handover objectives.
  • Develop and lead value engineering, cost savings, and pricing initiatives and activities.
  • Monitor and analyze critical path activities and advise project team accordingly.
  • Review and manage short interval planning.
  • Lead pre-job planning including estimate turnover, kick off meetings, subcontractor selection, material handling strategies and opportunities for risk management and improved productivity.
  • Follow up with site supervision on labour/manpower progress; identify and reduce roadblocks to success.
  • Manage project team to ensure requirements for document control, change order process, coordination of equipment and material deliveries, site meetings and progress documentation are adhered to.
  • Identify opportunities to provide project team members with regular feedback, coaching and training.
  • Build strong relationships with clients, GCs and Engineers to positively contribute to the success of the project.

Our ideal candidate has:

  • Mechanical Engineering post-secondary education or related and a minimum of five years construction project management experience; trade experience a definite asset.
  • Experience managing mechanical commercial and institutional projects.
  • Ability to obtain Reliability and/or Secret Security Clearance to work on secured work sites is required.

title: Project Manager - ICI Construction
description:
As the Senior Project Manager you  will take ownership of projects by being responsible for the entire project delivery process and accountable for the implementation and realization of projects. As such, you will plan, organize, direct and manage all facets of construction projects and ensure pre-established costs, schedule and scope objectives are achieved.  
 
QUALIFICATIONS
  • 5+ years of experience in Project Management roles, with experience managing medium-large scale construction projects.
  • An engineering degree or technical diploma in Construction, Building, Civil or Architecture
  • Excellent budgeting and scheduling skills
  • Experience managing and supervising staff
  • Strong computer skills, advanced knowledge of MS Project
  • Ability to demonstrate a stable career history as well as a track record of successfully completed projects
  • Ability to quickly build strong relationships and resolve complex issues
  • Exceptional communication, time management and negotiating skills with ability to work as a leader, in a team environment

title: Site Superintendent - Toro
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Established in 1979, Toro Aluminum has become a leader in the development and manufacturing of window walls and doors for high-rise condominiums, office buildings and hotels, across Canada, the United States, and Mexico. 

 

JOB SUMMARY

 

The Site Superintendent will be accountable for overseeing all field operations in multiple construction projects. This role will be the driving force in ensuring our project plans are successfully completed as per design, budget, and schedule. This position will lead and coach the Site Coordinators while being responsible for safety and quality. The Site Superintendent is expected to spend a minimum of 85% of their workweek on the jobsite.

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

 

Health and Safety

  • Create and maintain a culture of Safety First, leading by example and holding our site teams and site partners accountable
  • Works with the Project Manager and Site Safety Manager to ensure implementation of Toro Aluminum’s safety program and adherence to all safety requirements
  • Work in partnership with Site Coordinators to ensure all on site safety standards are being met

 

Site Management

  • Oversee, direct, coach, train, and mentor direct and indirect reports on the Project team
  • Effectively communicates with Site teams and subcontractors to ensure that performance, productivity, quality, and safety requirements are met
  • Collaborates with the project team in finding solutions to potential problems, identifying risks, work interferences and schedule conflicts.
  • Work in partnership with clients and other site contractors to ensure all parties are aligned with the project requirements
  • Designs and implements recovery plan if required
  • Assists to create, maintain, and execute the project plan and schedule to ensure compliance with budget and quality
  • Reviews and understands the contract and subcontracts
  • Develops and maintain strong customer focused relationships with all stakeholders
  • Contributes to company initiatives
  • Other duties as required

 

 

As the Site Superintendent, you will play a key role in modelling and recognizing our core values. You will strive to demonstrate the Toro Company Values and hold our Site team accountable to behave in accordance with them every day through both words and actions.

  • Do what you say – act with integrity so our customers and project teams trust us to deliver results
  • Get it done – find solutions to ensure the job gets done right
  • Be better every day – take pride and be passionate about improving our business, safety, and quality and strive to be the best
  • Think big picture – think long-term, be strategic and have a vision. Your investment in our business, is critical to our success.
  • Build strong relationships – value our employees, suppliers, and advisors as an essential part of our business. Develop and maintain strong relationships with our customers, contractors and stakeholders.

 

 

QUALIFICATIONS

 

Education

  • Journeyman certificate or Postsecondary diploma or degree in related field
    • Architecture
    • Construction
    • Building Science
    • Engineering
    • Management (Post-secondary in Management is an asset, but not required)

 

Experience

  • 5 years of experience in field supervision preferred

 

Skills

  • Successfully supervised a construction workforce
  • In depth knowledge of and experience in construction industry and company operations, including building materials, construction specifications, methods, and procedures
  • Ability to coordinate multiple scopes of a construction project
  • Understanding of contract language
  • In depth knowledge of and application of safety, environmental principles, procedures, and legislation
  • Ability to lead and run effective site meetings with the client, consultants, own forces, and internal employees
  • Demonstrated conflict resolution skills, problem solving abilities and professional judgement
  • Ability to develop and maintain effective stakeholder relationships
  • Knowledge of virtual construction software and tools
  • Knowledge of construction drawings and specifications
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite

title: Senior Project Manager -Interior Construction
description:
SENIOR PROJECT MANAGER 
GENERAL CONTRACTOR
NATIONAL RETAIL AND COMMERCIAL CONSTRUCTION 

Our client a highly successful General Contractor is looking for Senior Project Managers to join their team.  

Responsibilities:

  • At start of project reviews, quotations and plans for completion date, budget, construction schedule and processes, staffing requirements, sub-trades 
  •  Leads, communicates continuously with the site supervisor to ensure that all construction activities are progressing according to terms-of-reference, budget and timelines (checklists, supply lists, delivery dates, etc.) 
  • Continuously ensures strict and timely management and control of all assignment expenses, billings, extras, change orders and construction costs 
  • Reviews construction documents /shop drawings for consistency with our clientâ€™s professional and quality standards 
  • Assists Estimation with the development of bid packages, communication with approved list of bidders, qualification 
  • Assign and negotiate contract to sub-contractions making sure they have the latest version of documents 
  • Responsible for maintaining cost tracking database for all new construction project 
  • Directs, coordinates and communicates changes to constructions and equipment that are required due to cost, clarification, code requirements, and also negotiate needed order changes as required 
  • Updates and manages all of the processes (checklists, supply lists, delivery dates, etc.) required to efficiently execute projects 
  • Manages project turnover from the construction phase to the finished product
  • Setup Team including orientation walk throughs of spaces and systems with all participants involved, Landlord and City approval coordination, etc. 
  •  Responsible for maintaining discretion related to all confidential/sensitive company and customer information 
  •  Performs other tasks and duties requested by Production Department Team Leader. 

Benefits:

  • Medical and dental 
  • RRSP - 10% match of what the employee contributes
  • After 6 months training period; office 3 days & home 2 days
  • Many office events & celebrations
  • Bagel Mondays & Fruit Wednesdays 
  • Great team atmosphere

 

Powered by JazzHR

title: Project Manager, Electrical
description:
Your Employer

Arrow Engineering Inc. is a division of Englobe Corp. Since 1961, Englobe has been providing consulting services and is a national leader in environmental, geotechnical, pavement and materials engineering and building science with specialized services in civil, municipal and transportation engineering.

 

With the Arrow team joining Englobe, we have expanded our service offerings but remain your easy-to-work-with multi-discipline engineering firm. We specialize in Mechanical, Electrical, and Civil Engineering across Canada.

 

Your Contribution

 

As a Project Manager, in our Electrical Engineering team, you have a shared responsibility for the performance and success of our Electrical Engineering team, and firm, respectively. This position will report directly to the Principal or Senior Project Manager, work independently, and with minimal supervision, while working in collaboration with various colleagues and external partners. The Project Manager, Electrical actively guides a professional team working on various electrical engineering projects represented by a broad range of client sectors. The work environment is of high volume, offering a range of project complexities and requires a high level of responsibility.


Your Contribution

  • Actively participates in all projects, providing guidance, client input/feedback, and general direction
  • Working with the design team on the project, develops and monitors electrical design strategies for building construction to ensure efficient and sustainable project delivery
  • Successfully develops relationships with clients, industry affiliates, engineers, technologists, technicians, and construction personnel
  • Manages client relationships and project service delivery, actively participating in the entire project life cycle, from preliminary services through project implementation, and warranty
  • Meet with clients regarding projects, progress reporting, and the resolution of issues, as required
  • Coordinates the preparation of engineering specifications and drawings, quantity and cost estimates
  • Responsible for ensuring the electrical drawings and specifications meet established project criteria and applicable standards
  • Develops standards related to our electrical engineering practice, ensuring best practices for project management and delivery
  • Utilization of industry specific software and related technologies in design and analysis
  • Preparation of reports, proposals, and tender/bid submissions, budgets, project plans, and other supporting documentation, as required
  • When necessary, involvement with a variety of agencies for project approvals and permitting
  • Estimating and scheduling of projects, procurement of materials, and update / maintenance of company-related resources

Your Profile

Education

A degree, diploma, or certification from a recognized post-secondary institution, in the area of electrical engineering (Engineering, CAD Design, Technologies, or Project Management). LEED Accreditation and experience with sustainable design initiatives is considered an asset.

 

Experience

Five to ten years of experience in consulting electrical design engineering for buildings or equivalent experience and responsibilities is required. A comprehensive working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Excel, along with AutoCAD drafting experience are required. Experience with Revit would be considered an asset.

 

Character Strengths

  • Excellent command of English grammar, spelling and composition, as well as oral communication and interpersonal skills
  • Professional, energetic and action-oriented
  • Strong organization, time management, and prioritization skills
  • Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to work individually and as a team member, within a dynamic, fast-paced, deadline driven environment
  • Effectively manages a variety of projects and/or initiatives, often occurring simultaneously
  • Able to balance work and personal requirements
  • Sense of humour
  • Enjoys working in a professional office environment, with occasional client and/or site visits, and is able to work outside of normal business hours, when necessary

title: Senior Project Manager - Utilities
description:
Overview:

BE Totally Engaged. BE Business Savvy. BE the Right Partner. Be all that and more at Colliers Project Leaders. Join our team as a Senior Project Manager, Utilities.    

 

At Colliers Project Leaders, we help our clients succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.

 

In this role, youâ€™ll join our team of experts who lead building and infrastructure projects. Through our Get it Right Solutionâ„¢, youâ€™ll ensure we get it ready, get it built and get it performing -- so investors, owners and occupants are certain of success.

 

Colliers Project Leaders is Canadaâ€™s leading building and infrastructure project advisory and delivery solution provider. We provide program and project leadership, and act as trusted advisors on capital projects. With offices across Canada, our multidisciplinary team of project management and advisory professionals offer unparalleled depth and expertise to capital projects.

 

Weâ€™d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.

 

Responsibilities:

What your role entails:

  • Advising clients in the planning, design and construction of utility services and/or the coordination of utility services relocation as a result of other construction such as roadway or bridge improvements
  • Developing Early Works strategies pertaining to utilities
  • Coordinating the implementation of utility relocations (gas, hydro, water, sanitary sewer, storm sewer, communication, cable TV, other) on municipal design projects;
  • Coordinating the development of contractual strategies to facilitate relocations including stand-alone contracts
  • Managing utility relocation risk;
  • Negotiating cost sharing agreements;
  • Coordinating the utility relocation process including design, construction, progress monitoring, inspection and contract administration;
  • Establishing and implementing the necessary agreements for utility work;
  • Directing contract procurement and related commercial terms
  • Ensuring that utility relocations are planned/executed in accordance with the project plan
  • Meeting with government and/or utility authorities to resolve scope, schedule, risk and/or budget issues;
  • Coordinating property and permitting needs;
Qualifications:

Who you are:

 

Weâ€™re looking for an experienced Senior Project Manager who is looking for the right opportunity to leverage their strong reputation in the utility sector (telecom, hydro, gas, municipal services) into a successful leadership role. You bring a wealth of experience in the coordination of utilities for linear infrastructure projects varying in scope and complexity.

 

Youâ€™re already known as a trusted advisor to your clients and have built strong, lasting relationships with senior leaders. You bring in-depth knowledge and have led and managed complex projects from start to finish â€“ on time and on budget. You also maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients, keeping them in mind for new business and sales opportunities.

 

Are you looking to build upon your reputation as a project leader in the Utility Sector to make a difference for new clients and businesses? Look no further.

 

What you bring:

 

  • A university degree or diploma in engineering, architecture, construction management or quantity surveying (or an equivalent combination of academic and practical experience) specializing in municipal services and/or roadway design, or the equivalent;
  • Registration as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario, or relevant equivalent designation, is an asset;
  • PMP certification (mandatory within first year of employment);
  • At least  15 years of experience in project coordination and  management
  • In-depth knowledge of engineering principles, methods, and practices for the design and construction of utilities and services;
  • Knowledge of the project management process including an understanding cost and schedule certainty, as well as managing risk;
  • Knowledge of the legal framework for implementing civil/utility infrastructure in the Province of Ontario, and a strong knowledge of applicable codes and legislation; and
  • Familiarity and awareness of underground locate technologies, and regional services supporting utility infrastructure redevelopment.


Bonus skills and experience:

  • Strong leadership and organizational skills with a proven ability to effectively influence others and resolve client, project and technical issues
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Proficient in MS Project, MS Word and MS Excel

 

What success looks like:

 

  • Youâ€™ve completed a number of relevant projects, varying in size and scope ideally dealing with stand-alone utility implementation or as part of municipal works relocations
  • Your clients trust you and rely on your knowledge, skills and expertise to achieve their business goals and objectives.
  • Your clients are impressed with your ability to represent their best interests regarding contractual and technical issues
  • Your project teams rely on your ability to manage change, communicate and coordinate between multiple stakeholders, resolve issues, and deliver projects on time and on budget
  • You maintain contact with existing and prospective clients and respond to business development and sales opportunities with support from the Business Development Team, Principal or Regional Vice President

BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers Project Leaders. Weâ€™d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team

 

We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization, however only short-listed candidates who most closely meet the requirements will be contacted for an interview.  

 

 

#LI-AD1

Through our Get it Right Solutionâ„¢, youâ€™ll ensure we get it ready, get it built and get it performing -- so investors, owners and occupants are certain of success.', 'Bonus skills and experience:']

title: Site Superintendent ("Builder")
description:
Location:

Ottawa, Ontario

Department:

Construction Site

Employment Type:

Full-Time

Reports to:

Senior Builder

 

Who We Are

 

Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with 40-plus years of history across the United States and Canada. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 8,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area, as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.

 

What We Offer

 

The Builder (Site Superintendent) oversees the timely construction of each home from carpentry to warranty service request signoff.  Reporting to the Senior Builder, the Builder is responsible for producing zero defect homes through effective management of trades, inspectors, suppliers and staff.  The Builder acts as the primary representative of the company on construction matters to homeowners and maintains an aesthetically appealing, safe worksite and professional and efficient work environment.

 

Responsibilities

  • Ensures complete adherence to Mattamy Construction Processes, in accordance with Policy and Procedures.
  • Accountable for managing the construction of assigned homes from carpentry to 30-day warranty service request signoff. 
  • Monitors all daily trade functions:  timeliness, quality of workmanship and completion of work.  
  • Walks all homes on a daily basis to ensure imperfections are noted, Building Code is adhered to, and Homebuyers Options and Extras are complied with.  Adheres to procedures as required by the trade Scopes of Work and Mattamy Quality Standards and takes corrective action as necessary.
  • Conducts a detailed frame check on each unit prior to drywall, in accordance with Mattamy Policy and Procedures, and follows up to ensure the timely completion of any items noted.
  • Schedules and conducts homeowner frame walk.
  • Responsible for supervising on-site construction staff, including the scheduling of subcontractors, inspectors and suppliers on the job.
  • Resolves day-to-day problems on the job site, inspecting all work during construction to ensure compliance with plans and specifications, and resolving construction problems.
  • Approves subcontractor invoice for quality and quantity before issuing Completion Slip.
  • Assists in ordering all materials required to construct houses.
  • Continuously trains and mentors staff.
  • Reinforces and educates the importance of schedule adherence (and assists where trade availability is causing difficulty), unwavering focus on Mattamy mission, and safety and quality standards.
  • Communicates and coordinates activities with other staff (Site and Head Office) to ensure smooth production operation.
  • Schedules and attends all necessary municipal inspections.  Assists Inspectors with the completion of the review, and rectifies issues as required.
  • Responsible for managing to the Production Schedule and updating it no less than weekly.  Adds comments regarding site changes and improvements as necessary and communicates to Senior Builder.
  • Ensures all work is being done in a safe manner and enforces safety standards and laws within positions scope of authority. 
  • Ensures homes are as clean and aesthetically appealing as possible while under construction.

 

What You Bring

 

  • A minimum of 4 years residential construction management experience in the new home industry.
  • Post-secondary education/community college in a related field (e.g. Construction Engineering Technology)
  • Extensive knowledge of Ontario Building Code, Occupational Health and Safety Act, and other health and safety regulations.
  • Clear understanding of contracts, plans, and specifications, as well as construction methods, materials and regulations. Includes knowledge of all trades, staff responsibilities, scheduling and scopes of work.
  • Flexible, with the ability to work at locations across the Ottawa Area.
  • Excellent Customer Service skills.
  • Strong organizational skills, including the tracking and control of costs and budgets.
  • Must be detailed and thorough.
  • Ability to train and mentor staff through advanced leadership skills with the ability to delegate as required.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills required, both oral and written.  Willing to take responsibility and be held accountable for results.
  • Skills in building relationships with a broad network of contacts, including trade partners and suppliers and a strong customer focus.
  • Proficient with MS Office software; knowledge of BuildPro or other ERP platform an asset.

 

Health & Safety
 

We are doing our part to safeguard your health and taking extra steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19. All work sites and premises will allow for required physical distancing requirements, and new routines and resources such as hand sanitizer, antiseptic wipes, masks, or other protective equipment.

 

Vaccination is the single best protection against COVID-19 for us as individuals and our communities and is vital to maintaining our commitment to health and safety. The successful applicant will be required, as a condition of employment with Mattamy, to provide Mattamy with proof that they have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine (or combination of vaccines) authorized by Health Canada, subject to accommodations required under applicable human rights legislation.

 

Why Mattamy


At Mattamy, we’re passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important aspects of the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues and communities. We offer a workplace that allows our employees to experience exciting possibilities in their career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.

When you’re part of the Mattamy family, your day to day work has an incredible impact. What we do takes teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. Based on the culture we pride ourselves on, we’ve been recognized with external awards as well. Some of our most recent recognition includes:

 

Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2021 & 2020)

Canada’s Top 100 Employers (2020 & 2019)

Greater Toronto’s Top Employers (2022, 2021, 2020 & 2019)

Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2021 & 2017)

 

 

We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

 

Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us on your application and we will work with you to meet your needs.

 

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.

title: Project Manager, Maintenance and Construction
description:
CHARGÉ DE PROJETS, MAINTENANCE ET CONTRUCTION

SOMMAIRE DU POSTE & RESPONSABILITÉS:

Relevant du chef, maintenance et construction de la Société du Vieux-Port de Montréal, vous gérez des projets de moyenne et grande envergure en maintenance et construction sur le site de la Société, tout en respectant les politique de qualité, de santé et de sécurité et les règlements environnementales. De plus, vous assurez la réalisation des travaux et veillerez au suivi et contrôle des échéanciers et des coûts, tout en garantissant une gestion rigoureuse des changements et en appliquant les mesures correctives nécessaires.

  • Planifie les projets en collaboration avec le demandeur (prise des besoins) et veille à prendre en compte tous les aspects des projets (coûts, échéanciers, qualité);
  • Effectue les études de faisabilité techniques;
  • Recommande le mode de réalisation des projets;
  • Coordonne les aspects administratifs et techniques des projets (appels d’offres, étude de soumissions, octroi de contrats) en collaboration avec le service de l’approvisionnement;
  • Administre les contrats des projets de maintenance et construction;
  • Coordonner l’équipe multidisciplinaire et les sous-traitants;
  • Établit l’échéancier et effectue le suivi de la réalisation des travaux selon les plans et devis (coût, qualité, échéancier) et produit des rapports périodiques d’avancement auprès des équipes concernés;
  • Négocie les demandes de prix supplémentaires des entrepreneurs et des consultants;
  • Prépare et préside les réunions de gestion et de coordination;
  • Apporte des solutions aux différents problèmes communiqués par divers intervenants au projet;
  • Respecte les standards, normes et procédures de la Société;
  • Veille à la conformité des systèmes aux normes de construction, de sécurité et d’environnement établies;
  • Fournit le soutien technique et assure le rôle de conseiller en matière de maintenance et construction à la Société;
  • Valide et/ou réalise les plans et devis;
  • Fait mettre à jour les plans « tel que construit », les manuels d’opération, d’entretien, de formation, etc. à la fin des travaux.

EXPÉRIENCES & CONNAISSANCES RECHERCHÉES:

  • Baccalauréat en ingénierie ou en architecture ou tout autre domaine pertinent relié à la construction
  • 5 années d’expérience en gestion de projets reliée aux bâtiments et aux infrastructures
  • Connaissances informatiques : Suite office, Autocad et Ms Project (intermédiaire)
  • Excellente connaissance de la réglementation et des codes en vigueur dans le secteur de la construction et des bâtiments
  • Connaissance de l’anglais (niveau intermédiaire)
  • Permis de conduire valide, un atout

APTITUDES RECHERCHÉES: 

  • Excellent sens de l’organisation et de la planification
  • Bonne capacité à travailler sous pression et à gérer les priorités
  • Flexibilité, polyvalence et bonne capacité d’adaptation
  • Leadership
  • Bonne capacité d’analyse
  • Bonnes habiletés relationnelles et esprit d’équipe
  • Être proactif

CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL PATICULIÈRES

  • Environnement de travail dynamique;
  • Heures flexibles;
  • Salaire compétitif;
  • 3 semaines de vacances;
  • Congés mobiles (5 jours);
  • Gamme complète d’avantages sociaux;
  • REER collectif 3.75% du salaire annuel
  • Ordinateur portable et cellulaire fourni;
  • Type d’emploi : permanent, à temps plein (37.5 hrs / semaine)

La Société adhère à un programme d’équité en matière d’emploi et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à soumettre leur candidature.

Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais nous ne communiquerons qu’avec celles sélectionnées. 

L'emploi du genre masculin a pour but d'alléger le texte et d'en faciliter la lecture.

title: Residential Construction Manager
description:
Who We Are:

As a  Best Managed Company,  we are honoured to be named one of  Londonâ€™s Best Places to Work. Sifton Properties Limited is a family owned and operated organization that has been in business for over 95 years. We have a family-based culture where we trust, understand, support and care about each other. As team members, we grow through collaboration, innovation, and open communication. At Sifton, we build outstanding communities where people live, work and play, and we live our values to the fullest.

 

The Residential Constuction Manager is responsible for the effective planning, direction and management of all residential construction projects. They will maintain an overall high level of production and quality standards, while providing excellent customer service to our clients, and consistently meeting established timelines. They will provide strong leadership to all site staff and sub-trades, working collaboratively and effectively with the New Homes Operations Manager.

 

We would love for you to join our team!

About the Role:
  • Work collaboratively with the New Homes Operations Manager to ensure the efficient flow of information out to all site staff and sub-trades.
  • Ensure construction of homes conform to approved plans/specifications and regulations of all governing bodies while meeting established schedules and budgets.
  • Maintain knowledge of all sub-trade contracts and specifications used to build the various standard types of homes offered for sale.
  • Adhere to established budget guidelines, controlling costs and establishing effective systems, processes and procedures.
  • Preparation and enforcement of effective schedules, while maintaining a high level of productivity, ensuring timely completion and delivery of the home to the customer, with minimal deficiencies.
  • Investigate all customer complaints and ensure that they are addressed in a prompt, professional manner, in the best interests of both the customer and the company working effectively with the Warranty team.
  • Hire, train, motivate and monitor performance of all construction team members and sub-trades, ensuring that systems and programs are in place and followed to motivate staff to achieve their highest possible levels of performance, efficiency and productivity. Act as a back-up resource for all direct reports. Ensure accurate timekeeping and reporting to meet payroll deadlines. Provide overall leadership to all New Homes staff in collaboration with the New Homes Operations Manager, acting as a role model and mentor.
  • Work with the New Homes Operation Manager to implement health, safety and environmental procedures on site in accordance with legislation and company policy to ensure safety of all workers and protection of public. Establish, instruct and ensure the adherence of divisionâ€™s personnel and sub-contractors to the appropriate safety rules and regulations so that chance of injury is reduced as much as possible, avoiding loss of work time and liability to the company
Experience & Qualifications:
  • 8-10 years experience in Residential home construction and direct site management in a senior role
  • Graduate of a construction management program, or equivalent experience
  • Proven ability to co-ordinate several major activities at once, with strong problem solving experience
  • Demonstrated effective planning, scheduling, cost control, as well as construction skills and knowledge
  • Thorough understanding of engineering and architecture as it pertains to residential construction
  • Solid working knowledge of the Ontario Building Code and regulatory requirements, as well as advanced building programs such as Energy Star and Net Zero
  • In-depth knowledge of relevant health and safety laws and regulations with proven success implementing and enforcing safe construction work procedures. Possess Supervisor Health and Safety Certificate.
  • Work well under pressure
  • Familiarity with computers and software programs for job costing, online collaboration, scheduling and estimating
  • Experience with Salesforce and Builder Tek is an asset
  • Effective communicator with high level customer service experience and skills
  • Strong leader and people manager
What We Can Offer You:
  • Weâ€™ll set you up for success by providing in-depth training with your team and mentors, working in partnership with our leadership team.
  • Youâ€™ll enjoy special events, celebrations, and unique perks, specific to your role and work environment, that reinforce our commitment to creating a wonderful employee experience.
  • Our unique rewards and recognition programs are designed to celebrate you, your contributions and promote your success.
  • Our Employee Assistance Program is available for your everyday need
AODA Statement:

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee  has the opportunity to  reach their potential.

 

Sifton Properties would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior E&I Manager
description:
Job Description:

The focus of this position is to meet client commitments and pursue future growth opportunities in our E&I business.â€¯ â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  

 

You will bring a minimum of 5 or more yearsâ€™ experience with  E&I Services offered include facility construction, demand and long-term industrial maintenance support, plant shutdowns and turnarounds, field construction and project management.â€¯    

 

This role is based out of  Calgary  or Strathmore, Alberta and is a permanent role local candidate are encouraged to apply  

â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  

 

What would you be doing?

  • Coach and Mentor staff promoting growth within the operational team.  
  • Lead and play an active role in the delivery of Flintâ€™s HSE policies, programs, and initiatives. Be a role model of the Flint safety culture to field supervision.  
  • Provide sales support by pursue opportunities in the assigned area for business growth and expansion through networking with potential clients and local community involvement.â€¯  
  • Participate in developing annual goals of revenue andâ€¯profitability for the District; develop short- and long-term forecasts.  
  • Manage key client relationships, providing estimating and project management support.  
  • Support and actively take part in the Strategic Account Management plan as it relates to the key customers in the assigned districts.  
  • Promote the company through personal involvement at local community and customer events, trade shows, and local business associations, etc. Develop local business plans and implement annual operational strategies in the context of the districts business strategy.  
  • Manage a team of project managers.  

â€¯  

Does this sound like you?

  • Have 5 plus yearsâ€™ experience and hold a Journeyman Electrical Trade Certification or Electrical Engineer Degree.  
  • Brings an entrepreneurial spirit and a proven record of developing and managing new business opportunities through an established network of relationships in the industrial sector.  
  • Persuasive communication and interpersonal skills.  
  • E&I trade knowledgeâ€¯incl: materials, suppliers, QAQC, estimating, code, E&I best practices and procedures.  
  • A record of accomplishment and highly effective at translating business priorities into operating realities with a proven ability to work at all levels (with customers and internally) to execute operating plans safely, within budget, with quality and schedule requirements.  

 

Perks of the jobâ€¯  

  • Competitive compensationâ€¯to include bonus.  
  • Health coverage for you and your familyâ€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  
  • The opportunity to work for a recognized leader in the energy and industrial marketsâ€¯â€¯  

 

Other important detailsâ€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  

 

This position has beenâ€¯identifiedâ€¯as a safety sensitive position and will require completion of a drug and alcohol testing.â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  

 

As a condition of employment, qualified applicants who are offered, and accept the role must complete a satisfactory pre-employment Background Check. This may consist of all or a combination of the following: Canadian Criminal Record check, an Employment Verification and/or an Education and Accreditation Verification.

 

Candidates shortlisted will require to complete theâ€¯Profile People Survey.

 

The  purpose  of the Profile People Survey  tool  is to assist ClearStream in  understanding  the behaviors of  individuals  with the  objective  of  supporting  the best use of their strengths, abilities, and potential.

â€¯â€¯  

 

Why ClearStreamâ€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  

 

We are theâ€¯clear choiceâ€¯for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of workâ€¯weâ€¯do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  

â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  

We believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other legally protected factors.

title: Site Superintendent - Revelstoke
description:
NPC Northland Builder is looking for a Site Superintendent for its major construction projects. NPC Northland Builder belongs to Northland Properties and manages its construction and design scope.

Why join us:

Northland Properties is recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, sports, and construction. We are the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, The Dallas Stars, and Northland Asset Management Company. Proud to be 100% Canadian-owned and operated, with over 150 outlets nationwide, we have home offices in Vancouver and Calgary and employ over 10,000 talented individuals across the nation.

Job Summary:

This role will report to the Project Manager. Duties include taking the lead on all on-site activities, ensuring the completion of each project on time and budget with high-quality standards. This role will build a site team and work collaboratively shoulder to shoulder with other sites, procurement, operations, construction, and design divisions.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Create daily, weekly, and monthly construction schedules that achieve the project completion timeline within labor budget parameters.
  • Supervising, coordinating, and scheduling the day-to-day activities of all crew.
  • Accomplishes construction human resource objectives by hiring, orienting, training, assigning, scheduling, coaching, counseling, and if required disciplining employees; communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, appraising job contributions; recommending compensation actions; adhering to policies and procedures.
  • Enforces best building practices with a hands-on tools approach.
  • Leads, teaches, and mentors the crew to achieve high excellence in performance and quality.
  • Manages crew and sub-contractors by locating, evaluating, selecting, monitoring, and controlling performance.
  • Meets operational standards by contributing construction information to strategic plans and reviews; implementing production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; resolving problems; identifying construction management system improvements.
  • Meets construction budget by monitoring project expenditures for weekly labor, equipment, and materials; identifying variances; implementing corrective actions.
  • Accomplishes project results by calculating resources required; establishing standards and protocols; allocating resources; scheduling and coordinating staff and sub-contractors; evaluating milestone assumptions and conclusions; resolving design problems; evaluating and implementing change orders.
  • Achieves construction quality standards by conducting daily inspections and taking corrective action as required.
  • Prevents fines and interruptions by complying with, and enforcing, codes.
  • Maintains a safe, secure, and healthy work environment by following and enforcing standards and procedures, complying with legal regulations.
  • Resolving work challenges and recommending measures to improve productivity and quality.
  • Enhances organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.

Essential Requirements:

  • 7-10 + years experience in related to large ground-up construction projects.

title: Adjoint(e) Chargé(e) de projet en construction
description:
Principales fonctions et tâches

  • Participe à la réunion de démarrage avec le client et l'estimateur;
  • Demande au client de lui fournir les plans et devis pour construction afin de transmettre aux sous-traitants;
  • Commande l'équipement de chantier (toilettes, roulotte, conteneur à rebuts, conteneur d'entreposage, etc.);
  • Fait le suivi des demandes avec info excavation;
  • Fait le suivi des documents de début de travaux: dessins d'atelier et échantillons
  • Demande et vérifie la conformité des dessins d'ateliers.
  • Fournit systématiquement une communication complète et opportune des informations sur le projet vers et depuis l'équipe de projet.
  • Fournit une communication continue par le biais de réunions d'équipe/procès-verbaux/notes de mise à jour à l'équipe de projet.
  • Communique avec les consultants, les entrepreneurs, les sous-consultants et les équipes d'autres disciplines pour assurer une communication efficace.
  • Coordonne avec le directeur de projet et/ou le chef d'équipe pour s'assurer que tous les plans, devis et calendriers des livrables des consultants sont respectés.
  • Coordonne avec le directeur de projet et/ou le chef d'équipe pour établir la structure de répartition du travail.
  • Assume des tâches de base en matière de coordination de projets.
    Coordonner le travail des ingénieurs, consultants et autres intervenants externes.
  • Fournir régulièrement des mises à jour sur la situation et consulter les directeurs de projets pour toute décision qui peut avoir une incidence sur l'intégrité du design et/ou la rentabilité du projet;
  • Assumer des tâches de base en matière de relations avec les clients et avec les fournisseurs.
  • Préparer, imprimer, expédier et classer les dessins.
  • Recherche et sélectionne des produits, matériaux, techniques et technologies.
  • Révise les dessins techniques et prépare les ordres de modifications
  • Effectue des relevés de chantiers ainsi que la mise en plan de relevé de chantiers.
  • Effectue la mise en page du projet
  • Développe et entretient des relations positives avec les consultants.
  • Tient le directeur de projet et/ou le chef d'équipe au courant du projet et des progrès sur une base régulière.
  • Contrôle et inspecte les travaux réalisés
  • Estime les coûts et les matériaux

Exigences

  • Capable de lire et interpréter les plans
  • Détenir un permis de conduire de classe 5.
  • Nécessite une compréhension des aspects techniques des projets.
  • Connaissance intermédiaire de la conception, des tendances, de la méthodologie de construction, de l'application des matériaux et de l'adéquation fabricant-fournisseur.
  • Connaissance intermédiaire des systèmes architecturaux du bâtiment.
  • Compréhension des plans de travail et des calendriers du projet.
  • Connaissance approfondie de la modélisation des informations du bâtiment (BIM) et de la livraison de projet intégrée (IDP).
  • Connaissance intermédiaire de la durabilité, de la conception intégrée et des directives LEED.
  • Capacité à respecter efficacement les délais.
  • Connaissance du code national du bâtiment;

Formation et expérience

  • DEC en Technologie de l'Architecture, en génie de la construction ou l'équivalent.
  • Exige 2 ans ou plus d'expérience dans toutes les phases de coordination d'architecture et d'ingénierie, incluant une expérience substantielle et variée en planification de projet.

Habiletés

  • Excellent leadership
  • Bon négociateur et relations interpersonnelles
  • Sens poussé de l'organisation
  • Souci du détail et rigueur
  • Approche solutions
  • Nécessite une approche collaborative, capacité à travailler en équipe.
  • Nécessite la capacité d'établir des relations avec des collaborateurs.

Logiciel

  • Asana
  • MS Excel
  • MS PowerPoint
  • MS Word
  • AutoCad
  • Autodesk REVIT
  • Procore

Avantages

  • 4 semaines de vacances
  • Horaire flexible

title: Senior Superintendent
description:
Our Client

Our client is an innovative industry leader in Environmental Services, having defined its success by delivering results where others have not, or could not. Their reputation for excellence in Environmental Remediation, Decommissioning, Reclamation, and Restoration is supported by numerous industry accreditations and accolades, and they continue to work on some of Canada's largest and most complex remediation projects. Our client provides best-in-class solutions for their clients and their approach to excellence and service delivery has earned them recognition as one of Canada's Top 500 fastest-growing companies.

The Opportunity

As a result of continued growth, we're looking for a Senior Superintendent to provide leadership in the implementation of major construction and remediation projects in Western Canada. This is a significant project that would appeal to a very seasoned and experienced Leader with major project experience in Civil, Marine, and large-scale construction. This position would report to the General Superintendent. 

Roles/Responsibilities

-Manage and support internal project teams and sub-contractors

-Oversee all on-site construction per design & budget plans

-Oversee and report on all Project Performance

-Ensure adherence to Occupational Health & Safety Act rules and regulations

-Communicate and disseminate project safety protocols to work teams & subcontractors

-Process and document contract drawings changes and specifications

-Track project scope changes and additional work requests

-Oversee project expenditure controls and procurement requisitions (purchase orders, expense claims)

-Provide team leadership to meet and exceed quality performance standards on all project milestones

-Collaborate with the HSE team and Regional Manager to establish and maintain strict H&S culture

Education/Experience

-10-15 years of related industry experience

-Experience overseeing $10M in Environmental Remediation/Marine Construction or Heavy Civil Projects

-Direct experience working with construction teams, including Construction Managers, Site Superintendents, Engineers, Clients, and Client Reps

-Experience with Major North American construction sites and projects

Who You Are

-Demonstrated leadership, ability to lead by example/build a team environment

-Strategic thinker/creative problem solver

-Exceptional organizational/time management skills

-Strong written/verbal communication skills

-Computer proficiency/familiarity with Industry Management Software

-Strong mentoring and coaching capabilities

-Collaborative Leader

-Strong achievement-orientation

-Ability to build relationships and interact with multiple clients, subcontractors, senior management, etc.


About Peeple Inc.

Peeple Inc is a Vancouver-based People Development firm specializing in Management Search and Executive Coaching and development. We're focused on helping companies build and develop world-class teams and assisting jobseekers to find incredible employers. Applicants can expect thorough communication, an in-depth evaluation of their background and abilities, complete confidentiality, and our continuing care and expertise in matching candidates to roles that provide the best fit possible.

Peeple Inc and the clients we represent are committed to an inclusive and discrimination-free workplace, as well as complete compliance with the B.C. Human Rights Code, Canadian Human Rights Act, and the Employment Equity Act.

Application and Timeline

We encourage interested applicants to apply as soon as possible as our client is keen to welcome their newest team member. Interviews will take place as resumes are submitted through the Peeple Inc website.

We're focused on helping companies build and develop world-class teams and assisting jobseekers to find incredible employers. Applicants can expect thorough communication, an in-depth evaluation of their background and abilities, complete confidentiality, and our continuing care and expertise in matching candidates to roles that provide the best fit possible.", '-Manage and support internal project teams and\xa0sub-contractors', '-Experience overseeing $10M in Environmental Remediation/Marine Construction or Heavy Civil Projects', '-Exceptional organizational/time management skills', "As a result of continued growth, we're looking for a Senior Superintendent\xa0to provide leadership in the implementation of major construction and remediation projects\xa0in Western\xa0Canada. title: Construction Site Superintendent
description:
Due to company growth we have a Great NEW Opportunity for a Site Superintendent based in and around the Lower Mainland, BC - Full Time Permanent.

Our client is rapidly growing general contractor in Burnaby, BC. There is a lot of room for you to grow/excel with the company and expand your role.

Team is specialized in Tenant Improvement work and have a highly trained and efficient workforce
Your parking and mileage will be reimbursed
Subsidized group benefits program
Opportunity to work with a company of great quality that makes people happy
The experience that can be gained in this role will leave you prepared for success in any aspect of the construction industry!

“Building Successful Relationships.”
The Construction/Renovations industry that we operate in entails working with people of various skilled worker trades such as Painters, Drywallers, Roofers, Tilers, Framers etc. Their new Site Manager will work with various trades to execute and complete awarded jobs.

Responsibilities:
  • Communicate and follow up with trades about specific projects, the project status or specific issues
  • Manage on site works including; subtrades, own-labor, material deliveries, equipment rentals/deliveries and other site related works
  • Coordinate with technicians/sub-trades to execute the designed scope of work
  • Coordinate with suppliers and vendors for materials/services required
  • Coordinating and working alongside our operations team & project managers
  • Responsible for ensuring all work on site is executed correctly and efficiently
  • Ensuring required documentation is compiled for every project including safety documents, daily reports, etc.
  • Ability to complete hands on work relating to steel stud framing, T-bar assemblies & GEB.
Ideal candidate requirements:
  • Experience/ knowledge of the Construction Industry
  • Positive “can-do” attitude
  • Ability to follow directions and take initiative when required
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills
  • Highly motivated and detail oriented. (You will be working independently for a fair amount of time.)
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to deal with changes in a positive manner
  • Proficient in English - written & spoken
  • A good understanding of office construction processes
  • Experience in Commercial Tenant improvements preferred but not necessary
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: From $33.00 per hour
Additional pay: Commission pay
Schedule: 8 hour shift

Benefits:
  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

title: Construction Superintendent
description:
Description:
Are you an experienced Site Superintendent looking to take the next step?
Agilus is recruiting for a Construction Superintendent in the Construction Industry in Burnaby, British Columbia.
Our client, a full-service construction partner with a variety of projects including ICI, civic & green buildings is looking for a Construction Superintendent. You will oversee the entire construction process on site. You are responsible for creating and monitoring project momentum, scheduling, quality control, safety & delegating work to the project team and sub-contractors. You will be an essential part of the project team and a dynamic leader who can manage people just as effectively as construction activities. The Construction Superintendent reports directly to the General Superintendent
You will:
  • Advise project team of potential problems, work interferences, and schedule difficulties, while assisting in resolving conflicts
  • Maintain solid documentation, complete daily site reports, POs, project photos and manage all required municipal and provincial inspections
  • Review the budget and the underlying estimate to understand the project, and plan ahead to avoid costly issues and project delays
  • Effectively monitor expenditures, review invoices in detail, and manage labour and material costs
  • Prepare and maintain construction schedules, and identify and solve potential scheduling problems, and advise Project Manager of any deviations or potential deviations from the overall schedule or critical path; Order materials and equipment, and request sufficient manpower throughout the project to maintain schedule and productivity
  • Promote a safe and healthy work environment for all personnel on site, monitor safety performance, and oversee the Site HSE Coordinator
  • Supervise and develop site team members through regular feedback, training, coaching and lead project meetings with internal and external parties
  • Review documents, drawings for accuracy and constructability. Review and enforce sub-contractor contracts and identify discrepancies in scopes of work

Successful candidates will have:
  • 10+ years of construction supervision experience
  • Trade background with progressive experience in General Contracting
  • Demonstrated competence in the areas of safety, people management, project execution, cost control, quality, and administration
  • Experience managing projects of $100M+

Total rewards:
  • Competitive salary, plus potential bonus & profit sharing
  • Matching RRSP
  • Extended benefits, Employee Assistance Program, life insurance, AD&D, LTD, CI
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation
  • Professional development support
  • Lunch provided once per month and occasional company-wide social events

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email rfernandes@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Directeur projets construction
description:
Tu recherches un nouveau défi? Viens contribuer à divers projets de construction et de rénovation pour tous nos ports d’attache localisés dans 28 pays.

Ta future équipe

Faire la différence, voilà comment Premier Tech se distingue. Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Assurer la gestion de l’équipe Construction, architecture et gestion immobilière pour l’ensemble des projets de construction et de rénovation
  • Diriger l’analyse des besoins des clients internes en termes de bâtiments et d’infrastructures
  • Planifier et gérer les budgets, les livrables et les échéanciers des projets de construction – particulièrement ceux du Siège mondial de Rivière-du-Loup
  • Déployer et faire évoluer le Modèle architectural de Premier Tech
  • Garantir que les différents projets soient conformes à la législation en vigueur quant à l’environnement, la sécurité civile, le code du bâtiment et autres

Compétences requises

  • Diplôme universitaire en génie ou autre discipline connexe
  • 10 ans d’expérience en gestion dans le domaine de la construction et de la gestion de projets
  • Bonne connaissance des lois et des normes canadiennes en vigueur entourant le domaine de la construction
  • Excellentes habiletés relationnelles
  • Approche axée vers les clients
  • Leadership d’action et mobilisateur
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais – tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
  • Accréditations en construction – ASP, SIMDUT, etc.

Ton futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Ces mots te parlent?

gestion de projets, construction, bâtiments, mécanique du bâtiment, leader

Envie d’en savoir plus? N’attends plus, tu es à un clic de propulser ta carrière au niveau supérieur!

Découvrez notre équipe :

Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.', 'Assurer la gestion de l’équipe Construction, architecture et gestion immobilière pour l’ensemble des projets de construction et de rénovation']

title: Project Manager, Capital Markets (Toronto, Ontario)
description:
FINCAD empowers Capital Market participants to solve derivative analytics problems with innovative simplicity. The key to our success for over 30 years is our unique combination of innovative engineering and a highly dedicated team committed to going above and beyond to help customers and partners achieve their goals. FINCAD is now the Capital Markets Group within Zafin. Products and services will continue to be offered under the FINCAD brand.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer in British Columbia for the last 11 years and a Top Canadian SME employer for the last three years in a row.

Location: This position is based in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, and it can accommodate remote work arrangement.

As a Project Manager, you will work closely with our professional services and software development teams to deliver SaaS and on-premise solutions from onboarding, throughout development to post go-live for our customers. You will be responsible for planning customer projects and monitoring overall progress, resolving issues, initiating corrective action as appropriate, referring major issues to senior stakeholders, and managing project reporting, including tracking key project KPIs.

In this position, you get to:

  • Deliver client solutions; in particular, coordinating internal and external resources and stakeholders for our enterprise customer implementations.
  • Handle day-to-day team administration, including resource management, operational management and controls (i.e. project scheduling, status reporting, timesheets, expense reporting, documentation controls), and operational reporting.
  • Track and report progress against financial targets, and handle contractual and financial dealings for client projects (i.e. expense management, project billing, revenue reporting and forecasting, contract management).
  • Ensure that all customer and internal project activities are carried out successfully in a timely and effective manner.
  • Help coordinate the delivery of relevant training tailored to our customers, partners and employees.
  • Be an active contributor to a positive, collaborative, and high performing team environment.

To be successful in this role, you should have:

  • 5+ years of project management experience in implementing technology solutions, ideally in financial institutions or financial technology (FinTech) sector.
  • A proven technical background in project management, business analysis.
  • A strong understanding of systems implementation and software development life cycle.
  • A customer first mindset, with strong communication and customer interaction skills.
  • Demonstrable experience in influencing, leading, and building relationships at all levels both internally and externally.
  • Related university degree (i.e. Computer Science, Finance, Business, Management Information Systems, etc).
  • Experience with project management best practices and excellent organizational skills with a keen interest in continuous process improvement.
  • Ability to travel up to 15% of the time.

It would be great if you also have:

  • Project Management certifications (i.e. Prince2, PMP, CAPM).
  • JIRA knowledge.
  • Knowledge of concepts or experience in Quantitative Finance.

Why choose FINCAD as your preferred employer?

At FINCAD you get to solve interesting problems in an intellectually challenging environment and work alongside very smart and hard-working people to build something that matters. The learning is continuous and in addition to competitive rewards, a flexible work environment, we offer a generous vacation policy.

We have transitioned to a flexible working approach and this role is expected to be remote, ideally in either the US or Canada. A willingness to work flexible hours given global collaboration across the Pacific, Eastern and European time zones is essential.

In addition to competitive salary and a great place to work, we offer:

Flexibility: At FINCAD, it's about getting the job done. You have flexibility when it comes to where and when you work.

Supportive Environment: We get that our team members have lives outside of work. We are understanding and supporting them in any way we can.

Professional Development: We offer a development-focused working environment that provides continual opportunities to learn and hone your skills.

Community Involvement: Working at FINCAD means you will be able to give back to your local and global communities with our organized volunteer efforts. And we welcome you taking initiative on where we can get involved more.

Time to Recharge: Our people work hard. And we realize it's important for them to have time to relax and recharge. That's why we offer a minimum of four weeks vacation to all employees.

Wellness Plans: We provide competitive health, dental and retirement plans in each of the countries we operate.
