title: Project Manager, Construction Services
description:
Location



Brookfield Place - 181 Bay Street



Business




Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.




If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.




Job Description




Responsible for providing project/construction management services, as well as administering and supervising Tenant and Landlord improvement activities for Brookfield Properties.




RESPONSIBILITIES:



+ Coordination of Landlord/Tenant Work:


+ Responsible for working with Tenants, their designers and contractors, reviewing Tenants’ drawing submissions to ensure that proposed design and construction meets Brookfield guidelines and standards.


+ Recommend changes to drawings and specifications for compliance with Brookfield standards and ease of construction through a review letter.


+ Monitoring Tenant’s construction projects to ensure that procedures, materials, and equipment comply with approved plans, specifications, and samples, building standards and quality.


+ Maintain, revise, and update Construction Manuals as a result of code changes or company standard changes; ensure that required start up documents are received and filed.


+ Co-ordinate with tenants, their consultants and contractors during construction to assist in resolving building issues, site problems, and to assist in maintaining project schedule.


+ Manage documentation and process release of Tenant allowances.




+ Capital/Landlord Work:


+ Prepare budget estimates and schedules for Landlord Work and capital expenditures.


+ Recommend selection of consultants and contractors for Landlord Work.


+ Prepare and review tender documents, contracts, purchase orders through Construction Manager/Yardi.


+ Notify building operations and security of pending construction.


+ Manage site meetings and project inspections.


+ Review documentation during construction progress to include shop drawings, schedules, site instructions, change orders, and other events affecting the project; ensure that required closeout documents are received and filed, and that all permits are closed.


+ Monitor deficiency lists; review projects at end of warranty period for defects and non-compliance items.


+ Advise management of up-to-date construction management concepts and practices.




+ Support to Other Departments:


+ Co-ordinate and support the Leasing (office and retail) and Legal Departments, as well as the Property Management offices.


+ Assist Leasing (office & retail) and Legal Departments in finalizing lease documents related to construction work and issues; assist Leasing (office and retail) in leasing, sub-dividing, demolition, make good, and modifications to vacant premises.


+ Assist Property Management in building modifications, capital projects, finishes selection, and research.




+ Billing & Administration:


+ Approve invoices and tenant allowances; review and recommend approval of payments to contractors, suppliers, etc. for quantities of materials received or used and work completed during specific periods.


+ Develop, recommend, and maintain accurate and current project budgets.






+ Embody and support Brookfield Properties’ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.





QUALIFICATIONS


SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS:



+ Strong verbal and written English language communication skills, interpersonal and problem-solving skills.


+ Solid negotiation, problem solving and interpersonal skills.


+ Excellent multi-tasking, detail orientation and organizational skills





EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:



+ 10 years’ related experience in retail, office and base building construction and renovations.


+ Previous management experience including motivating, mentoring/developing team members.


+ Ability to read, interpret and understand drawings and specifications.


+ Experience with negotiations and with budgeting is a definite asset.


+ Basic Accounting knowledge and working within an accounting system.


+ Computer Software knowledge of MS Office 2010, Outlook, Auto-View, Microsoft Project and Accounting/Construction Management software program.


+ Experience with Project close out procedures and maintaining project documentation and files.





EDUCATION/DESIGNATIONS/LICENSES:



+ University Education; P.Eng., preferred.


+ Strong knowledge of building codes, contract law, construction material, and design concepts


+ Knowledge of construction, contract practices and project close out procedures.


+ Knowledge of local municipality requirements and regulations.






We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will accommodate the needs of all qualified applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: Leader Finance Construction & Mise en Service
description:
Job Description Summary

As the Finance Leader for Construction and Commissioning, you will be joining a fast-paced and growing team within GE Renewables Hydro North America business. In this role, you will be a business partner to an experienced team of project managers and commissioning specialists who oversee GE Hydro’s on-site operations and work alongside GE Hydro’s global C&C finance team. You will work at the intersection of finance and operations to support Hydro in achieving their annual goals and objectives.


Job Description


In this role, your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):


FP&A


+ Provide input to and prepare C&C’s annual costing rates to liquidate expenses from cost centers to projects.

+ Explain variances to pacing in actuals and forecast as part of GE Hydro’s monthly business review.

+ Develop and implement tools and processes to enable C&C to deliver precise project margin reviews.

+ Support operations in capital expenditure assessment, compliance, and ROI calculations.


Controllership


+ Support and conduct data aggregation for financial compliance audits.

+ Ensure proper cost allocation during period close activities, posting journal entries as required


Operational


+ Build financial acumen across C&C’s operational team to link their actions to the financial statements.

+ Act as primary finance point of contact regarding C&C’s cost and cash-out forecasting.

+ Support adhoc requests and process improvements as they arise between C&C, Finance, and global HQ (i.e. KPIs, Hoshin Kanri, continuous improvement)


Do you qualify? We are seeking…


Skills:


+ Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in finance, accounting or management

+ Individuals with 4+ years of experience in financial, accounting, and/or operational roles

+ Minimum of two years in financial role(s) to have a strong understanding of accounting fundamentals and financial statements

+ Minimum of one year working in or closely with operations (manufacturing, construction, engineering)

+ Individuals who are analytical, self-starters, and require little supervision to meet deadlines

+ Fluent in English, French a strong asset

+ Strong knowledge of MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)


Desired:


+ Experience working with Tableau, SAP PowerMax, and/or Smartsheets considered an asset

+ CPA or working towards designation considered an asset

+ Individuals who have worked in a matrix organization

+ Experience working in a large international organization


Additional Information


Relocation Assistance Provided: No

title: Gérant(e) de projets, Construction - Projet Molson
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Travailler chez MONTONI, c’est faire partie d’une équipe qui valorise l’innovation, la collaboration et la responsabilité sociale. Notre équipe est toujours à la recherche de talents dans l’industrie pour nous appuyer dans notre mission de réinventer l’immobilier et la construction. Si vous êtes passionnés, curieux et que vous recherchez un environnement de travail collaboratif axé sur l’innovation, MONTONI est fait pour vous! Joignez-vous à notre équipe dès maintenant! 

Description du poste

Travailler sur le projet de redéveloppement du site de la brasserie Molson, c’est participer à la revitalisation urbaine d’un site unique en plein cœur de Montréal. Le projet à usage mixte de près de 6 M de pieds carrés vise la création d’un milieu de vie complet de qualité, qui mettra en valeur le patrimoine et la riche histoire du quartier, en favorisant le retissage de la trame urbaine, la création d’ouverture visuelle sur le fleuve Saint-Laurent et la création de nouveaux parcs pour les Montréalais.  

Poste à temps plein et permanent

Le gérant de projets planifie, organise, dirige et contrôle l’ensemble des activités liées aux projets. Il est responsable de concrétiser leur construction en respectant les délais, le budget alloués et les standards de qualité MONTONI. Il est responsable d’émettre ses recommandations dans son champ d’expertise et est amené à effectuer différents mandats reliés à son emploi ou requis par son supérieur immédiat.

RESPONSABILITÉS :

  • Valider les devis de construction en collaboration avec les différentes équipes.
  • Coordonner et maintenir un bon suivi des tâches de chantier avec le surintendant.
  • Élaborer des plans de planification détaillée, y compris le calendrier des activités et les budgets requis en collaboration avec l’équipe d’estimation.
  • Effectuer l’analyse des risques, recommander et mettre en place des plans de contingence afin de s’assurer de la réussite du projet.
  • Réviser les calendriers de projets de construction, l’ordonnancement et le cheminement critique des projets.
  • Agir comme référence, fixer l’orientation, donner l’information et apporter le soutien à tous les gestionnaires de services au besoin (développement, estimation, excavation, aspect légal, design, urbanisme et finances).
  • Superviser les litiges et les négociations avec les sous-traitants afin de respecter un délai normal et adéquat de la gestion administrative des projets au besoin, et à la demande de la direction.
  • Mettre de l’avant et faire respecter les procédures en matière de sécurité des travailleurs sur les chantiers (EPI).
Qualifications

  • Minimalement 5 ans d’expérience pertinente en gestion de projets chez un entrepreneur général
  • BAC en ingénierie
  • Excellente connaissance de MS Project
  • Connaissance des logiciels Procore et AutoCAD
  • Membre de l’Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec, un atout
  • Certification PMP-PMI, un atout
  • Expérience en centres de données, un atout
  • Bilinguisme (français/anglais), un atout


Informations complémentaires

Travailler chez MONTONI, c’est avoir accès à :

  • Une rémunération équitable et avantageuse
  • Une contribution REER de l'employeur en collaboration avec l’employé
  • Des assurances collectives généreuses incluant une couverture médicale et dentaire
  • Des activités sociales multiples et une vie au travail animée
  • Une flexibilité d'horaire et politique de télétravail
  • Un comité bien-être en place, un accès à un gym et à des activités sportives
  • Des services au bureau (collations, changement de pneus, nettoyeur)
  • Des billets de hockey et de spectacles à gagner chaque mois

Ce poste vous intéresse, faites-nous parvenir votre curriculum vitae sans tarder.

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt, cependant seules les personnes retenues pour une entrevue seront convoquées.

Le masculin n’est utilisé que pour alléger le texte.

title: Project Manager, Hazardous Materials
description:
Your Employer

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and it’s more than 2,600 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

 

As a Project Manager, Hazardous Materials, you will work in collaboration with the Hygiene Health and Safety Team.


Your Contribution

  • Apply and promote Englobe’s health and safety rules.
  • Coordinating projects in one or more of the following areas.
  • Designated Substances/Hazardous Materials Surveys.
  • Indoor Air Quality Assessments.
  • Hazardous Materials Tendering and Abatement Supervision.
  • Coordinating projects in other areas of Environmental Consulting, as required.
  • Generating and providing technical reviews of deliverable documentation such as technical reports, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Managing and/or generating deliverable documentation of various projects including technical documents.
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures and work plans.
  • Interacting, coordinating, and scheduling projects with clients, as directed by the Team Lead or Director.
  • Participating in project management meetings, office meetings, health, and safety inspections.
  • Maintaining a commitment to exceeding client expectations by consistently delivering high quality of work.
  • Consistently maintaining professionalism and objectivity while working with colleagues and clients who require varying degrees of support.
  • Handling difficult situations with tact and diplomacy to maintain positive working relationships with all internal and external contacts.
  • Conducting project administration tasks as required, including timesheet generation, project finance management and project invoicing.

Your Profile

  • Undergraduate degree and/or applicable (science/engineering) diploma required.
  • Minimum 3-5 years experience in a consulting environment.
  • Experience providing reviews to proposals, specifications, case studies, technical and non-technical reports required.
  • Solid understanding of provincial and federal regulatory requirements acquired through experience and education.
  • Possession of valid driver’s license required.
  • Possession of or eligibility to obtain secret security clearance required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Gérant de projets - Construction
description:
Engage-toi auprès d’une jeune équipe d’entrepreneurs passionnée et visionnaire!

Propulse ta carrière et deviens autonome avec les conseils des pros! Développe tes talents en estimation et en charge de projets de construction.  

Tu profiteras de l’expertise, l’influence et la volonté de patrons et de partenaires dévoués. Tu prendras rapidement ton envol comme gestionnaire de projets en gérant la sous-traitance, les suivis des chantiers, l’estimation, les négociations de contrats, les analyses de prix et plus encore!

Ce qu’on t’offre :

  • Une entreprise familiale, performante et généreuse de ses conseils;
  • Une latitude décisionnelle et une participation accrue à plusieurs projets;
  • Un salaire concurrentiel;
  • Un horaire de travail flexible;
  • Une proposition variée d’activités sociales;
  • L’accès à un centre de conditionnement physique;

Une organisation en pleine expansion et axée sur des projets de construction d’envergure et une carrière à la hauteur de tes attentes!

Plus précisément, en tant que gestionnaire de projets, ton rôle sera de :

  • Estimer les coûts de main-d’œuvre et de matériaux;
  • Assurer une saine gestion de la sous-traitance;
  • Coordonner et diriger les projets de construction en collaboration avec le directeur de projets;
  • Rencontrer les clients afin d’analyser leurs besoins;
  • Identifier des pistes d’économies et de solutions;
  • Veiller à la négociation des contrats;
  • Entretenir des relations de confiance avec les clients et collaborer dans la réalisation des projets de construction;
  • Préparer, surveiller et mettre à jour les calendriers de travaux;

Préparer des documents contractuels et évaluer des soumissions concernant des projets de construction.

Ton profil :

  • Baccalauréat en génie de la construction, civil, mécanique ou autre;
  • Cumuler une expérience pertinente en gestion de projets;
  • CPI ou membre OIQ;
  • Être passionné de projets de construction et ouvert aux changements;
  • Curieux, travaillant, collaborateur et axé résultats;
  • Engagé à faire une différence auprès d’une famille d’entrepreneurs humains et performants!

Qu’attends-tu pour démarrer ta carrière en gestion de projets de construction?

Pour plus d’informations, communique avec Stéphanie Roy

Au (418) 688-0880 poste 224, ou par

* Le genre masculin est utilisé comme générique, dans le seul but de ne pas alourdir le texte.

title: Senior Construction Quality Control Manager
description:
At Fluor, we are proud to design and build projects and careers. This requires teams that are as unique as the projects we execute. We are committed to fostering a work environment that embraces Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I) for all so our employees and stakeholders benefit from the creative solutions derived as a result of embracing differences.



Job Description:

Considering a change? Challenge yourself with Fluor!


Fluor is one of Canada's top employers and recognized globally as a leader in the Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Fabrication, and Maintenance industry. Our focus on innovation and providing cost effective technology based solutions to address our client's needs is second to none. As we look to the future, we need creative, ambitious, and innovative professionals who can help us achieve our goals.


Fluor team members are at the core of Fluor’s successes and instrumental in executing projects safely, smartly and with the highest quality. If you value teamwork, empowerment in your career and are eager to champion Fluor’s project execution, this opportunity just may be for you!


This position will be assigned to the Gordie Howe International Bridge Project in Windsor, Ontario and serve as the Quality Manager for the Project Co. The Gordie Howe International Bridge Project is a public-private partnership established to design, build, operate and maintain the Gordie Howe International Bridge between Detroit, Michigan and Windsor, Ontario. The scope of the Project includes the following components:

• A cable-stayed bridge spanning the Detroit River

• New U.S. and Canadian Point of Entries

• New interchange at Interstate 75 in Detroit


This role serves as the primary representative for the Project on all matters relating to quality management with the overall objective of providing our clients and with projects that comply with the quality requirements stipulated in our Contracts. The Quality Manager shall report directly to the Project Director to ensure the quality of Project Work. The Project Quality Manager is responsible for ensuring that any matters relating to quality control that could adversely affect the Project Critical Path Schedule are promptly brought to the attention of Project Co and owner (WDBA).


Job Duties:

• Maintain and ensure the effective operation of the existing approved Quality Management System which includes the Quality Manual and Construction Quality Manual by the following means:

• Initiating management reviews and taking other actions necessary to ensure the effective operation and continuous improvement of the Quality Management System

• Working with staff to prepare quality audit programs and scheduling and coordinating internal quality audits and external quality audits of key processes with relevant participants, including the Designer, the Construction Contractor, and the OMR Contractor, as applicable

• Maintaining ISO 9001 Accreditation and Certification of the Quality Management System

• Develop site-specific quality procedures as necessary to support the project and Quality Management System

• Ensure that relevant records are maintained and retained in accordance with the Quality Management System and the Records Management Protocol;

• Manage the existing program for correction and, when applicable, corrective action in respect of Non-Compliances including a risk based analysis to prevent reoccurrence in accordance with ISO 9001:2015

• Coordinate all matters and issues relating to compliance with the ISO 9001 Standard of the Quality Management System

• Add or change QA/QC staff as deemed necessary to meet the quality requirements

• Other duties as assigned

Job ID: 131243BR

City: Windsor

State: Ontario

Country: Canada


We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by governing law.

title: Site Superintendent Bridge Construction
description:
As a diverse management entity, Steel River Group creates opportunity where Indigenous led businesses are empowered to create and capture value for their people, alliance partners and our communities.  Our companies offer various support services to support projects in resource sectors across Canada.  

We have a deep belief that Indigenous communities, and the values they hold, have an integral role to play in the continued advancement of industries across Canada. Weâ€™re driven by the tremendous potential that can be unlocked through collaboration and respectful engagement.

Led by an experienced team of professionals, Steel River Group enables this collaboration through our Ecosystem business model â€“ bringing together Indigenous Partners, Alliance Partners and Steel River Companies under a shared vision and common set of values to build capacity and strengthen competency, creating equal opportunities for all partners.

Steel River Energy Services, a division of Steel River Group, works to fulfill commitments to clients in several different disciplines including facility construction, pipeline construction, turnarounds & maintenance and staffing solutions.

Steel River Energy Services is seeking an Site Superintendent for upcoming projects.

Key Job Duties:

  • Reporting to the Project Manager, the Site Superintendent will be responsible for ensuring the project is completed safely and that all budget, scheduling, and quality control requirements have been satisfied.  The Site Superintendent will assist in project tendering, estimating, planning and scheduling of various projects and must demonstrate a solid understanding of overall project supervision, coordination, and scheduling. 

Qualifications:

  • Plans, schedules and supervises all on-site construction activity including the supervision and enforcement of safe work practices per company's policies and procedures, and legislative requirements;
  • Prepares and updates schedules, look-ahead and completion timelines;
  • Prepares and submits daily and monthly reports;
  • Ensures the maintenance of up-to-date plans, specifications, RFI's, inspection reports, and contract documents;
  • Ensures all work is performed in accordance with plans, specifications, and the company's quality control policies;
  • Supervises and coordinates the procurement of construction materials ensuring timely delivery and accuracy of purchasing;
  • Provides technical input on the preparation of scopes of work and contract documents;
  • Reviews payment certificates, final payment certificates, and all extra-work orders per contract documents;
  • Maintains job diaries, logs, and site photos for proper site documentation;
  • Assist in project estimating duties as required;
  • Ensure project goals for safety, quality, budget, schedule as well as profitability are met;
  • Supervise, direct, coach and train Assistant Superintendents, Coordinators, Field Engineers, Surveyors, Students, Hourly Foreman and Hourly staff assigned to project.
  • Develop and maintain positive client relations (owner, clients, consultants, public);
  • Establish and maintain an excellent relationship with subcontractors and suppliers;
  • Other duties as required

Training & Certifications:

Including but not limited to:

  • 5 years of progressive ICI construction experience;
  • Experience in bridge construction, civil construction projects and foundation work is preferred
  • Understanding of construction industry standards and operations (i.e., construction specifications, building materials, methods and procedures);
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints.
  • Knowledge and experience working with various tools and equipment;

Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook for the latest job postings and news.

Steel River is an equal opportunity employer.  Thank you in advance for including us in your career search!  Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Construction Manager
description:
Core Construction Services is looking for experienced Construction Managers for sites located in Kingston ON and Peterborough ON.

Our vision is to pioneer the Single Family Rental asset class in Canada and aggregate the largest portfolio of high quality homes in the country. There are over 20,000 homes sold in Ontario annually that fit our investment criteria and the goal is to acquire, renovate, lease-up and stabilize our acquired assets.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Responsible for the management of multiple residential projects simultaneously
  • Ability to manage contractors and vendors on site
  • Receiving and inspecting all deliveries to ensure materials are undamaged, correct quantities are as ordered, incorrect or damaged items must be documented, photographed, and communicated in writing to the supplier and project team
  • Full understanding of trade scope of work, contractual obligations of sub trades, site scheduling, coordinating the sequence of work, cost and quality control
  • Attend to deficiencies as reported on monthly site inspections, communicating corrections to the Director of Construction
  • Completing the Daily Log documenting: site conditions, deliveries, delays, and daily activities
  • Document site progress by photographing job site on a daily or weekly basis based on site activity
  • Conduct permit inspections, deficiency walk-throughs and coordinate the completion of remaining work
  • Monitor project progress to ensure it aligns with the schedule
  • Identifying and communicating site activities and any concerns with the Director of Construction
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • Minimum 3-5 Yearsâ€™ experience in Residential Construction settings
  • Completion of Part 9 Building code course
  • Experience with scheduling site logistics
  • Good understanding of construction scheduling, cost control, and quality control, and excellent ability to supervise and direct groups of trades and personnel
  • Experience and understanding of jurisdictional processes ie building inspections, ESA etc
  • Experience using word processing, spreadsheet, email and Project programs (MS Office, G Suites, Outlook)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

title: Project Controls Manager
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">IO’s Project Delivery Enterprise Team delivers some of the province’s largest and most important public infrastructure projects, including new hospitals, highways, transit systems, and courthouses. Our made-in-Ontario approach to modern project delivery has brought over 100 major projects to market and has made Ontario a global leader in infrastructure development by delivering new projects on time and on budget while meeting high standards for design, quality, and health and safety.

Position level: P6

Position purpose: 
In this role you will assist in the build-out of IO’s internal project controls capability, integrating the services of the typical project controls disciplines of Cost Management & Change Control, Schedule Management, Risk & Opportunity Management, Estimating, and Document Control to inform project and program-level decision-making. 

Supporting various projects, you will be a key contributor to IO’s long-term project controls strategy, embedding best practice methods in a sustainable and scalable way to meet the needs of IO’s diverse portfolio, growing Agency mandate and the changing delivery models utilized across IO’s capital program and the Ontario infrastructure market.

In order to succeed in the role of Project Controls Manager, you will have well honed stakeholder management skills, strong business acumen and experience developing creative solutions to complex issues with diverse teams of in-house resources, consultants and Clients. 
Experience working in a matrix environment and excellent presentation, consultation, negotiation, influencing, and consensus building skills are requisite.


At Infrastructure Ontario, we strive to create a culture that encourages a diverse equitable and inclusive environment that fosters belonging. We believe that experience comes in many forms and through learning from each others’ differences and perspectives gives us strength. We are committed to enhancing our culture and encourage applications from all walks of life. Let us know if you require any accommodations for the selection process, by contacting the Talent Acquisition Team.

Infrastructure Ontario may share your personal data internally to appropriate persons involved in the recruitment process and to third parties where there is an administrative or lawful basis for doing so. Provided that Infrastructure Ontario does not have any lawful reason to continue processing your personal data, you may make a formal request to rectify, erase or restrict (the processing of) your personal data.

title: Residential Construction Project Manager
description:
Project Manager


We are seeking a Residential Construction Project Manager for high-end new builds and remodeling projects. The candidate we need is a very experienced individual that can lead field production efficiently while dealing in a professional manner with high-end clientele. We need a personable and proactive team leader to own this position. This position will ensure projects are run efficiently, within budget while keeping our standard of building high quality homes. If your past two supervisors would rate you as a 9 or above, on a scale of 1-10, where 10 is excellent, we want to hear from you. Candidate will provide project planning, resource and time management, create benchmarks for labor resources, maintain budget and scope of work for multiple projects.


Candidate will be running several projects at one time. This position will ensure that all of the work is done on time and within the projected budget. They also need to ensure that the construction project is compliant with current building codes. Strategic planning of material procurement and labor activities are a must. The ability to foresee potential issues and manage labor and materials to ensure timely project completion is a must.


A project manager needs to consistently inform staff of project details and evaluate the effectiveness of a project plan with employees to keep tasks completed in a timely manner. A great project manager is able to motivate and direct their team to ensure the delivery of a successful project.


Duties and Responsibilities:


  • Use project scope of work to determine and define the best plan to complete each task effectively.
  • Coordinate material procurement so materials are there when needed and running to get materials is kept to a minimum.
  • Manage construction schedule and activities
  • Ensure work is done in compliance with all relevant building and safety codes
  • Manage subcontractor and supplier relationships.
  • Maintain quality execution and keep job clean and orderly. Return materials not needed in a timely manner to keep site clean and obtain proper credit.
  • Coordinate efforts across entire project between architects, designers, engineers, and subcontractors
  • Ability to anticipate problems and proactively come up with solutions.
  • Provide feedback to owner/ client regarding processes, procedures and employee performance to improve our overall building experience.
  • Coordinate with independent contractors to efficiently manage our production schedule
  • Coordinate with client, designers, suppliers, ordering construction materials as needed.
  • Inspect all deliveries, ensuring the materials are the right quantity and quality and are properly placed at the job site.
  • Monitor quality of all workmanship in detail. Stop work when necessary and provide training to independent contractors as needed.
  • Communicate with independent contractors and suppliers to ensure timely completion of work.
  • Use your creative problem-solving skills to resolve construction and budget issues.
  • Ensure all site policies are adhered to, especially safety and cleanliness standards.
  • Provide regular communication with homeowners to inform them of progress on their homes and build and maintain goodwill throughout the construction process.


Skills:


  • Ability to read, understand, and explain construction blueprints and floor plans.
  • Must possess deep expertise in standard construction practices.
  • Proven ability to deliver project on time and on budget.
  • Ability to maintain a high level of customer satisfaction for demanding clients.
  • Deep knowledge of industry safety practices.
  • Excellent computer skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office and able to learn new software.


Qualifications for Construction Project Manager:


  • A skilled tradesman with exemplary supervisory experience may be considered.
  • 3-6 years of experience in project management within construction for a custom home builder or professional remodeler.
  • Comfortable reading and understanding blueprints and drawings
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office and general computer software
  • Demonstrated knowledge of construction, engineering, and architecture principles
  • Strong leadership and management skills
  • High School diploma or GED required.
  • Professionalism in manner and attire.
  • Please have job related references at the ready if selected for interview.
  • Willingness to travel to construction site(s) daily. This job involves a significant time in the office and some field work as needed.


About our company:

  • Alair Homes Collingwood is a “Team” based organization that prides itself as a leader in our market. Attention to detail and a strong commitment from our team helps to keep us among the top performers in this industry. 


Learn more about us: https://www.alairhomes.ca/collingwood/

title: Senior Construction Quality Control Manager
description:
Considering a change? Challenge yourself with Fluor!

Fluor is one of Canada's top employers and recognized globally as a leader in the Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Fabrication, and Maintenance industry. Our focus on innovation and providing cost effective technology based solutions to address our client's needs is second to none. As we look to the future, we need creative, ambitious, and innovative professionals who can help us achieve our goals.

Fluor team members are at the core of Fluor’s successes and instrumental in executing projects safely, smartly and with the highest quality. If you value teamwork, empowerment in your career and are eager to champion Fluor’s project execution, this opportunity just may be for you!

This position will be assigned to the Gordie Howe International Bridge Project in Windsor, Ontario and serve as the Quality Manager for the Project Co. The Gordie Howe International Bridge Project is a public-private partnership established to design, build, operate and maintain the Gordie Howe International Bridge between Detroit, Michigan and Windsor, Ontario. The scope of the Project includes the following components:
• A cable-stayed bridge spanning the Detroit River
• New U.S. and Canadian Point of Entries
• New interchange at Interstate 75 in Detroit

This role serves as the primary representative for the Project on all matters relating to quality management with the overall objective of providing our clients and with projects that comply with the quality requirements stipulated in our Contracts. The Quality Manager shall report directly to the Project Director to ensure the quality of Project Work. The Project Quality Manager is responsible for ensuring that any matters relating to quality control that could adversely affect the Project Critical Path Schedule are promptly brought to the attention of Project Co and owner (WDBA).

Job Duties:
• Maintain and ensure the effective operation of the existing approved Quality Management System which includes the Quality Manual and Construction Quality Manual by the following means:
• Initiating management reviews and taking other actions necessary to ensure the effective operation and continuous improvement of the Quality Management System
• Working with staff to prepare quality audit programs and scheduling and coordinating internal quality audits and external quality audits of key processes with relevant participants, including the Designer, the Construction Contractor, and the OMR Contractor, as applicable
• Maintaining ISO 9001 Accreditation and Certification of the Quality Management System
• Develop site-specific quality procedures as necessary to support the project and Quality Management System
• Ensure that relevant records are maintained and retained in accordance with the Quality Management System and the Records Management Protocol;
• Manage the existing program for correction and, when applicable, corrective action in respect of Non-Compliances including a risk based analysis to prevent reoccurrence in accordance with ISO 9001:2015
• Coordinate all matters and issues relating to compliance with the ISO 9001 Standard of the Quality Management System
• Add or change QA/QC staff as deemed necessary to meet the quality requirements
• Other duties as assigned

title: Senior Project Manager Planning Land Development
company: Steven Cardwell Recruitment / Engineering Search Firm Inc
description:
Senior Project Manager Planning Land Development
Steven Cardwell Recruitment (Engineering Search Firm Inc.) Hamilton, Ontario, Canada
Must be a PR of Canada, and live within  the travel distance to Hamilton Ontario Canada
Senior Project Manager – Land Development
 
 
The primary function of the Project Manager, Land Development, is to obtain draft plan approval, site plan approval, engineering approvals, and register plans of subdivision/condo .
 
Qualifications:
 
·        Post secondary education equivalent to a University degree or College Diploma –Planning, Engineering or related field preferred;
·        5+ years experience working in a Land Development environment, with a strong understanding of the residential land development process.
 
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
·        Manage all aspects of the land development process;
·        Prepare and submit Land Development approval applications, including Official Plan Amendment, Zoning Amendment, Draft Plan of Subdivision, Site Plan, Committee of Adjustment, and Plan of Condominium;
·        Develop and maintain project budgets and schedules
·        Obtain clearances related to approvals for registration and assumption;
·        Co-ordinate project consultant team and contractors to ensure projects are completed on schedule and on budget;
·        Prepare purchase for Land Acquisition
·        Prepare concept plans for subdivisions and site plans;
·        Conduct site visits as required;
·        Maintain positive relationships with consultants, contractors and key stakeholders to ensure project success;
·        Perform additional assignments and responsibilities as required;
·        Duties may change from time to time at the discretion of the Executive Director of Land Development.
 
 
Skills:
 
·        Working knowledge of Planning Legislation and processes is a requirement;
·        Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a requirement;
·        Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications is a requirement;
·        Ability to work independently and demonstrate a collaborative attitude while working with members of a team.

title: Construction Manager
description:
Company Description

Bantrel is proud to be a leading provider of Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) services in Canada.

Since our inception in 1983, we have delivered end-to-end solutions for some of Canada’s most challenging and complex energy, mining and infrastructure projects, with an unrelenting focus on safety, while delivering to the highest degree of quality. Bantrel performs design and procurement services from our Calgary, Edmonton and Toronto offices and delivers construction management and self perform construction services at various Client sites across Canada.

Our global reach and local touch is demonstrated by our affiliation with our parent company, Bechtel Corporation, one of the largest EPC companies in the world, and with McCaig Investments, a Canadian owned private company with longstanding ties to the local business community.

www.bantrel.com

Bantrel Co.: My Company | LinkedIn

Job Description

Ensures implementation of all aspects of project-related health, safety, and environment management system (HSEMS) processes, plans, procedures, systems, methods, and policies critical to the success of HSE applicable to the assigned project. Responsible for planning, organizing, coordinating, and managing the pre-execution construction activities of assigned projects. Responsible for developing the construction execution plans, HSEMS plans, construction work packages, execution schedules, site indirects plans, non-manual staffing plans, subcontracting plans, and labour strategies.

Provides direction to subordinate managers and staff for the conduct of project related activities. Monitors labour performance against budget, construction progress against schedule, identifies other deviations from construction plan and recommends corrective actions. The construction manager shall be competent and experienced person and be able to coordinate work efforts and ensure activities are sequenced in accordance with the overall project schedule, accurately evaluate methods and performance in all respects of the project for which they are accountable.

The construction manager will be required to work as part of multifunctional, dynamic group that perform a variety of business-related functions, including client solutions deliverables and organizing all project and tendering activities in cooperation with our project managers, project coordinators and corporate support services.

* Please note this position is not eligible for a relocation subsidy or living out allowance.

In this full-time permanent role, you will be a champion of diversity & inclusion.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Manage overall job site health, safety, and environment performance and verifies that contractors are protecting their workers at the job site.
  • Management of construction in an EPC/EPCM/C environment, including but not limited to contract execution, construction supervision, supervision of contractors and their subcontractors for assigned portions of the project.
  • Assisting in the coordination of the design deliverables to support continuous and efficient construction.
  • Job site point of contact for all contractors in assigned area of the project.
  • Manage logistical interfaces and delivery of materials to the site and release to contractor.
  • Planning and chairing safety meetings.
  • Manage incident investigations and reporting.
  • Participates in safety programs and initiatives aligned with project and operational procedures.
  • Communicating the identification, management, and resolution of deficiencies and nonconformance to the appropriate management.
  • Manage quality assurance, control, testing and reporting in accordance with the construction execution plan.
  • Responsible for construction estimating, scheduling, cost control and reporting for all work being performed by the contractor in his assigned area of the project.
  • Manage multiple interfaces for surface and underground scopes including owner interface and operations.
Qualifications

  • Minimum ten years onsite experience as a construction manager.
  • SMPEI (structural, mechanical, piping, electrical, instrumentation) experience required for construction.
  • Involvement in at least one significant project similar in size, scope, and location as the assignment being considered.
  • Ability to operate effectively in a team environment.
  • Ability to professionally manage and resolve contractor issues to avoid further conflict escalation.


Additional Information

Please note there is a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy in place. Prospective employees will not be asked to disclose their vaccination status and only successful candidates will be asked to provide proof of vaccination and/or to seek accommodation pursuant to the mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy prior to starting work.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for further review will be contacted. All other resumes will be retained for future consideration.

title: Construction Manager
description:
Company Description

Bantrel is proud to be a leading provider of Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) services in Canada.

Since our inception in 1983, we have delivered end-to-end solutions for some of Canada’s most challenging and complex energy, mining and infrastructure projects, with an unrelenting focus on safety, while delivering to the highest degree of quality. Bantrel performs design and procurement services from our Calgary, Edmonton and Toronto offices and delivers construction management and self perform construction services at various Client sites across Canada.

Our global reach and local touch is demonstrated by our affiliation with our parent company, Bechtel Corporation, one of the largest EPC companies in the world, and with McCaig Investments, a Canadian owned private company with longstanding ties to the local business community.

www.bantrel.com

Bantrel Co.: My Company | LinkedIn

Job Description

Hatch and Bantrel have formed the Hatch Bantrel Joint Venture (HBJV) to execute engineering and construction on the BHP Jansen Potash Mine Project in Saskatchewan. After successfully completing the Definition Phase Study for the project, the HBJV is currently carrying out the Detailed Engineering Phase for the Processing, Non-Process Infrastructure (NPI) and Mining Areas of the 4.5 Mtpa Stage 1 Potash Mine. With a published TIC of US $5.3-5.7 Billion this will represent one of the largest projects and private investments in Canada. The HBJV will use a hybrid of best-in-class new developing technologies and systems as well as the proven HBJV suite of tools to execute this exciting project.

The Construction Manager will be ensuring the implementation of all aspects of Jansen related health, safety, and environment management system (HSEMS) processes, plans, procedures, systems, methods, and policies critical to the success of HSE applicable to the project. Responsible for planning, organizing, coordinating, and managing the pre-execution construction activities of assigned projects. Responsible for developing the construction execution plans, HSEMS plans, construction work packages, execution schedules, site indirects plans, non-manual staffing plans, subcontracting plans, and labour strategies.

Provides direction to subordinate managers and staff for the conduct of project related activities. Monitors labour performance against budget, construction progress against schedule, identifies other deviations from construction plan and recommends corrective actions. The construction manager shall be competent and experienced person and be able to coordinate work efforts and ensure activities are sequenced in accordance with the overall project schedule, accurately evaluate methods and performance in all respects of the project for which they are accountable.

The construction manager will be required to work as part of multifunctional, dynamic group that perform a variety of business-related functions, including client solutions deliverables and organizing all project and tendering activities in cooperation with our project managers, project coordinators and corporate support services.

* Please note this position is not eligible for a relocation subsidy or living out allowance. This will be a camp position on a 14 day on 7 day off rotation.*

In this full-time permanent role, you will be a champion of diversity & inclusion.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Manage overall job site health, safety, and environment performance and verifies that contractors are protecting their workers at the job site.
  • Management of construction in an EPC/EPCM/C environment, including but not limited to contract execution, construction supervision, supervision of contractors and their subcontractors for assigned portions of the project.
  • Assisting in the coordination of the design deliverables to support continuous and efficient construction.
  • Job site point of contact for all contractors in assigned area of the project.
  • Manage logistical interfaces and delivery of materials to the site and release to contractor.
  • Planning and chairing safety meetings.
  • Manage incident investigations and reporting.
  • Participates in safety programs and initiatives aligned with project and operational procedures.
  • Communicating the identification, management, and resolution of deficiencies and nonconformance to the appropriate management.
  • Manage quality assurance, control, testing and reporting in accordance with the construction execution plan.
  • Responsible for construction estimating, scheduling, cost control and reporting for all work being performed by the contractor in his assigned area of the project.
  • Manage multiple interfaces for surface and underground scopes including owner interface and operations.
Qualifications

  • Minimum ten years onsite experience as a construction manager.
  • SMPEI (structural, mechanical, piping, electrical, instrumentation) experience required for construction.
  • Involvement in at least one significant project similar in size, scope, and location as the assignment being considered.
  • Ability to operate effectively in a team environment.
  • Ability to professionally manage and resolve contractor issues to avoid further conflict escalation.


Additional Information

Please note there is a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy in place. Prospective employees will not be asked to disclose their vaccination status and only successful candidates will be asked to provide proof of vaccination and/or to seek accommodation pursuant to the mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy prior to starting work.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for further review will be contacted. All other resumes will be retained for future consideration.

title: Studio Manager, HVAC+Plumbing
description:
INVIRO is seeking a motivated, passionate individual to join our team. As an employee of one of Canadaâ€™s leading Mechanical/Electrical engineering firms, you will be able to experience the thrills of working with a close-knit team on multiple challenging projects in the ICI sector.

We pride ourselves in enabling our employees to better themselves and provide them with opportunities to grow their skills and abilities. Additionally, we have developed and maintained a positive/nurturing company culture. All of this comes from our desire to see our employees succeed. If youâ€™re ready to take the next step in your career, weâ€™re excited to bring you on to our team.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide oversight and direction to the employees in the Ottawa office in accordance with the organization's policies and procedures
  • Coach, mentor and develop staff
  • Lead employees to meet the organization's expectations for productivity, and quality
  • Manage projects from design through construction
  • Direct and coordinate mechanical designs, and drawings to ensure compliance with work order requirements
  • Engage in meetings with clients regarding project reports and findings
  • Confer with management to discuss project specifications or procedures
  • Provide expertise and guidance in the identification, analysis, and resolution of problems
  • Create technical reports, documentation, calculations, and sketches
  • Perform calculations, specify, and select equipment

The duties and responsibilities mentioned, while not exhaustive, represent responsibilities that the Mechanical Engineering Manager will hold. The responsibilities listed may change over time, as instructed by INVIRO.

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • University degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field
  • Professional Engineer (P.Eng) designation is an asset
  • PMP is an asset
  • Outstanding interpersonal relationship building and employee coaching and development skills
  • Management experience in a team-oriented workplace preferred
  • Demonstrated ability to lead and develop a department and department staff members
  • 15 years of work experience in mechanical engineering with a focus in mechanical engineering/design for commercial, industrial, and institutional buildings
  • Strong background knowledge in Building Design with an emphasis on mechanical systems (HVAC/Plumbing/BAS)
  • Ability to do your own design CAD
  • Highly effective negotiation, diplomatic, and conflict resolutions skills
  • Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
  • Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Familiarity with the LEED accreditation process is an asset

This position is full time and located in Gloucester, ON.  Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Each qualified applicant will receive consideration for employment without being subject to discrimination based on any characteristics protected by law.

Any candidates contacted for an opportunity that may need accommodation throughout the recruitment process are encouraged to advise us of any such need. We will work with you to ensure that the accommodations made suit your individual needs. All details relating to the accommodation will be kept strictly confidential.

We appreciate all applications for this position. However, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Director, Construction - New Restaurant Construction
description:
Overview:

Recipe Unlimited Corporation is Canadaâ€™s leading full service restaurant company. Home to such iconic brands as Swiss Chalet, Harveyâ€™s, St.Hubert, The Keg, Montanaâ€™s, Kelseys, Pubs, Bier Markt, East Side Marioâ€™s, Landing Group, New York Fries, the Burgerâ€™s Priest, The Pickle Barrel & Catering, State and Main, Elephant and Castle and Original Joeâ€™s. With this diverse portfolio of restaurants our Home Office Teammates have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of some of the most popular, well-loved brands in Canada. Variety isnâ€™t the only thing we offer â€“ we are passionate about our industry, we celebrate and support diversity of thought, we are innately curious and encourage our Teammates to take ownership. Above all else, we believe in doing the right thing for our people, our communities and our planet.


The position's primary function is to help drive profitable business growth by overseeing new restaurant construction within Canada for Recipe Brands (all 19 brands). This individual will "own" the construction process from start to finish by creating the structure to manage multiple concurrent projects. The Director of Construction is the focal point for bringing together Recipe's construction experience from across the organization to develop a construction center of excellence. This individual will be a respected subject matter expert critical to charting Recipe's development future. The Director of Construction will assess new site opportunities, build estimates, review design concepts, build a strong team of project managers, and manage all new restaurants' construction processes. The Director of Construction will continually look for ways to improve processes, foster innovation, control costs, ensure design efficiencies and value engineering opportunities. The new restaurant construction team is responsible for establishing construction best practices for Recipe, resulting in an improved new restaurant experience for our customers (Brand and Franchisee) and helping drive the construction cost to fit the Unit Economic Model (UEM) for each brand. To achieve this, the Director of Construction will collaborate with Real Estate, Brand Leads, Design, Equipment Procurement and Operations teams to develop processes, procedures, training material, and technology enhancements that enable Recipe to achieve throughput, growth, schedule, cost and quality objectives. The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate depth and breadth of experience in the construction industry (preferably in the Restaurant space), a passion for innovation and technology, and an ability to move effectively between the field and corporate environments.


Responsibilities:
â¦ Assists in developing an annual plan for construction that supports the companyâ€™s objectives identified in the strategic plan. The Director of Construction will build, coach and retain Recipeâ€™s construction management team, creating a positive, fun, collaborative, results-orientated working environment
â¦ They will be responsible for taking the annual plan and creating tactical action plans and the people plan necessary to execute the annual plan
â¦ Develops a high-quality team to support all current and projected construction activities. Provides regular, timely, constructive feedback regarding performance and career development
â¦ Working closely with a team of staff, operations group, franchisees, external contractors, vendors and architects oversees the planning and all construction activities across Recipe Brands. Builds a project management checklist to ensure attention to detail. Ensures processes and structures are in place to effectively monitor and measure progress. Critically evaluates each project after completion
â¦ Builds corporate and franchise stores to specification and within set budgets and construction parameters across Canada. Including preparing bid specifications, estimating, awarding construction contracts, solving problems and developing project budgets and forecasts
â¦ Works to continuously formulate recommendations to improve building methods to contain construction costs
â¦ Work with governing bodies to ensure proper permits and all construction legislation is met
â¦ Overseeâ€™s the project management activities related to renovating and retrofitting existing stores
â¦ Works closely with the Director of Design, Real Estate, Brand Leads and Consultants in the value engineering of new store designs and concepts
â¦ Develops and submits construction department budget. Manages, monitors and reports on the status of the yearly capital budget. Carefully monitors each projectâ€™s financial status and performs a rigorous analysis of estimated to actual costs
â¦ Keeps abreast of trends in the construction industry to ensure that Recipe continues to be a leader in the industry
â¦ Collaborates with the entire development team. Openly communicates and shares learnings to ensure Recipe becomes a franchisor of choice
â¦ Establish a construction center of excellence; develop construction-related tools (processes, procedures, training material, technology enhancements) to improve Recipeâ€™s ability to support our brands to deliver new growth
â¦ 25-35% Travel required

 

Skills:

â¦ 10+ years of construction experience, preferably in restaurant space
â¦ 5+ years of people management and leadership experience
â¦ University or College degree or a combination of relevant education and experience
â¦ Restaurant, hospitality or retail industry experience is an asset
â¦ Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
â¦ Building Effective Teams
â¦ Strategic Agility and Managing through systems (creating systems where necessary)
â¦ Excellent decision-making skills
â¦ Proficiency with computer business software applications (Google Suite software, Microsoft Project, & Access)

 

Whatâ€™s in it for you?
â¦ Flexible/Hybrid work environment
â¦ Youâ€™d be joining a close-knit, innovative team of creative and energetic go-getters
â¦ Youâ€™d be a part of Canadaâ€™s largest full-service restaurant company that leads the industry in size and innovation
â¦ 20% associate discount dining card and monthly dining allowance valid at participating Recipe brands
â¦ A welcoming, fun and safe work environment founded on respect
â¦ Career advancement opportunities with a company that owns some of Canadaâ€™s most iconic restaurant brands
â¦ Industry-leading benefits, wellness programs, and total rewards programs

 

Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.


Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact recruit@recipeunlimited.com.

title: Contractor Site Manager
description:
Company Description

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

The Contractor Site Manager is a key member of the contract team at a historical remote site in the Canadian Arctic. Reporting to the Division Vice President Facilities Management Western Canada, the Contractor Site Manager is responsible for overseeing the CFS Alert Site Management Team delivering the portfolio of work at CFS Alert. Responsible for the attainment of the Health, Safety, Environment, Quality and Financial targets of the contract, the Contractor Site Manager will enable the operations team and support function leads to facilitate meeting the goals and objectives of the CFS Alert contract. Responsible for the management and administration of all operational requirements and activities of facilities and support services for the contract, this individual will foster strong relationships and deliver operational excellence to meet internal and external customer needs. An 8 weeks on, 8 weeks off rotational schedule with flights to and from the worksite in Nunavut leaving from Trenton, Ontario. A unique opportunity to contribute to the operation of an entire community supporting members of the Canadian Armed Forces.

This position requires Government of Canada security clearance at the Secret Status level.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Manage, plan, control audit and coordinate all on-site work activities including:
    • Accommodation and janitorial services, food services, environmental protection and domestic, industrial and hazmat waste collection, handling and disposal, transportation and vehicle maintenance, airfield operations, facility management services including building systems and equipment, standby power systems, fuel services, quarry services, engineering services, and project delivery.
  • Provide leadership and direction to managers responsible for the service delivery areas including the Food Services and Hospitality Manager, Transportation and Vehicle Manager, HSEQ Manager, and Real Property Services Manager.
  • Attend meetings and liaise with the site Commanding Officer to ensure all operational, administrative and safety matters are addressed.
  • Organize staff to ensure work is prioritized to meet the site operational needs, and that work is conducted in a professional and timely manner, meeting all standards, operating procedures, and guidelines.
  • Ensure that Emergency Response Plans are supported, liaising with National Defense Authorities, as required.
  • Ensure that phase-in and phase-out requirements are well planned and conducted, preparing and submitting reports and data deliverables as identified.
  • Prepare and maintain a cost management system including labour resource costs.
  • Act as the official point of contact for the client Contractor, with sufficient delegated technical and financial authority to respond appropriately to any contractual matters.
Qualifications

  • Minimum five (5) years of experience in management of multi-disciplinary-services and functions in a commercial or industrial setting.
  • At least ten (10) years of combined experiences in logistical support and facilities operations and maintenance services.
  • Minimum of fifteen (15) years overall work experience.
  • Relevant experience in projects of similar, or greater, size (duration or value of contract), scope (facilities management in an isolated or harsh environment) and complexity (responsible for the proper operation and maintenance of roads and grounds, power plant operation, cleaning, food services, water plant and fueling systems for facilities of similar, or greater scale).
  • Ability to obtain Government of Canada security clearance at the Secret Status level (requires a 10 year background check and Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency).
  • Education or certification from a recognized accredited institution in Engineering, Construction Management, Business Management, BOMI or related field.
  • Ability to obtain fit-for-duty medical assessment from a physician.
  • Experience working in and managing remote locations.
  • Knowledge and experience working with Federal Legislation or Territorial bodies.
  • Excellent presentation and written communication skills; ability to effectively convey information and influence.
  • Ability to effectively manage, adjust and adapt to fluctuating priorities and workloads in a high performance work environment.
  • Leadership competencies with the ability to provide mentorship, direction and monitor the deliverables of direct reports.
  • Inuit cultural awareness, knowledge and respect.
  • Flexibility to meet the unique requirements of the site including potential rotational shift changes and working after hours “on-call” duties.


Additional Information

  • An opportunity for work life balance. 8 weeks on and 8 weeks off allows you to use your time to do what you enjoy.
  • Continuous wage payment throughout your time off.
  • Competitive wages, benefits and an RSP matching program.
  • Retention Bonus of up to 10% of wages earned paid on the completion of a 2 year contract.
  • Paid travel time.
  • Unique experience in the northernmost continuously inhabited place in the world.
  • Training and development opportunities to help grow and diversify your career.
  • Transfer opportunities to other Dexterra sites across Canada.

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

*Please note this job is based in Alert, Nunavut, Canada.

title: Project Manager, Hazardous Materials
description:
Your Employer

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and it’s more than 2,600 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

 

As a Project Manager, Hazardous Materials, you will work in collaboration with the Hygiene Health and Safety Team.


Your Contribution

  • Apply and promote Englobe’s health and safety rules.
  • Coordinating projects in one or more of the following areas.
  • Designated Substances/Hazardous Materials Surveys.
  • Indoor Air Quality Assessments.
  • Hazardous Materials Tendering and Abatement Supervision.
  • Coordinating projects in other areas of Environmental Consulting, as required.
  • Generating and providing technical reviews of deliverable documentation such as technical reports, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Managing and/or generating deliverable documentation of various projects including technical documents.
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures and work plans.
  • Interacting, coordinating, and scheduling projects with clients, as directed by the Team Lead or Director.
  • Participating in project management meetings, office meetings, health, and safety inspections.
  • Maintaining a commitment to exceeding client expectations by consistently delivering high quality of work.
  • Consistently maintaining professionalism and objectivity while working with colleagues and clients who require varying degrees of support.
  • Handling difficult situations with tact and diplomacy to maintain positive working relationships with all internal and external contacts.
  • Conducting project administration tasks as required, including timesheet generation, project finance management and project invoicing.
  • Willingness to travel to remote areas of Northern Ontario

Your Profile

  • Undergraduate degree and/or applicable (science/engineering) diploma required.
  • Minimum 3-5 years experience in a consulting environment.
  • Experience providing reviews to proposals, specifications, case studies, technical and non-technical reports required.
  • Solid understanding of provincial and federal regulatory requirements acquired through experience and education.
  • Possession of valid driver’s license required.
  • Possession of or eligibility to obtain secret security clearance required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Construction Superintendent - Canada
description:
PRIMARY FUNCTION:

Supervise all onsite construction activities and ensure compliance to safety, design and schedule. Develop and maintain effective relationships with client, subcontractors and suppliers.

TYPICAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Supervise construction effort to ensure project is constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule.

  • Responsible for coordinating and supervising onsite functions (scheduling, subcontractor coordination, etc.).
  • Assume responsibility for compliance of crafts and subcontractors with contract documents, efficient use of materials & equipment, and timely performance of the project schedule.
  • Provide technical assistance, i.e., interpretation of drawings, recommending construction methods and equipment, etc., as required.
  • Assist project management in developing, project schedule, site logistics plan and implementing project procedures, working documents, standards, etc.
  • Assume responsibility for all trades compliance to Site Specific Safety Plan.
  • Coordinate with on-site Owner employees.
  • Perform additional assignments per supervisor's direction.

SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:

Educational and experience includes:

  • Five or more years in work experience in a Superintendent position (e.g., scheduling, ordering, field supervision, quality control, safety, and production of all phases in construction) on large projects is required with four or more years (or equivalent) field or trade work experience in the construction industry.
  • Knowledge, skills and experience with Canadian construction methods, techniques, and standards.
  • Resume shall indicate area of expertise (e.g. civil, structural, mechanical, electrical, materials, finishes, etc.)

In accordance with PMSI's duty to provide and maintain a workplace that is free of serious hazards, we have adopted a COVID-19 vaccination requirement for all new hires. We have implemented this requirement (subject to exceptions required by law, as explained below) in order to safeguard the health of our employees and their families; our clients; the contractors, vendors, and other parties with whom we regularly interact. This requirement will help protect our workforce and these groups from COVID-19 infections, which may be reduced or prevented by vaccination.

title: Roofing Superintendent
description:
At Flynn, It's not just a job, it's a career

“Best at what we do, innovative and forward-thinking, like a family, incredible team, sense of responsibility and achievement, great resources, exceptional tools and training, challenging, fast paced”

This is what our Superintendents coast to coast, love most about working as a Superintendent at Flynn.

A Day in the Life
  • Schedule & manage crews on site
  • Assist in the hiring and separation of field employees
  • Ensure crews meet or exceed safety plan
  • Proactively determine equipment needs on site and coordinate their delivery
  • Coach & mentor crews
  • Responsible for productivity, expediting materials/equipment and the contractual performance of the project
What We Are Seeking
  • Good communication (verbal & written)
  • Ability to deal with conflict
  • Good leadership skills
  • Good listening skills
  • Ability to adapt
  • Time management skills
  • Problem Solving Skills
What We Offer
  • Competitive wages and benefits 
  • RRSP matching
  • Great environment where our motto is "Flynn Family Winning Together!"
  • On-going career development programs through our in-house Flynn University and eLearning courses
  • In-house gym 
Position Summary

Location: Calgary

Employment Type: Full-time, Permanent

Job Functions: Roofing Superintendent

Industry: Construction, Building Envelope

title: Superintendent, Residential Construction
description:
Position Overview

Supervise residential / commercial construction project site operations through to completion ensuring the project completes on time and on budget while working to high safety, quality and production standards.  Work closely with a Project Manager in developing a schedule, controlling costs, recording site activity and reports and maintaining positive relationships with clients, sub-trades, consultants and employees. 

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage all on site activities; ensure project construction is executed in a safe, timely and efficient manner
  • Manage site flow of information: RFIâ€™s/ ASIâ€™s/ SSIâ€™s/ ESIâ€™s/ MSIâ€™s/ etc.
  • Chair and minute bi-weekly, monthly site meetings with consultants and sub trades as necessary
  • Liaison with all City Officials and create working relationships
  • Create schedules and assist sub trades to comply and maintain productivity
  • Competent at reviewing all work drawings and able to identify conflicts and issues in advance
  • Supervise all sub-trades, suppliers, and workers
  • Conduct site safety orientation and weekly safety meetings with sub-trades
  • Review on-site work to confirm that project is being built as per drawings, specifications, code and ensure that all finishes are to the Companyâ€™s and industry standards
  • Assemble the job site office and equipment requirements
  • Monitor and maintain the project construction schedule on a regular basis
  • Implement and enforce the requirements of WCB and Beedieâ€™s Health and Safety Program
  • Review the accuracy of shop drawings, change orders, and RFIâ€™s as required
  • Investigate and resolve any issues that arise
  • Responsible for field documentation such as daily logs, conduct daily safety inspections and other required reports
  • Order materials and schedules inspections as necessary; include coordinate offsite utilities and review with the applicable authority

Desired Skills and Experience

  • Minimum 5 yearsâ€™ experience in residential/commercial construction projects as a superintendent
  • Experience working on projects valued up to $60 million
  • Extensive knowledge of procedures, methods, conditions and documents related to building construction
  • Ability to understand the scopes of work project and schedule, as well as interpret drawings, specifications, and contract documents
  • Proactive and positive leadership and supervisory skills
  • Attentive to detail and accuracy
  • Demonstrated history of timely and within-budget construction
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient computer skills and knowledge of MS Office, MS Project, ProCore and scheduling/tracking software
