title: Maintenance Coordinator
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for a Maintenance Coordinator(s).  These roles are for Nuna's newest adventure located in Northern Canada in Nunavut.

This is your opportunity to experience one of Canada's most exclusive work locations!

Nuna offers:

  • Very competitive compensation package which consists of a balance pay schedule that will also provide income during your rotational days off; 
  • Extensive benefits package with a matching RRSP plan;
  • Company supplied flights;
  • Single / Private room accommodations;
  • On-site recreational facilities include weight room with tanning booth, gymnasium, theater, multiple entertainment/recreation rooms, and a bar/ lounge; 
  • Accommodations and full meals provided;
  • Annual Bonus program (at completion of term); 
  • Employee recognition program;
  • Rotation allowances - provided every rotation;
  • Long-term opportunities.

All successful candidates will be required to clear all pre-access conditions which will include criminal and security backgrounds, full medical /physical testing, and Drug and Alcohol testing. 

Due to the location of this remote worksite rotations will be 8 weeks in / 8 weeks out*  

Job Duties:

  • Serves as the maintenance subject matter expert (SME) at site;
  • Effectively tracks and records equipment hours services, repairs, inspections ;
  • Accurately records and tracks inventory and develops site re-supply list;
  • Practices safe warehousing techniques to minimize strain and strain during physical tasks;
  • Schedules preventative maintenance per manufacturer recommendations and company policy;
  • Participates in weekly maintenance conference calls;
  • Produces reports in an accurate and timely manner; 
  • Utilizes JD Edwards computer-based maintenance and inventory programs;
  • Complies with all Nuna and client policies and procedures;
  • Works in cooperation with client personnel and personnel from other subcontracted organizations working on site;
  • Performs other duties as required;


Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 3 years working as a Maintenance Coordinator, preferably in a remote/camp work site,
  • Journeyperson Parts person certification is required.
  • Journeyperson Mechanic and/or Heavy Equipment Mechanic registration is considered an asset;  
  • Strong background of technical and practical heavy construction equipment maintenance;
  • Proficient in the use of computer diagnostic and parts programs;
  • Demonstrates strong knowledge of appropriate computer software (MS Office Suite, JD Edwards);
  • Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Self-motivated, detail orientated, exceptional organizational skills and extremely accurate;
  • Able to work with little or no supervision;
  • Physically capable of lifting up to 60 pounds

*Covid-19 Quarantine periods up to 14 days will be required before each rotation.

All successful candidates must:

  1. All candidates must be proficient in English, both verbally and written. (Bilingual candidates preferred).
  2. Have experience as requested in the job description above.
  3. Able to work in a remote location for extended rotations.
  4. Clear all pre-access testing/requirements.
  5. Eligible to work for any employer in Canada.
  6. Reside within Canada and have a valid Canadian Passport.

 

Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   

Interested applicants are asked to apply online at:  http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html

Or by email: hr@nunalogistics.com

 

We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.  All resumes will be held for other current and future opportunities.

  

Nuna Logistics is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective and innovative operator in the north.

title: Vice President, Construction & Development
description:
Our client is a proud family business, where people come first – within their team globally as well as their customers. They are committed to top quality in everything they do in the quick service restaurant (QSR) business, providing exceptional customer experience. They are dedicated to providing an environment for an engaged and diverse workforce with exciting career opportunities, driven by giving back and supporting communities across the globe.

We are currently searching for a VP Construction & Development for their Canadian business. This role, reporting to the General Manager, will be based out of Toronto with national responsibility.  The VP Construction & Development is a key member of the senior leadership team, responsible for leading a high-performing team to deliver on end-to-end asset revitalization strategy across all brands within timeline and budgetary constraints.

As an experienced leader, you will be responsible for new site acquisition, site construction, as well as enhancements of existing sites.  Additionally, you will oversee facilities & maintenance, equipment strategy and estate management.  

In order to be considered for this opportunity, you will possess the following:
 
  • Undergrad degree preferred with business, finance or real estate discipline
  • 10+ years progressive experience in the construction and development industry, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership or executive capacity
  • Commercially minded professional with a solid network of industry contacts and/or referral sources
  • Embrace change as a constant and adaptable in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Proven leadership skills with innate ability to engage and inspire others
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills
  • Must be comfortable to spend 2-3 days per week in the field, often with overnight stays.
  • Innovative, change agent, results driven and collaborative professional

This role will appeal to a senior director looking for next step up or someone already at the VP level but looking to take on a challenging new opportunity. Don’t miss out on this exciting opportunity to lead the Canadian expansion of a scaling,  family-owned & operated, international business.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Join our team of Construction Professionals!

CASMAN is seeking a seasoned Site Superintendent who enjoys the challenge of Leading Teams and meeting targets!

A Casman Site Superintendent Oversees Safety, Schedule, Scope and Budget for our Clients. They are the stewards of the Project s overall success and building and maintaining client relationships. They will work with all internal team members as well as Subcontractors, Suppliers, and Clients. Excellent Communication skills (both written and verbal) and ability to work well in a team environment and lead a team are a must.

Experience managing projects under different contract types, such as Lump Sum and Construction Management, and also a proven track record with Commercial, Institutional, and multi-residential projects is required.

Candidates require 2-4 years of formal post-secondary construction education in Construction Engineering, Architectural Technology or Civil Engineering or a Journeyman Carpentry Certificate 5 years of experience as a Site Superintendent is required. Applicants must be very proficient with Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel, and familiar with building codes, standards and best construction practices.

Travel to our Various Western Canadian Offices will be required periodically.

This position would be in Victoria and only applicants applying that are local to the region or are willing to fully relocate will be considered.

CASMAN'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES:

Competitive salary and performance bonus

Pension matching plan

Comprehensive Benefits package

Proven Opportunities for Career Growth

Sponsorship for Additional Education & Training

Casman offers relocation support

Casman welcomes all applications, and we thank you for your interest in our group.

Only applicants of interest will be contacted.

title: Construction Manager
description:
Wednesday, March 16, 2022

The Wireless Construction Manager is required to perform an array of duties related to deployment of wireless sites through subcontractors. Typical duties may include site visits, safety audits, onsite quality, and efficiency reviews, assisting in bid preparation, scheduling subcontractors and bid walks, shipping and receiving site materials, coordinating engineering firms and close out duties. This position requires the full understanding of what it takes to build a wireless site from site acquisition stage to hand over to operations. It is expected that the employee demonstrates behavior consistent with the core values and support of our strategic plan.

Job Duties

  • Responsible for the deployment of wireless sites
  • Strong ability to read and comprehend engineered site drawings
  • Dispatch and organize subcontractors for site construction and pre-engineering phases
  • Clear understanding of the requirements for site acquisition, engineering and wireless site construction
  • Completion of regular bid walks for the purpose of understanding overall project execution.
  • Coordinates all resource requirements for projects including personnel, equipment, materials, etc.
  • Reviews work requirements with Program Managers regularly
  • Analyze technical construction issues and develop solutions to address issues.
  • Assist the Program Manager with the close-out of projects as they pertain to punch lists and deficiencies.
  • Ensure construction operations are well organized, coordinated and comply with client requirements.
  • Key on-site liaison between the field team, Project Manager, Landlords, and clients as required.
  • Maintains strong working relationships at job sites with client representatives, subcontractors, suppliers, and the labour work force.
  • Responsible for the installation / commissioning of wireless equipment and coordination of subcontractors
  • Adherence to project schedules and timelines
  • Manage the overall site build from conception to completion.
  • Ensures strict adherence to all WesTower safety programs and policies.
  • Assist with hiring and developing our wireless and technical workforce.
  • Time sheet approval for field staff.
  • A strong advocate of the NCR process as it pertains to our Quality Management system
  • Other duties as required.

Requirements

  • Technical Diploma and/or equivalent work experience.
  • Minimum 5 years of relevant telecommunications wireless construction experience.
  • Must have a solid understanding of the nuances of wireless site builds and an in-depth knowledge of what it takes to build or upgrade a cellular site.
  • Ability to participate in the planning and overall management of a project schedule.
  • Understanding of construction documents and the ability to ensure that they are complete, protect the owner's and WTCs interest, clearly define expectations, and provide incentive to perform.
  • Knowledge of construction project costs and budgets.
  • Ability to build a strong team oriented and HSE conscious culture at the work site.
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills.

Work Conditions

  • Travel to various job sites and other project offices will be required.
  • Primarily an office setting with regular field/site visits.
  • Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals.
  • Interacts with upper and middle management, employees, and clients.
  • Repetitive work.
  • Overtime, as required.

title: Director of Construction
description:
Location: Winnipeg, MB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 3/3/2022Job ID: 9L36304933Category: Engineering & Technical
Join a top employer and advance your career. David Aplin Group has partnered with a Winnipeg-based company to hire a Director of Construction. 

Our client is looking to add a key member to lead their Major Projects team. Reporting to the VP, the Regional Director will be responsible for informing, supporting and implementing the strategy to grow and enhance our operational capabilities within the organization. These responsibilities include leading a profitable project profile while attaining goals related to safety, quality, talent and growth.

Perks & Benefits: 
  • Excellent compensation package that includes a vehicle and bonus program, in addition to much much more

Responsibilities:
  • Develop and implement a strategy to grow and enhance the company
  • Develops effective working relationships with clients to deliver world-class construction solutions, drive repeat or new business and ensure issues/conflicts are resolved
  • Review and assure work proposals and final submissions on identified priority projects
  • Responsible for overseeing and managing planning and scheduling on all projects to ensure that projects are constructed in a safe, timely and cost-effective manner
  • Ensure all projects are adequately staffed with the appropriate resources
  • Accountable for the development and execution of the annual budget
  • Responsible for the hiring, developing and retaining the strongest talent within the industry, Responsible to ensure strong people practices are followed and turnover is low
  • Actively participate in the project and/or risk review meetings to ensure relevant issues are identified and resolved
  • Continuously monitor the organizational structures within the group to ensure optimal performance and delivery of results
  • Assist in the establishment and ensure compliance of operational short-term and long-term goals which are aligned to overall corporate objectives
  • Communicate with employees about the company plans and progress and drive performance toward agreed-upon expectations
  • Accountable for monitoring strong project controls practices within the company and ensuring operational performance issues are proactively managed and mitigated
  • Works closely with finance and operational management teams to review forecasting metrics, manage cash flow, working capital and other critical financial metrics regularly. Anticipates and mitigates issues
  • Works to develop new business within existing markets. Collaborates with internal operational teams to maximize multi-disciplinary construction opportunities
  • Ensures high-quality standards are in place in all operations

Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 10+ years of progressive experience in construction leadership in a related industry (Consulting, General contracting or Architecture)
  • Technical post-secondary degree or diploma preferred or strong knowledge experience in the industry
  • Knowledge of infrastructure-related projects (bridges, WWTP, industrial projects)
  • Experience managing a P&L center and building strong teams
  • Experience in large, complex, and diverse operating environments. Ability to demonstrate strong personal performance and ability to oversee complex project execution
  • Experience in negotiation and demonstrated strong dispute resolution skills
  • Experience effectively leading complex, multi-facet teams
  • Experience developing new business with demonstrated growth in new or existing markets
  • Experience with complex legal concepts related to construction contract law
  • Demonstrated success working with government stakeholders at every level

Job ID: 9L36304933

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-DNP

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Broad Function
This position reports directly to the Project Manager on supporting and growing the business by coordinating all site construction activities and supervises all field personnel as required to successfully complete the project on schedule and within budget.  Ensures all assigned projects are delivered safely, consistently and effectively and are profitably managed and compliant.  Supports building the Brock brand by providing world class service quality to all stakeholders.

Essential Functions
  • Promote, demonstrate and instill Brock’s Bsafe and Bbest culture in all aspects of the business
  • Responsible for site safety, quality, cost and schedule
  • Ensure proper planning and scheduling of resources, monitoring, and taking corrective actions
  • Assist Project Manager in developing and implementing project Execution Plan, Quality Control Plan, and Site Safety Plan.
  • Own the planning and implementation of a project by executing detailed project plans which include timelines, scheduling, logistics, purchasing and training plans
  • Build strong cross-functional operating partnerships across the organization (as defined in role success profile)
  • Ability to understand the contract and successfully initiate change orders
  • Manage changes to project scope through defined change management process
  • Effectively resolves customer issues / discrepancies
  • Ensure that all appropriate authorizations and approvals are in place and job site is free of hazards and or dangerous conditions. prior to the commencement of any work
  • Assist in quoting and performing preliminary job walks for defined projects
  • Responsible for leveraging opportunities to cross sell Brock’s product and service offerings
  • Maintains communication with Project Manager and Business Development to ensure customers’ needs are met 
  • Identify all operations aspects of the job including: labor, equipment, consumables and materials along with any sub-contract requirements
  • Coordinate with Asset Management and Customer on planning/scheduling, and determining materials & manpower demands for defined projects
  • Work with Business Development and Estimating to transition the job from sales to operations utilizing the Healthy Start process
  • Responsible for job cost management and profitability for assigned projects, including daily tracking and reporting for billable and non?billable activities. 
  • Identify appropriate KPIs based on customer and PM requirements and works with project controls to ensure that the site is tracking the proper data and taking corrective action as required.
  • Audit ongoing operations and identifies opportunities for field efficiencies and standardization of methods to improve margins
  • Manage outsourced services within project constraints
  • Follow Brock’s procurement process and manages vendor relationships
  • Manage site supervision and ensures scope, job efficiency and productivity are met
  • Conduct effective performance evaluations and mentors site and supervision and craft employees
  • Identify knowledge gaps and ensures that all site personnel receive appropriate training
  • Determine labor requirements and recruit and hire talented craft personnel within budgeted constraints
  • Ensure all current personnel policies and procedures are implemented and compliant
  • Work closely with Regional HR Manager to resolve all employee issues fairly and equitably
  • Stay current on industry trends and work practices and participates in continuing education opportunities
  • Attend any site meeting where information is exchanged relating to Brock scope work.
  • Don’t wait to be invited to meetings, be proactive and seek out opportunities to become involved
  • All Client/Brock incident reporting policies are met or exceeded
  • Superintendent is responsible to review safety manual stated policies vs. industry or regulatory policies and make recommendations for enhancement to BSL stated policies.
Working Conditions
  • Working conditions include outdoor and indoor field, yard and shop locations.
  • Site specific hazardous environments
  • Working indoors in an office environment
  • Utilization of Personal Protective Equipment is necessary.
  • Willingness to work in highly varying schedule as site conditions dictate


Skills & Abilities:
  • Ability to work within a highly service-oriented team culture
  • Strong understanding of operational impacts on profitability
  • Understands the meaning and implications of key performance indicators
  • Works with PM to generate, evaluate, and act on strategic options and opportunities
  • Manages conflict with a minimum of noise by integrating diverse views and finding common ground or acceptable alternatives
  • High degree of technical ability such as: read/interpret engineering plans, product knowledge, etc.
  • Ability and willingness to seek out areas for improvement and solve problems
  • Demonstrates courage to address difficult issues
  • Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
  • Proven communication and interpersonal skills, including strong leadership skills
  • Strong customer focus on relationship building
  • Strong organizational skills with ability to multi-task
  • High energy level, strong sense of ethics, discretion and adherence to process
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Tools, such as Excel, PowerPoint, Project and Word.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and work independently
  • Comfortable working in a hands-on environment



Education & Experience
  • 10 years of craft supervision experience
  • Advanced craft or project certifications desirable (NACE, NCCER, PMP, PMI, etc.)
  • Knowledge of employment practices (hiring and termination; discipline, attendance, employment regulations, pay practices, etc.)

title: Project Manager, Repairs
description:
About StackTeck Systems Limited

StackTeck, with over five decades of mold building innovation, is a leading source of high productivity tooling solutions for the injection molding industry. StackTeck supplies a wide range of injection molds and IML automation used to produce plastic parts in applications such as caps, closures, medical, PET preforms, and thinwall packaging; as well as complete system integrations including IML.  StackTeck has dedicated R&D, testing and part sampling facilities, in addition to plastic part design, prototyping, engineering, and manufacturing capabilities.  StackTeck Systems Ltd. is located 8 km north of Toronto’s Pearson International Airport.

SUMMARY:  The primary role of the Project Manager is to manage and expedite customer’s repair projects through the required processes at the Teck Center and with sub- contractors where required.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Take inventory and document (including pictures) of all received repairs and file them in the system.
  • Inspect and assess deficiencies and determine all modifications required.
  • Generate inspection reports.
  • Ensure quotes and shop orders are up to date and accurate by evaluating incoming projects to ensure scope mirrors Purchase Order with the customer.
  • Predetermine revised steel sizes of all modified components in consultation with Engineering.
  • Support engineering and assist with Repair BOM’s, ordering materials, confirming all materials are received and drawings are updated.
  • Coordinate Subcontractors and ensure costs are in line and PO’s are complete and manage subcontractor process in full to ensure all work completed to specifications (weld, chrome or coating included)
  • Schedule test and determine full requirements for test (supports, CD’s, resins). Determine rework after test, if required to ensure customer deadlines are met.
  • Prepare jobs for shipping ensuring all components are accounted for and listed on the approve to ship documents.
  • Direct communication with customers, Sales and Engineering regarding project details.
  • Ensure all work practices are conducted in a safe and effective manner, as per company policy.
  • Continually monitor ongoing job progress and provide the team updates during the daily Gemba walks.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE/EXPERIENCE:

  • 1) Post-Secondary education – Completion of College or University – Engineering or Business
  • 2 years practical experience in the injection mold manufacturing and/or precision machining 
  • Strong multi-tasking ability and technical problem solving skills.
  • Previous Project Management training and or experience.
  • Drive towards continuous improvement.

 

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, (AODA), StackTeck will provide accommodation, accessible formats, and communication supports for the recruitment process upon request.

title: Construction Finishing Superintendent - Niagara Region
description:
Overview:

Walsh  is currently seeking a Finishing Superintendent in the Niagara Region.

 

Are you someone that will take ownership for ensuring things are handled right? Do you trust your instincts to ensure that a project is carried out safely? Do you strive to finish projects on schedule and on budget to the highest standard of quality? If yes, then keep reading!

 

As a fourth-generation, family-owned business, Walsh recruits individuals who are seeking a small company feel with a large company backing.   Walsh is a successful fast-growing company at the forefront of technology and is committed to being the employer of choice to our employees and the builder of choice to our customers.

Walsh is a company where, when you work hard, you will be recognized. If this sounds like you, please apply!

Responsibilities:
  • Overall management of field operations
  • Create and manage project schedule
  • Coordination of subcontracts, drawings, and specifications
  • Establishing budgets and controlling cost
  • Identify the causes of cost variances and eliminate negative variances
  • Identify project risk, and work to mitigate it
  • Communicate quality standards to each subcontractor and vendor
  • Conduct systematic quality control inspections
  • Follows company safety program, laws, and OSHA operating standards
  • Manages jobsite cleanliness  
  • Prepares daily time cards for personnel under supervision
  • Prepares daily logs
Qualifications:
  • High School diploma
  • 6+ years of experience
  • Basic computer skills are preferred
  • Specific roles may require relocation

The Walsh Group offers  competitive wages and benefits,  including:

  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
  • Generous Vacation Time & Paid Holidays
  • Company RRSP Matching Contributions
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Maternity Leave Policy
  • Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • Term Life and AD&D Insurance

If hired by The Walsh Group, you must be in compliance with your employment locationâ€™s COVID-19 related requirements, if any.

 

The Walsh Group, Ltd. Is committed to providing equal opportunity to qualified applicants with disabilities to compete for jobs. To request a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, please contact the Human Resources Department at 312-563-5905 or

hr@walshgroup.com

.

 

An Equal Opportunity Employer, Disability/Veteran

title: Surintendant de chantier / Site Superintendent
description:
VERSION FRANÇAISE

Surintendant de chantier

 

À propos du poste

Le groupe IBE est à la recherche d'un surintendant de chantier pour leur emplacement de Montréal.

 

À propos de l'entreprise

Le Groupe IBE est une entreprise d'entrepreneur général au sein du domaine de la construction qui se spécialise dans les secteurs résidentiels, commerciaux et institutionnels. Nous exécutons une variété de projets à l'échelle internationale. Nous sommes une équipe unie, diversifiée, ambitieuse et multidisciplinaire. Notre objectif est de fournir des solutions optimales à nos clients en leur apportant notre expertise en gestion de projet et notre expertise technique.

Nous sommes une équipe agile en pleine expansion. Nous valorisons la communication, la transparence, l'apprentissage continu et le travail d'équipe. Nous nous efforçons de nous développer et d'atteindre ensemble nos objectifs communs. Nous avons de grandes aspirations et nous apprécions les idées de notre équipe.

En rejoignant le groupe IBE, vous faites partie d'une équipe qui veut votre succès. Vous aurez les outils et l'opportunité de perfectionner vos compétences et de faire partie de projets passionnants.

 

Principales responsabilités:

  • Superviser, coordonner et organiser le travail des employés du site
  • Assurer le respect des normes de sécurité au travail, du programme de prévention et de l'entretien du site de façon continue et rigoureuse
  • Gérer et surveiller les budgets de quantité, les commandes de matériel et les locations
  • Compléter la demande d'achat selon la méthode établie
  • Inspecter et assurer la qualité du travail
  • Assurer une communication fluide pour la transmission des documents de chantier au bureau dans un délai normal et régulier tout au long du projet
  • Suivi de tout « avis de changement » sur le chantier
  • Entretenir une relation professionnelle et de confiance avec les clients, les chefs de projet, les fournisseurs et les sous-traitants

 

Exigences du rôle:

  • Baccalauréat
  • Entre 1 à 4 ans d'expérience en tant que surintendant de projets de construction de bâtiments institutionnels ou commerciaux
  • Parfaitement bilingue en français et en anglais (parlé, lu et écrit)
  • Connaissance approfondie de la santé et de la sécurité au travail
  • Sens de responsabilité
  • Compétences en gestion, négociation et communication

 

Ce que nous offrons:

  • Salaire compétitif
  • Assurance collective pour soins médicaux et dentaires
  • Cotisations REER possibles
  • Accompagnement dans votre formation et développement
  • Possibilité d'évolution au sein de l'organisation
  • Prime de performance
  • Allocations et avantages sociaux éventuels (voiture, essence, etc.)
  • Stationnement gratuit au centre de Montréal (ou à 5 minutes à pied du métro)

 

Cela ressemble à la prochaine étape de votre carrière? Si oui, nous serions ravis de discuter avec vous!

 

ENGLISH VERSION

Site Superintendent

 

About the job

The IBE Group is looking for a Site Superintendent for their Montreal location.

 

About the company

The IBE Group is a general contractor company working in the construction industry in residential, commercial and institutional sectors. We execute a variety of projects internationally. We are a tight-knit, diverse, ambitious and multi-disciplinary team. Our objective is to provide optimal solutions to our clients by providing them with our project management and technical expertise.

We are an agile team in full expansion. We value communication, transparency continuous learning and teamwork. We thrive on developing ourselves and achieving our common goals together. We have big aspirations, and we value our team's ideas.

When joining the IBE group, you become part of a team that wants your success. You will be given the tools and opportunity to hone your skills and be part of exciting projects.

 

Main Responsibilities:

  • Supervise, coordinate and organize the work of site employees
  • Ensure compliance with occupational safety standards, the prevention program and site maintenance on a continuous and rigorous basis
  • Manage and monitor quantity budgets, material orders and rentals
  • Complete the purchase request according to the established method
  • Inspect and ensure the quality of the work
  • Ensure fluid communication for the transmission of site documents to the office within a normal and regular period throughout the project
  • Follow up on any "notice of change" at the worksite
  • Maintain a professional and trusting relationship with clients, project managers, suppliers and subcontractors

 

Role Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree
  • Between 1 to 4 years of experience as a superintendent of institutional or commercial building construction projects
  • Perfectly bilingual in French and English (spoken, read and written)
  • Thorough knowledge of Occupational Health and Safety
  • Sense of responsibility
  • Management, negotiation and communication skills

 

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Group insurance for medical and dental
  • Possible RRSP contributions
  • Support in your training and development
  • Possibility for advancement within the organization
  • Performance bonus
  • Possible allowances and perk benefits (car, gas, etc.)
  • Free parking in the center of Montreal (or 5 minute walk from the metro)

 

Does this sound like the next step in your career? If so, we'd love to talk with you!

title: Coordonnateur·rice national·e, Construction
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Référer un ami (https://www.smartrecruiters.com/referrals-portal/navigation/posting/743999805167548) 
 
 Company Description
 

 
Chez McDonald’s, nous mettons tout en œuvre pour demeurer un modèle d’excellence, et nous recrutons pour ce faire les meilleurs candidats. Notre équipe est constituée de talents exceptionnels venus des quatre coins du monde : des spécialistes de la résolution de problème, des amoureux du risque, des innovateurs et des penseurs qui prennent leur travail au sérieux sans jamais négliger le plaisir. Nous nous mettons au défi de cultiver notre esprit et nos connaissances au quotidien. La croissance personnelle et professionnelle est au cœur de nos activités, tout comme les célébrations et les récompenses entourant les réussites.
 

 
Job Description
 

 
Titre du poste : Coordonnateur·rice national·e, Construction
 

 
Service : Développement de restaurants
 

 
Échelon du poste : Coordonnateur·rice (G1)
 

 
Relève de : Directeur de la Construction – région de l’Est
 

 
Type de poste : Temps plein, permanent
 

 
L’occasion
 

 
Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un·e coordonnateur·rice au sein de l’équipe nationale de la Construction, qui se concentrera avant tout sur les restaurants de l’Ontario.
 

 
Qui vous êtes
 

 
Vous êtes une personne entreprenante et autonome qui aime prendre des initiatives. Vous pouvez gérer plusieurs projets et tenir plusieurs engagements simultanément et aimez travailler dans un environnement dynamique. Vous êtes une personne organisée, coopérative, axée sur la résolution de problèmes et passionnée par le service à la clientèle.
 

 
Ce que vous obtenez
 

 
Il s’agit d’une occasion sans pareil de vous joindre à une organisation gagnante pendant une période effervescente de changement transformationnel. Vous vous ferez connaître à tous les échelons de l’entreprise, des membres de votre équipe aux dirigeants et franchisés. Vous intégrerez une culture gagnante qui favorise un développement tous azimuts où vous influencerez de façon tangible les projets centraux.
 

 
Principales responsabilités En plus de respecter les politiques et les marches à suivre de McDonald’s, la personne choisie assumera les principales responsabilités suivantes :
 

 
Administration de la Construction
 

 

 
+ Coordonner la création de nouveaux emplacements dans les bases de données adéquates
 

 
+ Aider à la distribution et à l’approbation des budgets d’investissement
 

 
+ Téléverser et tenir à jour les renseignements sur les baux dans les bases de données adéquates
 

 
+ Créer et administrer des projets de construction dans MBS (McDonald’s eBusiness Suite – Oracle) Les principales responsabilités relatives aux processus sont les suivantes :
 

 
+ Créer des budgets et des bons de commande pour les projets, ce qui comprend l’envoi de demandes de prix pour les nouveaux projets
 

 
+ Surveiller et, à l’occasion, soutenir l’acquittement des reçus et des factures
 

 
+ Aider au processus d’appel d’offres pour les nouveaux projets de construction et vérifier que tous les documents requis ont été soumis par l’entrepreneur général avant le début de la construction Gérer et soutenir la création des bons de commande de l’entrepreneur général, les tirages mensuels, les ordres de modification et les retenues de garantie
 

 
+ Respecter la limite de 150 jours pour tous les projets de construction
 

 

 

 
+ Entrer les nouveaux fournisseurs dans le système de comptes créditeurs et aider à la formation des nouveaux entrepreneurs généraux et fournisseurs
 

 
+ Surveiller et mettre à jour les horaires de construction dans le répertoire canadien et PCA
 

 
+ S’assurer que les dossiers du restaurant sont organisés et tenus à jour, et qu’ils contiennent les renseignements requis mentionnés sur la Liste de vérification des documents requis du dossier de construction
 

 
+ Coordonner/planifier différentes réunions
 

 

 
Administration générale
 

 

 
+ Soutien administratif au service régional de la Construction de restaurants, et soutien supplémentaire au service (réunions, calendriers, etc.)
 

 
+ Partage de fonctions administratives, comme la lecture et la distribution du courrier à l’intérieur du service et, à l’occasion, l'organisation de déplacements
 

 

 
Relations
 

 

 
+ Favoriser l’approche de développement de la région; travailler de pair avec les homologues régionaux, le Franchisage, les Finances et le Service aux franchisés
 

 
+ Maintenir les relations entre le personnel régional, les conseillers, les entrepreneurs généraux, les fournisseurs et les franchisés
 

 

 
Qualifications
 

 

 
+ De 3 à 5 ans d’expérience de travail pertinente
 

 
+ Compétences éprouvées en coordination de projets et expérience en administration dans le milieu de la construction, un atout
 

 
+ Excellentes connaissances informatiques, surtout dans l’environnement Microsoft Office : Word, Excel et PowerPoint
 

 
+ Connaissance approfondie de Sharepoint, Teams et d’autres outils de collaboration en ligne
 

 
+ Solide connaissance (ou capacité à acquérir cette connaissance) d’Oracle, y compris les services du siège social, les bureaux régionaux et les restaurants, un atout
 

 
+ Aptitudes exceptionnelles à la communication écrite et verbale
 

 
+ Habileté à lire et à comprendre des documents de nature juridique
 

 
+ Aptitude de travail avec les chiffres et les données, un atout
 

 
+ Bon sens de l’organisation; excellente capacité à effectuer des tâches multiples, à établir des priorités et à travailler simultanément sur divers projets avec des échéanciers très serrés, tout en maintenant un niveau supérieur de rigueur et de minutie
 

 
+ Expérience de travail dans un environnement dynamique avec capacité à s’adapter rapidement au changement
 

 

 
Additional Information
 

 
McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request. 
 

 
Requsition ID: REF2808L

McDonald's Corporation and McDonald's USA, LLC (the "Company") are committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances.

McDonald's and its franchisees are taking proactive steps in response to the COVID-19 outbreak to ensure the safety in our restaurants across all communities. Our values of quality, service, and cleanliness continue to guide us. We're following direction from the CDC, state, and local governments and adhering to our deep cleaning procedures in every restaurant, every day. We also fully support employees who stay home from work if they are feeling sick. Read more about the ways we are prioritizing health at https://news.mcdonalds.com/news-releases/news-release-details/prioritizing-health-safety-and-community-mcdonalds-shares.

McDonald's and its franchisees are always looking for top candidates and encourage you to apply online. If you have any questions, please first call the restaurant as this will help the restaurant comply with any social distancing guidelines or other compliance obligations. For corporate roles, please proceed to the online application, or if you already applied, contact supportteam@us.mcd.com</section>

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Superintendent (Construction)

Gottardo Group of Companies is a Developer as well as office, commercial & industrial builders, with properties and land for sale and lease. Head office is located in Vaughan.

Immediate opening for Site Superintendents responsible for:
  • Ensuring appropriate resources are allocated and maintained to facilitate projects from start to completion - scheduling, cost control, contract administration.

Requirements:
  • Minimum seven (7) years experience.
  • Well-developed knowledge of the construction process and management.

title: Maintenance Coordinator- Afternoon Shift
description:
You already LOVE us and the SNACKS WE MAKE

Chips, Cookies, Crackers, Wafers, Cheese Curls, Popcorn, Tortilla Chips... yeah, we make them ALL! Shearer's is the company behind all your favorite snack brands.

We have nearly 5,000 associates in 11 state-of-the-art manufacturing and warehouse sites in North America that produce over 800 million pounds of snacks per year.  Did you know that we buy 20% of all the potatoes grown in the US?  WOW!

And we know what you're thinking…how can I get my hands on some free goodies?Our team members can crunch on oodles of free snacks – everyday!

At Shearer's, we provide the safest environment possible for our employees by providing proper PPE (Personal Protective Equipment), frequent and thorough sanitation practices, social distancing, daily temperature checks. Safety is our absolute priority.

 

Maintenance Coordinator  - Guelph, Canada

Afternoon Shift 

 3:00 PM - 11:30 PM - Monday to Friday

Hourly Pay

 $40.19

(in addition, .30 shift premium for afternoons)

Your seat at the best snacks table:

The Maintenance Coordinator handles various areas of business repair and aids in the implementation of maintenance procedures. Directly supervises and coordinates the activities of maintenance millwrights and electricians engaged in setup, install, repair, and maintaining of machinery, provides training on equipment, and keeps personnel records. Support continuous improvement objectives to improve safety, quality, and throughput processes. Ensures all work plans, specifications, labour & materials are accurately & consistently recorded against specified assets in our internal Maintenance tracking system.

What you bring to the party:

  • Physically capable of heavy lifting of 50 lbs. or more
  • Licensed 433A Industrial maintenance mechanic or 309A or 442A Electrical license
  • Five (5) years of facilities maintenance experience
  • Excellent analytical and reasoning skills, plus excellent organization skills required
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Please note: we have the following allergens in our facility:  Peanuts, Wheat, Whey, Dairy and Soya

We offer a variety pack of benefits:

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Retirement Savings Plan with Match, Short and Long Term Disability, Employee Assistance Plan and a great group of people to work with every day!

You will be considered for employment in our inclusive workplace:

Shearer's Foods Canada, Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please advise us if you require accommodation during the recruitment process.

This is your invitation to apply now!

title: Coordonnateur gestion des bâtiments et projets
description:
COORDONNATEUR GESTION DES BÂTIMENTS ET PROJETS

Groupe Robert est en pleine croissance! Vous avez envie de participer à la construction d'un grand centre de distribution automatisé à la fine pointe de la technologie? Vous voulez que Groupe Robert vous amène plus loin professionnellement? Cette opportunité est pour vous!

Groupe Robert est à la recherche d'un Coordonnateur gestion des bâtiments et projets pour combler un besoin permanent à temps plein.

Nous offrons:

- 3 semaines de vacances par année
- Fond de pension
- Assurances collectives complètes
- Possibilités d'avancement

Your responsibilities will be as follows:

Les tâches reliées au poste de Coordonnateur gestion des bâtiments et projets sont:

  • Effectuer des visites de chantiers, relever les anomalies et prendre les actions appropriées;
  • Vérifier, contrôler et recommander les avenants;
  • Faire le suivi de l'avancement des travaux, des coûts et des demandes de modification;
  • Valider que les travaux sont exécutés selon les documents contractuels;
  • Contrôler la qualité des travaux;

In order to join Groupe Robert's team, you must have:

Les exigences pour le poste de Coordonnateur gestion des bâtiments et projets sont les suivantes:

  • Détenir un baccalauréat en génie civil, génie de la construction ou génie du bâtiment
  • Candidat à la profession d’ingénieur et/ou membre en règle de l’Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec
  • 3 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire
  • Carte ASP Construction
  • Maîtrise du français et anglais parlé et écrit
  • Permis de conduire
  • Maîtrise des normes, loi et règlements en vigueur
  • Maîtrise du logiciel AutoCAD et de la suite Office
  • Maîtrise des bonnes pratiques en gestion de projets
  • Autonome et minutieux
  • Capacité de travailler en équipe
  • Bonne aptitude analytique et de résolution de problème

Groupe Robert offers you:

Groupe Robert vous offre les avantages suivants :• Environnement dynamique et enrichissant.• Assurances collectives et avantages sociaux compétitifs;• Stabilité et sécurité d’emploi;• Entreprise aux valeur familiales;Le poste de Coordonnateur gestion des bâtiments et projets vous intéresse? Postulez directement en ligne ou communiquez avec Rachelle au 514-835-4233.

Schedules

Day

Groupe Robert is proud to support the diversity of its employees through its terminals in Quebec and Ontario. Women, visible and / or ethnic minorities or people with disabilities will always be welcome to apply, because at Groupe Robert, the diversity of our employees is the link in our logistics chain that makes us even stronger!

title: Directeur, Produits et Services (équipements de construction)
description:
Notre client, une grande entreprise québécoise offrant des services de réparation et de location d'équipements aux entreprises et aux particuliers, est présentement à la recherche d'un DIRECTEUR PRODUITS ET SERVICES pour son siège social situé à Montréal.

Le DIRECTEUR PRODUITS ET SERVICES a pour principale mission d'assurer une gestion efficace des actifs d'équipements à louer dans ses différentes succursales et de recommander l'acquisition de nouveaux produits et services pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle.

RESPONSABILITÉS:

  • Optimiser la performance financière de l'ensemble de la flotte d'outils et d'équipements en fonction des besoins régionaux, le tout en collaboration avec les équipes aux ventes, au marketing, à l'approvisionnement et aux opérations régionales;
  •  Redéfinir et suivre le processus d'introduction de nouveaux produits afin d'améliorer le taux de succès de ceux-ci;
  • Être à l'affût des tendances du marché en participant à des forums de discussions, foires industrielles et commerciales, regroupements professionnels, études de marché et contacts avec les fournisseurs;
  • Rédiger un plan stratégique 0 -5 ans pour l'acquisition d'actifs par l'entreprise.
  • Appuyer le service des Approvisionnements pour structurer le processus d'appels d'offres en équipements et en outils,
  • Analyser les offres des différents fournisseurs et effectuer les recommandations d'achats;
  • Bâtir des rapports opérationnels de gestion

EXIGENCES:

  • 5 à 7 ans dans un poste similaire
  • Solides connaissances des enjeux, processus et outils industriels
  • Expérience dans les milieux de la construction, industriels, entreposage et transport
  • Connaissances avancées des logiciels Excel, Power Bi et utilisation SQL et suite Office 365
  • Bonnes connaissances des principes de gestion financière
  • Sens de la planification et de l'analyse
  • Esprit innovateur
  • Axé solution
  • Attitude corporative
  • Grande capacité à travailler en équipe
  • Autonomie, initiative, et grand sens des responsabilités
  • Intérêt marqué pour la mécanique et l'électronique ainsi que les nouvelles technologies
  • Capacité à travailler sur plus d'un projet à la fois
  • Bilinguisme

title: Directeur de Territoire- Équipement de Construction Compact / Territory Manager - Compact Construction Equipment
description:
Brandt est actuellement à la recherche d'un Directeur de territoire- Équipement de construction compact pour sa succursale de Brossard.

Le candidat retenu sera responsable de la démonstration et de la vente de l’équipement de construction compact de John Deere, y compris les chargeuses compactes, les chargeuses compactes sur chenilles et les mini-excavatrices, ainsi que les produits Ditch Witch, Workshight et d’autres lignes de fabricants associés.

Fonctions et responsabilités

  • Vendre des produits/équipements neufs et usagés
  • Faire au moins 7 appels par jour dans le territoire assigné
  • Prospection de nouveaux comptes/relations d’affaires
  • Supporter les clients
  • Supporter les comptes recevables pour la collection
  • Soumettre des rapports d’appel hebdomadaires
  • Soumettre les rapports de ventes perdues en temps opportun

Compétences requises

  • Excellentes compétences en communication – à l’oral et à l’écrit – requis
  • La connaissance du secteur de l’équipement et de la construction est considérée comme un atout

Expérience requise

  • Posséder et conserver un passeport valide et être en mesure de voyager à l’étranger
  • Expérience préalable de la vente- requis
  • Un dossier de conducteur récent sera requis

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Brandt is currently seeking a Territory Manager - Compact Construction Equipment for our Brossard location.

The successful applicant will be responsible for the demonstration and sale of John Deere Compact Construction Equipment, including skid steers, compact track loaders, and mini excavators, as well as Ditch Witch, Worksight light compaction equipment, and other associated manufacturer's lines.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Sales of new and used utility wholegoods
  • Minimum of 7 personal calls per day in assigned territory
  • Prospecting for new accounts
  • Assist with customer relations
  • Assist with account receivable collections
  • Submit call reports weekly
  • Submit lost sales reports on a timely basis

Required Skills

  • Excellent communication skills – verbal and written – are required
  • Knowledge of the equipment and construction industry is considered an asset

Required Experience

  • Must possess and maintain a valid passport and be able to travel internationally
  • Previous sales experience is required
  • A recent driver’s abstract will be required

title: Plumbing Superintendent
description:
Job Description:

Full-time, Permanent

Date Posted: December 21, 2021

 

Who we areâ€¦

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 111-year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams:   the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events.   The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance.   The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organizationâ€™s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution.   With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to â€œDeliver Memorable Experiencesâ€ for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees, or the community.

Under the direction of the Director Tech Services, and supervising the plumbing team, the Plumbing Superintendent  will ensure that the required plumbing and gas fitting tasks are completed on site.   This position is responsible for ensuring that the plumbing team is in compliance with WorksafeBC regulations, other applicable legislation, and company policies.  

 

Why join our Team?

  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Be a part of the growth of one of Vancouverâ€™s most iconic institutions
  • Join a diverse, passionate, and enthusiastic team

 

What will you do this year?

In your role as a Plumbing Superintendent, your primary accountabilities will include:

  • Planning, organizing, assigning, assisting, supervising, and reviewing the work of the plumbing team involved in the plumbing and gas fitting trades.
  • Holding the PNEâ€™s Plumbing Business and Gas Contracting License.
  • Preparing project estimates, requisition materials, equipment, labour, and maintaining cost records.
  • Ensuring systematic inspections, maintenance, and repair of park facilities.
  • Developing, recommending, and applying new or improved work techniques and methods; employ the use of machinery, equipment, and tools applicable to the trade.
  • Aiding in the preparation of the annual budget.
  • Conducting regular toolbox talks, hazard assessments and equipment inspections.
  • Ensuring teams under supervision are working within WCB regulations.
  • Recommending new equipment needed to achieve efficient operations in trade.
  • Inspecting work in progress and upon completion for conformance of plans, instructions, and codes.
  • Liaising with other Forepersons and staff to co-ordinate specific trade projects.
  • Appointing and assigning duties to lead hands during the Fair.
  • Operating vehicles and equipment as required.
  • Effect a systematic maintenance and repair program ensuring that all documentation is completed and readily accessible.
  • Developing and maintaining records, written reports, and daily timesheets.
  • Interpreting the Collective Agreement correctly to help prevent grievances.
  • Performing other related duties as assigned.

What else?

  • A Trades Qualification (TQ) Certificate as a Journeyman Plumber is required.
  • A Gas Certificate and Backflow Preventer Certificate for the Province of BC is required.
  • A minimum of 5 â€“ 7 years of experience in plumbing, mechanical, gas, and water main installation and maintenance is required.
  • A minimum of 3 â€“ 5 yearsâ€™ experience supervising and leading a team of skilled plumbers is required.
  • Thorough knowledge of the methods, practices, materials, tools, and equipment used in the plumbing and gas fitting trades is required.
  • A valid Class 5 BC Driverâ€™s License, and submittal of an up-to-date Driverâ€™s Abstract confirming a clean driving record (and re-submit upon license renewal) is required.
  • Proven experience in project management, ensuring deadlines are met and project roadblocks are communicated.
  • Demonstrated ability to leverage interpersonal skills, including communication, diplomacy, and flexibility, to establish and maintain effective work relationships with management, staff, contractors, and the public.
  • Experience operating mobile mechanical and aerial lift equipment.
  • Experience reading and interpreting blueprints and work sketches.
  • Working knowledge of computer applications such as Microsoft Office.
  • Demonstrated ability to follow corporate and department policies and procedures, and reliably attend work without lateness or attendance issues.
  • May be required to work overtime in emergency situations and during peak operational periods.
  • Physically capable of safely performing assigned work in accordance with the Occupational Health & Safety Regulations, working outdoors, lifting, walking, and working in awkward positions.
  • Successful candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check.

Who are you?

  • Passionate
  • Hardworking
  • Team player
  • Reliable
  • Motivated by fast-paced environments

 

Where and when to APPLY?

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

The PNE is proud to be an  equal  opportunity  employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at  

hr@pne.ca

.

title: Electrical Superintendent
description:
Electrical Superintendent

Apply now »



Date:Apr 7, 2022


Location: Toronto, ON, CA


Company: RailWorks




Job ID: 11973


Position Summary


Reporting to the Operations Manager or designate, the Superintendent oversees and manages all phases of railway track construction and maintenance projects including coordinating workers, materials and equipment, supervising sub-contractors, ensuring that specifications are being followed and that work is completed safely, on schedule and within budget.





Primary Duties and Responsibilities

+ Ensures adequate resources are in place including scheduling labour, equipment, materials.

+ Performs in-depth review of drawings, designs and contract documentation to become familiar with all details, notes and requirements.

+ Supervises total construction and maintenance effort in the field to ensure work is in accordance with design, budget and schedule.

+ Monitors quality standards of all work, including sub-contractor performance.

+ Assigns work to the various crews.

+ Responsible for productivity of workers and efficient use of materials and equipment

+ Reports production quantities to the office and reviews labour productivity reports on a weekly basis.

+ Monitors and adheres to established budgets for the job.

+ Investigates alternative work methods and materials which will either improve efficiency and/or the quality of work performed.

+ Monitors job schedules and coordinates sub-contractors’ work and suppliers’ deliveries and equipment needs, taking appropriate action as necessary.

+ Ensures all field personnel comply with Company policies, project procedures, safety program and work rules, taking corrective action as necessary.

+ The Superintendent will be on-site as well as in the office







 


General/Other Responsibilities

+ Reviews and approves timesheets for accuracy, job coding, equipment, material, etc.

+ Participates in invoicing, identifies and administers extra to be invoiced. Gets involved with outstanding A/R’s when required.

+ Establishes and maintains effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

+ Acts as a liaison among owners, inspectors, staff and subcontractors.

+ Assists with the preparation of written reports and/or updates for management, client, and project team, to ensure a clear understanding of project status.










Qualifications

+ High School graduation plus post-secondary training in a related field or equivalent education, training and experience.

+ A minimum of 5 years recent related construction experience including a thorough knowledge of construction industry practices, methods and process. Prior railway experience is preferred by not required.

+ Demonstrated experience applying knowledge of basic project controls, material management, contract management, subcontract management.

+ Track record of successfully executing projects on schedule and within budget.

+ Current First Aid, WHMIS.

+ Valid and clean Driver’s License.










#LI-RG1-PNR




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with PNR RailWorks without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.

title: ESAP Electrical Project Manager
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald’s Ottawa team is growing! If you are committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you.

This opportunity relates to the modernization of the heating and cooling energy distribution systems to over 80 buildings in the National Capital Region. The ESAP project involves construction of four new central heating and cooling plants plus associated distribution piping networks over a period of five years, under a Joint Venture Partnership with another leading major Contractor. The Project Manager will have responsibility for a defined scope of work within an integrated project team. The Project Manager will oversee the engineering design, and be responsible to plan, organize, coordinate, procure, control and evaluate the scope of work from start to finish according to schedule, specifications and budget of a new CHCP to be constructed in Gatineau, Quebec.

Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Ensure company safety policy is adhered to on all projects
  • Provide oversight of the electrical design of a new CHCP
  • Manage the procurement and delivery of materials and equipment
  • Manage and provide scheduling, planning, organizing of labor, and subcontractors
  • Coordinate with mechanical team and other disciplines
  • Manage the change order process for extras and revisions to the scope of work
  • Liaison with owner, engineers, subcontractors, and tradespersons
  • Monitor and increase labor productivity
  • Responsible for cost control and forecasting
  • Attend and run project meetings
  • Prepare and submit construction work packages and estimates as required
  • Review work/contracts/WIP for areas of risk and correct deficiencies
  • Liaison with Authorities Having Jurisdiction

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Change Orientation
  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Problem Solving and Innovation
  • Teamwork and Collaboration

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

Degree or Diploma in

  • Construction Management
  • Engineering

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 5-10 years’ experience in the construction industry

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Advance knowledge and understanding of:

  • Contract management
  • Construction scheduling, planning, and execution
  • Applicable local and provincial labor codes
  • Business operations processes
  • Organization and time management
  • Bilingual in French & English

Proficient user of:

  • MS Office (Word, Excel, Project)

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities.

Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

If you are an existing Black & McDonald employee, please notify your supervisor of your interest and intent to apply before applying.

title: Superintendent/Project Managers in the Ft. McMurray Area
description:
We are currently looking for Superintendent/Project Managers for Projects in Ft McMurray and Buffalo Region!!         #LI-DNI

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Opportunities for Multiple Projects in the Wood Buffalo Region
  • Drive-in and out as well as Fly in/Fly out
  • Competitive Compensation packages
  • Employee Benefit Program including medical and dental coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Training and Advancement Opportunities across Phoenix Group of Companies

Who You Are – You are a talented individual with proven experience in leading successful project teams. You thrive on teamwork, collaboration, and mentoring. You are not afraid of a challenge, can pivot like a champion. You understand that the success of the project is interwoven with the success of the project team. You want a company that values your experience, skillset, and proven leadership ability. We are that company!

What you Bring:

  • Proven experience in leading successful project teams with 5-10 years of previous experience in supervisory/management role in the industrial construction or Oil & Gas industry
  • Strategically oversee, monitor, and manage of a project 
  • Combination of work experience in a similar role and industry related trade certification / education
  • Pivotal in planning, organizing, and controlling a project to meet and exceed expectations
  • Ensuring utilization and compliance of corporate policies and procedures 
  • Prioritization of business needs, while keeping projects aligned with organizations strategy and portfolio direction
  • Provide guidance to project staff, responsible for the smooth functioning of day-to-day operations by influencing, developing and implementing field project plans and schedule
  • Effectively communicate all issues, resolve conflicts and removing obstacles to progress
  • Able to liaise between Clients and Company Ownership
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment
  • Previous Experience: construction manager, construction, manager, construction supervisor, general manager, construction management, construction superintendent, superintendent, supervisor, construction site supervisor, Foreman, General Foreman, construction

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Drivers License/Clean Abstract
  • Successful completion of background check and/or additional assessments
  • Leadership for Excellence Certificate
  • Standard First Aid
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015
     
See Job Description

title: Travelling Site Superintendent - UNITED STATES
description:
SAJO is in search of dynamic individuals for the position of TRAVELLING SITE SUPERINTENDENT in the UNITED STATES.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Education: A technical diploma in the areas of building or construction technology
  • Experience: 3+ years of on-site construction experience in retail build-out
 
SKILLS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  • The superintendent is responsible for the supervision of construction sites and for ensuring that site conditions comply with code and health and safety regulations. As well, he/she ensures adherence to the quality standards, specifications and schedule of the projects. The superintendent sets up site meetings as needed and performs, daily, all the tasks required to keep the project on track and to update all required reports and documentation. As well, he/she must remain in steady communication with the project manager and other team members. The superintendent is key to ensuring the successful and timely completion of the projects at hand. 
  • The superintendent must have good interpersonal skills, capable of resolving conflictual situations. He/she must be reliable and flexible and able to diffuse stress at critical moments.
  • The superintendent must be results-driven and have a sense of urgency.
  • Computer literacy is required.
  • Good communication in English.
 

To Submit Your Curriculum Vitae
 
By Mail:           
Director of Human Resources
1320 Graham 
Ville Mt-Royal, Québec
H3P 3C8

By internet:     

hr@sajoinc.com

title: Project Controls Manager
description:
Position Responsibilities:

We have an exciting opportunity for a Project Controls Manager  interested in joining our growing industry leading team. Youâ€™ll be responsible for managing cost on a portfolio of engineering projects. You will have the chance to work on project teams using your expertise in WBS setup, forecasting, invoicing, change management, cost management, project cost analysis, project earn value measurement tracking, risk management, proposals /pricing, cashflow, reporting and financial forecasting. You are an individual that is proactive, can meet deadlines and has strong problem solving and data analysis skills.

 

Bring your entrepreneurial spirit to IPS and be part of a growing dynamic team that delivers world class designs for our pharmaceutical clients and their facilities, which could include Biologic, Vaccine, API (organic synthesis), oral (OSD) and parenteral (Aseptic) drug products.

 

You will be working mainly from home (unless you prefer to work in the Vaughan or Montreal office), but youâ€™ll have to be available to travel to our Vaughan office for occasional team /client meetings (up to 10% of time).

Qualifications & Requirements:
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in construction management, engineering, project management, project accounting or related technical field preferred however experience in lieu of degree is acceptable
  • At least 10 years of project cost controls experience
  • Experience with scheduling software (P6) required
  • Understanding of engineering project delivery processes. Experience applying the principles of project control to the development of cost control work processes.
  • Experience working on various projects to include coordinating and executing project issues
  • Demonstrating effective leadership in the execution of cost control activities on projects
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex cost information to varied audiences including engineering, project/construction management, and project teams
  • Ability to write accurate and meaningful project status reports. Advanced Excel skills
  • Experience with cost management systems a plus (ecosys, prism, cobra, etc) is a plus
  • Entrepreneurial spirit, displaying creativity and innovation by continually working to improve solutions, tools, methods and service delivery system
Company Overview:

About Us

 

IPS-Integrated Project Services is a global leader in developing innovative and cost effective solutions for the engineering, construction, commissioning and qualification of complex pharmaceutical and biotech research and manufacturing facilities. With technical expertise spanning R&D to pilot-scale to large-scale production, our team specializes in the technology, trends and regulatory environment to successfully deliver capital projects and improve operations. For over thirty years, we have applied unique LEAN methodologies throughout the project life cycle, continually finding ways to do things better and more efficiently, delivering higher quality and controlling costs. Headquartered in Blue Bell, PA, IPS is a multi-national company with over 1,700 professionals worldwide and offices in California, Kansas, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Brazil, Canada, China, Ireland, Singapore, Switzerland, Germany, United Kingdom and four locations in India. Visit our website at www.ipsdb.com.

 

Specialties

 

Process Architecture, Process Design, Engineering, Construction, Commissioning, Qualification, LEAN Project Delivery, Strategic Master Planning, Energy Conservation Management, Project Controls, Program/Project Management, Operations/Logistics Strategy and Planning, EPCMV and Staffing Services.

 

IPS is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer of protected veterans (M/F/D/V).

 

Attention Search Firms / Third Party Recruiters:   IPS is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for employment opportunities with IPS. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at IPS via-email, the Internet or directly to hiring managers at IPS in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for a specific position will be deemed the sole property of IPS, and no fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by IPS as a result of the referral or through other means.
