title: Construction Manager/Coordinator
description:
Must be LOCAL to area
Focus on the line of business Construction/HVAC/Controls/Energy Retrofit Construction (Not high rise construction)

Will report to a local Program Manager

Looking for Construction Manager
Dealing with HVAC systems
Requires extensive coordination



Duration: 6 months with possible extension based on project need and performance
Working Hours: Normal Working Hours with availability for Weekend and Evening Shifts

Candidate will be responsible for assisting the Project Managers (PM) in the successful implementation of Construction/Energy Retrofit Projects. This position will assist with the overall relationship with the customer including technical or logistical issues that may arise with the implementation of the project plan. Primary function will be to interface with the Project Manager and customer to effectively complete the project on time and with a satisfied customer working in occupied buildings. Good communication skills are required. This position will require a good understanding and knowledge of construction and construction activities. This person will be required to read and interpret construction documents and understand trade terms and industry standards. This position will require travel to multiple sites across Newfoundland.


" Keeping projects on schedule
" Reviews all job contract documents for requirements and flow downs
" Review all contractor submitted documents for compliance with client and project requirements and ensure all requirements are met
" Planning, expediting, Implementing and monitoring project schedules and requirements
" Manage multiple projects packages on multiple sites and disciplines
" Coordinate work packages between multiple subcontractors and project team members internal and external
" Maintaining project meeting minutes and distribution
" Reporting project progress to the Project Manager
" Evaluates subcontractor performance against requirements
" Evaluates subcontractor safety performance against established protocol
" Complete daily logs and photo documentation of the Work and act with urgency to complete work.
" Assist with commissioning and record keeping of the Work
" Assemble and review project closeout documents and warranties for completeness and accuracy
" Witness pre- and post-test measurements
" Other tasks to support the Work as required

title: VP of Construction
description:
Our Client

Our client is a leading-edge commercial Construction Management group that champions the philosophy that construction project work has a deeper purpose than just creating spaces, and that through strong partnerships, they can bring transformation to the industry, their customers, and the communities they serve. They're passionate in their belief that the future of construction will be one where everyone is aligned with the mission, working shoulder to shoulder, solving problems, and understanding issues and challenges from each other's perspectives. Their consistent drive in this direction continues to propel their successful growth in the markets they serve. And being passionate about technology and innovation, they're using the latest software tools to make work more efficient and enjoyable.

Our client delivers a diverse mix of projects across various verticals, clients, and building types. They have three core business areas: tenant improvements, new construction projects, and building envelope upgrades. And their key markets include corporate offices, technology, biotech, post-secondary education, social housing, and financial institutions.

Current services include both General Contracting on tendered projects and acting as a Construction Manager with a heavy focus on pre-construction. They approach everything they do with the highest degree of mutual respect, value, and fairness, and aside from intentionally creating beautiful and functional spaces with purpose, their mission is to nurture solid professional relationships from positive and successful project experiences.

The Opportunity

The construction operations team's purpose is to deliver projects with high standards of excellence, transforming the construction experience for everyone they interact with – clients, architects, trade partners, and suppliers.

As a result of their rapid market growth, they're seeking a Vice President of Construction to join their executive team in the greater Vancouver region.  Reporting to the CEO, the successful candidate will be a well-experienced Senior Leader in the construction industry in an executive/leadership role, with an ability to align with the company's core values of humility, unity, generosity, forward-thinking, eagerness, and excellence.

This individual will oversee the entire construction/operations team in both the office and field, managing a full portfolio of projects from conception to successful completion. They'll bring their financial acumen and keen attention to detail and efficient process in managing all project planning and resource scheduling while implementing growth strategies for scalability. In addition, they'll champion the company's mission and growth plans through the development of all staff teams to reach their full potential.

Key Roles and Responsibilities

  • Oversee and manage the entire Construction/Operations team to successfully deliver projects
  • Manage hiring and team development
  • Direct Staff & Resource Planning for all Projects
  • Work with CFO on Financial Management of all Client Projects
  • Maintain Accountability for all Project profitability, cash flow, and forecasting
  • Liaise with CEO on Annual Strategic Planning and business plans
  • Act as CRO (Chief Revenue Officer) on all major clients
  • Manage Trade & Partner Contracts, Negotiations, and Project changes
  • Actively maintain industry presence within Construction/Building industry

Education/Experience

  • Min. 10 years Sr Construction Management experience (w/New Construction preferred)
  • Recognized University/College degree in Management, Business or Construction
  • Experienced in managing multiple major project portfolio
  • Proven Leadership Management skills in building/leading large work teams
  • High capability of managing Team Accountability
  • Experience and thorough understanding in building/managing construction contracts
  • Elite understanding of the financial side of the construction industry
  • Keen understanding of project profitability, cash flow, and forecasting
  • Strong understanding of current workplace regulations, building codes, and legislation
  • Recognized experience in negotiation and conflict resolution from a partnership perspective

Who You Are

  • Charismatic and Highly Process-oriented and detailed Leader
  • Natural ability to recognize and manage risk through strategic planning
  • High emotional EQ and excellent interpersonal skills
  • Keen ability to drive and ensure Accountability through work teams
  • Ability to maintain professional decorum in all environments
  • Takes conflict in stride / able to deal with difficult conversations calmly
  • Excellent communication skills for all professional situations
  • Proven experience in team mentoring/coaching for success
  • A strategic and entrepreneurial thinker with strong growth ambitions
  • Passionate about the Construction industry
  • Forward-thinking and innovative, with experience on a wide variety of industry-standard software (Procore, Navisworks, Building Connected, etc.) and contract models and approaches (Lean, IPD, etc.)
  • Champions and drives culture and operates within values

About Peeple Inc.

Peeple Inc is a Vancouver-based People Development firm specializing in Management Search and Executive Coaching and development. We're focused on helping companies build and develop world-class teams while assisting jobseekers to find incredible employers. Applicants can expect thorough communication, an in-depth evaluation of their background and abilities, complete confidentiality, and our continuing care and expertise in matching candidates to roles that provide the best fit possible.

Peeple Inc and the clients we represent are committed to an inclusive and discrimination-free workplace, as well as complete compliance with the B.C. Human Rights Code, Canadian Human Rights Act, and the Employment Equity Act.

Application and Timeline

We encourage interested applicants to apply as soon as possible as our client is keen to welcome their newest team member. Interviews will take place as resumes are submitted through the Peeple Inc website.

title: Roofing Project Manager
description:
Overview:

IRC Building Sciences Groupâ€“ a Rimkus Company is hiring!

We are seeking qualified candidates for the position of Roofing Project Manager based out of our Montreal office.

The ideal candidate for this position will have experience interfacing with commercial clients, as well as with conducting roof analyses and investigations, performing diagnostic integrity testing, preparing roof condition assessment reports, and carrying out roof quality assurance observation on flat roof systems.

In return for your talent and effort, Rimkus offers a dynamic organization with a competitive salary and benefits package, flexible work schedule and opportunities for advancement.

Responsibilities:

Major Duties & Responsibilities:

 

Assist with quality observation of work in progress to ensure compliance with tender documents and applicable codes and standards

 

    Site Work May Include:

  • Various site work tasks including: measuring, drawing, core-cuts, identifying deficiencies, photography, clean-up, etc.
  • Conduct site meetings with customers and contractors
  • Familiarize yourself with national and local client base and the IRC proposal formats
  • Provide pricing and assistance in completion of contracts and/or purchase orders
  • Co-ordinate all input for time billing and job costing
  • Other tasks may be required to ensure timely completion of deadlines
  • Provide assistance to other field technicians and technologists
  • Assist in preparation of pre-design on an as needed basis
  • Extended travel as necessary to perform the above listed duties
  • Assist with Contract administration and client management as required
  • Prepare roof condition or building envelope assessment reports using IRC standard format
  • Attend pre-bid site meetings and bid closing assessment meetings as required.
  • Perform site evaluations, inspections and testing as required to produce condition analysis reports
  • Compilation of data and photos into report form
  • Photocopying and assembly of reports
Qualifications:
  • 5+ yearsâ€™ experience in roofing and quality observation
  • AMCQ certified technician strongly preferred
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in an applicable or related field
  • Strong knowledge of various roofing systems and construction
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills (bilingual in French/English is required)
  • Advanced presentation skills
  • Possess strong entrepreneurial spirit and drive
  • Conducts all activities with the highest degree of professionalism
  • Can demonstrate business integrity, creativity and team orientation
  • Ability to travel as necessary to perform required duties

In return for your talent and effort, Rimkus offers a dynamic organization with a competitive salary and benefits package, flexible work schedule and opportunities for advancement.']

title: Directeur de la construction
description:
Progesys est une firme reconnue en gestion de projets industriels et leurs transitions optimales de la construction à l'opération. La société est basée à Laval (Canada) depuis 2002 et possède des bureaux aux États-Unis, au Moyen-Orient et en Asie.

Progesys est à la recherche d'un Directeur de la construction pour rejoindre son équipe de travail !

Le Directeur de la construction sera responsable de toutes les activités de construction, y compris la planification, l'exécution, le contrôle et la clôture. Les tâches et responsabilités du directeur de la construction, assisté de son équipe, se résument comme suit : 

  • Participer à l'examen de la constructibilité avec une société d'ingénierie externe
  • Examiner les lots d'ingénierie et élaborer et optimiser la définition des lots de construction
  • Examiner l'estimation des coûts de construction et s'assurer que les estimations sont conformes au budget
  • Assurer un suivi continu des coûts de construction par rapport à l'avancement des travaux
  • Mettre en place des procédures de gestion de la construction, y compris la gestion des ordres de modification, la gestion de la qualité, la gestion de la réception des travaux, la fermeture du site, la gestion des déficiences et la fermeture des contrats
  • Examiner, fournir des conseils et approuver les calendriers préparés (niveau 2 à niveau 4) et assurer le suivi des jalons
  • S'assurer que les entrepreneurs respectent le calendrier de construction
  • Développer, en collaboration avec le service des achats, une stratégie de négociation et d'attribution des contrats avec les entrepreneurs et l'optimiser afin de réduire les coûts et les délais d'exécution
  • S'assurer de l'obtention de tous les permis de construction nécessaires pour commencer les travaux
  • Examiner/commenter/approuver les stratégies de construction, les plans, les énoncés d'activités et de méthodes, les procédures, les documents relatifs au processus de construction
  • Participer au processus d'appel d'offres, y compris toutes les communications avec les entrepreneurs
  • Examiner les programmes de sécurité du chantier de construction
  • Organiser, coordonner, surveiller et gérer toutes les activités de construction sur le site ;
  • Coordonner avec le responsable HSE pour assurer la mise en œuvre du plan HSE
  • Coordonner et collaborer avec l'équipe de gestion environnementale externe
  • S'assurer que toutes les activités et l'avancement de la construction sont conformes à la portée, au budget et au calendrier des entrepreneurs
  • S'assurer que le calendrier est mis à jour chaque semaine, élaborer un plan d'atténuation si nécessaire
  • S'assurer que les rapports d'avancement sont dûment soumis et que le format et le contenu sont conformes aux exigences et aux normes de la société
  • Superviser toutes les activités d'administration du contrat
  • Diriger et guider le personnel du projet en définissant les responsabilités de gestion de la construction
  • Assurer le suivi de l'émission et de l'approbation des dessins d'atelier
  • Mettre en place un système permettant l'exécution efficace des travaux et qui sera suivi par tous les Entrepreneurs
  • Assurer une gestion adéquate du matériel et des équipements ainsi que la propreté du site
  • S'assurer que la sécurité et l'accès au site sont bien organisés
  • Assister l'entreprise dans la coordination des activités avec les autres parties concernées
  • Gestion des performances du site, mise en œuvre de mesures correctives ;
  • Superviser le système de gestion de la qualité, y compris le contrôle des documents, la gestion des déficiences, l'approbation des équipements et les processus de transfert ;
  • S'assurer que tous les ordres de modification et les instructions du site sont correctement remplis
  • Superviser le système de gestion de la qualité, y compris le contrôle des documents et le transfert de tous les documents requis ;
  • Superviser les processus de clôture de l'administration du contrat ;
  • Gérer les relations de travail
  • Assurer l'identification des problèmes qui pourraient avoir un impact sur les coûts de construction, le calendrier, la qualité, la santé, la sécurité ou l'environnement
  • Fournir des conseils techniques, des interprétations et de l'aide, au besoin, sur des questions liées aux activités de construction
  • S'assurer que tous les membres de l'équipe de construction comprennent la portée du projet et les exigences techniques
  • Coopérer étroitement avec l'entreprise pour gérer et coordonner les interfaces liées au travail
  • Coopérer avec les autorités gouvernementales sur les questions liées aux activités de construction
  • Fournir des canaux de communication efficaces et des liaisons appropriées avec toutes les parties
  • Examiner et approuver le plan de gestion des grues mobiles et des appareils de levage préparé par l'entrepreneur
  • Assurer une bonne logistique générale du chantier.

Exigences :

  • Baccalauréat en génie mécanique ou électrique ou tout autre domaine pertinent (Obligatoire)
  • Minimum 20 ans d'expérience dans un poste similaire (Obligatoire)
  • Expérience dans des projets miniers (Obligatoire)
  • Excellent communicateur
  • Démontrer de l'initiative et de l'autonomie
  • Bonne gestion du temps et des priorités
  • Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais parlé et écrit

Vous désirez joindre une entreprise en pleine croissance qui valorise le développement professionnel et personnel de ses employés ? Vous désirez travailler avec une équipe dynamique où vous pouvez relever des défis intéressants ? Joignez-vous à notre équipe et soumettez votre candidature!

Merci pour votre intérêt. Veuillez noter que seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées.

title: Maintenance Coordinator
company: Thales Canada Inc., Defence and Security
description:
Location: Halifax, Canada

In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.

This role requires provision of administration and coordination support to individuals and teams delivering maintenance to Royal Canadian Navy vessels. It requires working in an accurate and timely manner in a fast paced, customer focused environment, and in line with the project requirements.

The Maintenance Coordinator is responsible for providing work package support to the Ship Maintenance Leads and the broader Service Delivery team. Assigned responsibilities are required to be completed within time, quality and cost constraints to meet contracted Key Performance Indicator (KPI) requirements within the program and in accordance with Thales guidelines.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Provision of general project support and administration activities to the Waterfront Service Delivery Team;

  • Reviewing and ensuring that maintenance instructions are complete and sufficient for service providers to complete assigned maintenance operations;

  • Overseeing maintenance activities being conducted by service providers ensuring that the work is being conducted to the required quality in a safe and environmentally friendly manner;

  • Compiling Work Item closure reports, ensuring completeness and accuracy, and entering into the designated project tool for Work Item closure;

  • Generating and managing documentation and reports in various formats (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) as and when required in support of the Service Delivery Team;

  • Ensuring subcontracted service providers have the necessary paperwork and materials to complete designated maintenance tasks;

  • Attending meetings and preparing meeting agendas and minutes;

  • Generating purchase requisitions for Suppliers and Subcontracted Services, maintaining purchase orders and ensuring the efficient financial closure of Subcontracts on behalf of the Service Delivery and Procurement teams;

  • Ensuring service provider records are complete and up to date;

  • Ensuring compliance with Health and Safety requirements;

  • Assisting the Service Delivery team with keeping accurate and timely records; and

  • Other tasks as required.

Key Requirements:

  • Post-secondary Education in a marine related trade or technical discipline.

  • Strong computer literacy, with proven experience with Microsoft products especially Word, Excel and PowerPoint essential.

  • Experience interfacing between various internal/external stakeholders.

  • Strong organizational skills and ability to balance multiple priorities.

  • Five year’s experience working in a marine or industrial environment.

  • Experience within procurement, project management or warehouse environments highly desirable.

  • Previous experience working within the Military or a Defense Contract or Project desirable.

  • Experience with the Defense Resource Management Information System (DRMIS), or comparable document management system is advantageous

  • Experience working in SAP, or comparable Enterprise Resource Planning or Asset Management software is advantageous

  • This position requires direct or indirect access to hardware, software, technology or technical data controlled under the Canadian Export Control List, Canadian Controlled Goods Program, the Canadian Industrial Security Program, the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and/or the Export Administration Regulations (EAR). All applicants must be able to meet the eligibility requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Program and able to obtain a Canadian NATO Secret clearance.

Thales is required to follow mandatory customer policies as well as Federal and Provincial legislation, now and in the future.  This includes, but is not limited to, vaccination mandates and travel requirements.  This role requires you to work on a customer site and/or travel.   Therefore you must follow all mandatory customer policies and Federal and Provincial legislation as a condition of employment.

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Roofing Project Manager
description:
Overview:

We are seeking qualified candidates for the position of Roofing Project Manager based in our Richmond location.

This position is responsible for specifications, investigations and management of multiple roofing projects involving varying scopes and complexity. Extensive roofing experience is preferred. The ideal candidate will have excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as experience with client relations and developing proposals.

In return for your talent and effort, Rimkus offers a dynamic organization with a competitive salary and benefits package, flexible work schedule and opportunities for advancement.

Responsibilities:

â€¢ Coordinate the preparation of CAD drawings
â€¢ Preparation of design tender documents
â€¢ Preparation of technical specifications for roofing remediation projects
â€¢ Direct the collecting of field data required for the preparation of repair specifications, drawings and tendering
â€¢ Reviewing shop drawings
â€¢ Assisting with the compilation of both field and report data in order to prepare specification documents and drawings
â€¢ Reviewing drawings and specifications to verify that the scope of work is sufficient and to ensure that all required details, materials, methods, etc. are correctly specified
â€¢ Contract administration
â€¢ Prepare design briefs for Client approval
â€¢ Wind uplift calculations
â€¢ Prepare condition reports
â€¢ Coordinate and attend project meetings
â€¢ Coordinate interdepartmental design requirements
â€¢ Schedule mock ups and field testing
â€¢ Monitor Client scope and document changes as needed

Qualifications:

â€¢ Completion of a post-secondary degree/diploma in an Engineering or Architectural Technology program (or other related field)
â€¢ Minimum of 4 yearsâ€™ roofing working experience
â€¢ Experience with specifying roofing systems in accordance with RCABC standards
â€¢ Experience carrying out project management functions with a focus on roofing remediation projects
â€¢ Must possess the ability to read Architectural Blueprints
â€¢ General construction knowledge (i.e. how buildings go together)
â€¢ Exceptional attention to detail, specifically in accuracy of calculations and completeness of data collection and notation
â€¢ Good oral and written English communication skills
â€¢ Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
â€¢ Self-motivating and multi-tasking ability
â€¢ Able to work individually and in a team setting

title: Senior Project Manager, Construction and Land Development (Off Grid/Resort/Island)
description:
WHO WE ARE 

Elevation Capital - Venture Capital & Private Equity is a group of internationally impactful companies spanning consumer packaged goods, hospitality, technology, non-profit, and venture funding. With staff and markets in the US, Canada, Europe and the Caribbean, this group jointly serves a global vision to create an evolved world where humanity serves our highest purpose. Our mission is to create and deploy capital for a better world.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO

In this role you will lead land and property development projects for the Company and its portfolio companies, reporting directly to senior leadership in order to develop innovative private destinations rooted in philanthropy and environmental sustainability. The scope of the work will include managing all aspects of the projects from ground-up design and planning through to execution and completion using your extensive skills and understanding of land and development project management. 

 

Your first project will be to oversee the development of a mission driven, charity focused, 150+ acre private island located in the Strait of Georgia, British Columbia near Lasqueti Island. This project is being executed through a nonprofit vehicle sponsored by a successful entrepreneur, focused on educating and inspiring environmental stewardship, healing, and wellness. This project will require a multi-year effort that will be implemented in phases. Beginning with a blank canvas, you will partner with the Founder and leadership team to transform the island into the Necker Island of the north, a twist on the famous private island in the Caribbean belonging to Richard Branson, where our founder spent significant time with Richard. Inspired by a symbiotic relationship between nature and healing and driven by a charitable and ambitious vision, this island will be an eco-haven and positive force for good that will bring people together to heal themselves and the planet. Future projects may include similarly complex but remarkable projects in Hawaii or other locations.

 

This role manages critical and unique development & construction projects internally (for the Company) and externally (for our portfolio companies). This project will hone in on your diversified skill set, strategic thinking, and ability to create a one-of-a-kind eco-oasis in the area. Various requirements of this project will include; sourcing and recommending subcontractors, negotiating pricing and contracts, monitoring progress, ensuring regional and local regulatory mandates are met, and managing the construction process. Diverse experience in off-grid construction, sustainability, resort or island construction is highly desirable.

 

WHO YOU ARE

Intelligent - You have a way of figuring things out independently, a creative problem solver. Intelligent people like to talk with you because you are bright and insightful. You can anticipate risks and obstacles and enjoy recommending the best solutions and approaches to overcome them.

Experienced - You have land development and construction project management experience at various levels and can collaborate with subcontractors, engineers, architects, and key members of the project team with confidence and acumen. You have the knowledge to manage budgets, estimate costs, and resolve any problems that may arise, and the experience to obtain regional approvals as required while managing local relationships.

Fast Paced - You move incredibly fast. People you have worked with describe as a person who gets stuff done accurately and incredibly quickly. You're comfortable providing frequent updates and reports on job status because you keep things moving.

Organized - You are very organized and can multitask between projects and companies in an organized fashion including a history of working effectively and efficiently in various environments. Keeping track of inventory, tools, and equipment is no problem for you.

Driven - You are incredibly driven. You like to work hard, be challenged, have ambitious work goals and ultimately be very well rewarded. You're a pro at allocating and managing resources efficiently to get the work done and pride yourself on the quality of your work.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Oversee development projects from beginning to end in order to execute the Founder's vision and bring it to life;
  • Manage development budgets, inventory, suppliers and regulatory bodies;
  • Champion green and eco-friendly off grid power systems and telecom systems;
  • Select and recommend prefabricated cabins and houses and collaborate with vendors to plan and install;
  • Research and screen collaborators like contractors, suppliers, and firms;
  • Source and negotiate with external vendors and companies on contract agreements to obtain the most favorable terms;
  • Coordinate appropriate permits and licenses from relevant authorities;
  • Plan and manage construction operations to ensure all relevant deadlines are met;
  • Keep all stakeholders aware of progress via frequent status updates and reports;
  • Conduct site visits to monitor progress and quality standards on a regular basis and as needed to ensure a successful result;
  • Ensure compliance with company standards, environmental standards, safety regulations, and building codes;
  • Implement construction management best practices; and
  • Work closely with the Founder and senior leadership preparing various updates and progress reports in easy to understand formats; PERT, GANTT, Budgets, architectural drawings, and sketches, etc. 

 

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

  • 10+ years of experience of full life cycle development management experience with references that attest to your outstanding ability with this;
  • Off-grid and/or island/resort construction development or project management experience;
  • Proven experience in Canadian building and development, with full understanding of Code (national/regional and municipal as required);
  • Fluent, inspirational, persuasive, and articulate English business communication skills;
  • Previous experience in land development including design and working with planning and architects 
  • Off-grid and/or island/resort construction development or project management experience;
  • Knowledge of planning and implementation of off grid telecommunication systems and experience with green power systems;
  • Contacts and resources for building in the Georgia Strait area;
  • Conflict resolution and conflict management experience;
  • Experience with prefabricated homes selection, installation, and maintenance;
  • Excellent time management skills;
  • Extensive knowledge of the construction industry and construction projects;
  • Strong experience with sourcing and negotiating with external vendors;
  • Have experience implementing construction project management best practices and processes;
  • Data oriented, ability to leverage decisions from project data analytics;
  • Experience managing fast paced, extensive, and luxurious projects;
  • Ability to communicate and understand the needs of stakeholders and be able to translate them into results;
  • Project Management Degree or designation preferred; and

 

COMPENSATION 

Base salary for this role will be between $100,000 and $200,000 CAD depending on experience and requirements. An additional bonus plan will be provided based on performance. Medical benefits are provided as part of this roll. Options/equity in our parent company may be provided to suitable candidates as part of a long term compensation plan.

title: Building Superintendent/Gérante d’immeuble
description:
We're growing!! And looking for a detail-oriented and enthusiastic individual to join our team for the position of Resident Managers located in Dieppe, New Brunwick. This is an ideal full-time, live in position!

En raison de sa croissance continuelle, Skyline recherche une personnes enthousiastes et énergiques pour le poste de Gérante d'immeuble à Dieppe, Nouveau Brunswick. Ceci est un poste à temps-plein et permanent!

Additional Information
  • Providing great customer service is something you thrive on.
  • You get a thrill from staying organized and details are your "thing".
  • Being part of a great team has been your dream.
  • Working for a growing company that supports environmental stewardship and social responsibilities is a must for you.
  • You are obsessed with cleanliness!

*Please note that all Skyline buildings, apartment units, and premises are smoke free, with the exception of a designated outdoor smoking area*

title: Senior Site Superintendent - Residential Construction
description:
About us

We are Mountain Creations a boutique residential real estate developer that continues to push the envelope to create sustainable neighborhoods. With over 30 years of experience our projects span all over the North Shore, Tri-Cities, and Fraser Valley. 

Why work with us 

Is there anything better than teaming up with a stable, profitable well managed company with stellar community reputation that creates collaborative and progressive jobsite cultures that invest in both people and innovation? 

We are searching for a special caliber of talent- with sophisticated technical, management, communication and leadership skills and as such you get to name your price!

This is a unique opportunity to be a true stakeholder & involved in all the crucial stages of the design and development in addition to investment opportunities in the projects where you have a direct impact on your own return on investment.

We are dedicated to planning, designing, and constructing homes that we are proud to stand behind. Our team prides itself on being trailblazers and collaborating with the best in the industry to challenge the status quo and ensure our projects provide a thoughtful, creative, and successful contribution to the community.

About the opportunity 

Our growing business is in need of a permanent full time Site Superintendent who wishes to further develop their career with us for the long term starting with our current exciting project underway - Prosper Guilford, Surrey, BC

Scope of work 

  • Collaborate with engineers, subcontractors, etc. to determine project needs 
  • Set performance goals and deadlines
  • Plan construction processes and scheduling 
  • Estimate costs and ensure the project is on budget 
  • Oversee the entire construction project and  act as the link between various project parties
  • Lead and manage the on-site construction team and supervise all work on site
  • Take responsibility for orderliness on-site liaise with inspection authorities regarding approvals and ensure compliance with safety regulations & BC building codes
  • Ensuring quality standards are met, and all equipment and materials are available on-site at all times

 

What you bring to the table

The mindset

  • You are the master of your craft, you take ownership and pride in the quality of your work . 
  • You demonstrate a strong sense of accountability and steadfastness in assuring that each part of the project has been completed to the highest standards and every team member is working safely and efficiently. 
  • Your stellar interpersonal skills , allows you to build trust & rapport with all stakeholders . You believe in empowering your team and leading by example. You promote integrity and collaboration which creates an environment of trust and open communication.
  • You are adaptable, resourceful and engaged- while maintaining focus on the â€˜big pictureâ€™ at the strategic level, you are capable of keeping a variety of small project details in mind and function at the tactical level.  
  • Actively seeking out opportunities in a project that improves the final product comes to you naturally. Your tenacity, solution oriented mindset enables you to gain a good understanding of what is of value to all project stakeholders and how to improve the construction experience for all. 

Skills & Qualifications 

  • Degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or similar field
  • 8 years of experience as a construction superintendent or in a similar role
  • Proficiency with scheduling, project management and Takeoff software ( we use PlanSwift)
  • Familiarity with CAD software
  • Proficiency in MS Office
  • Knowledge of local quality, safety, and health guidelines for construction job sites
  • In-depth understanding of construction operations and processes

 

Excited to learn more? Interviews are happening now, for all inquiries reach out to Shiva GZ at Shiva@aceit.work

 

Powered by JazzHR

title: Maintenance Coordinator
description:
Job ID:  318080 

Work Type:  Full Time Permanent 

 

DELIVER CONCRETE RESULTS - JOIN THE DUFFERIN CONCRETE TEAM AT CRH CANADA 

 

 

 

Reporting to the Mobile and Fixed Equipment Maintenance Manager, the Fleet and Plant Coordinator is mainly responsible for supporting the Maintenance team through the whole Maintenance Cycle (PMR cycles, preventive/corrective work orders, purchase requisitions, etc), administering the fleets of mobile equipment (Licensing, Safetying and tracking of readymix trucks, yellow equipment, light duty vehicles), administering the documentation for certifiable fixed equipment, maintaining master data for fixed and mobile equipment. The position contributes to the overall efficiency and productivity of our fleet and plant equipment.

 

MAJOR DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible to Maintain a safe working environment, promoting a strong safety culture, following and communicating all safety guidelines when required, and ensuring safety compliance under legislation and Corporate requirements
  • Enter/update/review and ensure consistency of counter readings (mileage, hours) for readymix trucks, light duty vehicles and yellow equipment
  • Update, run, review and distribute weekly PMRs
  • Create/process/maintain work orders -preventive or corrective- ensuring documentation is attached and counter readings updated if/when necessary
  • Create purchase requisitions for Maintenance and Operations teams
  • Allocate purchased items to work orders and/or Purchase orders (goods receipts, service entries)
  • Maintain master data for all equipment (create, update, retire equipment) and ensure consistency with other systems (SAP, Command, TrackIT, GeoTab, etc)
  • Administer Licensing and help coordinate safetying of all fleet equipment, including updating required information for licensing and operating (license plates, ownerships, transponders, etc)
  • Administer Licensing, certification and/or Safetying of designated fixed equipment (boilers, water heaters, water meters, scales, etc)
  • Assist in KPIs and cost tracking and reporting
  • Administer Licensing documentation and OH&S certifications of shops, tools and technicians and skilled trades persons in the Maintenance team
  • Other duties as assigned

 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES 

  • Strong planning and organizational skills
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills
  • Customer Service focus
  • Good problem solving skills, and ability to work under pressure
  • High level of technical understanding preferred (mobile and fixed equipment)
  • Work Experience:  3-5 years’ experience in fleet/equipment administration and/or management preferred
  • Good knowledge of Computerized Maintenance Management Systems, and SAP or similar systems
  • Computer Skills:  Computer literate for all MS Office software. SAP knowledge would be an asset.

 

 

Visit our website for more information:    http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Construction Management
description:
Comtech Group Inc. (Comtech) is a multidisciplinary consulting firm providing integrated, world-class consulting services in Program and Project Management, Project Controls, Engineering, Technical Advisory, Construction Management, and Technology Integration Services to deliver complex capital projects. Our team thrives in embracing and navigating technical challenges within the Transportation & Infrastructure, Industrial & Manufacturing, Energy & Utilities, and Buildings & Facilities markets across North America. Our firm has a core focus and comprehensive experience supporting project owners through collaborative and integrated partnerships in delivering projects that improve the world around us.

Responsibilities
  • Responsible for inspecting the Work materials and methods to ensure that the requirements of the Contract Documents are fulfilled in a safe manner with requisite quality
  • Prepares daily reports for active construction contracts and issues Contract Deficiency Reports including the follow-up on required corrective actions including inspection of same
  • Observes, acts, and reports on any contractual and non-contractual infractions of safety, security, operational interference, or customer inconvenience
  • Provides special inspection expertise in structural, civil, architectural, roofing, mechanical or electrical disciplines, as required for the type of construction work
  • Liaises between the Contractor, client staff, utility companies, local municipalities, and other external agencies
Qualifications Required
  • Shall have approximately five (5) years experience in inspection and management of construction work
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational, interpersonal, problem solving, and analytical skills
  • Proficient at reading drawings and schematics
  • Ability to monitor and control the progress of construction activities against the Contract Baseline for schedule and cost
  • Must have a Joint Health and Safety Committee (JHSC) certification if elected as a worker member of the JHSC

Comtech Group Inc. is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are compliant with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources @ Comtech by emailing – 

career@teamcomtech.com

Comtech Group offers our employees a competitive compensation package with comprehensive employee benefits and an environment that fosters teamwork & entrepreneurial spirit. Comtech Group is an equal opportunity employer. Please submit your resume in MS Word format to

career@teamcomtech.com

title: Electrical Manager - Inspections
description:
Description

1. G ENERAL D ESCRIPTION OF R ESPONSIBILITIES

1.1. This position is responsible for the day-to-day management of an assigned lab, including managing the operational budget and assisting with the development and direction of strategic plans and growth initiatives.

2. S PECIFIC R ESPONSIBILITIES

2.1. Listed examples are illustrative and representative of the tasks required of this position and are not intended to be complete or exclusive.

2.2. Manage and direct personnel

2.3. Manage budgeted costs and exceed monthly production/revenue and profit goals

2.4. Assess, monitor, report, and improve on lab productivity

2.5. Identify and develop processes to enhance and maximize efficiencies and margin/expense

2.6. Coordinate with other working groups to effectively reach and exceed targeted goals

2.7. Mentor and develop staff by setting appropriate goals and objectives

2.8. Maintain facility assets in accordance with Intertek Safety, Health, Quality and Compliance Policies

2.9. Attend technical trade or association meetings

2.10. Serve as a technical resource to employees and clients

2.11. Make recommendations on improvements to operational processes to maximum efficiencies

2.12. Interact with clients, accreditors and/or Authority Having Jurisdiction to resolve issues

2.13. Provide support to engineering and sales

2.14. Make business recommendations on capital expenditures and other initiatives

2.15. Promote new business opportunities

2.16. Perform other work as required such as and not limited to project scheduling and back log maintenance, quoting projects to sales, lab upkeep.

2.17. Perform billable projects

2.18. Other duties related to the above, as assigned

2.19. Carrying out all responsibilities in a supportive manner with total adherence to: The Company's Health, Safety and Environmental Policies and Procedures, Quality Management System, Compliance and Ethics Policies, Vision, Mission and Strategy, and exercises good judgment, common sense, and diplomacy.

Qualifications

E DUCATION AND E XPERIENCE R EQUIREMENTS

4.1. Degree or Diploma in engineering

4.2. Minimum of three years technical management experience in an engineering environment, preferably within a testing or product development laboratory

4.3. Minimum of three years general management experience, including supervision of staff

4.4. Prior experience managing a budget

5. C ORE C OMPETENCIES

5.1. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

5.2. Excellent leadership and team building skills

5.3. Must be self motivated and assertive

5.4. Must be able to work independently in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment

5.5. Microsoft Office software expertise

5.6. Ability to travel as business needs dictate

title: Construction Inspectors - Casual Hours
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

 

Wood is currently recruiting for Casual Construction Inspectors in different locations throughout Newfoundland, to support a variety of infrastructure projects.

  • Conduct site inspection for municipal construction projects, including storm and sanitary sewers, water distribution, and roadways identifying and advising of non-compliance.
  • Review and interpret contract documents and contract drawings
  • Coordinate and monitor the material testing/quality control program completed by others
  • Keep field diaries, records of work completed, materials and equipment on site each day
  • Monitor environmental compliance
  • Work closely with the Contract Administrator to provide observations, records and data as required for contract administration
  • Track and summarize quantities, and review, prepare and recommend approval of payment certificates
  • Liaise with the design engineer and clients for approval of on-site changes
  • Liaise with the public and other stakeholders
  • Ensure compliance with Wood’s project-specific Health and Safety Plan

Skills / Qualifications

  • 2+ years’ experience as a Construction Inspector on municipal infrastructure projects
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Knowledge of DMAE Municipal Water, Sewer and Roads Master Construction Specifications would be considered an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Inspecteur municipal en bâtiment
description:
Sous la responsabilité de la direction générale de Saint-Maxime-du-Mont-Louis, l’inspecteur municipal agissant à titre d’officier municipal en bâtiment et en environnement voit principalement à l’application, au développement et au respect des dispositions des règlements municipaux en matière d’urbanisme et d’environnement. Plus particulièrement, le titulaire du poste doit :

- Renseigner les citoyens sur la règlementation en vigueur, recevoir les demandes, analyser les projets, émettre les permis et les certificats d’autorisation et en faire le suivi.

- Assurer l’application et l’adaptation des règlements municipaux, d’urbanisme ainsi que ceux relatifs à l’environnement.

- Mettre en place et adapter des plans d’inspection en fonction des besoins municipaux.

- Aviser verbalement ou par écrit les propriétaires ou les entrepreneurs enfreignant les règlements municipaux, indiquer s’il y a lieu les correctifs à apporter.

- Assumer la coordination du Comité consultatif d’urbanisme (CCU), analyser et présenter toute demande de dérogation mineure ou de modification aux règlements le cas échéant.  

- Recevoir les plaintes s’il y a lieu et en apporter le suivi à la direction générale.

- Faire partie d’un nouveau comité de direction avec la direction générale et adjointe ainsi que le directeur des travaux publics. Le comité sera responsable entre autres du volet santé et sécurité au travail.

- Assumer toute autre fonction ou responsabilité connexe entendue avec la municipalité selon le profil du candidat.

Exigences

-Détenir un diplôme d’études collégiales ou universitaire dans un domaine pertinent ou connexe au monde municipal (technicien en aménagement et en urbanisme, en architecture ou en génie civil)

-Avec ou sans expérience

-Avoir la certification de la COMBEQ ou s’engager à l’obtenir

-Faire preuve d’initiative et d’autonomie

-Avoir une bonne connaissance du français

-Maîtrise des principaux outils et logiciels informatiques

-Faire preuve de diplomatie

-Habile à vulgariser l’information

-Détenir un permis de conduire valide

Conditions salariales

-Poste permanent temps plein.

-Salaire et avantages sociaux compétitifs selon l’échelle en vigueur et le profil du candidat (45000$ à 58000$, assurances collectives et contribution REER de l’employeur).

Renseignements supplémentaires

Affichage de poste ouvert avec début d’emploi possible dès maintenant. Seuls les candidats retenus pour une entrevue seront contactés.

Formation offerte par l’employeur, conciliation travail-famille et emploi dans une équipe d’expérience et dévouée.

title: Junior Construction Inspector (Underground)
description:
McMillen Jacobs Associates' is looking for a Junior Construction Inspector in our Vancouver office within our Construction Management Practice. The Inspector will work at a project field office in the Lower Mainland or McMillen Jacobs Associates' design office in downtown Vancouver, primarily working on water and wastewater infrastructure project utilizing trenchless or tunneling methods.

The ideal candidate for this position should have experience in the heavy civil construction field. In particular, relevant experience includes underground utility construction, including open-cut trench, pit excavation and shoring; replacement and rehabilitation of pipelines ranging from 8 to 96 inches in diameter through methods such as open-cut, horizontal directional drilling, microtunneling and tunnel boring machines. Experience with trenchless methods and welding inspection is beneficial, however this is an entry-level position and previous field experience is not mandatory.

This position requires physical fitness necessary to make field visits and inspections of on-going construction. Work assignments will vary with construction work schedules and may include shifts from 8-12 hours in length, including days, nights or weekends.

Responsibilities:

  • Review Construction Contract Documents Plans, Specifications and Permits requirement.
  • Inspect and monitor construction contractor's work and prepare daily inspection reports.
  • Review contractor reports.
  • Review and provide input into field related Submittals, Requests for Information, Plan Clarifications, geotechnical information and data, and CPM schedules.
  • Monitor the Contractor's receipt inspection of materials arriving on-site, monitor off-site production activities and/or any other construction activities in their area.
  • Monitor construction progress for compliance with Contract Documents, safety standards and agency requirements.

Qualifications:

  • Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering Technology, Construction Management Technology, Civil Engineering or Construction Management from an ASTTBC accredited program. E.I.T or CET registrants preferred.
  • 2 to 10 years of experience in heavy civil construction monitoring/inspection.
  • Preferred current Occupational First Aid level 1 or greater or ability to obtain within 3 months.
  • Preferred current CSA Standards Concrete Field Testing Technician Grade 1 or ability to receive training and certification.
  • CWB welding inspector level 1 or greater is considered an asset.
  • Knowledge of construction-related processes and industry practices
  • Ability to wear personal protective equipment such as a respirator; meet physical demands of the position such as walking, standing, lifting up to 40 Lbs., climbing ladders, bending, squatting, and crawling in tight spaces to safely access work sites.
  • Working knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook.
  • Good written, verbal communication and organizational skills

ABOUT MCMILLEN JACOBS ASSOCIATES

McMillen Jacobs Associates is an employee owned, multi-disciplined firm, with self-performing design-build capability. We are experts in underground/tunneling and water resources projects and deploy this expertise to serve the water, wastewater, transportation, dams, energy and aquaculture sectors including public, private, and regulatory clients using a wide range of delivery methods. For 75 years, we have worked closely with our clients at every stage of a project assisting them with planning, permits, designs, project management, construction, and start-up.

We want our employees to make a career doing what they love to do. We encourage an entrepreneurial spirit and help our team members forge their own path within the company. We support their efforts to stay on the cutting edge of technology while fostering a great work-life balance. In addition to working hard, we also have fun. We socialize and celebrate achievements at summer picnics, holiday parties, and company outings.

We are pleased to accept applications from underrepresented groups and encourage applications from Indigenous persons, youth, new immigrants, and persons with disabilities.

Benefits: Full Benefits Program consisting of Medical Services Plan (MSP), Registered Retirement Savings Plan, Dental, Extended Health Care Benefit, Critical Illness Insurance, Health Spending Account, Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program, Education Reimbursement Program, Stock program, 10 Paid Holidays, Paid Time Off and Wellness Reimbursement

Pay Rate: DOE

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

For additional company information and to apply online, please visit our website at www.mcmjac.com

No Recruiters, Please.

title: Construction Inspector - Guelph
description:
Gannett Fleming Canada is looking for an experienced construction management professional for the role of Construction Inspector to join our team in Guelph to assist in the management of transportation construction projects. Our construction management and inspection capabilities satisfy the most selective clients. We effectively control our clients’ costs, deliver their projects on time, and meet strict regulatory needs while maintaining long-lasting relationships from the pre-construction stage until long after project completion Construction Inspector be the resident at the place of work when the construction activities are being carried out and be responsible for the inspection examination of work and the preparation of reports for work progressed on site. 

Key Responsibilities

  • Establish a safety-first culture for all construction projects
  • Inspect work materials and methods to ensure requirements of contract documents are fulfilled in a safe manner with requisite quality
  • Maintain a daily inspection diary documenting construction activity, including environmental events and recording of progress and as constructed details for the purposes of project closeout.
  • Issue contract deficiency reports, including follow-up on required corrective actions.
  • Observe, act, and report on contractual and non-contractual infractions of safety, security, operational interference
  • Assist in the resolution of construction related issues.
  • Carry out all quality assurance and quality control functions to confirm contractor's adherence to the contract documents.
  • Be responsible for tracking the details of change notices to ensure sufficient information is gathered for the completion of as constructed drawings.
  • Assist in the project close out phase including certificate of substantial completion, punch list and receipt of as-builts
  • Ability to clearly communicate, in writing and verbally, with project team members about relevant construction systems and processes.
  • Coordinate and carry out inspections during the construction of the work to verify compliance with the contract documents.
  • Review the quality of Contractors work and provide report to client.
  • Ensures contract compliance to technical plans and specifications; and reviews documentation and files for accuracy and completeness, including daily reports and construction logs. 

Education | Experience: Education Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or related field.
  • OACETT Designation (C.E. T, C.Tech, A.Sc.T)
  • Professional Engineer (P. Eng) is an asset.
  • Certification as a Certified Construction Contract Administrator (CCCA) from a Construction Specification Canada (CS) is an asset. Experience Requirements
  • Minimum of 5-15 years in construction engineering experience that includes field construction, contract administration, estimating, negotiations; project and design management.
  • Experience with a Class 1 Railway and working within a right of way is an asset.
  • Demonstrated experience in supervising construction sites, field engineering, site work inspections and work progress measurements
  • Demonstrated on-site construction inspection experience in construction of transit, commercial and municipal infrastructure.
  • Preference will be given to candidates with direct experience on large scale transit projects or transportation infrastructure
  • Must be comfortable in both professional office and field work environments
  • Proficient in MS Word / Excel / Outlook
  • Knowledge of pertinent federal, Provincial, and local laws, codes, and regulations as they apply to transit operations.
  • Proven understanding of industry standards within construction, Health and Safety codes and regulations.
  • Excellent listening, communication, and organizational skills
  • Experience in resolving claims
  • Strong communication skills, verbal and written
  • Valid driver’s license required; this position requires use of personal vehicle in good working order
  • Flexibility to travel to construction sites for extended periods and work outside of normal business hours

title: Junior Construction Inspector
description:
The Opportunity 
McElhanney has an exciting opportunity for a Construction Inspector to join our team in Langley, BC. In this role, you will be a key player in helping us expand our construction services for existing and prospective clients throughout the Lower Mainland and Fraser Valley. As a self-motivated problem solver, you excel in client-facing roles that allow you to think on the spot. You will consider this opportunity to be ideal if you have been looking to grow and develop your technical, leadership, and client management skills without forgoing your love for being outdoors.

Our construction management teams provide services for a wide array of clients and projects, including municipal infrastructure, water and sewer, highways, roads, bridges, and interchanges. Our construction management staff are a trusted and essential component of the project delivery team for our clients, taking the project from concept and constructability, through tendering and construction, to completion and implementation.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Provide on-site contractor inspection to monitor the quality and progress of the work being performed
  • Author daily inspection report
  • Be forward thinking; understand the construction process and be able to learn the specifications and requirements of the work which they will be inspecting
  • Understand the hazards and safe work procedures for each task and inspection location
  • Report inspection issues to a senior supervisor
  • Maintain inventories of bid item quantities and generate payment authorizations
  • Provide reporting of work progress and issue construction memos to contractors as needed
  • Identify field and design issues, facilitate corrective measures, and perform constructability reviews
  • Liaise with contractor, client, and affected stakeholders during construction operations
  • Lead or assist in the development of construction specifications and contract tender documents
  • Understand, commit to and fulfill responsibilities under the McElhanney Quality Management System, ISO 9001 and all client quality, safety and environmental management systems
  • Ensure team is motivated and on track, project deadlines are met within budget, and quality of work meets or exceeds client expectations.

What You’ll Bring 
  • Previous field or construction-related experience as assistant supervisor/inspector would be an asset
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in a relevant field
  • Ability to work: 10 hours a day, 6 days a week, during construction season
  • Willingness to commit to construction projects for the duration of the project
  • Experience with municipal and transportation, construction projects; consulting experience an asset
  • Ability to interpret construction, contracts, drawings, and specifications and compare them with construction in progress, detecting faulty materials and workmanship, and suggesting appropriate remedies
  • Have a forward-looking approach and the ability to foresee potential issues and problems so these items can be addressed and resolved
  • Exceptional organization and follow-up skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral

What Can We Offer You?
  • Generous signing bonus for the right candidate
  • Flexible hybrid work model and hours to accommodate lifestyle needs
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave 
  • Great benefits, including extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching 
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone 
  • A family-like culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all 
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth 
  • Ability to become a shareholder in an employee-owned company 


About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As an employee-owned and operated firm with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high level of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people

#Intermediate #Hybrid #LI-AM3
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

Centrally located in Southwestern BC’s Lower Mainland, the Township of Langley is one of Metro Vancouver’s dynamic and thriving Regional City Centres. Within just 10 square kilometres (4 square miles), the City of Langley contains six established residential neighbourhoods, a natural wetland of regional significance, parkland exceeding 300 acres, high density residential development, a revitalized pedestrian-oriented downtown, a regional shopping centre and one of the most active industrial and service commercial land bases found in the Lower Mainland.
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Civil Inspector - Edmonton
description:
The Civil Construction Inspector will provide on-site direction and supervision to ensure completion and quality of civil work on our multi-family residential construction site. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills and a working knowledge of various civil and residential construction means and methods.  

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Perform civil works coordination, inspections, and quantity measurement
  • Check grades and elevations of newly installed infrastructure
  • Monitor and coordinate contractor progress to ensure work is completed within construction schedule
  • Check for compliance to plans and specifications
  • Review and confirmation of monthly progress worksheets and measurements
  • Maintain an as-built plan and communicate changes to Civil Team
  • Follow up on deficiencies to ensure timely correction and completion of work
  • Assure compliance with the project construction schedule and budgets
  • Uphold the job-related safety regulations, policies, and procedures
  • Ensure project materials and workmanship meet the project quality standards
  • Use best efforts to resolve any scheduling challenges/disputes between on-site subcontractors and suppliers

 

REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 2 years of civil construction experience
  • Minimum 2 years of experience overseeing project sites/civil crews is an asset
  • Equipment operation is an asset
  • Valid Class 5 Driver's License
  • Understanding of methodology and terminology in the civil construction industry
  • Proven ability to read and interpret blueprints and other construction drawings
  • Working experience in earthworks and utility installation
  • Results-focused with a proven track record of accomplishments in the construction field
  • Ability to travel and work on various job sites at different territorial locations

 

Why Seymour Pacific?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: Chief Building Official - Town of Marathon
description:
Chief Building Official - Town of Marathon ON
CompetitiveCompensation (85 - 135K) & Benefits

Other Similar Titles:
- Deputy Chief Building Official
- Building Codes Official
- Building Inspector / Examiner

Reporting to the Town of Marathon's CAO, the Chief Building Official (CBO) is responsible for enforcing the Building Code Act and regulations in accordance with the Provincial statutes and municipal by-laws. The CBO manages all aspects of the Building Division from the building permit application intake, plans review & inspection to ensure the health and safety requirements are met for new construction & renovations. The CBO will have overall responsibility and statutory duties as defined under the Building Code Act

SomeKey responsibilities:
  • Leads & manages the Municipality's planning function including administration, zoning by-laws amendments, development applications & permits, site plan control, consents, minor variances, building & property standards, and the Official Plan
  • Performs CBO duties under Building Code requirements: conducts field inspections ensuring by-laws compliance, reviews & issues building permit applications, conducts building inspections as necessary
  • Assists Deputy Clerk with the management of municipal properties including land & building acquisitions or dispersals
  • Liaises with government ministries, the public and businesses
  • Assists Fire Chief on Fire Code inspections and enforcement
  • Works in a safe manner in accordance within OH&S Act
Ideal Candidates will likely have many of the following Attributes:
  • 5 - 20+ years experience in progressive building compliance roles, some leadership would be an asset
  • Degree / diploma in Architecture, Civil Engineering, Planning or a field closely related to the building industry
  • Experience working with Municipal & Planning Acts, Building Codes & Acts
  • Chief Building Official certification is ideal(CBO eligible &/or in-progress will be considered)
  • Valid Drivers Licenseand open to aVulnerable Sector check
  • Strong organization & communications skills- verbal & written plus Solid computer skills (ie, MS Word & Excel)
  • Open to periodic after hours meetings, emergencies & on-calls evenings & weekends
The successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary and benefits package, a variety of developmental opportunities, and the opportunity to make a real difference. Plus, you will have time to enjoy our community.

title: Electrical Inspector
description:
Description

THIS POSITION IS LOCATED IN BRITISH COLUMBIA - AT KITIMAT SITE.

Accepting candidates from all over Canada who are willing to travel to Kitimat.

********

Intertek is a leading Total Quality Assurance provider to industries worldwide. Our network of more than 1,000 laboratories and offices with over 43,000 people in more than 100 countries, delivers innovative and bespoke Assurance, Testing, Inspection, and Certification solutions for our customers' operations and supply chains. Intertek Total Quality Assurance expertise, delivered consistently with precision, pace, and passion, enables our customers to power ahead safely.

Intertek's Industry Services team provides technical solutions that help customers maximize operational efficiency, ensure asset reliability, improve quality, and minimize safety risks. Some of our many service areas include inspection, non-destructive and materials testing, technical training, engineering, surveying, QA/QC, and supplier auditing.

Ensure that Project Quality Plan in conjunction with Project Execution Plan is developed and implemented.
Promote quality awareness throughout the organization, emphasizing excellence, continuous improvement and corrective action to influence the overall success of company business.

Duties:

  • eview original material / test certificate for compliance to codes and specifications.
  • Verify that equipment is preserved per suppliers recommendation and approved preservation procedures.
  • Assist in Quality audit upon request
  • Liaise with inspection leads and contractor remediate quality management problems.
  • Witness and monitor suppliers / contractors work activities, inspection and test in accordance with the approved Quality Plan, ITP, Quality Procedures etc.
  • Promote quality awareness throughout the organization, emphasizing excellence, continuous improvement and corrective action to influence the overall success of company business.
  • Assist in the review of Supplier's/Contractor's Quality Plans, Inspection & Test Plans (ITPs) and Quality Procedures and all pertained QA/QC documentation prior to commencement of any fabrication / construction work.
  • Verify the implementation of PTW (permit to work) LOTO (lock-out and tag-out) and other safety procedures.

Conduct quality surveillance at suppliers / contactors to promote Company's quality culture.

Qualifications

Requirements:

  • equires certifications in the Electrical Engineering & Inspection industry, with over 10 years in oil & gas
  • Have knowledge of industrial codes (NEC, CEC, CSA, IEC, UL, NFPA, ISO 9001, API, and etc).
  • Have knowledge of standard industrial communication protocol such as 4-20 mA and Foundation Fieldbus
  • Have knowledge of wiring and cabling system for field instrumentation.
  • Have knowledge of electrical classification.
  • Have knowledge of various type of cable, its application, and installation / test requirements.
  • Have knowledge of installation and testing practices for electrical, instrument, and telecom equipment.
  • Have knowledge of Loop checking / commissioning practice.

A career with Intertek means joining a global network of professionals dedicated to bringing quality and safety to life. Our vision is to become the world's most trusted partner for Quality Assurance and we offer our employees the chance to make an impact with attractive growth opportunities in this industry on a global scale.

We offer a salary and benefit package competitively placed within the local market, including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement and more.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status or on the basis of disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, or gender identity.

Intertek is a drug-free workplace. As a condition of employment, all hires are required to pass a pre-employment drug test.
