title: Junior Site Superintendent
description:
Junior Site Superintendent
Chilliwack, BC
General Contractor
Commercial Construction
New Build and Tenant Improvement



Junior Site SuperintendentDuties & Responsibilities:


Pre-Construction Management
  • Work with the Project Manager, develop and maintain master project schedule with input from subcontractors
  • Assess commissioning and O&M requirements for master project schedule.
  • Develop Health, Safety and Environment Plan.
  • Review contracts with the Project Manager to ensure scope of work and schedules are accurate and feasible.
  • Notify Equipment Management Team of requirements for project.
  • Assist with selection of trade subcontractors.
  • Conduct constructability reviews to bring value to the construction execution stage.

Construction Management
  • Plan, organize, direct and control daily construction operations with direct leadership responsibilities for junior resources as assigned.
  • Fully understand the Master Contract and Subcontractor Contracts.
  • Develop and measure productivity on site to measure planned progress against actual.
  • Control site logistics, maximize efficiencies, minimize deficiencies of all work including all subcontractors, suppliers and employees.
  • Establish site for construction.
  • Maintain daily and ongoing reporting to track site progress.
  • Maintain a clean and organized site.
  • Execute the quality management program proactively to minimize deficiencies.
  • Approve timesheets.
  • Hold daily field level hazard assessments.
  • Hold weekly toolbox talks.
  • Conduct weekly subcontract progress meetings and hold everyone on site accountable to the Master Project Schedule.
  • Purchase, maintain, track and forecast materials.
  • Review all subcontractor submittals.
  • Support the development of commissioning and turn over plans.
  • Fix deficiencies in line with achieving total completion date.
  • Manage risk during the project by following the Risk Management Plan.
  • Communicate daily with the Project Manager and project team on the status of construction including any concerns or discrepancies that may require escalation.
  • Attend owner meetings throughout the project.
  • Manage, control, and record all permit requirements, third party inspections, commissioning, training and hand over.
  • Communicate with the office to manage administrative tasks.
  • Responsible to ensure all on site contractually required items are implemented and completed.
  • Champion health and safety and occupational practices and regulations.
  • Provide cost-effective solutions to construction issues and coordinate with the Project Manager.



Post Construction Management
  • Complete warranty work.
  • Close all site accounts.
  • Complete any deficiencies and issues related to the warranty period.
  • Demobilize site.


Junior Site SuperintendentQualifications:
  • Undergraduate degree or diploma in construction management, engineering, or another relevant field preferred
  • Certification of First Aid/CPR, WHMIS
  • Possess valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle
  • 5+ years’ experience in the construction industry, preferably Commercial construction management
  • Strong familiarity with contract administration, understanding drawings, specifications, architectural and engineering standards and building practices, including building codes
  • Full understanding of mechanical and electrical installations, including commissioning and handover
  • Excellent budgeting, costing, and scheduling skills
  • Solid understanding of construction industry practices, OBC, OHSA and WCB regulations and safety standards, OHS Certificate
  • Experience using MS Word, Outlook, MS Project, Electronic Document Management System, Bluebeam, and Plan Grid
  • Strong leadership skills with experience managing all disciplines, internal employees, and external sub-trades
  • Ability to inspire trust in difficult situations by instilling confidence and engaging people on matters that affect them
  • Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet the time demands of unpredictable activities, capable of handling pressure and challenges
  • Works within tight deadlines and prioritizes of work to achieve them
  • Strong analytical, critical thinking, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills demonstrated through speaking to groups of employees on site, and communicating to a variety of stakeholders including clients, management, and site employees
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals; ability to work in challenging, fast paced environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Travel to site will be required; travel within Canada as directed
  • Ability to relocate to projects and offices within Canada and elsewhere according to Company resource requirements an asset
  • Supportive of a culture that encompasses the highest ethical standards aligned with the Company Promise

Junior Site SuperintendentSalary:
Competitive Salary, Extended Benefits, Growth Opportunities, Flexible work environment, Continuous training and development, Match RRSP Program, Birthday off with pay

Junior Site Superintendent Similar Job Titles:
Site Super
General Superintendent
Construction Manager
Superintendent

Interested?
Apply below

Only applicants with the legal right to work in Canada can be considered for this opportunity.
We thank all those who express interest in this opportunity however only those short-listed we be contacted.

title: Superintendent
description:
superintendent

Are you looking for career opportunities within a global, 
growing real estate company?

Then you might be our next superintendent.

job description

Akelius is seeking a customer service-oriented superintendent with strong interpersonal skills to join the facility management team.

The superintendent will provide a safe and adequate environment for the tenants and assigned staff of the property.

The successful candidate will be responsible for cleaning, maintenance, repairs, and building code compliance.

  • complete minor and major repairs of all building equipment
  • perform preventative maintenance procedures on building mechanical equipment on a scheduled basis which is not limited to inspections of belts, checking fluid levels, replacing filters, greasing bearings, seals, replacing or repair broken parts
  • repair of doors, door locks, closets, and installation of blinds

 

  • complete daily, weekly, and monthly checklists on building equipment maintenance procedures
  • maintain records of scheduled maintenance procedures
  • operate a computer that controls and monitors mechanical equipment and utility systems

 

  • respond to emergency maintenance requests as required
  • assist with the renovations and remodeling of buildings
  • repair plaster, drywall and painting

 

  • perform outside custodial duties such as snow removal
  • other duties as assigned

who you are

  • three plus years of experience in building and mechanical maintenance repair, or an acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience
  • knowledge in using hand and power tools
  • must be able to regularly lift up to 50 lbs
     
  • bilingual in French and English preferred but not required
  • must be able to stand, sit, bend and or crouch throughout your shift
  • problem-solving - ownership of responsibilities, able to anticipate and address issues in emergency situations
     
  • great communication skills â€“ able to interact with tenants, people-focused, positive, and stay professional
  • exceptional driving skills
  • articulate - as there might be times in which information will need to be presented
     
  • time management â€“ organized, set priorities, meet daily targets and deadlines

how to apply

Apply with a copy of your resume.

about Akelius

Akelius acquires, upgrades, and manages residential properties.

Akelius owns 18 thousand rental apartments in the metropolitan cities of New York, Boston, Washington D.C., Montreal, Toronto, London, Paris, and Austin.

Akelius Canada is committed to providing accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you are contacted for this position and require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please let the HR team know.

Read more at www.akelius.com

title: Superintendent (ICI Construction)
description:
Job Description:

Superintendent - ICI Construction

Project Location: Ingersoll, ON

 

 

You enjoy being the leader of a team of construction professionals focused on delivering a quality project every time.

 

You have leadership goals and looking for the right organization to grow with.

 

You have built your career as a Superintendent with a stellar safety record and maintained solid relationships with your Project Managers, clients and other key project stakeholders.

 

Then this is the next step in your career.

 

As a Superintendent with our busy Buildings Division, you will have the responsibility of overseeing our site staff, field engineering and field teams accountable for the delivery of completed ICI building projects.     Maple Reinders is a growing organization and we are continually winning new work. With that come new experiences and new challenges.

 

At Maple, we look for leaders who can:

  • Direct field operations in the delivery of projects by adhering to schedules, budgets, safety and risk.
  • Effectively manage field employees by providing guidance and leadership on construction activities and developing effective communication between field and other project staff.
  • Develop and execute project work plans aimed at keeping projects on track and on budget.
  • Provide senior level presence in the field, coach field staff on issue resolution, review site labour requirements, mentor field staff and perform succession planning.

 

Our Superintendent will oversee projects that vary in size and scope and the successful candidate should have previous experience in leading construction teams, trades and hourly employees.   We would require the Superintendent to travel or stay close to the site; flexibility is a must. We are also focused on candidates who currently have:

  • Minimum 5 years of construction experience with a General Contractor in a leadership role
  • Post-secondary education, CET or equivalent
  • Proficiency with MS Office and Windows based computer applications (Word, Excel, Outlook and Project)
  • Can manage site operations on complex projects in excess of $40 million

 

The Superintendent is a key member of Maple Reindersâ€™ project team and is critical to the success of each project under their direction.  We want you to succeed and we are prepared to get you there by investing in you. We offer extensive training through our â€œCentre of Learningâ€ to facilitate your career growth through programs such as LEED, Gold Seal and â€œlunch and learnsâ€.

 

If you are a solid construction leader, we want to hear from you. Please provide your project list including the dollar value along with your resume and cover letter.

 

Thank you for your interest in a career with Maple Reinders. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Maple Reinders is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Maple Reinders accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

 

No agency calls please.

 

 

People, Passion, Performance

title: Superintendent (Structural/Bridges)
description:
Location: Vancouver, BC, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/11/2022Job ID: VF228116411Category: Engineering & Technical
If you are a talented and experienced Superintendent (Structural/Bridges), David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you! Our client, a leader in their field, has partnered with David Aplin Group to grow their team in Alberta.
 
The Superintendent provides site management for all phases of the project from pre-construction to completion including but not limited to coordinating workers, materials, and equipment as well as ensuring that specifications are being followed, work is proceeding on schedule and within budget, the project is completed with outstanding quality and that the project is a safe workplace.    
 
Benefits & Perks:
  • Competitive compensation, including 100% employer-paid benefits
  • Monthly uplift and housing allowance (non-taxable)
  • Meal allowance (taxable)
Responsibilities:
Pre-Construction:
  • Understanding of the contract and scope of work, ensuring the scope of work is clearly communicated to trades
  • Identify and eliminate/control all actual or potential hazards and risks and document them on the Hazard Identification and Risk Assessment Log
  • Completing a detailed review of drawings and specifications
  • Understanding entitlements and immediately notifying the Project Manager of changes and conditions.  
  • Reviewing shop drawings
  • Participate in developing a cost-effective plan and schedule for completion of the project and following a logical pattern for utilization of resources
Construction:
  • Coordinating the work of subcontractors working on various phases of the project
  • Controlling and directing subcontractors, labour, and labour relations
  • Providing on-site supervision for all project personnel and phases of construction, resolving complaints and grievances with employees
  • Completing all paperwork as required  
  • Reporting any challenges or issues to the Project Manager and/or General Superintendent in a timely manner
  • Maintaining accurate build drawings for underground utilities and plan changes as they occur
  • Keeping a daily log of site activities on the project including but not limited to: All trades and number of personnel/trades, description of work, weather, and safety hazards or issues  
  • Expeditious completion of project deficiencies
  • Conducting weekly progress review meetings with Trades to review the weekly schedule and update accordingly
  • Attending all project meetings
  • Maintaining site files, supplies, equipment, and services
Health & Safety:
  • Enforcing on-site safety in accordance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act the latest regulations and Safety Policy Manual
  • Leading on-site safety meetings with trades and labour
  • Reporting all accidents and incidents promptly
  • Continually ensure any hazards are identified/controlled/eliminated and recorded and filed in the Safety Records Binder
  • Discuss the hazards with all workers at meetings (i.e., weekly toolbox meetings, monthly safety meetings, etc.)
  • Ensuring site personnel has required safety training and records are maintained
  • Ensure all preventative maintenance is conducted according to manufacturer specifications and that records are maintained
Relationship Management:
  • Maintain a good working relationship with all subcontractors and ensures they are treated fairly
  • Maintain professional conduct at all times with owners, consultants, traders, suppliers, and the public
  • Develop a good working relationship with owners and consultants
  • Report progress to owners and architects
  • Supervise crews, reviewing their reports, checking on any reported difficulties, and correcting any safety violations or other reported deficiencies
  • Making realistic commitments to the Project Manager, trades, owners, and consultants
  • Coach and mentor hourly employees
Qualifications:
  • 7+ years of Construction experience
  • Experience with structural heavy civil projects
  • Experience managing own forces’ hourly labour
  • Valid driver's license
  • Advanced computer skills, including base knowledge in MS Suite
 
Job ID: VF228116411
 
If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-DNP #IND-DNP
 
David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Superintendent (Civil/Earthworks)
description:
Superintendent (Civil/Earthworks)

We're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values. Then we simply give them the freedom to take their career further.


In the position of a Superintendent, we would ask you to do the following:

-Plan, schedule, direct crews within the budget and timeline assigned

-Provide leadership and training to General Foreman, Foreman and other field staff

-Work with the Safety Advisors to ensure the work is performed safely


Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

-Strong computer skills and experience working with project management software, Excel, Word, and Email

-A minimum of 5 years in a Superintendent role

-10 years of Civil construction experience

-Strong communication skills

-Equipment Operator experience, and a background in big earthworks projects

-You must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS-09) Certificate, Ground Disturbance Level II and Leadership for Safety Excellence

-Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required

-Pre-employment Drug and Alcohol testing is required

You will be based out of the Saskatoon office.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

title: Superintendent
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

Job Description

  • Continuously monitor project budget and forecasting to the individual phase code level and cost type for potential gains and losses
  • Provide leadership and direction for all project activities and tasks, ensuring project outcomes are delivered successfully and in compliance with all contracts and client needs
  • Ensure clear communication of project-specific roles and responsibilities for all site personnel. Provide regular and respectful feedback for all under your direction
  • Monitor company equipment and supplies to ensure the needed equipment is where it’s required.
  • Inspect tools and equipment and notify the Tools and Equipment Manager for service and repair as needed
Qualifications

  • Journeyman trade certification or equivalent experience
  • Technical diploma and/or Gold Seal certification are considered assets
  • Five or more years experience in commercial construction for a large general contractor
  • One or more years experience as a superintendent for a large general contractor


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

The health and safety of our employees, families, industry partners, clients, and communities remains of the utmost importance.  That’s why we’re taking several steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19.

As of November 15, 2021, Chandos Construction requires all employees across the country to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. This is in line with our values and commitment to all stakeholders.

title: Superintendent
description:
Our client has partnered with Randstad Engineering in their search for a Site Superintendent who specializes in Commercial Construction to join their established team spanning the Simcoe County and Kawartha Lakes Region! In this role, the Site Superintendent will effectively control all work on the project job site. In doing this, the Site Superintendent will see to it that the project is constructed in close conformity with the plans and specifications, while ensuring methods used are safe, efficient, economical, expedient, and of high quality.

Advantages
This is a permanent opportunity with a highly reputable organization working on a variety of significant heavy civil construction projects . Our client provides the potential for career growth, a competitive annual salary, + bonus, RRSP, pension, comprehensive benefits plan and paid vacation among other perks, and a fantastic crew culture.

Responsibilities
• Plan, schedule and manage projects for the construction and/or repair of civil construction projects such as roads, bridges, sewers and watermains.
• Be proactive in all aspects of construction requirements including adapting to changes as they
apply to each project.
• Effectively communicate with all members of the construction team as well as effectively
negotiate and resolve any conflicts which may arise.
• Plan and supervise the set-up of temporary field facilities such as power, offices, construction
roads, etc.
• Supervise, check and/or perform the surveying and layout required for the construction
of all portions of the project.
• Effectively plan and carry out the work (in conjunction with Project Manager) to ensure an
efficient, expedient and economical program of construction.
• Be thoroughly familiar with and understand project documentation including the specifications,
project drawings and schedules, etc.
• Manage day to day labour requirements and be able to lead and direct in high pressure
situations.

Qualifications
• University or College degree in Civil Engineering
• Minimum 5 years in a leadership capacity (Foreman or Site Super)
• Experience with municipal projects, asphalt roads, bridges, highways required
• Up to date WHIMS, CPR, Fall Arrest, and Lift Training certifications
• Forward thinking, problem solving mentality with a strong attribution to time management
• Valid G Drivers License

Summary
If you are interested in this opportunity please email lindsay.lambert@randstad.ca and apply today! Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Superintendent
description:
Superintendent

Broad Function
This position reports directly to the Project Manager on supporting and growing the business by coordinating all site construction activities and supervises all field personnel as required to successfully complete the project on schedule and within budget.  Ensures all assigned projects are delivered safely, consistently and effectively and are profitably managed and compliant.  Supports building the Brock brand by providing world class service quality to all stakeholders.

Essential Functions
  • Promote, demonstrate and instill Brock’s Bsafe and Bbest culture in all aspects of the business
  • Responsible for site safety, quality, cost and schedule
  • Ensure proper planning and scheduling of resources, monitoring, and taking corrective actions
  • Assist Project Manager in developing and implementing project Execution Plan, Quality Control Plan, and Site Safety Plan.
  • Own the planning and implementation of a project by executing detailed project plans which include timelines, scheduling, logistics, purchasing and training plans
  • Build strong cross-functional operating partnerships across the organization (as defined in role success profile)
  • Ability to understand the contract and successfully initiate change orders
  • Manage changes to project scope through defined change management process
  • Effectively resolves customer issues / discrepancies
  • Ensure that all appropriate authorizations and approvals are in place and job site is free of hazards and or dangerous conditions. prior to the commencement of any work
  • Assist in quoting and performing preliminary job walks for defined projects
  • Responsible for leveraging opportunities to cross sell Brock’s product and service offerings
  • Maintains communication with Project Manager and Business Development to ensure customers’ needs are met 
  • Identify all operations aspects of the job including: labor, equipment, consumables and materials along with any sub-contract requirements
  • Coordinate with Asset Management and Customer on planning/scheduling, and determining materials & manpower demands for defined projects
  • Work with Business Development and Estimating to transition the job from sales to operations utilizing the Healthy Start process
  • Responsible for job cost management and profitability for assigned projects, including daily tracking and reporting for billable and non-billable activities. 
  • Identify appropriate KPIs based on customer and PM requirements and works with project controls to ensure that the site is tracking the proper data and taking corrective action as required.
  • Audit ongoing operations and identifies opportunities for field efficiencies and standardization of methods to improve margins
  • Manage outsourced services within project constraints
  • Follow Brock’s procurement process and manages vendor relationships
  • Manage site supervision and ensures scope, job efficiency and productivity are met
  • Conduct effective performance evaluations and mentors site and supervision and craft employees
  • Identify knowledge gaps and ensures that all site personnel receive appropriate training
  • Determine labor requirements and recruit and hire talented craft personnel within budgeted constraints
  • Ensure all current personnel policies and procedures are implemented and compliant
  • Work closely with Regional HR Manager to resolve all employee issues fairly and equitably
  • Stay current on industry trends and work practices and participates in continuing education opportunities
  • Attend any site meeting where information is exchanged relating to Brock scope work.
  • Don’t wait to be invited to meetings, be proactive and seek out opportunities to become involved
  • All Client/Brock incident reporting policies are met or exceeded
  • Superintendent is responsible to review safety manual stated policies vs. industry or regulatory policies and make recommendations for enhancement to BSL stated policies.
Working Conditions
  • Working conditions include outdoor and indoor field, yard and shop locations.
  • Site specific hazardous environments
  • Working indoors in an office environment
  • Utilization of Personal Protective Equipment is necessary.
  • Willingness to work in highly varying schedule as site conditions dictate
Skills & Abilities:
  • Ability to work within a highly service-oriented team culture
  • Strong understanding of operational impacts on profitability
  • Understands the meaning and implications of key performance indicators
  • Works with PM to generate, evaluate, and act on strategic options and opportunities
  • Manages conflict with a minimum of noise by integrating diverse views and finding common ground or acceptable alternatives
  • High degree of technical ability such as: read/interpret engineering plans, product knowledge, etc.
  • Ability and willingness to seek out areas for improvement and solve problems
  • Demonstrates courage to address difficult issues
  • Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
  • Proven communication and interpersonal skills, including strong leadership skills
  • Strong customer focus on relationship building
  • Strong organizational skills with ability to multi-task
  • High energy level, strong sense of ethics, discretion and adherence to process
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Tools, such as Excel, PowerPoint, Project and Word.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and work independently
  • Comfortable working in a hands-on environment
Education & Experience
  • 5 years' of craft supervision experience
  • 5 years' tank panel insulation experience
  • Advanced craft or project certifications desirable (NACE, NCCER, PMP, PMI, etc.)
  • Knowledge of employment practices (hiring and termination; discipline, attendance, employment regulations, pay practices, etc.)

title: Superintendent
description:
About the Company:

Here at Axiom Builders, we pride ourselves on being a down-to-earth organization with serious commitment to building things right. As a leading general contractor of mixed-use, residential, commercial, and special projects, we have become one of British Columbiaâ€™s largest construction companies with notable â€˜Canadaâ€™s 2021 Kincentric Best Employersâ€™ award and current employees in the â€™40 Under 40 in Canadian Constructionâ€™ list. With clear purpose and principles, we are an organization that is cultivating dedication and growth in our people, clients, and communities. Learn about what we do from our current and up-coming projects here.

About the Role:

Axiom Builders is looking to bring on a Superintendent for an upcoming high-rise project in the Vancouver area with a projected summer start date. As part of the larger field operations team, the Superintendent will lead and direct a field and site team to manage the overall operations, site, quality and schedule of a construction project. The successful candidate will maintain effective working relationships with our project management, safety and trades partners while ensuring a seamless construction process consistent with Axiom Builders' commitment to quality, objectives and values. Key responsibilities include:

  • Work collaboratively with Project Manager and regularly communicate updates such as field reports, safety inspections, staffing requirements and schedule updates;
  • Oversee subcontractor performance with regards to safety and scope of work;
  • Ensure sufficient staffing is provided to achieve safety, schedule and quality objectives;
  • Identify and advise of design deficiencies, schedule interruptions or difficulties, and other project issues;  
  • Administer contracts, subcontracts, purchase orders, site instructions and change notices to ensure scopes, terms and conditions are properly executed;
  • Supervise and direct trades and labourers through regular instruction, communication feedback;
  • Support CSO and head office in ensuring all employees, subcontractors and contractors are adhering to the safety policies;
  • Work in partnership with Head Office and communicate effectively with all departments and provides reports as requested.
What you Bring:

The ideal Superintendent candidate is a construction and people leader in the field with an extensive expertise in concrete high-rise residential or mixed-use projects. As a carpenter by trade, you are well-versed, knowledgable and influential when communicating daily with our formwork team as well as other trade partners on the site. You have strong connections in the industry and you recognize these relationships will be key to your long-term success at Axiom Builders. You remain calm under pressure and have the ability to motivate the crew to rise to the occasion. People would describe you as a role model - you have the ability to inspire a team of different personalities to work together and you are approachable and willing to listen to challenges they face daily. You value integrity and honesty from your leaders and your team - you not only dedicate yourself to the project, to the team and to the company, but also, just as importantly, to the client.

 

Skills and Experience

  • At least six years of experience as a superintendent for a general contractor with a unique list of various project types (including high rise, institutional, wood frame, tenant improvement, etc);
  • Excellent record of leading a project from pre-construction to completion;
  • Experience with infrastructure, roadworks or bridges will be considered an asset;
  • Ability to build relationships with not only the field staff, but also clients and other external stakeholders;
  • Ability and proven experience to lead and motivate site crew of various sizes and scopes;
  • Proven success in influencing a culture of positivity, ownership and reliability on site.

 

Your Rewards

Axiom Builders is not only committed to the growth of the business, but also to the success and development of our people. We recognize that people are the drivers behind our success, and we provide our teams with the tools and support they need to strive, thrive, and advance their long-term career here.

 

At Axiom Builders, we offer a competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package:

  • Medical and Dental Coverage:  Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost;
  • RRSP Matching Program: We support your future goals by matching up to 5% of your salary;
  • Professional Development and Education Support: We are keen on internal growth and development, which is why we are excited to fully support you in your pursuit of achieving further education;
  • Company Development: Our annual development conference that is hosted by our leadership and complemented by a range of world-class speakers and workshop experts;
  • Leadership Development: Our proprietary Leadership Development program designed to support your continued growth, development and leadership capabilities.

 

Whatâ€™s Next

We are always on the lookout for talented people who are passionate about what they do. If you want to love what you do, and believe that with the right tools and opportunities you can grow with us, simply add your resume through our Careers Portal or email:

careers@axiombuilders.ca

to join our incredible team.  While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

 

Follow us on our LinkedIn to connect with our Talent Acquisition Team and Instagram to see updates on our current projects.

title: Superintendents
description:
We are currently looking for Superintendents to join our team for upcoming future opportunities!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Employee Benefit Program including medical and dental coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Training and Advancement Opportunities 

What you Bring:

  • 3 to 8 years construction supervisory experience
  • Previous experience as a Superintendent, or similar direct supervisory role
  • Combination of work experience in a similar role and industry related trade certification / education
  • Solid understanding of construction practices and trades
  • Ability to plan and manage to a project schedule
  • Understanding of construction documents and the ability to ensure that they are complete, protect the owner's interest, clearly define expectations, and provide incentive to perform
  • Contract negotiation/management skills
  • Knowledge of construction costs and budgets
  • Provide guidance to project staff, responsible for the smooth functioning of day-to-day operations by influencing, developing and implementing field project plans and schedule
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment
  • Previous Experience: Foreman, construction, general foreman, roofing, supervisor, construction foreman, construction supervisor, superintendent, construction superintendent, steamfitter, pipefitter, Project Management

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Journeyman Red Seal Certification
  • Valid Drivers License and Clean Abstract
  • Leadership for Excellence Certificate
  • Standard First Aid
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015

*Please note that this advertisement does not reflect a current job vacancy; this posting is intended to fill upcoming competitions for various projects we are about to start work on. 

*Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for further consideration; we are not accepting phone inquiries at this time.

See Job Description

title: Superintendent (Nights) - Building Construction
description:
Superintendent (Nights) - Building Construction









Location: Vancouver, BC, Canada Job ID: R9825 Job Status: Full-Time



Share:











Apply Now



Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.













Description





Job Summary:

You are an exceptional Superintendent with 3+ years of experience. You will be responsible for overseeing and the coordination of our project to ensure it is completed on time and within budget. As a Superintendent, you are able to work independently or with direction from the team, implement project plans and schedules, ensuring site safety and quality control, and are able to effectively communicate with stakeholders.


Join the Ledcor Building team in Coquitlam, BC today!







Essential Responsibilities



+ Lead the project execution in accordance with contract documents, sub-contracts/agreements, plans, specifications and shop drawings including coordination and execution of changes to the work


+ Daily supervision and coordination of sub-trades


+ Demonstrates leadership in health, safety and environmental protection on the project


+ Applies the requirements of the Project Specific Safety Program (PSSP) to promote overall compliance of Ledcor HS&E standards, applicable OH&S Acts, regulations and codes with all employees and subcontractors on the project.


+ Ensures project materials are supplied and work is completed in compliance with the Project Quality Program


+ Ensures that projects are built according to approved plans, specifications, shop drawings, and applicable building codes and that high quality standards are maintained.


+ Reviews, maintains, and updates the construction schedule in conjunction with project team and ensures project milestones and completion dates are met.


+ Issues material and services purchase orders and confirms receipt of materials and return of equipment


+ Participates in project meetings with internal and external stakeholders to monitor and support the project’s ongoing progression


+ Maintains a thorough daily report that accurately tracks site progress, events, inspections, and other relevant information


+ Performs other related duties as outlined in Ledcor’s Construction Operations Manual





Qualifications



+ Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Superintendent


+ Have a thorough understanding of both high-rise and low-rise residential and commercial projects


+ Great relationship with finishing sub trades, material suppliers and vendors locally


+ Coordinate with the Project Superintendent to plan and manage the project schedule.


+ Must have good customer service experience and able to conduct PDI's


+ Working knowledge of health, safety and environmental protection practices and procedures


+ Solid understanding of current construction practices; working knowledge of construction documents, drawings, specifications and project management


+ Ability to guide safe work practices in a high paced environment while maintaining project quality, schedule and budget


+ Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, understand and interpret stakeholder needs and identify solutions


+ Capable of anticipating constructability issues in moderately complex situations and creating solutions in the construction plan and schedule


+ Skilled at promoting teamwork with project team and stakeholders


+ Have strong budgeting and scheduling skills and aptitude with scheduling software and project management software is a must


+ Ability to use Word, Excel, and Outlook


+ Must have and maintain a valid provincial driver’s license





Work Conditions



+ Night shifts


+ Successful completion of pre-employment drug & alcohol requirements





Additional Information:


Company Description


Ledcor Building offers full-service construction for commercial, residential, institutional, and light industrial projects, along with expertise in green building. Our depth of knowledge and expertise come from building hundreds of projects – of all sizes – across North America each year.




But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!




Employment Equity


At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.



Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.




View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here (https://www.ledcor.com/who-we-are/inclusion-and-diversity) .



Date Posted

May 4, 2022



1067 West Cordova Street, Vancouver, BC, Canada

title: Project Manager, Terminal Construction
description:
“We connect communities and customers to the people and places important in their lives”








PROJECT MANAGER, TERMINAL CONSTRUCTION


Victoria or Tsawwassen








A results-oriented and experienced Project Manager, your goal is to effectively manage marine, civil, and building construction projects at our terminals. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Terminal Construction PMO, you will be involved in multiple projects from preliminary planning through to commissioning, as well as supporting other the departmental technical initiatives. Other specific responsibilities include: initiating feasibility studies and undertaking preliminary field investigations; leading stakeholder meetings and public consultation; identifying, developing and presenting project business cases; and identifying, preparing, managing and being accountable for project scope, schedule, required resources, and budget. You will also manage the tendering process and will be required to coach project coordinators, ensuring a high degree of professionalism and organization throughout the department.





You will have excellent knowledge of construction contract law and expertise in the preparation, review, and interpretation of technical design documentation and drawings. You are a systematic thinker with the ability to provide effective solutions to complex problems. You have a positive attitude and excellent interpersonal and communication skills which allow you to maintain effective working relationships.





You bring seven to ten years progressive project management experience, with considerable experience managing capital construction projects, specifically site planning and development, consultants, major contracts, project budgets and financial reporting. You possess a Bachelor Degree in Civil or Mechanical Engineering and membership, or eligibility to be registered, as a Professional Engineer with EGBC. Alternatively, a Civil or Mechanical Engineering Technologist with AScT designation and comprehensive work experience will be considered. PMP designation is an asset.





Please apply by May 20, 2022. You will be required to create a profile which you can use to apply on future career opportunities.





At BC Ferries, our employees are our most important assets in delivering our commitment to customer safety, service and satisfaction. We offer a unique West Coast working environment with diverse challenges and opportunities. Whether your goal is to work behind the scenes, onboard our ships, or within our land based operations, you are a key contributor to the BC Ferries team.





With 47 ports of call and around 500 sailings every day, BC Ferries is the largest independently-owned ferry company in the world. Dedicated to safety, excellence, innovation, and people, we are committed to continuously improving the west coast travel experience of our customers.





BC Ferries supports employment equity and diversity in the workplace and we encourage applications from all qualified individuals including women, visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (LGBTQ2S+), and others who reflect our ever-changing workplace.





We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.













Job Type: Full Time

Job Post End: 5/20/2022

External Company URL: http://www.bcferries.com/

Post End Date: 5/21/2022

title: Site Superintendent (FT)
description:
Site Superintendent - Williams Lake.

The Site Superintendent will primarily be responsible to ensure all persons on the construction site are using the required personal protective equipment properly and at all times. This position will ensure all employees are performing duties in compliance with company policies and standards for cost control, waste reduction, quality, safety, and complete and on-time delivery. This role will also manage job site administration duties, such as reviewing/submitting employee time-sheets and completing/maintaining daily logs. The Site Superintendent must possess a degree or diploma in a related field and position-relevant bonding and certifications.

Location: 60 Westridge Dr, Williams Lake, BC.

Responsibilities:
  • Monitor and maintain the project construction schedule as needed.
  • Control and monitor labor, material, and equipment needs.
  • Coordinate and direct good construction standards and quality control.
  • See that good housekeeping practices are observed and maintained.
  • Attend pre-construction and construction meetings, taking notes on areas that may present a future problem and present to the Project Manager for consultation.
  • Coordinate all required inspections as mandated.
  • Prepare and expedite project deficiency lists.
  • Collaborate with the team to determine project needs.
  • Plan construction processes.
  • Estimate costs and ensure the project is on budget.
  • Supervise staff and provide constructive feedback.
  • Monitor and report on project progress.
  • Plan inspections and obtain construction permits from local authorities.
  • Implement safety and quality guidelines.
  • Ensure the job site remains safe, clean, and orderly.
  • Resolve on-site issues and emergencies.

Requirements:
  • 5+ years of experience as Construction Site Superintendent.
  • Degree or diploma in a related field.
  • Position-relevant bonding and certifications.
  • A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills.
  • Ability to manage coordination efforts in construction projects with various parties, such as architects, project engineers, and landscaping installers.
  • Strong knowledge of health and safety regulations.
  • Proven experience preparing and conducting post-implementation evaluations.
  • Ability to create realistic schedules to support the timely completion of construction projects.
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise necessary cost control measures.
  • Demonstrated project management skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage conflicting demands.
  • Ability to delegate, set expectations, and monitor the progress of all direct reports.

Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!

New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.



About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

title: Construction Manager
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is seeking an experienced Construction Manager to join our growing team!  

 

Position Overview

Plan, direct, and coordinate constructions activities, usually through subordinate supervisory personnel. Liaise with customers regarding activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. Participate in the conceptual development of a construction project and oversee its organization, scheduling, and Execution.   Work in a safe manner, abiding by all company safety rules and applicable legislation.

This position involves working outdoors and extreme temperatures in Alberta climate. May involve working at heights or in confined spaces. Travel, out-of-town work, and shifts would be dependent upon project assignment.

 

Technical Duties and Essential Functions

  • Follow all company and site-specific safety rules. Working within the Companyâ€™s Safety Program at all times. Maintaining behaviour-based safety essentials and adherence to the Life Saving Rules. Understand and respond accordingly to all safety alerts, warnings, hazards, etc.
  • Use effective verbal and written communication skills. Able to adequately comprehend and communicate using the English Language. Listen and communicate effectively and respectfully.
  • Liaise with Construction Team, Management, and Customer representatives to ensure safe and successful execution of all project goals.
  • Respond to customer needs while promoting a safe workplace and meeting quality, budgetary and schedule requirements.
  • Lead and participate in construction planning and progress meetings, responding and adapting to changing conditions.
  • Able to interpret, understand and explain contract terms and project requirements to team members.
  • Motivate, mentor, develop and direct employees throughout the workday.
  • Delegate tasks to the construction supervision team to effectively manage project needs and deadlines.
  • Regularly review all aspects of project progress, ensuring compliance with contractual requirements, construction and safety codes and local laws.
  • Act as a role model for Woodâ€™s safety program. Encouraging full participation of all employees, at all times.
  • Work with the Quality Department, ensuring that all aspects of the project meet required specifications.
  • Utilize Advanced Work Packages to direct construction activities.
  • Assist with proposal process and construction execution plan development
  • Perform other duties as required
Skills / Qualifications (Text Only):Education and Experience: - Bachelorâ€™s degree in mechanical or civil engineering OR Journeyperson Certification in a related field with considerable leadership training and experience.- Minimum of 15+ years in Construction Management or related field.- Excellent leadership and interpersonal communication skills are required.- Experience in building successful client-contractor relationships- Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications.- Experience with progress measurement software and 3D model reviews- Extensive knowledge of established construction and maintenance practices, procedures, and techniques as well as applicable local, provincial, and Canadian codes.- Familiarity with a wide range of equipment and tools and proficiency in skilled construction and maintenance.- Strong commitment to Construction Safety - Business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources, leadership techniques, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.- Applicable knowledge of Advanced Work Packaging Best Practices  Physical Requirements:- Must pass a site-specific drug and alcohol test, as required by the customer- Must possess enough strength and stamina to perform the technical duties and essential functions as identified above. - May be required consistently to work 10hour shifts performing physical labour in varying temperature extremes and conditions. May be required to work overtime on occasion- Must be able to climb and maintain balance on stairs, ladders, scaffolds and steel framework, utilizing proper fall arrest procedures when required. Able to safely and comfortably work at heights without posing a danger to oneself or others - Able to meet physical requirements of frequent walking, climbing, standing, bending, twisting, and crawling for the duration of the shift. Aspects of the job may require sitting or walking for extended durations.  Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Senior Construction Manager
description:
Job Description

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

  • Reporting to the Site Director, the Construction Manager will act as the senior EPCM Contractor's representative on site.
  • Manage and supervise the construction management team assigned to the Project.
  • Responsible for overall construction activities and the global execution of the works in respect of cost, schedule, quality and HSSE objectives.
  • ln conjunction with the HSSE Manager, the Construction Manager is responsible for leading, managing, assisting, and monitoring the Trade Contractors to provide a safe environment for all personnel during the construction phase.
  • Ensuring that provisions have been made for resources and training necessary to carry out the project HSSE program and ensure that the policies and procedures are communicated and applied throughout the project site organization.
  • Support the pre-operational verification activities to ensure that the facilities can be commissioned on time and within budget.

What will you contribute?

  • Degree in Engineering from a recognized institution.
  • 20+ years’ experience in Construction Management, either as a Contractor or an Owner’s Representative on large scale mining projects.
  • Expert knowledge of materials means and methods, and equipment involved in the construction of heavy works.
  • Proficiency in reading and interpreting contract requirements, including contractor/client negotiations.
  • Advanced communication skills (written and verbal) and ability to maintain professional and effective working relationships with Project Owner and related team.
  • Advanced ability to engage team and drive performance.
  • Expert knowledge in construction safety standards with ability to drive safety culture.
  • Strong understanding of risk management.
  • Results oriented with extremely high work ethic, stringent quality standards and can-do attitude.
  • An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available atsnclavalin.comor follow us onLinkedInandTwitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: 22-045 Intermediate Maintenance Project Manager
description:
Our client, a Canadian global leader in exploration, mine engineering, and environmental protection has an immediate need for an Intermediate Maintenance Project Manager. This individual will oversee the implementation of mill lubrication systems and tool crib management including digitization, contractor onboarding/offboarding and generating authorizations for expenditures. This is a contract position for four (4) months located at the client's northern Saskatchewan operations.

Fly In Fly Out Camp accommodations provided

Rotation (2 weeks in-2 weeks out, 11 hours a day)

Company Charter Flights provided - Departing from Saskatoon, Saskatchewan

Responsibilities:

  • Implement and maintain the project schedule on a daily or weekly basis and review progress with the project team and client representatives
  • Monitoring and reviewing project delivery components including administration, authorization for expenditures and resource planning
  • Manage and coordinate staffing, safety and quality effort for the project, utilizing supervision, safety and QA resources accordingly
  • Establish an honest working relationship with other contractors, sub-contractors, and the client, and proactively resolve challenges and barriers
  • Ensuring an appropriate review process is implemented for the project including client project reviews, risk review and execution reviews

Qualifications:

  • Strong project management experience on mining or underground projects
  • Proficient understanding of mining and mineral processing
  • Minimum 7 years of project management experience leading large multi-discipline teams
  • Proven experience in winning and delivering project management services for mining and processing commissioning projects
  • Strong task management skills, with the ability to manage tight deadlines and competing priorities
  • Demonstrated success in building trusting relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Strong leadership, communicative, analytical and adaptability skills
  • Excellent computer skills (MS O365, MS Project, Adobe, SAP, etc)
  • Must be self sufficient, self motivated and the ability to multitask

Nice to Haves:

  • Profession Degree in Civil, Structural, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering
  • Completion of a diploma or degree in a certified project management program
  • Journeyperson trade certificate or technologist diploma or equivalent

Additional Information

Client requires proof of Covid-19 vaccination to access job site. Providing proof of vaccination is a condition of employment with Ian Martin for this opportunity.

If you're a technical professional, you know that it can be difficult to find fulfilling work that advances your career. At the Ian Martin Group, we exist to connect professionals like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at

http://recruit@ianmartin.com/

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

#WES

#MON

title: Project Superintendent - Road Construction
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

The objective of the Project Superintendent is to coordinate and supervise manpower, materials lay down, subcontractors and equipment in order to successfully complete the awarded projects safely, as specified, on schedule and on budget.  The position will assist the Project Manager in the overall management of assigned projects.

Responsibilities

Health, Safety and Environment:

  • Demonstrates a commitment to a safe work environment. Understands the safety objectives of the organization and supports these efforts in a visible manner.
  • Maintains a working knowledge of safety policies and regulations to ensure duties of self and others are performed in a safe manner.
  • Administers Safety Policies and Programs to employees, subcontractors, and sub-trades including all required meetings.

Responsibilities:

  • Constant monitoring of projects to ensure safety standards are adhered to
  • In conjunction with the PM/General Superintendent, schedule all phases of the project to meet completion dates
  • Update schedules as required
  • A strong understanding of Alberta One Calls and required permits, distributing information appropriately
  • Assist foremen in coordinating daily tasks, including personnel, equipment, and materials
  • Ensure that quality meets specifications and customer expectations
  • Accurate and on-time reports, including time, production, materials, etc.
  • Attend site meetings as a representative
  • Maintain and develop strong working relationship with customers and/or representatives
  • Report deficiencies, potential issues or opportunities as soon as they appear or are foreseen
  • Maintain a daily project diary
  • Supervise, train, and act as mentor to foremen
  • Estimate and/or assist estimators with tenders
  • Understanding scope of project to track measurements for payment, change orders, and extras
  • Understanding of labour laws and collective agreements.
  • Communicate expectations clearly to all internal stakeholders on site, mentor and guide
  • Onsite liaison with customers, building respectful and sustainable relationships
  • Organizing subcontractors on site

Dimensions:

  • Number of employees: 1 - 50
  • Number of subcontractors: 1 -5
  • Total cost of projects: $1 - $20 million

Qualifications

Education:

Certified Engineering Technologist Diploma, or related post-secondary education, equivalent hands-on experience will also be considered

 

Knowledge, Skills & Experience:

  • Road construction – minimum of five years’ field based experience preferred
  • Solid estimating experience – minimum of two years preferred
  • Proven ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams
  • Ability to estimate contracts, schedule work and materials
  • Ability to read technical drawings
  • Effectively conduct meetings with owners, consultants, inspectors, suppliers, sub-contractors, and other customers to promote Lafarge products and image
  • Basic knowledge of operation of heavy equipment for road construction
  • Basic mechanical knowledge
  • Solid understanding of quality control
  • Strong supervisory skills and interpersonal skills
  • Sound knowledge of Safety Policies and Programs
  • Basic product knowledge
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
  • Experience with MS Project, Build2Win, AutoCAD and MS Office Suite is an asset

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Capital Construction Manager
description:
capital construction manager

Are you looking for career opportunities within a global growing real estate company?

Then you might be our next Capital Construction Manager.

Join us and be a part of our journey.

 

 

job description

Akelius is seeking a Capital Construction Manager to join the construction department.

The Capital Construction Manager will manage several multi-family residential construction and renovation projects throughout the local portfolio. 

The successful candidate will be a team player that successfully collaborates with internal and external personnel.

They will be a forward thinker with the ability to share ideas and suggestions and focus on the big picture.

 

  • manage multiple residential retrofit and restoration projects throughout the cities area
  • initiate projects from the concept stage, carry out feasibilities and investigations and see them through construction completion
  • review designs, specifications, and tender packages

 

  • advise on budget and project costs and provide recommendations to branch managers
  • monitor on-site construction and actively enforce quality and schedule with contractors
  • provide branch managers with updates on schedule, budget, and design

 

  • effectively communicate to property managers and property administrators about schedule updates and potential tenant disruptions
  • review completed projects and address deficiencies in a timely manner
  • other duties as assigned

who you are

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology, Architecture, or Architectural science
  • Three-plus years of large-scale residential or commercial construction projects experience
  • clean criminal background

 

  • problem-solving ownership of responsibilities, able to anticipate and address issues, solutions-focused and driven
  • a team player, work as a team with internal and external personnel, forward-thinking, ability to share ideas and suggestions, focus on the big picture, and pitch-in attitude
  • time management and organization, set priorities, meet deadlines and multitask

 

how to apply

Apply here.

 

about Akelius

Akelius acquires, upgrades, and manages residential properties.

Akelius owns 18 thousand rental apartments in the metropolitan cities of New York, Boston, Washington D.C., Montreal, Toronto, London, Paris, and Austin.

 

Read more at www.akelius.com.

 

Akelius Canada is committed to providing accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you are contacted for this position and require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please let the HR team know.
