title: Senior Project Manager, Electrical Construction
description:
Do you welcome the challenge of working on complex, multi-million dollar projects and take pride on completing them on time and on budget? Take the leap and make your mark at Plan Group!

As our Senior Project Manager you:

  • Establish and achieve project targets and milestones to deliver electrical construction projects on-time and within budget.
  • Provide active promotion and leadership in Health and Safety
  • Monitor and provide status updates of work in progress, forecasts, cost control and project schedule in line with Plan Group's T.I.M.E. efficiency program.
  • Proactively identify and bring to management's attention potential problems and/or schedule delays.
  • Lead and manage project quality assurance, commissioning, and handover objectives.
  • Develop and lead value engineering, cost savings, and pricing initiatives and activities.
  • Monitor and analyze critical path activities and advise project team accordingly.
  • Review and manage short interval planning.
  • Lead pre-job planning including estimate turnover, kick off meetings, subcontractor selection, material handling strategies and opportunities for risk management and improved productivity.
  • "Last Planner" scheduling is an asset.
  • Oversee monthly forecasts of project financial performance against financial budget, productivity targets and operational goals
  • Follow up with site supervision on labour/manpower progress; identify and reduce roadblocks to success. 
  • Manage project team to ensure requirements for document control, change order process, coordination of equipment and material deliveries, site meetings and progress documentation are adhered to.
  • Identify opportunities to provide project team members with regular feedback, coaching and training.
  • Build strong relationships with clients, GCs and Engineers to positively contribute to the success of the project.

Our ideal candidate has:

  • Electrical Engineering post-secondary education or related
  • A minimum of five to ten years construction project management experience; trade experience a definite asset.
  • Experience managing large scale electrical commercial and institutional projects.
  • Experience managing project teams

Take the leap and make your mark at Plan Group!', 'Provide active promotion and leadership in Health and Safety']

title: Senior Construction Project Manager : ICI
description:
Are you aSeniorProject Manageror ambitious Project Managerlooking to grow your career withahigh-end commercial interiors GCin the GTA? Are you interested in working for a company with an excellent reputation for working on large high-end and innovative commercial interiors and base build projects? Do you enjoy collaborating with a close-knit team and mentoring/coaching junior staff? Then read on…

This is a new role developed out of growth. The company has developed an impressive track record of successfully completing large interiors and base-build projects for Fortune 500 clientele – and have a ton of upcoming projects! With your previous project management experience and eye for detail you will excel in this client focused role. With your previous experience you will work closely with the executive team, manage client expectations, and oversee commercial interiors and ground-up projects.

What you will get out of it
Our client is a leading commercial construction general contractor with an excellent reputation for constructing ‘one of a kind’ commercial interiors projects across the GTA. You will be compensated competitively with a salary and benefits package respectful of your experience. Collaborating with executive leadership towards project success and client satisfaction.

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Intermediate Superintendent (ICI Construction)
description:
Job Description:

Superintendent - ICI Construction

 

You enjoy being the leader of a team of construction professionals focused on delivering a quality project every time.

 

You have leadership goals and looking for the right organization to grow with.

 

You have built your career as a Superintendent with a stellar safety record and maintained solid relationships with your Project Managers, clients and other key project stakeholders.

 

Then this is the next step in your career.

 

As a Superintendent with our busy Buildings Division, you will have the responsibility of overseeing our site staff, field engineering and field teams accountable for the delivery of completed ICI building projects.     Maple Reinders is a growing organization and we are continually winning new work. With that come new experiences and new challenges.

 

At Maple, we look for leaders who can:

  • Direct field operations in the delivery of projects by adhering to schedules, budgets, safety and risk.
  • Effectively manage field employees by providing guidance and leadership on construction activities and developing effective communication between field and other project staff.
  • Develop and execute project work plans aimed at keeping projects on track and on budget.
  • Provide senior level presence in the field, coach field staff on issue resolution, review site labour requirements, mentor field staff and perform succession planning.

 

Our Superintendent will oversee projects that vary in size and scope and the successful candidate should have previous experience in leading construction teams, trades and hourly employees. Many of our projects are located within Southern Ontario; however, work can sometimes take us to other provinces.     We would require the Superintendent to travel or stay close to the site; flexibility is a must. We are also focused on candidates who currently have:

  • Five or more years experience assisting or supervising construction projects of increasing complexity
  • Post-secondary education, CET or equivalent
  • Proficiency with MS Office and Windows based computer applications (Word, Excel, Outlook and Project)
  • Can manage site operations on complex projects in excess of $40 million

 

The Superintendent is a key member of Maple Reindersâ€™ project team and is critical to the success of each project under their direction.  We want you to succeed and we are prepared to get you there by investing in you. We offer extensive training through our â€œCentre of Learningâ€ to facilitate your career growth through programs such as LEED, Gold Seal and â€œlunch and learnsâ€.

 

If you are a solid construction leader, we want to hear from you. Please provide your project list including the dollar value along with your resume and cover letter.

 

Thank you for your interest in a career with Maple Reinders. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Maple Reinders is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Maple Reinders accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

 

No agency calls please.

 

 

People, Passion, Performance

title: Regional Manager, Director of Construction
description:
Location: Winnipeg, MB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 1/12/2022Job ID: 9L281859111Category: Engineering & Technical
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to recruit for a Regional Manager, Director of Construction based in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Our client is expanding their business and opening its doors in Winnipeg. This newly created leadership role will be able to put their own stamp on this business, with the assistance of head office in another province. This business is already in operation throughout Manitoba and within Winnipeg.

Reporting into the Owner, the Regional Director will be responsible for informing, supporting and implementing the strategy to grow and enhance our operational capabilities within the organization. These responsibilities include leading a profitable project profile, while attaining goals related to Safety, Quality, Talent, and Growth.

The Role:
  • Develop and implement a strategy to grow and enhance the company
  • Develops effective working relationships with clients to deliver world class construction solutions, drive repeat or new business and ensure issues/ conflicts are resolved
  • Review and assure work proposals and final submissions on identified priority projects
  • Responsible for overseeing and managing planning and scheduling on all projects to ensure that projects are constructed in a safe, timely and cost-effective manner
  • Ensure all projects are adequately staffed with the appropriate resources
  • Accountable for the development and execution of the annual budget
  • Responsible for the hiring, developing, and retaining the strongest talent within the industry, Responsible to ensure strong people practices are followed and turnover is low
  • Actively participate in Project and/or Risk Review meetings to ensure relevant issues are identified and resolved
  • Continuously monitor the organizational structures within the group to ensure optimal performance and delivery of results
  • Assist in the establishment and ensure compliance of operational short-term and long-term goals which are aligned to overall corporate objectives
  • Communicate with employees about the company plans and progress and drive performance toward agreed upon expectations
  • Accountable for monitoring strong project controls practices within the company and ensuring operational performance issues are proactively managed and mitigated
  • Works closely with finance and operational management teams to review forecasting metrics, manage cash flow, working capital, and other critical financial metrics regularly. Anticipates and mitigates issues
  • Works to develop new business within existing markets. Collaborates with internal operational teams to maximize multi-disciplinary construction opportunities
  • Ensures high quality standards are in place in all operations

The Ideal Candidate:
  • Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in Sub contractor Construction in a related industry.
  • Engineering (or related) post-secondary Degree or diploma
  • Knowledge of building envelope Industry
  • Experience managing a P&L center and building strong teams
  • Experience in large, complex, and diverse operating environments. Ability to demonstrate strong personal performance and ability to oversee complex project execution
  • Experience in negotiation and demonstrated strong dispute resolution skills
  • Experience effectively leading complex, multi-facet teams
  • Experience developing new business with demonstrated growth in new or existing markets
  • Experience with complex legal concepts related to construction contract law
  • Demonstrated success working government stakeholders at every level

If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Leanne Bonnar, Partner, Engineering & Technical. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.

If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian-owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, over four decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!

Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.

title: Chef de projet de construction / Construction Project Manager
description:
VERSION FRANÇAISE

Chef de projet de construction

 

À propos du poste

Le groupe IBE est à la recherche d'un chef de projet de construction pour leur emplacement de Montréal.

 

À propos de l'entreprise

Le Groupe IBE est une entreprise d'entrepreneur général au sein du domaine de la construction qui se spécialise dans les secteurs résidentiels, commerciaux et institutionnels. Nous exécutons une variété de projets à l'échelle internationale. Nous sommes une équipe unie, diversifiée, ambitieuse et multidisciplinaire. Notre objectif est de fournir des solutions optimales à nos clients en leur apportant notre expertise en gestion de projet et notre expertise technique.

Nous sommes une équipe agile en pleine expansion. Nous valorisons la communication, la transparence, l'apprentissage continu et le travail d'équipe. Nous nous efforçons de nous développer et d'atteindre ensemble nos objectifs communs. Nous avons de grandes aspirations et nous apprécions les idées de notre équipe.

En rejoignant le groupe IBE, vous faites partie d'une équipe qui veut votre succès. Vous aurez les outils et l'opportunité de perfectionner vos compétences et de faire partie de projets passionnants.

 

Principales responsabilités:

  • Recueillir les informations techniques et administratives nécessaires auprès des personnes impliquées lors de la soumission
  • S'assurer que les permis et autorisations nécessaires à l'exécution des travaux sont obtenus
  • Participer à l'élaboration de programmes de prévention et environnementaux tout en assurant le suivi du chantier
  • Avec le surintendant et l'équipe discuter, établir et préparer les méthodes de travail envisagées
  • Passer les commandes de matériaux critiques, négocier les prix et préparer les documents contractuels pour les sous-traitants en collaboration avec le chef de projet
  • Coordonner et participer à diverses réunions
  • Établir et maintenir les communications nécessaires avec les sous-traitants, les professionnels et le client
  • Préparer et suivre le budget d'exécution avec votre chef de projet
  • Livrer le projet en collaboration avec le surintendant et obtenir l'acceptation finale du client
  • Superviser la collecte et la création des documents de fin de travaux

 

Exigences du rôle:

  • Diplôme universitaire ou diplôme technique dans les domaines de l'ingénierie, de l'architecture, des sciences du bâtiment ou de la technologie de la construction
  • Entre 2 et 3 ans d'expérience dans la mise en œuvre de projets publics, la gestion d'équipe et l'estimation au sein d'entreprises d'entrepreneurs généraux dans le domaine de la construction
  • Parfaitement bilingue en français et en anglais (parlé, lu et écrit)
  • Compétences techniques et analytiques, ainsi que résolution de problèmes
  • Compétences en gestion, négociation et communication
  • État d'esprit axé sur la résolution de problèmes et une réponse rapide à l'évolution des besoins opérationnels ou des clients sont essentiels
  • Compréhension approfondie des procédures de construction et des principes et systèmes de gestion de projet
  • Excellentes compétences en gestion, en négociation et en leadership ainsi que d'excellentes compétences en matière d'organisation et de gestion du temps
  • Bonnes compétences en communication verbale et écrite en anglais

 

Ce que nous offrons:

  • Salaire compétitif
  • Assurance collective pour soins médicaux et dentaires
  • Cotisations REER possibles
  • Accompagnement dans votre formation et développement
  • Possibilité d'évolution au sein de l'organisation
  • Prime de performance
  • Allocations et avantages sociaux éventuels (voiture, essence, etc.)
  • Stationnement gratuit au centre de Montréal (ou à 5 minutes à pied du métro)

 

Cela ressemble à la prochaine étape de votre carrière? Si oui, nous serions ravis de discuter avec vous!

 

ENGLISH VERSION

Construction Project Manager

 

About the job

The IBE Group is looking for a Construction Project Manager for their Montreal location.

 

About the company

The IBE Group is a general contractor company working in the construction industry in residential, commercial and institutional sectors. We execute a variety of projects internationally. We are a tight-knit, diverse, ambitious and multi-disciplinary team. Our objective is to provide optimal solutions to our clients by providing them with our project management and technical expertise.

We are an agile team in full expansion. We value communication, transparency continuous learning and teamwork. We thrive on developing ourselves and achieving our common goals together. We have big aspirations, and we value our team's ideas.

When joining the IBE group, you become part of a team that wants your success. You will be given the tools and opportunity to hone your skills and be part of exciting projects.

 

Main Responsibilities:

  • Collect the necessary technical and administrative information from the people involved during the submission
  • Ensure that the permits and authorizations required for the execution of the work are obtained
  • Participate in the development of prevention and environmental programs while ensuring site monitoring
  • With the superintendent and the team discuss, establish and prepare the envisaged work methods
  • Place orders for critical materials, negotiate prices and prepare contract documents for subcontractors in collaboration with the project manager
  • Coordinate and participate in various meetings
  • Establish and maintain the necessary communications with subcontractors, professionals and the client
  • Prepare and monitor the execution budget with your project manager
  • Deliver the project in collaboration with the superintendent and obtain final acceptance from the client
  • Supervise the collection and creation of end-of-work documents

 

Role Requirements:

  • University degree or technical degree in the fields of engineering, architecture, building science or construction technology
  • Between 2 and 3 years of experience in public project implementation, team management and estimation at general contractor companies in the construction field in Quebec or Ontario
  • Perfectly bilingual in French and English (spoken, read and written)
  • Ability to prioritize and work independently with minimal supervision
  • Technical and analytical skills, as well as problem solving
  • Management, negotiation and communication skills

 

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Group insurance for medical and dental
  • Possible RRSP contributions
  • Support in your training and development
  • Possibility for advancement within the organization
  • Performance bonus
  • Possible allowances and perk benefits (car, gas, etc.)
  • Free parking in the center of Montreal (or 5 minute walk from the metro)

 

Does this sound like the next step in your career? If so, we'd love to talk with you!

title: Project Manager - High Rise Development
description:
Our client has an immediate opening for a Project Manager to manage a high rise project scheduled to start this year.  Consideration will be given to Assistant PM's who are looking to transition into a Project Management role.
 

  • Responsible for implementing project goals
  • Assign duties to staff to implement project goals, as needed
  • Oversee variable aspects of projects and provide direct assistance to ensure timely project execution
  • Overview project goals and ensure project goals are achievable
  • Liaise with project lead and other project managers to maintain project schedule and efficacy
  • Assist with procuring materials and other items necessary for completing project goals
  • Review project implementation and gather data on project execution
  • Coordinate with project managers and other project leads following project execution

Qualifications for Assistant Project Manager

  • Post secondary education in a Construction 
  • 1-5 years of proven and successful experience in a similar role
  • Verifiable leadership experience and capabilities, with past successful project execution
  • Ability and desire to work collaborative to ensure successful project execution
  • Working knowledge of necessary industry-related tools
  • Expert-level experience with computer operating systems
  • Proven ability to generate and deliver reports that provide useful insight into project details
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented with a passion for ensuring projects proceed efficiently and effectively

title: ESAP Electrical Project Manager
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald's Ottawa team is growing! If you are committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you.

This opportunity relates to the modernization of the heating and cooling energy distribution systems to over 80 buildings in the National Capital Region.  The ESAP project involves construction of four new central heating and cooling plants plus associated distribution piping networks over a period of five years, under a Joint Venture Partnership with another leading major Contractor.  The Project Manager will have responsibility for a defined scope of work within an integrated project team. The Project Manager will oversee the engineering design, and be responsible to plan, organize, coordinate, procure, control and evaluate the scope of work from start to finish according to schedule, specifications and budget of a new CHCP to be constructed in Gatineau, Quebec.

Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Ensure company safety policy is adhered to on all projects
  • Provide oversight of the electrical design of a new CHCP
  • Manage the procurement and delivery of materials and equipment
  • Manage and provide scheduling, planning, organizing of labor, and subcontractors
  • Coordinate with mechanical team and other disciplines
  • Manage the change order process for extras and revisions to the scope of work
  • Liaison with owner, engineers, subcontractors, and tradespersons
  • Monitor and increase labor productivity
  • Responsible for cost control and forecasting
  • Attend and run project meetings
  • Prepare and submit construction work packages and estimates as required
  • Review work/contracts/WIP for areas of risk and correct deficiencies
  • Liaison with Authorities Having Jurisdiction

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Change Orientation
  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Problem Solving and Innovation
  • Teamwork and Collaboration

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

Degree or Diploma in

  • Construction Management
  • Engineering

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 5-10 years' experience in the construction industry

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Advance knowledge and understanding of:

  • Contract management
  • Construction scheduling, planning, and execution
  • Applicable local and provincial labor codes
  • Business operations processes
  • Organization and time management
  • Bilingual in French & English

Proficient user of:

  • MS Office (Word, Excel, Project)

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities. 

Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

If you are an existing Black & McDonald employee, please notify your supervisor of your interest and intent to apply before applying.

title: Project Manager, Hazardous Materials
description:
Your Employer:

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and itâ€™s more than 2,600 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

 

As a Project Manager, Hazardous Materials, you will work in collaboration with the Hygiene Health and Safety Team.

Your Contribution:
  • Apply and promote  Englobeâ€™s  health and safety rules.
  • Coordinating projects in one or more of the following areas.
  • Designated Substances/Hazardous Materials Surveys.
  • Indoor Air Quality Assessments.
  • Hazardous Materials Tendering and Abatement Supervision.
  • Coordinating projects in other areas of Environmental Consulting, as required.
  • Generating and providing technical reviews of deliverable documentation such as technical reports, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Managing and/or generating deliverable documentation of various projects including technical documents.
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures and work plans.
  • Interacting, coordinating, and scheduling projects with clients, as directed by the Team Lead or Director.
  • Participating in project management meetings, office meetings, health, and safety inspections.
  • Maintaining a commitment to exceeding client expectations by consistently delivering high quality of work.
  • Consistently maintaining professionalism and objectivity while working with colleagues and clients who require varying degrees of support.
  • Handling difficult situations with tact and diplomacy to maintain positive working relationships with all internal and external contacts.
  • Conducting project administration tasks as required, including timesheet generation, project finance management and project invoicing.
Your Profile:
  • Undergraduate degree and/or applicable (science/engineering) diploma required.
  • Minimum 2 years experience in a consulting environment.
  • Experience providing reviews to proposals, specifications, case studies, technical and non-technical reports required.
  • Solid understanding of provincial and federal regulatory requirements acquired through experience and education.
  • Possession of valid driverâ€™s license required.
  • Possession of or eligibility to obtain secret security clearance required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Project Manager, Electrical
description:
Your Employer:

Arrow Engineering Inc. is a division of  Englobe Corp.  Since 1961, Englobe has been providing consulting services and is a national leader in environmental, geotechnical, pavement and materials engineering and building science with specialized services in civil, municipal and transportation engineering.

 

With the Arrow team joining Englobe, we have expanded our service offerings but remain your easy-to-work-with multi-discipline engineering firm. We specialize in  Mechanical,  Electrical, and  Civil Engineering  across Canada.

 

Your Contribution

 

As a Project Manager, in our Electrical Engineering team, you have a  shared responsibility for the performance and success of our Electrical Engineering team, and firm, respectively. This position will report directly to the Principal or Senior Project Manager, work independently, and with minimal supervision, while working in collaboration with various colleagues and external partners. The Project Manager, Electrical actively guides a professional team working on various electrical engineering projects represented by a broad range of client sectors. The work environment is of high volume, offering a range of project complexities and requires a high level of responsibility.

Your Contribution:
  • Actively participates in all projects, providing guidance, client input/feedback, and general direction
  • Working with the design team on the project, develops and monitors electrical design strategies for building construction to ensure efficient and sustainable project delivery
  • Successfully develops relationships with clients, industry affiliates, engineers, technologists, technicians, and construction personnel
  • Manages client relationships and project service delivery, actively participating in the entire project life cycle, from preliminary services through project implementation, and warranty
  • Meet with clients regarding projects, progress reporting, and the resolution of issues, as required
  • Coordinates the preparation of engineering specifications and drawings, quantity and cost estimates
  • Responsible for ensuring the electrical drawings and specifications meet established project criteria and applicable standards
  • Develops standards related to our electrical engineering practice, ensuring best practices for project management and delivery
  • Utilization of industry specific software and related technologies in design and analysis
  • Preparation of reports, proposals, and tender/bid submissions, budgets, project plans, and other supporting documentation, as required
  • When necessary, involvement with a variety of agencies for project approvals and permitting
  • Estimating and scheduling of projects, procurement of materials, and update / maintenance of company-related resources
Your Profile:

Education

A degree, diploma, or certification from a recognized post-secondary institution, in the area of electrical engineering (Engineering, CAD Design, Technologies, or Project Management). LEED Accreditation and experience with sustainable design initiatives is considered an asset.

 

Experience

Five to ten years of experience in consulting electrical design engineering for buildings or equivalent experience and responsibilities is required. A comprehensive working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Excel, along with AutoCAD drafting experience are required. Experience with Revit would be considered an asset.

 

Character Strengths

  • Excellent command of English grammar, spelling and composition, as well as oral communication and interpersonal skills
  • Professional, energetic and action-oriented
  • Strong organization, time management, and prioritization skills
  • Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to work individually and as a team member, within a dynamic, fast-paced, deadline driven environment
  • Effectively manages a variety of projects and/or initiatives, often occurring simultaneously
  • Able to balance work and personal requirements
  • Sense of humour
  • Enjoys working in a professional office environment, with occasional client and/or site visits, and is able to work outside of normal business hours, when necessary

title: VP of Construction
description:
Our Client

Our client is a leading-edge commercial Construction Management group that champions the philosophy that construction project work has a deeper purpose than just creating spaces, and that through strong partnerships, they can bring transformation to the industry, their customers, and the communities they serve. They’re passionate in their belief that the future of construction will be one where everyone is aligned with the mission, working shoulder to shoulder, solving problems, and understanding issues and challenges from each other's perspectives. Their consistent drive in this direction continues to propel their successful growth in the markets they serve. And being passionate about technology and innovation, they’re using the latest software tools to make work more efficient and enjoyable.

Our client delivers a diverse mix of projects across various verticals, clients, and building types. They have three core business areas: tenant improvements, new construction projects, and building envelope upgrades. And their key markets include corporate offices, technology, biotech, post-secondary education, social housing, and financial institutions.

Current services include both General Contracting on tendered projects and acting as a Construction Manager with a heavy focus on pre-construction. They approach everything they do with the highest degree of mutual respect, value, and fairness, and aside from intentionally creating beautiful and functional spaces with purpose, their mission is to nurture solid professional relationships from positive and successful project experiences.

The Opportunity

The construction operations team's purpose is to deliver projects with high standards of excellence, transforming the construction experience for everyone they interact with – clients, architects, trade partners, and suppliers.

As a result of their rapid market growth, they’re seeking a Vice President of Construction to join their executive team in the greater Vancouver region. Reporting to the CEO, the successful candidate will be a well-experienced Senior Leader in the construction industry in an executive/leadership role, with an ability to align with the company’s core values of humility, unity, generosity, forward-thinking, eagerness, and excellence.

This individual will oversee the entire construction/operations team in both the office and field, managing a full portfolio of projects from conception to successful completion. They’ll bring their financial acumen and keen attention to detail and efficient process in managing all project planning and resource scheduling while implementing growth strategies for scalability. In addition, they’ll champion the company’s mission and growth plans through the development of all staff teams to reach their full potential.

Key Roles and Responsibilities

  • Oversee and manage the entire Construction/Operations team to successfully deliver projects
  • Manage hiring and team development
  • Direct Staff & Resource Planning for all Projects
  • Work with CFO on Financial Management of all Client Projects
  • Maintain Accountability for all Project profitability, cash flow, and forecasting
  • Liaise with CEO on Annual Strategic Planning and business plans
  • Act as CRO (Chief Revenue Officer) on all major clients
  • Manage Trade & Partner Contracts, Negotiations, and Project changes
  • Actively maintain industry presence within Construction/Building industry

Education/Experience

  • Min. 10 years Sr Construction Management experience (w/New Construction preferred)
  • Recognized University/College degree in Management, Business or Construction
  • Experienced in managing multiple major project portfolio
  • Proven Leadership Management skills in building/leading large work teams
  • High capability of managing Team Accountability
  • Experience and thorough understanding in building/managing construction contracts
  • Elite understanding of the financial side of the construction industry
  • Keen understanding of project profitability, cash flow, and forecasting
  • Strong understanding of current workplace regulations, building codes, and legislation
  • Recognized experience in negotiation and conflict resolution from a partnership perspective

Who You Are

  • Charismatic and Highly Process-oriented and detailed Leader
  • Natural ability to recognize and manage risk through strategic planning
  • High emotional EQ and excellent interpersonal skills
  • Keen ability to drive and ensure Accountability through work teams
  • Ability to maintain professional decorum in all environments
  • Takes conflict in stride / able to deal with difficult conversations calmly
  • Excellent communication skills for all professional situations
  • Proven experience in team mentoring/coaching for success
  • A strategic and entrepreneurial thinker with strong growth ambitions
  • Passionate about the Construction industry
  • Forward-thinking and innovative, with experience on a wide variety of industry-standard software (Procore, Navisworks, Building Connected, etc.) and contract models and approaches (Lean, IPD, etc.)
  • Champions and drives culture and operates within values

About Peeple Inc.

Peeple Inc is a Vancouver-based People Development firm specializing in Management Search and Executive Coaching and development. We’re focused on helping companies build and develop world-class teams while assisting jobseekers to find incredible employers. Applicants can expect thorough communication, an in-depth evaluation of their background and abilities, complete confidentiality, and our continuing care and expertise in matching candidates to roles that provide the best fit possible.

Peeple Inc and the clients we represent are committed to an inclusive and discrimination-free workplace, as well as complete compliance with the B.C. Human Rights Code, Canadian Human Rights Act, and the Employment Equity Act.

Application and Timeline

We encourage interested applicants to apply as soon as possible as our client is keen to welcome their newest team member. Interviews will take place as resumes are submitted through the Peeple Inc website.

title: Construction Managers!! for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area
description:
Currently we are looking for Construction Managers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Employee Benefit Program
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Training and Advancement Opportunities

What you Bring:

  • 10-15 years of previous experience in management role and/or industrial construction or Oil & Gas
  • Successful development and review of project scope, budget, plans and schedules
  • High standards to produce quality products
  • Proven track record in achieving successful project schedule commitments while meeting financial targets
  • Ability to multi-task in high-paced environments
  • Experience responding to changing deadlines/priorities
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong relationships with employees and stakeholders
  • Exceptional organizational skills and strong attention to detail
  • Strong commitment to safe work practices; walks the talk everyday
  • Addresses all relevant issues with the appropriate correspondence in a professional manner
  • Self motivated with excellent time management and problem-solving skills
  • Capable of handling high stress scenarios
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Displays exemplary professionalism at all times
  • Mentor project team for success
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment
  • Relevant terms: Project Manager; Management
  • Requirements:
  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Flexibility in working periods of overtime with travel to site locations
  • Valid Drivers License
  • Clean Abstract
  • Leadership for Excellence Certificate
  • Standard First Aid
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015

**At this time, our client’s may request contractors, vendors and suppliers to be fully vaccinated while providing service to their sites and therefore may require candidates to attest their vaccination disclosure status**
At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success. 
We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.
Come Grow With Us!

title: Site Superintendent- Industrial
description:
Come use your drive, energy, and diligence to make your mark!

Casman Industrial Construction, part of the Casman Group of Companies, is seeking a Site Superintendent with Industrial Carpentry experience to oversee construction projects at various industrial sites in the region of Wood Buffalo.

Applicants must be safety conscious, professional, and value sound client relationships. The successful candidate will use exceptional communication skills to prevent, manage and resolve conflicts; and can identify, assess and manage risks while striving to meet objectives and provide innovative solutions. Experience working with concrete is preferred.

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Monday- Friday 
  • Potentially change in shifts 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Completion of technical training in construction, trades, construction management, or project management supplemented by more than four (4) years of developmental experience in industrial construction, with at least 2 years serving in a supervisory capacity. Equivalencies will be considered.

CASMAN'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES:

Wage range dependent on skills and experience

Pension matching plan

Comprehensive Benefits, 50% premium paid

Compulsory life & disability insurance

Health, Dental coverage

Casman provides relocation support 

Casman welcomes all applications, and we thank you for your interest in our group. Only applicants of interest will be contacted.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
The Company: ROMAG isa fast paced, stable company and team-focused organization.

ROMAGis an equal opportunity employer. We would like to thank all candidates that applied, however, only candidates considered for the position will be contacted.

This position is permanent full time. We offer high salaries, car allowance/truck, a competitive compensation package complete with comprehensive benefits and opportunity for personal growth and development. If you are interested in stepping into an exciting and busy environment, this may be the ideal opportunity! 

 

Position: Superintendent:

Reporting to the Construction Manager, to plan, coordinate, and supervise a construction project in order to meet company objectives of costs, quality, time and safety

Responsibilities:

  • In Charge of all on-site construction activities
  • On a daily basis, direct field operations.
  • Responsible for the delivery of projects by adhering to schedules, budgets, safety and risk.
  • Organize, coordinate, and supervise the work of the Subcontractors
  • Effectively manage field employees by providing guidance and leadership
  • Completing a detailed review of drawings and understand project plans and specifications thoroughly
  • Develop and execute project work plans aimed at keeping projects on track and on budget.
  • Review site labour requirements and manage hourly employees
  • Maintaining accurate as build drawings.
  • Keeping a daily log of site activities on the project such as: All trades and number of personnel/trade, description of work, weather, and safety hazards or issues. 
  • Prepare timely two-week-look-ahead schedules for review by the Construction Manager and submission to the Owner/Consultant
  • Expeditious completion of project deficiencies.
  • Managing all aspects of safety on site.
  • Track and record all extra work orders.
  • Take the lead on productivity issues and monitor work performance and efficiency of employees and subcontractors to ensure project plans and schedule are followed and project is executed effectively and within budget.
  • Assure construction compliance with design requirements, schedule and budgets and assume responsibility for the commissioning of project systems.
  • Ensure that all proper authorities and consultants are performing periodic inspections as required. Arrange for all necessary inspections throughout the duration of the project.
  • Prepare for weekly/bi-weekly progress meetings held with owners/consultants
  • Review minutes of progress meetings and respond accordingly
  • Ensure the enactment of ROMAGâ€™s Safety Program to create a safe work environment throughout the jobsite and adhere to the safety and record keeping requirements.
  • Build and Maintain positive relationships with Subcontractors, Suppliers, Owner and Consultant.
  • Document and report all injuries, fill out Notice of Injury/Accident Report.
  • Reporting any challenges or issues to the Construction Manager in a timely manner.
  • Advise senior management of potential problems, work interferences or schedule difficulties while resolving issues as they occur.
  • Periodically check for deficiencies during construction and take immediate action to resolve them.

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Ten or more yearsâ€™ experience assisting or supervising construction of complex projects in the water and wastewater projects and or Heavy Civil projects
  • College Diploma / Engineering Degree
  • Ability to work under pressure and coordinate numerous activities and groups of people to achieve maximum efficiency
  • Proficient in reading, understanding and interpreting technical drawings and specifications.
  • Ability to effectively solve problem and take decisive action within the limits of authority.
  • Ability to take a proactive outlook as it relates to Health and Safety.
  • Proficient MS Office and Windows-based computer applications skills (Word, Excel, Outlook, Project, etc.)
  • Excellent communication skills both oral and written
  • Good organizational skills
  • Attention to details
  • Valid driverâ€™s license
  • Ability to exercise independent judgment and innovation and can go beyond immediate assignments and act on opportunities.
  • Ability to address and resolve conflicts and disagreements

title: Project Manager, Repairs
description:
About StackTeck Systems Limited

StackTeck, with over five decades of mold building innovation, is a leading source of high productivity tooling solutions for the injection molding industry. StackTeck supplies a wide range of injection molds and IML automation used to produce plastic parts in applications such as caps, closures, medical, PET preforms, and thinwall packaging; as well as complete system integrations including IML.  StackTeck has dedicated R&D, testing and part sampling facilities, in addition to plastic part design, prototyping, engineering, and manufacturing capabilities.  StackTeck Systems Ltd. is located 8 km north of Torontoâ€™s Pearson International Airport.

SUMMARY:  The primary role of the Project Manager is to manage and expedite customerâ€™s repair projects through the required processes at the Teck Center and with sub- contractors where required.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Take inventory and document (including pictures) of all received repairs and file them in the system.
  • Inspect and assess deficiencies and determine all modifications required.
  • Generate inspection reports.
  • Ensure quotes and shop orders are up to date and accurate by evaluating incoming projects to ensure scope mirrors Purchase Order with the customer.
  • Predetermine revised steel sizes of all modified components in consultation with Engineering.
  • Support engineering and assist with Repair BOMâ€™s, ordering materials, confirming all materials are received and drawings are updated.
  • Coordinate Subcontractors and ensure costs are in line and POâ€™s are complete and manage subcontractor process in full to ensure all work completed to specifications (weld, chrome or coating included)
  • Schedule test and determine full requirements for test (supports, CDâ€™s, resins). Determine rework after test, if required to ensure customer deadlines are met.
  • Prepare jobs for shipping ensuring all components are accounted for and listed on the approve to ship documents.
  • Direct communication with customers, Sales and Engineering regarding project details.
  • Ensure all work practices are conducted in a safe and effective manner, as per company policy.
  • Continually monitor ongoing job progress and provide the team updates during the daily Gemba walks.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE/EXPERIENCE:

  • 1) Post-Secondary education â€“ Completion of College or University â€“ Engineering or Business
  • 2 years practical experience in the injection mold manufacturing and/or precision machining 
  • Strong multi-tasking ability and technical problem solving skills.
  • Previous Project Management training and or experience.
  • Drive towards continuous improvement.

 

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, (AODA), StackTeck will provide accommodation, accessible formats, and communication supports for the recruitment process upon request.

title: Directeur du territoire - Construction / Territory Manager - Construction
description:
Brandt est l'un des principaux fournisseurs de solutions de positionnement au Canada, desservant les marchés de la construction, de l'arpentage, de l'ingénierie, du gouvernement et de l'agriculture. Nous disposons d'une technologie de pointe qui améliore l'efficacité et la productivité de nos clients dans tous les marchés que nous desservons.

Brandt est actuellement à la recherche d'un directeur du territoire - Construction pour son emplacement à St-Augustin.

Ce poste se spécialise dans la vente de solutions de positionnement novatrices et de classe mondiale à l'industrie du géomatique. Vous serez dans la position enviable d'avoir une organisation de soutien de classe mondiale pour vous aider à développer votre entreprise, un client à la fois.

Fonctions et responsabilités

  • Vendre des produits entiers neufs et usagés dans le territoire de vente désigné
  • Remplir tous les documents de vente en temps utile et avec précision
  • Se tenir à jour sur les produits et les équipements
  • Se tenir à jour des activités et des besoins des clients
  • Développer des stratégies de marketing et de promotion pour le territoire
  • Préparer des rapports sur l'état des clients, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, les appels de vente, les rapports de clôture, de suivi et de prospection, le cas échéant
  • Autres tâches assignées

Compétences requises

  • De solides compétences en matière de service à la clientèle
  • Très motivé et autonome
  • Excellentes compétences en matière de communication, de présentation et d'organisation
  • Capacité à nouer des relations et à prospecter de nouveaux comptes
  • Doit être disponible pour voyager si nécessaire; un permis de conduire récent et un passeport valide sont requis

Expérience requise

  • Une expérience dans le secteur de la vente ou une connaissance approfondie des équipements lourds sont considérées comme un atout
  • Des études postsecondaires en arpentage, ingénierie ou géomatique sont considérées comme un atout
  • La connaissance du GPS, des réseaux, des systèmes de coordonnées, de la cartographie, de l'élévation et du niveau est autant d'atouts

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Brandt is a leading vendor of Positioning Solutions across Canada serving the construction, surveying, engineering, governmental and agricultural markets. We have leading edge technology that improves our customer’s efficiency and productivity in all the markets we serve.

Brandt is currently seeking a Territory Manager - Construction for ourSt-Augustin location.

This position specializes in the sales of world class, innovative Positioning solutions into the GeoPositioning industry. You would be in the enviable position of having some a world class support organization to help you grow your business one customer at a time.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Sell new and used whole goods product within the designated sales territory
  • Complete all sales documentation in a timely and accurate manner
  • Keep current on product knowledge and equipment
  • Keep current on customers’ business activities and needs
  • Develop marketing and promotion strategies for territory
  • Prepare customer status reports, including but not limited to sales call activity, closing, follow –up, and prospect reports as required
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Skills

  • Strong customer service skills
  • Highly motivated and self-directed
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills
  • Ability to build relationships and prospect new accounts
  • Must be available to travel as needed; a recent driver's abstract and valid passport are required

Required Experience

  • Sales industry experience and/or a comprehensive knowledge of heavy equipment considered an asset
  • Post-secondary education in Lan Surveying, Engineering, or Geomatics considered an asset
  • Knowledge of GPS, networks, coordinate systems, mapping, elevation, and level are all considered assets

title: Roofing Project Manager
description:
Overview:

We are seeking qualified candidates for the position of Roofing Project Manager based in our Richmond location.

This position is responsible for specifications, investigations and management of multiple roofing projects involving varying scopes and complexity. Extensive roofing experience is preferred. The ideal candidate will have excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as experience with client relations and developing proposals.

In return for your talent and effort, Rimkus offers a dynamic organization with a competitive salary and benefits package, flexible work schedule and opportunities for advancement.

Responsibilities:

â€¢ Coordinate the preparation of CAD drawings
â€¢ Preparation of design tender documents
â€¢ Preparation of technical specifications for roofing remediation projects
â€¢ Direct the collecting of field data required for the preparation of repair specifications, drawings and tendering
â€¢ Reviewing shop drawings
â€¢ Assisting with the compilation of both field and report data in order to prepare specification documents and drawings
â€¢ Reviewing drawings and specifications to verify that the scope of work is sufficient and to ensure that all required details, materials, methods, etc. are correctly specified
â€¢ Contract administration
â€¢ Prepare design briefs for Client approval
â€¢ Wind uplift calculations
â€¢ Prepare condition reports
â€¢ Coordinate and attend project meetings
â€¢ Coordinate interdepartmental design requirements
â€¢ Schedule mock ups and field testing
â€¢ Monitor Client scope and document changes as needed

Qualifications:

â€¢ Completion of a post-secondary degree/diploma in an Engineering or Architectural Technology program (or other related field)
â€¢ Minimum of 4 yearsâ€™ roofing working experience
â€¢ Experience with specifying roofing systems in accordance with RCABC standards
â€¢ Experience carrying out project management functions with a focus on roofing remediation projects
â€¢ Must possess the ability to read Architectural Blueprints
â€¢ General construction knowledge (i.e. how buildings go together)
â€¢ Exceptional attention to detail, specifically in accuracy of calculations and completeness of data collection and notation
â€¢ Good oral and written English communication skills
â€¢ Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
â€¢ Self-motivating and multi-tasking ability
â€¢ Able to work individually and in a team setting

title: Roofing Project Manager
description:
Overview:

IRC Building Sciences Group â€“ a Rimkus Company is hiring!

We are seeking qualified candidates for the position of Roofing Project Manager based in our Mississauga location.

In return for your talent and effort, Rimkus offers a dynamic organization with a competitive salary and benefits package, flexible work schedule and opportunities for advancement.

Responsibilities:

Quality Assurance Observation:

  • Perform quality assurance observation of work in progress to ensure compliance with tender documents and applicable codes and standards

 

Site Work May Include:

  • Measuring
  • Drawing to record as-built conditions
  • Core-cuts
  • Moisture scanning
  • Identifying deficiencies
  • Photography and data processing, etc.
  • Conduct site meetings with customers and contractors
  • Familiarize yourself with national and local client base and the companyâ€™s proposal formats
  • Provide pricing and assistance in completion of contracts and/or purchase orders
  • Coordinate all input for time billing and job costing
  • Other tasks may be required to ensure timely completion of deadlines
  • Provide technical assistance to field technician and technologists
  • Assist in preparation of pre-design on an as needed basis
  • Extended travel as necessary to perform the above listed duties
  • Assist with Contract administration and client management as required
  • Prepare roof condition or building envelope assessment reports using company standard format
  • Conduct leak investigations
  • Conduct attic investigations
  • Attend pre-bid site meetings and bid closing assessment meetings as required.
  • Perform site evaluations, inspections and testing as required to produce condition analysis reports

Other Responsibilities:

  • Compilation of data and photos into report form
  • Photocopying and assembly of reports
  • Keep abreast of current trends in the industry to ensure professional development
  • Ongoing professional development via the International Institute of Building Enclosure Consultants (IIBEC)
Qualifications:
  • 3-5 yearsâ€™ experience in roofing (Red Seal in roofing is preferred)
  • Registered Roof Observer (RRO) designation is preferred (attaining the RRO designation is a requirement)
  • Strong knowledge of various roofing systems and construction
  • General comprehension of business dynamics in construction/roofing marketplace
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Advanced proficiency in negotiation and presentation skills
  • Possess strong entrepreneurial spirit and drive
  • Superior interpersonal and communication skills
  • Conducts all activities with the highest degree of professionalism while demonstrating business integrity, creativity and team orientation
  • Ability to travel as necessary to perform required duties

title: Hi-Rise Construction Project Manager
description:
Brookfield Properties, Office

At Brookfield Properties, our success starts with our people. People like you.

We develop, operate, and manage more than 650 properties and 325 million square feet of real estate across the globe. Itâ€™s a feat that wouldnâ€™t be possible without our team, a diverse group of creative visionaries and innovative experts who are relentless in pursuit of one goal: to ensure our buildings donâ€™t simply meet the needs of our tenants, residents, and communities â€” but exceed them, every day.

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations â€” bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. Itâ€™s why the worldâ€™s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If youâ€™re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

 

DESCRIPTION: 

As part of the Brookfield Properties Eastern Region Development department, this position is responsible for providing project and construction management services, coordination with consultant, various trades and overseeing construction management activities.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Consultant Management

  • Ability to manage consultants regarding scope of services including specific design, engineering, specialist consultants and various other services
  • Manage architects and consultant design schedules while ensuring design schedules and design coordination documents and projects are up to date and completed in timely manner
  • Create and maintain Decision Matrix and Risk/ Unresolved issues registers with proper follow up seeing through to project completion
  • Coordinate building and other municipal permits and submissions with proper documentation

Construction and Trades

  • Manage all aspects of pre-construction project work including reviewing tenders, work scopes, analyzing bids and preparing bid recaps
  • Reviewing and finalizing construction management/ logistic plans
  • Thoroughly investigate all credits and extras on contracts, update and report extra/credit log and prepare Change Orders for execution
  • Prepare monthly progress reports consisting of updated budget information and accurate cost to complete
  • Coordinate and review progress payment and general invoices
  • Monitor trade progress and project schedule to compare baseline and provide recommendations for improvements when required
  • Ensure construction Managers are maintaining quality of workmanship that meet or exceed Brookfield standards, rectifying issues and addressing concerns and deficiencies through to project completion
  • Assist in municipal inspections as requested by Construction Team
  • Manage occupancy strategy and implementation of reports

Project Management

  • Create and maintain necessary files for document control and completeness
  • Develop detailed project management work plans, schedules and establish milestones
  • Act as liaison between Construction Sites and Head Office
  • Coordinate activities such as obtaining IFC plans, services (hydro, gas, water, phone), major equipment deliveries and ensure building permits are obtained in timely manner
  • Responsible for stakeholder inquiries and responding in timely manner
  • Coordination of Management schedules

SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS: 

  • Outstanding customer service, communication and interpersonal skills for building and maintaining strong relationships with contractors, trades, various internal and external clients
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Extremely organized with strong analytical and investigative skills to be applied to different situations with attention to detail and thoroughness
  • A team player who can work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment, able to cope with changing priorities
  • Able to prioritize tasks, work under pressure, deal with complex teams and reporting structures
  • Professional, self-motivated with a positive attitude

EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:

  • Minimum 5-7 years of experience with completed high rise residential projects
  • Experience with Microsoft Office (MS Word and Excel), Microsoft Project is required
  • Knowledge of building codes, contract law, construction material, design concepts, and local municipality requirements and regulations
  • Strong knowledge with analyzing site, building and suite plans, understanding (technical) drawings

EDUCATION/DESIGNATIONS/LICENSES:

  • University Degree or College Diploma in Engineering, architecture or Construction Management is required.

 

Brookfield is committed to accommodating the individual needs of all applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process as required under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Superintendent (Construction)

Gottardo Group of Companies is a Developer as well as office, commercial & industrial builders, with properties and land for sale and lease. Head office is located in Vaughan.

Immediate opening for Site Superintendents responsible for: 
  • Ensuring appropriate resources are allocated and maintained to facilitate projects from start to completion - scheduling, cost control, contract administration. 

Requirements:
  • Minimum seven (7) years experience.
  • Well-developed knowledge of the construction process and management.




About Gottardo Group of Companies:

We are a Real Estate Developer, Design builder and General Contractor. Head Office is located in Vaughan. Successful completion of prestigious developments, office buildings, industrial distribution and manufacturing facilities, retail centres, and hotels, which are owned and leased, has established Gottardo as a leader in the building sector.

title: Materials Testing Technician
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is currently seeking Materials Testing Technicians to join our Environment & Infrastructure Solutions group in Dartmouth, NS. Applicants must be willing to work flexible hours.

 

Our team of professionals offers a full range of services to clients in a wide range of sectors including government, industrial & commercial, water, transportation, minerals & metals, oil & gas and clean energy. 

 

We offer an excellent remuneration package with benefits, extensive safety training, and opportunities for diverse experiences and professional development based in Dartmouth, NS.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Prioritize work in a team environment
  • Responsible for providing client service
  • Assist in business development
  • Train and supervise junior staff
  • Provide quality control and quality assurance on a variety of laboratory and field projects including but not limited to:
    • Marshall or Superpave lab testing
    • Asphalt and field density testing
    • Preparation of field reports
    • Out of town work should be anticipated,.

 

Skills / Qualifications

  • Completion of a Geological, Construction or Civil Engineering Technology program
  • Ideal candidates will have 3+ years of related materials testing experience including aggregate, concrete, and asphalt, but applicants with less experience will be considered
  • Preference will be given to individuals with Asphalt testing experience
  • Knowledge of CSA, ASTM, and Provincial Test Methods an asset
  • Detail oriented, organized, team player and self-motivated
  • Must be well organized and have the ability to manage and prioritize several tasks at one time and ensure commitment to service and technical excellence
  • Willingness and ability to work for long days
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Must be able to lift independently up to a maximum of 50 lbs. 
  • Flexible to work overtime as required 
  • Must have & wear CSA Safety boots while in the field
  • Valid Driver’s License with a clean driver’s abstract 

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Materials Testing Technician
description:
The Opportunity
What’s better than living in a city that offers great recreation, amenities, and affordable housing? What about the ability to grow your career in a community that is the right fit for you? McElhanney has a new opportunity for a Materials Testing Technician to join our growing team in Campbell River, BC. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on both field and laboratory testing projects. This position will work closely with our Geotechnical and Civil Engineering teams to deliver construction quality control and quality assurance services.

McElhanney’s in-house materials testing laboratories deliver prompt, locally focused materials testing services throughout BC. Complementing our local laboratories, our fleet of mobile laboratories enables our qualified technicians to provide responsive on-site services, even in remote areas. We offer our services for the following project needs: construction aggregate testing, soil and concrete testing, and asphalt testing.

 What You’ll Be Doing: 
  • Working as part of a team of highly skilled engineers, technicians, surveyors and drafters to provide excellent service to our clients
  • Conducting field testing of concrete (slump, air content, cast cylinders)
  • Conducting Field Compaction testing using a nuclear densometer
  • Conducting laboratory soil testing including wash sieve analysis, modified and standard proctors
  • Conducting laboratory concrete testing including compressive strength of concrete cylinders
  • Conducting laboratory asphalt testing, marshall properties
  • Timely preparation of reports
  • Other duties as required

What You’ll Bring:
  • Prior experience with earthworks/concrete construction and an interest in construction technology
  • A diploma in Civil Engineering Technology is an asset, but not required  
  • Canadian Council of Independent Laboratories (CCIL)/American Concrete Institution (ACI) certification or the ability to obtain certification
  • Knowledge of Canadian Standards Association (CSA) and American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) testing methods would be considered an asset
  • Physical ability to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas and willing to work in remote areas when needed
  • Good attitude and willingness to work cooperatively as a team player
  • Strong communication skills and leadership capabilities.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your lifestyle
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
  • Opportunity to become a shareholder in an employee-owned firm
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
  • Participation in our numerous programs that support our Four Cornerstones: people & communities, clients & partners, processes & technology, and financial.
Vaccination Requirement
 In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

  #LI-AM3   #LI-Junior  #Junior #Onsite #LI-Onsite
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Civil Inspector - Kamloops
description:
The Civil Construction Inspector will provide on-site direction and supervision to ensure completion and quality of civil work on our multi-family residential construction site. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills and a working knowledge of various civil and residential construction means and methods.  

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Perform civil works coordination, inspections, and quantity measurement
  • Check grades and elevations of newly installed infrastructure
  • Monitor and coordinate contractor progress to ensure work is completed within construction schedule
  • Check for compliance to plans and specifications
  • Review and confirmation of monthly progress worksheets and measurements
  • Maintain an as-built plan and communicate changes to Civil Team
  • Follow up on deficiencies to ensure timely correction and completion of work
  • Assure compliance with the project construction schedule and budgets
  • Uphold the job-related safety regulations, policies, and procedures
  • Ensure project materials and workmanship meet the project quality standards
  • Use best efforts to resolve any scheduling challenges/disputes between on-site subcontractors and suppliers

 

REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 2 years of civil construction experience
  • Minimum 2 years of experience overseeing project sites/civil crews is an asset
  • Equipment operation is an asset
  • Valid Class 5 Driver's License
  • Understanding of methodology and terminology in the civil construction industry
  • Proven ability to read and interpret blueprints and other construction drawings
  • Working experience in earthworks and utility installation
  • Results-focused with a proven track record of accomplishments in the construction field
  • Ability to travel and work on various job sites at different territorial locations

 

Why Seymour Pacific?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: Chief Building Official - Marathon ON
description:
Chief Building Official - Town of Marathon ON
CompetitiveCompensation (85 - 135K) & Benefits

Other Similar Titles:
- Deputy Chief Building Official
- Building Codes Official
- Building Inspector / Examiner

Reporting to the Town of Marathon's Chief Administrative Officer, the Chief Building Official (CBO) is responsible for enforcing the Building Code Act and regulations in accordance with the Provincial statutes and municipal by-laws. The CBO manages all aspects of the Building Division from the building permit application intake, plans review & inspection to ensure the health and safety requirements are met for new construction & renovations. The CBO will have overall responsibility and statutory duties as defined under the Building Code Act

SomeKey responsibilities:
  • Leads & manages the Municipality's planning function including administration, zoning by-laws amendments, development applications & permits, site plan control, consents, minor variances, building & property standards, and the Official Plan
  • Performs CBO duties under Building Code requirements: conducts field inspections ensuring by-laws compliance, reviews & issues building permit applications, conducts building inspections as necessary
  • Assists Deputy Clerk with the management of municipal properties including land & building acquisitions or dispersals
  • Liaises with government ministries, the public and businesses
  • Assists Fire Chief on Fire Code inspections and enforcement
  • Works in a safe manner in accordance within OH&S Act
Ideal Candidates will likely have many of the following Attributes:
  • 5 - 20+ years experience in progressive building compliance roles, some leadership would be an asset
  • Degree / diploma in Architecture, Civil Engineering, Planning or a field closely related to the building industry
  • Experience working with Municipal & Planning Acts, Building Codes & Acts
  • Chief Building Official certification is ideal(CBO eligible &/or in-progress will be considered)
  • Valid Drivers Licenseand open to aVulnerable Sector check
  • Strong organization & communications skills- verbal & written plus Solid computer skills (ie, MS Word & Excel)
  • Open to periodic after hours meetings, emergencies & on-calls evenings & weekends
The successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary and benefits package, a variety of developmental opportunities, and the opportunity to make a real difference. Plus, you will have time to enjoy our community.
