title: Contractor Site Manager
description:
Company Description

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

The Contractor Site Manager is a key member of the contract team at a historical remote site in the Canadian Arctic. Reporting to the Division Vice President Facilities Management Western Canada, the Contractor Site Manager is responsible for overseeing the CFS Alert Site Management Team delivering the portfolio of work at CFS Alert. Responsible for the attainment of the Health, Safety, Environment, Quality and Financial targets of the contract, the Contractor Site Manager will enable the operations team and support function leads to facilitate meeting the goals and objectives of the CFS Alert contract. Responsible for the management and administration of all operational requirements and activities of facilities and support services for the contract, this individual will foster strong relationships and deliver operational excellence to meet internal and external customer needs. An 8 weeks on, 8 weeks off rotational schedule with flights to and from the worksite in Nunavut leaving from Trenton, Ontario. A unique opportunity to contribute to the operation of an entire community supporting members of the Canadian Armed Forces.

This position requires Government of Canada security clearance at the Secret Status level.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Manage, plan, control audit and coordinate all on-site work activities including:  
    • Accommodation and janitorial services, food services, environmental protection and domestic, industrial and hazmat waste collection, handling and disposal, transportation and vehicle maintenance, airfield operations, facility management services including building systems and equipment, standby power systems, fuel services, quarry services, engineering services, and project delivery.
  • Provide leadership and direction to managers responsible for the service delivery areas including the Food Services and Hospitality Manager, Transportation and Vehicle Manager, HSEQ Manager, and Real Property Services Manager.
  • Attend meetings and liaise with the site Commanding Officer to ensure all operational, administrative and safety matters are addressed.
  • Organize staff to ensure work is prioritized to meet the site operational needs, and that work is conducted in a professional and timely manner, meeting all standards, operating procedures, and guidelines.
  • Ensure that Emergency Response Plans are supported, liaising with National Defense Authorities, as required.
  • Ensure that phase-in and phase-out requirements are well planned and conducted, preparing and submitting reports and data deliverables as identified.
  • Prepare and maintain a cost management system including labour resource costs.
  • Act as the official point of contact for the client Contractor, with sufficient delegated technical and financial authority to respond appropriately to any contractual matters.

 

Qualifications

  • Minimum five (5) years of experience in management of multi-disciplinary-services and functions in a commercial or industrial setting.
  • At least ten (10) years of combined experiences in logistical support and facilities operations and maintenance services.
  • Minimum of fifteen (15) years overall work experience.
  • Relevant experience in projects of similar, or greater, size (duration or value of contract), scope (facilities management in an isolated or harsh environment) and complexity (responsible for the proper operation and maintenance of roads and grounds, power plant operation, cleaning, food services, water plant and fueling systems for facilities of similar, or greater scale).
  • Ability to obtain Government of Canada security clearance at the Secret Status level (requires a 10 year background check and Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency).
  • Education or certification from a recognized accredited institution in Engineering, Construction Management, Business Management, BOMI or related field.
  • Ability to obtain fit-for-duty medical assessment from a physician.
  • Experience working in and managing remote locations.
  • Knowledge and experience working with Federal Legislation or Territorial bodies.
  • Excellent presentation and written communication skills; ability to effectively convey information and influence.
  • Ability to effectively manage, adjust and adapt to fluctuating priorities and workloads in a high performance work environment.
  • Leadership competencies with the ability to provide mentorship, direction and monitor the deliverables of direct reports.
  • Inuit cultural awareness, knowledge and respect.
  • Flexibility to meet the unique requirements of the site including potential rotational shift changes and working after hours “on-call” duties.


Additional Information

  • An opportunity for work life balance. 8 weeks on and 8 weeks off allows you to use your time to do what you enjoy.
  • Continuous wage payment throughout your time off.
  • Competitive wages, benefits and an RSP matching program.
  • Retention Bonus of up to 10% of wages earned paid on the completion of a 2 year contract.
  • Paid travel time.
  • Unique experience in the northernmost continuously inhabited place in the world.
  • Training and development opportunities to help grow and diversify your career.
  • Transfer opportunities to other Dexterra sites across Canada.

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Electrical Service Manager
description:
As Electrical Service Manager you maintain full profit and loss responsibility for the successful business development and operations of our Electrical Service business unit.  

To be successful in this role you can demonstrate your superior leadership ability, to develop and execute a tailored strategic business plan. You have the ability to effectively leverage your strong communication and interpersonal skills to positively influence clients and drive for results. Forward thinking, solid negotiation skills and the ability to “think on your feet” will take you a long way, both in this role and throughout your career with Plan Group.

As Electrical Service Manager you will be asked to do the following:

  • Develop and execute a strategic business plan to grow the Electrical Service division on a national level in line with overall company goals and objectives.
  • Develop an annual budget for Electrical Service; monitor and report actual vs. projected sales, margins and profitability
  • Establish, cultivate and strengthen key client relationships by demonstrating value proposition and strategic positioning
  • Support, coach and mentor Account Executives in maintaining and enhancing customer relationships and evaluate individual performance. and individual pursuit strategies
  • Effectively promote Plan Group’s key differentiators and integrated services to secure new business opportunities with new and existing clients
  • Populate and leverage Salesforce CRM to document and track client correspondences, follow up action items and set overall pursuit plans.
  • Strategize and evaluate potential business opportunities to determine whether or not to pursue, review pricing and terms on bids and support the development of a win strategy.
  • Work closely with and provide leadership with proposal / marketing group throughout RFP process. Review all proposals prior to sign off and/or submission.
  • Develop and strengthen key internal relationships with business unit leaders to achieve overall Company goals
  • Maintain, develop and nurture key relationships with clients, subs, suppliers and related stakeholders

QUALIFICATIONS

  • You have a combination of related post-secondary education and minimum 10 years’ related industry experience; electrical trade experience an asset.
  • You are proficient in Microsoft Office and experience with Enterprise, SAP and/or Jonas a definite asset.
  • Experience and existing relationship with national clients a definite asset

title: Regional Construction Manager
description:
Why join us:

Northland Properties is recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, sports, and construction. We are the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, The Dallas Stars, and Northland Asset Management Company. Proud to be 100% Canadian-owned and operated, with over 150 outlets nationwide, we have home offices in both Vancouver and Calgary and employ over 10,000 talented individuals across the nation. - To be modified and reviewed with Legal.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job Summary:

This role will report to the Director of Construction and is responsible for leading construction projects (hotels, restaurants, resort expansions) in the Western regions of Canada (British Columbia, Alberta, Manitoba, Saskatchewan) in the total value of $75MM and above. The successful candidate should have a well-rounded knowledge of construction and be familiar with working with project managers leading new construction and expansion projects, providing oversight and direction to cross-discipline team members working with both office and site-based employees. Duties will include overseeing the implementation of the project plans, schedules, being aligned with the budget. To be successful as a Regional Construction Manager, you will need to be able to work on tight deadlines, have excellent problem-solving skills, with exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Accountable for the successful delivery of the new and expansion construction projects implemented in the western regions of Canada.
  • Ensure to be within the remit of the determined project budget, and time commitments.
  • Set up a team, assign duties, and determine the roles and responsibilities of the team members.
  • Develop, coach, and mentor a cohesive self-performing team.
  • Contribute to the ongoing continuous improvement process for ongoing or potential future projects.
  • Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable.
  • Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution.
  • Ensure compliance with project efforts with the company's Health, Safety, and Environmental policies.

Essential requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in the field.
  • Min of 8 years' experience in managing large, complex construction projects, particularly those involving hotel construction would be a significant asset.
  • Proven ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure with minimum supervision in a fast-paced environment.
  • Experience in recruiting and setting up teams.
  • Extensive knowledge in local jurisdictions for western regions of Canada.
  • Excellent communicator with deep people leadership experience who can coordinate a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Ability to focus on multiple projects simultaneously with exceptional problem-solving skills.
  • Ability and willingness to travel.

Desirable requirements:

  • Experience in the hotel and restaurant construction.
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team as well as leading a team.
  • Experience in leading cross-cultural people.
  • Ability to work and succeed in tight deadlines.
  • Ability to work with high integrity.
  • Competency in Office 365 including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
  • Owning or operating your own business would be a significant asset.
  • Being familiar with various software or computer programs would be an additional asset.

Benefits/Perks:

  • Extended Health and Dental Insurance.
  • Yearly bonus opportunities.
  • Retirement Saving Plan after a year of employment.
  • Employee discounts across the Northland-owned restaurants, hotels, resorts.
  • Cell Phone Reimbursement.
  • Flexible schedule.
  • Work travel reimbursement.
  • Excellent career growth opportunities as part of the growing company.
  • Collaborative, friendly working environment.
  • Applicable relocation expenses.

title: Project Manager : Metering
description:
Are you an experiencedProject Managerorambitious Senior Technicianlooking to continue your career insub-metering / power systems? Are you looking to work with anational industry leadermanaging sub-metering projects for top-tier clients? Do you enjoy collaborating with asupportive team? Then read on...

In the role of Project Manager, you will be collaborating with senior leadership and enjoy mentoring junior teammates. You will ultimately be responsible for overseeing sub-metering installation projects for top-tier commercial and residential clientele.

With your electrical / mechanical expertise, you will develop single-line diagrams in AutoCAD to determine the best method of installation and then utilize your project management abilities to oversee the project end to end. And, with your previous client management experience you will excel in this client facing role.

What you get out of it?
Working with a national industry leader and managing projects for top-tier clients. Great training and mentorship. Competitive compensation and benefits. And, overall working with a supporting team.


Interested in learning more? Apply NOW.

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: E&I Project Manager
description:
Job Description:

This is a hands-on role accountable for budget, schedule, safety, quality, and overall project performance; ensuring quality work is completed on schedule in an economical manner. This position is also responsible for providing leadership and direction for all levels of project leadership, along with promoting amicable relationships with all parties involved, including clients, engineers, suppliers, and subcontractors.  

   

You will bring 5+ years of previous project managing experience along with a Electrical Journeyperson Certificate.

   

   

This is a permanent, salaried position.  

   

   

What youâ€™ll be doing:  

  • Leading project planning sessions.  
  • Coordinating staff and internal resources.  
  • Managing project progress and adapting work as required.  
  • Ensuring projects meet deadlines.  
  • Managing relationships with clients and stakeholders.  
  • Designing and signing off on contracts.  
  • Overseeing all incoming and outgoing project documentation.  
  • Participating in tender process i.e., design, submission, and review.  
  • Designing risk mitigation plan.  
  • Conducting project review and creating detailed reports for executive staff.  
  • Optimizing and improving processes and the overall approach where necessary.  
  • Securing growth opportunities and initiating new projects.  
  • Managing staff and teams.  

   

We would love to hear from you if youâ€¯have:

  • Skilled with Microsoft Office.  
  • Well versed in estimating and scheduling.
  • Field experience in Oil and Gas construction and or maintenance is an asset.  
  • Ability to track project costs, project material and labour.  
  • Must have good organizational skills and ability to multitask and work without direction.  
  • Previous project managing experience.  
  • Ability to dispatch crews and meet Client expectations.
  • Having a PMP or related certification is considered an asset

 

What we offer:    

  • Competitive compensation.  
  • Company supplied benefits for you and your family.    
  • RRSP (Registered Retirement Savings Plan)  Matching.    
  • Health Spending Account / Wellness Spending Account.  

       

Other details:    

     

As a condition of employment, qualified applicants who are  offered  and accept the role must complete a satisfactory pre-employment Background Check. This may consist of all or a combination of the following: Canadian Criminal Record check, an Employment Verification and/or an Education and Accreditation Verification.  

                         

Candidates shortlisted will be  required  to complete  theâ€¯Profile  People  Survey.                

                       

The purpose of the  Profile  People Survey tool is to  assist  ClearStream in understanding the behaviors of individuals with the  objective  of supporting the best use of their strengths,  abilities,  and potential.  

     

     

Why ClearStream    

     

We are the  clear choice  for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of work we do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.  

                   

We believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other legally protected factors.

title: Construction Manager-Fiber-Manitoba-XP17
description:
Construction Manager, Fibre

As part of the Fibre Construction team, the Construction Manager will be responsible for all physical and contractual aspects of the project related to the design and construction of the physical plant associated with fibre optic and FTTP networks. The Fibre Construction team employs a model whereby internal, or third party, fibre optic network designs are contracted out to external construction teams to build and test.  As such, the Construction Project Manager must possess excellent people and communication skills to motivate and maintain effective lines of communication between all stakeholders.
This position reports to the Deployment Manager, Fibre, with various locations required in Manitoba, Ontario, Quebec, and within Atlantic Region.

What you will do (Team responsibilities):
  • Work with Fibre Planners to develop preliminary cost estimates and schedules
  • Assist in Xplornet’s marketing effort where appropriate and as directed by management
  • Assist Project Managers to run competitive RFP processes for the selection of fibre design and construction contractors
  •  Assist management in final contract negotiations and in the development of a short list of qualified contractors for future work
  • Assist in negotiations with municipalities and government departments for Municipal Access Agreements and right of way usage
  • Assist in contract negotiations with infrastructure owners (e.g. pole, duct owners) for the use of their infrastructure
  • Conduct contractor safety pre-qualifications as required
  • Gather applicable project safety documentation and certificates of insurance prior to project start
  • Ensure contract, project coding and file structure are ready prior to project start
  • Ensure contractual obligations of the project are understood and met by all parties
  • Plan and organize work to meet project schedule deadlines and financial objectives
  • Manage Request for Information, Change Order Management process and related reporting
  • Develop and implement Inspection and Test Plans (ITP)
  • Review applications for progress payment and approve invoicing in a timely manner
  • Perform field safety audits and quality inspections
  • Assist with the procurement of fibre construction materials
  • Consult with industry peers and stay abreast of new industry technologies and industry standards

What you need to succeed (Individual competencies):
  • Engineering Degree (electrical or civil), Technologist Diploma (electrical or civil), Journeyman Certificate for Communications Electrician, or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 5 to 7 years of fibre optics construction management experience
  • In-depth knowledge of fibre optic network construction techniques, construction equipment and fibre optic network technologies for use in both outside plant and inside plant applications
  • Experience in the design and construction of FTTx networks
  • Experience managing fixed price, unit price and time and materials contracting models – understanding of advantages / disadvantages of the various models
  • Proven ability to manage relationships with construction contractors, consultants and subcontractors ensuring defined / contracted responsibilities are met
  • Demonstrated ability to implement processes and best practices which improve communication and allow teams to scale
  • Experienced in the implementation of construction standards and auditing contractors in their compliance of those standards
  • Solid understanding of OH&S requirements with demonstrated experience in the development and application of Project Specific Safety Programs (Job Hazard Assessments, Emergency Response Plans, Safe Work Practices)
  • Proven ability to break down barriers and foster collaboration across functions and teams
  • Able to maintain a high level of performance under pressure in a fast-paced changing environment
  • Excellent computer skills, particularly in the use of Google Earth software, CAD software and Microsoft products including Outlook, Word, Excel and Project
  • Willingness to travel

In alignment with the Vaccination Protocol, all new  team members are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.  Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case by case basis.

title: Construction Site Superintendent
description:
Location: Osoyoos, BC, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 3/1/2022Job ID: SN1624531Category: Engineering & Technical
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to recruit a Construction Site Supervisor in the construction industry. Based in Osoyoos, BC, this is a full-time opportunity with an organization that prioritizes quality, integrity, and employee engagement. We are seeking a seasoned Site Supervisor who is comfortable with tight deadlines and driven to succeed. 

The Role:
  • Oversee construction projects on-site from start to finish, according to schedule, specifications and budget
  • Communicate effectively with all employees, contractors, and sub-contractors
  • Hire, train and manage all employees on the project
  • Monitor performance of contractors, sub-contractors, and staff
  • Maintain the project budget and report any overages to the Construction Manager
  • Maintain the project schedule and report milestones
  • Allocate resources, materials, contractors, sub-contractors, and other staff
  • Utilize project management software to ensure the reporting it provides is current and accurate
  • Ensure contractual agreements with architects, consultants, clients, suppliers, and subcontractors are met
  • Receive and verify the purchase of building materials
  • Maintain a safe, secure, and healthy work environment by adhering to and enforcing safety codes
  • Maintain compliance with quality control programs
  • Ensure quality construction standards and the use of proper construction techniques
  • Plan ahead to prevent problems and resolve any emerging ones; analyze, manage and mitigate risks

The Ideal Candidate:
  • Honesty, transparency, and strong ethics are critical success factors
  • Ability to build strong working relationships with internal and external partners, while maintaining an atmosphere of trust 
  • Socially adept, comfortable in client-facing situations, and competent in conflict and crisis management
  • Priority on strong communication skills, ensuring open, accurate information sharing both internally and externally
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Solutions-minded and able to foresee upcoming challenges
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
Required Education, Experience, and Abilities:
  • Post-secondary education in construction management, architecture, engineering, or related field is preferred
  • 8-10 years experience in general construction is required, along with related leadership experience
  • Proven working experience in construction management and understanding of all facets of the construction process, having advanced knowledge of construction management processes, means and methods
  • Expert knowledge of building products, construction details and relevant rules, regulations, and quality standards
  • Reliable computer skills, familiar with construction management software packages and basic Microsoft Office and Google software
  • Valid driver’s license

If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Suzanne Noesgaard, Consultant, Engineering & Technical. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.

If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian-owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, over four decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!

Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.

title: Assistant Project Manager â€“ Buildings
description:
Overview:

BE Totally Engaged. BE Community-Minded. BE Aspirational. Be all that and more at Colliers Project Leaders.  

Are you motivated to build your career in Project Management?  Do you have experience in a consultancy or professional services environment? Have you had exposure to design management, construction contract administration or project financial management? Is your experience backed by an education in engineering, architecture, construction  management or project management?  

 

As Colliers Project Leaders continues to grow and attract exciting new project opportunities, we are seeking an Assistant Project Manager to join our team.

 

Our Assistant Project Managers get the opportunity work with the best in the industry and to develop their skills on a diverse range of projects that vary in scope and complexity. In this role, you will be able to demonstrate your experience by supporting projects in a variety of sectors such as commercial, institutional, post-secondary or light industrial.  

 

Why  Colliers Project Leaders?

 

Colliers Project Leaders is a leading Canadian building and infrastructure project delivery solution provider. We provide integrated and strategic solutions for program and project leadership, and we act as trusted advisors on capital projects. With 30 offices across Canada, our multidisciplinary team of project management and advisory professionals offer unparalleled depth and expertise to capital projects. Colliers Project Leaders has completed more than 15,000 projects to date, deploying our proprietary tools and techniques to ensure success for our clients.

 

Responsibilities:
  • Work alongside experienced project managers to learn the keys to client relationship building and successful project delivery
  • Provide project support to Project Managers by performing schedule updates,  maintaining project controls, developing progress reports and preparing tender and contract documents
  • Attend various  project  meetings, capturing accurate action items and key decisions in meeting minutes
  • Provide a communication path between the Project Manager and other project stakeholders
  • Ensure that project activities are conducted in accordance with Colliers Project Leaders Quality Management System
Qualifications:
  • A university degree or diploma in engineering, architecture, construction management or project management (or an equivalent combination of academic and practical experience)
  • Self-motivation, initiative and an eagerness to learn and contribute to meeting project deliverables
  • 1 to 3 years of experience representing owners to multiple stakeholders to deliver construction and building projects of varying size and scope
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Previous  exposure to consultant and design management, construction contract administration or project financials is an asset  
  • A results-oriented approach with the ability to take action and responsibility
  • Exceptional detail orientation, organizational skills and the ability to prioritize competing tasks to meet tight deadlines and client expectations
  • Strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of scheduling (MS Project), word processing (Word) and spreadsheet (Excel) software applications
  • CAPM designation, PMP and LEED accreditation would be an asset

title: Project Manager, Hazardous Materials
description:
Your Employer:

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and itâ€™s more than 2,600 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

 

As a Project Manager, Hazardous Materials, you will work in collaboration with the Hygiene Health and Safety Team.

Your Contribution:
  • Apply and promote  Englobeâ€™s  health and safety rules.
  • Coordinating projects in one or more of the following areas.
  • Designated Substances/Hazardous Materials Surveys.
  • Indoor Air Quality Assessments.
  • Hazardous Materials Tendering and Abatement Supervision.
  • Coordinating projects in other areas of Environmental Consulting, as required.
  • Generating and providing technical reviews of deliverable documentation such as technical reports, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Managing and/or generating deliverable documentation of various projects including technical documents.
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures and work plans.
  • Interacting, coordinating, and scheduling projects with clients, as directed by the Team Lead or Director.
  • Participating in project management meetings, office meetings, health, and safety inspections.
  • Maintaining a commitment to exceeding client expectations by consistently delivering high quality of work.
  • Consistently maintaining professionalism and objectivity while working with colleagues and clients who require varying degrees of support.
  • Handling difficult situations with tact and diplomacy to maintain positive working relationships with all internal and external contacts.
  • Conducting project administration tasks as required, including timesheet generation, project finance management and project invoicing.
Your Profile:
  • Undergraduate degree and/or applicable (science/engineering) diploma required.
  • Minimum 2 years experience in a consulting environment.
  • Experience providing reviews to proposals, specifications, case studies, technical and non-technical reports required.
  • Solid understanding of provincial and federal regulatory requirements acquired through experience and education.
  • Possession of valid driverâ€™s license required.
  • Possession of or eligibility to obtain secret security clearance required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Construction Manager â€“ Civil (Water, Wastewater Construction) - Future Opportunity
description:
Job Description:

Construction Manager â€“ Civil (Water, Wastewater Construction)

As a Construction Manager, you will be the right hand to our  Regional Manager overseeing staff, projects and implementing processes with the overall goal to deliver successful projects. You will have the opportunity to direct the project teams on some of our exciting Civil projects along with providing training and guidance to other members of the branch in relation to scheduling, budgets and overall construction management.     The opportunities here are endless!    

 

As  Construction  Manager, you will be accountable to:

  • Effectively manage projects by monitoring design, schedules, budgets and other project controls while making regular updates to reports aimed at measuring project success and timelines. Your natural leadership style will encourage your team to perform and continuously deliver outstanding projects.
  • Utilize your experience in planning to ensure that projects are being executed using the correct controls, adhering to quality and customer standards.
  • Monitor the deliverables within the department including reporting, procedures and systems that can be shared both internally and externally.
  • Share your knowledge by providing training on various project control methodology and software use. This role is responsible for mentoring junior Project Managers and Coordinators, guiding them to progress in their careers.

 

We are looking for a  Construction Manager to direct our Civil projects including Water/Waste Water Treatment plants, reservoirs, pump stations and lift stations and composting facilities with the potential to grow into larger opportunities. The ideal candidate will currently have:

  • A minimum of 15 yearsâ€™ experience in the construction industry, specifically with increasingly responsible positions involving multi-million dollar design-build and plan spec heavy civil projects.
  • Minimum 10 year's experience in water & waste water estimating
  • A University Degree/Technology Diploma in Civil Engineering, or a combination of education and industry experience.

 

With your strong business sense you will be empowered to manage your project teams to maximize productivity and profitability.

 

If you are a leader, and aspire to grow into more senior management positions, we want to hear from you. Please provide your project list including the dollar value along with your resume and cover letter.

 

Thank you for your interest in a career with Maple Reinders.  Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Maple Reinders is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Maple Reinders accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

 

 

People, Passion, Performance

title: Site Superintendent (FT)
description:
The Site Superintendent will primarily be responsible to ensure all persons on the construction site are using the required personal protective equipment properly and at all times. This position will ensure all employees are performing duties in compliance with company policies and standards for cost control, waste reduction, quality, safety, and complete and on-time delivery. This role will also manage job site administration duties, such as reviewing/submitting employee time-sheets and completing/maintaining daily logs. The Site Superintendent must possess a degree or diploma in a related field and position-relevant bonding and certifications.

Responsibilities:
  • Monitor and maintain the project construction schedule as needed.
  • Control and monitor labor, material, and equipment needs.
  • Coordinate and direct good construction standards and quality control.
  • See that good housekeeping practices are observed and maintained.
  • Attend pre-construction and construction meetings, taking notes on areas that may present a future problem and present to the Project Manager for consultation.
  • Coordinate all required inspections as mandated.
  • Prepare and expedite project deficiency lists.
  • Collaborate with the team to determine project needs.
  • Plan construction processes.
  • Estimate costs and ensure the project is on budget.
  • Supervise staff and provide constructive feedback.
  • Monitor and report on project progress.
  • Plan inspections and obtain construction permits from local authorities.
  • Implement safety and quality guidelines.
  • Ensure the job site remains safe, clean, and orderly.
  • Resolve on-site issues and emergencies.
Requirements:
  • 5+ years of experience as Construction Site Superintendent.
  • Degree or diploma in a related field.
  • Position-relevant bonding and certifications.
  • A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills.
  • Ability to manage coordination efforts in construction projects with various parties, such as architects, project engineers, and landscaping installers.
  • Strong knowledge of health and safety regulations.
  • Proven experience preparing and conducting post-implementation evaluations.
  • Ability to create realistic schedules to support the timely completion of construction projects.
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise necessary cost control measures.
  • Demonstrated project management skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage conflicting demands.
  • Ability to delegate, set expectations, and monitor the progress of all direct reports.
Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.

title: Construction Project Manager
description:
*Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.

Tu recherches un nouveau défi? Viens contribuer à divers projets de construction et de rénovation pour tous nos ports d’attache localisés dans 28 pays.

Ta future équipe

Faire la différence, voilà comment Premier Tech se distingue. Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Assurer la gestion de l’équipe Construction, architecture et gestion immobilière pour l’ensemble des projets de construction et de rénovation
  • Diriger l’analyse des besoins des clients internes en termes de bâtiments et d’infrastructures
  • Planifier et gérer les budgets, les livrables et les échéanciers des projets de construction – particulièrement ceux du Siège mondial de Rivière-du-Loup
  • Déployer et faire évoluer le Modèle architectural de Premier Tech
  • Garantir que les différents projets soient conformes à la législation en vigueur quant à l’environnement, la sécurité civile, le code du bâtiment et autres

Compétences requises

  • Diplôme universitaire en génie ou autre discipline connexe
  • 10 ans d’expérience en gestion dans le domaine de la construction et de la gestion de projets
  • Bonne connaissance des lois et des normes canadiennes en vigueur entourant le domaine de la construction
  • Excellentes habiletés relationnelles
  • Approche axée vers les clients
  • Leadership d’action et mobilisateur
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais – tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
  • Accréditations en construction – ASP, SIMDUT, etc.

Ton futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Ces mots te parlent?

gestion de projets, construction, bâtiments, mécanique du bâtiment, leader

Envie d’en savoir plus? N’attends plus, tu es à un clic de propulser ta carrière au niveau supérieur!

Découvrez notre équipe : https://www.premiertech.com/fr/construction-architecture-gestion-immobiliere

Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.', 'Assurer la gestion de l’équipe Construction, architecture et gestion immobilière pour l’ensemble des projets de construction et de rénovation', '*Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.']

title: Construction Managers!! for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area
description:
Currently we are looking for Construction Managers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Employee Benefit Program
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Training and Advancement Opportunities

What you Bring:

  • 10-15 years of previous experience in management role and/or industrial construction or Oil & Gas
  • Successful development and review of project scope, budget, plans and schedules
  • High standards to produce quality products
  • Proven track record in achieving successful project schedule commitments while meeting financial targets
  • Ability to multi-task in high-paced environments
  • Experience responding to changing deadlines/priorities
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong relationships with employees and stakeholders
  • Exceptional organizational skills and strong attention to detail
  • Strong commitment to safe work practices; walks the talk everyday
  • Addresses all relevant issues with the appropriate correspondence in a professional manner
  • Self motivated with excellent time management and problem-solving skills
  • Capable of handling high stress scenarios
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Displays exemplary professionalism at all times
  • Mentor project team for success
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment
  • Relevant terms: Project Manager; Management
  • Requirements:
  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Flexibility in working periods of overtime with travel to site locations
  • Valid Drivers License
  • Clean Abstract
  • Leadership for Excellence Certificate
  • Standard First Aid
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015

**At this time, our client’s may request contractors, vendors and suppliers to be fully vaccinated while providing service to their sites and therefore may require candidates to attest their vaccination disclosure status**
At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success. 
We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.
Come Grow With Us!
 

See Job Description

title: Directeur du territoire - Construction / Territory Manager - Construction
description:
Brandt est l'un des principaux fournisseurs de solutions de positionnement au Canada, desservant les marchés de la construction, de l'arpentage, de l'ingénierie, du gouvernement et de l'agriculture. Nous disposons d'une technologie de pointe qui améliore l'efficacité et la productivité de nos clients dans tous les marchés que nous desservons.

Brandt est actuellement à la recherche d'un directeur du territoire - Constructionpour la région de Quebec, se rapporter à la succursale de St-Augustin.

Ce poste se spécialise dans la vente de solutions de positionnement novatrices et de classe mondiale à l'industrie du géomatique. Vous serez dans la position enviable d'avoir une organisation de soutien de classe mondiale pour vous aider à développer votre entreprise, un client à la fois.

Fonctions et responsabilités

  • Vendre des produits entiers neufs et usagés dans le territoire de vente désigné
  • Remplir tous les documents de vente en temps utile et avec précision
  • Se tenir à jour sur les produits et les équipements
  • Se tenir à jour des activités et des besoins des clients
  • Développer des stratégies de marketing et de promotion pour le territoire
  • Préparer des rapports sur l'état des clients, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, les appels de vente, les rapports de clôture, de suivi et de prospection, le cas échéant
  • Autres tâches assignées

Compétences requises

  • De solides compétences en matière de service à la clientèle
  • Très motivé et autonome
  • Excellentes compétences en matière de communication, de présentation et d'organisation
  • Capacité à nouer des relations et à prospecter de nouveaux comptes
  • Doit être disponible pour voyager si nécessaire; un permis de conduire récent et un passeport valide sont requis

Expérience requise

  • Une expérience dans le secteur de la vente ou une connaissance approfondie des équipements lourds sont considérées comme un atout
  • Des études postsecondaires en arpentage, ingénierie ou géomatique sont considérées comme un atout
  • La connaissance du GPS, des réseaux, des systèmes de coordonnées, de la cartographie, de l'élévation et du niveau est autant d'atouts

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Brandt is a leading vendor of Positioning Solutions across Canada serving the construction, surveying, engineering, governmental and agricultural markets. We have leading edge technology that improves our customer’s efficiency and productivity in all the markets we serve.

Brandt is currently seeking a Territory Manager - Construction for the Quebec City area, reporting to ourSt-Augustin location.

This position specializes in the sales of world class, innovative Positioning solutions into the GeoPositioning industry. You would be in the enviable position of having some a world class support organization to help you grow your business one customer at a time.

Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to

  • Sell new and used whole goods product within the designated sales territory
  • Complete all sales documentation in a timely and accurate manner
  • Keep current on product knowledge and equipment
  • Keep current on customers’ business activities and needs
  • Develop marketing and promotion strategies for territory
  • Prepare customer status reports, including but not limited to sales call activity, closing, follow –up, and prospect reports as required
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Skills

  • Strong customer service skills
  • Highly motivated and self-directed
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills
  • Ability to build relationships and prospect new accounts
  • Must be available to travel as needed; a recent driver's abstract and valid passport are required

Required Experience

  • Sales industry experience and/or a comprehensive knowledge of heavy equipment considered an asset
  • Post-secondary education in Lan Surveying, Engineering, or Geomatics considered an asset
  • Knowledge of GPS, networks, coordinate systems, mapping, elevation, and level are all considered assets

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Join our team of Construction Professionals!

CASMAN is seeking a seasoned Site Superintendent who enjoys the challenge of Leading Teams and meeting targets!

A Casman Site Superintendent Oversees Safety, Schedule, Scope and Budget for our Clients. They are the stewards of the Project s overall success and building and maintaining client relationships. They will work with all internal team members as well as Subcontractors, Suppliers, and Clients. Excellent Communication skills (both written and verbal) and ability to work well in a team environment and lead a team are a must.

Experience managing projects under different contract types, such as Lump Sum and Construction Management, and also a proven track record with Commercial, Institutional, and multi-residential projects is required.

Candidates require 2-4 years of formal post-secondary construction education in Construction Engineering, Architectural Technology or Civil Engineering or a Journeyman Carpentry Certificate 5 years of experience as a Site Superintendent is required.Applicants must be very proficient with Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel, and familiar with building codes, standards and best construction practices.

Travel to our Various Western Canadian Offices will be required periodically.

This position would be in Fort McMurray and only applicants applying that are local to the region or are willing to fully relocate will be considered.

 

CASMAN'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES:

Competitive salary and performance bonus

Pension matching plan

Comprehensive Benefits package

Proven Opportunities for Career Growth

Sponsorship for Additional Education & Training

Casman offers relocation support 

 

Casman welcomes all applications, and we thank you for your interest in our group.

Only applicants of interest will be contacted.

title: Roofing Project Manager
description:
Overview:

The Roofing Project Manager will be responsible for leading and overseeing the

development and growth of new, profitable business and to create and maintain effective key customer relationships within the Ottawa area. The primary goal of this position is to drive IRCâ€™s company revenue and profit growth in Ottawa's Roof, Building Envelope and Pavement Consulting market.

 

Success in this position will be measured by a consistently increasing sales volume, profit and market share within the budget and pricing objectives for the defined market. Reporting to the Director of Business Development, the incumbent of this role will be expected to create demand for our consulting services and will ensure that all activities are conducted in accordance with the organizational strategy.

Responsibilities:

Project Management:

- Coordinate and conduct pre-bid, pre-start, progress and final project site meetings
- Coordinate the resolution of any problems identified in the field including: clarifying details; preparing new details for unique conditions; coordinating the drafting of new details, if required; coordinating design meetings if required to clarify design issues; issuing Addenda, Field Orders, Contemplated Change Orders and Change Orders
- Prepare leak investigation reports
- Prepare condition assessments and analysis reports
- Participate in design review meetings for roofing, waterproofing and building envelope
- Coordinate with manufacturers to resolve material performance and warranty issues
- Coordinate with OIRCA for warranty inspections and administration

Field Work:

- Collect field data including measuring, drawing, core-cuts, identifying deficiencies, photography and clean-up, etc.
- Conduct water leakage testing in order to determine case and effect and prepare report
- Responsible for the retrieval of information and preparation of roofing analysis reports
- Assist with building envelope field investigation work
- Specifications:
- Assist with the compilation of both field and report data in order to prepare specification documents
- Review drawings and specifications prepared by others to verify that the scope of work is sufficient and to ensure that all required details, materials, methods, etc. are correctly specified
- Quality Observations:
- Perform Quality Observations of work in progress to ensure compliance with tender documents and applicable codes and standards
- Obtain (of not already accredited) and maintain RRO designation

Other Duties:

- Maintain computer skills as required to perform duties
- General office duties including photocopying, faxing, filing, etc. as required
- Assist with the compilation of written reports
- Keep abreast of current trends in the industry to ensure professional development
- Other work-related duties as required

Qualifications:

- Minimum 8-10 yearsâ€™ experience in roofing
- Post-secondary degree or diploma in an applicable or related field
- Must be bilingual in French & English (written and verbal communication)
- Strong knowledge of various roofing systems and construction
- General comprehension of business dynamics in construction/roofing marketplace
- Excellent interpersonal skills, including strong written and verbal communication
- Possess strong entrepreneurial spirit and drive
- Conducts all activities with the highest degree of professionalism while demonstrating business integrity, creativity and team orientation
- Ability to travel as necessary to perform required duties

Reporting to the Director of Business Development, the incumbent of this role will be expected to create demand for our consulting services and will ensure that all activities are conducted in accordance with the organizational strategy.', 'Other Duties:']

title: Construction Materials Testing Technician
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood  is seeking a  Construction Materials Testing Technician  to join our Central Canada Materials Testing group based out of our Windsor (Tecumseh), Ontario office.   Join our team of specialists who provide materials testing and quality assurance as an integral component to design, and ensure projects are built with the safest and most sustainable materials. We provide materials testing and quality assurance services on some of the biggest projects in Canada.

 

 Key Responsibilities:

 

  • Laboratory Testing of soils, aggregates, and concrete in strict accordance with the applicable Canadian Standard Association (CSA), Canadian Council of Independent Laboratory (CCIL) and American Standard Testing Materials (ASTM) standards.
  • Become CCIL Certified for concrete, aggregates, and hot mix asphalt.
  • Road and foundation subgrade inspections, concrete re-bar inspections.
  • Quality Control (QC) and Quality Assurance (QA) testing of soils, aggregate and asphalt on a wide variety of construction projects such as commercial, industrial, and institutional building sites and infrastructure projects.
  • QC & QA testing includes liaison with the design consultants, providing recommendations to and directing the contractor on how to best reach the applicable Ontario Provincial Standard Specification (OPSS) standards as well as the contract specifications.
  • Safely using a nuclear density / moisture gauge, it is use being governed by the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC), and safe transportation as per the Transportation of Dangerous Goods (TDG) regulations; and
  • Daily preparation of field and laboratory testing / inspections reports.
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Min. 1 year experience with materials testing and inspection.
  • Diploma in Civil Technology or Civil Engineering or equivalent.
  • Current registration or eligibility for registration with OACETT or PEO.
  • Familiar with civil construction practices and relevant testing standards.
  • Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite including Word and Excel.
  • Familiar with Quality Management Systems.
  • Strong written, verbal communication and people management skills.
  • Experience in writing technical reports, business development and client relations.
  • Able to work independently in construction and laboratory settings and liaise with local office manager, supervisors, and contractor personnel.
  • Valid driver's license with acceptable driving experience; and
  • Travel out of town and willing to work overtime including nightshifts and weekends.

 

Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Material Testing Technician
description:
The Opportunity
What’s better than living in a city that offers great recreation, amenities, and affordable housing? What about the ability to grow your career in a community that is the right fit for you? McElhanney has a new opportunity for a Materials Testing Technician to join our growing team in Courtenay, BC.

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on both field and laboratory testing projects, and potentially assist other divisions, Survey, Civil, Structural and Marine Structural. This position will work closely with our Geotechnical and Civil Engineering teams to deliver construction quality control and quality assurance services.

McElhanney’s in-house materials testing laboratories deliver prompt, locally focused materials testing services throughout BC. Complementing our local laboratories, our fleet of mobile laboratories enables our qualified technicians to provide responsive on-site services, even in remote areas. We offer our services for the following project needs: construction aggregate testing, soil and concrete testing, and asphalt testing.

 What You’ll Be Doing: 
  • Working as part of a multi-discipline team of highly skilled engineers, technicians, surveyors, and drafters to provide excellent service to our clients
  • Conducting laboratory soil testing including wash sieve analysis, modified and standard proctors
  • Conducting laboratory concrete testing including compressive strength of concrete cylinders
  • Conducting laboratory asphalt testing, marshall properties
  • Conducting field testing of concrete (slump, air content, cast cylinders).
  • Conducting field compaction testing using a nuclear densometer
  • Timely preparation of reports
  • Other duties as required

What You’ll Bring:
  • Prior experience with earthworks/concrete construction and an interest in construction technology
  • A diploma in Civil Engineering Technology is an asset, but not required  
  • Canadian Council of Independent Laboratories (CCIL)/American Concrete Institution (ACI) certification or the ability to obtain certification
  • Knowledge of Canadian Standards Association (CSA) and American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) testing methods would be considered an asset
  • Physical ability to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas and willing to work in remote areas when needed
  • Good attitude and willingness to work cooperatively as a team player
  • Strong communication skills and leadership capabilities.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your lifestyle
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
  • Opportunity to become a shareholder in an employee-owned firm
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
  • Participation in our numerous programs that support our Four Cornerstones: people & communities, clients & partners, processes & technology, and financial.
About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
 
  #LI-AM3    #Junior  #Hybrid
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 
A beautiful and vibrant city on the east coast of Vancouver Island, Courtenay’s residents love its stunning scenery and recreational opportunities, as well as its affordability. World-class beaches are only a short drive away!
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Chief Building Official
description:
Chief Building Official - Ontario Municipality
Competitive Compensation (85 - 135K) & Benefits

Other Similar Titles:
- Building Official
- Building Inspector / Examiner

Reporting to the municipality's Chief Administrative Officer, the Chief Building Official (CBO) is responsible for enforcing the Building Code Act and regulations in accordance with the Provincial statutes and municipal by-laws. The CBO manages all aspects of the Building Division from the building permit application intake, plans review & inspection to ensure the health and safety requirements are met for new construction & renovations. The CBO will have overall responsibility and statutory duties as defined under the Building Code Act

Some Key responsibilities:
  • Leads & manages the Municipality's planning function including administration, zoning by-laws amendments, development applications & permits, site plan control, consents, minor variances, building & property standards, and the Official Plan
  • Performs CBO duties under Building Code requirements: conducts field inspections ensuring by-laws compliance, reviews & issues building permit applications, conducts building inspections as necessary
  • Assists Deputy Clerk with the management of municipal  properties including land & building acquisitions or dispersals
  • Liaises with government ministries, the public and businesses
  • Assists Fire Chief on Fire Code inspections and enforcement
  • Works in a safe manner in accordance within OH&S Act
Ideal Candidates will likely have many of the following Attributes:
  • 8 - 25+ years experience in progressive building compliance roles, some leadership would be an asset
  • Degree / diploma in Architecture, Civil Engineering, Planning or a field closely related to the building industry
  • Experience working with Municipal & Planning Acts, Building Codes & Acts
  • Chief Building Official certification is ideal (CBO eligible &/or in-progress will be considered)
  • Valid Drivers License and open to a Vulnerable Sector check
  • Strong organization & communications skills - verbal & written plus Solid computer skills (ie, MS Word & Excel)
  • Open to periodic after hours meetings, emergencies & on-calls evenings & weekends
The successful candidate will be rewarded with a competitive salary and benefits package, a variety of developmental opportunities, and the opportunity to make a real difference. Plus, you will have time to enjoy our community. 

Thank you for your interest in this job posting.
We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Superintendent (Structural/Bridges)
description:
Location: Peace River, AB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/11/2022Job ID: VF228116411Category: Engineering & Technical
If you are a talented and experienced Superintendent (Structural/Bridges), David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you!  Our client, a leader in their field, has partnered with David Aplin Group to grow their team in Alberta.
 
The Superintendent provides site management for all phases of the project from pre-construction to completion including but not limited to coordinating workers, materials, and equipment as well as ensuring that specifications are being followed, work is proceeding on schedule and within budget, the project is completed with outstanding quality and that the project is a safe workplace.    
 
Benefits & Perks:
  • Competitive compensation, including 100% employer-paid benefits
  • Monthly uplift and housing allowance (non-taxable)
  • Meal allowance (taxable)
Responsibilities:
Pre-Construction:
  • Understanding of the contract and scope of work, ensuring the scope of work is clearly communicated to trades
  • Identify and eliminate/control all actual or potential hazards and risks and document them on the Hazard Identification and Risk Assessment Log
  • Completing a detailed review of drawings and specifications
  • Understanding entitlements and immediately notifying the Project Manager of changes and conditions.  
  • Reviewing shop drawings
  • Participate in developing a cost-effective plan and schedule for completion of the project and following a logical pattern for utilization of resources
Construction:
  • Coordinating the work of subcontractors working on various phases of the project
  • Controlling and directing subcontractors, labour, and labour relations
  • Providing on-site supervision for all project personnel and phases of construction, resolving complaints and grievances with employees
  • Completing all paperwork as required  
  • Reporting any challenges or issues to the Project Manager and/or General Superintendent in a timely manner
  • Maintaining accurate build drawings for underground utilities and plan changes as they occur
  • Keeping a daily log of site activities on the project including but not limited to: All trades and number of personnel/trades, description of work, weather, and safety hazards or issues  
  • Expeditious completion of project deficiencies
  • Conducting weekly progress review meetings with Trades to review the weekly schedule and update accordingly
  • Attending all project meetings
  • Maintaining site files, supplies, equipment, and services
Health & Safety:
  • Enforcing on-site safety in accordance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act the latest regulations and Safety Policy Manual
  • Leading on-site safety meetings with trades and labour
  • Reporting all accidents and incidents promptly
  • Continually ensure any hazards are identified/controlled/eliminated and recorded and filed in the Safety Records Binder
  • Discuss the hazards with all workers at meetings (i.e., weekly toolbox meetings, monthly safety meetings, etc.)
  • Ensuring site personnel has required safety training and records are maintained
  • Ensure all preventative maintenance is conducted according to manufacturer specifications and that records are maintained
Relationship Management:
  • Maintain a good working relationship with all subcontractors and ensures they are treated fairly
  • Maintain professional conduct at all times with owners, consultants, traders, suppliers, and the public
  • Develop a good working relationship with owners and consultants
  • Report progress to owners and architects
  • Supervise crews, reviewing their reports, checking on any reported difficulties, and correcting any safety violations or other reported deficiencies
  • Making realistic commitments to the Project Manager, trades, owners, and consultants
  • Coach and mentor hourly employees
Qualifications:
  • 7+ years of Construction experience
  • Experience with structural heavy civil projects
  • Experience managing own forces’ hourly labour
  • Valid driver's license
  • Advanced computer skills, including base knowledge in MS Suite
 
Job ID: VF228116411
 
If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Superintendent
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

Job Description

  • Continuously monitor project budget and forecasting to the individual phase code level and cost type for potential gains and losses
  • Provide leadership and direction for all project activities and tasks, ensuring project outcomes are delivered successfully and in compliance with all contracts and client needs
  • Ensure clear communication of project-specific roles and responsibilities for all site personnel. Provide regular and respectful feedback for all under your direction
  • Monitor company equipment and supplies to ensure the needed equipment is where it’s required.
  • Inspect tools and equipment and notify the Tools and Equipment Manager for service and repair as needed
Qualifications

  • Journeyman trade certification or equivalent experience
  • Technical diploma and/or Gold Seal certification are considered assets
  • Five or more years experience in commercial construction for a large general contractor
  • One or more years experience as a superintendent for a large general contractor


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

The health and safety of our employees, families, industry partners, clients, and communities remains of the utmost importance.  That’s why we’re taking several steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19.

As of November 15, 2021, Chandos Construction requires all employees across the country to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. This is in line with our values and commitment to all stakeholders.
