title: Construction Manager-Fiber-GTA-XP19
description:
Construction Manager, Fibre

As part of the Fibre Construction team, the Construction Manager will be responsible for all physical and contractual aspects of the project related to the design and construction of the physical plant associated with fibre optic and FTTP networks. The Fibre Construction team employs a model whereby internal, or third party, fibre optic network designs are contracted out to external construction teams to build and test.  As such, the Construction Project Manager must possess excellent people and communication skills to motivate and maintain effective lines of communication between all stakeholders.
This position reports to the Deployment Manager, Fibre, with various locations required in Manitoba, Ontario, Quebec, and within Atlantic Region.

What you will do (Team responsibilities):
  • Work with Fibre Planners to develop preliminary cost estimates and schedules
  • Assist in  marketing effort where appropriate and as directed by management
  • Assist Project Managers to run competitive RFP processes for the selection of fibre design and construction contractors
  •  Assist management in final contract negotiations and in the development of a short list of qualified contractors for future work
  • Assist in negotiations with municipalities and government departments for Municipal Access Agreements and right of way usage
  • Assist in contract negotiations with infrastructure owners (e.g. pole, duct owners) for the use of their infrastructure
  • Conduct contractor safety pre-qualifications as required
  • Gather applicable project safety documentation and certificates of insurance prior to project start
  • Ensure contract, project coding and file structure are ready prior to project start
  • Ensure contractual obligations of the project are understood and met by all parties
  • Plan and organize work to meet project schedule deadlines and financial objectives
  • Manage Request for Information, Change Order Management process and related reporting
  • Develop and implement Inspection and Test Plans (ITP)
  • Review applications for progress payment and approve invoicing in a timely manner
  • Perform field safety audits and quality inspections
  • Assist with the procurement of fibre construction materials
  • Consult with industry peers and stay abreast of new industry technologies and industry standards

What you need to succeed (Individual competencies):
  • Engineering Degree (electrical or civil), Technologist Diploma (electrical or civil), Journeyman Certificate for Communications Electrician, or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 5 to 7 years of fibre optics construction management experience
  • In-depth knowledge of fibre optic network construction techniques, construction equipment and fibre optic network technologies for use in both outside plant and inside plant applications
  • Experience in the design and construction of FTTx networks
  • Experience managing fixed price, unit price and time and materials contracting models – understanding of advantages / disadvantages of the various models
  • Proven ability to manage relationships with construction contractors, consultants and subcontractors ensuring defined / contracted responsibilities are met
  • Demonstrated ability to implement processes and best practices which improve communication and allow teams to scale
  • Experienced in the implementation of construction standards and auditing contractors in their compliance of those standards
  • Solid understanding of OH&S requirements with demonstrated experience in the development and application of Project Specific Safety Programs (Job Hazard Assessments, Emergency Response Plans, Safe Work Practices)
  • Proven ability to break down barriers and foster collaboration across functions and teams
  • Able to maintain a high level of performance under pressure in a fast-paced changing environment
  • Excellent computer skills, particularly in the use of Google Earth software, CAD software and Microsoft products including Outlook, Word, Excel and Project
  • Willingness to travel

In alignment with the Vaccination Protocol, all new  team members are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.  Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case by case basis.

title: Construction Project Manager
description:
*Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.

Tu recherches un nouveau défi? Viens contribuer à divers projets de construction et de rénovation pour tous nos ports d’attache localisés dans 28 pays.

Ta future équipe

Faire la différence, voilà comment Premier Tech se distingue. Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Assurer la gestion de l’équipe Construction, architecture et gestion immobilière pour l’ensemble des projets de construction et de rénovation
  • Diriger l’analyse des besoins des clients internes en termes de bâtiments et d’infrastructures
  • Planifier et gérer les budgets, les livrables et les échéanciers des projets de construction – particulièrement ceux du Siège mondial de Rivière-du-Loup
  • Déployer et faire évoluer le Modèle architectural de Premier Tech
  • Garantir que les différents projets soient conformes à la législation en vigueur quant à l’environnement, la sécurité civile, le code du bâtiment et autres

Compétences requises

  • Diplôme universitaire en génie ou autre discipline connexe
  • 10 ans d’expérience en gestion dans le domaine de la construction et de la gestion de projets
  • Bonne connaissance des lois et des normes canadiennes en vigueur entourant le domaine de la construction
  • Excellentes habiletés relationnelles
  • Approche axée vers les clients
  • Leadership d’action et mobilisateur
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais – tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
  • Accréditations en construction – ASP, SIMDUT, etc.

Ton futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Ces mots te parlent?

gestion de projets, construction, bâtiments, mécanique du bâtiment, leader

Envie d’en savoir plus? N’attends plus, tu es à un clic de propulser ta carrière au niveau supérieur!

Découvrez notre équipe : https://www.premiertech.com/fr/construction-architecture-gestion-immobiliere

Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.', 'Assurer la gestion de l’équipe Construction, architecture et gestion immobilière pour l’ensemble des projets de construction et de rénovation', '*Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.']

title: Construction Project Manager : Hospital / ICI
description:
Are you a SeniorProject ManagerorambitiousProject Managerlooking for a career with a leading general contractor in the GTA? Would you like to work on high-profileinstitutional / hospitalconstruction projects? Are you interested in joining a company thattreats their team like family, with great support and collaboration? Then read on…

This is an exciting new project management role working with a leading GC on innovative and high-end institutional construction projects. As the Senior PM, you will have the opportunity to lead projects frompre-construction through to close-out, including: scheduling, tendering, budget/forecast preparation, and contract execution. With your leadership and excellent communication skills you will manage clients, collaborate on design, coordinate with consultants and direct trades and junior staff.

What you will get out of it
Our client is a leading general contractor with an excellent reputation for constructing high profile institutional projects that you can be proud of, within asupportive and collaborative team. Salary and benefits package will be respectful of your experience. If you are interested in learning more about this exciting new role, apply now!

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Project Manager, Hazardous Materials
description:
Your Employer:

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and itâ€™s more than 2,600 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

 

As a Project Manager, Hazardous Materials, you will work in collaboration with the Hygiene Health and Safety Team.

Your Contribution:
  • Apply and promote  Englobeâ€™s  health and safety rules.
  • Coordinating projects in one or more of the following areas.
  • Designated Substances/Hazardous Materials Surveys.
  • Indoor Air Quality Assessments.
  • Hazardous Materials Tendering and Abatement Supervision.
  • Coordinating projects in other areas of Environmental Consulting, as required.
  • Generating and providing technical reviews of deliverable documentation such as technical reports, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Managing and/or generating deliverable documentation of various projects including technical documents.
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures and work plans.
  • Interacting, coordinating, and scheduling projects with clients, as directed by the Team Lead or Director.
  • Participating in project management meetings, office meetings, health, and safety inspections.
  • Maintaining a commitment to exceeding client expectations by consistently delivering high quality of work.
  • Consistently maintaining professionalism and objectivity while working with colleagues and clients who require varying degrees of support.
  • Handling difficult situations with tact and diplomacy to maintain positive working relationships with all internal and external contacts.
  • Conducting project administration tasks as required, including timesheet generation, project finance management and project invoicing.
  • Willingness to travel to remote areas of Northern Ontario
Your Profile:
  • Undergraduate degree and/or applicable (science/engineering) diploma required.
  • Minimum 3-5 years experience in a consulting environment.
  • Experience providing reviews to proposals, specifications, case studies, technical and non-technical reports required.
  • Solid understanding of provincial and federal regulatory requirements acquired through experience and education.
  • Possession of valid driverâ€™s license required.
  • Possession of or eligibility to obtain secret security clearance required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Construction Managers
description:
Currently we are looking for Construction Managers!! to join our team for upcoming future opportunities!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us !!!

What We Offer:

  • Employee Benefit Program including medical and dental coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Training and Advancement Opportunities 

What you Bring:

  • Proven experience in leading successful project teams with 10-15 years of previous experience in management role and/or industrial construction or Oil & Gas
  • Successful development and review of project scope, budget, plans and schedules
  • High standards to produce quality products
  • Proven track record in achieving successful project schedule commitments while meeting financial targets
  • Ability to multi-task in high-paced environments
  • Experience responding to changing deadlines/priorities
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong team through collaboration and mentoring
  • Exceptional organizational skills and strong attention to detail
  • Strong commitment to safe work practices; walks the talk everyday
  • Display professionalism at all times 
  • Self motivated with excellent time management and problem-solving skills
  • Capable of handling high stress scenarios
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment
  • Previous Experience: construction manager, construction, manager, construction supervisor, general manager, construction management, construction superintendent, superintendent, supervisor, construction site supervisor

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Drivers License/Clean Abstract
  • Leadership for Excellence Certificate
  • Standard First Aid
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015

*Please note that this advertisement does not reflect a current job vacancy; this posting is intended to fill upcoming competitions for various projects we are about to start work on.

*Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for further consideration; we are not accepting phone inquiries at this time.

See Job Description

title: Summer Materials Testing Technician - Edmonton
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

 

Wood Resilient Environments (Wood) will be accepting resumes to employ students in the coming 2022 summer and fall months (May to October). These individuals will fill the role of Materials Laboratory and Field Technicians in Edmonton, Alberta. This is an excellent opportunity for candidates looking to develop their career and experience in the engineering and construction field. All applicants must have a valid Alberta driver’s license and be required to submit an up-to-date driver’s abstract upon being hired.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

Responsibilities will include conducting various tests on asphalt pavements, concrete, aggregates and various soils in both laboratory and field environment. This position will require working on out of town projects. In addition, the incumbent will:

  • Maintain orderliness of laboratory.
  • Preparation of inspection reports and data entry.
  • Follow Wood’s Project Review, Ethics and Safety Policies.
  • Construction monitoring of roads, pads, buildings etc.
  • Field Concrete testing
  • Field Compaction testing
  • Laboratory work 

Skills / Qualifications

  • Good written and verbal English communication skills
  • Some form of Civil Engineering education, either from a university or technical school
  • Reliable and punctual
  • Willing to do a variety of tasks and able to prioritize
  • CSA Safety boots required
  • Ability to work in the laboratory and office settings
  • Light to moderate lifting may be required

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Finishing Site Superintendent (Mid-Rise Project)
description:
Our Client:
A renowned & award winning home-builder that has delivered state of the art communities across the GTA. They have been in business for over 30 years and are looking to add a a skilledFinishing Site Superintendentfor their site in the East GTA.

Duties:

Scheduling:

  • Coordinate with trade contractors and ensure they progress according to the project schedule
  • Create, track and monitor look-ahead schedules

Budget and Cost tracking:

  • Assisting project manager with overall budget review and cost tracking
  • Help issue site documentation and review of any site changes and cost implications

Management and Leadership:

  • Familiarize yourself with the blueprints in order to foresee problems and minimize the schedule & financial impacts
  • Establish, maintain, and control quality control standards on site
  • Identify and escalate potential issues to the Construction Manager in a timely manner
  • Recommend corrective actions when necessary to maintain project schedule and quality
  • Ensure all staff and contractors maintain a safe working environment according to company policies
  • Coordinate all activity between trades and suppliers
  • Ensure that all changes are properly documented and implemented
  • Ensure the timely delivery of reports to Head Office
  • Provide schedule updates to the Construction Manager on a regular basis
  • Ensure inspections are completed throughout all construction phases, to ensure buildings meet clients’ specifications and the Ontario Building Code
  • Maintain a daily construction journal
  • Attend pre-delivery inspections (PDI’s) with purchasers, and ensure any deficiencies identified are corrected in a timely manner
  • Document the construction process and keep all parties informed on important issues
  • Create deficiency lists and follow up with trades to ensure a high quality is adhered to

Summary of Qualifications & Requirements:

  • Minimum 5 years of mid-rise or high-rise residential construction experience
  • Strong sequencing experience
  • Excellent knowledge of Ontario Building Code and high attention to detail
  • Proven performance in leadership and managing both people and construction sites
  • Demonstrated effective communication and team building skills
  • Demonstrated ability to problem solve, juggle numerous and diverse activities, organizing and prioritizing appropriately to meet demands and expectations
  • Be a motivated self-starter who thrives in a fast pace team environment and have a desire to grow with the Company

Rewards:

Base salary of$90,000-$105,000+ Benefits, Bonuses & Allowances

TSSHP

title: Area Construction Manager - Infrastructure
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is seeking a Construction Area Manager (Infrastructure) for our Mining & Minerals project site located near Gogama, Ontario, reporting to the Manager, Construction, the successful candidate will be responsible for the safe and effective completion of various multi-discipline scopes within the project, primarily on the process plant site.    

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Work with the engineering team and provide constructability guidance during the planning phase of the project
  • Construction planning and construction work packaging for scopes of work that fall within the process/infrastructure area of responsibility.   Responsibility to build the plan, communicate planning through to engineering teams, align engineering to support construction schedule and execute in accordance with plan.
  • Responsibilities will include field management of multiple contractors.  This will include monitoring of contractor performance  insuring compliance with all project objectives -  HSSEA, Cost, Schedule, and Quality.  
  • Successful proponent will be required to report against progress of their portion of the overall project schedule.
  • Manage a team of multi-disciplined construction coordinators while managing multiple multi-discipline contractors in order to enable on time completion of their scopes of work
  • Liaise with a team of support service coordinators: cost control, scheduling, contract administrations, HSSE, fielding engineering, materials and quality.
  • Develop team relationships to ensure smooth interaction between parties responsible for work identification, planning & scheduling, resource provision, and execution of work
  • Control nonconforming products, services and their subsequent repair, and re-work until corrective actions have been implemented
  • Ensure compliance with established safety and environmental programs to execute services with zero harm to people, environment, and plant
  • Monitor, participate and lead  safety performance of contractors.  Implement steps to rectify any trends of deficiencies in performance of the program
  • Participate and assist with overall safety and environmental programs to drive continuous improvement
  • Ensure safety reporting, incidents, and near misses are reported both in a timely and accurate manner in accordance with the standard procedure
  • Maintain a thorough and comprehensive record of actions and events. Document and/or obtain necessary detail to provide a clear understanding of particular occurrences and conditions
  • All other duties as assigned
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 15 yearsâ€™ experience in multi-discipline scopes of work in a construction supervisory role specifically on heavy industrial sites
  • Experience in Mining Industry is required (gold mining process facilities)
  • Possess a relevant degree or technical diploma or a combination of equivalent in training and combined experience
  • Excellent communication and personnel management skills; ability to liaise at all levels with the client
  • Proven track record of successful project completion on time and on budget
  • Experience with construction camps, turn-key design/supply/install packages, high voltage power-lines  and substations an asset.
  • Accommodation for the site works will be construction camp based.   Applicants need to be familiar with standard camp accommodation and rules.
  • Authorization to lawfully work in Canada without sponsorship from Wood is required
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Project Manager - Road Construction
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

The primary objective of the Project Manager is to provide support to the project management team and coordinate daily road construction activities on various projects in the greater Edmonton market.

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for all safety and environmental aspects on projects and at worksites. Promote Lafarge’s safety culture.
  • Project management of all contracts either awarded or assigned to the incumbent including attending site meetings, identifying and pricing work extra to the contract, coordinating and scheduling the project with the customer, invoicing, collections, and resolving any disputes involving the customer and any other third parties.
  • Verify contract documents and blueprints for accuracy and project materials.
  • Manage Subcontractors, outline expectations, scheduling information and track productions.
  • Verify job site quantities.
  • Monitor project costs and financial reports. Provide feedback to operations and estimating departments.
  • Direct liaison with customers, consultants and owners. Ensure that client satisfaction has been achieved.
  • Monitoring of the construction market and identifying suitable projects which Lafarge would be interested in bidding.
  • In conjunction with the estimating team prepare accurate and competitive cost estimates based on efficient construction practices, and using the most competitive and reliable subcontractors and suppliers
  • Job set-up for all projects estimated and awarded to Lafarge by the incumbent including credit approval, bonding, insurance, W.C.B. clearance, schedules, pre-construction meetings, subcontract agreements, purchase orders, as well as internal job setup for operations and accounting
  • Other tasks as assigned.

Qualifications

Educational Background:

A diploma or degree in Civil Engineering with a C.E.T or P.Eng designation is preferred.  A combination of educational background along with skills / experience will be considered.     

Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years project management in road construction and field supervisory experience, estimating experience preferred.
  • Computer literate.
  • Understanding of Microsoft excel, Microsoft project, and Bid2Win estimating software
  • Strong understanding of paving, sub-grade, gravel base course, concrete construction and related subcontractor operations.

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Senior Superintendent (Civil Construction)
description:
Job Description:

Superintendent - Water, Waste Water Construction  

 

You enjoy being the leader of a team of construction professionals focused on delivering a quality project every time.

 

You have leadership goals and looking for the right organization to grow with.

 

You have built your career as a Superintendent with a stellar safety record and maintained solid relationships with your Project Managers, clients and other key project stakeholders.

 

Then this is the next step in your career.

 

As a Superintendent with our busy Heavy Civil & Environmental division, you will have the responsibility of overseeing our site staff, field engineering and field teams accountable for the delivery of completed civil and environmental projects.     Maple Reinders is a growing organization and we are continually winning new work. With that come new experiences and new challenges.

 

At Maple, we look for leaders who can:

  • Direct field operations in the delivery of projects by adhering to schedules, budgets, safety and risk.
  • Effectively manage field employees by providing guidance and leadership on construction activities and developing effective communication between field and other project staff.
  • Develop and execute project work plans aimed at keeping projects on track and on budget.
  • Provide senior level presence in the field, coach field staff on issue resolution, review site labour requirements, mentor field staff and perform succession planning.

 

Our Superintendent will oversee projects that vary in size and scope and the successful candidate should have previous experience in leading construction teams, trades and hourly employees. Many of our projects are located within Ontario; however, work can sometimes take us to other parts of the province and beyond.     We would require the Superintendent to travel or stay close to the site; flexibility is a must. We are also focused on candidates who currently have:

  • Minimum 5 years of construction experience with a General Contractor in a leadership role
  • Post-secondary education, CET or equivalent
  • Proficiency with MS Office and Windows based computer applications (Word, Excel, Outlook and Project)
  • Can manage site operations on complex projects in excess of $40 million

 

The Superintendent is a key member of Maple Reindersâ€™ project team and is critical to the success of each project under their direction.  We want you to succeed and we are prepared to get you there by investing in you. We offer extensive training through our â€œCentre of Learningâ€ to facilitate your career growth through programs such as LEED, Gold Seal and â€œlunch and learnsâ€.

 

If you are a solid construction leader, we want to hear from you. Please provide your project list including the dollar value along with your resume and cover letter.

 

Thank you for your interest in a career with Maple Reinders. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Maple Reinders is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Maple Reinders accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

 

No agency calls please.

 

 

People, Passion, Performance

title: Contractor Site Manager
description:
Company Description

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

The Contractor Site Manager is a key member of the contract team at a historical remote site in the Canadian Arctic. Reporting to the Division Vice President Facilities Management Western Canada, the Contractor Site Manager is responsible for overseeing the CFS Alert Site Management Team delivering the portfolio of work at CFS Alert. Responsible for the attainment of the Health, Safety, Environment, Quality and Financial targets of the contract, the Contractor Site Manager will enable the operations team and support function leads to facilitate meeting the goals and objectives of the CFS Alert contract. Responsible for the management and administration of all operational requirements and activities of facilities and support services for the contract, this individual will foster strong relationships and deliver operational excellence to meet internal and external customer needs. An 8 weeks on, 8 weeks off rotational schedule with flights to and from the worksite in Nunavut leaving from Trenton, Ontario. A unique opportunity to contribute to the operation of an entire community supporting members of the Canadian Armed Forces.

This position requires Government of Canada security clearance at the Secret Status level.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Manage, plan, control audit and coordinate all on-site work activities including:
    • Accommodation and janitorial services, food services, environmental protection and domestic, industrial and hazmat waste collection, handling and disposal, transportation and vehicle maintenance, airfield operations, facility management services including building systems and equipment, standby power systems, fuel services, quarry services, engineering services, and project delivery.
  • Provide leadership and direction to managers responsible for the service delivery areas including the Food Services and Hospitality Manager, Transportation and Vehicle Manager, HSEQ Manager, and Real Property Services Manager.
  • Attend meetings and liaise with the site Commanding Officer to ensure all operational, administrative and safety matters are addressed.
  • Organize staff to ensure work is prioritized to meet the site operational needs, and that work is conducted in a professional and timely manner, meeting all standards, operating procedures, and guidelines.
  • Ensure that Emergency Response Plans are supported, liaising with National Defense Authorities, as required.
  • Ensure that phase-in and phase-out requirements are well planned and conducted, preparing and submitting reports and data deliverables as identified.
  • Prepare and maintain a cost management system including labour resource costs.
  • Act as the official point of contact for the client Contractor, with sufficient delegated technical and financial authority to respond appropriately to any contractual matters.
Qualifications

  • Minimum five (5) years of experience in management of multi-disciplinary-services and functions in a commercial or industrial setting.
  • At least ten (10) years of combined experiences in logistical support and facilities operations and maintenance services.
  • Minimum of fifteen (15) years overall work experience.
  • Relevant experience in projects of similar, or greater, size (duration or value of contract), scope (facilities management in an isolated or harsh environment) and complexity (responsible for the proper operation and maintenance of roads and grounds, power plant operation, cleaning, food services, water plant and fueling systems for facilities of similar, or greater scale).
  •  Ability to obtain Government of Canada security clearance at the Secret Status level (requires a 10 year background check and Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency).
  • Education or certification from a recognized accredited institution in Engineering, Construction Management, Business Management, BOMI or related field.
  • Ability to obtain fit-for-duty medical assessment from a physician.
  • Experience working in and managing remote locations.
  • Knowledge and experience working with Federal Legislation or Territorial bodies.
  • Excellent presentation and written communication skills; ability to effectively convey information and influence.
  • Ability to effectively manage, adjust and adapt to fluctuating priorities and workloads in a high performance work environment.
  • Leadership competencies with the ability to provide mentorship, direction and monitor the deliverables of direct reports.
  • Inuit cultural awareness, knowledge and respect.
  • Flexibility to meet the unique requirements of the site including potential rotational shift changes and working after hours “on-call” duties.


Additional Information

  • An opportunity for work life balance. 8 weeks on and 8 weeks off allows you to use your time to do what you enjoy.
  • Continuous wage payment throughout your time off.
  • Competitive wages, benefits and an RSP matching program.
  • Retention Bonus of up to 10% of wages earned paid on the completion of a 2 year contract.
  • Paid travel time.
  • Unique experience in the northernmost continuously inhabited place in the world.
  • Training and development opportunities to help grow and diversify your career.
  • Transfer opportunities to other Dexterra sites across Canada.

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

*Please not this job is based in Alert, Nunavut, Canada

title: Construction Manager-Fiber-Atlan-QCXP16-Sid
description:
Construction Manager, Fibre

As part of the Fibre Construction team, the Construction Manager will be responsible for all physical and contractual aspects of the project related to the design and construction of the physical plant associated with fibre optic and FTTP networks. The Fibre Construction team employs a model whereby internal, or third party, fibre optic network designs are contracted out to external construction teams to build and test.  As such, the Construction Project Manager must possess excellent people and communication skills to motivate and maintain effective lines of communication between all stakeholders.
This position reports to the Deployment Manager, Fibre, with various locations required in Manitoba, Ontario, Quebec, and within Atlantic Region.

What you will do (Team responsibilities):
  • Work with Fibre Planners to develop preliminary cost estimates and schedules
  • Assist in Xplornet’s marketing effort where appropriate and as directed by management
  • Assist Project Managers to run competitive RFP processes for the selection of fibre design and construction contractors
  •  Assist management in final contract negotiations and in the development of a short list of qualified contractors for future work
  • Assist in negotiations with municipalities and government departments for Municipal Access Agreements and right of way usage
  • Assist in contract negotiations with infrastructure owners (e.g. pole, duct owners) for the use of their infrastructure
  • Conduct contractor safety pre-qualifications as required
  • Gather applicable project safety documentation and certificates of insurance prior to project start
  • Ensure contract, project coding and file structure are ready prior to project start
  • Ensure contractual obligations of the project are understood and met by all parties
  • Plan and organize work to meet project schedule deadlines and financial objectives
  • Manage Request for Information, Change Order Management process and related reporting
  • Develop and implement Inspection and Test Plans (ITP)
  • Review applications for progress payment and approve invoicing in a timely manner
  • Perform field safety audits and quality inspections
  • Assist with the procurement of fibre construction materials
  • Consult with industry peers and stay abreast of new industry technologies and industry standards

What you need to succeed (Individual competencies):
  • Engineering Degree (electrical or civil), Technologist Diploma (electrical or civil), Journeyman Certificate for Communications Electrician, or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 5 to 7 years of fibre optics construction management experience
  • In-depth knowledge of fibre optic network construction techniques, construction equipment and fibre optic network technologies for use in both outside plant and inside plant applications
  • Experience in the design and construction of FTTx networks
  • Experience managing fixed price, unit price and time and materials contracting models – understanding of advantages / disadvantages of the various models
  • Proven ability to manage relationships with construction contractors, consultants and subcontractors ensuring defined / contracted responsibilities are met
  • Demonstrated ability to implement processes and best practices which improve communication and allow teams to scale
  • Experienced in the implementation of construction standards and auditing contractors in their compliance of those standards
  • Solid understanding of OH&S requirements with demonstrated experience in the development and application of Project Specific Safety Programs (Job Hazard Assessments, Emergency Response Plans, Safe Work Practices)
  • Proven ability to break down barriers and foster collaboration across functions and teams
  • Able to maintain a high level of performance under pressure in a fast-paced changing environment
  • Excellent computer skills, particularly in the use of Google Earth software, CAD software and Microsoft products including Outlook, Word, Excel and Project
  • Willingness to travel

In alignment with the Vaccination Protocol, all new  team members are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.  Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case by case basis.

title: Manager Engineering & Construction, Capital Projects - Calgary (Calgary, Alberta, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada 
All Available Locations: Calgary 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

 

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.

Interested in joining our Capital Projects team? Keep reading to learn more!

We are looking for professionals with management consulting experience to join our Capital Projects team.

What will your typical day look like?

As part of our team, you will be responsible for the followin

  • Providing an independent perspective on key capital projects processes and identifying opportunities for improvement;
  • Assisting clients in setting up their organization to effectively plan and manage across the project lifecycle including in the areas of cost, schedule, change order, procurement and risk management;
  • Providing subject matter expertise on construction claims, including cost and schedule analysis;
  • Developing and facilitating impactful and value-add workshops and meetings;
  • Playing a leadership role in business development, including developing and delivering proposals;
  • Expanding our national capital projects presence;
  • Developing thought leadership;
  • Leading engagements and managing multi-disciplinary teams
  • Mentoring, coaching and developing the team; and
  • Contributing to the on-going development of expertise within our Capital Projects practice.

About the team

Our Capital Projects team – comprising of some 40 professionals nationally - are dedicated project professionals that have unsurpassed, cross-sector of deep industry experience in every aspect of the capital project lifecycle.  Our people possess practical and effective project management, engineering, consulting, and communication skills, as well as strong professional qualities.  We are committed to producing high quality results and have a passion for ensuring that our clients have successful capital projects.   Our services help clients manage their capital and/or construction programs more effectively to achieve timely completion within budget.

Our team provides a variety of advisory services to capital project owners, governmental agencies, institutions, constructors, developers, or any organization with a significant interest in the successful delivery of a capital project.  Our team of experienced engineers, quantity surveyors, construction managers, architects, and accountants possess comprehensive engineering and construction industry experience.  Furthermore, through our access to the Deloitte global network of member firms, our Capital Projects team offers a broad range of integrated services in varied professional disciplines and diverse locations.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone with:

  • 5-8 years of experience related to major projects
  • Prior management consulting and/or advisory services in connection with Capital Projects is required
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills required
  • Familiarity with commonly used project management technology solutions (For example, P6, Ecosys, Unifier, PRISM, etc.) is considered an asset;
  • Proven ability to thrive in a team and collaborative setting, contribute and share ideas, regularly seek guidance and feedback, and work to ensure the success of the team;
  • Proven ability to work independently, when required, take initiative, and maintain a positive attitude;
  • The willingness to learn, and a strong commitment to professional and client service excellence; and
  • PMP designation is considered an asset.

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now!
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Project Manager, Electrical
description:
Your Employer:

Arrow Engineering Inc. is a division of  Englobe Corp.  Since 1961, Englobe has been providing consulting services and is a national leader in environmental, geotechnical, pavement and materials engineering and building science with specialized services in civil, municipal and transportation engineering.

 

With the Arrow team joining Englobe, we have expanded our service offerings but remain your easy-to-work-with multi-discipline engineering firm. We specialize in  Mechanical,  Electrical, and  Civil Engineering  across Canada.

 

Your Contribution

 

As a Project Manager, in our Electrical Engineering team, you have a  shared responsibility for the performance and success of our Electrical Engineering team, and firm, respectively. This position will report directly to the Principal or Senior Project Manager, work independently, and with minimal supervision, while working in collaboration with various colleagues and external partners. The Project Manager, Electrical actively guides a professional team working on various electrical engineering projects represented by a broad range of client sectors. The work environment is of high volume, offering a range of project complexities and requires a high level of responsibility.

Your Contribution:
  • Actively participates in all projects, providing guidance, client input/feedback, and general direction
  • Working with the design team on the project, develops and monitors electrical design strategies for building construction to ensure efficient and sustainable project delivery
  • Successfully develops relationships with clients, industry affiliates, engineers, technologists, technicians, and construction personnel
  • Manages client relationships and project service delivery, actively participating in the entire project life cycle, from preliminary services through project implementation, and warranty
  • Meet with clients regarding projects, progress reporting, and the resolution of issues, as required
  • Coordinates the preparation of engineering specifications and drawings, quantity and cost estimates
  • Responsible for ensuring the electrical drawings and specifications meet established project criteria and applicable standards
  • Develops standards related to our electrical engineering practice, ensuring best practices for project management and delivery
  • Utilization of industry specific software and related technologies in design and analysis
  • Preparation of reports, proposals, and tender/bid submissions, budgets, project plans, and other supporting documentation, as required
  • When necessary, involvement with a variety of agencies for project approvals and permitting
  • Estimating and scheduling of projects, procurement of materials, and update / maintenance of company-related resources
Your Profile:

Education

A degree, diploma, or certification from a recognized post-secondary institution, in the area of electrical engineering (Engineering, CAD Design, Technologies, or Project Management). LEED Accreditation and experience with sustainable design initiatives is considered an asset.

 

Experience

Five to ten years of experience in consulting electrical design engineering for buildings or equivalent experience and responsibilities is required. A comprehensive working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Excel, along with AutoCAD drafting experience are required. Experience with Revit would be considered an asset.

 

Character Strengths

  • Excellent command of English grammar, spelling and composition, as well as oral communication and interpersonal skills
  • Professional, energetic and action-oriented
  • Strong organization, time management, and prioritization skills
  • Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to work individually and as a team member, within a dynamic, fast-paced, deadline driven environment
  • Effectively manages a variety of projects and/or initiatives, often occurring simultaneously
  • Able to balance work and personal requirements
  • Sense of humour
  • Enjoys working in a professional office environment, with occasional client and/or site visits, and is able to work outside of normal business hours, when necessary

title: Construction Managers
description:
Currently we are looking for Construction Managers!! to join our team for upcoming future opportunities!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us !!!

What We Offer:

  • Employee Benefit Program including medical and dental coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Training and Advancement Opportunities 

What you Bring:

  • Proven experience in leading successful project teams with 10-15 years of previous experience in management role and/or industrial construction or Oil & Gas
  • Successful development and review of project scope, budget, plans and schedules
  • High standards to produce quality products
  • Proven track record in achieving successful project schedule commitments while meeting financial targets
  • Ability to multi-task in high-paced environments
  • Experience responding to changing deadlines/priorities
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong team through collaboration and mentoring
  • Exceptional organizational skills and strong attention to detail
  • Strong commitment to safe work practices; walks the talk everyday
  • Display professionalism at all times 
  • Self motivated with excellent time management and problem-solving skills
  • Capable of handling high stress scenarios
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment
  • Previous Experience: construction manager, construction, manager, construction supervisor, general manager, construction management, construction superintendent, superintendent, supervisor, construction site supervisor

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Drivers License/Clean Abstract
  • Leadership for Excellence Certificate
  • Standard First Aid
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015

*Please note that this advertisement does not reflect a current job vacancy; this posting is intended to fill upcoming competitions for various projects we are about to start work on.

*Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for further consideration; we are not accepting phone inquiries at this time.

See Job Description

title: Vice President, Construction
description:
Are you a VP of Construction or ambitious Director of Construction, looking to apply your expertise in capital improvement and new build residential, retail, commercial and industrial projects with a leading international REIT? Do you enjoy working with a collaborative and supportive executive team? Do you take pride in mentoring and coaching junior staff towards project and portfolio success? Then read on..

In the role of VP, Construction you will lead the construction team, taking lead on both new build and capital/tenant improvement projects with a robust portfolio of multi-family residential, retail and industrial assets. With your background in engineering and construction, you will take point on projects across Eastern Canada (Ontario, Quebec, Maritime). Ensuring projects run smoothly and ensuring assets are performing at their optimum.

What you get out of it?
Competitive compensation and benefits, including a robust retirement program. Carte blanche to manage and streamline processes within your team. Working alongside a collaborative and supportive executive team, with some of the highest retention rates in the sector – this will likely be your forever “career home”.

This is an amazing opportunity for a VP of Construction or ambitious Director of Construction to work with an international leader in real estate. If interested, APPLY NOW.

title: Summer Materials Testing Technician - Edmonton
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

 

Wood Resilient Environments (Wood) will be accepting resumes to employ students in the coming 2022 summer and fall months (May to October). These individuals will fill the role of Materials Laboratory and Field Technicians in Edmonton, Alberta. This is an excellent opportunity for candidates looking to develop their career and experience in the engineering and construction field. All applicants must have a valid Alberta driverâ€™s license and be required to submit an up-to-date driverâ€™s abstract upon being hired.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

Responsibilities will include conducting various tests on asphalt pavements, concrete, aggregates and various soils in both laboratory and field environment. This position will require working on out of town projects. In addition, the incumbent will:

  • Maintain orderliness of laboratory.
  • Preparation of inspection reports and data entry.
  • Follow Woodâ€™s Project Review, Ethics and Safety Policies.
  • Construction monitoring of roads, pads, buildings etc.
  • Field Concrete testing
  • Field Compaction testing
  • Laboratory work  
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Good written and verbal English communication skills
  • Some form of Civil Engineering education, either from a university or technical school
  • Reliable and punctual
  • Willing to do a variety of tasks and able to prioritize
  • CSA Safety boots required
  • Ability to work in the laboratory and office settings
  • Light to moderate lifting may be required
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people.  www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Finishing Site Superintendent (Mid-Rise Project)
description:
Our Client:
A renowned & award winning home-builder that has delivered state of the art communities across the GTA. They have been in business for over 30 years and are looking to add a a skilled Finishing Site Superintendent for their site in the East GTA.

Duties:

Scheduling:

  • Coordinate with trade contractors and ensure they progress according to the project schedule
  • Create, track and monitor look-ahead schedules

Budget and Cost tracking:

  • Assisting project manager with overall budget review and cost tracking
  • Help issue site documentation and review of any site changes and cost implications

Management and Leadership:

  • Familiarize yourself with the blueprints in order to foresee problems and minimize the schedule & financial impacts
  • Establish, maintain, and control quality control standards on site
  • Identify and escalate potential issues to the Construction Manager in a timely manner
  • Recommend corrective actions when necessary to maintain project schedule and quality
  • Ensure all staff and contractors maintain a safe working environment according to company policies
  • Coordinate all activity between trades and suppliers
  • Ensure that all changes are properly documented and implemented
  • Ensure the timely delivery of reports to Head Office
  • Provide schedule updates to the Construction Manager on a regular basis
  • Ensure inspections are completed throughout all construction phases, to ensure buildings meet clients’ specifications and the Ontario Building Code
  • Maintain a daily construction journal
  • Attend pre-delivery inspections (PDI’s) with purchasers, and ensure any deficiencies identified are corrected in a timely manner
  • Document the construction process and keep all parties informed on important issues
  • Create deficiency lists and follow up with trades to ensure a high quality is adhered to

Summary of Qualifications & Requirements:

  • Minimum 5 years of mid-rise or high-rise residential construction experience
  • Strong sequencing experience
  • Excellent knowledge of Ontario Building Code and high attention to detail
  • Proven performance in leadership and managing both people and construction sites
  • Demonstrated effective communication and team building skills
  • Demonstrated ability to problem solve, juggle numerous and diverse activities, organizing and prioritizing appropriately to meet demands and expectations
  • Be a motivated self-starter who thrives in a fast pace team environment and have a desire to grow with the Company

Rewards:

Base salary of $90,000-$105,000 + Benefits, Bonuses & Allowances

title: Area Construction Manager - Infrastructure
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is seeking a Construction Area Manager (Infrastructure) for our Mining & Minerals project site located near Gogama, Ontario, reporting to the Manager, Construction, the successful candidate will be responsible for the safe and effective completion of various multi-discipline scopes within the project, primarily on the process plant site.  

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Work with the engineering team and provide constructability guidance during the planning phase of the project
  • Construction planning and construction work packaging for scopes of work that fall within the process/infrastructure area of responsibility.  Responsibility to build the plan, communicate planning through to engineering teams, align engineering to support construction schedule and execute in accordance with plan.
  • Responsibilities will include field management of multiple contractors. This will include monitoring of contractor performance insuring compliance with all project objectives - HSSEA, Cost, Schedule, and Quality. 
  • Successful proponent will be required to report against progress of their portion of the overall project schedule.
  • Manage a team of multi-disciplined construction coordinators while managing multiple multi-discipline contractors in order to enable on time completion of their scopes of work
  • Liaise with a team of support service coordinators: cost control, scheduling, contract administrations, HSSE, fielding engineering, materials and quality.
  • Develop team relationships to ensure smooth interaction between parties responsible for work identification, planning & scheduling, resource provision, and execution of work
  • Control nonconforming products, services and their subsequent repair, and re-work until corrective actions have been implemented
  • Ensure compliance with established safety and environmental programs to execute services with zero harm to people, environment, and plant
  • Monitor, participate and lead safety performance of contractors. Implement steps to rectify any trends of deficiencies in performance of the program
  • Participate and assist with overall safety and environmental programs to drive continuous improvement
  • Ensure safety reporting, incidents, and near misses are reported both in a timely and accurate manner in accordance with the standard procedure
  • Maintain a thorough and comprehensive record of actions and events. Document and/or obtain necessary detail to provide a clear understanding of particular occurrences and conditions
  • All other duties as assigned

Skills / Qualifications

  • Minimum of 15 years’ experience in multi-discipline scopes of work in a construction supervisory role specifically on heavy industrial sites
  • Experience in Mining Industry is required (gold mining process facilities)
  • Possess a relevant degree or technical diploma or a combination of equivalent in training and combined experience
  • Excellent communication and personnel management skills; ability to liaise at all levels with the client
  • Proven track record of successful project completion on time and on budget
  • Experience with construction camps, turn-key design/supply/install packages, high voltage power-lines and substations an asset.
  • Accommodation for the site works will be construction camp based.  Applicants need to be familiar with standard camp accommodation and rules.
  • Authorization to lawfully work in Canada without sponsorship from Wood is required

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Construction Manager-Fiber-Manitoba-XP17
description:
Construction Manager,Fibre

As part of the Fibre Construction team, the Construction Manager will be responsible for all physical and contractual aspects of the project related to the design and construction of the physical plant associated with fibre optic and FTTP networks. The Fibre Construction team employs a model whereby internal, or third party, fibre optic network designs are contracted out to external construction teams to build and test. As such, the Construction Project Manager must possess excellent people and communication skills to motivate and maintain effective lines of communication between all stakeholders.
This position reports to the Deployment Manager, Fibre, with various locations required in Manitoba, Ontario, Quebec, and within Atlantic Region.

What you will do (Team responsibilities):
  • Work with Fibre Planners to developpreliminary cost estimates and schedules
  • Assist in Xplornet’s marketing effort where appropriate and as directed by management
  • Assist Project Managers to run competitive RFP processes for the selection of fibre design and construction contractors
  • Assist management in final contract negotiations and in the development of a short list of qualified contractors for future work
  • Assist in negotiations with municipalities and government departments for Municipal Access Agreements and right of way usage
  • Assist in contract negotiations with infrastructure owners (e.g. pole, duct owners) for the use of their infrastructure
  • Conduct contractor safety pre-qualifications as required
  • Gather applicable project safety documentation and certificates of insurance prior to project start
  • Ensure contract, project coding and file structure are ready prior to project start
  • Ensure contractual obligations of the project are understood and met by all parties
  • Plan and organize work to meet project schedule deadlines and financial objectives
  • Manage Request for Information, Change Order Management process and related reporting
  • Develop and implement Inspection and Test Plans (ITP)
  • Review applications for progress payment and approve invoicing in a timely manner
  • Perform field safety audits and quality inspections
  • Assist with the procurement of fibre construction materials
  • Consult with industry peers and stay abreast of new industry technologies and industrystandards

What you need to succeed (Individual competencies):
  • Engineering Degree (electrical or civil), Technologist Diploma (electrical or civil), Journeyman Certificate for Communications Electrician, or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 5 to 7 years of fibre optics construction management experience
  • In-depth knowledge of fibre optic network construction techniques, construction equipment and fibre optic network technologies for use in both outside plant and inside plant applications
  • Experience in the design and construction of FTTx networks
  • Experience managing fixed price, unit price and time and materials contracting models – understanding of advantages / disadvantages of the various models
  • Proven ability to manage relationships with construction contractors, consultants and subcontractors ensuring defined / contracted responsibilities are met
  • Demonstrated ability to implement processes and best practices which improve communication and allow teams to scale
  • Experienced in the implementation of construction standards and auditing contractors in their compliance of those standards
  • Solid understanding of OH&S requirements with demonstrated experience in the development and application of Project Specific Safety Programs (Job Hazard Assessments, Emergency Response Plans, Safe Work Practices)
  • Proven ability to break down barriers and foster collaboration across functions and teams
  • Able to maintain a high level of performance under pressure in a fast-paced changing environment
  • Excellent computer skills, particularly in the use of Google Earth software, CAD software and Microsoft products including Outlook, Word, Excel and Project
  • Willingness to travel

In alignment with the Vaccination Protocol, all new team members are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case by case basis.

title: Senior Superintendent (ICI Construction)
description:
Job Description:

Senior Superintendent - ICI Construction

 

 

As a Superintendent with our busy Buildings Division, you will have the responsibility of overseeing our site staff, field engineering and field teams accountable for the delivery of completed ICI building projects.     Maple Reinders is a growing organization and we are continually winning new work. With that come new experiences and new challenges.

 

At Maple, we look for leaders who can:

  • Direct field operations in the delivery of projects by adhering to schedules, budgets, safety and risk.
  • Effectively manage field employees by providing guidance and leadership on construction activities and developing effective communication between field and other project staff.
  • Develop and execute project work plans aimed at keeping projects on track and on budget.
  • Provide senior level presence in the field, coach field staff on issue resolution, review site labour requirements, mentor field staff and perform succession planning.

 

Our Superintendent will oversee projects that vary in size and scope and the successful candidate should have previous experience in leading construction teams, trades and hourly employees. Many of our projects are located within Southern Ontario; however, work can sometimes take us to other provinces.     We would require the Superintendent to travel or stay close to the site; flexibility is a must. We are also focused on candidates who currently have:

  • Ten or more years experience assisting or supervising construction projects of increasing complexity
  • Post-secondary education, CET or equivalent
  • Proficiency with MS Office and Windows based computer applications (Word, Excel, Outlook and Project)
  • Can manage site operations on complex projects in excess of $40 million

 

The Superintendent is a key member of Maple Reindersâ€™ project team and is critical to the success of each project under their direction.  We want you to succeed and we are prepared to get you there by investing in you. We offer extensive training through our â€œCentre of Learningâ€ to facilitate your career growth through programs such as LEED, Gold Seal and â€œlunch and learnsâ€.

 

If you are a solid construction leader, we want to hear from you. Please provide your project list including the dollar value along with your resume and cover letter.

 

Thank you for your interest in a career with Maple Reinders. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Maple Reinders is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Maple Reinders accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

 

No agency calls please.

 

 

People, Passion, Performance

title: Oracle CX Manager (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada 
All Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Regina; Vancouver; Victoria 

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.
Have many careers in one Firm.

As a part of the Oracle CX/CRM team, you will get to work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective field. Take your team working skills to a higher level by working in a collaborative team analyzing client issues and developing solutions. As a manager, you will bring your leadership skills in training and mentoring staff. Work with your clients and have an advisory function in their daily routines. You will also supervise and mentor junior staff and manage client engagements. And last but not the least, develop a project management mindset by prioritizing objectives, planning and status reporting to your peers and clients on a daily basis. You will also have to travel within Canada and to some U.S. locations to work on client assignments.

What will your typical day look like?

 

A Customer Experience/CRM Manager at Deloitte is expected to contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways, includin

  • Engagement management: Scope and plan engagements; manage engagement economics and risks; manage engagement teams; develop deliverable structure and content; ensure exceptional outcomes are achieved
  • Stakeholder management: Establish and sustain long-term relationships with top decision makers and key clients
  • Practice development and eminence: Create practical solutions and methodologies; develop “thoughtware” and “point of view” documents; support industry and eminence events sponsored by the firm
  • Develop core offering expertise: Leverage expertise in customer, marketing and digital commerce offerings to support sales pursuits and marketplace eminence
  • Sales and business development: Participate in business development activities; manage pursuit teams; support proposal development
  • Talent development: Develop high performing people and teams by coaching junior practitioners; provide input into project staffing; support recruiting activities

About the team

 

Deloitte’s Oracle Customer experience (Oracle CX) team is composed of designers, strategists and engagement SMEs. Together we imagine new futures for our clients using a collection of methods from human-centered design, conceptual design, strategic foresight, as well as customer and innovation strategy. We work across industries to imagine, deliver, and run winning customer experiences, from digital strategy to omnichannel experiences through to loyalty.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

 

Deloitte’s Oracle Customer experience (Oracle CX) team is composed of designers, strategists and engagement SMEs. Together we imagine new futures for our clients using a collection of methods from human-centered design, conceptual design, strategic foresight, as well as customer and innovation strategy. We work across industries to imagine, deliver, and run winning customer experiences, from digital strategy to omnichannel experiences through to loyalty.

Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:

  • You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
  • You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
  • You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.


The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities!  Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates that represents the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes candidates from Indigenous communities in support of living our values and our commitments to our Reconciliation Action Plan . We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

 

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.
