title: Construction Managers
description:
Currently we are looking for Construction Managers Local to the Cold Lake area, for upcoming projects!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us !!!

What We Offer:

  • Employee Benefit Program including medical and dental coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Training and Advancement Opportunities 

What you Bring:

  • Proven experience in leading successful project teams with 10-15 years of previous experience in management role and/or industrial construction or Oil & Gas
  • Successful development and review of project scope, budget, plans and schedules
  • High standards to produce quality products
  • Proven track record in achieving successful project schedule commitments while meeting financial targets
  • Ability to multi-task in high-paced environments
  • Experience responding to changing deadlines/priorities
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong team through collaboration and mentoring
  • Exceptional organizational skills and strong attention to detail
  • Strong commitment to safe work practices; walks the talk everyday
  • Display professionalism at all times 
  • Self motivated with excellent time management and problem-solving skills
  • Capable of handling high stress scenarios
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment
  • Previous Experience: construction manager, construction, manager, construction supervisor, general manager, construction management, construction superintendent, superintendent, supervisor, construction site supervisor

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Drivers License/Clean Abstract
  • Leadership for Excellence Certificate
  • Standard First Aid
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015

*Please note that this advertisement does not reflect a current job vacancy; this posting is intended to fill upcoming competitions for various projects we are about to start work on.

*Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for further consideration; we are not accepting phone inquiries at this time.

See Job Description

title: Project Manager, Hazardous Materials
description:
Your Employer:

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and itâ€™s more than 2,600 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

 

As a Project Manager, Hazardous Materials, you will work in collaboration with the Hygiene Health and Safety Team.

Your Contribution:
  • Apply and promote  Englobeâ€™s  health and safety rules.
  • Coordinating projects in one or more of the following areas.
  • Designated Substances/Hazardous Materials Surveys.
  • Indoor Air Quality Assessments.
  • Hazardous Materials Tendering and Abatement Supervision.
  • Coordinating projects in other areas of Environmental Consulting, as required.
  • Generating and providing technical reviews of deliverable documentation such as technical reports, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Managing and/or generating deliverable documentation of various projects including technical documents.
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures and work plans.
  • Interacting, coordinating, and scheduling projects with clients, as directed by the Team Lead or Director.
  • Participating in project management meetings, office meetings, health, and safety inspections.
  • Maintaining a commitment to exceeding client expectations by consistently delivering high quality of work.
  • Consistently maintaining professionalism and objectivity while working with colleagues and clients who require varying degrees of support.
  • Handling difficult situations with tact and diplomacy to maintain positive working relationships with all internal and external contacts.
  • Conducting project administration tasks as required, including timesheet generation, project finance management and project invoicing.
  • Willingness to travel to remote areas of Northern Ontario
Your Profile:
  • Undergraduate degree and/or applicable (science/engineering) diploma required.
  • Minimum 3-5 years experience in a consulting environment.
  • Experience providing reviews to proposals, specifications, case studies, technical and non-technical reports required.
  • Solid understanding of provincial and federal regulatory requirements acquired through experience and education.
  • Possession of valid driverâ€™s license required.
  • Possession of or eligibility to obtain secret security clearance required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Senior Construction Project Manager : ICI
description:
Are you aSenior Project Manageror an ambitious PM looking for a job with a leading General Contractor in the GTA? Are you interested in working for a company with an excellent reputation for constructing high-end institutional and commercial projects? Do you want to work with a team that supports your continued growth? Then read on…

If you are currently a Project Manager with ground-up institutional projects experience and if you are looking to work for a stable company in a position that will provide you with autonomy and career advancement, then this is the job for you.
As the Senior Project Manager, you will be managing projects from design stages through to finish and close out.With your expertise and professionalism, you will manage project teams, collaborate with consultants and work closely with the executive team towards project success.

What you will get out of it
Our client is an international GC with an excellent reputation for constructing high-end institutional, commercial and retail projects across the GTA and Canada.

You will be competitively compensated with salary and benefits package respectful of your experience. Reporting to the Director of Construction, you willbe visible to the executive team and be able to showcase your talents with the opportunity for continued growth and progression.

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Summer Materials Testing Technician - Calgary
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

 

Wood Resilient Environments (Wood) will be accepting resumes to employ students in the coming 2022 summer and fall months (May to October). These individuals will fill the role of Materials Laboratory and Field Technicians in Calgary, Alberta. This is an excellent opportunity for candidates looking to develop their career and experience in the engineering and construction field.

 

All applicants must have a valid Alberta driverâ€™s license and be required to submit an up-to-date driverâ€™s abstract upon being hired.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

Responsibilities will include conducting various tests on asphalt pavements, concrete, aggregates and various soils in both laboratory and field environment. This position will require working on out of town projects. In addition, the incumbent will:

  • Maintain orderliness of laboratory.
  • Preparation of inspection reports and data entry.
  • Follow Woodâ€™s Project Review, Ethics and Safety Policies.
  • Contrusction monitoring of roads, pads, buildings etc.
  • Field Concrete testing
  • Field Compaction testing
  • Laboratory work  
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Good written and verbal English communication skills
  • Some form of Civil Engineering education, either from a university or technical school
  • Reliable and punctual
  • Willing to do a variety of tasks and able to prioritize
  • CSA Safety boots required
  • Ability to work in the laboratory and office settings
  • Light to moderate lifting may be required
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Superintendent
Real Estate Developer  
Multi-family
Concrete & Woodframe Midrise
Vancouver, BC 

As Site Superintendent you will oversee the entire construction process on site. You will be responsible for creating and monitoring project momentum, scheduling, quality control, safety, and delegating work to the project team and sub-contractors. You are a dynamic leader who can manage people just as effectively as construction activities. You will report directly to the Project Manager/General Superintendent who oversees the performance of all projects.

 
Site Superintendent Duties & Responsibilities:
 
  • Review and maintain documentation and drawings, specifications; complete daily site reports, POs, and project photographs
  • Review and enforce sub-contractor contracts and identify discrepancies in scopes of work.
  • Monitor expenditures effectively, review invoices in detail, and manage labor and material costs according to the project budget and underlying estimate, keep up-to-date and track all changes and ensures implementation
  • Schedule inspections with municipality to meet building code requirements and with suppliers/installers.
  • Supervise and develop site team members through regular feedback, training, and coaching while providing leadership and guidance to the team.
  • Order materials and equipment and request sufficient manpower throughout the project to maintain schedule and productivity.
  • Strategically and proactively plan and implement project work plan and manpower levels while anticipating issues before they arise to resolve them in a timely and efficient manner. Schedule manpower to ensure safety, quality, cost and project milestones are met.
  • Prepare and maintain project construction schedule in detail.
  • Promote a safe and healthy work environment for all personnel on site, monitor safety performance, and oversee the Construction Safety Officer; Occupational First Aid Level 1 or higher certificate is an asset.
  • Adhere to Cascadia’s quality standards, monitor the performance of sub-contractors, and implement techniques to ensure quality issues are addressed proactively.
  • Long hours and/or weekend work may be required at times to maintain project schedule

 
Site Superintendent Qualifications: 
 
  • Minimum of 10 years of construction supervision experience, preferably with a general contractor; some experience in concrete multi-family building required
  • Trade background with progressive experience in general contracting
  • Demonstrated competence in the areas of safety, people management, project execution, cost control, quality, and administration.
  • Must have a valid Class 5 BC Driver's License
  • Excellent command of the English language, both written and verbal with the ability to interpret needs and express ideas clearly
  • Organized, multitasker with the ability to set and manage priorities
  • Exceptional time management skills
  • Willing to travel to different jobsites
  • Demonstrated ability to handle pressure situations in a professional manner
  • Problem-solving and analytical skills with the demonstrated ability to work under pressure in professional manner

Site Superintendent Salary:
Competitive Salary, Extended Benefits, Growth Opportunities

Site Superintendent Similar Job Titles:
Site Super
General Superintendent
Construction Manager
Superintendent

Interested?
Apply below
 
Only applicants with the legal right to work in Canada can be considered for this opportunity.
We thank all those who express interest in this opportunity however only those short-listed we be contacted.
 


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Project Controls Manager
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

 

Wood is seeking a highly motivated Project Controls Manager to join our project controls team in Ontario, Canada. We are looking for highly self-motivated candidates with strong Project Controls credentials and a passion for client service, and who enjoy working as part of a high energy team on cutting-edge programs supporting a wide range of engineering, design, and construction projects for our clients.

 

Please note this role may be based in various locations throughout Ontario, with travel to the project sites in Port Hope and Eastern Ontario as required.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • A working Manager capable of leading a project team of Project Controls professionals in project planning, scheduling, cost tracking, performance measurement, risk management, and reporting
  • Develop WBS and project cost coding structures
  • Proficiency in utilizing industry â€œbest in classâ€ project management systems and tools to update and manage project budgets, commitments, expenditures, and forecasts
  • Develop and maintain cost loaded or resource loaded schedules using critical path methodology
  • Conduct project performance analysis using industry standard earned value management processes and techniques
  • Support project controls reporting requirements for weekly and monthly status reporting
  • Maintain project budgets and forecast spending plans
  • Prepare labor and subcontractor commitment analysis reports
  • Prepare program and project cash flow analysis
  • Provide support for proposals and project change requests to include schedule development, estimate development, pricing proposals, and client negotiations
  • Administrative and document control support for project related documents  
Skills / Qualifications:

 

Required

  • 10+ years of project controls/cost-schedule experience
  • Advanced proficiency with Primavera P6
  • Proficiency with the Microsoft Office software suite of applications
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Demonstrated proficiency in meeting detailed deliverables with a high level of accuracy
  • Adaptability and willingness to adjust to internal and external client needs
  • Flexibility to work outside of normal business hours if required
  • Must be willing to travel when required to support critical project needs

Preferred

  • BS in Engineering, Construction Management, or other related field
  • Construction/field experience a plus
  • Proficiency in use of Ares Prism Cost Management to include schedule integration and change management desired
  • Formal professional certification (PMI, AACE, etc.) a plus
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a Project Controls team
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Wireless Construction Project Manager-Er-1203
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

Construction Manager is responsible for field supervision and quality control for coordination of new site construction as well as augmentation swaps. The candidate works directly with subcontractors to facilitate installation of provided equipment. The candidate is responsible for coordination and order of landlord and access as well as engineering. The candidate is responsible for overall installation of all construction work required for the site to be on air as planned. The candidate is also responsible to ensure quality control measures are followed and site is completed per design standards and consequently a background in civil engineering is required. Bachelors Degree or equivalent may be required. At least 3 years related work experience required. 

Job Requirements 

Responsibilities: For augmentation builds, audit existing installation and complete gap analysis. For both augmentation and new site builds, work with sub contractors, real estate, landlords, equipment manufacturers, RF Team etc to over see the efficient and timely installation of necessary equipment. Problem solve any installation issues. Resource needs to have mechanical aptitude, self-motivation, and be a self-starter. 

Experience: 
- Site and Telco installation
- Civil Engineering 
- Wireless carrier new build and capital 
- Managing outside contractors and internal processes thru construction and integration. 
- Working knowledge of reviewing and validating BOM (Bill of Materials) and working within internal systems for ordering and procuring materials on a site by site basis. 
- Proficiency with Microsoft Office and database applications. 

Benefit:
Comprehensive medial Insurance 
Annual and Casual leave
TA-DA

title: Site Superintendent : ICI New Build
description:
Are you a SeniorSite Superintendentor ambitiousSite Superlooking for a career witha successful ICI General Contractor? Are you interested in working for a company with an excellent reputation for working on large institutional projects? Would you like to work with a company that understand if you're successful their successful? Then read on…

This is a new role developed out of growth. The company has been awarded several large client contracts in the institutional sector - a ton of upcoming projects! With your previous educational new build site super experience and eye for detail you will excel in this senior level role.

What you will get out of it
Our client is a leading ICI general contractor with an excellent reputation for constructing impressive institutional projects in Ontario. You will be compensated competitively with a salary and benefits package respectful of your experience. You will be visible to the executive team and be able to showcase your expertise.

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Summer Materials Testing Technician - Calgary
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

 

Wood Resilient Environments (Wood) will be accepting resumes to employ students in the coming 2022 summer and fall months (May to October). These individuals will fill the role of Materials Laboratory and Field Technicians in Calgary, Alberta. This is an excellent opportunity for candidates looking to develop their career and experience in the engineering and construction field.

 

All applicants must have a valid Alberta driver’s license and be required to submit an up-to-date driver’s abstract upon being hired.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

Responsibilities will include conducting various tests on asphalt pavements, concrete, aggregates and various soils in both laboratory and field environment. This position will require working on out of town projects. In addition, the incumbent will:

  • Maintain orderliness of laboratory.
  • Preparation of inspection reports and data entry.
  • Follow Wood’s Project Review, Ethics and Safety Policies.
  • Contrusction monitoring of roads, pads, buildings etc.
  • Field Concrete testing
  • Field Compaction testing
  • Laboratory work 

Skills / Qualifications

  • Good written and verbal English communication skills
  • Some form of Civil Engineering education, either from a university or technical school
  • Reliable and punctual
  • Willing to do a variety of tasks and able to prioritize
  • CSA Safety boots required
  • Ability to work in the laboratory and office settings
  • Light to moderate lifting may be required

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Superintendent
Real Estate Developer
Multi-family
Concrete & Woodframe Midrise
Vancouver, BC

As Site Superintendent you will oversee the entire construction process on site. You will be responsible for creating and monitoring project momentum, scheduling, quality control, safety, and delegating work to the project team and sub-contractors. You are a dynamic leader who can manage people just as effectively as construction activities. You will report directly to the Project Manager/General Superintendent who oversees the performance of all projects.


Site SuperintendentDuties & Responsibilities:
  • Review and maintain documentation and drawings, specifications; complete daily site reports, POs, and project photographs
  • Review and enforce sub-contractor contracts and identify discrepancies in scopes of work.
  • Monitor expenditures effectively, review invoices in detail, and manage labor and material costs according to the project budget and underlying estimate, keep up-to-date and track all changes and ensures implementation
  • Schedule inspections with municipality to meet building code requirements and with suppliers/installers.
  • Supervise and develop site team members through regular feedback, training, and coaching while providing leadership and guidance to the team.
  • Order materials and equipment and request sufficient manpower throughout the project to maintain schedule and productivity.
  • Strategically and proactively plan and implement project work plan and manpower levels while anticipating issues before they arise to resolve them in a timely and efficient manner. Schedule manpower to ensure safety, quality, cost and project milestones are met.
  • Prepare and maintain project construction schedule in detail.
  • Promote a safe and healthy work environment for all personnel on site, monitor safety performance, and oversee the Construction Safety Officer; Occupational First Aid Level 1 or higher certificate is an asset.
  • Adhere to Cascadia’s quality standards, monitor the performance of sub-contractors, and implement techniques to ensure quality issues are addressed proactively.
  • Long hours and/or weekend work may be required at times to maintain project schedule


Site SuperintendentQualifications:
  • Minimum of 10 years of construction supervision experience, preferably with a general contractor; some experience in concrete multi-family building required
  • Trade background with progressive experience in general contracting
  • Demonstrated competence in the areas of safety, people management, project execution, cost control, quality, and administration.
  • Must have a valid Class 5 BC Driver's License
  • Excellent command of the English language, both written and verbal with the ability to interpret needs and express ideas clearly
  • Organized, multitasker with the ability to set and manage priorities
  • Exceptional time management skills
  • Willing to travel to different jobsites
  • Demonstrated ability to handle pressure situations in a professional manner
  • Problem-solving and analytical skills with the demonstrated ability to work under pressure in professional manner

Site SuperintendentSalary:
Competitive Salary, Extended Benefits, Growth Opportunities

Site Superintendent Similar Job Titles:
Site Super
General Superintendent
Construction Manager
Superintendent

Interested?
Apply below

Only applicants with the legal right to work in Canada can be considered for this opportunity.
We thank all those who express interest in this opportunity however only those short-listed we be contacted.

title: Project Controls Manager
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

 

Wood is seeking a highly motivated Project Controls Manager to join our project controls team in Ontario, Canada. We are looking for highly self-motivated candidates with strong Project Controls credentials and a passion for client service, and who enjoy working as part of a high energy team on cutting-edge programs supporting a wide range of engineering, design, and construction projects for our clients.

 

Please note this role may be based in various locations throughout Ontario, with travel to the project sites in Port Hope and Eastern Ontario as required.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • A working Manager capable of leading a project team of Project Controls professionals in project planning, scheduling, cost tracking, performance measurement, risk management, and reporting
  • Develop WBS and project cost coding structures
  • Proficiency in utilizing industry “best in class” project management systems and tools to update and manage project budgets, commitments, expenditures, and forecasts
  • Develop and maintain cost loaded or resource loaded schedules using critical path methodology
  • Conduct project performance analysis using industry standard earned value management processes and techniques
  • Support project controls reporting requirements for weekly and monthly status reporting
  • Maintain project budgets and forecast spending plans
  • Prepare labor and subcontractor commitment analysis reports
  • Prepare program and project cash flow analysis
  • Provide support for proposals and project change requests to include schedule development, estimate development, pricing proposals, and client negotiations
  • Administrative and document control support for project related documents 

Skills / Qualifications

 

Required

  • 10+ years of project controls/cost-schedule experience
  • Advanced proficiency with Primavera P6
  • Proficiency with the Microsoft Office software suite of applications
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Demonstrated proficiency in meeting detailed deliverables with a high level of accuracy
  • Adaptability and willingness to adjust to internal and external client needs
  • Flexibility to work outside of normal business hours if required
  • Must be willing to travel when required to support critical project needs

Preferred

  • BS in Engineering, Construction Management, or other related field
  • Construction/field experience a plus
  • Proficiency in use of Ares Prism Cost Management to include schedule integration and change management desired
  • Formal professional certification (PMI, AACE, etc.) a plus
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a Project Controls team

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Vice President of Construction
description:
Vice President- Construction - Muskoka District
Are you looking for a job that allows you to leverage your skills in residential custom home and cottage building, project management and mentorship? Are you passionate about highly customised unique and traditional building and looking to find a job as Vice President of Constructionwithin the industry? Do you want a job that allows you to work autonomously within a small, energetic and innovative team? If so, then you need to apply today!

Responsibilities
In this job you will be able to use your 15 plus years of experience in residential home and cottage construction, to work with a well renowned, stable and established firm with ambitious growth plans who are based in Muskoka District. This role you will lead , manage and oversee all construction activities. Handling tasks involving the entire project delivery operation, cost controlling, timelines, budgeting, leadership and technical know-how from conception to completion.

Working from the head office in Muskoka district, you will be able to use your knowledge and expertise to manage day-to-dayoperations of all new builds, technical advisory projects and on-site progress meetings.

If you are an accomplished construction leader , with exceptional financial business acumen along with being a positive and inspirational leader then we want to hear from you.

What's in in for you
  • This is an exceptional opportunity to take on a highly visible and critical role in the company, the success you achieve will have a real effect on the growth and long term success of the division and ultimately you career.
  • You will be working on extremely high end, high quality products & can be very proud to be the expert in the field you will be in.
  • Working in "cottage country" has immediate advantages, the pace of life and the work culture.
  • Salary will be respectful of your experience along with a strong annual bonus and benefits program for medical and dental, RRSP matching program, 4 weeks vacation.

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Construction Manager
description:
As an integrated single source construction, maintenance, and fabrication constructor, Phoenix Industrial is able to provide a large variety of services to industries throughout Western Canada. We are committed to providing Visibility, Value and Accountability to our clients through every project we are involved in works with clients to develop cost-effective processes and procedures to meet the multiple demands of industrial projects. Our management teams work with leading-edge software, planning and scheduling techniques along with risk management practices to increase certainty and drive out costs. With a wide range of services from project planning to commissioning and eventually maintenance, Phoenix Industrial delivers successful projects no matter the size or scale. From partial scopes to entire plants, we are the clear choice for all of your project needs. 

Phoenix Industrial requires Construction Managers with previous industrial construction experience for multiple projects for current and upcoming projects across Western Canada!

The Construction Manager is responsible for assisting all trades with various jobs and engaging in various physical tasks.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan, control and manage construction projects from planning to project execution, ensuring success through continued and future relationships with clients
  • Ensure budgetary constraints and project timelines are met or exceeded, and profitability.
  • Prepare and submit budget estimations
  • Ensure the utilization and compliance of corporate policies and procedures to establish project goals and objectives
  • Ensuring the business need is valid and correctly prioritised; Keeps project aligned with organizations strategy and portfolio direction
  • Ensuring the project remains a viable business proposition
  • Ensure the project is properly launched
  • Act as liaison between the client and company ownership
  • Respond to Corporate departments, including but not limited to, Safety, Finance, Quality Control, Human Resources and Ownership
  • Monitor site safety to ensure that all personnel are complying with established safety standards at all times.
  • Securing project resources
  • Ensuring the budget is on time, budget and scope
  • Approving key project deliverables
  • Determine manpower requirements and produce manpower forecasts
  • Control labour, material and equipment costs; Recommends opportunities to optimize costs and benefits
  • Communicates business issues and providing feedback on status reports and ensuring they reach the necessary stakeholders
  • Resolving issues, conflicts and removing obstacles to progress
  • Effectively communicate all issues and concerns to the relevant stakeholder groups
  • Act as a mentor and role model at all times through exemplary professional conduct
  • Manage all Phoenix personnel including employees, subcontractors and third party subcontractors
  • Lead by example by demonstrating the importance of fostering a safety culture

Requirements:

  • 3 - 5 years of previous Construction Management experience in industrial construction or Oil & Gas
  • Must be willing to submit to a pre-employment drug & alcohol test

Thank you to all those who apply, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. We are not accepting third party recruitment at this time.

See Job Description

Wood is recruiting for Materials Laboratory and Field Technicians within our Resilient Environments group for the 2022 summer and fall months (May to October 2022) based out of our Lloydminster / Bonnyville, Alberta.  This is an excellent opportunity for candidates looking to develop their career and experience in the engineering and construction field.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
OUR CLIENT

For 50 years, Our client has made its mark in the homebuilding industry with our own brand of design-forward developments. From our inception as a master builder of one-of-a-kind estate homes, our client has developed and delivered a broad portfolio of quality single-family homes, master-planned communities, classic and contemporary townhomes, boutique condos and luxury rental residences. Along the way we have earned our reputation as an award-winning, trusted brand and a sought-after home builder across Southern Ontario.

ABOUT THE JOB
The primary purpose of the role is to oversee construction field work on a Low-Rise Residential site by managing site activities. The position acts as the main interface with trades and sub-contractors and ensures that all lots are constructed in accordance with design, budget, schedule, attention to detail so as to maintain the Company’s quality standards and expectations

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Utilizes technical expertise to provide direction to site staff.

  • Take a lead role in executing the project management team’s schedules, permits, contracts/scopes of work, and communicates with the team on a daily basis with progress updates or status reports as required.

  • Manages, plans and schedules to meet deliverables and regularly review progress, ensuring houses are completed on time and on budget.

  • Oversees the performance of trades with close attention to detail and trade quality of work and ensures the accurate completion of Purchaser extras and or custom changes.

  • Oversees the close-out phase of projects, by reducing deficiencies to avoid unnecessary PDI issues after occupancy, and a smooth transition to Customer Care.

  • Oversees and provides direction to staff regarding the final stage of curb and side walk coordination, driveway and sod installation.

  • Works closely with the Customer Care department to ensure that the standards of customer care are met, and company policies are followed.

  • Adheres to, implements and enforces the Company’s Health & Safety Policies and Procedures and advises Senior Management of any unsafe conditions or practices.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 10+ years of relevant, progressive experience in the low-rise, residential building industry

  • Solid hands-on rough stage experience

  • Experience with stacked and mid-rise product is a must

  • Underground garage experience considered a valuable asset

  • Proficiency with MS Office, including Excel, Word and Outlook

  • Strong communication and reporting skills

  • Ability to contribute in a fast-paced, deadline-driven team atmosphere

  • Strong working knowledge of the Occupational Health & Safety Act and Regulations for Construction Projects (Ontario) and Tarion Rules and Regulations.

APPLY
Compensation is between $100K-$140K depending on the candidate's experience.

title: Construction Field Coordinator
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is seeking a Field Construction Coordinator for our Mining & Minerals gold mine construction project site located near Gogama, Ontario. Reporting to the Manager, Construction, the successful candidate will provide guidance and technical support to contractors and / or advise, monitor and supervise work in all phases within assigned area and discipline.

 

If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges within a fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.   This position is camp based, with a rotation of 14 days on, 14 days off (12 hours per day).

 

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Decide if queries from contractors require referral to engineering or if they can be resolved at site
  • Resolve field issues not requiring referral to engineering
  • Plan and supervise site survey control, including initial layouts and spot checks of construction
  • Review JHA's and FLRA's prior to work commencing on a daily basis
  • Plan and supervise all site QA/QC programs including material testing
  • Assist the contractors with clarification, interpretation, interference resolution and QA/QC related matters
  • Ensure instructions, drawings and specifications for scope changes are issued in a timely manner
  • Assist in the management of the site safety program
  • Maintain a safe working environment and comply with all environmental, health and safety policies
  • Work with contractors to ensure project safety, quality, schedule and cost objectives are achieved
  • Ensure construction conforms to the drawings and specifications and that consistent construction practices are followed in assigned areas and disciplines
  • Assist the project team with reviews and estimates for contract extras and monitor the actual daily costs submitted by the contractors
  • Monitor the three week look-ahead schedules submitted by the contractors and report deviations and activities not being met by the contractors to the construction manager
  • Notify engineering in advance of any changes in the program or shortfalls in documentation and materials that could have an impact on the construction progress
  • Submit daily progress reports to the site construction office outlining items of concern such as safety observations/directions, non-conformance with the specifications and drawings, equipment and weather delays, site cleanup, congestions, infrastructure, workmanship, quality control and potential contract extras
  • Update the site-wide deficiency lists to be issued at weekly construction meetings
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Extensive experience at the site supervisory level with on the job responsibility for directing work crews
  • 5 7 years of overseeing contractors on large mining projects
  • Authorization to lawfully work in Canada without sponsorship from Wood is required
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Director of Construction
description:
Are you a Senior Project Manager looking for the next stepupin your career with leading Asset Management firm. Our client is looking for a Director of Construction to manage their in-house development and construction arm fortheir "new developments" division. Are you interested in working for a company with an excellent reputation? Would you like to work on high profile projects and high-rise residential and mixed use projects? Then read the details below and apply today!

Responsibilities
If you are currently a Senior Project Manager with at least 10 years of experience in high-rise projects, have experience building and leading a construction team and looking for autonomy and career advancement, then this is the opportunity you've been waiting for!

Our client is looking for a Director of Construction that's a respectable, confident and knowledgeable leader with a well versed in High-rise condominium construction in theGTAand is capable of managing the construction division in its entirety. If you have exceptional business acumenand deliver meetings to multiple stakeholders, then you will be very successful in this job.

What you will get out of it
Our is a successful brand with leadingdevelopmentsin Ontario. They have an excellent reputation for constructing high profile condominium projects across theGTAand other related projects. Theyare looking to hire an experienced Project Management expert in Design and Construction to be the Director of Construction, representing the owner from design stages through to finish and close out.

You would be compensated well with a salary and benefits package respectful of your experience and market value. You would report directly to the Executive team and you willbe visible and able to showcase your talents directly with the owner.

Please apply withyour resume and project list.

We thank all applicants in advance and only qualified applicants will be contacted.

  • Construction monitoring of roads, pads, buildings etc.
  • Field Concrete testing
  • Field Compaction testing
  • Laboratory work 

Skills / Qualifications

  • Enrolment in an accredited Civil Engineering Technology Diploma program
  • Ability to understand and resolve soil, granular and asphalt problems while on construction sites
  • Able to read drawings and specifications
  • Ability to exercise diplomacy and tact when interacting with fellow staff, clients, consultants and contractors
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Reliable and punctual
  • Willing to do a variety of tasks and able to prioritize
  • CSA Safety boots required
  • Ability to work in the laboratory and office settings
  • Must be able to lift up to 40 lbs., be capable of moderate lifting as required
  • Ability to travel for out of town work as required
  • An unrestricted Class 5 driver’s license valid in the province of Alberta is required for this role 
  • A clean driver’s abstract is required for this role.  Successful candidates will need to submit an up-to-date driver’s abstract before hiring is finalized.

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Our client is a young, dynamic, and rapidly growing construction and development company, based in Markham, Ontario, creating leading edge, unique lifestyles in residential and condominium developments. They are looking to augment their team with highly motivated individuals striving for a career development opportunity, one where they are valued, can make an impact and contribute to the growth and success of themselves and our company. This is a ground floor opportunity for the right candidate who wants to move to the next level in their career.

They are searching for an experienced Construction Site Supervisor to join our team in Bracebridge, Ontario. The successful candidate will have previous experience in assisting Project Managers and will perform coordinating, estimating and management tasks under the direction of the Project Manager. For more information on this 10-year project you can check out our website, uppervistamuskoka.com

The Construction Site Supervisor will provide on-site field supervision and administrative management for all construction operations, including direct supervision of on-site employees, subcontractors, and other construction-related personnel. The site superintendent is responsible for directing and executing work according to the project plan, executing work on time, maintaining a safe workplace, and promoting and enhancing the company image. Site Supervisors will be 'hands on' when required

Qualifications are as follows:
  • Minimum of five (5) years' experience in a construction site supervisor position within the midrise/low rise residential building industry
  • Understanding of architectural drawings and building codes
  • Able to deal with inspectors and Ministry of Labour
  • Able to help find, train and supervise staff and allocate responsibilities
  • Able to resolve issues on-site with strong leadership skills
  • Working relationships and knowledge of material suppliers within Muskoka and Southern Ontario
  • Able to estimate labour and material requirements  
  • Able to monitor trade performance and recommend measures to improve productivity and quality
  • Able to manage changes to schedule and cost effectively and report on same
  • Able to ensure adherence with health and safety standards and report any issues
  • Able to estimate and take off quantities from drawings
  • Able to understand trade and project schedules
  • Able to order materials to conform to project schedule
  • Able to manage changes to schedule and cost effectively, and report on same
  • Strong communication skills, knowledge of MS office, ability to prepare project documentation, agendas, meeting minutes and reports
  • Familiarity with construction management and estimating software, working knowledge and experience with Procore software a definite asset
  • Self-motivated with organizational, time management and problem solving skills
Valid drivers license
Full-time, Permanent, 8 hour shift Monday to Friday, Overtime and weekends may be required

 


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Construction Field Coordinator
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is seeking a Field Construction Coordinator for our Mining & Minerals gold mine construction project site located near Gogama, Ontario. Reporting to the Manager, Construction, the successful candidate will provide guidance and technical support to contractors and / or advise, monitor and supervise work in all phases within assigned area and discipline.

 

If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges within a fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.  This position is camp based, with a rotation of 14 days on, 14 days off (12 hours per day).

 

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Decide if queries from contractors require referral to engineering or if they can be resolved at site
  • Resolve field issues not requiring referral to engineering
  • Plan and supervise site survey control, including initial layouts and spot checks of construction
  • Review JHA's and FLRA's prior to work commencing on a daily basis
  • Plan and supervise all site QA/QC programs including material testing
  • Assist the contractors with clarification, interpretation, interference resolution and QA/QC related matters
  • Ensure instructions, drawings and specifications for scope changes are issued in a timely manner
  • Assist in the management of the site safety program
  • Maintain a safe working environment and comply with all environmental, health and safety policies
  • Work with contractors to ensure project safety, quality, schedule and cost objectives are achieved
  • Ensure construction conforms to the drawings and specifications and that consistent construction practices are followed in assigned areas and disciplines
  • Assist the project team with reviews and estimates for contract extras and monitor the actual daily costs submitted by the contractors
  • Monitor the three week look-ahead schedules submitted by the contractors and report deviations and activities not being met by the contractors to the construction manager
  • Notify engineering in advance of any changes in the program or shortfalls in documentation and materials that could have an impact on the construction progress
  • Submit daily progress reports to the site construction office outlining items of concern such as safety observations/directions, non-conformance with the specifications and drawings, equipment and weather delays, site cleanup, congestions, infrastructure, workmanship, quality control and potential contract extras
  • Update the site-wide deficiency lists to be issued at weekly construction meetings

Skills / Qualifications

  • Extensive experience at the site supervisory level with on the job responsibility for directing work crews
  • 5 7 years of overseeing contractors on large mining projects
  • Authorization to lawfully work in Canada without sponsorship from Wood is required

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Director of Construction : High-rise
description:
Are you a Senior Project Manager looking for the next step in your career? Would you enjoy working with a leading developer in theGTA with an excellent reputation for developing and building innovative and sustainable high-rise communities? Would you like to work on high profile and award-winning projects? Then read on…

As the Director of Construction, you will manage multiple full-cycle high-rise community projects while driving and motivating your team to success. Collaborating closely with the VP, Construction and the projects and site teams from pre-construction to completion.

If you are a confident and knowledgeable leader, well versed in High-rise condominium construction in theGTAandknow you are capable of managing multiple complex high-rise projects; have exceptional business acumen, then you will be very successful in this role.

What you will get out of it
Our client is a leading developer with an excellent reputation for constructing high profile condominium projects across theGTAand other related projects. Theyare looking to hire an experienced Senior Project Manager to be the Director of Construction, representing the owner from pre-construction to close-out.

You would be compensated well with a salary and benefits package respectful of your experience. You would report directly to the VP, Construction and you willbe visible and able to showcase your talents directly with the President. In this merit focused company, your successes will be celebrated and rewarded both monetarily and with future progression.

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.
We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Intermediate Materials Testing Technician
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Our team of professionals offers a full range of services to clients in a wide range of sectors including government, industrial & commercial, water, transportation, minerals & metals, oil & gas and clean energy. 

 

We are currently seeking an Intermediate Materials Testing Technician to join our Environment & Infrastructure Solutions group in Winnipeg, MB. Applicants must be willing to work flexible hours.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Prioritize work in a team environment
  • Responsible for providing client service
  • Assist in business development
  • Train and supervise junior staff
  • Provide quality control and quality assurance on a variety of laboratory and field projects including but not limited to:
    • Concrete Field and Laboratory Testing
    • Aggregate Field and Laboratory Testing
    • Foundation Installation Monitoring
    • Earthworks Construction Monitoring
    • Preparation of Field Reports
    • Out of town work should be anticipated, and typically based on a rotation bases.

Skills / Qualifications

  • Completion of a Geological, Construction or Civil Engineering Technology program
  • Ideal candidates will have 3-5 years of related materials testing experience including aggregate, concrete, and asphalt, but applicants with less experience will be considered
  • Preference will be given to individuals with foundation installation monitoring experience
  • Knowledge of CSA, ASTM, and Provincial Test Methods an asset
  • Detail oriented, organized, team player and self-motivated
  • Must be well organized and have the ability to manage and prioritize several tasks at one time and ensure commitment to service and technical excellence
  • Willingness and ability to work outdoors for long days in rough terrain, harsh elements
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Must be able to lift independently up to a maximum of 50 lbs. 
  • Flexible to work overtime as required 
  • Must have & wear CSA Safety boots while in the field
  • Must have an unrestricted Class 5 Driver’s License valid in the province of Manitoba with a clean driver’s abstract 

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Construction Manager - Remediation
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is seeking a strong Construction Manager, with leadership capabilities, for a greenfield construction project in Eastern Ontario.

 

This is a strategic role. Reporting to the Project Manager at site, the successful candidate will form part of the project leadership team, will have responsibility for planning and management of construction execution activities, and the oversight of superintendents and sub-contractors.  The candidate will ensure the construction is executed in compliance with the contract, scope and requirements, and performed to the highest standards of safety and quality.

 

Wood’s Remediation business is thriving and growing; we have a solid backlog of projects, and a number of large scale recent wins. If you have a successful track record as a “hands-on” Construction Manager, on large-scale construction projects (Construction remediation is an asset), and you thrive on challenges in a fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

We offer a comprehensive Benefits Package (Medical, Dental, Insurance), Health Care spending account, Paid time off, and a 100% vested RRSP matching program.

 

Come join the winning team!

 

Key Responsibilities:

 

  • Develops the construction sequencing and execution plan, including early site mobilization logistics.
  • Develops construction work breakdown structure work packages and provides input to Procurement and Contracting Work Packages
  • Primary contributor towards the development and maintenance of the construction schedule, in conjunction with Project Management and Project Controls
  • Manages and mentors Senior Site Superintendents and Functional leads including Health and Safety and Environmental Protection on day-to-day responsibilities
  • Oversees recruitment and performance of Wood’s construction personnel, heavy equipment operators and field labor
  • Enforces Safety, Health, Environment, and Security requirements with all Construction Sub-Contractors and Supply Chain Vendors
  • Ensures strong interaction and collaboration between construction disciplines, including civil, structural, electrical, mechanical subcontractors and interfacing work packages. Ensures construction work is properly delineated, assigned, and supervised.
  • Leads clarification, interpretation, interference resolution and quality matters
  • Primary reviewer/contributor towards engineering designs and field changes. Leads constructability reviews and provides constructability input throughout the project life cycle.
  • Creates, reviews, and responds to construction requests for information (RFIs)
  • Effectively communicates with internal Wood project personnel, client representatives, stakeholders and sub-contractors on all aspects of the work
  • Monitors the construction execution to ensure that work flows smoothly and is delivered to customer’s expectations
  • Proactively ensures construction performance measures are being monitored and achieved.
  • Contributes towards project status reports outlining items of concern such as look-ahead, safety observations, non-conformances to drawings and specifications, risks, delays, quality control and potential field changes.
  • Mentor Superintendents, ensuring oversight of decisions, driving innovative thinking and efficiencies on the job
  • Monitor field staff and sub-contractor performance and expenditures

Skills / Qualifications

  • Minimum 15-20 years of experience in construction management within a civil construction or heavy industrial project environment
  • Must have at least 10 years increasing responsibility as a construction manager along with a focus on heavy civil construction; the last 5 years must have been on large scale projects in Canada
  • Will have large scale ($100-$250 Mn) project experience
  • Engineering technologist diploma or, a graduate degree in related field is considered an asset
  • Intimate knowledge of construction legislation, standards, and guidelines in Ontario
  • Proficient computer skills
  • Experience in a highly regulated nuclear environment (or equivalent) would be an asset
  • Remediation background is an asset
  • Demonstrated leadership capabilities
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Demonstrated commitment to Health and Safety
  • Strong ability to interpret and analyze detailed design drawings and specifications
  • Willingness to travel
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship

We encourage all qualified applicants including Indigenous peoples, women, peoples with disabilities, and visible minorities to consider this opportunity.

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Assistant Project Manager : High-rise
description:
Are you an ambitious Assistant Project Manager looking to work on theowner's side? Are you excited by constructing and managingaward winning,sustainablehigh-rise projects? Are you looking for a company that is growing and offers fast-track progression andcareer advancement? Then read on…

An award-winning high-rise developer is in search of an experienced Assistant Project Manager with full-cycle high-rise experience to join their growing team. With your previous high-rise project management experience, you will have take ownership of running your own project, collaborating closely with the VP, and site team. The company heavily supports and invests in their staff, so "fit" is key. If you are upbeat, ambitious, can take lead, but also work closely and be supportive of your teammates, then this could be the right company for you. This is a growth role, so there is expected progression and aVP in place that will nurture and support your advancement.

What you get out of it?
Competitive compensation package reflective of your experience. Executive visibility to showcase your expertise with rewarded progression opportunities. The opportunity to work on leading and award winning high-rise projects in the GTA.

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Superintendent  
Ottawa, ON
Construction / Building Materials 
$100-120K     depending on experience 
Bonus, Vacation, benefits, Car Allowance 

If you are a leader and have experience coaching, leading and mentoring people, continue reading. We are looking for leaders. 

Year Over Year multi award winning company. (Amazing company to work for) 
Very Attractive Base Salary + Bonus + Benefits + Vacation + RRSP matching + Car allowance.

This fantastic opportunity offers; Internal growth, positive environment.
Good leaders looking for good leaders. We are looking for candidates who have developed the leadership skills and can provide examples of this
6-10 years experience

Our client:
Are among the largest in their field and have an extremely strong and reputable history. They are a dominant player and have managed to surpass challenges and be the leader in their industry. 
With decades of experience our history of operations has grown internationally.
Responsibilities
  • Adhere to Construction Processes, in accordance with Policy and Procedures.
  • Accountable for managing the construction of assigned homes from carpentry to 30-day warranty service request signoff. 
  • Monitors all daily trade functions:  timeliness, quality of workmanship and completion of work.  
  • Walks all homes on a daily basis to ensure imperfections are noted, Building Code is adhered to, and Homebuyers Options and Extras are complied with.  Adheres to procedures as required by the trade Scopes of Work and company standards and takes corrective action as necessary.
  • Conducts a detailed frame check on each unit prior to drywall, in accordance with company Policy and Procedures, and follows up to ensure the timely completion of any items noted.
  • Schedules and conducts homeowner frame walk.
  • Responsible for supervising on-site construction staff, including the scheduling of subcontractors, inspectors and suppliers on the job.
  • Resolves day-to-day problems on the job site, inspecting all work during construction to ensure compliance with plans and specifications, and resolving construction problems.
  • Approves subcontractor invoice for quality and quantity before issuing Completion Slip.
  • Assists in ordering all materials required to construct houses.
  • Continuously trains and mentors staff.
  • Reinforces and educates the importance of schedule adherence (and assists where trade availability is causing difficulty), unwavering focus on company mission, and safety and quality standards.
  • Communicates and coordinates activities with other staff (Site and Head Office) to ensure smooth production operation.
  • Schedules and attends all necessary municipal inspections.  Assists Inspectors with the completion of the review, and rectifies issues as required.
  • Responsible for managing to the Production Schedule and updating it no less than weekly.  Adds comments regarding site changes and improvements as necessary and communicates to Senior Builder.
  • Ensures all work is being done in a safe manner and enforces safety standards and laws within positions scope of authority. 
  • Ensures homes are as clean and aesthetically appealing as possible while under construction.
 
What You Bring
 
  • A minimum of 4 years residential construction management experience in the new home industry.
  • Post-secondary education/community college in a related field (e.g. Construction Engineering Technology)
  • Extensive knowledge of Ontario Building Code, Occupational Health and Safety Act, and other health and safety regulations.
  • Clear understanding of contracts, plans, and specifications, as well as construction methods, materials and regulations. Includes knowledge of all trades, staff responsibilities, scheduling and scopes of work.
  • Flexible, with the ability to work at locations across the Ottawa Area.
  • Excellent Customer Service skills.
  • Strong organizational skills, including the tracking and control of costs and budgets.
  • Must be detailed and thorough.
  • Ability to train and mentor staff through advanced leadership skills with the ability to delegate as required.

title: Construction Manager - Remediation
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is seeking a strong Construction Manager, with leadership capabilities, for a greenfield construction project in Eastern Ontario.

 

This is a strategic role. Reporting to the Project Manager at site, the successful candidate will form part of the project leadership team, will have responsibility for planning and management of construction execution activities, and the oversight of superintendents and sub-contractors.   The candidate will ensure the construction is executed in compliance with the contract, scope and requirements, and performed to the highest standards of safety and quality.

 

Woodâ€™s Remediation business is thriving and growing; we have a solid backlog of projects, and a number of large scale recent wins. If you have a successful track record as a â€œhands-onâ€ Construction Manager, on large-scale construction projects (Construction remediation is an asset), and you thrive on challenges in a fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

We offer a comprehensive Benefits Package (Medical, Dental, Insurance), Health Care spending account, Paid time off, and a 100% vested RRSP matching program.

 

Come join the winning team!

 

Key  Responsibilities:

 

  • Develops the construction sequencing and execution plan, including early site mobilization logistics.
  • Develops construction work breakdown structure work packages and provides input to Procurement and Contracting Work Packages
  • Primary contributor towards the development and maintenance of the construction schedule, in conjunction with Project Management and Project Controls
  • Manages and mentors Senior Site Superintendents and Functional leads including Health and Safety and Environmental Protection on day-to-day responsibilities
  • Oversees recruitment and performance of Woodâ€™s construction personnel, heavy equipment operators and field labor
  • Enforces Safety, Health, Environment, and Security requirements with all Construction Sub-Contractors and Supply Chain Vendors
  • Ensures strong interaction and collaboration between construction disciplines, including civil, structural, electrical, mechanical subcontractors and interfacing work packages. Ensures construction work is properly delineated, assigned, and supervised.
  • Leads clarification, interpretation, interference resolution and quality matters
  • Primary reviewer/contributor towards engineering designs and field changes. Leads constructability reviews and provides constructability input throughout the project life cycle.
  • Creates, reviews, and responds to construction requests for information (RFIs)
  • Effectively communicates with internal Wood project personnel, client representatives, stakeholders and sub-contractors on all aspects of the work
  • Monitors the construction execution to ensure that work flows smoothly and is delivered to customerâ€™s expectations
  • Proactively ensures construction performance measures are being monitored and achieved.
  • Contributes towards project status reports outlining items of concern such as look-ahead, safety observations, non-conformances to drawings and specifications, risks, delays, quality control and potential field changes.
  • Mentor Superintendents, ensuring oversight of decisions, driving innovative thinking and efficiencies on the job
  • Monitor field staff and sub-contractor performance and expenditures
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Minimum 15-20 years of experience in construction management within a civil construction or heavy industrial project environment
  • Must have at least 10 years increasing responsibility as a construction manager along with a focus on heavy civil construction; the last 5 years must have been on large scale projects in Canada
  • Will have large scale ($100-$250 Mn) project experience
  • Engineering technologist diploma or, a graduate degree in related field is considered an asset
  • Intimate knowledge of construction legislation, standards, and guidelines in Ontario
  • Proficient computer skills
  • Experience in a highly regulated nuclear environment (or equivalent) would be an asset
  • Remediation background is an asset
  • Demonstrated leadership capabilities
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal  and presentation skills
  • Demonstrated commitment to Health and Safety
  • Strong ability to interpret and analyze detailed design drawings and specifications
  • Willingness to travel
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship

We encourage all qualified applicants including Indigenous peoples, women, peoples with disabilities, and visible minorities to consider this opportunity.

Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

description:

As the Construction Project Manager you will work collaboratively with the rest of the internal team,externalconsultants, construction management firm, the municipality, and other stakeholders through allstagesof the project being directly responsible for the design detail,construction, and post construction stages of allprojects on behalf of the Developer.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Our client
Our client enjoys a hard-earned reputation as a Toronto developer who invests in exciting neighborhoods, improving the quality of entire communities. Every one of our celebrated residential projects integrates seamlessly into its surroundings, respecting the historic look and feel of the area while providing a glimpse into what could be. Our unwavering commitment to build a more livable and culturally rich Toronto has allowed us to attract the absolute best and most passionate talent. Our client is currently seeking qualified, ambitious, and driven individuals to join our team in the following role:

About the role
Joining the team as a High Rise Site Superintendent, you will be responsible for the day to day construction activities on a high rise project which includes:
  • Assuring projects are completed according to design and specifications meeting deadlines and budgets
  • Ensure health & safety on site
  • Creating progress reports throughout the project for key stakeholders
  • Communicating with site staff and creating schedules
  • Coordinating all relevant inspections

Location
Toronto, ON
9 Story Residential Project

Salary
From $130,000-$160,000 (Based on experience) plus vehicle allowance &  benefits

Qualifications
10 + years experience working in the high rise environment as a Site Superintendent with preference of  having lead a project full cycle. Strong experience in scheduling is required, as is supervising trades, evaluating labor requirements, attention to detail and ability to prioritize and problem solve to ensure deadlines are met and production continues. You'd need to have an excellent understanding of laws and regulation surrounding residential construction in the province of Ontario.

If this is a position that interests you and you meet the qualifications outlined,  please apply now


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.
