title: Construction Manager
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood currently has an exciting opportunity available for a Construction Manager, reporting to the Project Delivery Manager. This role has overall responsibility for providing leadership in the performance management of all activities related to the execution of construction work within Transmission & Distribution projects, including planning, cost control, materials management, contract/work force administration, safety/incident prevention, quality, security, and change management. If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.



Key responsibilities

 

  • All on site Power System Safety Protection (PSSP) Person in Charge (PIC) duties. Responsible for after erection inspection and offline construction of a project or part of a project
  • Listing all equipment or circuit items including outstanding deficiencies and safety hazards
  • Coordination of all staging and energization sequencing and development of staging plans
  • Ensuring construction work is executed as per Wood engineering drawing specifications, design standards and contractual requirements
  • Ensuring overall project execution is completed in accordance with the Project Management Plan and to the satisfaction of the Project Manager by acting as the single point of contact between the construction work force and Wood Engineering
  • Managing the overall Safety Management Plan, the site Environmental Management Plan, Quality Management Plan, Request for Information, Change Notices, Non-Conformance Reports, commissioning and energizing processes, As-Built completions and contract compliance
  • Assisting the Project Manager with scope of work portion of contracts, bid evaluation, land owner concerns, vegetation or access issues, constructability reviews and creating the construction schedule, including identifying outages as required
  • Implementing continuous improvements to positively impact project performance
  • Maintaining Wood T&D contractual responsibilities
  • Establishing and maintaining Wood T & D relationships with clients and other 3rd parties
  • Monitoring the construction and commissioning of all projects for schedule changes and tracking and reporting progress on a daily, weekly and monthly basis: identifying any issues that could delay the schedule,
  • Providing advice on course of action to maintain the schedule within authority levels or escalating to quickly address
  • Monitoring and auditing construction and materials management documentation to ensure that the facilities are being constructed to meet the quality specifications
  • Managing and replying to RFIâ€™s, issuing Site Instructions, NCRs and coordinating energization documentation
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Minimum 15 yearsâ€™ experience in the construction, maintenance, controls or commissioning of Substations and/or Power Lines
  • Academic qualifications/experience to enable effective interface at the engineering and management level
  • Results oriented with the capacity to successfully manage multiple and competing priorities and timelines
  • Superior analytical, problem solving, audit and investigation skills
  • Demonstrated effective leadership interacting with multiple internal disciplines and external customers in areas of civil, structural and electrical design
  • Working knowledge of contract terms and conditions with the ability to manage to the specification of a contract
  • Excellent and professional communication, interpersonal and team building skills within a diverse work group
  • Ability to work autonomously with frequent travel to remote site locations within an assigned geographical region
  • Experience as a Site Safety Coordinator considered an asset
  • Valid driver's license and clean driving abstract
  • Available to travel within BC
  • Fully vaccinated by having received the recommended number of doses of a COVID-19 vaccine that has been approved by the Government of Canada
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Vice President of Construction
description:
Vice President- Mid/High Rise Mixed-Use Construction
Are you looking for a job that allows you to leverage your skills in Supervision, Project Management and Mentorship? Are you passionate about Mid/High-Rise mixed-use development and looking to find a job as Vice President, Constructionwithin the industry? Do you want a job that allows you work autonomously within a small, energetic and innovative team? If so, then you need to apply today!

Responsibilities
In this job you will be able to use your 10-15 years of experience inMid/High Rise Mixed-Usedevelopments, to work with a fast growing builder/developer in the GTA. The Mid/High rise developer/builder will allow you to combine your knowledge of Development and Construction Management – handling tasks involving cost controlling, timelines, budgeting, leadership and technical know-how from conception to completion.

Working from the head office, you will be able to use your knowledge and expertisein presenting progress reports and meetings to multiple stakeholders, as well as managing day-to-dayoperations of all Mid/High-Rise mixed-use development in the GTA. This would include attending meetings, tracking progress, documenting milestones and ensuring completion, complying with regulations, and overseeing a clean and safe site. If you are looking for the next step in your career, and looking to take on a larger amount of responsibility – then this is the job for you!

Requirements:
- 10-15 years of construction management experience
- Ability to lead and motivate a people
- Strong technical expertise and communication skills
- Experience with budgeting, forecasting, and reporting
- Project Management experience a must (MBA and/or PMP ideal)
- Entrepreneurial drive and self-motivated
- Technical education background, P.Eng preferred (Engineering, Architecture, Construction etc)

What you will get out of it?
This job is an exciting opportunity to join a growing, innovative and energetic developer/builder who is looking for an experiencedVice President, Constructionto join their team. In this medium sized construction company, you will be in a unique position, encompassing aspects of project management and site staff management. This job will allow you to show your passion for Mid/High-Rise mixed-use construction, and work with an exciting, reputable, and growing team and well are hire and recruit your own team. You will also have the ability to mentor and coach staff,showing leadership and motivation on site and within the office environment.

You will be generously compensated depending on your experience, with plenty of autonomy if you want it! Apply ASAP if interested.

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Senior Site Superintendent
description:
Senior Site Superintendent  
Ottawa, ON
Construction / Building Materials 
$125-140K     
Bonus, Vacation, benefits, Car Allowance 

If you are a leader and have experience coaching, leading and mentoring people, continue reading. We are looking for leaders. 

Year Over Year multi award winning company. (Amazing company to work for) 
Very Attractive Base Salary + Bonus + Benefits + Vacation + RRSP matching + Car allowance.

This fantastic opportunity offers; Internal growth, positive environment.
Good leaders looking for good leaders. We are looking for candidates who have developed the leadership skills and can provide examples of this
8-10 years experience

Our client:
Are among the largest in their field and have an extremely strong and reputable history. They are a dominant player and have managed to surpass challenges and be the leader in their industry. 
With decades of experience our history of operations has grown internationally.

What We Offer

The selected candidate for the Sr. Site Superintendent is responsible for assisting with the day-to-day operations and management of Site Supers and Assistant site Supers. We offer the support from the top down to ensure that we are providing the best service in the industry.


Responsibilities
• Site scheduling, conflict resolution and prevention
• Approval all production schedules at site. Ensures adherence to scheduled activities.
• Accountable for complete adherence to construction process.
• Site Prep
• Responsible for the scheduling of early trades. With respect to trades/suppliers prior to excavation, orders and coordinates delivery of initial building materials e.g. windows and trusses. In cases where the project does not have sufficient starts to warrant a Foundation Builder, the Senior Site Super assumes those responsibilities.
• Accountable for managing Construction Staff (salaried and hourly) through on-going performance management, development, coaching and attracting and retaining strong performers. Plans, organizes and conducts regular meetings with staff to review manpower, materials, quality, production and safety and communicate business updates as required.
• In communications with internal stakeholders, such as Land, Contracts & Purchasing, the Design Studio and Construction Management.
• Must ensure homes are built to requirements and specifications established by construction drawings, building codes, TARION and Company standards.
• Develops and maintains strong, productive supplier and trade contractor relationships. Communicates company quality and performance standards to each trade contractor and supplier. Conducts periodic work inspections to ensure standards are met.
• Provide Builders with contracts, scopes of work, and contacts for all trades, suppliers, engineers, and consultants. Evaluates daily production overview and makes necessary changes to ensure schedule compliance.
• Monitors critical paths for projects, trade contractor schedules, and cost control to ensure that homes are QA ready and meet expected quality and budgets.
• Proofreads and reviews work orders prior to commencement of home construction to ensure feasibility, clarity and intent of extras and changes described in paperwork.
• Reviews and approves all rework invoices.
• Liaise with company Health and Safety department ensuring local division support of accident investigations, claims administration and case management (i.e. return to work of division employees), while ensuring a safe work environment.

What You Bring

• 10+ years residential construction supervision experience in the new home industry, ideally high volume.
• Experience using BuildPro
• Extensive knowledge of Ontario Building Code, Occupational Health and Safety Act and other health and safety regulations.
• Post-Secondary education in construction management, engineering or architectural technology preferred.
• Clear understanding of contracts, plans, and specifications, as well as construction methods, materials and regulations. Includes knowledge of all trades, staff responsibilities, scheduling and scopes of work.

 


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Construction Manager - Mining & Minerals
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is seeking Construction Managers for our Mining and Minerals consulting and EPCM projects in our Vancouver, BC office in Canada.

 

This is a strategic role, that  will be filled contingent on award of project, and has overall responsibility for proactively managing all daily maintenance activities and ensuring activities are executed in accordance with the schedule, as this role will play an integral part in the construction, construction  support, and of all phases of commissioning for a successful plant start-up.  If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for development of the construction strategy and execution plan
  • Responsible for Construction Work Breakdown Structure (CWBS) and Work Packages and provide input into Procurement and Contracting Work Packages
  • Developing and maintaining, in conjunction with the Planner/Scheduler, the construction schedule
  • Providing support to engineering designs with respect to constructability and schedule
  • Coordinating engineering requirements between site and engineering offices and ensuring strong interaction within the civil, structural, electrical and process departments.
  • Assisting the contractors with clarification, interpretation, interference resolution and QA/QC related matters
  • Responding to and processing contractorâ€™s requests for information (RFIs)
  • Reviewing and approving QA/QC non conformance reports (NCRs)
  • Ensure instructions, drawings and specifications for scope changes are issued in a timely manner
  • Developing and maintaining communication channels with clients, stake holders, and internal Wood personnel to ensure that work flows smoothly and is delivered to customerâ€™s expectations
  • Proactively working with contractors to ensure project safety, quality, schedule and cost objectives are being achieved.
  • Monitoring construction activities with respect to performance, procedure, and quality.
  • Submitting weekly progress reports outlining items of concern such as safety observations, non-conformance with specifications and drawings, equipment and weather delays, congestion, workmanship, quality control and potential contract
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Engineering technologist diploma or graduate degree in related field is considered an asset
  • At least 15-20 years of experience in construction management with mining or heavy industrial projects including at least 10 years increasing responsibility as a construction manager along with a focus on underground mines
  • AutoCAD and/or 3D design/drafting software capabilities is considered an asset
  • Willingness to travel to both domestically and internationally, for varying durations to a remote location
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

title: Site Superintendent-Stacked Towns
description:
Low Rise Site Super

Are you interested in working for a forward thinking real estate developer committed to high end construction, continuous development, entrepreneurial flare, and exceptional performance? Are you ambitious, career driven, and excited to collaborate on a team that values forward thinking and initiative from a Site Super? If you are passionate about real estate, and working for a fast-paced, supportive team, then you need to keep reading.

What will you be doing?
Day-to-day duties will have you managing all operations within the scope of a Site Super in unique low/mid-rise projects, including attending meetings, tracking progress, documenting milestones of a strong team, ensuring safe and successful completion of projects, and complying with regulations. Other day-to-day activities might include:
  • Working closely with the executive team to report on progress, team initiatives, and processes
  • Work with Construction Manager to ensure cohesive and effective strategy is in place for construction team
  • Continuously stay up to date on industry trends to provide disruptive thinking on initiatives, projects, and implementation of current and new projects
  • Collaborate with a wide range of individuals every day to create open communication through all stages of projects
What’s in it for you?
Our client is a forward thinking, fast paced developer looking for individuals to be a part of something incredible. If you are a Low Rise Site Super that is experienced, hands-on and operationally focused, and understand how to oversee the all stages of unique low rise residential projects, then you need to apply today before this role is gone. This company has a successful, reputable, and proven track record for sustainable and value driven projects. Step into a Low Rise Site Super role that allows you the ability to lead and mentor a team from your experience in the industry. This construction opportunity provides generous compensations with full benefits. If you are ready to take your career, and these projects to the next level, apply today.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Our client
Our client enjoys a hard-earned reputation as a Toronto developer who invests in excitingneighborhoods, improving the quality of entire communities. Every one of our celebrated residential projects integrates seamlessly into its surroundings, respecting the historic look and feel of the area while providing a glimpse into what could be. Our unwavering commitment to build a more livable and culturally rich Toronto has allowed us to attract the absolute best and most passionate talent. Our client is currently seeking qualified, ambitious, and driven individuals to join our team in the following role:

About the role
Joining the team as a High Rise Site Superintendent, you will be responsible for the day to day construction activities on a high rise project which includes:
  • Assuring projects are completed according to design and specifications meeting deadlines and budgets
  • Ensure health & safety on site
  • Creating progress reports throughout the project for key stakeholders
  • Communicating with site staff and creating schedules
  • Coordinating all relevant inspections

Location
Toronto, ON
9 Story Residential Project

Salary
From $130,000-$160,000 (Based on experience) plus vehicle allowance & benefits

Qualifications
10 + years experience working in the high rise environment as a Site Superintendent with preference of having lead a project full cycle.Strong experience in scheduling is required, as is supervising trades, evaluating labor requirements, attention to detail and ability to prioritize and problem solve to ensure deadlines are met and production continues. You'd need to have an excellent understanding oflaws and regulation surrounding residential construction in the province of Ontario.

If this is a position that interests you and you meet the qualifications outlined, please apply now

title: Construction Manager, Municipal Infrastructure
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood currently has an exciting opportunity available for a Civil Construction Manager for Municipal Infrastructure related work.

 

Based in any of our larger Alberta or BC offices, we are seeking a motivated candidate who combines strong technical and construction management skills with a keen ability to ensure that construction remains on schedule and within budget.  The role includes responsibility for providing leadership in the performance management of activities related to the execution of construction work within the Municipal Infrastructure sector.  This includes a wide range of responsibilities including planning, cost control, materials management, contract/work force administration, safety/incident prevention, quality, security, and change management.  If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast-paced environment, this is a great opportunity for you.

 

Day to day work could include office and field duties as follows:

  • Assisting Engineers with design work for municipal infrastructure projects
  • Coordinate and participate in site and facility inspections
  • Coordinate and supervise survey crews, material inspectors & contractors
  • Preliminary engineering of new projects and existing assets for rehabilitation
  • Detailed design and design checks of municipal infrastructure projects
  • Preparation of tender documents
  • Construction and post-construction engineering
  • Contract preparation and administration, including RFI’s, NCR’s and Change Orders, etc
  • Liaise with existing clients, involvement with proposals and project presentations
  • Ensuring construction work is executed as per engineering drawings & specifications

 

Skills / Qualifications

  • 15 + years of relevant construction experience.  CET, P.Tech, EIT or P.Eng. designation would be considered an asset
  • Familiarity with the use of AutoCAD, Civil 3d, and other municipal design software would be considered an asset
  • Familiarity with Municipal Infrastructure Construction Standards (ie: City of Edmonton, etc) is required for this role
  • Demonstrated experience supervising municipal infrastructure construction is required for this role
  • Experience working as an Engineering Consultant is preferred
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both verbal and written at multiple levels of an organization
  • Effective people management skills required for this role
  • Must have a valid driver’s license and vehicle
  • Must be able to travel out of town and be willing to work extended hours as required
  • Experience with Site Safety management is considered an asset
  • Available to travel within Alberta and British Columbia

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

description:

Ottawa, ON
Construction / Building Materials

Responsibilities
  • Adhere to Construction Processes, in accordance with Policy and Procedures.
  • Accountable for managing the construction of assigned homes from carpentry to 30-day warranty servicerequest signoff.
  • Monitors all daily trade functions:timeliness, quality of workmanship and completion of work.

  • Must be detailed and thorough.
  • Ability to train and mentorstaff through advanced leadership skills with the ability to delegate as required.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills required, both oral and written.Willing to take responsibility and be held accountable for results.
  • Skills in building relationships with a broad network of contacts, including trade partners and suppliers and a strong customer focus.

title: Construction Manager
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood currently has an exciting opportunity available for a Construction Manager, reporting to the Project Delivery Manager. This role has overall responsibility for providing leadership in the performance management of all activities related to the execution of construction work within Transmission & Distribution projects, including planning, cost control, materials management, contract/work force administration, safety/incident prevention, quality, security, and change management. If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

Key responsibilities

 

  • All on site Power System Safety Protection (PSSP) Person in Charge (PIC) duties. Responsible for after erection inspection and offline construction of a project or part of a project
  • Listing all equipment or circuit items including outstanding deficiencies and safety hazards
  • Coordination of all staging and energization sequencing and development of staging plans
  • Ensuring construction work is executed as per Wood engineering drawing specifications, design standards and contractual requirements
  • Ensuring overall project execution is completed in accordance with the Project Management Plan and to the satisfaction of the Project Manager by acting as the single point of contact between the construction work force and Wood Engineering
  • Managing the overall Safety Management Plan, the site Environmental Management Plan, Quality Management Plan, Request for Information, Change Notices, Non-Conformance Reports, commissioning and energizing processes, As-Built completions and contract compliance
  • Assisting the Project Manager with scope of work portion of contracts, bid evaluation, land owner concerns, vegetation or access issues, constructability reviews and creating the construction schedule, including identifying outages as required
  • Implementing continuous improvements to positively impact project performance
  • Maintaining Wood T&D contractual responsibilities
  • Establishing and maintaining Wood T & D relationships with clients and other 3rd parties
  • Monitoring the construction and commissioning of all projects for schedule changes and tracking and reporting progress on a daily, weekly and monthly basis: identifying any issues that could delay the schedule,
  • Providing advice on course of action to maintain the schedule within authority levels or escalating to quickly address
  • Monitoring and auditing construction and materials management documentation to ensure that the facilities are being constructed to meet the quality specifications
  • Managing and replying to RFI’s, issuing Site Instructions, NCRs and coordinating energization documentation

Skills / Qualifications

  • Minimum 15 years’ experience in the construction, maintenance, controls or commissioning of Substations and/or Power Lines
  • Academic qualifications/experience to enable effective interface at the engineering and management level
  • Results oriented with the capacity to successfully manage multiple and competing priorities and timelines
  • Superior analytical, problem solving, audit and investigation skills
  • Demonstrated effective leadership interacting with multiple internal disciplines and external customers in areas of civil, structural and electrical design
  • Working knowledge of contract terms and conditions with the ability to manage to the specification of a contract
  • Excellent and professional communication, interpersonal and team building skills within a diverse work group
  • Ability to work autonomously with frequent travel to remote site locations within an assigned geographical region
  • Experience as a Site Safety Coordinator considered an asset
  • Valid driver's license and clean driving abstract
  • Available to travel within BC
  • Fully vaccinated by having received the recommended number of doses of a COVID-19 vaccine that has been approved by the Government of Canada

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Development and Construction Project Manager
description:
There are very exciting times on the horizon for our Real Estate Developer client who buildsResidential & Mixed useprojects. If you are looking for ahybrid role heavily focused on the Development phase but also has scope to manage the construction stages as wellthen read on!

Our client, a start up Real Estate Developer, is looking to expand their team. If starting from the ground up excites you and you have come from a large company or medium sized firm; you will get the autonomy, visibility and recognition you are looking for.

Our client is looking for minimum 5-10 years of experience in Development and Construction with Residential and Commercial projects. Someone who really understands how to oversee 3rd party Construction Management companies and represent the owner’s best interest. Additionally, you must be very experienced with permitting, approval process, providing construction cost estimating, plans review etc… With the level of exposure in this role, this is truly an opportunity for you to be more than just a construction expert.

Lastly, you must have the communication and client facing skills and the technical education to support your work. (Planning Degree, Construction Management Degree, Building Sciences, Engineering and/or Architecture) would be an asset.

In this role you must be confident and knowledgeable in your area of expertise, be capable of presenting progress reports and meetings to multiple stakeholders and have strong technical knowledge on Building Engineering, budget control, cost (life-cycle) estimating, feasibility and value engineering with new development projects. You must also be good at dealing with and managing trades and be able to communicate clearly with difference groups.

This is an exciting time to join this well-established company as they re-develop their leadership team development division. If you are ambitious, passionate and ready for the challenge; this is the perfect role for you!

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

description:

Ottawa, ON
Construction / Building Materials
$125-140K

Year Over Year multi award winning company. (Amazing company to work for)
Very Attractive Base Salary + Bonus + Benefits + Vacation + RRSP matching + Car allowance.

This fantastic opportunity offers; Internal growth, positive environment.
Good leaders looking for good leaders. We are looking for candidates who have developed the leadership skills and can provide examples of this
8-10 years experience

Our client:
Are among the largest in their field and have an extremely strong and reputable history. They are a dominant player and have managed to surpass challenges and be the leader in their industry.
With decades of experience our history of operations has grown internationally.

What We Offer

The selected candidate for the Sr. Site Superintendent is responsible for assisting with the day-to-day operations and management of Site Supers and Assistant site Supers. We offer the support from the top down to ensure that we are providing the best service in the industry.


Responsibilities
• Site scheduling, conflict resolution and prevention
• Approval all production schedules at site. Ensures adherence to scheduled activities.
• Accountable for complete adherence to construction process.
• Site Prep
• Responsible for the scheduling of early trades. With respect to trades/suppliers prior to excavation, orders and coordinates delivery of initial building materials e.g. windows and trusses. In cases where the project does not have sufficient starts to warrant a Foundation Builder, the Senior Site Super assumes those responsibilities.
• Accountable for managing Construction Staff (salaried and hourly) through on-going performance management, development, coaching and attracting and retaining strong performers. Plans, organizes and conducts regular meetings with staff to review manpower, materials, quality, production and safety and communicate business updates as required.
• In communications with internal stakeholders, such as Land, Contracts & Purchasing, the Design Studio and Construction Management.
• Must ensure homes are built to requirements and specifications established by construction drawings, building codes, TARION and Company standards.
• Develops and maintains strong, productive supplier and trade contractor relationships. Communicates company quality and performance standards to each trade contractor and supplier. Conducts periodic work inspections to ensure standards are met.
• Provide Builders with contracts, scopes of work, and contacts for all trades, suppliers, engineers, and consultants. Evaluates daily production overview and makes necessary changes to ensure schedule compliance.
• Monitors critical paths for projects, trade contractor schedules, and cost control to ensure that homes are QA ready and meet expected quality and budgets.
• Proofreads and reviews work orders prior to commencement of home construction to ensure feasibility, clarity and intent of extras and changes described in paperwork.
• Reviews and approves all rework invoices.
• Liaise with company Health and Safety department ensuring local division support of accident investigations, claims administration and case management (i.e. return to work of division employees), while ensuring a safe work environment.

What You Bring

• 10+ years residential construction supervision experience in the new home industry, ideally high volume.
• Experience using BuildPro
• Extensive knowledge of Ontario Building Code, Occupational Health and Safety Act and other health and safety regulations.
• Post-Secondary education in construction management, engineering or architectural technology preferred.
• Clear understanding of contracts, plans, and specifications, as well as construction methods, materials and regulations. Includes knowledge of all trades, staff responsibilities, scheduling and scopes of work.

title: Construction Manager - Mining & Minerals
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is seeking Construction Managers for our Mining and Minerals consulting and EPCM projects in our Vancouver, BC office in Canada.

 

This is a strategic role, that will be filled contingent on award of project, and has overall responsibility for proactively managing all daily maintenance activities and ensuring activities are executed in accordance with the schedule, as this role will play an integral part in the construction, construction  support, and of all phases of commissioning for a successful plant start-up. If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for development of the construction strategy and execution plan
  • Responsible for Construction Work Breakdown Structure (CWBS) and Work Packages and provide input into Procurement and Contracting Work Packages
  • Developing and maintaining, in conjunction with the Planner/Scheduler, the construction schedule
  • Providing support to engineering designs with respect to constructability and schedule
  • Coordinating engineering requirements between site and engineering offices and ensuring strong interaction within the civil, structural, electrical and process departments.
  • Assisting the contractors with clarification, interpretation, interference resolution and QA/QC related matters
  • Responding to and processing contractor’s requests for information (RFIs)
  • Reviewing and approving QA/QC non conformance reports (NCRs)
  • Ensure instructions, drawings and specifications for scope changes are issued in a timely manner
  • Developing and maintaining communication channels with clients, stake holders, and internal Wood personnel to ensure that work flows smoothly and is delivered to customer’s expectations
  • Proactively working with contractors to ensure project safety, quality, schedule and cost objectives are being achieved.
  • Monitoring construction activities with respect to performance, procedure, and quality.
  • Submitting weekly progress reports outlining items of concern such as safety observations, non-conformance with specifications and drawings, equipment and weather delays, congestion, workmanship, quality control and potential contract

Skills / Qualifications

  • Engineering technologist diploma or graduate degree in related field is considered an asset
  • At least 15-20 years of experience in construction management with mining or heavy industrial projects including at least 10 years increasing responsibility as a construction manager along with a focus on underground mines
  • AutoCAD and/or 3D design/drafting software capabilities is considered an asset
  • Willingness to travel to both domestically and internationally, for varying durations to a remote location

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

Prince George 
General Contractor

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Super - Custom Homes
Are you currently an Assistant Site Super or full Super looking to work for a leading Builder/Developer on Custom home construction projects

Our client is an established builder/developer and is currently sourcing for an experienced, hands-on and operationally focused Super to support the construction activities on large custom projects across the GTA. The company has a successful, reputable and proven track record in the construction industry and is looking for a natural team player who can hit the ground running and bring their specific expertise and ideas to the company and grow their career

In return for your experience you would be generously compensated. This company prefers to pay on an hourly basis. For this permanent full time position.

Responsibilities are to manage the day-to-day operation of all projects within the scope of the Site Super, attend meetings, track progress, document milestones and ensure completion. Support the delivery approaches and project plans, time frames and budgets, work with all levels of the organization assisting in conflict resolution. Utilize project management tools and techniques to prioritize requirements, set objectives, deliverables and ensuring initiatives are on track. Communicate of information to all stakeholders at critical points. Ensure all deliverables are documented for budget and timelines objectives are achieved. Maintain documentation of changes/ revisions and related issues or decisions.

It is essential that you have completed and are familiar with building Custom Home projects. Superior communication skills and interpersonal skills are also important in dealing with a wide range of individuals and strong computer skills will be an advantage.

If this is a job that fits your skills then apply today, if you know anyone who would be a perfect match please share this job posting. Due to the volume of applications, we will only contact applicants qualified for this role. We will also contact you with relevant future opportunities, Thank you

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Superintendent
Prince George
General Contractor
Commercial Construction


Site SuperintendentDuties & Responsibilities:
  • Manage the project health and safety program as per OH&S Act and Company Health, Safety and Environmental policies
  • The ability to lead all on site activities including subcontractors, suppliers, and own forces coordination
  • Robust knowledge of site layout and working with surveyors to ensure building layout and elevations are accurate
  • Planning, scheduling, cost control and thorough knowledge of current safety requirements, construction technology and techniques, and subcontractors scope of work and responsibilities
  • Conduct daily site orientations, hazard assessments, maintain thorough daily reports and accurately track site progress to ensure construction schedules are met
  • Ensure projects are built according to the approved design drawings, specifications and meet applicable code requirements
  • Manage the Quality Control Program and ensure all aspects of the project meet the project quality requirements
  • Schedule and chair regular subtrade coordination meetings
  • Must be capable of reading drawings, specifications, and shop drawings to ensure compliance
  • Ability to use on site computer and work with Word, Excel, Outlook, and scheduling software programs
  • Knowledge of pre-engineered metal buildings systems would be an asset.


Site SuperintendentQualifications:
  • Journeyperson certificate or postsecondary diploma or degree in a related discipline.
  • Gold Seal certification is preferred.
  • 5+ years of progressive field supervision experience
  • Demonstrated experience implementing a strong safety culture by application of health, safety, and environment principles and legislation
  • In-depth knowledge of and experience in construction industry; including building materials, construction methods, specifications, safety and environmental principles, and procedures
  • Ability to apply engineering principles to construction plans and schedules
  • Ability to coordinate multiple scopes of a construction project, including monitoring, and coordinating our trade partners with the construction schedule
  • Thorough understanding of contract language, with the ability to identify and mitigate risks and leverage opportunities.
  • Valid Driver’s License

Site SuperintendentSalary:
Competitive Salary, Extended Benefits, Growth Opportunities

title: Finishing Site Superintendent
description:
Finish Site-Superintendent
Low-Rise Projects
Caledon ON

Our Client:
A respected Residential Builder and Developer with decades of experience in the GTA market. They are known for their innovative approach to delivering quality homes and have very healthy project pipeline of Mid-Rise & Low-Rise projects.

Essential Responsibilities:
  • Assist the Superintendent in managing work on site to ensure the compliance of construction with the drawings and specifications
  • Support the Superintendent in planning and implementing schedules, determining manpower levels, material quantities, inspections and equipment.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Superintendent
Greater Toronto Area
ICI Ground-Up Construction
$110-150K + bonus and benefits

About our client
An established ICI General Contractor in Toronto delivering projects from $500,000 - $40,000,000. They have carved out a niche for themselves in the Institutional space and have been delivering projects for close to 40 years. They have loyal staff who are currently retiring and they are looking to build up their team.

About the role
Joining the team as a Site Superintendent, you will be responsible for the day to day construction activities on a high rise project which includes:
  • Assuring projects are completed according to design and specifications meeting deadlines and budgets
  • Ensure health & safety on site
  • Creating progress reports throughout the project for key stakeholders
  • Communicating with site staff and creating schedules
  • Coordinating all relevant inspections

Location
Greater Toronto Area (Oshawa-Barrie-Pickering-Scarborough)

Salary
From $110,000-$150,000 (Based on experience) plus vehicle allowance & benefits

Qualifications
At least 10 years experience working in the ICI environment as a Site Superintendent with preference on Institutional projects such as schools, universities & hospitals. Strong experience in scheduling is required, as is supervising trades, evaluating labor requirements, attention to detail and ability to prioritize and problem solve to ensure deadlines are met and production continues. You'd also ideally have experience on bothrenovation & new build projects. You would also ideally have a strong understanding of the construction process in the province of Ontario.

If this is a position that interests you and you meet the qualifications outlined, please apply now

Only qualified candidates will be contacted for screening. We thank you for your interest.
Apply Below

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Superintendent
Greater Toronto Area
Commercial Interiors
$80-120K+ benefits, vehicle allowance + bonus

For over 40 years this company has been providing construction management and general contracting services for commercial clients across the Greater Toronto Area, specializing in office fitouts. This firm is led by a strong team of great people who lead by example. If this is your niche, you will love this company.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Pre-Construction Management

  • Work with the Project Manager, develop and maintain master project schedule with input from subcontractors
  • Assess commissioning and O&M requirements for master project schedule.
  • Develop Health, Safety and Environment Plan.
  • Review contracts with the Project Manager to ensure scope of work and schedules are accurate and feasible.
  • Notify Equipment Management Team of requirements for project.
  • Assist with selection of trade subcontractors.
  • Conduct constructability reviews to bring value to the construction execution stage.

Construction Management
  • Plan, organize, direct and control daily construction operations with direct leadership responsibilities for junior resources as assigned.
  • Fully understand the Master Contract and Subcontractor Contracts.
  • Develop and measure productivity on site to measure planned progress against actual.
  • Control site logistics, maximize efficiencies, minimize deficiencies of all work including all subcontractors, suppliers and employees.
  • Establish site for construction.
  • Maintain daily and ongoing reporting to track site progress.
  • Maintain a clean and organized site.
  • Execute the quality management program proactively to minimize deficiencies.
  • Approve timesheets.
  • Hold daily field level hazard assessments.
  • Hold weekly toolbox talks.
  • Conduct weekly subcontract progress meetings and hold everyone on site accountable to the Master Project Schedule.
  • Purchase, maintain, track and forecast materials.
  • Review all subcontractor submittals.
  • Support the development of commissioning and turn over plans.
  • Fix deficiencies in line with achieving total completion date.
  • Manage risk during the project by following the Risk Management Plan.
  • Communicate daily with the Project Manager and project team on the status of construction including any concerns or discrepancies that may require escalation.
  • Attend owner meetings throughout the project.
  • Manage, control, and record all permit requirements, third party inspections, commissioning, training and hand over.
  • Communicate with the office to manage administrative tasks.
  • Responsible to ensure all on site contractually required items are implemented and completed.
  • Champion health and safety and occupational practices and regulations.
  • Provide cost-effective solutions to construction issues and coordinate with the Project Manager.

Post Construction Management
  • Complete warranty work.
  • Close all site accounts.
  • Complete any deficiencies and issues related to the warranty period.
  • Demobilize site.


Site SuperintendentQualifications:
  • Undergraduate degree or diploma in construction management, engineering, or another relevant field preferred
  • Certification of First Aid/CPR, WHMIS
  • Possess valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle
  • 5+ years’ experience in the construction industry, preferably Commercial construction management
  • Strong familiarity with contract administration, understanding drawings, specifications, architectural and engineering standards and building practices, including building codes
  • Full understanding of mechanical and electrical installations, including commissioning and handover
  • Excellent budgeting, costing, and scheduling skills
  • Solid understanding of construction industry practices, OBC, OHSA and WCB regulations and safety standards, OHS Certificate
  • Experience using MS Word, Outlook, MS Project, Electronic Document Management System, Bluebeam, and Plan Grid
  • Strong leadership skills with experience managing all disciplines, internal employees, and external sub-trades
  • Ability to inspire trust in difficult situations by instilling confidence and engaging people on matters that affect them
  • Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet the time demands of unpredictable activities, capable of handling pressure and challenges
  • Works within tight deadlines and prioritizes of work to achieve them
  • Strong analytical, critical thinking, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills demonstrated through speaking to groups of employees on site, and communicating to a variety of stakeholders including clients, management, and site employees
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals; ability to work in challenging, fast paced environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Travel to site will be required; travel within Canada as directed
  • Ability to relocate to projects and offices within Canada and elsewhere according to Company resource requirements an asset
  • Supportive of a culture that encompasses the highest ethical standards aligned with the Company Promise

Site Superintendent Similar Job Titles:
Site Super
General Superintendent
Construction Manager
Superintendent

Interested?
Apply below

Only applicants with the legal right to work in Canada can be considered for this opportunity.
We thank all those who express interest in this opportunity however only those short-listed we be contacted.

Our client
Our client is Canada's largest community builder, delivering back to back high-rise communities from coast to coast. They have close to 100 years of experience and have presence in Asia, Europe as well as the Americas

The Finishing Superintendent will be responsible for:

title: Senior Site Superintendent
description:
About our client
A well-respected medium size homebuilder with 30 years of low-rise construction experience. Very forward thinking and employee focused with advancement opportunities.  Approximately 300 +/- closings per year moving forward

Site Manager / Site Supervisor who is responsible for the day to day construction site operations for a large low rise construction site in Caledon from excavation to completion
 
Experience in the construction of single family detached, semi detached and townhomes in a large volume setting ,  approximately 100 units per year .
 
  • Applicant should possess a minimum of 7-10 years as a lead site supervisor able to coordinate the daily on site activities of the support staff , construction process, including scheduling, inspections and record keeping and reporting
  • Able to organize and supervise site staff, trades and contractors and ensuring they are performing as required and reporting progress
  • Ensuring that the health and safety project plans and MOL requirements are implemented and followed.
  • Liaise with government inspectors and the requirements of the Ontario Building Code inspections.
  • Ensuring the site office and construction documents and records are organized and maintained.
  • Able to read construction working drawings including and not limited to architectural, structural, mechanical, electrical, landscape civil engineering drawings
  • Inspect all houses regularly to ensure construction is progressing in accordance with the builder’s quality standards, the Tarion Construction Performance Standards , and that all the purchaser’s extras are being delivered.
Working knowledge of Tarion Warranty Program
Training completed in the Ontario Building Code OBC Part 9
Training completed in the Energy Star for New Homes
Training completed as a Joint Health Safety Committee Member
Training completed in the IHSA Basics of Supervising
Post secondary education in Construction Management preferred.
Current Certification in Working at Heights, WHIMIS, and First Aid
Aptitude with scheduling and project management software
 
Salary range $120-135k  plus bonus,  health & dental benefits vehicle and related expenses

title: Senior Site Superintendent
description:
About our client
A well-respected medium size homebuilder with 30 years of low-rise construction experience. Very forward thinking and employee focused with advancement opportunities. Approximately 300 +/- closings per year moving forward

Site Manager / Site Supervisorwho is responsible for the day to day construction site operations for a large low rise construction site in Caledon from excavation to completion

Experience in the construction of single family detached, semi detached and townhomes in a large volume setting , approximately 100 units per year .
  • Applicant should possess a minimum of 7-10 years as a lead site supervisor able to coordinate the daily on site activities of the support staff , construction process, including scheduling, inspections and record keeping and reporting
  • Able to organize and supervise site staff, trades and contractors and ensuring they are performing as required and reporting progress
  • Ensuring that the health and safety project plans and MOL requirements are implemented and followed.
  • Liaise with government inspectors and the requirements of the Ontario Building Code inspections.
  • Ensuring the site office and construction documents and records are organized and maintained.
  • Able to read construction working drawings including and not limited to architectural, structural, mechanical, electrical, landscape civil engineering drawings
  • Inspect all houses regularly to ensure construction is progressing in accordance with the builder’s quality standards, the Tarion Construction Performance Standards , and that all the purchaser’s extras are being delivered.
Working knowledge of Tarion Warranty Program
Training completed in the Ontario Building Code OBC Part 9
Training completed in the Energy Star for New Homes
Training completed as a Joint Health Safety Committee Member
Training completed in the IHSA Basics of Supervising
Post secondary education in Construction Management preferred.
Current Certification in Working at Heights, WHIMIS, and First Aid
Aptitude with scheduling and project management software

Salary range $120-135k plus bonus, health & dental benefits vehicle and related expenses

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Site Superintendent
Mississauga, ON
General Contractor
Commercial Construction
New Build and Tenant Improvement



Site SuperintendentDuties & Responsibilities:


Pre-Construction Management
  • Work with the Project Manager, develop and maintain master project schedule with input from subcontractors
  • Assess commissioning and O&M requirements for master project schedule.
  • Develop Health, Safety and Environment Plan.
  • Review contracts with the Project Manager to ensure scope of work and schedules are accurate and feasible.
  • Notify Equipment Management Team of requirements for project.
  • Assist with selection of trade subcontractors.
  • Conduct constructability reviews to bring value to the construction execution stage.

Construction Management
  • Plan, organize, direct and control daily construction operations with direct leadership responsibilities for junior resources as assigned.
  • Fully understand the Master Contract and Subcontractor Contracts.
  • Develop and measure productivity on site to measure planned progress against actual.
  • Control site logistics, maximize efficiencies, minimize deficiencies of all work including all subcontractors, suppliers and employees.
  • Establish site for construction.
  • Maintain daily and ongoing reporting to track site progress.
  • Maintain a clean and organized site.
  • Execute the quality management program proactively to minimize deficiencies.
  • Approve timesheets.
  • Hold daily field level hazard assessments.
  • Hold weekly toolbox talks.
  • Conduct weekly subcontract progress meetings and hold everyone on site accountable to the Master Project Schedule.
  • Purchase, maintain, track and forecast materials.
  • Review all subcontractor submittals.
  • Support the development of commissioning and turn over plans.
  • Fix deficiencies in line with achieving total completion date.
  • Manage risk during the project by following the Risk Management Plan.
  • Communicate daily with the Project Manager and project team on the status of construction including any concerns or discrepancies that may require escalation.
  • Attend owner meetings throughout the project.
  • Manage, control, and record all permit requirements, third party inspections, commissioning, training and hand over.
  • Communicate with the office to manage administrative tasks.
  • Responsible to ensure all on site contractually required items are implemented and completed.
  • Champion health and safety and occupational practices and regulations.
  • Provide cost-effective solutions to construction issues and coordinate with the Project Manager.



Post Construction Management
  • Complete warranty work.
  • Close all site accounts.
  • Complete any deficiencies and issues related to the warranty period.
  • Demobilize site.


Site SuperintendentQualifications:
  • Undergraduate degree or diploma in construction management, engineering, or another relevant field preferred
  • Certification of First Aid/CPR, WHMIS
  • Possess valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle
  • 5+ years’ experience in the construction industry, preferably Commercial construction management
  • Strong familiarity with contract administration, understanding drawings, specifications, architectural and engineering standards and building practices, including building codes
  • Full understanding of mechanical and electrical installations, including commissioning and handover
  • Excellent budgeting, costing, and scheduling skills
  • Solid understanding of construction industry practices, OBC, OHSA and WCB regulations and safety standards, OHS Certificate
  • Experience using MS Word, Outlook, MS Project, Electronic Document Management System, Bluebeam, and Plan Grid
  • Strong leadership skills with experience managing all disciplines, internal employees, and external sub-trades
  • Ability to inspire trust in difficult situations by instilling confidence and engaging people on matters that affect them
  • Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet the time demands of unpredictable activities, capable of handling pressure and challenges
  • Works within tight deadlines and prioritizes of work to achieve them
  • Strong analytical, critical thinking, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills demonstrated through speaking to groups of employees on site, and communicating to a variety of stakeholders including clients, management, and site employees
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals; ability to work in challenging, fast paced environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Travel to site will be required; travel within Canada as directed
  • Ability to relocate to projects and offices within Canada and elsewhere according to Company resource requirements an asset
  • Supportive of a culture that encompasses the highest ethical standards aligned with the Company Promise

Site SuperintendentSalary:
Competitive Salary, Extended Benefits, Growth Opportunities, Flexible work environment, Continuous training and development, Match RRSP Program, Birthday off with pay

Site Superintendent Similar Job Titles:
Site Super
General Superintendent
Construction Manager
Superintendent

Interested?
Apply below

Only applicants with the legal right to work in Canada can be considered for this opportunity.
We thank all those who express interest in this opportunity however only those short-listed we be contacted.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
PROJECT SUPERINTENDENT
POSTED IN: LOW-RISE CONSTRUCTION
OUR CLIENT

Our client is a family-operated business with deep roots in Toronto. With more than 65 years of history focused on building single-family homes that delivered outstanding quality and lasting value. Over the years, our client grew to creating entire mixed-use communities, becoming a fully integrated, multi-disciplinary real estate development company.

ABOUT THE JOB
The primary purpose of the role is to oversee construction field work on a Low-Rise Residential site by managing site activities. The position acts as the main interface with trades and sub-contractors and ensures that all lots are constructed in accordance with design, budget, schedule, attention to detail so as to maintain the Company’s quality standards and expectations

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Utilizes technical expertise to provide direction to site staff.

  • Take a lead role in executing the project management team’s schedules, permits, contracts/scopes of work, and communicates with the team on a daily basis with progress updates or status reports as required.

  • Manages, plans and schedules to meet deliverables and regularly review progress, ensuring houses are completed on time and on budget.

  • Oversees the performance of trades with close attention to detail and trade quality of work and ensures the accurate completion of Purchaser extras and or custom changes.

  • Oversees the close-out phase of projects, by reducing deficiencies to avoid unnecessary PDI issues after occupancy, and a smooth transition to Customer Care.

  • Oversees and provides direction to staff regarding the final stage of curb and side walk coordination, driveway and sod installation.

  • Works closely with the Customer Care department to ensure that the standards of customer care are met, and company policies are followed.

  • Adheres to, implements and enforces the Company’s Health & Safety Policies and Procedures and advises Senior Management of any unsafe conditions or practices.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 10+ years of relevant, progressive experience in the low-rise, residential building industry

  • Solid hands-on rough stage experience

  • Experience with stacked and mid-rise product is a must

  • Underground garage experience considered a valuable asset

  • Proficiency with MS Office, including Excel, Word and Outlook

  • Strong communication and reporting skills

  • Ability to contribute in a fast-paced, deadline-driven team atmosphere

  • Strong working knowledge of the Occupational Health & Safety Act and Regulations for Construction Projects (Ontario) and Tarion Rules and Regulations.

APPLY
Our client offers a competitive compensation package and the opportunity to work with an industry leader.
 


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Our client
A very large & reputable General Contractor who has built High Value projects in southern Ontario across the High-Rise Residential, Institutional, Commercial, Industrial & Health-Care space. They have been in business for close to 70 years and work on some of the most complex & interesting projects in the construction industry.

About the role
Joining the team as a High Rise Site Superintendent, you will be responsible for the day to day construction activities on a high rise project which includes:
  • Assuring projects are completed according to design and specifications meeting deadlines and budgets
  • Ensure health & safety on site
  • Creating progress reports throughout the project for key stakeholders
  • Communicating with site staff and creating schedules
  • Coordinating all relevant inspections
Qualifications
  • 10 + years experience working in the high rise environment as a Site Superintendent with strong preference of  having lead 4+ multi-story projects full cycle.
  • The incumbent needs to have strong familiarity with high-rise constructions & regulations in the province of Ontario.
  • Strong experience in scheduling is required, as is supervising trades, evaluating labor requirements, attention to detail and ability to prioritize and problem solve to ensure deadlines are met and production continues.
Salary is Dependent on experience - $130k-$170k + Yearly Bonus, Benefits & Allowance

title: Senior Construction Manager
description:
Senior Manager, Construction
 
Our client is an established architecture and advocacy group that is endeavoring to integrate construction management to fulfill our increasing demand for laneway house construction. This role is for a senior manager who will be responsible for establishing and scaling a production-housing model for small, infill residential projects in Toronto.
 
Our client was a key player in the development of the City of Toronto’s laneway housing policy, which was formally endorsed by City Council in 2018.  In 2021 our client will have completed over 40 projects for individual property owners in Toronto using third party GC’s, and in 2022 our client projects to complete a total of 50+ projects.
 
With an in-house staff of 10 including designers as well as support staff specializing in marketing/communications, accounting and business development, our client is well positioned to capitalize on the growing interest in laneway-based housing, as well as associated housing types like garden suites, which are soon to receive municipal approval in the City of Toronto and elsewhere in Southern Ontario.
 
Our client is currently developing a Construction Management division to complement its Architecture practice, and is looking for an established professional to take the lead and work with its senior management team to grow the division.  
 
Ideally, the candidate should have –
 
  • A minimum of 10 year experience in the residential construction industry in the GTA, and a minimum of 5 years of experience as a Senior Project Manager with a demonstrated capacity to lead a project from start through to completion;
  • A proven ability to manage, motivate and lead a construction team;
  • An established network of sub-trades in the GTA;  
  • Familiarity with municipal approval agencies in the City of Toronto;
  • Competence in developing and effectively managing budgets and schedules with a proven ability to meet delivery schedules;
  • A thorough understanding of building design and the capacity to work with the design team to develop/modify construction details;
  • A proven ability to act and client interface and effectively manage the builder/client relationship.  This is especially important because of the nature of the housing type and its context within established neighborhoods;
  • Competence in navigating Tarion processes and a familiarity with green building design.

 


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Site Superintendent
description:
Our Client
Founded in 1989. Three decades of experience has developed a team of construction professionals who consistently deliver challenging projects, across Canada and the United States. Our client has successfully completed many commercial, industrial, institutional projects, including historical renovations, high-rise hotels, and a variety of multi-residential developments. 

About the role
Joining the team as an ICI Site Superintendent, you will be responsible for the day to day construction activities on a high rise project which includes:
  • Assuring projects are completed according to design and specifications meeting deadlines and budgets
  • Ensure health & safety on site
  • Creating progress reports throughout the project for key stakeholders
  • Communicating with site staff and creating schedules
  • Coordinating all relevant inspections
Qualifications
  • 10 + years experience working in the ICI environment as a Site Superintendent ..
  • The incumbent needs to have strong familiarity with constructions & regulations in the province of Ontario.
  • Strong experience in scheduling is required, as is supervising trades, evaluating labor requirements, attention to detail and ability to prioritize and problem solve to ensure deadlines are met and production continues.

Location
Niagara, ON

From $120,000-$140,000 (Based on experience) plus vehicle allowance &  benefits
